filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that exposes the genocide raging in Darfur, Sudan as seen through the eyes of a former U.S. marine who returns home to make the story public.
filmInfoContainer4: The Devil Came on Horseback is both a strong primer on the complexities of the situation in Darfur and a harrowing first-person doc.

filmInfoContainer3: When a teenage girl is possessed by a mysterious entity, her mother seeks the help of two priests to save her daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: The Exorcist rides its supernatural theme to magical effect, with remarkable special effects and an eerie atmosphere, resulting in one of the scariest films of all time.

filmInfoContainer3: Three young Irish women struggle to maintain their spirits while they endure dehumanizing abuse as inmates of a Magdalene Sisters Asylum.
filmInfoContainer4: A typical women-in-prision film made untypical because it's based on real events.

filmInfoContainer3: A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to the Wachowskis' imaginative vision, The Matrix is a smartly crafted combination of spectacular action and groundbreaking special effects.

filmInfoContainer3: A mute woman is sent to 1850s New Zealand along with her young daughter and prized piano for an arranged marriage to a wealthy landowner, but is soon lusted after by a local worker on the plantation.
filmInfoContainer4: Powered by Holly Hunter's main performance, The Piano is a truth-seeking romance played in the key of erotic passion.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of disgraced New York Congressman Anthony Weiner's mayoral campaign and today's political landscape.
filmInfoContainer4: Weiner uses sharp insight and untrammeled access to offer a portrait of a political and personal collapse that's as queasy as it is undeniably compelling.

filmInfoContainer3: Two youngsters from rival New York City gangs fall in love, but tensions between their respective friends build toward tragedy.
filmInfoContainer4: Buoyed by Robert Wise's dazzling direction, Leonard Bernstein's score, and Stephen Sondheim's lyrics, West Side Story remains perhaps the most iconic of all the Shakespeare adaptations to visit the big screen.

filmInfoContainer3: Director Michael Apted revisits the same group of British-born adults after a 7 year wait. The subjects are interviewed as to the changes that have occurred in their lives during the last seven years.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Michael Apted continues to utilize cinema as a window into the lives of everyday people, and in the reflection of this documentary we can glimpse our own aging humanity.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that chronicles artist and activist Ai Weiwei as he prepares for a series of exhibitions and gets into an increasing number of clashes with the Chinese government.
A little boy goes on an adventurous quest in search of his father.
filmInfoContainer4: Boy and the World's distinctive animation is visually thrilling -- and it's backed up with a daring, refreshingly different storyline that should enthrall younger viewers while resonating deeply with adults.

filmInfoContainer3: An aspiring photographer develops an intimate relationship with an older woman in 1950s New York.
filmInfoContainer4: Shaped by Todd Haynes' deft direction and powered by a strong cast led by Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara, Carol lives up to its groundbreaking source material.

filmInfoContainer3: Henry Spencer tries to survive his industrial environment, his angry girlfriend, and the unbearable screams of his newly born mutant child.
filmInfoContainer4: David Lynch's surreal Eraserhead uses detailed visuals and a creepy score to create a bizarre and disturbing look into a man's fear of parenthood.

filmInfoContainer3: The lone survivor of an onslaught of flesh-possessing spirits holes up in a cabin with a group of strangers while the demons continue their attack.
filmInfoContainer4: Evil Dead 2's increased special effects and slapstick-gore makes it as good -- if not better -- than the original.

filmInfoContainer3: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soapmaker form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.
filmInfoContainer4: Solid acting, amazing direction, and elaborate production design make Fight Club a wild ride.

filmInfoContainer3: American nuclear weapons testing results in the creation of a seemingly unstoppable, dinosaur-like beast.
filmInfoContainer4: More than straight monster-movie fare, Gojira offers potent, sobering postwar commentary.

filmInfoContainer3: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.
filmInfoContainer4: Dark, intelligent, and stylish to a fault, Gone Girl plays to director David Fincher's sick strengths while bringing the best out of stars Ben Affleck and Rosamund Pike.

filmInfoContainer3: A weatherman finds himself inexplicably living the same day over and over again.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, sweet, and inventive, Groundhog Day highlights Murray's dramatic gifts while still leaving plenty of room for laughs.

filmInfoContainer3: A week in the life of a young singer as he navigates the Greenwich Village folk scene of 1961.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, funny, and profoundly melancholy, Inside Llewyn Davis finds the Coen brothers in fine form.

filmInfoContainer: Jonestown: The Life and Death of Peoples Temple
filmInfoContainer3: Featuring never-before-seen footage, this documentary delivers a startling new look at the Peoples Temple, headed by preacher Jim Jones who, in 1978, led more than 900 members to Guyana, where he orchestrated a mass suicide via tainted punch.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Stanley Nelson avoids editorializing and sensationalizing in Jonestown, letting the CIA photos and film speak for themselves, and giving a voice to the surviving victims.

filmInfoContainer3: During a preview tour, a theme park suffers a major power breakdown that allows its cloned dinosaur exhibits to run amok.
filmInfoContainer4: Jurassic Park is a spectacle of special effects and life-like animatronics, with some of Spielberg's best sequences of sustained awe and sheer terror since Jaws.

filmInfoContainer3: At a Montréal public grade school, an Algerian immigrant is hired to replace a popular teacher who committed suicide in her classroom. While helping his students deal with their grief, his own recent loss is revealed.
filmInfoContainer4: Monsieur Lahzar is a tender and thoughtful portrait of a man with hidden grief and also a compelling exploration of the teacher-student dynamic.

filmInfoContainer3: An aging, booze-addled father makes the trip from Montana to Nebraska with his estranged son in order to claim a million-dollar Mega Sweepstakes Marketing prize.
filmInfoContainer4: Elegant in its simplicity and poetic in its message, Nebraska adds another stirringly resonant chapter to Alexander Payne's remarkable filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: A disfigured Holocaust survivor sets out to determine if the man she loved betrayed her trust.
filmInfoContainer4: Tense, complex, and drenched in atmosphere, Phoenix is a well-acted, smartly crafted war drama that finds writer-director Christian Petzold working at peak power.

filmInfoContainer3: Eric Love is a 19 year old teenager who is so violent he has been 'Starred Up' (Moved to Adult prison) where he finds his father Neville who Eric hasn't seen since he was 5 (since he was ...
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, hard-hitting, and queasily realistic, Starred Up is an instant classic of U.K. prison cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: Jafar Panahi is banned from making movies by the Iranian government, he poses as a taxi driver and makes a movie about social challenges in Iran.
filmInfoContainer4: Jafar Panahi's Taxi offers another round of trenchant societal commentary from a director whose entire filmography stands as a daring act of dissent.

filmInfoContainer3: A band comprised of members of the Egyptian police force head to Israel to play at the inaugural ceremony of an Arab arts center, only to find themselves lost in the wrong town.
filmInfoContainer4: The Band's Visit is both a clever, subtle slice-of-life comedy, and poignant cross-cultural exploration.

filmInfoContainer3: In 2001, Afghanistan is under the control of the Taliban. When her father is captured, a determined young girl disguises herself as a boy in order to provide for her family.
filmInfoContainer4: The Breadwinner's stunning visuals are matched by a story that dares to confront sobering real-life issues with uncommon -- and richly rewarding -- honesty.

filmInfoContainer3: Jep Gambardella has seduced his way through the lavish nightlife of Rome for decades, but after his 65th birthday and a shock from the past, Jep looks past the nightclubs and parties to find a timeless landscape of absurd, exquisite beauty.
filmInfoContainer4: Dazzlingly ambitious, beautifully filmed, and thoroughly enthralling, The Great Beauty offers virtuoso filmmaking from writer/director Paolo Sorrentino.

filmInfoContainer3: An Iranian man deserts his French wife and her two children to return to his homeland. Meanwhile, his wife starts up a new relationship, a reality her husband confronts upon his wife's request for a divorce.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully written, sensitively directed, and powerfully acted, The Past serves as another compelling testament to Asghar Farhadi's gift for finely layered drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A joinery instructor at a rehab center refuses to take a new teen as his apprentice, but then begins to follow the boy through the hallways and streets.
filmInfoContainer4: Austere, finely crafted, and compelling.

filmInfoContainer: What We Do in the Shadows
filmInfoContainer3: Viago, Deacon and Vladislav are vampires who are finding that modern life has them struggling with the mundane - like paying rent, keeping up with the chore wheel, trying to get into nightclubs and overcoming flatmate conflicts.
filmInfoContainer4: Smarter, fresher, and funnier than a modern vampire movie has any right to be, What We Do in the Shadows is bloody good fun.

filmInfoContainer3: Rusalochka opens in modern day Copenhagen, Denmark. Several tourists gather around the capital's famous mermaid statue, as a tour guide explains its significance. A fish in the water below ...
filmInfoContainer4: The Little Mermaid ushered in a new golden era for Disney animation with warm and charming hand-drawn characters and catchy musical sequences.

filmInfoContainer3: A transient young man breaks into empty homes to partake of the vacationing residents' lives for a few days.
filmInfoContainer4: A tender and moving romance from Spring, Summer, Fall, Winter... And Spring's director Kim Ki-Duk.

filmInfoContainer3: A man coping with the institutionalization of his wife because of Alzheimer's disease faces an epiphany when she transfers her affections to another man, Aubrey, a wheelchair-bound mute who also is a patient at the nursing home.
filmInfoContainer4: An accomplished directorial debut by Sarah Polley, Away From Her is a touching exploration of the effects of Alzheimer's, in which the tender wisdom of Polley's script is beautifully complemented by a wonderful performance from Julie Christie.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a forbidden and secretive relationship between two cowboys, and their lives over the years.
filmInfoContainer4: A beautiful, epic Western, Brokeback Mountain's love story is imbued with heartbreaking universality thanks to moving performances by Heath Ledger and Jake Gyllenhaal.

filmInfoContainer3: A cinematic portrait of the homeless population who live permanently in the underground tunnels of New York City.
filmInfoContainer4: Marc Singer's documentary about a group of homeless people living beneath the streets of New York City is haunting and uplifting in equal measure.

filmInfoContainer3: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a breath-taking humanoid A.I.
filmInfoContainer4: Ex Machina leans heavier on ideas than effects, but it's still a visually polished piece of work -- and an uncommonly engaging sci-fi feature.

filmInfoContainer3: A troubled family must face the facts when something goes terribly wrong at their son's desolate military post.
filmInfoContainer4: Foxtrot uses topical themes to deliver a bruising sociopolitical statement that's equally effective taken simply as an absorbing, well-acted drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A businessman thwarts his wife's bequest of an estate to another woman.
filmInfoContainer4: A superbly-mounted adaptation of E.M. Forster's tale of British class tension, with exceptional performances all round, Howard's End ranks among the best of Merchant-Ivory's work.

filmInfoContainer3: After having suffered a heart-attack, a 59-year-old carpenter must fight the bureaucratic forces of the system in order to receive Employment and Support Allowance.
filmInfoContainer4: I, Daniel Blake marks yet another well-told chapter in director Ken Loach's powerfully populist filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: A profile of an ancient city and its unique people, seen through the eyes of the most mysterious and beloved animal humans have ever known, the Cat.
filmInfoContainer4: Kedi is a cat fancier's dream, but this thoughtful, beautifully filmed look at Istanbul's street feline population offers absorbing viewing for filmgoers of any purr-suasion.

filmInfoContainer3: Sparks fly when spirited Elizabeth Bennet meets single, rich, and proud Mr. Darcy. But Mr. Darcy reluctantly finds himself falling in love with a woman beneath his class. Can each overcome their own pride and prejudice?
filmInfoContainer4: Sure, it's another adaptation of cinema's fave Jane Austen novel, but key performances and a modern filmmaking sensibility make this familiar period piece fresh and enjoyable.

filmInfoContainer3: An idealistic FBI agent is enlisted by a government task force to aid in the escalating war against drugs at the border area between the U.S. and Mexico.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by outstanding work from Emily Blunt and Benicio del Toro, Sicario is a taut, tightly wound thriller with much more on its mind than attention-getting set pieces.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary featuring interviews with all surviving former heads of Shin Bet, the Israeli security agency whose activities and membership are closely held state secrets.
filmInfoContainer4: Strikingly stark, brutally honest, and rivetingly assembled, The Gatekeepers offers essential perspective on a seemingly intractable war from some of the men who fought it.

filmInfoContainer3: A redemptive tale of an aspiring rap artist surviving failed levees and her own troubled past and seizing a chance for a new beginning.
filmInfoContainer4: This incredible documentary displays the tragedy and mismanagement of Katrina along with the heroism of strangers and survivors.

filmInfoContainer3: A real-time account of the events on United Flight 93, one of the planes hijacked on September 11th, 2001 that crashed near Shanksville, Pennsylvania when passengers foiled the terrorist plot.
filmInfoContainer4: Potent and sobering, United 93 treats the subject matter with respect, never resorting to Hollywood aggrandizement.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of the decade-long hunt for al-Qaeda terrorist leader Osama bin Laden after the September 2001 attacks, and his death at the hands of the Navy S.E.A.L.s Team 6 in May 2011.
filmInfoContainer4: Gripping, suspenseful, and brilliantly crafted, Zero Dark Thirty dramatizes the hunt for Osama bin Laden with intelligence and an eye for detail.

filmInfoContainer3: Count Dracula moves from Transylvania to Wismar, spreading the Black Plague across the land. Only a woman pure of heart can bring an end to his reign of horror.
filmInfoContainer4: Stunning visuals from Werner Herzog and an intense portrayal of the famed bloodsucker from Klaus Kinski make this remake of Nosferatu a horror classic in its own right.

filmInfoContainer3: In a post-apocalyptic world, a family is forced to live in silence while hiding from monsters with ultra-sensitive hearing.
filmInfoContainer4: A Quiet Place artfully plays on elemental fears with a ruthlessly intelligent creature feature that's as original as it is scary -- and establishes director John Krasinski as a rising talent.

filmInfoContainer: Birdman: Or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
filmInfoContainer3: A washed-up superhero actor attempts to revive his fading career by writing, directing, and starring in a Broadway production.
filmInfoContainer4: A thrilling leap forward for director Alejandro González Iñárritu, Birdman is an ambitious technical showcase powered by a layered story and outstanding performances from Michael Keaton and Edward Norton.

filmInfoContainer3: A young blade runner's discovery of a long-buried secret leads him to track down former blade runner Rick Deckard, who's been missing for thirty years.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually stunning and narratively satisfying, Blade Runner 2049 deepens and expands its predecessor's story while standing as an impressive filmmaking achievement in its own right.

filmInfoContainer3: An authorized documentary on the late musician Kurt Cobain, from his early days in Aberdeen, Washington to his success and downfall with the grunge band Nirvana.
filmInfoContainer4: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck makes a persuasive case for its subject without resorting to hagiography -- and includes plenty of rare and unreleased footage for fans.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on perception of the United States's war with Iraq, with an emphasis on Al Jazeera's coverage.
filmInfoContainer4: A fascinating, enlightening behind-the-scenes look at the Al Jazeera network.

filmInfoContainer: Encounters at the End of the World
filmInfoContainer3: Film-maker Werner Herzog travels to the McMurdo Station in Antarctica, looking to capture the continent's beauty and investigate the characters living there.
filmInfoContainer4: Encounters at the End of the World offers a poignant study of the human psyche amid haunting landscapes.

filmInfoContainer3: James Bond willingly falls into an assassination ploy involving a naive Russian beauty in order to retrieve a Soviet encryption device that was stolen by SPECTRE.
filmInfoContainer4: The second James Bond film, From Russia with Love is a razor-sharp, briskly-paced Cold War thriller that features several electrifying action scenes.

filmInfoContainer3: With only the plan of moving in together after high school, two unusually devious friends seek direction in life. As a mere gag, they respond to a man's newspaper ad for a date, only to find it will greatly complicate their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: With acerbic wit, Terry Zwigoff fashions Daniel Clowes' graphic novel into an intelligent, comedic trip through deadpan teen angst.

filmInfoContainer3: Three former parapsychology professors set up shop as a unique ghost removal service.
filmInfoContainer4: An infectiously fun blend of special effects and comedy, with Bill Murray's hilarious deadpan performance leading a cast of great comic turns.

filmInfoContainer3: Two men form an unlikely friendship that will change both of their lives forever.
filmInfoContainer4: An original and thoughtful human drama, Goodbye Solo looks at relationships and loneliness while proving director Ramin Bahrani's is an important American voice.

filmInfoContainer3: An epic mosaic of interrelated characters in search of love, forgiveness, and meaning in the San Fernando Valley.
filmInfoContainer4: Critics say Magnolia is an ambitious, lengthy work that ultimately succeeds due to the interesting stories and excellent ensemble performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A TV interviewer and his cameraman meet a former actress and travel through her memories and career.
filmInfoContainer4: The story of an aging movie actress' complicated personal saga unfolds in this sophisticated anime film that deftly blurs memory and make-believe into a meditation on the nature of cinema itself.

filmInfoContainer3: A tribute to the late German choreographer, Pina Bausch, as her dancers perform her most famous creations.
filmInfoContainer4: Pina is an immersive, gorgeously shot tribute to the people who express life through movement.

filmInfoContainer3: An astronaut crew crash-lands on a planet in the distant future where intelligent talking apes are the dominant species, and humans are the oppressed and enslaved.
filmInfoContainer4: Planet of the Apes raises thought-provoking questions about our culture without letting social commentary get in the way of the drama and action.

filmInfoContainer3: A five-year-old boy develops a relationship with Ponyo, a young goldfish princess who longs to become a human after falling in love with him.
filmInfoContainer4: While not Miyazaki's best film, Ponyo is a visually stunning fairy tale that's a sweetly poetic treat for children of all ages.

filmInfoContainer3: Tells the story of a chimpanzee taken from its mother at birth and raised like a human child by a family in a brownstone on the upper West Side in the 1970s.
filmInfoContainer4: Equal parts hilarious, poignant, and heartbreaking, Project Nim not only tells a compelling story masterfully, but also raises the flag on the darker side of human nature.

filmInfoContainer3: Bond's loyalty to M is tested when her past comes back to haunt her. When MI6 comes under attack, 007 must track down and destroy the threat, no matter how personal the cost.
filmInfoContainer4: Sam Mendes brings Bond surging back with a smart, sexy, riveting action thriller that qualifies as one of the best 007 films to date.

filmInfoContainer3: Eight years after the Joker's reign of anarchy, Batman, with the help of the enigmatic Catwoman, is forced from his exile to save Gotham City, now on the edge of total annihilation, from the brutal guerrilla terrorist Bane.
filmInfoContainer4: The Dark Knight Rises is an ambitious, thoughtful, and potent action film that concludes Christopher Nolan's franchise in spectacular fashion.

filmInfoContainer3: From the dealer to the narcotics officer, the inmate to the federal judge, a penetrating look inside America's criminal justice system, revealing the profound human rights implications of U.S. drug policy.

filmInfoContainer: The Internet's Own Boy: The Story of Aaron Swartz
filmInfoContainer3: The story of programming prodigy and information activist Aaron Swartz, who took his own life at the age of 26.
filmInfoContainer4: Informative and enraging in equal measure, The Internet's Own Boy: The Story of Aaron Swartz uses its subject's tragic tale to deliver an impassioned call to action.

filmInfoContainer3: Aspiring comic Rupert Pupkin attempts to achieve success in show business by stalking his idol, a late night talk-show host who just craves his privacy.
filmInfoContainer4: Largely misunderstood upon its release, The King of Comedy today looks eerily prescient, and features a fine performance by Robert DeNiro as a strangely sympathetic psychopath.

filmInfoContainer3: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where an evil spiritual presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from both past and future.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it deviates from Stephen King's novel, Stanley Kubrick's The Shining is a chilling, often baroque journey into madness -- exemplified by an unforgettable turn from Jack Nicholson

filmInfoContainer3: Soon after a stranger arrives in a little village, a mysterious sickness starts spreading. A policeman, drawn into the incident, is forced to solve the mystery in order to save his daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: The Wailing delivers an atmospheric, cleverly constructed mystery whose supernatural thrills more than justify its imposing length.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Biography, Drama, History, Romance, War
filmInfoContainer3: A look at the life of Jiro Horikoshi, the man who designed Japanese fighter planes during World War II.
filmInfoContainer4: The Wind Rises is a fittingly bittersweet swan song for director Hayao Miyazaki.

filmInfoContainer3: A cattle herder and his family who reside in the dunes of Timbuktu find their quiet lives -- which are typically free of the Jihadists determined to control their faith -- abruptly disturbed.
filmInfoContainer4: Gracefully assembled and ultimately disquieting, Timbuktu is a timely film with a powerful message.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1975, the dynamics of a Swedish commune begin to change upon the arrival of a beaten wife and her two kids.
filmInfoContainer4: Managing to be both satirical and warm-hearted in its look at the inhabitants of a commune, Together successfully captures the spirit of a time.

filmInfoContainer3: On Christmas Eve, three homeless people living on the streets of Tokyo find a newborn baby among the trash and set out to find its parents.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautiful and substantive, Tokyo Godfathers adds a moving -- and somewhat unconventional -- entry to the animated Christmas canon.

filmInfoContainer3: A conservative judge is appointed by the President to spearhead America's escalating war against drugs, only to discover that his teenage daughter is a crack addict. Two DEA agents protect an informant. A jailed drug baron's wife attempts to carry on the family business.
filmInfoContainer4: Soderbergh successfully pulls off the highly ambitious Traffic, a movie with three different stories and a very large cast. The issues of ethics are gray rather than black-and-white, with no clear-cut good guys. Terrific acting all around.

filmInfoContainer3: A stubborn teenager enlists the help of a tough U.S. Marshal to track down her father's murderer.
filmInfoContainer4: Girded by strong performances from Jeff Bridges, Matt Damon, and newcomer Hailee Steinfeld, and lifted by some of the Coens' most finely tuned, unaffected work, True Grit is a worthy companion to the Charles Portis book.

filmInfoContainer3: Liège, Belgium. Sandra is a factory worker who discovers that her workmates have opted for a EUR1,000 bonus in exchange for her dismissal. She has only a weekend to convince her colleagues to give up their bonuses in order to keep her job.
filmInfoContainer4: Another profoundly affecting work from the Dardenne brothers, Two Days, One Night delivers its timely message with honesty and clear-eyed compassion.

filmInfoContainer3: Abortionist Vera Drake finds her beliefs and practices clash with the mores of 1950s Britain--a conflict that leads to tragedy for her family.
filmInfoContainer4: With a piercingly powerful performance by Imelda Staunton, Vera Drake brings teeming humanity to the controversial subject of abortion.

filmInfoContainer: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
filmInfoContainer3: Sweeney Todd returns to London to uncover the past, along the way meeting Mrs. Lovett, and begins to start his life of crime.
filmInfoContainer4: Full of pith and Grand Guignol grossness, this macabre musical is perfectly helmed and highly entertaining. Tim Burton masterfully stages the musical in a way that will make you think he has done this many times before.

filmInfoContainer3: A colorful array of characters compete at a national dog show.
filmInfoContainer4: A fine example of writer-director-star Christopher Guest's gift for improv comedy, Best in Show boasts an appealingly quirky premise and a brilliantly talented cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Ginger Baker looks back on his musical career with Cream and Blind Faith; his introduction to Fela Kuti; his self-destructive patterns and losses of fortune; and his current life inside a fortified South African compound.
filmInfoContainer4: Free of the hagiographic overtones that dog many documentary profiles, Beware of Mr. Baker presents a clear-eyed, thoroughly gripping look at one of rock's greatest -- and most personally problematic -- musicians.

filmInfoContainer3: Female-born Teena Brandon adopts his male identity of Brandon Teena and attempts to find himself and love in Nebraska.
filmInfoContainer4: Hilary Swank's acclaimed performance pays fitting tribute to the tragic life of Brandon Teena.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary about writer and director Brian De Palma.
filmInfoContainer4: De Palma may not make believers out of the director's detractors, but they'll likely share longtime fans' fascination with his career's worth of entertaining stories.

filmInfoContainer3: The filmed account of a large Canadian rock festival train tour boasting major acts like Janis Joplin, The Grateful Dead and The Band.
filmInfoContainer4: Festival Express is a spellbinding documentary that nostalgically chronicles five days in the summer of 1970, when a train full of now- legendary rock perfomers jammed its way across Canada.

filmInfoContainer: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
filmInfoContainer3: In 1938, after his father Professor Henry Jones, Sr. goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, Indiana Jones finds himself up against Adolf Hitler's Nazis again to stop them obtaining its powers.
filmInfoContainer4: Lighter and more comedic than its predecessor, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade returns the series to the brisk serial adventure of Raiders, while adding a dynamite double act between Harrison Ford and Sean Connery.

filmInfoContainer3: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.
filmInfoContainer4: A classic Tarantino genre-blending thrill ride, Inglourious Basterds is violent, unrestrained, and thoroughly entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: After the rise of the Taliban in Afghanistan and the restriction of women in public life, a pre-teen girl is forced to masquerade as a boy in order to find work to support her mother and grandmother.
filmInfoContainer4: Osama is bitterly honest, deeply disturbing, and utterly worth watching.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the Soviet Union's famed Red Army hockey team through the eyes of its players.
filmInfoContainer4: Fun and fascinating, Red Army delivers absorbing documentary drama for hockey fans and sports novices alike.

filmInfoContainer3: After a botched money delivery, Lola has 20 minutes to come up with 100,000 Deutschmarks.
filmInfoContainer4: More fun than a barrel of Jean-Paul Sartre, pic's energy riffs on an engaging love story and really human performances while offering a series of what-ifs and a blood-stirring soundtrack.

filmInfoContainer3: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.
filmInfoContainer4: A brutal, relentlessly grimy shocker with taut performances, slick gore effects, and a haunting finale.

filmInfoContainer3: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.
filmInfoContainer4: Typically stunning visuals and sharp dialogue from the Coen Brothers, brought to life with strong performances from Goodman and Bridges.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the story of Micky Ward, a fledgling boxer who tries to escape the shadow of his more famous but troubled older boxing brother and get his own shot at greatness.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a trio of captivating performances from Mark Wahlberg, Christian Bale, and Amy Adams, The Fighter is a solidly entertaining, albeit predictable, entry in the boxing drama genre.

filmInfoContainer3: A mistaken delivery in Mumbai's famously efficient lunchbox delivery system connects a young housewife to an older man in the dusk of his life as they build a fantasy world together through notes in the lunchbox.
filmInfoContainer4: Warm, affectionate, and sweet but not cloying, The Lunchbox is a clever crowd-pleaser from first-time director Ritesh Batra.

filmInfoContainer3: A man is shipwrecked on a deserted island and encounters a red turtle, which changes his life.
filmInfoContainer4: The Red Turtle adds to Studio Ghibli's estimable legacy with a beautifully animated effort whose deceptively simple story boasts narrative layers as richly absorbing as its lovely visuals.

filmInfoContainer3: Two thirteen year-old working-class friends in Bradford seek fortune by getting involved with a local scrap dealer and criminal.
filmInfoContainer4: Starkly emotional and beautifully directed, The Selfish Giant uses a lovely script and some powerful performances to present some of the best that modern British cinema has to offer.

filmInfoContainer: The Wild Parrots of Telegraph Hill
filmInfoContainer3: A homeless musician finds meaning to his life when he starts a friendship with dozens of parrots.
filmInfoContainer4: Interesting and appealing as both a study of man and nature.

filmInfoContainer3: An unemployed man finds his life sinking more and more into trouble as he hides his situation from his family and friends.
filmInfoContainer4: A haunting psychological drama, Time Out takes a penetrating look at the angst of the modern worker.

filmInfoContainer3: A practical joking father tries to reconnect with his hard working daughter by creating an outrageous alter ego and posing as her CEO's life coach.
filmInfoContainer4: Toni Erdmann pairs carefully constructed, three-dimensional characters in a tenderly funny character study that's both genuinely moving and impressively ambitious.

filmInfoContainer3: Chronicles three underprivileged students from inner-city Memphis and their volunteer coach who tries to help them beat the odds on and off the field.
filmInfoContainer4: It covers familiar sports documentary territory, but Undefeated proves there are still powerful stories to be told on the high school gridiron.

filmInfoContainer3: The telling of an Inuit legend of an evil spirit causing strife in the community and one warrior's endurance and battle of its menace.
filmInfoContainer4: Compelling human drama and stunning cinematography make The Fast Runner an absorbing experience.

filmInfoContainer3: While on probation, a man begins to re-evaluate his relationship with his volatile best friend.
filmInfoContainer4: As timely as it is overall impactful, Blindspotting blends buddy comedy with seething social commentary, and rises on the strength of Daveed Diggs' powerful performance.

filmInfoContainer: Born Into Brothels: Calcutta's Red Light Kids
filmInfoContainer3: Two documentary filmmakers chronicle their time in Sonagchi, Calcutta and the relationships they developed with children of prostitutes who work the city's notorious red light district.
filmInfoContainer4: A powerful and uplifting documentary.

filmInfoContainer3: Oilman Jan is paralyzed in an accident. His wife, who prayed for his return, feels guilty; even more, when Jan urges her to have sex with another.
filmInfoContainer4: Breaking the Waves offers a remarkable testament to writer-director Lars von Trier's insight and filmmaking skill -- and announces Emily Watson as a startling talent.

filmInfoContainer3: In New York in 1928, a struggling playwright is forced to cast a mobster's talentless girlfriend in his latest drama in order to get it produced.
filmInfoContainer4: A gleefully entertaining backstage comedy, Bullets Over Broadway features some of Woody Allen's sharpest, most inspired late-period writing and direction.

filmInfoContainer3: French dancers gather in a remote, empty school building to rehearse on a wintry night. The all-night celebration morphs into a hallucinatory nightmare when they learn their sangria is laced with LSD.
filmInfoContainer4: Challenging and rewarding in equal measure, Climax captures writer-director Gaspar Noé working near his technically brilliant and visually distinctive peak.

filmInfoContainer3: Intent on seeing the Cahulawassee River before it's turned into one huge lake, outdoor fanatic Lewis Medlock takes his friends on a river-rafting trip they'll never forget into the dangerous American back-country.
A gentle man, with scissors for hands, is brought into a new community after living in isolation.
filmInfoContainer4: The first collaboration between Johnny Depp and Tim Burton, Edward Scissorhands is a magical modern fairy tale with gothic overtones and a sweet center.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on the late Vivian Maier, a nanny whose previously unknown cache of 100,000 photographs earned her a posthumous reputation as one of the most accomplished street photographers.
filmInfoContainer4: Narratively gripping, visually striking, and ultimately thought-provoking, Finding Vivian Maier shines an overdue spotlight on its subject's long-hidden brilliance.

filmInfoContainer3: A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon.
filmInfoContainer4: Frost/Nixon is weighty and eloquent; a cross between a boxing match and a ballet with Oscar worthy performances.

filmInfoContainer3: Gandhi's character is fully explained as a man of nonviolence. Through his patience, he is able to drive the British out of the subcontinent. And the stubborn nature of Jinnah and his commitment towards Pakistan is portrayed.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Richard Attenborough is typically sympathetic and sure-handed, but it's Ben Kingsley's magnetic performance that acts as the linchpin for this sprawling, lengthy biopic.

filmInfoContainer3: Four boys from Sudan embark on a journey to America after years of wandering Sub-Saharan Africa in search of safety.
filmInfoContainer4: Not just a powerful telling of the journey of exiled Sudanese boys, God Grew Tired of Us is also a poignant account of the determination of the human spirit.

filmInfoContainer3: Irish republican Bobby Sands leads the inmates of a Northern Irish prison in a hunger strike.
filmInfoContainer4: Unflinching, uncompromising, vivid and vital, Steve McQueen's challenging debut is not for the faint hearted, but it's still a richly rewarding retelling of troubled times.

filmInfoContainer3: A political satire about a group of skeptical American and British operatives attempting to prevent a war between two countries.
filmInfoContainer4: In the Loop is an uncommonly funny political satire that blends Dr. Strangelove with Spinal Tap for the Iraq war era.

filmInfoContainer3: Faced with an unplanned pregnancy, an offbeat young woman makes an unusual decision regarding her unborn child.
filmInfoContainer4: One of the brightest, funniest comedies of the year, Juno's smart script and direction are matched by assured performances in a coming of age story with a 21st century twist.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that celebrates Rick Hall, the founder of FAME Studios in Muscle Shoals, Alabama, and the signature sound he developed in songs such as "I'll Take You There", "Brown Sugar", and "When a Man Loves a Woman".
filmInfoContainer4: Essential for soul fans and entertaining for novices, Muscle Shoals offers a compelling, warts-and-all glimpse at one of the most fascinating stories in modern American music.

filmInfoContainer3: Fact, fantasy and memory are woven seamlessly together in this portrait of film-maker Guy Maddin's home town of Winnipeg, Manitoba.
filmInfoContainer4: My Winnipeg is a charmingly irreverent 'docu-fantasy' from the unpredictable mind of Guy Maddin.

filmInfoContainer3: A Dogme film about an engaged couple that is torn apart after the man is paralyzed in an accident, and the woman falls in love with the husband of the woman who caused the accident.
filmInfoContainer4: Pulsing with honesty, this film lays bare the rawness of human emotion with a story made all the more believable thanks to its gritty, low-budget approach.

filmInfoContainer3: A twist on the Snow White fairy tale that is set in 1920s Seville and centered on a female bullfighter.
filmInfoContainer4: Smartly written and beautiful to behold, Blancanieves uses its classic source material to offer a dark tale, delightfully told.

filmInfoContainer3: Spellbound follows eight teenagers on their quest to win the 1999 National Spelling Bee.
filmInfoContainer4: A suspenseful, gripping documentary that features an engaging cross section of American children.

filmInfoContainer3: An American newcomer to a prestigious German ballet academy comes to realize that the school is a front for something sinister amid a series of grisly murders.
filmInfoContainer4: The blood pours freely in Argento's classic Suspiria, a giallo horror as grandiose and glossy as it is gory.

filmInfoContainer3: Plagued by a series of apocalyptic visions, a young husband and father questions whether to shelter his family from a coming storm, or from himself.
filmInfoContainer4: Michael Shannon gives a powerhouse performance and the purposefully subtle filmmaking creates a perfect blend of drama, terror, and dread.

filmInfoContainer3: An accidental discovery near a doctor's estate stirs up some painful memories eight years after his wife's hideous murder, and now, things are bound to take a turn for the unexpected. Does the good doctor know more than he's letting on?
filmInfoContainer4: An intense, well-crafted thriller, Tell No One is equal parts heart-pounding and heart-wrenching.

filmInfoContainer: The Beatles: Eight Days a Week - The Touring Years
filmInfoContainer3: A compilation of found footage featuring music, interviews, and stories of The Beatles' 250 concerts from 1963 to 1966.
filmInfoContainer4: We love them, yeah, yeah, yeah -- and with archival footage like that, you know The Beatles: Eight Days a Week -- The Touring Years can't be bad.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that examines the 1989 case of five black and Latino teenagers who were convicted of raping a white woman in Central Park. After having spent between 6 and 13 years each in prison, a serial rapist confessed to the crime.
After Carlos - a 12-year-old whose father has died in the Spanish Civil War - arrives at an ominous boys' orphanage, he discovers the school is haunted and has many dark secrets that he must uncover.
filmInfoContainer4: Creepily atmospheric and haunting, The Devil's Backbone is both a potent ghost story and an intelligent political allegory.

filmInfoContainer3: Rithy Panh uses clay figures, archival footage, and his narration to recreate the atrocities Cambodia's Khmer Rouge committed between 1975 and 1979.
filmInfoContainer4: Thrillingly unorthodox and emotionally searing without being didactic, The Missing Picture is a uniquely poignant documentary -- and so much more.

filmInfoContainer3: Backup singers live in a world that lies just beyond the spotlight. Their voices bring harmony to the biggest bands in popular music, but we've had no idea who these singers are or what lives they lead, until now.
filmInfoContainer4: Rich, insightful, and occasionally heartbreaking, 20 Feet From Stardom is an energetic tribute to the passion, talent, and hard work of backup singers.

filmInfoContainer3: At the edge of the Yangtze River, not far from the Three Gorges Dam, young men and women take up employment on a cruise ship, where they confront rising waters and a radically changing China.
filmInfoContainer4: Up the Yangtze is a visually stunning meditation about the changes confronting modern China.

filmInfoContainer3: In the 1940s, a young boy named Ralphie attempts to convince his parents, his teacher and Santa that a Red Ryder BB gun really is the perfect Christmas gift.
filmInfoContainer4: Both warmly nostalgic and darkly humorous, A Christmas Story deserves its status as a holiday perennial.

filmInfoContainer3: After the death of his father, a private detective struggles to find child support money and reconnect with his son and ex-wife.
filmInfoContainer4: After the Storm crosses cultural lines to offer timeless observations about parental responsibilities, personal bonds, and the capacity for forgiveness.

filmInfoContainer3: A seventeen year-old navigates his survival amongst an explosive criminal family and the detective who thinks he can save him.
filmInfoContainer4: With confident pacing, a smart script, and a top-notch cast, Animal Kingdom represents the best the Australian film industry has to offer.

filmInfoContainer3: NASA must devise a strategy to return Apollo 13 to Earth safely after the spacecraft undergoes massive internal damage putting the lives of the three astronauts on board in jeopardy.
filmInfoContainer4: In recreating the troubled space mission, Apollo 13 pulls no punches: it's a masterfully told drama from director Ron Howard, bolstered by an ensemble of solid performances.

filmInfoContainer3: In a building site in present-day Tehran, Lateef, a 17-year-old Turkish worker is irresistibly drawn to Rahmat, a young Afghan worker. The revelation of Rahmat's secret changes both their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: The lyrical Baran is a moving film, both for its love story and political underpinnings.

filmInfoContainer3: In order to ruin a western town, a corrupt politician appoints a black Sheriff, who promptly becomes his most formidable adversary.
filmInfoContainer4: Daring, provocative, and laugh-out-loud funny, Blazing Saddles is a gleefully vulgar spoof of Westerns that marks a high point in Mel Brooks' storied career.

filmInfoContainer3: A nun, while comforting a convicted killer on death row, empathizes with both the killer and his victim's families.
filmInfoContainer4: A powerful, thought-provoking film that covers different angles of its topic without resorting to preaching, Dead Man Walking will cause the viewer to reflect regardless of their political viewpoint.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on the once-promising American rock bands The Brian Jonestown Massacre and The Dandy Warhols, and the friendship/rivalry between their respective founders, Anton Newcombe and Courtney Taylor.
filmInfoContainer4: So you wanna be a rock 'n' roll star? Dig! compellingly chronicles the ups and downs of the Dandy Warhols and the Brian Jonestown Massacre, two ambitious bands whose love/hate relationship embodies many of the potential pratfalls of the music business.

filmInfoContainer3: Ambitious but troubled movie director Edward D. Wood Jr. tries his best to fulfill his dreams, despite his lack of talent.
filmInfoContainer4: Tim Burton and Johnny Depp team up to fete the life and work of cult hero Ed Wood, with typically strange and wonderful results.

filmInfoContainer3: An unflattering look inside America's corporate controlled food industry.
filmInfoContainer4: An eye-opening expose of the modern food industry, Food, Inc. is both fascinating and terrifying, and essential viewing for any health-conscious citizen.

filmInfoContainer3: Rob, a record store owner and compulsive list maker, recounts his top five breakups, including the one in progress.
filmInfoContainer4: The deft hand of director Stephen Frears and strong performances by the ensemble cast combine to tell an entertaining story with a rock-solid soundtrack.

filmInfoContainer3: Simon Spier keeps a huge secret from his family, his friends and all of his classmates: he's gay. When that secret is threatened, Simon must face everyone and come to terms with his identity.
filmInfoContainer4: Love, Simon hits its coming-of-age beats more deftly than many entries in this well-traveled genre -- and represents an overdue, if not entirely successful, milestone of inclusion.

filmInfoContainer3: While on a trip to Paris with his fiancée's family, a nostalgic screenwriter finds himself mysteriously going back to the 1920s everyday at midnight.
filmInfoContainer4: It may not boast the depth of his classic films, but the sweetly sentimental Midnight in Paris is funny and charming enough to satisfy Woody Allen fans.

filmInfoContainer3: After a famous author is rescued from a car crash by a fan of his novels, he comes to realize that the care he is receiving is only the beginning of a nightmare of captivity and abuse.
filmInfoContainer4: Elevated by standout performances from James Caan and Kathy Bates, this taut and frightening film is one of the best Stephen King adaptations to date.

filmInfoContainer3: A quiet observation of the triumphs and defeats of daily life, along with the poetry evident in its smallest details.
filmInfoContainer4: Paterson adds another refreshingly unvarnished entry to Jim Jarmusch's filmography -- and another outstanding performance to Adam Driver's career credits.

filmInfoContainer3: The documentary investigates the history, process and workflow of both digital and photochemical film creation.

War in Georgia, Apkhazeti region in 1990. An Estonian man Ivo has stayed behind to harvest his crops of tangerines. In a bloody conflict at his door, a wounded man is left behind, and Ivo is forced to take him in.
filmInfoContainer4: Tangerines' impassioned message and the strong work of a solid cast more than make up for the movie's flawed narrative and uneven structure.

filmInfoContainer3: In 2006-7 a group of investors bet against the US mortgage market. In their research they discover how flawed and corrupt the market is.
filmInfoContainer4: The Big Short approaches a serious, complicated subject with an impressive attention to detail -- and manages to deliver a well-acted, scathingly funny indictment of its real-life villains in the bargain.

filmInfoContainer3: A British soldier kidnapped by IRA terrorists soon befriends one of his captors, who then becomes drawn into the soldier's world.
filmInfoContainer4: The Crying Game is famous for its shocking twist, but this thoughtful, haunting mystery grips the viewer from start to finish.

filmInfoContainer3: An investigative documentary about the epidemic of rape of soldiers within the US military.
filmInfoContainer4: The Invisible War is a vital and frank expose on sexual assault in the U.S. military, shot by master filmmaker Kirby Dick (This Film is Not Yet Rated).

filmInfoContainer3: Abandoned by his father, a young boy is left in a state-run youth farm. In a random act of kindness, the town hair-dresser agrees to foster him on week-ends.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to the Dardenne brothers' typically fine direction, The Kid with a Bike is a heart-wrenching, thematically and spiritually rich drama.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the final Emperor of China.
filmInfoContainer4: While decidedly imperfect, Bernardo Bertolucci's epic is still a feast for the eyes.

filmInfoContainer: The Most Dangerous Man in America: Daniel Ellsberg and the Pentagon Papers
filmInfoContainer3: "The Most Dangerous Man in America" is the story of what happens when a former Pentagon insider, armed only with his conscience, steadfast determination, and a file cabinet full of ...

A young boy in a remote medieval outpost under siege from barbarian raids is beckoned to adventure when a celebrated master illuminator arrives with an ancient book, brimming with secret wisdom and powers.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully drawn and refreshingly calm, The Secret of Kells hearkens back to animation's golden age with an enchanting tale inspired by Irish mythology.

filmInfoContainer3: The Clock family are four-inch-tall people who live anonymously in another family's residence, borrowing simple items to make their home. Life changes for the Clocks when their teenage daughter, Arrietty, is discovered.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually lush, refreshingly free of family-friendly clatter, and anchored with soulful depth, The Secret World of Arrietty lives up to Studio Ghibli's reputation.

filmInfoContainer: The Story of the Weeping Camel
filmInfoContainer3: When a Mongolian nomadic family's newest camel colt is rejected by its mother, a musician is needed for a ritual to change her mind.
filmInfoContainer4: Delightful and strangely moving.

filmInfoContainer: War for the Planet of the Apes
filmInfoContainer3: After the apes suffer unimaginable losses, Caesar wrestles with his darker instincts and begins his own mythic quest to avenge his kind.
filmInfoContainer4: War for the Planet of the Apes combines breathtaking special effects and a powerful, poignant narrative to conclude this rebooted trilogy on a powerful -- and truly blockbuster -- note.

filmInfoContainer3: Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.
filmInfoContainer4: Rob Reiner's touching, funny film set a new standard for romantic comedies, and he was ably abetted by the sharp interplay between Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan.

filmInfoContainer3: Broke small-time rancher Dan Evans is hired by the stagecoach line to put big-time captured outlaw leader Ben Wade on the 3:10 train to Yuma but Wade's gang tries to free him.
filmInfoContainer4: This remake of a classic Western improves on the original, thanks to fiery performances from Russell Crowe and Christian Bale as well as sharp direction from James Mangold.

filmInfoContainer3: In Hawaii in 1941, a private is cruelly punished for not boxing on his unit's team, while his captain's wife and second-in-command are falling in love.
filmInfoContainer4: It has perhaps aged poorly, but this languidly paced WWII romance remains an iconic, well-acted film, featuring particularly strong performances from Burt Lancaster and Montgomery Clift.

filmInfoContainer: What's Love Got to Do with It
filmInfoContainer3: The story of singer Tina Turner's rise to stardom and how she gained the courage to break free from her abusive husband, Ike Turner.
filmInfoContainer4: With a fascinating real-life story and powerhouse performances from Angela Bassett and Laurence Fishburne, What's Love Got to Do With It? is a can't miss biopic.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Drama, Family, Sci-Fi
filmInfoContainer3: The special bond that develops between plus-sized inflatable robot Baymax, and prodigy Hiro Hamada, who team up with a group of friends to form a band of high-tech heroes.
filmInfoContainer4: Agreeably entertaining and brilliantly animated, Big Hero 6 is briskly-paced, action-packed, and often touching.

filmInfoContainer3: New Jersey, 1950s. Two brothers run an Italian restaurant. Business is not going well as a rival Italian restaurant is out-competing them. In a final effort to save the restaurant, the brothers plan to put on an evening of incredible food.
filmInfoContainer4: The performances in Big Night are wonderful, and the food looks delicious.

filmInfoContainer3: A committed dancer wins the lead role in a production of Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake" only to find herself struggling to maintain her sanity.
filmInfoContainer4: Bracingly intense, passionate, and wildly melodramatic, Black Swan glides on Darren Aronofsky's bold direction -- and a bravura performance from Natalie Portman.

filmInfoContainer: Brand Upon the Brain! A Remembrance in 12 Chapters
filmInfoContainer3: Returned home to his long-estranged mother upon a request from her deathbed, a man raised by his parents in an orphanage has to confront the childhood memories that have long haunted him.
filmInfoContainer4: A bizarre, compelling spectacle that invests its absurd plot with heartfelt sincerety, Brand Upon the Brain! is a unique cinematic experience.

filmInfoContainer3: Exposing her role behind the camera, Kirsten Johnson reaches into the vast trove of footage she has shot over decades around the world. What emerges is a visually bold memoir and a revelatory interrogation of the power of the camera.
filmInfoContainer4: Fresh and inventive yet immediately accessible, Cameraperson distills its subject's life and career into an experience that should prove immediately absorbing even for those unfamiliar with her work.

filmInfoContainer3: A profile of Ian Curtis, the enigmatic singer of Joy Division whose personal, professional, and romantic troubles led him to commit suicide at the age of 23.
filmInfoContainer4: Control is a work of art, thanks to its evocative black and white cinematography and sensational performances from Sam Riley and Samantha Morton. Even those not familiar with Joy Division can still appreciate the beauty of the film.

filmInfoContainer3: An extraterrestrial race forced to live in slum-like conditions on Earth suddenly finds a kindred spirit in a government agent who is exposed to their biotechnology.
filmInfoContainer4: Technically brilliant and emotionally wrenching, District 9 has action, imagination, and all the elements of a thoroughly entertaining science-fiction classic.

filmInfoContainer3: A mysterious Hollywood stuntman and mechanic moonlights as a getaway driver and finds himself in trouble when he helps out his neighbor.
filmInfoContainer4: With its hyper-stylized blend of violence, music, and striking imagery, Drive represents a fully realized vision of arthouse action.

filmInfoContainer3: Twelve-year-old Koichi, who has been separated from his brother Ryunosuke due to his parents' divorce, hears a rumor that the new bullet trains will precipitate a wish-granting miracle when they pass each other at top speed.
filmInfoContainer4: Elliptical and deliberately paced yet steadily absorbing, I Wish presents a beguiling portrait of childhood that grounds its sweetly nostalgic glow with well-rounded characters and attention to detail.

filmInfoContainer3: A family of Irish immigrants adjust to life on the mean streets of Hell's Kitchen while also grieving the death of a child.
filmInfoContainer4: A rich and moving story about an immigrant family adjusting to life in New York.

filmInfoContainer3: A New England couple's college-aged son dates an older woman who has two small children and an unwelcome ex-husband.
filmInfoContainer4: Expertly crafted and performed, In the Bedroom is a quietly wrenching portrayal of grief.

filmInfoContainer2: Action, Comedy, Crime, Drama, Fantasy, Thriller
filmInfoContainer3: In Shanghai, China in the 1940s, a wannabe gangster aspires to join the notorious "Axe Gang" while residents of a housing complex exhibit extraordinary powers in defending their turf.
filmInfoContainer4: Kung Fu Hustle blends special effects, martial arts, and the Looney Toons to hilarious effect.

filmInfoContainer3: Three elite climbers struggle to find their way through obsession and loss as they attempt to climb Mount Meru, one of the most coveted prizes in the high stakes game of Himalayan big wall climbing.
filmInfoContainer4: Gripping visually as well as narratively, Meru is the rare documentary that proves thought-provoking while offering thrilling wide-screen vistas.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Crime, Mystery, Sci-Fi, Thriller
filmInfoContainer3: When a machine that allows therapists to enter their patients' dreams is stolen, all Hell breaks loose. Only a young female therapist, Paprika, can stop it.
filmInfoContainer4: Following its own brand of logic, Paprika is an eye-opening mind trip that is difficult to follow but never fails to dazzle.

filmInfoContainer3: The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda.
filmInfoContainer4: A sleek, slick, well-oiled machine, Rush is a finely crafted sports drama with exhilarating race sequences and strong performances from Chris Hemsworth and Daniel Brühl.

filmInfoContainer3: Marianne, some thirty years after divorcing Johan, decides to visit her ex-husband at his summer home. She arrives in the middle of a family drama between Johan's son from another marriage and his granddaughter.
filmInfoContainer4: If Saraband appears to be a minor entry in Ingmar Bergman's filmography, it's still an accomplished piece of work from one of cinema's greatest masters.

filmInfoContainer3: Meet Seymour Bernstein: a beloved pianist, teacher and true inspiration who shares eye-opening insights from an amazing life. Ethan Hawke helms this poignant guide to life.
filmInfoContainer4: Seymour Bernstein's genuineness shines so brightly in Seymour: An Introduction that viewers will forgive debuting director Ethan Hawke's reverent treatment.

filmInfoContainer3: After a stint in a mental institution, former teacher Pat Solitano moves back in with his parents and tries to reconcile with his ex-wife. Things get more challenging when Pat meets Tiffany, a mysterious girl with problems of her own.
filmInfoContainer4: Silver Linings Playbook walks a tricky thematic tightrope, but David O. Russell's sensitive direction and some sharp work from a talented cast gives it true balance.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1995, director Steve James (of 'Hoop Dreams') returned to rural Southern Illinois to reconnect with Stevie Fielding, a troubled young boy to whom he had been an "Advocate Big Brother" ten years earlier.
filmInfoContainer4: Poignant documentary that's hard to forget.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the Operation Bernhard, the largest counterfeiting operation in history, carried out by Germany during WWII.
filmInfoContainer4: The Counterfeiters is a gripping account of one prisoner's moral dilemma, superbly portrayed by Karl Markovics.

filmInfoContainer3: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians.
filmInfoContainer4: With an outstanding starring performance from Benedict Cumberbatch illuminating its fact-based story, The Imitation Game serves as an eminently well-made entry in the "prestige biopic" genre.

filmInfoContainer3: Thor is imprisoned on the planet Sakaar, and must race against time to return to Asgard and stop Ragnarök, the destruction of his world, at the hands of the powerful and ruthless villain Hela.
filmInfoContainer4: Exciting, funny, and above all fun, Thor: Ragnarok is a colorful cosmic adventure that sets a new standard for its franchise -- and the rest of the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

filmInfoContainer3: A thesis picture. In 1938, Gandhi's party is making inroads in women's rights. Chuyia, a child already married but living with her parents, becomes a widow. By tradition, she is ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: This compassionate work of social criticism is also luminous, due to both its lyrical imagery and cast.

filmInfoContainer3: The X-Men send Wolverine to the past in a desperate effort to change history and prevent an event that results in doom for both humans and mutants.
filmInfoContainer4: X-Men: Days of Future Past combines the best elements of the series to produce a satisfyingly fast-paced outing that ranks among the franchise's finest installments.

filmInfoContainer: In the Name of the Father
filmInfoContainer3: In 1958 Angelo, a rich and spoiled boy, enters a religious school, where students are tired of its vice-rector, and the strict rules and old-fashioned teaching methods of priests. Soon ...
A young boy encounters a magical garden which enables him to travel through time and meet his relatives from different eras, with guidance by his younger sister from the future.
filmInfoContainer4: The simplicity and colorful warmth of Mirai's animation is underscored by a story with surprising - and deeply affecting - depth and emotional resonance.

filmInfoContainer3: The classic Shakespearean play about a murderously scheming King staged in an alternative fascist England setting.
filmInfoContainer4: This re-imagining of Shakespeare's Crookback King relocates the story in 1930 and features an indelible star turn for Ian McKellen as the monstrous and magnetic King Richard.

filmInfoContainer3: An adventurous mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive.
filmInfoContainer4: As gut-wrenching as it is inspirational, 127 Hours unites one of Danny Boyle's most beautifully exuberant directorial efforts with a terrific performance from James Franco.

filmInfoContainer3: Writer and musician Nick Cave marks his 20,000th day on the planet Earth.
filmInfoContainer4: Revealing yet respectful, 20,000 Days on Earth is essential viewing for any Nick Cave fan.

filmInfoContainer3: In London, four very different people team up to commit armed robbery, then try to doublecross each other for the loot.
filmInfoContainer4: Smartly written, smoothly directed, and solidly cast, A Fish Called Wanda offers a classic example of a brainy comedy with widespread appeal.

filmInfoContainer3: A former neo-nazi skinhead tries to prevent his younger brother from going down the same wrong path that he did.
filmInfoContainer4: A compelling and provocative story led by an excellent performance by Edward Norton.

filmInfoContainer3: After training with his mentor, Batman begins his fight to free crime-ridden Gotham City from corruption.
filmInfoContainer4: Brooding and dark, but also exciting and smart, Batman Begins is a film that understands the essence of one of the definitive superheroes.

filmInfoContainer: Beats, Rhymes & Life: The Travels of A Tribe Called Quest
filmInfoContainer3: Michael Rapaport documents the inner workings and behind the scenes drama that follows this innovative and influential band to this day.
filmInfoContainer4: This documentary focuses less on the music and more on the personality clashes and in-group tensions to great, compelling effect.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on the series of televised debates in 1968 between liberal Gore Vidal and conservative William F. Buckley.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, fascinating, and funny, Best of Enemies takes a penetrating -- and wildly entertaining -- look back at the dawn of pundit politics.

filmInfoContainer3: A young New York socialite becomes interested in a young man who has moved into her apartment building, but her past threatens to get in the way.
filmInfoContainer4: It contains some ugly anachronisms, but Blake Edwards is at his funniest in this iconic classic, and Audrey Hepburn absolutely lights up the screen.

filmInfoContainer3: During the Cold War, an American lawyer is recruited to defend an arrested Soviet spy in court, and then help the CIA facilitate an exchange of the spy for the Soviet captured American U2 spy plane pilot, Francis Gary Powers.
filmInfoContainer4: Bridge of Spies finds new life in Hollywood's classic Cold War espionage thriller formula, thanks to reliably outstanding work from Steven Spielberg and Tom Hanks.

filmInfoContainer3: A tale of greed, deception, money, power, and murder occur between two best friends: a mafia enforcer and a casino executive, compete against each other over a gambling empire, and over a fast living and fast loving socialite.
filmInfoContainer4: Impressive ambition and bravura performances from an outstanding cast help Casino pay off in spite of a familiar narrative that may strike some viewers as a safe bet for director Martin Scorsese.

filmInfoContainer3: Follow National Geographic photographer James Balog across the Arctic as he deploys time-lapse cameras designed for one purpose: to capture a multi-year record of the world's changing glaciers.

A documentary on the effect of fishing the Nile perch in Tanzania's Lake Victoria. The predatory fish, which has wiped out the native species, is sold in European supermarkets, while starving Tanzanian families have to make do with the leftovers.
filmInfoContainer4: This eye-opening documentary brings some of the shocking effects of globalization to light.

filmInfoContainer3: Documentary about the pioneering 1970s Zephyr skating team.
filmInfoContainer4: Dogtown and Z-Boys is a colorful, exhilarating look at the skateboarding subculture.

filmInfoContainer3: A romantic police captain breaks a beautiful member of a rebel group out of prison to help her rejoin her fellows, but things are not what they seem.
filmInfoContainer4: The visual splendor of the movie makes up for the weak story.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: When Hiccup and Toothless discover an ice cave that is home to hundreds of new wild dragons and the mysterious Dragon Rider, the two friends find themselves at the center of a battle to protect the peace.
filmInfoContainer4: Exciting, emotionally resonant, and beautifully animated, How to Train Your Dragon 2 builds on its predecessor's successes just the way a sequel should.

filmInfoContainer3: The spiritual journey of a ninety-year-old atheist.
filmInfoContainer4: Lucky is a bittersweet meditation on mortality, punctuating the career of beloved character actor Harry Dean Stanton.

filmInfoContainer3: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored by a powerful performance from Denzel Washington, Spike Lee's biopic of the legendary civil rights leader brings his autobiography to life with an epic sweep and a nuanced message.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in 1950s London, Reynolds Woodcock is a renowned dressmaker whose fastidious life is disrupted by a young, strong-willed woman, Alma, who becomes his muse and lover.
filmInfoContainer4: Phantom Thread's finely woven narrative is filled out nicely by humor, intoxicating romantic tension, and yet another impressively committed performance from Daniel Day-Lewis.

filmInfoContainer3: She is almost deaf and she lip-reads. He is an ex-convict. She wants to help him. He thinks no one can help except himself.
filmInfoContainer4: A clever and offbeat character study about two people discovering each other.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of Jean Dominique, a Haitian radio journalist and human rights activist.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-made, emotionally engaging documentary about Haitian social activist Jean Dominique.

filmInfoContainer3: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to a script that emphasizes its heroes' humanity and a wealth of superpowered set pieces, The Avengers lives up to its hype and raises the bar for Marvel at the movies.

filmInfoContainer3: Various women struggle to function in the oppressively sexist society of contemporary Iran.
filmInfoContainer4: Bleak, yet powerful, The Circle offers a searing indictment of the oppressive conditions experienced by women in Iran.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Mystery, Sci-Fi
filmInfoContainer3: Wallace and his loyal dog, Gromit, set out to discover the mystery behind the garden sabotage that plagues their village and threatens the annual giant vegetable growing contest.
filmInfoContainer4: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit is a subtly touching and wonderfully eccentric adventure featuring Wallace and Gromit.

filmInfoContainer3: A brilliant but eccentric scientist begins to transform into a giant man/fly hybrid after one of his experiments goes horribly wrong.
filmInfoContainer4: David Cronenberg combines his trademark affinity for gore and horror with strongly developed characters, making The Fly a surprisingly affecting tragedy.

filmInfoContainer3: After the death of Princess Diana, Queen Elizabeth II struggles with her reaction to a sequence of events nobody could have predicted.
filmInfoContainer4: Full of wit, humor, and pathos, Stephen Frears' moving portrait looks at life of the British royals during the period after Princess Diana's death.

filmInfoContainer: The Wind That Shakes the Barley
filmInfoContainer3: Against the backdrop of the Irish War of Independence, two brothers fight a guerrilla war against British forces.
filmInfoContainer4: Bleak and uncompromising, but director Ken Loach brightens his film with gorgeous cinematography and tight pacing, and features a fine performance from Cillian Murphy.

filmInfoContainer3: It's been months since Jafar Panahi, stuck in jail, has been awaiting a verdict by the appeals court. By depicting a day in his life, Panahi and Mojtaba Mirtahmasb try to portray the deprivations looming in contemporary Iranian cinema.
filmInfoContainer4: Through simple means and filming, This is Not a Film presents a vital political statement and a snapshot of life in Iran as enemy of the state.

filmInfoContainer3: An ordinary Japanese family slowly disintegrates after its patriarch loses his job at a prominent company.
filmInfoContainer4: J-Horror director Kiyoshi Kurosawa turns successfully to dramedy and gives a unique (and specifically national) perspective to the universal subjects of family and identity.

filmInfoContainer2: Biography, Comedy, Drama, History, Music, Musical
filmInfoContainer3: Set in the 1880s, the story of how, during a creative dry spell, the partnership of the legendary musical/theatrical writers Gilbert and Sullivan almost dissolves, before they turn it all around and write the Mikado.
filmInfoContainer4: A thoroughly entertaining character study and a great success for Mike Leigh.

filmInfoContainer3: While a zombie virus breaks out in South Korea, passengers struggle to survive on the train from Seoul to Busan.
filmInfoContainer4: Train to Busan delivers a thrillingly unique -- and purely entertaining -- take on the zombie genre, with fully realized characters and plenty of social commentary to underscore the bursts of skillfully staged action.

filmInfoContainer3: In a future world devastated by disease, a convict is sent back in time to gather information about the man-made virus that wiped out most of the human population on the planet.
filmInfoContainer4: The plot's a bit of a jumble, but excellent performances and mind-blowing plot twists make 12 Monkeys a kooky, effective experience.

filmInfoContainer3: When her husband goes missing at the beach, a female professor begins to mentally disintegrate as her denial of his disappearance becomes delusional.
filmInfoContainer4: Rampling carries the film with her finely nuanced performance of a woman coping with her husband's death.

filmInfoContainer3: Three girls in 1980s Stockholm decide to form a punk band -- despite not having any instruments and being told by everyone that punk is dead.
filmInfoContainer4: Sweet, empathetic, and shot through with a palpable joy, We Are the Best! offers a tender tribute to the bittersweet tumult of adolescence.

filmInfoContainer3: An unattractive seventh grader struggles to cope with inattentive parents, snobbish classmates, a smart older brother, an attractive younger sister and her own insecurities in suburban New Jersey.
A documentary on a chorus of senior citizens from Massachusetts who cover songs by Jimi Hendrix, Coldplay, Sonic Youth, and other unexpected musicians.
filmInfoContainer4: Full of endearing characters, this doc about a choir of "seniors behaving badly" is uplifting and delightful.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1976, Tony Wilson sets up Factory Records and brings Manchester's music to the world.
filmInfoContainer4: The colorful, chaotic 24 Hour Party People nimbly captures the spirit of the Manchester music scene.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1959, Truman Capote learns of the murder of a Kansas family and decides to write a book about the case. While researching for his novel In Cold Blood, Capote forms a relationship with one of the killers, Perry Smith, who is on death row.
filmInfoContainer4: Philip Seymour Hoffman's riveting central performance guides a well-constructed retelling of the most sensational and significant period in author Truman Capote's life.

filmInfoContainer3: Political involvement in the Avengers' activities causes a rift between Captain America and Iron Man.
filmInfoContainer4: Captain America: Civil War begins the next wave of Marvel movies with an action-packed superhero blockbuster boasting a decidedly non-cartoonish plot and the courage to explore thought-provoking themes.

filmInfoContainer: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
filmInfoContainer3: A growing nation of genetically evolved apes led by Caesar is threatened by a band of human survivors of the devastating virus unleashed a decade earlier.
filmInfoContainer4: With intelligence and emotional resonance to match its stunning special effects, Dawn of the Planet of the Apes expands on its predecessor with an exciting and ambitious burst of sci-fi achievement.

filmInfoContainer3: A Russian teenager living in London who dies during childbirth leaves clues to a midwife in her journal that could tie her child to a rape involving a violent Russian mob family.
filmInfoContainer4: David Cronenberg triumphs again, showcasing the Viggo Mortensen's onscreen prowess in a daring performance. Bearing the trademarks of psychological drama and gritty violence, Eastern Promises is a very compelling crime story.

filmInfoContainer3: Competitive ice skater Tonya Harding rises amongst the ranks at the U.S. Figure Skating Championships, but her future in the activity is thrown into doubt when her ex-husband intervenes.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by strong work from Margot Robbie and Alison Janney, I, Tonya finds the humor in its real-life story without losing sight of its more tragic -- and emotionally resonant -- elements.

filmInfoContainer: Joe Strummer: The Future Is Unwritten
filmInfoContainer3: As the front man of the Clash from 1977 onwards, Joe Strummer changed people's lives forever. Four years after his death, his influence reaches out around the world, more strongly now than ...
filmInfoContainer4: Displaying Joe Strummer warts and all, The Future is Unwritten succeeds as both an engrossing documentary and a comprehensive examination of one of music's most legendary figures.

filmInfoContainer3: Krisha returns for Thanksgiving dinner after ten years away from her family, but past demons threaten to ruin the festivities.
filmInfoContainer4: Raw, bracingly honest, and refreshingly unconventional, Krisha wrings fresh -- and occasionally uncomfortable -- truths from a seemingly familiar premise.

filmInfoContainer3: Ben Sanderson, a Hollywood screenwriter who lost everything because of his alcoholism, arrives in Las Vegas to drink himself to death. There, he meets and forms an uneasy friendship and non-interference pact with prostitute Sera.
filmInfoContainer4: Oscar-awarded Nicolas Cage finds humanity in his character as it bleeds away in this no frills, exhilaratingly dark portrait of destruction.

filmInfoContainer3: Ryota is a successful workaholic businessman. When he learns that his biological son was switched with another boy after birth, he faces the difficult decision to choose his true son or the boy he and his wife have raised as their own.
filmInfoContainer4: Sensitively written, smartly directed, and powerfully performed, Like Father, Like Son uses familiar-seeming elements to tell a thought-provoking story.

filmInfoContainer3: A Brooklyn teenager juggles conflicting identities and risks friendship, heartbreak, and family in a desperate search for sexual expression.
filmInfoContainer4: Pulsing with authenticity and led by a stirring lead performance from Adepero Oduye, Pariah is a powerful coming out/coming-of-age film that signals the arrival of a fresh new talent in writer/director Dee Rees.

filmInfoContainer3: When Shaun decides to take the day off and have some fun, he gets a little more action than he bargained for. A mix up with the Farmer, a caravan and a very steep hill lead them all to the Big City and it's up to Shaun and the flock to return everyone safely to the green grass of home.
