filmInfoContainer4: Warm, funny, and brilliantly animated, Shaun the Sheep is yet another stop-motion jewel in Aardman's family-friendly crown.

filmInfoContainer: Standing in the Shadows of Motown
filmInfoContainer3: Documentary about the Funk Brothers, a group of Detroit musicians who backed up dozens of Motown artists.
filmInfoContainer4: A toe-tapping tribute to the band that gave Motown its sound.

filmInfoContainer3: Documentary that looks at the concept of the corporation throughout recent history up to its present-day dominance.
filmInfoContainer4: The Corporation is a satisfyingly dense, thought-provoking rebuttal to some of capitalism's central arguments.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the controversial Brian Clough's 44-day reign as the coach of the English football club Leeds United.
filmInfoContainer4: Better than your average football pic, Damned United is carried by another star turn from Michael Sheen as Brian Clough.

filmInfoContainer3: Moscow, 1953. After being in power for nearly 30 years, Soviet dictator Josef Stalin takes ill and quickly dies. Now the members of the Council of Ministers scramble for power.
filmInfoContainer4: The Death of Stalin finds director/co-writer Arnando Iannucci in riotous form, bringing his scabrous political humor to bear on a chapter in history with painfully timely parallels.

filmInfoContainer3: The youngest son of an alcoholic former boxer returns home, where he's trained by his father for competition in a mixed martial arts tournament - a path that puts the fighter on a collision course with his estranged, older brother.
filmInfoContainer4: Warrior relies on many of the clichés that critics of the genre love to mock -- and it transcends them with gripping action, powerful acting, and heart.

filmInfoContainer3: A contemporary story of love, rejection and triumph as a young Maori girl fights to fulfill a destiny her grandfather refuses to recognize.
filmInfoContainer4: An empowering and uplifting movie, with a wonderful performance by Castle-Hughes.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical
filmInfoContainer3: The Beatles agree to accompany Captain Fred in his Yellow Submarine and go to Pepperland to free it from the music hating Blue Meanies.
filmInfoContainer4: A joyful, phantasmagoric blend of colorful animation and the music of the Beatles, Yellow Submarine is delightful (and occasionally melancholy) family fare.

filmInfoContainer3: A manager of an orphanage in India is sent to Copenhagen, Denmark, where he discovers a life-altering family secret.
filmInfoContainer4: The cast brings After the Wedding's melodramatic script to life, creating a movie that is emotionally raw and satisfying.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the career of consumer advocate Ralph Nader from wannabe presidential candidate to public pariah.
filmInfoContainer4: A compelling documentary that humanizes the controversial, polarizing politician.

filmInfoContainer3: Ballets Russes is an intimate portrait of a group of pioneering artists -- now in their 70s, 80s and 90s -- who gave birth to modern ballet.
filmInfoContainer4: Even if you know little about ballet, there is much to love about this documentary's captivating archival footage and its interviews with elderly former dancers who have much to share.

filmInfoContainer3: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier.
filmInfoContainer4: Suspenseful and politically astute, Captain America: The Winter Soldier is a superior entry in the Avengers canon and is sure to thrill Marvel diehards.

filmInfoContainer3: Carrie White, a shy, friendless teenage girl who is sheltered by her domineering, religious mother, unleashes her telekinetic powers after being humiliated by her classmates at her senior prom.
filmInfoContainer4: Carrie is a horrifying look at supernatural powers, high school cruelty, and teen angst -- and it brings us one of the most memorable and disturbing prom scenes in history.

filmInfoContainer3: A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies.
filmInfoContainer4: Gripping, well-acted, funny, and clever, Edge of Tomorrow offers entertaining proof that Tom Cruise is still more than capable of shouldering the weight of a blockbuster action thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: The uncompromising Tony and Emmy Award-winner is showcased both on and off stage via rare archival footage and intimate cinema vérité.
filmInfoContainer4: Brutally honest and utterly compelling, Elaine Stritch: Shoot Me offers a riveting, vanity-free portrait of its legendary subject while offering a few essential truths about the human condition.

filmInfoContainer3: A working-class Italian-American bouncer becomes the driver of an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the 1960s American South.
filmInfoContainer4: Green Book takes audiences on a surprisingly smooth ride through potentially bumpy subject matter, fueled by Peter Farrelly's deft touch and a pair of well-matched leads.

filmInfoContainer: Once Upon a Time in Anatolia
filmInfoContainer3: A group of men set out in search of a dead body in the Anatolian steppes.
A world-weary political journalist picks up the story of a woman's search for her son, who was taken away from her decades ago after she became pregnant and was forced to live in a convent.
filmInfoContainer4: Based on a powerful true story and led by note-perfect performances from Judi Dench and Steve Coogan, Philomena offers a profoundly affecting drama for adult filmgoers of all ages.

filmInfoContainer3: When Keller Dover's daughter and her friend go missing, he takes matters into his own hands as the police pursue multiple leads and the pressure mounts.
filmInfoContainer4: Prisoners has an emotional complexity and a sense of dread that makes for absorbing (and disturbing) viewing.

filmInfoContainer3: After an odd new medical student arrives on campus, a dedicated local and his girlfriend become involved in bizarre experiments centering around the re-animation of dead tissue.
filmInfoContainer4: Perfectly mixing humor and horror, the only thing more effective than Re-Animator's gory scares are its dry, deadpan jokes.

filmInfoContainer3: A 19th century French aristocrat, notorious for his scathing memoirs about life in Russia, travels through the Russian State Hermitage Museum and encounters historical figures from the last 200+ years.
filmInfoContainer4: As successful as it is ambitious, Russian Ark condenses three centuries of Russian history into a single, uninterrupted, 87-minute take.

filmInfoContainer3: After his 16-year-old daughter goes missing, a desperate father breaks into her laptop to look for clues to find her.
filmInfoContainer4: Searching's timely premise and original execution are further bolstered by well-rounded characters brought to life by a talented cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Side by Side explores, with refreshing honesty, the unique bond between a brother and a sister. Facing the rest of their childhood apart, they runaway in search of the only person who can keep their family together.
An alien orphan is sent from his dying planet to Earth, where he grows up to become his adoptive home's first and greatest superhero.
filmInfoContainer4: Superman deftly blends humor and gravitas, taking advantage of the perfectly cast Christopher Reeve to craft a loving, nostalgic tribute to an American pop culture icon.

filmInfoContainer3: Film-maker Jonathan Caouette's documentary on growing up with his schizophrenic mother -- a mixture of snapshots, Super-8 film, answering machine messages, video diaries, early short films, and more - culled from nineteen years of his life.
filmInfoContainer4: Using music and home video footage to great effect, Jonathan Caouette has made a very personal and moving film.

filmInfoContainer3: An exposé of rape crimes on U.S. college campuses, their institutional cover-ups, and the devastating toll they take on students and their families.
filmInfoContainer4: The Hunting Ground isn't director Kirby Dick's strongest work as a filmmaker, but the movie's powerful message more than trumps any technical weaknesses.

filmInfoContainer3: Two best friends set out on an adventure, but it soon turns around to a terrifying escape from being hunted by the police, as these two girls escape for the crimes they committed.
filmInfoContainer4: Simultaneously funny, heartbreaking, and peppered with action, Ridley Scott's Thelma & Louise is a potent, well-acted road movie that transcends the feminist message at its core.

filmInfoContainer3: Journalist David Farrier stumbles upon a mysterious tickling competition online. As he delves deeper he comes up against fierce resistance, but that doesn't stop him getting to the bottom of a story stranger than fiction.
filmInfoContainer4: Tickled uses an investigation into a silly-seeming subculture as the launching point for thought-provoking insights into online bullying and the destructive abilities of the internet.

filmInfoContainer3: Inventor Tim Jenison seeks to understand the painting techniques used by Dutch Master Johannes Vermeer.
filmInfoContainer4: Entertaining and profound in equal measure, Tim's Vermeer uses its seemingly esoteric subject to pose fascinating questions about art and obsession.

filmInfoContainer3: An aspiring director and the marginally talented amateur cast of a hokey small-town Missouri musical production go overboard when they learn that someone from Broadway will be in attendance.
filmInfoContainer4: This riotously deadpan mockumentary about aspiring community theater performers never stoops to ridicule oft-ridiculous characters.

filmInfoContainer3: A married couple preparing to celebrate their wedding anniversary receives shattering news that promises to forever change the course of their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: 45 Years offers richly thought-provoking rewards for fans of adult cinema -- and a mesmerizing acting showcase for leads Charlotte Rampling and Tom Courtenay.

filmInfoContainer3: Ajami is the religiously mixed community of Muslims and Christians in Tel Aviv. These are five stories about the everyday life in Ajami.
filmInfoContainer4: This multi-character drama balances intimate portrayals and broad political implications to paint a bracing and moving portrait of the Middle East conflict.

filmInfoContainer3: A coming-of-age story about a teenage girl in 1960s suburban London, and how her life changes with the arrival of a playboy nearly twice her age.
filmInfoContainer4: Though the latter part of the film may not appeal to all, An Education is a charming coming-of-age tale powered by the strength of relative newcomer Carey Mulligan's standout performance.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination on the effect of Franco-era religious schooling and sexual abuse on the lives of two longtime friends.
filmInfoContainer4: A layered, wonderfully-acted, and passionate drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A renowned New York playwright is enticed to California to write for the movies and discovers the hellish truth of Hollywood.
filmInfoContainer4: Twisty and unsettling, the Coen brothers' satirical tale of a 1940s playwright struggling with writer's block is packed with their trademark sense of humor and terrific performances from its cast.

filmInfoContainer3: An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one.
filmInfoContainer4: A stark, nuanced portrait of life in organized crime, bolstered by strong performances from Al Pacino and Johnny Depp.

filmInfoContainer3: Elena, a young Brazilian woman, travels to New York with the same dream as her mother, to become a movie actress. She leaves behind her childhood spent in hiding during the years of the ...

Follows the plight of real-life dancers as they struggle through auditions for the Broadway revival of "A Chorus Line". Also investigates the history of the show and the creative minds behind the original and current incarnations.
filmInfoContainer4: Fascinating and insightful, Every Little Step is a thoroughly engrossing behind the scenes look at Broadway performers.

filmInfoContainer3: Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy.
filmInfoContainer4: A passionate and concise cinematic civics lesson, Good Night, And Good Luck has plenty to say about today's political and cultural climate, and its ensemble cast is stellar.

filmInfoContainer3: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, who served during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people, and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.
filmInfoContainer4: Hacksaw Ridge uses a real-life pacifist's legacy to lay the groundwork for a gripping wartime tribute to faith, valor, and the courage of remaining true to one's convictions.

filmInfoContainer3: A martial artist/doctor steals from the corrupt authorities as a masked thief to give to the poor while another martial artist/doctor is forced to hunt him down. But a major threat unites them as a powerful and traitorous shaolin monk takes over the authorities.
filmInfoContainer4: Iron Monkey may not have the poetic lyricism of Crouching Tiger, it makes up for it in fun and energy.

filmInfoContainer3: A five-year-old Indian boy gets lost on the streets of Calcutta, thousands of kilometers from home. He survives many challenges before being adopted by a couple in Australia. 25 years later, he sets out to find his lost family.
filmInfoContainer4: Lion's undeniably uplifting story and talented cast make it a moving journey that transcends the typical cliches of its genre.

filmInfoContainer3: In 2074, when the mob wants to get rid of someone, the target is sent into the past, where a hired gun awaits - someone like Joe - who one day learns the mob wants to 'close the loop' by sending back Joe's future self for assassination.
filmInfoContainer4: As thought-provoking as it is thrilling, Looper delivers an uncommonly smart, bravely original blend of futuristic sci-fi and good old-fashioned action.

filmInfoContainer3: A stressed father, a bride-to-be with a secret, a smitten event planner, and relatives from around the world create much ado about the preparations for an arranged marriage in India.
filmInfoContainer4: An insightful, energetic blend of Hollywood and Bollywood styles, Monsoon Wedding is a colorful, exuberant celebration of modern-day India, family, love, and life.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that goes inside one of the great museums of the world: The National Gallery in London.
filmInfoContainer4: National Gallery finds director Frederick Wiseman doing what he does best: Drawing the viewer in with richly detailed, patiently constructed observations on modern institutions.

filmInfoContainer3: A film shot over during a two-night performance by Neil Young at Nashville's Ryman Auditorium.
filmInfoContainer4: Proving that it's neither better to burn out nor fade away, Neil Young: Heart of Gold works both as a concert film and a meditation on mortality.

filmInfoContainer3: A stubborn man past his prime reflects on his life of strict independence and seeks more out of himself.
filmInfoContainer4: It's solidly directed by Robert Benton and stacked with fine performances from an impressive cast, but above all, Nobody's Fool is a showcase for some of Paul Newman's best late-period work.

filmInfoContainer3: An author (Hahn) is undergoing multiple fertility therapies to get pregnant, putting her relationship with her husband (Giamatti) on edge.
filmInfoContainer4: Private Life uses one couple's bumpy journey to take an affecting look at an easily identifiable - and too rarely dramatized - rite of adult passage.

filmInfoContainer3: A Lower East Side teen-ager struggles to find some sanity while surrounded by an eccentric grandmother, a crazy new girlfriend, and a longing younger brother.
filmInfoContainer4: A coming-of-age tale marked by its authenticity.

filmInfoContainer3: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions run deep.
filmInfoContainer4: Though the movie may be too intense for some to stomach, the wonderful performances and the bleak imagery are hard to forget.

filmInfoContainer3: The group NWA emerges from the mean streets of Compton in Los Angeles, California, in the mid-1980s and revolutionizes Hip Hop culture with their music and tales about life in the hood.
filmInfoContainer4: Straight Outta Compton is a biopic that's built to last, thanks to F. Gary Gray's confident direction and engaging performances from a solid cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A hooker tears through Tinseltown on Christmas Eve searching for the pimp who broke her heart.
filmInfoContainer4: Tangerine shatters casting conventions and its filmmaking techniques are up-to-the-minute, but it's an old-fashioned comedy at heart -- and a pretty wonderful one at that.

filmInfoContainer: The Day I Became a Woman
filmInfoContainer3: A film comprised of three interconnected vignettes that depict women at three stages of life in Iran. The first part centers on a young girl on her ninth birthday who is told that she can ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Meshkini has made an excellent contribution to Iranian cinema with this poetic, emotionally poignant film.

filmInfoContainer3: The factual story of Spaniard Ramon Sampedro, who fought a thirty-year campaign in favor of euthanasia and his own right to die.
filmInfoContainer4: Held aloft by a transfixing performance from Javier Bardem as a terminally ill man who chooses to die, The Sea Inside transcends its melodramatic story with tenderness and grace.

filmInfoContainer3: Follows two young boys dealing with their parents' divorce in Brooklyn in the 1980s.
filmInfoContainer4: This is a piercingly honest, acidly witty look at divorce and its impact on a family.

filmInfoContainer3: A rural farmer is forced to confront the mortality of his faithful horse.
filmInfoContainer4: Uncompromisingly bold and hauntingly beautiful, Bela Tarr's bleak parable tells a simple story with weighty conviction.

filmInfoContainer3: A 12-year-old girl is sent to the country for health reasons, where she meets an unlikely friend in the form of Marnie, a young girl with long, flowing blonde hair. As the friendship ...
filmInfoContainer4: When Marnie Was There is still blessed with enough visual and narrative beauty to recommend, even if it isn't quite as magical as Studio Ghibli's greatest works.

filmInfoContainer3: The crew of Tibi Balogh sets out on a journey across Hungary to get the ancient Gold Owl statue, as well as the Milk Man. The treasure is worth millions, who gets there first?
filmInfoContainer4: Tense, exciting, and often darkly comic, Argo recreates a historical event with vivid attention to detail and finely wrought characters.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the 1914-1916 Antarctic exploration mission of Sir Ernest Shackleton. The ship sails south, breaking the ice, and ultimately getting trapped by the fast-changing weather. The ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: The Endurance presents exciting footage of an amazing real-life story of survival.

filmInfoContainer3: Two teenage girls share a unique bond; their parents, concerned that the friendship is too intense, separate them, and the girls take revenge.
filmInfoContainer4: Dark, stylish, and captivating, Heavenly Creatures signals both the auspicious debut of Kate Winslet and the arrival of Peter Jackson as more than just a cult director.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1971, a young and disorientated British soldier is accidentally abandoned by his unit following a riot on the deadly streets of Belfast.
filmInfoContainer4: Powerfully directed and acted, '71 stays true to its fact-based origins while remaining as gripping as any solidly crafted action thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: The monstrous spirit of a slain janitor seeks revenge by invading the dreams of teenagers whose parents were responsible for his untimely death.
filmInfoContainer4: Wes Craven's intelligent premise, combined with the horrifying visual appearance of Freddy Krueger, still causes nightmares to this day.

filmInfoContainer3: Fledgling writer Briony Tallis, as a thirteen-year-old, irrevocably changes the course of several lives when she accuses her older sister's lover of a crime he did not commit.
filmInfoContainer4: Atonement features strong performances, brilliant cinematography, and a unique score. Featuring deft performances from James MacAvoy and Keira Knightley, it's a successful adaptation of Ian McEwan's novel.

filmInfoContainer3: The friendship between two young women who grew up in the same orphanage; one has found refuge at a convent in Romania and refuses to leave with her friend, who now lives in Germany.
filmInfoContainer4: Although some viewers may mistake its deliberate pace for passionless filmmaking, Beyond the Hills offers an intelligent, powerfully acted examination of the tension between secular life and religious faith.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of the life of acclaimed 'horse whisperer' Buck Brannaman, who recovered from years of child abuse to become a well-known expert in the interactions between horses and people.

Alejandro, a resourceful street orphan on the verge of adolescence, lives and works in an auto-body repair shop in a sprawling junkyard on the outskirts of Queens, New York. In this chaotic world of adults, Alejandro struggles to make a better life for himself and his sixteen-year-old sister.
filmInfoContainer4: Filled with excellent performances, Ramin Bahrani's deft sophomore effort is a heartfelt, hopeful neorealist look at the people who live in the gritty underbelly of New York City.

filmInfoContainer3: A New York woman (who doesn't really have an apartment) apprentices for a dance company (though she's not really a dancer) and throws herself headlong into her dreams, even as the possibility of realizing them dwindles.
filmInfoContainer4: Audiences will need to tolerate a certain amount of narrative drift, but thanks to sensitive direction from Noah Baumbach and an endearing performance from Greta Gerwig, Frances Ha makes it easy to forgive.

filmInfoContainer3: Two Boston area detectives investigate a little girl's kidnapping, which ultimately turns into a crisis both professionally and personally.
filmInfoContainer4: Ben Affleck proves his directing credentials in this gripping dramatic thriller, drawing strong performances from the excellent cast and bringing working-class Boston to the screen.

filmInfoContainer3: After a botched bank robbery lands his younger brother in prison, Connie Nikas embarks on a twisted odyssey through the city's underworld in an increasingly desperate-and dangerous-attempt to get his brother Nick out of jail.
filmInfoContainer4: A visual treat filled out by consistently stellar work from Robert Pattinson, Good Time is a singularly distinctive crime drama offering far more than the usual genre thrills.

filmInfoContainer3: When a young Russian woman and her son leave Moscow to meet her fiancé, who fails to show up, she declares political asylum.
filmInfoContainer4: Critics are raving about Last Resort, saying it's a convincing, touching tale. Particularly impressive is the lack of script during the film's shoot.

filmInfoContainer3: When an open-minded Jewish librarian and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor, and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.
filmInfoContainer4: Benigni's earnest charm, when not overstepping its bounds into the unnecessarily treacly, offers the possibility of hope in the face of unflinching horror.

filmInfoContainer3: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.
filmInfoContainer4: A 3D adaptation of a supposedly "unfilmable" book, Ang Lee's Life of Pi achieves the near impossible -- it's an astonishing technical achievement that's also emotionally rewarding.

filmInfoContainer3: In the 1960s, Beach Boys leader Brian Wilson struggles with emerging psychosis as he attempts to craft his avant-garde pop masterpiece. In the 1980s, he is a broken, confused man under the 24-hour watch of shady therapist Dr. Eugene Landy.
filmInfoContainer4: As unconventional and unwieldy as the life and legacy it honors, Love & Mercy should prove moving for Brian Wilson fans while still satisfying neophytes.

filmInfoContainer3: Tom Regan, an advisor to a Prohibition-era crime boss, tries to keep the peace between warring mobs but gets caught in divided loyalties.
filmInfoContainer4: Though possibly more notable for its distinctive style than an airtight story, this Coen brothers take on the classic gangster flick features sharp dialogue, impressive cinematography, and a typically quirky cast of characters.

filmInfoContainer3: Astronaut Sam Bell has a quintessentially personal encounter toward the end of his three-year stint on the Moon, where he, working alongside his computer, GERTY, sends back to Earth parcels of a resource that has helped diminish our planet's power problems.
filmInfoContainer4: Boosted by Sam Rockwell's intense performance, Moon is a compelling work of science-fiction, and a promising debut from director Duncan Jones.

filmInfoContainer3: An ad executive comes up with a campaign to defeat Augusto Pinochet in Chile's 1988 referendum.
filmInfoContainer4: No uses its history-driven storyline to offer a bit of smart, darkly funny perspective on modern democracy and human nature.

filmInfoContainer: Not Quite Hollywood: The Wild, Untold Story of Ozploitation!
filmInfoContainer3: The story of the Australian exploitation genre cinema of 1970s and 80s.
filmInfoContainer4: A raucous, fast-paced celebration of the Ozploitation films that came out of Australia in the 1970s and 1980s.

filmInfoContainer3: A story that revolves around three sisters who live in their grandmother's home and the arrival of their thirteen-year-old half sister.
filmInfoContainer4: Our Little Sister uses the story of one fractured family to offer universal -- and deeply moving -- observations on the human condition.

filmInfoContainer3: A Honduran young girl and a Mexican gangster are united in a journey across the American border.
filmInfoContainer4: Part harrowing immigration tale, part gangster story, this debut by writer/director Cary Fukunaga is sensitive, insightful and deeply authentic.

filmInfoContainer3: Peter Parker is beset with troubles in his failing personal life as he battles a brilliant scientist named Doctor Otto Octavius.
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting an entertaining villain and deeper emotional focus, this is a nimble sequel that improves upon the original.

filmInfoContainer3: A visual social examination in the form of ten conversations between a driving woman and her various pick-ups and hitchhikers.
filmInfoContainer4: Ten turns a conversational car ride into a gritty and compelling character study full of real emotion while providing an intriguing look into the lives of women in contemporary Iranian culture.

filmInfoContainer3: High-school life gets even more unbearable for Nadine when her best friend, Krista, starts dating her older brother.
filmInfoContainer4: The Edge of Seventeen's sharp script -- and Hailee Steinfeld's outstanding lead performance -- make this more than just another coming-of-age dramedy.

filmInfoContainer3: At a top secret research facility in the 1960s, a lonely janitor forms a unique relationship with an amphibious creature that is being held in captivity.
filmInfoContainer4: The Shape of Water finds Guillermo del Toro at his visually distinctive best -- and matched by an emotionally absorbing story brought to life by a stellar Sally Hawkins performance.

filmInfoContainer3: During the era of Prohibition in the United States, federal agent Eliot Ness sets out to stop ruthless Chicago gangster Al Capone, and because of rampant corruption, assembles a small, hand-picked team to help him.
filmInfoContainer4: Slick on the surface but loaded with artful touches, Brian DePalma's classical gangster thriller is a sharp look at period Chicago crime, featuring excellent performances from a top-notch cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Strange events happen in a small village in the north of Germany during the years before World War I, which seem to be ritual punishment. Who is responsible?
filmInfoContainer4: The White Ribbon effectively utilizes tension and a bleak atmosphere to deliver a thought-provoking examination of nascent fascism.

filmInfoContainer3: A family moves into a new neighborhood, and a 10-year-old named Laure deliberately presents as a boy named Mikhael to the neighborhood children.
filmInfoContainer4: In tune with the emotion and tribulations of childhood, Tomboy is a charming movie that treats its main subject with warmth and heart.

filmInfoContainer3: Julián receives an unexpected visit from his friend Tomás, who lives in Canada. The two men, accompanied by Julián's faithful dog, Truman, will share emotional and surprising moments prompted by Julián's complicated situation.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-written, well-acted, and patiently crafted, Truman takes an affecting look at a long friendship separated by distance but undimmed by time.

filmInfoContainer3: A veteran hunter helps an FBI agent investigate the murder of a young woman on a Wyoming Native American reservation.
filmInfoContainer4: Wind River lures viewers into a character-driven mystery with smart writing, a strong cast, and a skillfully rendered setting that delivers the bitter chill promised by its title.

filmInfoContainer3: An unflinching Ozark Mountain girl hacks through dangerous social terrain as she hunts down her drug-dealing father while trying to keep her family intact.
filmInfoContainer4: Bleak, haunting, and yet still somehow hopeful, Winter's Bone is writer-director Debra Granik's best work yet -- and it boasts an incredible, starmaking performance from Jennifer Lawrence.

filmInfoContainer3: A married couple grieving the recent death of their young daughter are in Venice when they encounter two elderly sisters, one of whom is psychic and brings a warning from beyond.
filmInfoContainer4: Don't Look Now patiently builds suspense with haunting imagery and a chilling score -- causing viewers to feel Donald Sutherland and Julie Christie's grief deep within.

filmInfoContainer3: The relationship between a father and daughter is complicated by the arrival of a handsome young man.
filmInfoContainer4: This slow-moving French family drama is rich, complex, subtle and emotionally eloquent.

filmInfoContainer3: Inspired by a true story, a comedy centered on a 27-year-old guy who learns of his cancer diagnosis and his subsequent struggle to beat the disease.
filmInfoContainer4: A good-hearted film about a difficult topic, 50/50 maneuvers between jokes and drama with surprising finesse.

filmInfoContainer3: When three blue collar acquaintances come across millions of dollars in lost cash they make a plan to keep their find from the authorities but find complications and mistrust weaving its way into their plan.
filmInfoContainer4: A riveting crime thriller full of emotional tension.

filmInfoContainer3: The Muppet Elmo is one of the most beloved characters among children across the globe. Meet the unlikely man behind the puppet - the heart and soul of Elmo - Kevin Clash.
An examination of America's win-at-all-cost culture from the perspective of bodybuilding and performance enhancing drugs, as it focuses on a pair of siblings chasing their dream.
filmInfoContainer4: Bigger, Stronger, Faster* is a fascinating, informative, entertaining and especially introspective account of the American 'enhancement' culture.

filmInfoContainer3: A progressive graduate student finds success and sparks outrage when his interest in battle rap as a thesis subject becomes a competitive obsession.
filmInfoContainer4: With its thorny themes and aggressive humor, Bodied dares to offend - and justifies its approach with a subversive comedy that edifies as it entertains.

filmInfoContainer3: Filmmaker Michael Moore explores the roots of America's predilection for gun violence.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it may not always convince, Bowling for Columbine asks important questions and provokes thought.

filmInfoContainer3: A married couple is terrorized by a series of surveillance videotapes left on their front porch.
filmInfoContainer4: A creepy French psychological thriller that commands the audience's attention throughout.

filmInfoContainer3: Werner Herzog gains exclusive access to film inside the Chauvet caves of Southern France and captures the oldest known pictorial creations of humanity.
filmInfoContainer4: Hauntingly filmed and brimming with Herzog's infectious enthusiasm, Cave of Forgotten Dreams is a fascinating triumph.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1990, to protect his fragile mother from a fatal shock after a long coma, a young man must keep her from learning that her beloved nation of East Germany as she knew it has disappeared.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny and poignant social critique of German reunification.

filmInfoContainer3: Drawn from a never-before-seen cache of personal footage spanning decades, this is an intimate portrait of the Sri Lankan artist and musician who continues to shatter conventions.
filmInfoContainer4: Matangi/Maya/M.I.A. makes up in energy and ambition what it lacks in objective distance, offering fans a personal perspective on a singular career.

filmInfoContainer2: Action, Crime, Drama, Mystery, Sci-Fi, Thriller
filmInfoContainer3: In a future where a special police unit is able to arrest murderers before they commit their crimes, an officer from that unit is himself accused of a future murder.
filmInfoContainer4: Thought-provoking and visceral, Steven Spielberg successfully combines high concept ideas and high octane action in this fast and febrile sci-fi thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenage hustler and a young man obsessed with alien abductions cross paths, together discovering a horrible, liberating truth.
filmInfoContainer4: Bold performances and sensitive, spot-on direction make watching this difficult tale of trauma and abuse a thought-provoking, resonant experience.

filmInfoContainer3: A small town police chief awaits the arrival of a gang of killers.
A young Peruvian bear travels to London in search of a home. Finding himself lost and alone at Paddington Station, he meets the kindly Brown family, who offer him a temporary haven.
filmInfoContainer4: Paddington brings a beloved children's character into the 21st century without sacrificing his essential charm, delivering a family-friendly adventure as irresistibly cuddly as its star.

filmInfoContainer3: A man must struggle to travel home for Thanksgiving with an obnoxious slob of a shower curtain ring salesman as his only companion.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to the impeccable chemistry between Steve Martin and John Candy, as well as a deft mix of humor and heart, Planes, Trains and Automobiles is a hilarious, heartfelt holiday classic.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary comparing the highly profitable American health care industry to other nations, and HMO horror stories including shotgun deaths.
filmInfoContainer4: Driven by Michael Moore's sincere humanism, Sicko is a devastating, convincing, and very entertaining documentary about the state of America's health care.

filmInfoContainer3: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.
filmInfoContainer4: Spider-Man: Homecoming does whatever a second reboot can, delivering a colorful, fun adventure that fits snugly in the sprawling MCU without getting bogged down in franchise-building.

filmInfoContainer3: A town in Fengjie county is gradually being demolished and flooded to make way for the Three Gorges Dam. A man and woman visit the town to locate their estranged spouses, and become witness to the societal changes.
filmInfoContainer4: Zhangke spellbindingly captures the human cost of rapid industrialization in modern China.

filmInfoContainer3: In a Chilean little town, the son of an uprooted couple, formed by a rigorous communist father and a loving but weak mother, tries to pave his own path in a society that does not understand their Jewish-Ukrainian origins.
filmInfoContainer4: This long-overdue return from Alejandro Jodorowsky finds him just as overflowing with imagination -- and heart -- as fans have come to expect.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the five-day interview between Rolling Stone reporter David Lipsky and acclaimed novelist David Foster Wallace, which took place right after the 1996 publication of Wallace's groundbreaking epic novel, 'Infinite Jest.'
filmInfoContainer4: Brilliantly performed and smartly unconventional, The End of the Tour pays fitting tribute to a singular talent while offering profoundly poignant observations on the human condition.

filmInfoContainer3: Starr witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood best friend Khalil at the hands of a police officer. Now, facing pressure from all sides of the community, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what's right.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a breakout turn from Amandla Stenberg, the hard-hitting The Hate U Give emphatically proves the YA genre has room for much more than magic and romance.

filmInfoContainer3: A French illusionist finds himself out of work and travels to Scotland, where he meets a young woman. Their ensuing adventure changes both their lives forever.
filmInfoContainer4: An engrossing love letter to fans of adult animation, The Illusionist offers a fine antidote to garish mainstream fare.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary centered on a young man in Spain who claims to a grieving Texas family that he is their 16-year-old son who has been missing for 3 years.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite its true-crime trappings, The Imposter is an utterly gripping and sometimes heartbreaking documentary thriller cleverly told with narrative flair.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama centered on a maid trying to hold on to her position after having served a family for 23 years.
filmInfoContainer4: Catalina Saavedra's devastating performance would be reason enough to see The Maid, but Sebastian Silva's empathetic direction and finely tuned script only add to the movie's pleasing heft.

filmInfoContainer3: The dramatization of a motorcycle road trip Che Guevara went on in his youth that showed him his life's calling.
filmInfoContainer4: The Motorcycle Diaries is heartfelt and profound in its rendering of the formative experiences that turn Ernesto "Che" Guerva into a famous revolutionary.

filmInfoContainer3: Prompted by the death of his father and the grief of his mother, a man recalls the story of how they met in flashback.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully filmed, The Road Home is a simple touching and tender love story.

filmInfoContainer3: The eccentric members of a dysfunctional family reluctantly gather under the same roof for various reasons.
filmInfoContainer4: The Royal Tenenbaums is a delightful adult comedy with many quirks and a sense of poignancy. Many critics especially praised Hackman's performance.

filmInfoContainer3: Three men, three women, opposites, possibilities, and tastes. Castella owns a industrial steel barrel plant in Rouen; Bruno is his flute-playing driver, Franck is his temporary bodyguard ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: The Taste of Others is a fresh, witty comedy about the attraction of opposites. The characters are well-drawn and engaging and their social interactions believable.

filmInfoContainer3: A man shuffles through a dream meeting various people and discussing the meanings and purposes of the universe.
filmInfoContainer4: Waking Life's inventive animated aesthetic adds a distinctive visual component to a film that could easily have rested on its smart screenplay and talented ensemble cast.

filmInfoContainer3: In the late 1960s/early 1970s, a San Francisco cartoonist becomes an amateur detective obsessed with tracking down the Zodiac Killer, an unidentified individual who terrorizes Northern California with a killing spree.
filmInfoContainer4: A quiet, dialogue-driven thriller that delivers with scene after scene of gut-wrenching anxiety. David Fincher also spends more time illustrating nuances of his characters and recreating the mood of the 70s than he does on gory details of murder.

filmInfoContainer3: A giant builds a wall to keep children out of his garden, but then winter sets in permanently.
filmInfoContainer4: Starkly emotional and beautifully directed, The Selfish Giant uses a lovely script and some powerful performances to present some of the best that modern British cinema has to offer.

filmInfoContainer3: After the assassination of Dr. George Tiller in Kansas in 2009, there are a limited number of doctors left in the country who provide third-trimester abortions for women. AFTER TILLER moves...
filmInfoContainer4: After Tiller applies empathy, honesty, and graceful understatement to a discussion that all too often lacks them all.

filmInfoContainer3: A talented young boy becomes torn between his unexpected love of dance and the disintegration of his family.
filmInfoContainer4: Billy Elliot is a charming movie that can evoke both laughter and tears.

filmInfoContainer3: Daphne and her four children try to cope with the abrupt death of husband/father. As the family seems to fall apart, a sudden incident gives them a chance to heal their 'broken wings'.
filmInfoContainer4: An accurate and compassionate rendering of an ordinary family in crisis.

filmInfoContainer3: A drug cartel boss who is arrested in a raid is coerced into betraying his former accomplices as part of an undercover operation.
filmInfoContainer4: A taut, solidly constructed action thriller with uncommon intelligence, Drug War delivers exhilarating set pieces without skimping on sophisticated filmmaking.

filmInfoContainer3: A high school teacher's personal life becomes complicated as he works with students during the school elections, particularly with an obsessive overachiever determined to become student body president.
filmInfoContainer4: Election successfully combines dark humor and intelligent writing in this very witty and enjoyable film.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of children, in a depressed small town, band together to cover up a tragic mistake one summer.
Tomas is too much for his lone mother so she sends him to live with his older brother Federico, aka Sombra, in Mexico City.
filmInfoContainer4: A striking effort that synthesizes disparate influences with inventive flair, Güeros marks a bold step forward for modern Mexican cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: An inner-city junior high school teacher with a drug habit forms an unlikely friendship with one of his students after she discovers his secret.
filmInfoContainer4: Half Nelson features powerful performances from Ryan Gosling and Shareeka Epps. It's a wise, unsentimental portrait of lonely people at the crossroads.

filmInfoContainer2: Adventure, Drama, Family, Fantasy, Mystery, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: In Paris in 1931, an orphan named Hugo Cabret, who lives in the walls of a train station, is wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton.
filmInfoContainer4: Hugo is an extravagant, elegant fantasy with an innocence lacking in many modern kids' movies, and one that emanates an unabashed love for the magic of cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.
filmInfoContainer4: With his sturdy cast and confident direction, Sean Penn has turned a complex work of non-fiction like Into the Wild into an accessible and poignant character study.

filmInfoContainer3: In San Francisco, a group of people discover the human race is being replaced one by one, with clones devoid of emotion.
filmInfoContainer4: Employing gritty camerawork and evocative sound effects, Invasion of the Body Snatchers is a powerful remake that expands upon themes and ideas only lightly explored in the original.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman struggles to interact with her family and find her place in society after spending fifteen years in prison.
filmInfoContainer4: I've Loved You So Long is a sublimely acted family drama as well as a noteworthy directorial debut from Phillipe Claudel.

filmInfoContainer3: When an African boy arrives by cargo ship in the port city of Le Havre, an aging shoe shiner takes pity on the child and welcomes him into his home.
filmInfoContainer4: Aki Kaurismäki's deadpan wit hits a graceful note with Le Havre, a comedy/drama that's sweet, sad, and uplifting in equal measure.

filmInfoContainer3: Ethan and team take on their most impossible mission yet, eradicating the Syndicate - an International rogue organization as highly skilled as they are, committed to destroying the IMF.
filmInfoContainer4: Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation continues the franchise's thrilling resurgence -- and proves that Tom Cruise remains an action star without equal.

filmInfoContainer3: Two young boys encounter a fugitive and form a pact to help him evade the vigilantes that are on his trail and to reunite him with his true love.
filmInfoContainer4: Bolstered by a strong performance from Matthew McConaughey in the title role, Mud offers an engaging Southern drama that manages to stay sweet and heartwarming without being sappy.

filmInfoContainer3: Director Nathaniel Kahn searches to understand his father, noted architect Louis Kahn, who died bankrupt and alone in 1974.
filmInfoContainer4: A moving and enlightening documentary about architect Louis Kahn.

filmInfoContainer3: Struggle of Women in a country that excludes them from entering the stadiums.
filmInfoContainer4: A spirited film that explores gender politics with comedy, intelligence, and a variety of interesting characters.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the true story of the Granite Mountain Hotshots, a group of elite firefighters who risk everything to protect a town from a historic wildfire.
filmInfoContainer4: Only the Brave's impressive veteran cast and affecting fact-based story add up to a no-frills drama that's just as stolidly powerful as the real-life heroes it honors.

filmInfoContainer3: In Miami in 1980, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel and succumbs to greed.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Brian De Palma and star Al Pacino take it to the limit in this stylized, ultra-violent and eminently quotable gangster epic that walks a thin white line between moral drama and celebratory excess.

filmInfoContainer3: The crew of the ship Serenity try to evade an assassin sent to recapture one of their members who is telepathic.
filmInfoContainer4: Snappy dialogue and goofy characters make this Wild Wild West soap opera in space fun and adventurous.

filmInfoContainer3: The Borg travel back in time intent on preventing Earth's first contact with an alien species. Captain Picard and his crew pursue them to ensure that Zefram Cochran makes his maiden flight reaching warp speed.
filmInfoContainer4: While fans of the series will surely appreciate it, First Contact is exciting, engaging, and visually appealing enough to entertain Star Trek novices.

filmInfoContainer3: About a filmmaker not only revisiting, but also recreating (not in a conventional sense) one of his first films, The Perfect Human / Det perfekte menneske (1967)
filmInfoContainer4: Both an intriguing intellectual exercise and an amusing look at the contrasts between the two filmmakers.

filmInfoContainer: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
filmInfoContainer3: A journalist is aided by a young female hacker in his search for the killer of a woman who has been dead for forty years.
filmInfoContainer4: Its graphic violence and sprawling length will prove too much for some viewers to take, but Noomi Rapace's gripping performance makes The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo an unforgettable viewing experience.

filmInfoContainer3: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, yet who has a mysterious gift.
filmInfoContainer4: Though The Green Mile is long, critics say it's an absorbing, emotionally powerful experience.

filmInfoContainer3: After a threat from the tiger Shere Khan forces him to flee the jungle, a man-cub named Mowgli embarks on a journey of self discovery with the help of panther Bagheera and free-spirited bear Baloo.
filmInfoContainer4: As lovely to behold as it is engrossing to watch, The Jungle Book is the rare remake that actually improves upon its predecessors -- all while setting a new standard for CGI.

filmInfoContainer3: After a tragic accident, two stage magicians engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have to outwit each other.
filmInfoContainer4: Full of twists and turns, The Prestige is a dazzling period piece that never stops challenging the audience.

filmInfoContainer3: A college professor travels to New York City to attend a conference and finds a young couple living in his apartment.
filmInfoContainer4: The Visitor is a heartfelt, humanistic drama that deftly explores identity, immigration, and other major post-9/11 issues.

filmInfoContainer3: Called up for service in Iraq, several members of the National Guard were given digital video cameras. This film, edited from their footage, provides a perspective on a complex and troubled conflict.
filmInfoContainer4: Candid, eye-opening footage gives viewers a close-up -- and educational -- look at the experiences of American soldiers in Iraq, a viewpoint not normally seen.

filmInfoContainer3: The remarkable story of The Weather Underground, radical activists of the 1970s, and of radical politics at its best and most disastrous.
filmInfoContainer4: Fascinating documentary about the militant Weathermen.

filmInfoContainer3: In Detroit, a lonely pop culture geek marries a call girl, steals cocaine from her pimp, and tries to sell it in Hollywood. Meanwhile, the owners of the cocaine, the Mob, track them down in an attempt to reclaim it.
filmInfoContainer4: Fueled by Quentin Tarantino's savvy screenplay and a gallery of oddball performances, Tony Scott's True Romance is a funny and violent action jaunt in the best sense.

filmInfoContainer3: Several women enter a science fiction author's life over the course of a few years, after the author has lost the woman he considers his one true love.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Wong Kar-Wai has created in 2046 another visually stunning, atmospheric, and melancholy movie about unrequited love and loneliness.

filmInfoContainer3: A small-time rancher agrees to hold a captured outlaw who's awaiting a train to go to court in Yuma. A battle of wills ensues as the outlaw tries to psych out the rancher.
filmInfoContainer4: This remake of a classic Western improves on the original, thanks to fiery performances from Russell Crowe and Christian Bale as well as sharp direction from James Mangold.

filmInfoContainer: Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan
filmInfoContainer3: Kazakh TV talking head Borat is dispatched to the United States to report on the greatest country in the world. With a documentary crew in tow, Borat becomes more interested in locating and marrying Pamela Anderson.
filmInfoContainer4: Part satire, part shockumentary,Borat gets high-fives almost all-around for being offensive in the funniest possible way. Jagshemash!

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a young Jack, newly released from serving a prison sentence for a violent crime he committed as a child.
filmInfoContainer4: Small in scale but large in impact, Boy A's career making performances (particularly that by star Andrew Garfield) and carefully crafted characters defy judgment and aggressively provoke debate.

filmInfoContainer3: A satirical look at the gangsters of Poland and some teens who accidentally get involved with them.
filmInfoContainer4: Hilary Swank's acclaimed performance pays fitting tribute to the tragic life of Brandon Teena.

filmInfoContainer3: A FedEx executive must transform himself physically and emotionally to survive a crash landing on a deserted island.
filmInfoContainer4: Flawed but fascinating, Cast Away offers an intelligent script, some of Robert Zemeckis' most mature directing, and a showcase performance from Tom Hanks.

filmInfoContainer3: Under the tutelage of Rocky Balboa, heavyweight contender Adonis Creed faces off against Viktor Drago, son of Ivan Drago.
filmInfoContainer4: Creed II's adherence to franchise formula adds up to a sequel with few true surprises, but its time-tested generational themes still pack a solid punch.

filmInfoContainer3: In a time of social change and unrest, war and poverty, a young working class woman, Maria, wins a camera in a lottery. The decision to keep it alters her whole life.
filmInfoContainer4: Elegant and intimate, Everlasting Moments moves at the deliberate and gentle pace of a classical European period drama.

filmInfoContainer3: New Orleans District Attorney Jim Garrison discovers there's more to the Kennedy assassination than the official story.
filmInfoContainer4: As history, Oliver Stone's JFK is dubious, but as filmmaking it's electric, cramming a ton of information and excitement into its three-hour runtime and making great use of its outstanding cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Mathilda, a 12-year-old girl, is reluctantly taken in by Léon, a professional assassin, after her family is murdered. Léon and Mathilda form an unusual relationship, as she becomes his protégée and learns the assassin's trade.
filmInfoContainer4: Pivoting on the unusual relationship between seasoned hitman and his 12-year-old apprentice -- a breakout turn by young Natalie Portman -- Luc Besson's Léon is a stylish and oddly affecting thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.
filmInfoContainer4: Daniel Day-Lewis characteristically delivers in this witty, dignified portrait that immerses the audience in its world and entertains even as it informs.

filmInfoContainer3: A recovering alcoholic and recently converted Mormon, Arthur "Killer" Kane, of the rock band The New York Dolls, is given a chance at reuniting with his band after 30 years.
filmInfoContainer4: Arthur Kane is a fascinating subject in what ultimately proves to be a touching, bittersweet documentary.

filmInfoContainer3: Selfish yuppie Charlie Babbitt's father left a fortune to his savant brother Raymond and a pittance to Charlie; they travel cross-country.
filmInfoContainer4: This road-trip movie about an autistic savant and his callow brother is far from seamless, but Barry Levinson's direction is impressive, and strong performances from Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman add to its appeal.

filmInfoContainer3: At age 42, Rafael Belvedere is having a crisis. He lives in the shadow of his father, he feels guilty about rarely visiting his aging mother, his ex-wife says he doesn't spend enough time ...
filmInfoContainer4: A film about one man's mid-life crisis, The Son of the Bride is both touching and funny.

filmInfoContainer: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
filmInfoContainer3: With the assistance of the Enterprise crew, Admiral Kirk must stop an old nemesis, Khan Noonien Singh, from using the life-generating Genesis Device as the ultimate weapon.
filmInfoContainer4: Considered by many fans to be the best of the Star Trek movies, Khan features a strong plot, increased tension, and a sharp supporting performance from Ricardo Montalban.

filmInfoContainer3: Two co-dependent high school seniors are forced to deal with separation anxiety after their plan to stage a booze-soaked party goes awry.
filmInfoContainer4: Deftly balancing vulgarity and sincerity while placing its protagonists in excessive situations, Superbad is an authentic take on friendship and the overarching awkwardness of the high school experience.

filmInfoContainer: The Cave of the Yellow Dog
filmInfoContainer3: The little nomad girl Nansal finds a baby dog in the Mongolian veld, who becomes her best friend - against all rejections of her parents. A story about a Mongolian family of nomads - their ...
filmInfoContainer4: A sparse, hauntingly beautiful journey across continents and cultures.

filmInfoContainer3: A brilliant but troubled New Zealand chess champion finds purpose by teaching underprivileged children about the rules of chess and life.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by an outstanding performance from Cliff Curtis, The Dark Horse tackles complex themes with a richly layered, unpredictable, and deeply affecting story.

filmInfoContainer3: When Greg Sestero, an aspiring film actor, meets the weird and mysterious Tommy Wiseau in an acting class, they form a unique friendship and travel to Hollywood to make their dreams come true.
filmInfoContainer4: Oh, hai Mark. The Disaster Artist is a surprisingly poignant and charming movie-about-a-movie that explores the creative process with unexpected delicacy.

filmInfoContainer3: Five friends travel to a cabin in the woods, where they unknowingly release flesh-possessing demons.
filmInfoContainer4: This classic low budget horror film combines just the right amount of gore and black humor, giving The Evil Dead an equal amount of thrills and laughs.

filmInfoContainer3: A fine day in the life of a fly presented completely from the fly's point of view. A fine day until something dreary happens, that is.
filmInfoContainer4: David Cronenberg combines his trademark affinity for gore and horror with strongly developed characters, making The Fly a surprisingly affecting tragedy.

filmInfoContainer3: A S.W.A.T. team becomes trapped in a tenement run by a ruthless mobster and his army of killers and thugs.
filmInfoContainer4: No frills and all thrills, The Raid: Redemption is an inventive action film expertly paced and edited for maximum entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: In southern France, a Franco-Arabic shipyard worker along with his partner's daughter pursues his dream of opening a restaurant.
filmInfoContainer4: A complex portrait of an immigrant family, The Secret of the Grain is a sprawling, intimate film with many fine performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A research team in Antarctica is hunted by a shape-shifting alien that assumes the appearance of its victims.
filmInfoContainer4: Grimmer and more terrifying than the 1950s take, John Carpenter's The Thing is a tense sci-fi thriller rife with compelling tension and some remarkable make-up effects.

filmInfoContainer3: As he plans his next job, a longtime thief tries to balance his feelings for a bank manager connected to one of his earlier heists, as well as the F.B.I. Agent looking to bring him and his crew down.
filmInfoContainer4: Tense, smartly written, and wonderfully cast, The Town proves that Ben Affleck has rediscovered his muse -- and that he's a director to be reckoned with.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a teenage boy, his mother, and two other women who help raise him among the love and freedom of Southern California of 1979.
filmInfoContainer4: 20th Century Women offers Annette Bening a too-rare opportunity to shine in a leading role -- and marks another assured step forward for writer-director Mike Mills.

filmInfoContainer3: Amidst financial crises and unprecedented public school budget cuts, Brooklyn Castle takes an intimate look at the challenges and triumphs facing members of a junior high school's champion chess team.
filmInfoContainer4: Brooklyn Castle is a warm, engaging, and even uplifting documentary about chess-playing whiz kids.

filmInfoContainer3: A day in the lives of two convenience clerks named Dante and Randal as they annoy customers, discuss movies, and play hockey on the store roof.
filmInfoContainer4: With its quirky characters and clever, quotable dialogue, Clerks is the ultimate clarion call for slackers everywhere to unite and, uh, do something we guess?

filmInfoContainer3: An Iranian pizza delivery man sees the worst of corruption and social unbalance in his city and is driven to crime.
filmInfoContainer4: A slow-burning, riveting film about Iranian class differences.

filmInfoContainer3: A resourceful British government agent seeks answers in a case involving the disappearance of a colleague and the disruption of the American space program.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring plenty of the humor, action, and escapist thrills the series would become known for, Dr. No kicks off the Bond franchise in style.

filmInfoContainer3: When a sudden illness and an unexpected reunion threaten dutiful housewife Elena's potential inheritance, she must hatch a desperate plan ...

filmInfoContainer: Ex Libris: The New York Public Library
filmInfoContainer3: A look within the walls of the New York Public Library.
filmInfoContainer4: Ex Libris: The New York Public Library adds another remarkable chapter to documentarian Frederick Wiseman's career-long quest for observational excellence.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1950s Connecticut, a housewife faces a marital crisis and mounting racial tensions in the outside world.
filmInfoContainer4: An exquisitely designed and performed melodrama, Far From Heaven earns its viewers' tears with sincerity and intelligence.

filmInfoContainer3: Everything changes for 15-year-old Mia when her mum brings home a new boyfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: Cannes Jury Prize-winner Fish Tank is gritty British realism at its very best, with flawless performances from newcomer Kate Jarvis, and Michael Fassbender.

filmInfoContainer3: The lives of upstairs guests and downstairs servants at a party in 1932 in a country house in England as they investigate a murder involving one of them.
filmInfoContainer4: A mixture of Upstairs, Downstairs, Clue, and perceptive social commentary, Gosford Park ranks among director Altman's best.

filmInfoContainer3: How Divine, aka Harris Glenn Milstead, became John Waters' cinematic muse and an international drag icon.
filmInfoContainer4: With warmth and affection, I Am Divine offers an engaging portrait of the complex personality behind a trailblazing cinematic figure.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that follows former U.S. Labor Secretary Robert Reich as he looks to raise awareness of the country's widening economic gap.
filmInfoContainer4: While it arrives in a glut of similarly themed documentaries, Inequality for All distinguishes itself with a compelling presentation of an important message, as well as much-needed splashes of wit.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary about fashion icon Iris Apfel from legendary documentary filmmaker Albert Maysles.
filmInfoContainer4: A small, insightful feature with a deceptively thoughtful thesis, Iris adds a bittersweet postscript to director Albert Maysles' filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: The relationships of four couples unravel after the discovery of a young woman's body in Lantana bush in suburban Sydney.
filmInfoContainer4: Lantana is an intricately plotted character study that quietly shines with authenticity.

filmInfoContainer3: A Ugandan girl sees her world rapidly change after being introduced to the game of chess.
filmInfoContainer4: Queen of Katwe is a feel-good movie of uncommon smarts and passion, and outstanding performances by Lupita Nyong'o and David Oyelowo help to elevate the film past its cliches.

filmInfoContainer3: Two competitive friends, fueled by literary aspirations and youthful exuberance, endure the pangs of love, depression and burgeoning careers.
filmInfoContainer4: With Reprise, first-time director Joachim Trier effectively captures the spirit of young adulthood, and announces his arrival as a filmmaker to be watched.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the life of French painter Séraphine de Senlis.
filmInfoContainer4: Seraphine is a well-crafted French film that effectively captures one woman's experience with art, religion, and mental illness, and features a brilliant performance from Yolande Moreau.

filmInfoContainer3: A dramatization of the final days of Sophie Scholl, one of the most famous members of the German World War II anti-Nazi resistance movement, The White Rose.
filmInfoContainer4: A film that begs the audience to reflect upon their own courage and strength of character in light of this young heroine's daring story.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: The magically long-haired Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but now that a runaway thief has stumbled upon her, she is about to discover the world for the first time, and who she really is.
filmInfoContainer4: While far from Disney's greatest film, Tangled is a visually stunning, thoroughly entertaining addition to the studio's classic animated canon.

filmInfoContainer3: A story within a story. In Australia's Northern Territory, a man tells us one of the stories of his people and his land. It's a story of an older man, Minygululu, who has three wives and ...
filmInfoContainer4: Ten Canoes combines adventure, comedy, and anthropology to explore an Aborigine folk tale both fallibly human and legendary. Helmer Rolf de Heer depicts a barely represented oral tradition with a clean style.

filmInfoContainer3: Five high school students meet in Saturday detention and discover how they have a lot more in common than they thought.
filmInfoContainer4: The Breakfast Club is a warm, insightful, and very funny look into the inner lives of teenagers.

filmInfoContainer3: An unorthodox Irish policeman with a confrontational personality is partnered with an up-tight F.B.I. agent to investigate an international drug-smuggling ring.
filmInfoContainer4: A violent, crackerjack comedy with a strong Irish flavor and an eminently likable Brendan Gleeson in the main role.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the events of the brutal Ugandan dictator Idi Amin's regime as seen by his personal physician during the 1970s.
filmInfoContainer4: Forest Whitaker's performance as real-life megalomaniac dictator Idi Amin powers this fictionalized political thriller, a blunt and brutal tale about power and corruption.

filmInfoContainer: The Life and Times of Hank Greenberg
filmInfoContainer3: The life and career of Hank Greenberg, the first major Jewish baseball star in the Major Leagues.
filmInfoContainer4: The Life and Times of Hank Greenberg is an affectionate, often very funny portrait of a baseball pioneer.

filmInfoContainer3: Two siblings and three of their friends en route to visit their grandfather's grave in Texas end up falling victim to a family of cannibalistic psychopaths.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to a smart script and documentary-style camerawork, The Texas Chainsaw Massacre achieves start-to-finish suspense, making it a classic in low-budget exploitation cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: Ryan Bingham enjoys living out of a suitcase for his job, travelling around the country firing people, but finds that lifestyle threatened by the presence of a potential love interest, and a new hire.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by charismatic performances by its three leads, director Jason Reitman delivers a smart blend of humor and emotion with just enough edge for mainstream audiences.

filmInfoContainer3: Manny, Joel, and Jonah tear their way through childhood and push against the volatile love of their parents. As Manny and Joel grow into versions of their father and Ma dreams of escape, Jonah embraces an imagined world all on his own.
filmInfoContainer4: Dreamlike and haunting, We the Animals approaches the coming-of-age odyssey with a uniquely documentarian eye.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in a surrealistic, nightmarish, Kafkaesque no man's land, this version of the famous Shakespeare play centres on the ghostly, supernatural aspects of the play. The text is the original ...
filmInfoContainer4: Kenneth Branagh's sprawling, finely textured adaptation of Shakespeare's masterpiece lives up to its source material, using strong performances and a sharp cinematic focus to create a powerfully resonant film that wastes none of its 246 minutes.

filmInfoContainer3: This is a musical short from Disney that features Timon and Pumbaa from The Lion King. Timon sings his own rendition of the hit song Stand By Me in the African fields. While he is singing, ...
filmInfoContainer4: Stand By Me is a wise, nostalgic movie with a weird streak that captures both Stephen King's voice and the trials of growing up.

filmInfoContainer3: Jean and her sister, played by Macha Grenon, have a life long infatuation with the Japanese Pianist who once lived across the street from them during their high school years. The film is ...
12 August 1945, 11 AM. Two mysterious strangers dressed in black appear at the railway station of a Hungarian village. Within a few hours, everything changes.
filmInfoContainer4: 1945 sifts through the aftermath of the Holocaust to offer a sober, well-crafted look at a variety of weighty themes.

filmInfoContainer3: The crew of a Danish cargo ship is hijacked by Somali pirates who proceed to engage in escalating negotiations with authorities in Copenhagen.
filmInfoContainer4: A tense, gripping thriller, A Hijacking avoids action movie cliches and instead creates a palpable sense of dread by mixing gritty realism with atmospheric beauty.

filmInfoContainer3: Ove, an ill-tempered, isolated retiree who spends his days enforcing block association rules and visiting his wife's grave, has finally given up on life just as an unlikely friendship develops with his boisterous new neighbors.
filmInfoContainer4: A Man Called Ove's winsome sincerity -- and Rolf Lassgård's affectingly flinty performance in the title role -- keep it from succumbing to excess sentimentality.

filmInfoContainer3: A man crippled by the mundanity of his life experiences something out of the ordinary.
filmInfoContainer4: Anomalisa marks another brilliant and utterly distinctive highlight in Charlie Kaufman's filmography, and a thought-provoking treat for fans of introspective cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: A doctor working in 1980s East Germany finds herself banished to a small country hospital.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, solidly grafted, and thoroughly gripping, Barbara offers a deliberately paced, subtly powerful character study.

filmInfoContainer3: A mysterious outsider's quiet life is turned upside down when he returns to his childhood home to carry out an act of vengeance. Proving himself an amateur assassin, he winds up in a brutal fight to protect his estranged family.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, stripped-down, and thrillingly grim, Blue Ruin proves that a well-told revenge story can still leave its audience on the edge of their seat.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of lawsuit by tens of thousands of Ecuadorans against Chevron over contamination of the Ecuadorean Amazon.
filmInfoContainer4: Dynamic, tightly arranged, and deliberately provocative, Joe Berlinger's Crude is a sobering, enraging wake-up call.

filmInfoContainer3: This candid New York love story explores the chaotic 40-year marriage of famed boxing painter Ushio Shinohara and his wife, Noriko. Anxious to shed her role as her overbearing husband's assistant, Noriko finds an identity of her own.
filmInfoContainer4: A beautifully-made documentary that explores the challenges and richness of both marriage and art through the lens of a fascinating and complex couple.

filmInfoContainer3: A newly unemployed cellist takes a job preparing the dead for funerals.
filmInfoContainer4: If slow and predictable, Departures is a quiet, life affirming story.

filmInfoContainer3: An illegal Nigerian immigrant discovers the unpalatable side of London life.
filmInfoContainer4: An illuminating and nuanced film about the exploitation of illegal immigrants.

filmInfoContainer3: A successful businesswoman gets caught up in a game of cat and mouse as she tracks down the unknown man who raped her.
filmInfoContainer4: Elle finds director Paul Verhoeven operating at peak power -- and benefiting from a typically outstanding performance from Isabelle Huppert in the central role.

filmInfoContainer3: An imaginary woman recollects the painful experience of adultery to a storyteller.
filmInfoContainer4: This brooding, measured look at adultery is ultimately emotionally riveting, thanks to its script and performances.

filmInfoContainer3: Fourteen-year-old György's life is torn apart in World War II Hungary, as he is sent to a concentration camp, where he is forced to become a man, and learns to find happiness in the midst of hatred, and what it really means to be Jewish.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully photographed and majestically scored, Fateless is a haunting account of one boy's experiences during the Holocaust and his journey to pick up the pieces in the war's aftermath.

filmInfoContainer3: It's a rare person who would give up fame and fortune to toil in obscurity for someone else's creative vision. Yet, that's exactly what Leon Vitali did after his acclaimed performance as '...
filmInfoContainer4: Filmworker offers long-overdue recognition to one of Stanley Kubrick's key collaborators while opening an often troubling window into the director's demanding work.

filmInfoContainer3: The friendly but forgetful blue tang fish, Dory, begins a search for her long-lost parents, and everyone learns a few things about the real meaning of family along the way.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, poignant, and thought-provoking, Finding Dory delivers a beautifully animated adventure that adds another entertaining chapter to its predecessor's classic story.

filmInfoContainer3: The last days of Frankenstein (1931) Director James Whale are explored.
filmInfoContainer4: Gods and Monsters is a spellbinding, confusing piece of semi-fiction, featuring fine performances; McKellen leads the way, but Redgrave and Fraser don't lag far behind.

filmInfoContainer3: Disgruntled Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbor, a Hmong teenager who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession: a 1972 Gran Torino.
filmInfoContainer4: Though a minor entry in Eastwood's body of work, Gran Torino is nevertheless a humorous, touching, and intriguing old-school parable.

filmInfoContainer3: An accomplished headhunter risks everything to obtain a valuable painting owned by a former mercenary.
filmInfoContainer4: Grisly, twisty, and darkly comic, Headhunters is an exhilaratingly oddball take on familiar thriller elements.

filmInfoContainer3: Three Palestinian women living in an apartment in Tel Aviv try to find a balance between traditional and modern culture.
filmInfoContainer4: In Between takes a light yet nuanced approach to dramatizing complex, timely themes, further enriched by outstanding cinematography and powerful performances.

filmInfoContainer3: After returning to the criminal underworld to repay a debt, John Wick discovers that a large bounty has been put on his life.
filmInfoContainer4: John Wick: Chapter 2 does what a sequel should -- which in this case means doubling down on the non-stop, thrillingly choreographed action that made its predecessor so much fun.

filmInfoContainer3: Antoine Fuqua's documentary on the blues, shot at Radio City Music Hall in New York City.
filmInfoContainer4: Lightning in a Bottle pays dazzling tribute to the blues by capturing its power and excitement through backstage interviews and performance footage.

filmInfoContainer3: In the Antarctic, every March since the beginning of time, the quest begins to find the perfect mate and start a family.
filmInfoContainer4: Only the most hardened soul won't be moved by this heartwarming doc.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of Homer Hickam, a coal miner's son who was inspired by the first Sputnik launch to take up rocketry against his father's wishes.
filmInfoContainer4: Rich in sweet sincerity, intelligence, and good old-fashioned inspirational drama, October Sky is a coming-of-age story with a heart to match its Hollywood craftsmanship.

filmInfoContainer3: Under threat by fundamentalist terrorists, a group of Trappist monks stationed with an impoverished Algerian community must decide whether to leave or stay.
filmInfoContainer4: Patient and restrained, Of Gods and Men asks deep, profound questions that will linger in the audience's mind long after the movie.

filmInfoContainer3: Brutal gangster Don Logan recruits "retired" safecracker Gal for one last job, but it goes badly for both of them.
filmInfoContainer4: Sexy Beast rises above other movies in the British gangster genre due to its performances -- particularly an electrifying one by Ben Kingsley -- and the script's attention to character development.

filmInfoContainer3: Dominican baseball star Miguel "Sugar" Santos is recruited to play in the U.S. minor-leagues.
filmInfoContainer4: Sugar is an exceptionally-crafted film -- part sports flick, part immigrant tale -- with touching and poignant drama highlighted by splendid performances.

filmInfoContainer3: The beauty of this movie is that you, as the reader of the subtitles, are the only one who knows what is going on. The woman and the two men all speak different languages. It is a comedy of errors up until the end.
filmInfoContainer4: A sweet and amusing comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark become targets of the Capitol after their victory in the 74th Hunger Games sparks a rebellion in the Districts of Panem.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, smoothly directed, and enriched with a deeper exploration of the franchise's thought-provoking themes, Catching Fire proves a thoroughly compelling second installment in the Hunger Games series.

filmInfoContainer3: A little girl lives in a very grown-up world with her mother, who tries to prepare her for it. Her neighbor, the Aviator, introduces the girl to an extraordinary world where anything is possible, the world of the Little Prince.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully animated and faithful to the spirit of its classic source material, The Little Prince is a family-friendly treat that anchors thrilling visuals with a satisfying story.

filmInfoContainer3: A boy who communicates with spirits seeks the help of a disheartened child psychologist.
filmInfoContainer4: M Night Shayamalan's The Sixth Sense is a twisty ghost story with all the style of a classical Hollywood picture, but all the chills of a modern horror flick.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman leaves an Austrian convent to become a governess to the children of a Naval officer widower.
filmInfoContainer4: Unapologetically sweet and maybe even a little corny, The Sound of Music will win over all but the most cynical filmgoers with its classic songs and irresistible warmth.
