filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of country music legend Johnny Cash's life, from his early days on an Arkansas cotton farm to his rise to fame with Sun Records in Memphis, where he recorded alongside Elvis Presley, Jerry Lee Lewis, and Carl Perkins.
filmInfoContainer4: Superior acting and authentic crooning capture the emotional subtleties of the legend of Johnny Cash with a freshness that is a pleasure to watch.

filmInfoContainer3: Three friends struggle to find work in Paris. Things become more complicated when two of them fall in love with the same woman.
filmInfoContainer4: The plot may be problematic, but such concerns are rendered superfluous by Gene Kelly and Leslie Caron's star power, the Gershwins' classic songs, and Vincente Minnelli's colorful, sympathetic direction.

filmInfoContainer3: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.
filmInfoContainer4: The well-acted A Beautiful Mind is both a moving love story and a revealing look at mental illness.

filmInfoContainer3: An English professor, one year after the sudden death of his boyfriend, is unable to cope with his typical days in 1960s Los Angeles.
filmInfoContainer4: Though the costumes are beautiful and the art direction impeccable, what stands out most from this debut by fashion designer Tom Ford is the leading performance by Colin Firth.

filmInfoContainer3: After wishing to be made big, a teenage boy wakes the next morning to find himself mysteriously in the body of an adult.
filmInfoContainer4: Refreshingly sweet and undeniably funny, Big is a showcase for Tom Hanks, who dives into his role and infuses it with charm and surprising poignancy.

filmInfoContainer3: The life and career of the hailed Hollywood movie star and underappreciated genius inventor, Hedy Lamarr.
filmInfoContainer4: Inspiring and tragic, Bombshell is a bittersweet celebration and reclamation of Hedy Lemarr's journey from Hollywood legend to technology genius.

filmInfoContainer3: An adventurous 11-year-old girl finds another world that is a strangely idealized version of her frustrating home, but it has sinister secrets.
filmInfoContainer4: With its vivid stop-motion animation combined with Neil Gaiman's imaginative story, Coraline is a film that's both visually stunning and wondrously entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: Post-apocalyptic surrealist black comedy about the landlord of an apartment building who occasionally prepares a delicacy for his odd tenants.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Jean-Pierre Jeunet deftly combines horror, sci-fi, and humor in Delicatessen, a morbid comedy set in a visually ravishing futuristic dystopia.

filmInfoContainer3: A minister of a small congregation in upstate New York grapples with mounting despair brought on by tragedy, worldly concerns and a tormented past.
filmInfoContainer4: Brought to life by delicate work from writer-director Paul Schrader and elevated by a standout performance by Ethan Hawke, First Reformed takes a sensitive and suspenseful look at weighty themes.

filmInfoContainer3: A girl with few real prospects joins a gang, reinventing herself and gaining a sense of self confidence in the process. However, she soon finds that this new life does not necessarily make her any happier.
filmInfoContainer4: Powerfully acted and smartly scripted, Girlhood offers a fresh perspective on familiar cinematic territory.

filmInfoContainer3: An aging chief's last stand, lessons for the new, and the education of a young chief-to-be played against harsh Nature in Nepal's Dolpo. When his son dies returning from Tibet's salt lakes,...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Unlike the overproduced and overbudgeted Hollywood blockbusters, Himalaya is a stunningly photographed movie that offers an intimate look into the lives of a Dolpo tribe.

filmInfoContainer3: A young boy accidentally discovers a deep hole in the ground, where another boy is kept prisoner.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-acted and thrilling coming-of-age tale that captures a child awakening to the frightening world of adults.

filmInfoContainer: Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work
filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on the life and career of Joan Rivers, made as the comedienne turns 75 years old.
filmInfoContainer4: Penetrating Rivers' coarse image, this compelling documentary offers an honest, behind-the-scenes look at her career -- and at show business in general.

filmInfoContainer3: After awakening from a four-year coma, a former assassin wreaks vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her.
filmInfoContainer4: Kill Bill is admittedly little more than a stylish revenge thriller -- albeit one that benefits from a wildly inventive surfeit of style.

filmInfoContainer3: A coming of age story about a boy and his family who overcame great challenges by turning Disney animated movies into a language to express love, loss, kinship and brotherhood.
filmInfoContainer4: Life, Animated offers a heartwarming look at one family's journey, and a fascinating message that's more than enough to outweigh its unanswered questions.

filmInfoContainer3: Loretta Castorini, a bookkeeper from Brooklyn, New York, finds herself in a difficult situation when she falls for the brother of the man she has agreed to marry.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by energetic performances from Nicolas Cage and Cher, Moonstruck is an exuberantly funny tribute to love and one of the decade's most appealing comedies.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Family, Fantasy, Musical, War
filmInfoContainer3: To save her father from death in the army, a young maiden secretly goes in his place and becomes one of China's greatest heroines in the process.
filmInfoContainer4: Exploring themes of family duty and honor, Mulan breaks new ground as a Disney film, while still bringing vibrant animation and sprightly characters to the screen.

filmInfoContainer3: Going behind the curtain to capture the most controversial, passionate, risky and high-profile Broadway season in decades.
filmInfoContainer4: Made with obvious care and attention, Showbusiness is an entertaining, insightful look into Broadway.

filmInfoContainer3: The blind masseur/swordsman comes to a town in control of warring gangs, and while bunking with a farming family, he meets two women with their own agenda.
filmInfoContainer4: Colorful, rich with action and wonderfully choreographed, Takeshi Kitano takes on the classic samurai character with his own brand of cinematic flair.

filmInfoContainer3: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.
filmInfoContainer4: Expertly blending genre formula with bursts of unexpected wit, The Bourne Identity is an action thriller that delivers -- and then some.

filmInfoContainer3: Thirteen-year-old Aisholpan trains to become the first female in twelve generations of her nomad family to become an eagle huntress.
filmInfoContainer4: Effectively stirring and bolstered by thrilling visuals, The Eagle Huntress uses its heartwarming message to fill up a feature that might have made for an even more powerful short film.

filmInfoContainer3: At the close of WWII, a young nurse tends to a badly-burned plane crash victim. His past is shown in flashbacks, revealing an involvement in a fateful love affair.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it suffers from excessive length and ambition, director Minghella's adaptation of the Michael Ondaatje novel is complex, powerful, and moving.

filmInfoContainer: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
filmInfoContainer3: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist is aided in his search for a woman who has been missing for forty years by Lisbeth Salander, a young computer hacker.
filmInfoContainer4: Brutal yet captivating, The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo is the result of David Fincher working at his lurid best with total role commitment from star Rooney Mara.

filmInfoContainer: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
filmInfoContainer3: An introvert freshman is taken under the wings of two seniors who welcome him to the real world.
filmInfoContainer4: The Perks of Being a Wallflower is a heartfelt and sincere adaptation that's bolstered by strong lead performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the life of activist, musician, and cultural icon Kathleen Hanna, who formed the punk band Bikini Kill and pioneered the "riot grrrl" movement of the 1990s.
filmInfoContainer4: It verges on hagiography, but given the deeply compelling nature of its subject's story, The Punk Singer can be forgiven its lack of objectivity.

filmInfoContainer3: As a mother and daughter struggle to cope with the terrors of the post-revolution, war-torn Tehran of the 1980s, a mysterious evil begins to haunt their home.
filmInfoContainer4: Under the Shadow deftly blends seemingly disparate genres to deliver an effective chiller with timely themes and thought-provoking social subtext.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of the current state of education in America today.
filmInfoContainer4: Gripping, heartbreaking, and ultimately hopeful, Waiting for Superman is an impassioned indictment of the American school system from An Inconvenient Truth director Davis Guggenheim.

filmInfoContainer3: Somewhere in Sub-Saharan Africa, Komona, a 14-year-old girl, tells her unborn child growing inside her the story of her life since she has been at war. Everything started when she was abducted by the rebel army at the age of 12.
filmInfoContainer4: War Witch is a mature, intense drama that embraces the bruatlity of its subject and invites the audience to sympathize with its protagonist's nightmarish circumstances.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of German construction workers start a tough job at a remote site in the Bulgarian countryside. The foreign land awakens the men's sense of adventure, but they are also confronted ...
filmInfoContainer4: Western earns the viewer's attention with an unpredictable, patiently told tale that evokes the spirit of the titular genre while adding its own unique touches.

filmInfoContainer3: A shy student trying to reach his family in Ohio, a gun-toting tough guy trying to find the last Twinkie, and a pair of sisters trying to get to an amusement park join forces to travel across a zombie-filled America.
filmInfoContainer4: Wickedly funny and featuring plenty of gore, Zombieland is proof that the zombie subgenre is far from dead.

filmInfoContainer3: A young man's life is turned around with the help of a genie inside a lamp.
filmInfoContainer4: A highly entertaining entry in Disney's renaissance era," Aladdin is beautifully drawn, with near-classic songs and a cast of scene-stealing characters.

filmInfoContainer3: A family vacationing in the French Alps is confronted with a devastating avalanche.
filmInfoContainer4: Gleefully uncomfortable, Force Majeure is a relationship drama that's hard to watch -- and just as difficult to ignore.

filmInfoContainer3: Yusuff has a hard time defining his adulthood. In one hand, there are his mother's expectations while on the other hand his passions.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored by Sean Penn's powerhouse performance, Milk is a triumphant account of America's first openly gay man elected to public office.

filmInfoContainer: A Girl Walks Home Alone at Night
filmInfoContainer3: In the Iranian ghost-town Bad City, a place that reeks of death and loneliness, the townspeople are unaware they are being stalked by a lonesome vampire.
filmInfoContainer4: A Girl Walks Home Alone at Night blends conventional elements into something brilliantly original -- and serves as a striking calling card for writer-director Ana Lily Amirpour.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at how contestants on the a musical contest program "Pop Idol" in Afghanistan risk their lives to appear on the show.
filmInfoContainer4: An enlightening and sobering documentary on Afghanistan's very own X-Factor.

filmInfoContainer3: Six blind Tibetan teenagers climb the Lhakpa-Ri peak of Mount Everest, led by seven-summit blind mountain-climber Erik Weihenmayer.
filmInfoContainer4: A powerful glimpse of the possibilities for transcendence in straightforward documentary filmmaking -- and extreme physical disability.

filmInfoContainer3: Set on the east coast of New Zealand in 1984, Boy, an 11-year-old child and devout Michael Jackson fan, gets a chance to know his absentee criminal father, who has returned to find a bag of money he buried years ago.
filmInfoContainer4: Boy possesses the offbeat charm associated with New Zealand film but is also fully capable of drawing the viewer in emotionally.

filmInfoContainer3: Two brothers must negotiate changing roles and shifting family dynamics when one is sent to war in Afghanistan.
filmInfoContainer4: This tense, understated drama explores the complications of individual and social ethics stemming from the repercussions of war on one man and his family.

filmInfoContainer3: After he is threatened during a confession, a good-natured priest must battle the dark forces closing in around him.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a brilliant performance from Brendan Gleeson, Calvary tackles weighty issues with humor, intelligence, and sensitivity.

filmInfoContainer3: Lu and Feng are a devoted couple forced to separate when Lu is arrested and sent to a labor camp as a political prisoner during the Cultural Revolution. He finally returns home only to find that his beloved wife no longer recognizes him.
filmInfoContainer4: The rare tearjerking melodrama with sociopolitical subtext, Coming Home plucks the heartstrings with thought-provoking power.

filmInfoContainer3: In order to foil an extortion plot, an FBI agent undergoes a facial transplant surgery and assumes the identity and physical appearance of a terrorist, but the plan turns from bad to worse when the same terrorist impersonates the FBI agent.
filmInfoContainer4: John Travolta and Nicolas Cage play cat-and-mouse (and literally play each other) against a beautifully stylized backdrop of typically elegant, over-the-top John Woo violence.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that follows six young dancers from around the world as they prepare for the Youth America Grand Prix, one of the most prestigious ballet competitions in the world.
filmInfoContainer4: An upbeat and visually dramatic documentary of children's ballet, First Position displays the potential of the human spirit when fostered at a young age.

filmInfoContainer3: In the aftermath of WWI, a young German who grieves the death of her fiancé in France meets a mysterious Frenchman who visits the fiancé's grave to lay flowers.
filmInfoContainer4: Frantz finds writer-director François Ozon thoughtfully probing the aftermath of World War I through the memories and relationships of loved ones left behind.

filmInfoContainer3: Guilt-stricken after a job gone wrong, hitman Ray and his partner await orders from their ruthless boss in Bruges, Belgium, the last place in the world Ray wants to be.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring witty dialogue and deft performances, In Bruges is an effective mix of dark comedy and crime thriller elements.

filmInfoContainer3: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.
filmInfoContainer4: Interstellar represents more of the thrilling, thought-provoking, and visually resplendent filmmaking moviegoers have come to expect from writer-director Christopher Nolan, even if its intellectual reach somewhat exceeds its grasp.

filmInfoContainer3: Stories from modern day Iraq as told by Iraqis living in a time of war, occupation and ethnic tension.
filmInfoContainer4: A stylistically bold, humanist take on the difficulties of post-invasion Iraq.

filmInfoContainer3: Parallel storylines tell the current state of affairs for two ex-lovers: Nora's a single mother who comes to care for her terminally ill father; holed in up in mental ward, Ismael, a brilliant musician, plots his escape.
filmInfoContainer4: A dryly comic, stylistically brave film.

filmInfoContainer3: A murder mystery brings together a private eye, a struggling actress, and a thief masquerading as an actor.
filmInfoContainer4: Tongue-in-cheek satire blends well with entertaining action and spot-on performances in this dark, eclectic neo-noir homage.

filmInfoContainer3: Bruno and Sonia, a young couple living off her benefit and the thefts committed by his gang, have a new source of money: their newborn son.
filmInfoContainer4: The Dardennes continue to excel at presenting works of rigorous naturalism, with detached observations of authentic characters that nevertheless resonate with complex moral issues.

filmInfoContainer3: A career bank robber breaks out of jail, and shares a moment of mutual attraction with a U.S. Marshal he has kidnapped.
filmInfoContainer4: Steven Soderbergh's intelligently crafted adaptation of the Elmore Leonard novel is witty, sexy, suprisingly entertaining, and a star-making turn for George Clooney.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1931, three half-white, half-Aboriginal girls escape after being plucked from their houses to be trained as domestic staff, and set off on a journey across the Outback.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually beautiful and well-acted, Rabbit-Proof Fence tells a compelling true-life story.

filmInfoContainer3: The exceptional life and career of U.S. Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, who has developed a breathtaking legal legacy while becoming an unexpected pop culture icon.
filmInfoContainer4: RBG might be preaching to the choir of viewers who admire Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg, but it does so effectively.

filmInfoContainer3: Filmed over nearly five years in twenty-five countries on five continents, and shot on seventy-millimetre film, Samsara transports us to the varied worlds of sacred grounds, disaster zones, industrial complexes, and natural wonders.
filmInfoContainer4: It's a tad heavy-handed in its message, but Samsara's overwhelmingly beautiful visuals more than compensate for any narrative flaws.

filmInfoContainer2: Comedy, Drama, Musical, Mystery, Romance, Western
filmInfoContainer3: An anthology film comprised of six stories, each dealing with a different aspect of life in the Old West.
filmInfoContainer4: The Ballad of Buster Scruggs avoids anthology pitfalls with a consistent collection tied together by the Coen brothers' signature blend of dark drama and black humor.

filmInfoContainer3: A land baron tries to reconnect with his two daughters after his wife is seriously injured in a boating accident.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, moving, and beautifully acted, The Descendants captures the unpredictable messiness of life with eloquence and uncommon grace.

filmInfoContainer3: The life of Jesus Christ, his journey through life as he faces the struggles all humans do, and his final temptation on the cross.
filmInfoContainer4: The Last Temptation of Christ is a surprisingly straight and passionate affair, one that also seeks to redeem Scorsese's '80s career.

filmInfoContainer3: A young martial artist is caught between respecting his pacifist father's wishes or stopping a group of disrespectful foreigners from stealing precious artifacts.
filmInfoContainer4: Jackie Chan sends up some amazing and entertaining fight sequences in The Legend of Drunken Master.

filmInfoContainer: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!
filmInfoContainer3: Incompetent police Detective Frank Drebin must foil an attempt to assassinate Queen Elizabeth II.
filmInfoContainer4: The Naked Gun is chock full of gags that are goofy, unapologetically crass, and ultimately hilarious.

filmInfoContainer3: Only a short time after the first raid, Rama goes undercover with the thugs of Jakarta and plans to bring down the syndicate and uncover the corruption within his police force.
filmInfoContainer4: Although its high-energy plot and over-the-top violence may play better with genre aficionados, The Raid 2 definitely delivers more of everything audiences loved about its predecessor.

filmInfoContainer3: A frontiersman on a fur trading expedition in the 1820s fights for survival after being mauled by a bear and left for dead by members of his own hunting team.
filmInfoContainer4: As starkly beautiful as it is harshly uncompromising, The Revenant uses Leonardo DiCaprio's committed performance as fuel for an absorbing drama that offers punishing challenges -- and rich rewards.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, self-referential, and irreverent to a fault, The Wolf of Wall Street finds Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio at their most infectiously dynamic.

filmInfoContainer3: When technical illustrator Tony Takitani asks his wife to resist her all-consuming obsession for designer clothes, the consequences are tragic.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite its deceptive wispiness, this delicately lovely and melancholy film about loneliness has a haunting power.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Spanish woman who has recently moved to Berlin finds her flirtation with a local guy turn potentially deadly as their night out with his friends reveals a dangerous secret.
filmInfoContainer4: Victoria's single-take production is undeniably impressive, but it's also an effective drama in its own right -- and one that juggles its tonal shifts as deftly as its technical complexities.

filmInfoContainer3: A struggling lawyer and volunteer wrestling coach's chicanery comes back to haunt him when the teenage grandson of the client he has double-crossed comes into his life.
filmInfoContainer4: Rich, wonderful characters and strong performances populate Win Win, with writer/director Thomas McCarthy continuing to emerge as a great American humanist.

filmInfoContainer3: An offbeat romantic comedy about a woman who doesn't believe true love exists, and the young man who falls for her.
filmInfoContainer4: A clever, offbeat romantic comedy, 500 Days of Summer is refreshingly honest and utterly charming.

filmInfoContainer3: Four weeks after a mysterious, incurable virus spreads throughout the UK, a handful of survivors try to find sanctuary.
filmInfoContainer4: Kinetically directed by Danny Boyle, 28 Days Later is both a terrifying zombie movie and a sharp political allegory.

filmInfoContainer3: A young queen, who is married to an insane king, falls secretly in love with her physician - and together they start a revolution that changes a nation forever.
filmInfoContainer4: A Royal Affair is a lavish and sumptuous costume drama with a juicy story to back it up.

filmInfoContainer3: A con man, Irving Rosenfeld, along with his seductive partner Sydney Prosser, is forced to work for a wild F.B.I. Agent, Richie DiMaso, who pushes them into a world of Jersey powerbrokers and the Mafia.
filmInfoContainer4: Riotously funny and impeccably cast, American Hustle compensates for its flaws with unbridled energy and some of David O. Russell's most irrepressibly vibrant direction.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at four seasons in the lives of a happily married couple and their relationships with their family and friends.
filmInfoContainer4: Characterized by strong performances and the director's trademark feel for the nuances of everyday life, Another Year marks another solid entry in Mike Leigh's career of kitchen-sink English drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Faced with both her hot-tempered father's fading health and melting ice-caps that flood her ramshackle bayou community and unleash ancient aurochs, six-year-old Hushpuppy must learn the ways of courage and love.
filmInfoContainer4: Beasts of the Southern Wild is a fantastical, emotionally powerful journey and a strong case of filmmaking that values imagination over money.

filmInfoContainer3: The relationship of a contemporary married couple, charting their evolution over a span of years by cross-cutting between time periods.
filmInfoContainer4: This emotionally gripping examination of a marriage on the rocks isn't always easy to watch, but Michelle Williams and Ryan Gosling give performances of unusual depth and power.

filmInfoContainer3: Charlie is an average French suburban teenager, but when she becomes fast friends with Sarah, the rebellious new girl at school, she discovers there's nothing average about how she feels.
filmInfoContainer4: Breathe finds writer-director Mélanie Laurent opening a sensitive, well-acted window into the bittersweet upheaval of adolescence.

filmInfoContainer3: In the forests of the Pacific Northwest, a father devoted to raising his six kids with a rigorous physical and intellectual education is forced to leave his paradise and enter the world, challenging his idea of what it means to be a parent.
filmInfoContainer4: Captain Fantastic's thought-provoking themes -- and an absorbing starring turn from Viggo Mortensen -- add up to an above-average family drama with unexpected twists.

filmInfoContainer3: Lieutenant John Dunbar, assigned to a remote western Civil War outpost, befriends wolves and Indians, making him an intolerable aberration in the military.
filmInfoContainer4: A grand, sweeping epic with inarguably noble intentions and arresting cinematography, but one whose center, arguably, is not as weighty as it should be.

filmInfoContainer3: In Nazi occupied Czechoslovakia, a childless couple agree to hide a Jewish friend at great personal risk of discovery and execution.
filmInfoContainer4: Divided We Fall takes a complex look at World War II, skillfully balancing humor and gravity.

filmInfoContainer3: Feature-length version of the documentary TV series Planet Earth (2006), following the migration paths of four animal families.
filmInfoContainer4: With its spectacular and extensive footage, Earth is both informative and entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: Col. Katherine Powell, a military officer in command of an operation to capture terrorists in Kenya, sees her mission escalate when a girl enters the kill zone triggering an international dispute over the implications of modern warfare.
filmInfoContainer4: As taut as it is timely, Eye in the Sky offers a powerfully acted -- and unusually cerebral -- spin on the modern wartime political thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: A family vacationing in the French Alps is confronted with a devastating avalanche.
filmInfoContainer4: Gleefully uncomfortable, Force Majeure is a relationship drama that's hard to watch -- and just as difficult to ignore.

filmInfoContainer3: Quentin Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez's homage to exploitation double features in the 60s and 70s with two back-to-back cult films that include previews of coming attractions between them.
filmInfoContainer4: Grindhouse delivers exhilarating exploitation fare with wit and panache, improving upon its source material with feral intelligence.

filmInfoContainer3: Filmmakers discuss how Francois Truffaut's 1966 book "Cinema According to Hitchcock" influenced their work.
filmInfoContainer4: Essential viewing for cineastes while still offering rich rewards for neophytes, Hitchcock/Truffaut offers an affectionate -- and well-crafted -- tribute to a legend.

filmInfoContainer: I Am Big Bird: The Caroll Spinney Story
filmInfoContainer3: Caroll Spinney has been Sesame Street's Big Bird and Oscar the Grouch since 1969; at 78-years-old, he has no intention of stopping.
filmInfoContainer4: Every bit as good-natured as longtime fans might hope, I Am Big Bird: The Carroll Spinney Story offers heartwarming behind-the-scenes perspective on a cultural icon.

filmInfoContainer3: A police detective, a bank robber, and a high-power broker enter high-stakes negotiations after the criminal's brilliant heist spirals into a hostage situation.
filmInfoContainer4: Spike Lee's energetic and clever bank-heist thriller is a smart genre film that is not only rewarding on its own terms, but manages to subvert its pulpy trappings with wit and skill.

filmInfoContainer3: Zaza is a 31-year old Israeli bachelor, handsome and intelligent, and his family wants to see him married. But tradition dictates that Zaza has to choose a young virgin. She must be ...
filmInfoContainer4: An observant black comedy about arranged marriages and tradition.

filmInfoContainer3: An old shepherd lives his last days in a quiet medieval village perched high on the hills of Calabria, at the southernmost tip of Italy. He herds goats under skies that most villagers have ...
filmInfoContainer4: Birth, death, and transformation are examined in Le Quattro Volte, a profound and often funny mediation on the cycles of life on earth.

filmInfoContainer: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
filmInfoContainer3: High schooler Greg, who spends most of his time making parodies of classic movies with his co-worker Earl, finds his outlook forever altered after befriending a classmate who has just been diagnosed with cancer.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully scripted and perfectly cast, Me & Earl & the Dying Girl is a coming-of-age movie with uncommon charm and insight.

filmInfoContainer3: Tom Berninger chronicles his time spent on the road as a member of the tour crew for The National, the rock & roll band fronted by his brother, Matt.
filmInfoContainer4: A suitably complicated look at fraternal bonds, Mistaken for Strangers offers more depth and insight than the usual tour documentary.

filmInfoContainer3: When a headstrong chef takes charge of her equally stubborn 8-year-old niece, the tensions between them mount... until an Italian sous-chef arrives to lighten the mood.
filmInfoContainer4: Mostly Martha may have a predictable plot, but it still feels charming and fresh, and the food will make you hungry.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Palestinian freedom fighter agrees to work as an informant after he's tricked into an admission of guilt by association in the wake of an Israeli soldier's killing.
filmInfoContainer4: Twisty and riveting, Omar is a well-directed crime drama with uncommon depth.

filmInfoContainer3: Two childhood friends are recruited for a suicide bombing in Tel Aviv.
filmInfoContainer4: This film delves deeply into the minds of suicide bombers, and the result is unsettling.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Shakespeare, out of ideas and short of cash, meets his ideal woman and is inspired to write one of his most famous plays.
filmInfoContainer4: Endlessly witty, visually rapturous, and sweetly romantic, Shakespeare in Love is a delightful romantic comedy that succeeds on nearly every level.

filmInfoContainer: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi
filmInfoContainer3: After a daring mission to rescue Han Solo from Jabba the Hutt, the rebels dispatch to Endor to destroy a more powerful Death Star. Meanwhile, Luke struggles to help Darth Vader back from the dark side without falling into the Emperor's trap.
filmInfoContainer4: Though failing to reach the cinematic heights of its predecessors, Return of the Jedi remains an entertaining sci-fi adventure and a fitting end to the classic trilogy.

filmInfoContainer3: Two brothers and a sister witness the disappearance of their childhood memories when they must relinquish the family belongings to ensure their deceased mother's succession.
filmInfoContainer4: Olivier Assayas' contemplative family drama handles lofty ideas about art and culture with elegance and lightness.

filmInfoContainer3: A tale of nineteenth-century New York high society in which a young lawyer falls in love with a woman separated from her husband, while he is engaged to the woman's cousin.
A widowed mother, plagued by the violent death of her husband, battles with her son's fear of a monster lurking in the house, but soon discovers a sinister presence all around her.
filmInfoContainer4: The Babadook relies on real horror rather than cheap jump scares -- and boasts a heartfelt, genuinely moving story to boot.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of how the novel "Mrs. Dalloway" affects three generations of women, all of whom, in one way or another, have had to deal with suicide in their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: The movie may be a downer, but it packs an emotional wallop. Some fine acting on display here.

filmInfoContainer3: The Little Prince questions the universe in this story of innocence and wonder.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully animated and faithful to the spirit of its classic source material, The Little Prince is a family-friendly treat that anchors thrilling visuals with a satisfying story.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman brings her family back to her childhood home, which used to be an orphanage for handicapped children. Before long, her son starts to communicate with an invisible new friend.
filmInfoContainer4: Deeply unnerving and surprisingly poignant, The Orphanage is an atmospheric, beautifully crafted haunted house horror film that earns scares with a minimum of blood.

filmInfoContainer3: A boy who is believed to bring bad luck to everyone around him leads his family and two new friends through Laos to find a new home. After a calamity-filled journey through a land scarred ...
filmInfoContainer4: A feel-good success crafted with care, Kim Mordaunt's story of two young kids in Laos is a heartfelt audience pleaser while remaining sensitive toward its subjects.

filmInfoContainer3: In the Ottoman province of Hijaz during World War I, a young Bedouin boy experiences a greatly hastened coming-of-age as he embarks on a perilous desert journey to guide a British officer to his secret destination.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by an outstanding performance from Jacir Eid Al-Hwietat in the title role, Theeb is a startlingly assured first effort from director/co-writer Naji Abu Nowar.

filmInfoContainer: Tibet: Cry of the Snow Lion
filmInfoContainer3: A film about the state of Chinese occupied Tibet and its history of oppression and resistance.
filmInfoContainer4: Makes no effort to do more than present one side of its story, but does it so passionately and persuasively that the viewer almost cannot help but be moved.

filmInfoContainer3: A drunken, hard-nosed U.S. Marshal and a Texas Ranger help a stubborn teenager track down her father's murderer in Indian territory.
filmInfoContainer4: True Grit rides along on the strength of a lived-in late-period John Wayne performance, adding its own entertaining spin to the oft-adapted source material.

filmInfoContainer3: On the steppes of Kazakhstan, Asa lives in a yurt with his sister Samal, her husband Ondas, and their three children. Ondas is a herdsman, tough and strong. It's dry, dusty, and windy; too ...
filmInfoContainer4: Kazakh sheep herders get their cinematic due in this lovely, unsentimental debut from director Sergei Dvortsevoy.

filmInfoContainer3: A video game villain wants to be a hero and sets out to fulfill his dream, but his quest brings havoc to the whole arcade where he lives.
filmInfoContainer4: Equally entertaining for both kids and parents old enough to catch the references, Wreck-It Ralph is a clever, colorful adventure built on familiar themes and joyful nostalgia.

filmInfoContainer3: A small financial institution called Abacus becomes the only company criminally indicted in the wake of the United States' 2008 mortgage crisis.
filmInfoContainer4: Abacus: Small Enough to Jail transcends its less-than-dramatic trappings to present a gripping real-life legal thriller with far-reaching implications.

filmInfoContainer3: Filmmaker Matthew Heineman examines the state of the ongoing drug problem along the U.S.-Mexican border.
filmInfoContainer4: Raw, brutal, and bitter, Cartel Land offers a ground-level look at vigilante efforts to thwart organized crime at the Mexican-American border.

filmInfoContainer3: In Tuscany to promote his latest book, a middle-aged British writer meets a French woman who leads him to the village of Lucignano. While there, a chance question reveals something deeper.
filmInfoContainer4: The main stars are absolutely perfect in this absorbing, existential drama that dissects human relationships.

filmInfoContainer3: Two death-row murderesses develop a fierce rivalry while competing for publicity, celebrity, and a sleazy lawyer's attention.
filmInfoContainer4: A rousing and energetic adaptation of the Broadway musical, Chicago succeeds on the level pure spectacle, but provides a surprising level of depth and humor as well.

filmInfoContainer3: An orphaned cheetah becomes the best friend and pet of a young boy living in South Africa.
filmInfoContainer4: This is an old-fashioned, richly textured family film that will appeal to children and adults alike.

filmInfoContainer3: When his mother, who has sheltered him his entire 40 years, dies, Elling, a sensitive, would-be poet, is sent to live in a state institution. There he meets Kjell Bjarne, a gentle giant and...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Quirky without being overly cutesy, Elling is a gentle, warm comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: After a daughter witnesses her father having an affair, she begins a chain reaction that could tear her family apart.
A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.
filmInfoContainer4: Ridley Scott and an excellent cast successfully convey the intensity of Roman gladitorial combat as well as the political intrigue brewing beneath.

filmInfoContainer: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
filmInfoContainer3: A young wizard finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.
filmInfoContainer4: The main characters are maturing, and the filmmakers are likewise improving on their craft; vibrant special effects and assured performances add up to what is the most complex yet of the Harry Potter films.

filmInfoContainer3: In February 2002 in the Shamshatoo Refugee Camp in the North West Frontier Province in Pakistan, there are 53,000 refugees living in sub-human conditions since 1979 with the Soviet Union ...
filmInfoContainer4: Using documentary-style filmmaking to blur the lines between fact and fiction. In This World tells a harrowing but important story about the plight of refugees.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of life inside the Grande Chartreuse, the head monastery of the reclusive Carthusian Order in France.
filmInfoContainer4: A meditative, deliberately paced doc capable of absorbing patient viewers into a whole different world.

filmInfoContainer3: A scientific observer's job of observing an old cantankerous single man's kitchen habits is complicated by his growing friendship with him.
filmInfoContainer4: By turns touching and funny, this Norwegian import offers quietly absorbing commentary on modern life and friendship.

filmInfoContainer3: A tale about a strange young man, Bulcsú, the fellow inspectors on his team, all without exception likable characters, a rival ticket inspection team and racing along the tracks - and a tale about love.
filmInfoContainer4: Kontroll is a smart thriller that's dark, gritty, and funny.

filmInfoContainer3: A nerdy florist finds his chance for success and romance with the help of a giant man-eating plant who demands to be fed.
filmInfoContainer4: Remixing Roger Corman's B-movie by way of the Off-Broadway musical, Little Shop of Horrors offers camp, horror and catchy tunes in equal measure -- plus some inspired cameos by the likes of Steve Martin and Bill Murray.

filmInfoContainer: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
filmInfoContainer3: A botched card game in London triggers four friends, thugs, weed-growers, hard gangsters, loan sharks and debt collectors to collide with each other in a series of unexpected events, all for the sake of weed, cash and two antique shotguns.
filmInfoContainer4: Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels is a grimy, twisted, and funny twist on the Tarantino hip gangster formula.

filmInfoContainer3: When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated.
filmInfoContainer4: A terrifically original, eccentric screwball comedy, Raising Arizona may not be the Coens' most disciplined movie, but it's one of their most purely entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: A restless retired woman teams up with her deceased neighbor's maid to seek out a man who has a secret connection to her past life as a farm owner at the foothill of Mount Tabu in Africa.
Documentary that follows the struggle for control of Dr. Albert C. Barnes' 25 billion dollar collection of modern and post-impressionist art.
filmInfoContainer4: Deeply esoteric and unapologetically one-sided, The Art of the Steal proves a documentary doesn't have to make an objective argument as long as it argues well.

filmInfoContainer3: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-made sequel that delivers the thrills.

filmInfoContainer3: Photographer Robert Kincaid wanders into the life of housewife Francesca Johnson, for four days in the 1960s.
filmInfoContainer4: Sentimental, slow, schmaltzy, and very satisfying, The Bridges of Madison County finds Clint Eastwood adapting a bestseller with heft, wit, and grace.

filmInfoContainer3: In the aftermath of the Persian Gulf War, four soldiers set out to steal gold that was stolen from Kuwait, but they discover people who desperately need their help.
filmInfoContainer4: Three Kings successfully blends elements of action, drama, and comedy into a thoughtful, exciting movie on the Gulf War.

filmInfoContainer3: An Orthodox Jewish couple's faith is tested after praying to the Lord for a child on the Succoth holiday.
filmInfoContainer4: Ushpizin offers a rare and warmly intimate look into ultra-Orthodox Jewish culture.

filmInfoContainer3: A watch salesman meets a young woman soon leaving for Paris and becomes infatuated, so he begins to change all the clocks in Taipei to Paris time.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it requires patience to view, What Time Is It There?'s exploration of loneliness is both elegant and haunting.

filmInfoContainer3: Following a banal incident in her local village, 8-year old girl Shula is accused of witchcraft. After a short trial she is found guilty, taken into state custody and exiled to a witch camp...
filmInfoContainer4: I Am Not a Witch approaches real-life injustices with a beguiling blend of sorrow, anger, and humor, marking debuting writer-director Rungano Nyoni as an exciting new talent.

filmInfoContainer3: A mild-mannered man becomes a local hero through an act of violence, which sets off repercussions that will shake his family to its very core.
filmInfoContainer4: A History of Violence raises compelling and thoughtful questions about the nature of violence, while representing a return to form for director David Cronenberg in one of his more uncharacteristic pieces.

filmInfoContainer3: An outcast New York City cop is charged with bringing down Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas, whose real life inspired this partly biographical film.
filmInfoContainer4: American Gangster is a gritty and entertaining throwback to classic gangster films, with its lead performers firing on all cylinders.

filmInfoContainer3: Mario Van Peebles' half-documentary/half-homage to his father Melvin Van Peebles' movie Sweet Sweetback's Baadasssss Song (1971).
filmInfoContainer4: An entertaining and intriguing tribute to a father from his son.

filmInfoContainer3: A mix of Dave Chappelle's sketch comedy and musical interludes, inspired in part by the 1973 documentary Wattstax.
filmInfoContainer4: Dave Chappelle's Block Party is a raucous return to the spotlight for the comic, buoyed by witty, infectious humor and outstanding musical performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A fan who has an affair with one minor-league baseball player each season meets an up-and-coming pitcher and the experienced catcher assigned to him.
filmInfoContainer4: Kevin Costner at his funniest and most charismatic in Bull Durham, a film that's as wise about relationships as it is about minor league baseball.

filmInfoContainer3: A fast-talking mercenary with a morbid sense of humor is subjected to a rogue experiment that leaves him with accelerated healing powers and a quest for revenge.
filmInfoContainer4: Fast, funny, and gleefully profane, the fourth-wall-busting Deadpool subverts superhero film formula with wildly entertaining -- and decidedly non-family-friendly -- results.

filmInfoContainer3: From dawn to dusk, a few hours in the shadowy life of a mystic man named Monsieur Oscar.
filmInfoContainer4: Mesmerizingly strange and willfully perverse, Holy Motors offers an unforgettable visual feast alongside a spellbinding -- albeit unapologetically challenging -- narrative.

filmInfoContainer3: Two business executives--one an avowed misogynist, the other recently emotionally wounded by his love interest--set out to exact revenge on the female gender by seeking out the most innocent, uncorrupted girl they can find and ruining her life.
filmInfoContainer4: Neil LaBute's pitch-black comedy is a masterful exploration of male insecurity, and it's elevated by a breakout performance by Aaron Eckhart as a businessman who likes to play psychological games.

filmInfoContainer3: A high school French teacher is drawn into a precocious student's increasingly transgressive story about his relationship with a friend's family.
filmInfoContainer4: Dark, tense, and wryly funny, In the House is brilliantly directed by François Ozon and features fine performances from its talented cast.

filmInfoContainer: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
filmInfoContainer3: During the Napoleonic Wars, a brash British captain pushes his ship and crew to their limits in pursuit of a formidable French war vessel around South America.
filmInfoContainer4: Russell Crowe's rough charm is put to good use in this masterful adaptation of Patrick O'Brian's novel.

filmInfoContainer3: An in-depth look at the life and music of Manchester-based rock band, Oasis.
filmInfoContainer4: Oasis: Supersonic foregoes a comprehensive approach to its multi-platinum subjects in favor of an appreciative -- and stirring -- look at their heady early years.

filmInfoContainer3: Three company workers who hate their jobs decide to rebel against their greedy boss.
filmInfoContainer4: Mike Judge lampoons the office grind with its inspired mix of sharp dialogue and witty one-liners.

filmInfoContainer3: In New York City's Harlem circa 1987, an overweight, abused, illiterate teen who is pregnant with her second child is invited to enroll in an alternative school in hopes that her life can head in a new direction.
filmInfoContainer4: Precious is a grim yet ultimately triumphant film about abuse and inner-city life, largely bolstered by exceptional performances from its cast.

filmInfoContainer3: In a dystopic and crime-ridden Detroit, a terminally wounded cop returns to the force as a powerful cyborg haunted by submerged memories.
filmInfoContainer4: While over-the-top and gory, Robocop is also a surprisingly smart sci-fi flick that uses ultraviolence to disguise its satire of American culture.

filmInfoContainer3: A small-time boxer gets a supremely rare chance to fight a heavy-weight champion in a bout in which he strives to go the distance for his self-respect.
filmInfoContainer4: This story of a down-on-his-luck boxer is thoroughly predictable, but Sylvester Stallone's script and stunning performance in the title role brush aside complaints.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in a future where a failed climate-change experiment kills all life on the planet except for a lucky few who boarded the Snowpiercer, a train that travels around the globe, where a class system emerges.
filmInfoContainer4: Snowpiercer offers an audaciously ambitious action spectacular for filmgoers numb to effects-driven blockbusters.

filmInfoContainer3: When Cartman and his friends go see an R rated movie, they start cursing and their parents think that Canada is to blame.
filmInfoContainer4: Its jokes are profoundly bold and rude but incredibly funny at the same time.

filmInfoContainer3: A scientist in a surrealist society kidnaps children to steal their dreams, hoping that they slow his aging process.
filmInfoContainer4: Not all of its many intriguing ideas are developed, but The City of Lost Children is an engrossing, disturbing, profoundly memorable experience.

filmInfoContainer: The Diary of a Teenage Girl
filmInfoContainer3: A teen artist living in 1970s San Francisco enters into an affair with her mother's boyfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: Boldly unconventional and refreshingly honest, Diary of a Teenage Girl is a frank coming-of-age story that addresses its themes -- and its protagonist -- without judgment.

filmInfoContainer3: A lawman apprehends a notorious outlaw and gives him nine days to kill his older brother, or else they'll execute his younger brother.
filmInfoContainer4: Brutal, unflinching, and violent, but thought-provoking and with excellent performances, this Australian western is the one of the best examples of the genre to come along in recent times.

filmInfoContainer3: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.
filmInfoContainer4: The Thin Red Line is a daringly philosophical World War II film with an enormous cast of eager stars.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the New York Times bestseller, this movie tells the incredibly inspiring and heartwarming story of August Pullman, a boy with facial differences who enters the fifth grade, attending a mainstream elementary school for the first time.
filmInfoContainer4: Wonder doesn't shy away from its bestselling source material's sentiment, but this well-acted and overall winsome drama earns its tugs at the heartstrings.

filmInfoContainer3: A magician meets an eccentric girl and offers her to work together in his magic show. It is only until a year later that he starts to know her personally and develops a feeling towards her despite her own problems.
In the bleak days of the Cold War, espionage veteran George Smiley is forced out of semi-retirement to uncover a Soviet Agent within MI6's echelons.
filmInfoContainer4: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy is a dense puzzle of anxiety, paranoia, and espionage that director Tomas Alfredson pieces together with utmost skill.

filmInfoContainer3: A boy seeks the help of a tree monster to cope with his single mother's terminal illness.
filmInfoContainer4: A Monster Calls deftly balances dark themes and fantastical elements to deliver an engrossing and uncommonly moving entry in the crowded coming-of-age genre.

filmInfoContainer: Amandla! A Revolution in Four Part Harmony
filmInfoContainer3: Interviews, archival footage, and filmed performances highlight the role of music in the South African struggle against apartheid.
filmInfoContainer4: The powerful singing in Amandla makes for an uplifting, compelling documentary.

filmInfoContainer3: The University of California at Berkeley, the oldest and most prestigious member of a ten campus public education system, is also one of the finest research and teaching facilities in the ...
filmInfoContainer4: Its generous running time will test less forbearing viewers' patience, but for filmgoers seeking more of director Frederick Wiseman's observant brand of documentary, At Berkeley satisfies.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of James Braddock, a supposedly washed-up boxer who came back to become a champion and an inspiration in the 1930s.
filmInfoContainer4: With grittiness and an evocative sense of time and place, Cinderella Man is a powerful underdog story. And Ron Howard and Russell Crowe prove to be a solid combination.

filmInfoContainer3: A faded country music musician is forced to reassess his dysfunctional life during a doomed romance that also inspires him.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to a captivating performance from Jeff Bridges, Crazy Heart transcends its overly familiar origins and finds new meaning in an old story.

filmInfoContainer3: An aspiring writer is hired as a croupier at a casino, where he realizes that his life as a croupier would make a great novel.
filmInfoContainer4: The writer slumming for human truths and real experience is a common enough story, but this cool-headed and slick thriller provides a gut-churningly compelling backdrop to a look at our darker sides.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenager gets a summer job working for a horse trainer and befriends the fading racehorse, Lean on Pete.
filmInfoContainer4: Lean on Pete avoids mawkish melodrama, offering an empathetic yet clear-eyed portrayal of a young man at a crossroads that confirms Charley Plummer as a major talent.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a Palestinian widow who must defend her lemontree field when a new Israeli Defense Minister moves next to her and threatens to have her lemon grove torn down.
filmInfoContainer4: A positive and personal Israeli film that offers an understated and thought-provoking vision of the West Bank troubles.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary crew followed Metallica for the better part of 2001-2003, a time of tension and release for the rock band, as they recorded their album St. Anger, fought bitterly, and sought the counsel of their on-call shrink.
filmInfoContainer4: Fascinating behind-the-scenes look at how Metallica survives one of their more turbulent periods.

filmInfoContainer3: Follows a jealous countess, a wealthy businessman, and a young orphaned boy across Portugal, France, Italy and Brazil where they connect with a variety of mysterious individuals.
An innocent teenager, studying to be a vet, develops a craving for human flesh.
filmInfoContainer4: Raw's lurid violence and sexuality live up to its title, but they're anchored with an immersive atmosphere and deep symbolism that linger long after the provocative visuals fade.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama set at a Swiss ski resort and centered on a boy who supports his sister by stealing from wealthy guests.
A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train. A mission he has only 8 minutes to complete.
filmInfoContainer4: Finding the human story amidst the action, director Duncan Jones and charming Jake Gyllenhaal craft a smart, satisfying sci-fi thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: After the crew of the Enterprise find an unstoppable force of terror from within their own organization, Captain Kirk leads a manhunt to a war-zone world to capture a one-man weapon of mass destruction.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually spectacular and suitably action packed, Star Trek Into Darkness is a rock-solid installment in the venerable sci-fi franchise, even if it's not as fresh as its predecessor.

filmInfoContainer3: 15-year-old Oliver Tate has two objectives: To lose his virginity before his next birthday, and to extinguish the flame between his mother and an ex-lover who has resurfaced in her life.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, stylish, and ringing with adolescent truth, Submarine marks Richard Ayoade as a talent to watch.

filmInfoContainer3: Jake Blues, just out from prison, puts together his old band to save the Catholic home where he and brother Elwood were raised.
filmInfoContainer4: Too over the top for its own good, but ultimately rescued by the cast's charm, director John Landis' grace, and several soul-stirring musical numbers.

filmInfoContainer3: A monster emerges from Seoul's Han River and focuses its attention on attacking people. One victim's loving family does what it can to rescue her from its clutches.
filmInfoContainer4: As populace pleasing as it is intellectually satisfying, The Host combines scares, laughs, and satire into a riveting, monster movie.

filmInfoContainer3: American-born Gogol, the son of Indian immigrants, wants to fit in among his fellow New Yorkers, despite his family's unwillingness to let go of their traditional ways.
filmInfoContainer4: An ambitious exploration of the immigrant experience with a talented cast that serves the material well.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenage boy must deal with his mother's complicated response after his father temporarily abandons them to take a menial and dangerous job.
filmInfoContainer4: Wildlife's portrait of a family in crisis is beautifully composed by director Paul Dano -- and brought brilliantly to life by a career-best performance from Carey Mulligan.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary focused on Stuxnet, a piece of self-replicating computer malware that the U.S. and Israel unleashed to destroy a key part of an Iranian nuclear facility, and which ultimately spread beyond its intended target.
filmInfoContainer4: Factors beyond Gibney's control prevent Zero Days from offering a comprehensive look at its subject, but the partial picture that emerges remains as frightening as it is impossible to ignore.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman living in the woods with her husband, a struggling musician, and her daughter discover she has terminal cancer. She begins to tape-record a journal of the time she has left.
Arthur Curry learns that he is the heir to the underwater kingdom of Atlantis, and must step forward to lead his people and be a hero to the world.
filmInfoContainer4: Aquaman swims with its entertainingly ludicrous tide, offering up CGI superhero spectacle that delivers energetic action with an emphasis on good old-fashioned fun.

filmInfoContainer3: Poor Milton can't get any respect. He works at an evil corporation called Initech and his "office" has been shoved into the basement. He talks to the camera, picks his nose, and threatens ...
filmInfoContainer4: Mike Judge lampoons the office grind with its inspired mix of sharp dialogue and witty one-liners.

filmInfoContainer3: On a distant planet, descendants of a crashed spaceship are subjected to mysterious forces that cause them to age and die in just eight days. They must also live in caves to escape the ...
filmInfoContainer4: Simultaneously sweeping and intimate, Quest uses one family's experiences to offer trenchant, wide-ranging observations about modern American life.

filmInfoContainer3: A 20-year veteran of the Angolan civil war returns to the capital city of Luanda where he faces the challenges of assimilation and survival.
filmInfoContainer4: With death-defying action sequences and epic historic sweep, Hero offers everything a martial arts fan could ask for.

filmInfoContainer3: A paraplegic marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.
filmInfoContainer4: It might be more impressive on a technical level than as a piece of storytelling, but Avatar reaffirms James Cameron's singular gift for imaginative, absorbing filmmaking.

filmInfoContainer3: A New York socialite, deeply troubled and in denial, arrives in San Francisco to impose upon her sister. She looks a million, but isn't bringing money, peace, or love...
filmInfoContainer4: Woody Allen's Blue Jasmine finds the director in peak late-period form -- and benefiting from a superb cast led by Cate Blanchett.

filmInfoContainer3: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.
filmInfoContainer4: One of Hollywood's greatest critical and commercial successes, The Godfather gets everything right; not only did the movie transcend expectations, it established new benchmarks for American cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.
filmInfoContainer4: Sidney Lumet's feature debut is a superbly written, dramatically effective courtroom thriller that rightfully stands as a modern classic.

filmInfoContainer3: A poor village under attack by bandits recruits seven unemployed samurai to help them defend themselves.
filmInfoContainer4: Arguably Akira Kurosawa's masterpiece, The Seven Samurai is an epic adventure classic with an engrossing story, memorable characters, and stunning action sequences that make it one of the most influential films ever made.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of the rise and fall of O.J. Simpson, whose high-profile murder trial exposed the extent of American racial tensions, revealing a fractured and divided nation.
filmInfoContainer4: O.J.: Made in America paints a balanced and thorough portrait of the American dream juxtaposed with tragedy and executed with power and skill.

filmInfoContainer3: A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbors from his apartment window and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.
filmInfoContainer4: Hitchcock exerted full potential of suspense in this masterpiece.

filmInfoContainer3: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazi Germans.
filmInfoContainer4: Schindler's List blends the abject horror of the Holocaust with Steven Spielberg's signature tender humanism to create the director's dramatic masterpiece.

filmInfoContainer3: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.
filmInfoContainer4: Drawing on strong performances by Al Pacino and Robert De Niro, Francis Ford Coppola's continuation of Mario Puzo's Mafia saga set new standards for sequels that have yet to be matched or broken.

filmInfoContainer3: A cynical nightclub owner protects an old flame and her husband from Nazis in Morocco.
filmInfoContainer4: An undisputed masterpiece and perhaps Hollywood's quintessential statement on love and romance, Casablanca has only improved with age, boasting career-defining performances from Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman.

filmInfoContainer3: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.
filmInfoContainer4: Clever, incisive, and funny, Singin' in the Rain is a masterpiece of the classical Hollywood musical.

filmInfoContainer3: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits, and where humans are changed into beasts.
filmInfoContainer4: Spirited Away is a dazzling, enchanting, and gorgeously drawn fairy tale that will leave viewers a little more curious and fascinated by the world around them.

filmInfoContainer3: Miles Morales becomes the Spider-Man of his reality and crosses paths with his counterparts from other dimensions to stop a threat to all reality.
filmInfoContainer4: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse matches bold storytelling with striking animation for a purely enjoyable adventure with heart, humor, and plenty of superhero action.

filmInfoContainer3: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.
filmInfoContainer4: A slapstick skewering of industrialized America, Modern Times is as politically incisive as it is laugh-out-loud hilarious.

filmInfoContainer3: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.
filmInfoContainer4: One of the most influential films of the 1990s, Pulp Fiction is a delirious post-modern mix of neo-noir thrills, pitch-black humor, and pop-culture touchstones.

filmInfoContainer: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
filmInfoContainer3: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.
filmInfoContainer4: Arguably the greatest of the spaghetti westerns, this epic features a compelling story, memorable performances, breathtaking landscapes, and a haunting score.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.
filmInfoContainer4: The epic of all epics, Lawrence of Arabia cements director David Lean's status in the filmmaking pantheon with nearly four hours of grand scope, brilliant performances, and beautiful cinematography.

filmInfoContainer3: A Phoenix secretary embezzles forty thousand dollars from her employer's client, goes on the run, and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.
filmInfoContainer4: Infamous for its shower scene, but immortal for its contribution to the horror genre. Because Psycho was filmed with tact, grace, and art, Hitchcock didn't just create modern horror, he validated it.

filmInfoContainer3: An ingenue insinuates herself into the company of an established but aging stage actress and her circle of theater friends.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, sophisticated, and devastatingly funny, All About Eve is a Hollywood classic that only improves with age.

filmInfoContainer3: Following the death of a publishing tycoon, news reporters scramble to discover the meaning of his final utterance.
filmInfoContainer4: Orson Welles's epic tale of a publishing tycoon's rise and fall is entertaining, poignant, and inventive in its storytelling, earning its reputation as a landmark achievement in film.

filmInfoContainer3: A model discovers her neighbor is keen on invading people's privacy.
filmInfoContainer4: A complex, stirring, and beautifully realized portrait of interconnected lives, Red is the captivating conclusion to a remarkable trilogy.

filmInfoContainer: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
filmInfoContainer3: An insane general triggers a path to nuclear holocaust that a War Room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.
filmInfoContainer4: Stanley Kubrick's brilliant Cold War satire remains as funny and razor-sharp today as it was in 1964.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mob, covering his relationship with his wife Karen Hill and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito in the Italian-American crime syndicate.
filmInfoContainer4: Hard-hitting and stylish, GoodFellas is a gangster classic -- and arguably the high point of Martin Scorsese's career.

filmInfoContainer3: A film following the lives of two inner-city Chicago boys who struggle to become college basketball players on the road to going professional.
filmInfoContainer4: One of the most critically acclaimed documentaries of all time, Hoop Dreams is a rich, complex, heartbreaking, and ultimately deeply rewarding film that uses high school hoops as a jumping-off point to explore issues of race, class, and education in modern America.

filmInfoContainer3: A hapless New York City advertising executive is mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies, and is pursued across the country while he looks for a way to survive.
filmInfoContainer4: Gripping, suspenseful, and visually iconic, this late-period Hitchcock classic laid the groundwork for countless action thrillers to follow.

filmInfoContainer3: An account of underground resistance fighters in Nazi-occupied France.
filmInfoContainer4: Originally made in 1969, this recently reissued classic is a masterful examination of the inner workings of the World War II resistance efforts.

filmInfoContainer3: A former police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with a hauntingly beautiful woman.
filmInfoContainer4: An unpredictable scary thriller that doubles as a mournful meditation on love, loss, and human comfort.

filmInfoContainer3: A screenwriter is hired to rework a faded silent film star's script, only to find himself developing a dangerous relationship.
filmInfoContainer4: Arguably the greatest movie about Hollywood, Billy Wilder's masterpiece Sunset Boulevard is a tremendously entertaining combination of noir, black comedy, and character study.

filmInfoContainer3: During the Vietnam War, Captain Willard is sent on a dangerous mission into Cambodia to assassinate a renegade Colonel who has set himself up as a god among a local tribe.
filmInfoContainer4: Francis Ford Coppola's haunting, hallucinatory Vietnam War epic is cinema at its most audacious and visionary.

filmInfoContainer3: In a futuristic city sharply divided between the working class and the city planners, the son of the city's mastermind falls in love with a working class prophet who predicts the coming of a savior to mediate their differences.
filmInfoContainer4: A visually awe-inspiring science fiction classic from the silent era.

filmInfoContainer3: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.
filmInfoContainer4: This atmospheric thriller is one of the undisputed masterpieces of cinema, and boasts iconic performances from Joseph Cotten and Orson Welles.

filmInfoContainer3: When the police in a German city are unable to catch a child-murderer, other criminals join in the manhunt.
Three young men bond together to escape volatile families in their Rust-Belt hometown. As they face adult responsibilities, unexpected revelations threaten their decade-long friendship.
filmInfoContainer4: Minding the Gap draws on more than a decade of documentary footage to assemble a poignant picture of young American lives that resonates far beyond its onscreen subjects.

filmInfoContainer3: In Medieval Japan, an elderly warlord retires, handing over his empire to his three sons. However, he vastly underestimates how the new-found power will corrupt them and cause them to turn on each other...and him.
filmInfoContainer4: Akira Kurosawa's sprawling, epic take on King Lear should be required viewing for fans of westerns, war movies, or period films in general.

filmInfoContainer3: In the 1950s, fear and violence escalate as the people of Algiers fight for independence from the French government.
filmInfoContainer4: A powerful, documentary-like examination of the response to an occupying force, The Battle of Algiers hasn't aged a bit since its release in 1966.

filmInfoContainer3: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's room.
filmInfoContainer4: Entertaining as it is innovative, Toy Story reinvigorated animation while heralding the arrival of Pixar as a family-friendly force to be reckoned with.

filmInfoContainer3: A married couple are faced with a difficult decision - to improve the life of their child by moving to another country or to stay in Iran and look after a deteriorating parent who has Alzheimer's disease.
filmInfoContainer4: Morally complex, suspenseful, and consistently involving, A Separation captures the messiness of a dissolving relationship with keen insight and searing intensity.

filmInfoContainer3: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action by attempting to liberate a presidential campaign worker and an underage prostitute.
filmInfoContainer4: A must-see film for movie lovers, this Martin Scorsese masterpiece is as hard-hitting as it is compelling, with Robert De Niro at his best.

filmInfoContainer3: An insurance representative lets himself be talked into a murder/insurance fraud scheme that arouses the suspicion of an insurance investigator.
filmInfoContainer4: A dark, tautly constructed adaptation of James M. Cain's novel -- penned by Billy Wilder and Raymond Chandler -- Double Indemnity continues to set the standard for the best in Hollywood film noir.

filmInfoContainer3: When two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.
filmInfoContainer4: Some Like It Hot: A spry, quick-witted farce that never drags.

filmInfoContainer3: A weak-willed Italian man becomes a fascist flunky who goes abroad to arrange the assassination of his old teacher, now a political dissident.
filmInfoContainer4: A commentary on fascism and beauty alike, Bernardo Bertolucci's The Conformist is acclaimed for its sumptuous visuals and extravagant, artful cinematography.

filmInfoContainer: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
filmInfoContainer3: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.
filmInfoContainer4: Full of eye-popping special effects, and featuring a pitch-perfect cast, The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring brings J.R.R. Tolkien's classic to vivid life.

filmInfoContainer3: A religious fanatic marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real daddy hid $10,000 he'd stolen in a robbery.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring Robert Mitchum's formidable performance as a child-hunting preacher, The Night of the Hunter is a disturbing look at good and evil.

filmInfoContainer3: An exploration of the life, lessons, and legacy of iconic children's television host, Fred Rogers.
filmInfoContainer4: Won't You Be My Neighbor? takes a fittingly patient and honest look at the life and legacy of a television pioneer whose work has enriched generations.

filmInfoContainer3: After refusing to attack an enemy position, a general accuses the soldiers of cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.
filmInfoContainer4: Paths of Glory is a transcendentally humane war movie from Stanley Kubrick, with impressive, protracted battle sequences and a knock-out ending.

filmInfoContainer: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
filmInfoContainer3: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a Wookiee and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the evil Darth Vader.
filmInfoContainer4: A legendarily expansive and ambitious start to the sci-fi saga, George Lucas opened our eyes to the possibilities of blockbuster filmmaking and things have never been the same.

filmInfoContainer: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
filmInfoContainer3: After the rebels are brutally overpowered by the Empire on the ice planet Hoth, Luke Skywalker begins Jedi training with Yoda, while his friends are pursued by Darth Vader.
filmInfoContainer4: Dark, sinister, but ultimately even more involving than A New Hope, The Empire Strikes Back defies viewer expectations and takes the series to heightened emotional levels.

filmInfoContainer3: The life, success and troubles of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, as told by Antonio Salieri, the contemporary composer who was insanely jealous of Mozart's talent and claimed to have murdered him.
filmInfoContainer4: A lavish, entertaining, powerful film about the life and influence, both positive and negative, of one of Western culture's great artists.

filmInfoContainer3: In post-war Italy, a working-class man's bicycle is stolen. He and his son set out to find it.
filmInfoContainer4: An Italian neorealism exemplar, Bicycle Thieves thrives on its non-flashy performances and searing emotion.

filmInfoContainer3: A private detective hired to expose an adulterer finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder.
filmInfoContainer4: As bruised and cynical as the decade that produced it, this noir classic benefits from Robert Towne's brilliant screenplay, director Roman Polanski's steady hand, and wonderful performances from Jack Nicholson and Faye Dunaway.

filmInfoContainer3: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.
filmInfoContainer4: The holiday classic to define all holiday classics, It's a Wonderful Life is one of a handful of films worth an annual viewing.

filmInfoContainer: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
filmInfoContainer3: King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table embark on a surreal, low-budget search for the Holy Grail, encountering many, very silly obstacles.
filmInfoContainer4: A cult classic as gut-bustingly hilarious as it is blithely ridiculous, Monty Python and the Holy Grail has lost none of its exceedingly silly charm.

filmInfoContainer3: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.
filmInfoContainer4: A seminal French New Wave film that offers an honest, sympathetic, and wholly heartbreaking observation of adolescence without trite nostalgia.

filmInfoContainer3: An Italian epic that follows the lives of two brothers, from the 1960s to the 2000s.
filmInfoContainer4: Earns its 6 hours running time by telling an engrossing story with compelling characters.

filmInfoContainer3: When the menace known as the Joker emerges from his mysterious past, he wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham. The Dark Knight must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.
filmInfoContainer4: Dark, complex and unforgettable, The Dark Knight succeeds not just as an entertaining comic book film, but as a richly thrilling crime saga.

filmInfoContainer3: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.
filmInfoContainer4: The Shawshank Redemption is an uplifting, deeply satisfying prison drama with sensitive direction and fine performances.

filmInfoContainer3: An ex-prize fighter turned longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses.
filmInfoContainer4: With his electrifying performance in Elia Kazan's thought-provoking, expertly constructed melodrama, Marlon Brando redefined the possibilities of acting for film and helped permanently alter the cinematic landscape.

filmInfoContainer3: In the falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.
filmInfoContainer4: Pan's Labyrinth is Alice in Wonderland for grown-ups, with the horrors of both reality and fantasy blended together into an extraordinary, spellbinding fable.

filmInfoContainer: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
filmInfoContainer3: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.
filmInfoContainer4: The Two Towers balances spectacular action with emotional storytelling, leaving audiences both wholly satisfied and eager for the final chapter.

filmInfoContainer3: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping, and police corruption in a Mexican border town.
filmInfoContainer4: Artistically innovative and emotionally gripping, Orson Welles' classic noir is a visual treat, as well as a dark, sinister thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: Each member of a middle class Taipei family seeks to reconcile past and present relationships within their daily lives.
filmInfoContainer4: In its depiction of one family, Yi Yi accurately and expertly captures the themes and details, as well as the beauty, of everyday life.

filmInfoContainer: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
filmInfoContainer3: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually breathtaking and emotionally powerful,  The Lord of the Rings - The Return of the King is a moving and satisfying conclusion to a great trilogy.
