filmInfoContainer3: A private detective takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar, and their quest for a priceless statuette.
filmInfoContainer4: Suspenseful, labyrinthine, and brilliantly cast, The Maltese Falcon is one of the most influential noirs -- as well as a showcase for Humphrey Bogart at his finest.

filmInfoContainer3: When a rich woman's ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.
filmInfoContainer4: Offering a wonderfully witty script, spotless direction from George Cukor, and typically excellent lead performances, The Philadelphia Story is an unqualified classic.

filmInfoContainer3: A young FBI cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Jonathan Demme's smart, taut thriller teeters on the edge between psychological study and all-out horror, and benefits greatly from stellar performances by Anthony Hopkins and Jodie Foster.

filmInfoContainer3: The rape of a bride and the murder of her samurai husband are recalled from the perspectives of a bandit, the bride, the samurai's ghost and a woodcutter.
filmInfoContainer4: One of legendary director Akira Kurosawa's most acclaimed films, Rashomon features an innovative narrative structure, brilliant acting, and a thoughtful exploration of reality versus perception.

filmInfoContainer3: Marty McFly, a 17-year-old high school student, is accidentally sent thirty years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his close friend, the maverick scientist Doc Brown.
filmInfoContainer4: Inventive, funny, and breathlessly constructed, Back to the Future is rousing a time-travel adventure with an unforgettable spirit.

filmInfoContainer3: As corruption grows in 1950s LA, three policemen - one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy - investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.
filmInfoContainer4: Taut pacing, brilliantly dense writing and Oscar-worthy acting combine to produce a smart, popcorn-friendly thrill ride.

filmInfoContainer3: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored by another winning performance from Tom Hanks, Steven Spielberg's unflinchingly realistic war film virtually redefines the genre.

filmInfoContainer3: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home to Kansas and help her friends as well.
filmInfoContainer4: An absolute masterpiece whose groundbreaking visuals and deft storytelling are still every bit as resonant, The Wizard of Oz is a must-see film for young and old.

filmInfoContainer3: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.
filmInfoContainer4: Intense, inspiring, and well-acted, Whiplash is a brilliant sophomore effort from director Damien Chazelle and a riveting vehicle for stars J.K. Simmons and Miles Teller.

filmInfoContainer3: An allegorical tale about a man fighting the good and evil within him. Both sides are made flesh - one a sophisticated woman he is attracted to and the other his wife.
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting masterful cinematography to match its well-acted, wonderfully romantic storyline, Sunrise is perhaps the final -- and arguably definitive -- statement of the silent era.

filmInfoContainer3: A man tries to rise in his company by letting its executives use his apartment for trysts, but complications and a romance of his own ensue.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Billy Wilder's customary cynicism is leavened here by tender humor, romance, and genuine pathos.

filmInfoContainer3: A young ballet dancer is torn between the man she loves and her pursuit to become a prima ballerina.
filmInfoContainer4: The Red Shoes is one of the best-looking movies ever, and blends multiple moods and styles with balletic grace.

filmInfoContainer3: After a space merchant vessel perceives an unknown transmission as a distress call, its landing on the source moon finds one of the crew attacked by a mysterious lifeform, and they soon realize that its life cycle has merely begun.
filmInfoContainer4: A modern classic, Alien blends science fiction, horror and bleak poetry into a seamless whole.

filmInfoContainer3: Director Agnes Varda and photographer/muralist J.R. journey through rural France and form an unlikely friendship.
filmInfoContainer4: Equal parts breezily charming and poignantly powerful, Faces Places is a unique cross-generational portrait of life in rural France from the great Agnès Varda.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1936, archaeologist and adventurer Indiana Jones is hired by the U.S. government to find the Ark of the Covenant before Adolf Hitler's Nazis can obtain its awesome powers.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring bravura set pieces, sly humor, and white-knuckle action, Raiders of the Lost Ark is one of the most consummately entertaining adventure pictures of all time.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1951, a group of high schoolers come of age in a bleak, isolated, atrophied West Texas town that is slowly dying, both culturally and economically.
filmInfoContainer4: Making excellent use of its period and setting, Peter Bogdanovich's small town coming-of-age story is a sad but moving classic filled with impressive performances.

filmInfoContainer3: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.
filmInfoContainer4: Wall-E's stellar visuals testify once again to Pixar's ingenuity, while its charming star will captivate younger viewers -- and its timely story offers thought-provoking subtext.

filmInfoContainer3: A series of stories following a week in the life of a philandering paparazzo journalist living in Rome.
filmInfoContainer4: An epic, breathtakingly stylish cinematic landmark, La Dolce Vita remains riveting in spite of -- or perhaps because of -- its sprawling length.

filmInfoContainer: Once Upon a Time in the West
filmInfoContainer3: A mysterious stranger with a harmonica joins forces with a notorious desperado to protect a beautiful widow from a ruthless assassin working for the railroad.
filmInfoContainer4: A landmark Sergio Leone spaghetti western masterpiece featuring a classic Morricone score.

filmInfoContainer3: A young couple moves in to an apartment only to be surrounded by peculiar neighbors and occurrences. When the wife becomes mysteriously pregnant, paranoia over the safety of her unborn child begins to control her life.
filmInfoContainer4: A frightening tale of Satanism and pregnancy that is even more disturbing than it sounds thanks to convincing and committed performances by Mia Farrow and Ruth Gordon.

filmInfoContainer3: Disturbed Blanche DuBois moves in with her sister in New Orleans and is tormented by her brutish brother-in-law while her reality crumbles around her.

Ellen Ripley is rescued by a deep salvage team after being in hypersleep for 57 years. The moon that the Nostromo visited has been colonized, but contact is lost. This time, colonial marines have impressive firepower, but will that be enough?
filmInfoContainer4: While Alien was a marvel of slow-building, atmospheric tension, Aliens packs a much more visceral punch, and features a typically strong performance from Sigourney Weaver.

filmInfoContainer: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
filmInfoContainer3: A criminal pleads insanity after getting into trouble again and once in the mental institution rebels against the oppressive nurse and rallies up the scared patients.
filmInfoContainer4: The onscreen battle between Jack Nicholson and Louise Fletcher serves as a personal microcosm of the culture wars of the 1970s -- and testament to the director's vision that the film retains its power more than three decades later.

filmInfoContainer3: The life of boxer Jake LaMotta, as the violence and temper that leads him to the top in the ring destroys his life outside of it.
filmInfoContainer4: Arguably Martin Scorsese's and Robert De Niro's finest film, Raging Bull is often painful to watch, but it's a searing, powerful work about an unsympathetic hero.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.
filmInfoContainer4: Spotlight gracefully handles the lurid details of its fact-based story while resisting the temptation to lionize its heroes, resulting in a drama that honors the audience as well as its real-life subjects.

filmInfoContainer3: A family that survived the genocide in Indonesia confronts the men who killed one of their brothers.
filmInfoContainer4: The Look of Silence delivers a less shocking -- yet just as terribly compelling -- companion piece to Joshua Oppenheimer's The Act of Killing.

filmInfoContainer3: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-acted and dramatically moving, The Pianist is Polanski's best work in years.

filmInfoContainer3: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup, a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.
filmInfoContainer4: It's far from comfortable viewing, but 12 Years a Slave's unflinchingly brutal look at American slavery is also brilliant -- and quite possibly essential -- cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: Neurotic New York comedian Alvy Singer falls in love with the ditzy Annie Hall.
filmInfoContainer4: Filled with poignant performances and devastating humor, Annie Hall represents a quantum leap for Woody Allen and remains an American classic.

filmInfoContainer3: An impressionable teenage girl from a dead-end town and her older greaser boyfriend embark on a killing spree in the South Dakota badlands.
filmInfoContainer4: Terrence Malick's debut is a masterful slice of American cinema, rife with the visual poetry and measured performances that would characterize his work.

filmInfoContainer: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
filmInfoContainer3: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories.
filmInfoContainer4: Propelled by Charlie Kaufman's smart, imaginative script and Michel Gondry's equally daring directorial touch, Eternal Sunshine is a twisty yet heartfelt look at relationships and heartache.

filmInfoContainer3: Follow Alex Honnold as he becomes the first person to ever free solo climb Yosemite's 3,000ft high El Capitan Wall. With no ropes or safety gear, he completed arguably the greatest feat in rock climbing history.
filmInfoContainer4: Free Solo depicts athletic feats that many viewers will find beyond reason - and grounds the attempts in passions that are all but universal.

filmInfoContainer3: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.
filmInfoContainer4: Filmed and presented on a scale not seen in modern productions, Gone with the Wind is, if not the definitive Hollywood film, then certainly near the top of the list.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Drama, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.
filmInfoContainer4: Inventive, gorgeously animated, and powerfully moving, Inside Out is another outstanding addition to the Pixar library of modern animated classics.

filmInfoContainer3: A family gathers together for a commemorative ritual whose nature only gradually becomes clear.
filmInfoContainer4: Hirokazu Kore-eda's film may seem modest at first, but this family drama casts a delicate, entrancing spell.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1984 East Berlin, an agent of the secret police, conducting surveillance on a writer and his lover, finds himself becoming increasingly absorbed by their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: Unlike more traditional spy films,  The Lives of Others doesn't sacrifice character for cloak and dagger chases, and the performances (notably that by the late Ulrich Muhe) stay with you.

filmInfoContainer3: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.
filmInfoContainer4: Deftly blending comedy, adventure, and honest emotion, Toy Story 3 is a rare second sequel that really works.

filmInfoContainer3: A self-conscious bride is tormented by the memory of her husband's dead first wife.
filmInfoContainer4: Hitchcock's first American film (and his only Best Picture winner), Rebecca is a masterpiece of haunting atmosphere, Gothic thrills, and gripping suspense.

filmInfoContainer3: Nine years after Jesse and Celine first met, they encounter each other again on the French leg of Jesse's book tour.
filmInfoContainer4: Filled with engaging dialogue, Before Sunset is a witty, poignant romance, with natural chemistry between Hawke and Delpy.

filmInfoContainer3: A former prisoner of war is brainwashed as an unwitting assassin for an international Communist conspiracy.
filmInfoContainer4: A classic blend of satire and political thriller that was uncomfortably prescient in its own time, The Manchurian Candidate remains distressingly relevant today.

filmInfoContainer3: During the First World War, two French soldiers are captured and imprisoned in a German P.O.W. camp. Several escape attempts follow until they are sent to a seemingly impenetrable fortress which seems impossible to escape from.
A man seeks answers about life, death, and the existence of God as he plays chess against the Grim Reaper during the Black Plague.
filmInfoContainer4: Narratively bold and visually striking, The Seventh Seal brought Ingmar Bergman to the world stage -- and remains every bit as compelling today.

filmInfoContainer3: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation's history of racial inequality.
filmInfoContainer4: 13th strikes at the heart of America's tangled racial history, offering observations as incendiary as they are calmly controlled.

filmInfoContainer3: A spoiled heiress running away from her family is helped by a man who is actually a reporter in need of a story.
After leaving prison, master thief Corey crosses paths with a notorious escapee and an alcoholic former policeman. The trio proceed to plot an elaborate heist.
filmInfoContainer4: Melville is at the top of his game, giving us his next-to-last entry into the world of deception, crime, and extreme suspense that made him a maestro of the French heist genre.

filmInfoContainer3: A psychologist is sent to a station orbiting a distant planet in order to discover what has caused the crew to go insane.
filmInfoContainer4: Solaris is a haunting, meditative film that uses sci-fi to raise complex questions about humanity and existence.

filmInfoContainer: The Tale of The Princess Kaguya
filmInfoContainer3: Found inside a shining stalk of bamboo by an old bamboo cutter and his wife, a tiny girl grows rapidly into an exquisite young lady. The mysterious young princess enthralls all who encounter her, but ultimately she must confront her fate, the punishment for her crime.
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting narrative depth, frank honesty, and exquisite visual beauty, The Tale of the Princess Kaguya is a modern animated treasure with timeless appeal.

filmInfoContainer3: Animation, testimony, and archival footage combine to relate the events of August 1, 1966 when a gunman opened fire from the University of Texas clock tower, killing 16 people.
filmInfoContainer4: Tower probes into a painful chapter of American history with sensitivity and grace -- and revisits its events from a valuable new perspective.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman assists her friend in arranging an illegal abortion in 1980s Romania.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring gut-wrenching performances from Anamaria Marinca and Laura Vasiliu, 4 Months is a gripping portrayal of life in Communist Romania.

filmInfoContainer3: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.
filmInfoContainer4: Cynical, ironic, and suffused with seductive natural lighting, Barry Lyndon is a complex character piece of a hapless man doomed by Georgian society.

filmInfoContainer3: A selfish prince is cursed to become a monster for the rest of his life, unless he learns to fall in love with a beautiful young woman he keeps prisoner.
filmInfoContainer4: Enchanting, sweepingly romantic, and featuring plenty of wonderful musical numbers, Beauty and the Beast is one of Disney's most elegant animated offerings.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Music, Mystery
filmInfoContainer3: Aspiring musician Miguel, confronted with his family's ancestral ban on music, enters the Land of the Dead to find his great-great-grandfather, a legendary singer.
filmInfoContainer4: Coco's rich visual pleasures are matched by a thoughtful narrative that takes a family-friendly -- and deeply affecting -- approach to questions of culture, family, life, and death.

filmInfoContainer3: Seventy-eight year old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his home equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.
filmInfoContainer4: An exciting, funny, and poignant adventure, Up offers an impeccably crafted story told with wit and arranged with depth, as well as yet another visual Pixar treat.

filmInfoContainer3: In the slums of Rio, two kids' paths diverge as one struggles to become a photographer and the other a kingpin.
filmInfoContainer4: A shocking and disturbing, but always compelling look at life in the slums of Rio de Janiero.

filmInfoContainer3: Paddington, now happily settled with the Brown family and a popular member of the local community, picks up a series of odd jobs to buy the perfect present for his Aunt Lucy's 100th birthday, only for the gift to be stolen.
filmInfoContainer4: Paddington 2 honors its star's rich legacy with a sweet-natured sequel whose adorable visuals are matched by a story perfectly balanced between heartwarming family fare and purely enjoyable all-ages adventure.

filmInfoContainer3: A precocious and outspoken Iranian girl grows up during the Islamic Revolution.
filmInfoContainer4: Persepolis is an emotionally powerful, dramatically enthralling autobiographical gem, and the film's simple black-and-white images are effective and bold.

filmInfoContainer: The Bridge on the River Kwai
filmInfoContainer3: After settling his differences with a Japanese P.O.W. camp commander, a British Colonel co-operates to oversee his men's construction of a railway bridge for their captors, while oblivious to a plan by the Allies to destroy it.
filmInfoContainer4: This complex war epic asks hard questions, resists easy answers, and boasts career-defining work from star Alec Guinness and director David Lean.

filmInfoContainer: The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
filmInfoContainer3: A surreal, virtually plotless series of dreams centered around six middle-class people and their consistently interrupted attempts to have a meal together.
A Lion cub crown prince is tricked by a treacherous uncle into thinking he caused his father's death and flees into exile in despair, only to learn in adulthood his identity and his responsibilities.
filmInfoContainer4: Emotionally stirring, richly drawn, and beautifully animated, The Lion King stands tall within Disney's pantheon of classic family films.

filmInfoContainer3: A police detective falls in love with the woman whose murder he is investigating.
filmInfoContainer4: A psychologically complex portrait of obsession, Laura is also a deliciously well-crafted murder mystery.

filmInfoContainer3: A self-assured businessman murders his employer, the husband of his mistress, which unintentionally provokes an ill-fated chain of events.
A comprehensive look at the Bush Administration's conduct of the Iraq war and its occupation of the country.
filmInfoContainer4: Charles Ferguson's documentary provides a good summary of the decisions that led to the mess in post-war Iraq, and offers politically interested audiences something they'd been looking for: a lowdown on the decision making.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Drama, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous restaurant.
filmInfoContainer4: Fast-paced and stunningly animated, Ratatouille adds another delightfully entertaining entry -- and a rather unlikely hero -- to the Pixar canon.

filmInfoContainer3: Ben, a young Irish boy, and his little sister Saoirse, a girl who can turn into a seal, go on an adventure to free the fairies and save the spirit world.
filmInfoContainer4: Song of the Sea boasts narrative depth commensurate with its visual beauty, adding up to an animated saga overflowing with family-friendly riches.

filmInfoContainer3: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring outstanding work from an excellent cast, The Departed is a thoroughly engrossing gangster drama with the gritty authenticity and soupy morality we come to expect from Martin Scorsese.

filmInfoContainer: The Diving Bell and the Butterfly
filmInfoContainer3: The true story of Elle editor Jean-Dominique Bauby who suffers a stroke and has to live with an almost totally paralyzed body; only his left eye isn't paralyzed.
filmInfoContainer4: Breathtaking visuals and dynamic performances make The Diving Bell and the Butterfly a powerful biopic.

filmInfoContainer: The Fog of War: Eleven Lessons from the Life of Robert S. McNamara
filmInfoContainer3: The story of America as seen through the eyes of the former Secretary of Defense under President John F. Kennedy and President Lyndon Johnson, Robert McNamara.
A pair of NYC cops in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a drug smuggling job with a French connection.
filmInfoContainer4: Realistic, fast-paced and uncommonly smart, The French Connection is bolstered by stellar performances by Gene Hackman and Roy Scheider, not to mention William Friedkin's thrilling production.

filmInfoContainer3: A story of family, religion, hatred, oil and madness, focusing on a turn-of-the-century prospector in the early days of the business.
filmInfoContainer4: Widely touted as a masterpiece, this sparse and sprawling epic about the underhanded "heroes" of capitalism boasts incredible performances by leads Daniel Day-Lewis and Paul Dano, and is director Paul Thomas Anderson's best work to date.

filmInfoContainer3: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner and a young man.
filmInfoContainer4: As both director and star, Clint Eastwood strips away decades of Hollywood varnish applied to the Wild West, and emerges with a series of harshly eloquent statements about the nature of violence.

filmInfoContainer3: Two strangers find themselves linked in a bizarre way. When a connection forms, will distance be the only thing to keep them apart?
filmInfoContainer4: As beautifully animated as it is emotionally satisfying, Your Name adds another outstanding chapter to writer-director Makoto Shinkai's filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: A tale of friendship between two unlikely pen pals: Mary, a lonely, eight-year-old girl living in the suburbs of Melbourne, and Max, a forty-four-year old, severely obese man living in New York.
filmInfoContainer4: Mary and Max is a lovingly crafted, startlingly inventive piece of animation whose technical craft is equaled by its emotional resonance.

filmInfoContainer3: Hypnotist Dr. Caligari uses a somnambulist, Cesare, to commit murders.
filmInfoContainer4: Arguably the first true horror film, The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari set a brilliantly high bar for the genre -- and remains terrifying nearly a century after it first stalked the screen.

filmInfoContainer3: Young Esteban wants to become a writer and also to discover the identity of his father, carefully concealed by his mother Manuela.
filmInfoContainer4: Almodovar weaves together a magnificent tapestry of femininity with an affectionate wink to classics of theater and cinema in this poignant story of love, loss and compassion.

filmInfoContainer3: A filmmaker recalls his childhood when falling in love with the pictures at the cinema of his home village and forms a deep friendship with the cinema's projectionist.
filmInfoContainer4: Cinema Paradiso is a life-affirming ode to the power of youth, nostalgia, and the the movies themselves.

filmInfoContainer3: A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune.
After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home.
filmInfoContainer4: Breathtakingly lovely and grounded by the stellar efforts of a well-chosen cast, Finding Nemo adds another beautifully crafted gem to Pixar's crown.

filmInfoContainer3: Two neighbors, a woman and a man, form a strong bond after both suspect extramarital activities of their spouses. However, they agree to keep their bond platonic so as not to commit similar wrongs.
filmInfoContainer4: This understated romance, featuring good performances by its leads, is both visually beautiful and emotionally moving.

filmInfoContainer3: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper, and a drifter named Max.
filmInfoContainer4: With exhilarating action and a surprising amount of narrative heft, Mad Max: Fury Road brings George Miller's post-apocalyptic franchise roaring vigorously back to life.

filmInfoContainer3: A television network cynically exploits a deranged former anchor's ravings and revelations about the news media for its own profit.
filmInfoContainer4: Driven by populist fury and elevated by strong direction, powerful acting, and an intelligent script, Network's searing satire of ratings-driven news remains sadly relevant more than four decades later.

filmInfoContainer3: Held captive for years in an enclosed space, a woman and her young son finally gain their freedom, allowing the boy to experience the outside world for the first time.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by incredible work from Brie Larson and Jacob Tremblay, Room makes for an unforgettably harrowing -- and undeniably rewarding -- experience.

filmInfoContainer3: Spinal Tap, one of England's loudest bands, is chronicled by film director Marty DiBergi on what proves to be a fateful tour.
filmInfoContainer4: Smartly directed, brilliantly acted, and packed with endlessly quotable moments, This Is Spinal Tap is an all-time comedy classic.

filmInfoContainer3: A "typical" day in the life of The Beatles, including many of their famous songs.
filmInfoContainer4: A Hard Day's Night, despite its age, is still a delight to watch and has proven itself to be a rock-and-roll movie classic.

filmInfoContainer3: We meet Jesse and Celine nine years on in Greece. Almost two decades have passed since their first meeting on that train bound for Vienna.
filmInfoContainer4: Building on the first two installments in Richard Linklater's well-crafted Before trilogy, Before Midnight offers intelligent, powerfully acted perspectives on love, marriage, and long-term commitment.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1980s Italy, a romance blossoms between a seventeen year-old student and the older man hired as his father's research assistant.
filmInfoContainer4: Call Me by Your Name offers a melancholy, powerfully affecting portrait of first love, empathetically acted by Timothée Chalamet and Armie Hammer.

filmInfoContainer3: Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.
filmInfoContainer4: Violent, quirky, and darkly funny, Fargo delivers an original crime story and a wonderful performance by McDormand.

filmInfoContainer3: When a killer shark unleashes chaos on a beach resort, it's up to a local sheriff, a marine biologist, and an old seafarer to hunt the beast down.
filmInfoContainer4: Compelling, well-crafted storytelling and a judicious sense of terror ensure Steven Spielberg's Jaws has remained a benchmark in the art of delivering modern blockbuster thrills.

filmInfoContainer3: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.
filmInfoContainer4: Bolstered by powerful lead performances from Javier Bardem, Josh Brolin, and Tommy Lee Jones, No Country for Old Men finds the Coen brothers spinning cinematic gold out of Cormac McCarthy's grim, darkly funny novel.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary which challenges former Indonesian death-squad leaders to reenact their mass-killings in whichever cinematic genres they wish, including classic Hollywood crime scenarios and lavish musical numbers.
filmInfoContainer4: Raw, terrifying, and painfully difficult to watch, The Act of Killing offers a haunting testament to the edifying, confrontational power of documentary cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: Using state-of-the-art equipment, a group of activists, led by renowned dolphin trainer Ric O'Barry, infiltrate a cove near Taijii, Japan to expose both a shocking instance of animal abuse and a serious threat to human health.
filmInfoContainer4: Though decidedly one-sided, The Cove is an impeccably crafted, suspenseful expose of the covert slaughter of dolphins in Japan.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman is hired as a handmaiden to a Japanese heiress, but secretly she is involved in a plot to defraud her.
filmInfoContainer4: The Handmaiden uses a Victorian crime novel as the loose inspiration for another visually sumptuous and absorbingly idiosyncratic outing from director Park Chan-wook.

filmInfoContainer3: An Israeli film director interviews fellow veterans of the 1982 invasion of Lebanon to reconstruct his own memories of his term of service in that conflict.
filmInfoContainer4: A wholly innovative, original, and vital history lesson, with pioneering animation, Waltz With Bashir delivers its message about the Middle East in a mesmerizing fashion.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Arab man is sent to a French prison.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring an impressive star turn by newcomer Tahar Rahim, A Prophet is a French gangster film filled with arresting, immediate details.

filmInfoContainer3: A blade runner must pursue and terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space, and have returned to Earth to find their creator.
filmInfoContainer4: Misunderstood when it first hit theaters, the influence of Ridley Scott's mysterious, neo-noir Blade Runner has deepened with time. A visually remarkable, achingly human sci-fi masterpiece.

filmInfoContainer3: On the hottest day of the year on a street in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn, everyone's hate and bigotry smolders and builds until it explodes into violence.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, vibrant, and urgent without being didactic, Do the Right Thing is one of Spike Lee's most fully realized efforts -- and one of the most important films of the 1980s.

filmInfoContainer3: Takes a closer look at what brought about the 2008 financial meltdown.
filmInfoContainer4: Disheartening but essential viewing, Charles Ferguson's documentary explores the 2008 Global Financial Crisis with exemplary rigor.

filmInfoContainer3: In a small Tokyo apartment, twelve-year-old Akira must care for his younger siblings after their mother leaves them and shows no sign of returning.
filmInfoContainer4: Tragic and haunting, a beautifully heart-wrenching portrait of child abandonment.

filmInfoContainer: Once Upon a Time in America
filmInfoContainer3: A former Prohibition-era Jewish gangster returns to the Lower East Side of Manhattan over thirty years later, where he once again must confront the ghosts and regrets of his old life.
filmInfoContainer4: Sergio Leone's epic crime drama is visually stunning, stylistically bold, and emotionally haunting, and filled with great performances from the likes of Robert De Niro and James Woods.

filmInfoContainer3: A 20-something supervising staff member of a residential treatment facility navigates the troubled waters of that world alongside her co-worker and longtime boyfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: Short Term 12 is an emphatic, revealing drama that pulls audiences into the perspective of neglected youths.

filmInfoContainer3: Mangal drives a taxi by day, then drinks at night, listens to his singer girlfriend Sylvie and then goes into a drunken stupor - and wakes up with a hangover. One day, while assisting ...
filmInfoContainer4: A must-see film for movie lovers, this Martin Scorsese masterpiece is as hard-hitting as it is compelling, with Robert De Niro at his best.

filmInfoContainer3: An insurance salesman/adjuster discovers his entire life is actually a television show.
filmInfoContainer4: A funny, tender, and thought-provoking film, The Truman Show is all the more noteworthy for its remarkably prescient vision of runaway celebrity culture and a nation with an insatiable thirst for the private details of ordinary lives.

filmInfoContainer3: As the feudal Japan era draws to a close, a widower samurai experiences difficulty balancing 2 young daughters, an aged mother, clan loyalties, and the sudden reappearance of his childhood sweetheart.
filmInfoContainer4: Samurai epic as a touching drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A space-opera spanning the dawn of man to humanity reaching the stars, 2001: A Space Odyssey tells the story of the Black Monolith, humanity's evolution and the rise of A.I.'s ultimate supercomputer HAL 9000.
filmInfoContainer4: One of the most influential of all sci-fi films -- and one of the most controversial -- Stanley Kubrick's 2001 is a delicate, poetic meditation on the ingenuity -- and folly -- of mankind.

filmInfoContainer3: Writer James Baldwin tells the story of race in modern America with his unfinished novel, Remember This House.
filmInfoContainer4: I Am Not Your Negro offers an incendiary snapshot of James Baldwin's crucial observations on American race relations -- and a sobering reminder of how far we've yet to go.

filmInfoContainer3: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.
filmInfoContainer4: Christopher Nolan skillfully guides the audience through Memento's fractured narrative, seeping his film in existential dread.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of the childhood, adolescence and burgeoning adulthood of a young, African-American, gay man growing up in a rough neighborhood of Miami.
filmInfoContainer4: Moonlight uses one man's story to offer a remarkable and brilliantly crafted look at lives too rarely seen in cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: A sex-repulsed woman who disapproves of her sister's boyfriend sinks into depression and has horrific visions of rape and violence.
filmInfoContainer4: Roman Polanski's first English film follows a schizophrenic woman's descent into madness, and makes the audience feel as claustrophobic as the character.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on Brazilian Formula One racing driver Ayrton Senna, who won the F1 world championship three times before his death at age 34.
filmInfoContainer4: Even for filmgoers who aren't racing fans, Senna offers heart-pounding thrills -- and heartbreaking emotion.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Drama, Family, Sci-Fi
filmInfoContainer3: A young boy befriends a giant robot from outer space that a paranoid government agent wants to destroy.
filmInfoContainer4: The endearing Iron Giant tackles ambitious topics and complex human relationships with a steady hand and beautifully animated direction from Brad Bird.

filmInfoContainer3: Atticus Finch, a lawyer in the Depression-era South, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge, and his children against prejudice.
filmInfoContainer4: To Kill a Mockingbird is a textbook example of a message movie done right -- sober-minded and earnest, but never letting its social conscience get in the way of gripping drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a rich family. Before the complex case is over, he's seen murder, blackmail, and what might be love.
filmInfoContainer4: A perfect match of screenplay, director, and leading man, The Big Sleep stands as a towering achievement in film noir whose grim vitality remains undimmed.

filmInfoContainer3: The life of Mason, from early childhood to his arrival at college.
filmInfoContainer4: Epic in technical scale but breathlessly intimate in narrative scope, Boyhood is a sprawling investigation of the human condition.

filmInfoContainer: In the Name of the Father
filmInfoContainer3: A man's coerced confession to an IRA bombing he did not commit results in the imprisonment of his father as well. An English lawyer fights to free them.

filmInfoContainer: Spring, Summer, Fall, Winter... and Spring
filmInfoContainer3: A boy is raised by a Buddhist monk on an isolated floating temple where the years pass like the seasons.
filmInfoContainer4: A visually stunning and contemplative piece of work.

filmInfoContainer3: An old man makes a long journey by lawnmower to mend his relationship with an ill brother.
filmInfoContainer4: Slow-paced but heart-warming.

filmInfoContainer3: A small-time thief steals a car and impulsively murders a motorcycle policeman. Wanted by the authorities, he reunites with a hip American journalism student and attempts to persuade her to run away with him to Italy.
filmInfoContainer4: Breathless rewrote the rules of cinema -- and more than 50 years after its arrival, Jean-Luc Godard's paradigm-shifting classic remains every bit as vital.

filmInfoContainer3: An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West is disappearing around them.
filmInfoContainer4: The Wild Bunch is Sam Peckinpah's shocking, violent ballad to an old world and a dying genre.

filmInfoContainer: What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?
filmInfoContainer3: A former child star torments her paraplegic sister in their decaying Hollywood mansion.
filmInfoContainer4: What Ever Happened to Baby Jane? combines powerhouse acting, rich atmosphere, and absorbing melodrama in service of a taut thriller with thought-provoking subtext.

filmInfoContainer3: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.
filmInfoContainer4: Flawlessly cast and brimming with dark, acid wit, American Beauty is a smart, provocative high point of late '90s mainstream Hollywood film.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Chinese warrior steals a sword from a famed swordsman and then escapes into a world of romantic adventure with a mysterious man in the frontier of the nation.
filmInfoContainer4: The movie that catapulted Ang Lee into the ranks of upper echelon Hollywood filmmakers, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon features a deft mix of amazing martial arts battles, beautiful scenery, and tasteful drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A surgeon causes an accident which leaves his daughter disfigured, and goes to extremes to give her a new face.
filmInfoContainer4: A horrific tale of guilt and obsession, Eyes Without a Face is just as chilling and poetic today as it was in 1959.

filmInfoContainer3: A town Marshal, despite the disagreements of his newlywed bride and the townspeople around him, must face a gang of deadly killers alone at high noon when the gang leader, an outlaw he sent up years ago, arrives on the noon train.
filmInfoContainer4: A classic of the Western genre that broke with many of the traditions at the time, High Noon endures -- in no small part thanks to Gary Cooper's defiant, Oscar-winning performance.

filmInfoContainer3: There is panic throughout the nation as the dead suddenly come back to life. The film follows a group of characters who barricade themselves in an old farmhouse in an attempt to remain safe from these bloodthirsty, flesh-eating monsters.
filmInfoContainer4: George A. Romero's debut set the template for the zombie film, and features tight editing, realistic gore, and a sly political undercurrent.

filmInfoContainer3: A young soldier in Vietnam faces a moral crisis when confronted with the horrors of war and the duality of man.
filmInfoContainer4: Informed by director Oliver Stone's personal experiences in Vietnam, Platoon forgoes easy sermonizing in favor of a harrowing, ground-level view of war, bolstered by no-holds-barred performances from Charlie Sheen and Willem Dafoe.

filmInfoContainer3: On a journey to find the cure for a Tatarigami's curse, Ashitaka finds himself in the middle of a war between the forest gods and Tatara, a mining colony. In this quest he also meets San, the Mononoke Hime.
filmInfoContainer4: With its epic story and breathtaking visuals, Princess Mononoke is a landmark in the world of animation.

filmInfoContainer: The King of Kong: A Fistful of Quarters
filmInfoContainer3: Die-hard gamers compete to break world records on classic arcade games.
filmInfoContainer4: The King of Kong is funny and compelling with more than a few poignant insights into human behavior. Director Seth Gordon presents the dueling King Kong players in all their obsessive complexity and with perfectly al dente observations.

filmInfoContainer3: The life and work of photographer Sebastião Salgado, who has spent forty years documenting deprived societies in hidden corners of the world.
filmInfoContainer4: While the work it honors may pose thorny ethical questions that Salt of the Earth neglects to answer, it remains a shattering, thought-provoking testament to Sebastião Salgado's career.

filmInfoContainer3: When the estranged daughter of a hard-working live-in housekeeper suddenly appears, the unspoken class barriers that exist within the home are thrown into disarray.
filmInfoContainer4: The Second Mother's compelling characters serve an artfully drawn, thought-provoking story that's beautifully brought to life by a talented cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of Egyptian revolutionaries battle leaders and regimes, risking their lives to build a new society of conscience.
filmInfoContainer4: The Square offers an electrifying -- and edifying -- ground-level glimpse of life inside a real-life political revolution.

filmInfoContainer3: Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con.
filmInfoContainer4: Paul Newman, Robert Redford, and director George Roy Hill prove that charm, humor, and a few slick twists can add up to a great film.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman separated from her lover by war faces a life-altering decision.
filmInfoContainer4: Jacques Demy elevates the basic drama of everyday life into a soaring opera full of bittersweet passion and playful charm, featuring a timeless performance from Catherine Deneuve.

filmInfoContainer3: When Woody is stolen by a toy collector, Buzz and his friends vow to rescue him, but Woody finds the idea of immortality in a museum tempting.
filmInfoContainer4: The rare sequel that arguably improves on its predecessor, Toy Story 2 uses inventive storytelling, gorgeous animation, and a talented cast to deliver another rich moviegoing experience for all ages.

filmInfoContainer3: In the future, a sadistic gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for a conduct-aversion experiment, but it doesn't go as planned.
filmInfoContainer4: Disturbing and thought-provoking, A Clockwork Orange is a cold, dystopian nightmare with a very dark sense of humor.

filmInfoContainer3: Documentary on the Friedmans, a seemingly typical, upper-middle-class Jewish family whose world is instantly transformed when the father and his youngest son are arrested and charged with shocking and horrible crimes.
filmInfoContainer4: A haunting depiction of a disintegrating family, and a powerful argument on the elusiveness of truth.

filmInfoContainer: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
filmInfoContainer3: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.
filmInfoContainer4: Thrilling, powerfully acted, and visually dazzling, Deathly Hallows Part II brings the Harry Potter franchise to a satisfying -- and suitably magical -- conclusion.

filmInfoContainer3: A film crew goes to a tropical island for an exotic location shoot and discovers a colossal ape who takes a shine to their female blonde star. He is then captured and brought back to New York City for public exhibition.
filmInfoContainer4: King Kong explores the soul of a monster -- making audiences scream and cry throughout the film -- in large part due to Kong's breakthrough special effects.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that utilizes hundreds of hours of audio that Marlon Brando recorded over the course of his life to tell the screen legend's story.
filmInfoContainer4: Listen to Me Marlon offers a fascinating look at the inner life of a Hollywood icon, told in his own words.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at tightrope walker Philippe Petit's daring, but illegal, high-wire routine performed between New York City's World Trade Center's twin towers in 1974, what some consider, "the artistic crime of the century".
filmInfoContainer4: James Marsh's doc about artist Phililppe Petit's artful caper brings you every ounce of suspense that can be wrung from a man on a (suspended) wire.

filmInfoContainer3: Ethan Hunt and his IMF team, along with some familiar allies, race against time after a mission gone wrong.
filmInfoContainer4: Fast, sleek, and fun, Mission: Impossible - Fallout lives up to the "impossible" part of its name by setting yet another high mark for insane set pieces in a franchise full of them.

filmInfoContainer3: A modern-day musical about a busker and an immigrant and their eventful week in Dublin, as they write, rehearse and record songs that tell their love story.
filmInfoContainer4: A charming, captivating tale of love and music, Once sets the standard for the modern musical. And with Dublin as its backdrop, Once is fun and fresh.

filmInfoContainer3: A twenty-seven-year-old office worker travels to the countryside while reminiscing about her childhood in Tokyo.
filmInfoContainer4: Only Yesterday's long-delayed U.S. debut fills a frustrating gap for American Ghibli fans while offering further proof of the studio's incredibly consistent commitment to quality.

filmInfoContainer3: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her teenage son, John Connor, from a more advanced and powerful cyborg.
filmInfoContainer4: T2 features thrilling action sequences and eye-popping visual effects, but what takes this sci-fi/ action landmark to the next level is the depth of the human (and cyborg) characters.

filmInfoContainer3: Agnès Varda explores her memories, mostly chronologically, with photographs, film clips, interviews, reenactments, and droll, playful contemporary scenes of her narrating her story.
filmInfoContainer4: An enchanting self-portrait by a veteran director, Beach of Agnes is equal parts playful and profound.

filmInfoContainer3: Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the social networking site that would become known as Facebook, but is later sued by two brothers who claimed he stole their idea, and the co-founder who was later squeezed out of the business.
filmInfoContainer4: Impeccably scripted, beautifully directed, and filled with fine performances, The Social Network is a riveting, ambitious example of modern filmmaking at its finest.

filmInfoContainer3: A seemingly indestructible android is sent from 2029 to 1984 to assassinate a waitress, whose unborn son will lead humanity in a war against the machines, while a soldier from that war is sent to protect her at all costs.
filmInfoContainer4: With its impressive action sequences, taut economic direction, and relentlessly fast pace, it's clear why The Terminator continues to be an influence on sci-fi and action flicks.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary portrait of a one-room school in rural France, where the students (ranging in age from 4 to 11) are educated by a single dedicated teacher.
filmInfoContainer4: A small, sensitive, and moving portrait of a teacher and his students.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: When a street urchin vies for the love of a beautiful princess, he uses a genie's magic power to make himself off as a prince in order to marry her.
filmInfoContainer4: A highly entertaining entry in Disney's renaissance era," Aladdin is beautifully drawn, with near-classic songs and a cast of scene-stealing characters.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentarian and a reporter travel to Hong Kong for the first of many meetings with Edward Snowden.
filmInfoContainer4: Part real-life thriller, part sobering examination of 21st century civil liberties, Citizenfour transcends ideology to offer riveting, must-see cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: Documentary about Father Oliver O'Grady, a Catholic priest who was relocated to various parishes around the United States during the 1970s in an attempt by the Catholic Church to cover up his rape of dozens of children.
filmInfoContainer4: Deliver Us From Evil is a superb documentary and a searing look at an institution protecting its leaders at the expense of its followers. A profoundly disturbing chronicle of a wolf in sheep's clothing, the film builds a clear-eyed case against pedophile priest Oliver O'Grady, and the Catholic bureaucracy that protected him. The recollections of O'Grady's victims are nothing short of shocking and heartbreaking.

filmInfoContainer3: After he is diagnosed with ALS, former professional football player Steve Gleason begins making a video diary for his unborn son, as he, his wife, and their friends and family work to raise money for ALS patients as his disease progresses.
filmInfoContainer4: Gleason stands out among sports-themed documentaries by offering a clear-eyed look at its subject's physical deterioration -- and an intimate portrait of the family affected by his ordeal.

filmInfoContainer3: Between two Thanksgivings two years apart, Hannah's husband falls in love with her sister Lee, while her hypochondriac ex-husband rekindles his relationship with her sister Holly.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, tender, and funny in equal measure, Hannah and Her Sisters is one of Woody Allen's finest films.

filmInfoContainer3: Twins journey to the Middle East to discover their family history and fulfill their mother's last wishes.
filmInfoContainer4: It's messy, overlong, and a touch melodramatic, but those flaws pale before Incendies' impressive acting and devastating emotional impact.

filmInfoContainer3: A graphic documentary on both sides of the abortion debate.
filmInfoContainer4: Lake of Fire's engaging interviews and powerful black-and-white visuals make for a riveting and honest documentary about a very controversial topic.

filmInfoContainer3: Oskar, an overlooked and bullied boy, finds love and revenge through Eli, a beautiful but peculiar girl.
filmInfoContainer4: Let the Right One In reinvigorates the seemingly tired vampire genre by effectively mixing scares with intelligent storytelling.

filmInfoContainer3: The life of a divorced television writer dating a teenage girl is further complicated when he falls in love with his best friend's mistress.
filmInfoContainer4: One of Woody Allen's early classics, Manhattan combines modern, bittersweet humor and timeless romanticism with unerring grace.

filmInfoContainer3: A sixty-something woman, faced with the discovery of a heinous family crime and in the early stages of Alzheimer's disease, finds strength and purpose when she enrolls in a poetry class.
filmInfoContainer4: Poetry is an absorbing, poignant drama because it offers no easy answers to its complex central conflict.

filmInfoContainer3: A crime boss assembles a team of six experienced criminals to pull off a large jewellery heist.
filmInfoContainer4: Thrumming with intelligence and energy, Reservoir Dogs opens Quentin Tarantino's filmmaking career with hard-hitting style.

filmInfoContainer3: Two men share an odd friendship while they care for two women who are both in deep comas.
filmInfoContainer4: Another masterful, compassionate work from Pedro Almodovar.

filmInfoContainer3: A teacher lives a lonely life, all the while struggling over his son's custody. His life slowly gets better as he finds love and receives good news from his son, but his new luck is about to be brutally shattered by an innocent little lie.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored by Mads Mikkelsen's sympathetic performance, The Hunt asks difficult questions with the courage to pursue answers head on.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of King George VI, his impromptu ascension to the throne of the British Empire in 1936, and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.
filmInfoContainer4: Colin Firth gives a masterful performance in The King's Speech, a predictable but stylishly produced and rousing period drama.

filmInfoContainer3: While home sick in bed, a young boy's grandfather reads him the story of a farmboy-turned-pirate who encounters numerous obstacles, enemies and allies in his quest to be reunited with his true love.
filmInfoContainer4: A delightfully postmodern fairy tale, The Princess Bride is a deft, intelligent mix of swashbuckling, romance, and comedy that takes an age-old damsel-in-distress story and makes it fresh.

filmInfoContainer3: The mysterious disappearance of a kindergarten teacher during a picnic in the north of Iran is followed by a series of misadventures for her fellow travelers.
filmInfoContainer4: About Elly offers viewers performances as powerful as its thought-provoking ideas, and adds another strong entry to Asghar Farhadi's impressive filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: A horrific car accident connects three stories, each involving characters dealing with loss, regret, and life's harsh realities, all in the name of love.
filmInfoContainer4: The brutality of Amores Perros may be difficult to watch at times, but this intense, gritty film packs a hard wallop.

filmInfoContainer3: Georges and Anne are an octogenarian couple. They are cultivated, retired music teachers. Their daughter, also a musician, lives in Britain with her family. One day, Anne has a stroke, and the couple's bond of love is severely tested.
filmInfoContainer4: With towering performances and an unflinching script from Michael Haneke, Amour represents an honest, heartwrenching depiction of deep love and responsibility.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary following the controversial captivity of killer whales, and its dangers for both humans and whales.
filmInfoContainer4: Blackfish is an aggressive, impassioned documentary that will change the way you look at performance killer whales.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a young man's adventures in the California pornography industry of the late 1970s and early 1980s.
filmInfoContainer4: Grounded in strong characters, bold themes, and subtle storytelling, Boogie Nights is a groundbreaking film both for director P.T. Anderson and star Mark Wahlberg.

filmInfoContainer3: An introverted teenage girl tries to survive the last week of her disastrous eighth grade year before leaving to start high school.
filmInfoContainer4: Eighth Grade takes a look at its titular time period that offers a rare and resounding ring of truth while heralding breakthroughs for writer-director Bo Burnham and captivating star Elsie Fisher.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Crime, Drama, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: The story of an unlikely friendship between a bear, Ernest, and a young mouse named Celestine.
filmInfoContainer4: Sweet and visually charming, Ernest & Celestine offers old-fashioned delights for animation lovers of all ages.

filmInfoContainer3: A small-town doctor learns that the population of his community is being replaced by emotionless alien duplicates.
filmInfoContainer4: One of the best political allegories of the 1950s, Invasion of the Body Snatchers is an efficient, chilling blend of sci-fi and horror.

filmInfoContainer3: After losing his mother, a young boy is sent to a foster home with other orphans his age where he begins to learn the meaning of trust and true love.
filmInfoContainer4: My Life as a Zucchini's silly title and adorable characters belie a sober story whose colorful visuals delight the senses even as it braves dark emotional depths.

filmInfoContainer3: Karl Childers, a simple man hospitalized since his childhood murder of his mother and her lover, is released to start a new life in a small town.
filmInfoContainer4: You will see what's coming, but the masterful performances, especially Thornton's, will leave you riveted.

filmInfoContainer3: An in-depth examination of the ways in which the U.S. Vietnam War impacts and disrupts the lives of people in a small industrial town in Pennsylvania.
filmInfoContainer4: Its greatness is blunted by its length and one-sided point of view, but the film's weaknesses are overpowered by Michael Cimino's sympathetic direction and a series of heartbreaking performances from Robert De Niro, Meryl Streep, and Christopher Walken.

filmInfoContainer3: The adventures of Gustave H, a legendary concierge at a famous hotel from the fictional Republic of Zubrowka between the first and second World Wars, and Zero Moustafa, the lobby boy who becomes his most trusted friend.
filmInfoContainer4: Typically stylish but deceptively thoughtful, The Grand Budapest Hotel finds Wes Anderson once again using ornate visual environments to explore deeply emotional ideas.

filmInfoContainer3: When her grandson is kidnapped during the Tour de France, Madame Souza and her beloved pooch Bruno team up with the Belleville Sisters--an aged song-and-dance team from the days of Fred Astaire--to rescue him.
filmInfoContainer4: Richly detailed and loaded with surreal touches, The Triplets of Belleville is an odd, delightful charmer.

filmInfoContainer3: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.
filmInfoContainer4: A brutal, often times funny, other times terrifying portrayal of drug addiction in Edinburgh. Not for the faint of heart, but well worth viewing as a realistic and entertaining reminder of the horrors of drug use.

filmInfoContainer3: After a bad gambling bet, a schoolteacher is marooned in a town full of crazy, drunk, violent men who threaten to make him just as crazy, drunk, and violent.
filmInfoContainer4: A disquieting classic of Australian cinema, Wake in Fright surveys a landscape both sun-drenched and ruthlessly dark.

filmInfoContainer3: A high-school boy is given the chance to write a story for Rolling Stone Magazine about an up-and-coming rock band as he accompanies them on their concert tour.
filmInfoContainer4: Almost Famous, with its great ensemble performances and story, is a well-crafted, warm-hearted movie that successfully draws you into its era.

filmInfoContainer3: A puppeteer discovers a portal that leads literally into the head of movie star John Malkovich.
filmInfoContainer4: Being John Malkovich is both funny and smart, featuring a highly original script.

filmInfoContainer3: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.
filmInfoContainer4: Downfall is an illuminating, thoughtful and detailed account of Hitler's last days.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of how an eccentric French shop-keeper and amateur film-maker attempted to locate and befriend Banksy, only to have the artist turn the camera back on its owner. The film contains...
filmInfoContainer4: An amusing, engrossing look at underground art, Exit Through the Gift Shop entertains as it deflates the myths and hype surrounding its subjects.

filmInfoContainer3: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.
filmInfoContainer4: Intense, tightly constructed, and darkly comic at times, Stanley Kubrick's Full Metal Jacket may not boast the most original of themes, but it is exceedingly effective at communicating them.

filmInfoContainer3: A young African-American visits his white girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, scary, and thought-provoking, Get Out seamlessly weaves its trenchant social critiques into a brilliantly effective and entertaining horror/comedy thrill ride.

filmInfoContainer3: In a near future, a lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need.
filmInfoContainer4: Sweet, soulful, and smart, Spike Jonze's Her uses its just-barely-sci-fi scenario to impart wryly funny wisdom about the state of modern human relationships.

filmInfoContainer3: A national manhunt is ordered for a rebellious kid and his foster uncle who go missing in the wild New Zealand bush.
filmInfoContainer4: The charmingly offbeat Hunt for the Wilderpeople unites a solid cast, a talented filmmaker, and a poignant, funny, deeply affecting message.

filmInfoContainer: In the Shadow of the Moon
filmInfoContainer3: The crew members of NASA's Apollo missions tell their story in their own words.
filmInfoContainer4: Director David Sington poetically interwove 20th Century's cosmonautic history with its effect on the public's view of their country, their heroes and their future.

filmInfoContainer3: In 2002, an artistically inclined seventeen-year-old girl comes of age in Sacramento, California.
filmInfoContainer4: Lady Bird delivers fresh insights about the turmoil of adolescence -- and reveals writer-director Greta Gerwig as a fully formed filmmaking talent.

filmInfoContainer: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India
filmInfoContainer3: The people of a small village in Victorian India stake their future on a game of cricket against their ruthless British rulers.
filmInfoContainer4: Lagaan is lavish, rousing entertainment in the old-fashioned tradition of Hollywood musicals.

filmInfoContainer3: The life and career of the renowned film critic and social commentator, Roger Ebert.
filmInfoContainer4: Rich in detail and warmly affectionate, Life Itself offers a joyful yet poignant tribute to a critical cinematic legacy.

filmInfoContainer3: When a woman shelters a group of girls from suffering female genital mutilation, she starts a conflict that tears her village apart.
filmInfoContainer4: A vibrant, powerful, and poignant glimpse into the struggles of women in modern Africa.

filmInfoContainer3: A bored and sheltered princess escapes her guardians and falls in love with an American newsman in Rome.
filmInfoContainer4: With Audrey Hepburn luminous in her American debut, Roman Holiday is as funny as it is beautiful, and sets the standard for the modern romantic comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: A bus crash in a small town brings a lawyer to the town to defend the families, but he discovers that everything is not what it seems.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Atom Egoyan examines tragedy and its aftermath with intelligence and empathy.

filmInfoContainer3: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat, which began when five criminals met at a seemingly random police lineup.
filmInfoContainer4: Expertly shot and edited, The Usual Suspects gives the audience a simple plot and then piles on layers of deceit, twists, and violence before pulling out the rug from underneath.

filmInfoContainer3: Vampire Count Orlok expresses interest in a new residence and real estate agent Hutter's wife.
filmInfoContainer4: One of the silent era's most influential masterpieces, Nosferatu's eerie, gothic feel -- and a chilling performance from Max Schreck as the vampire -- set the template for the horror films that followed.

filmInfoContainer3: A ferocious, bullying music teacher teaches a dedicated student.
filmInfoContainer4: Intense, inspiring, and well-acted, Whiplash is a brilliant sophomore effort from director Damien Chazelle and a riveting vehicle for stars J.K. Simmons and Miles Teller.

filmInfoContainer3: "The Washington Post" reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the details of the Watergate scandal that leads to President Richard Nixon's resignation.
filmInfoContainer4: A taut, solidly acted paean to the benefits of a free press and the dangers of unchecked power, made all the more effective by its origins in real-life events.

filmInfoContainer3: A transgender punk-rock girl from East Berlin tours the U.S. with her band as she tells her life story and follows the former lover/band-mate who stole her songs.
filmInfoContainer4: Hedwig and the Angry Inch may very well be the next Rocky Horror midnight movie. It not only knows how to rock, but Hedwig's story has an emotional poignancy.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman in Harlem desperately scrambles to prove her fiancé innocent of a crime while carrying their first child.
filmInfoContainer4: If Beale Street Could Talk honors its source material with a beautifully filmed adaptation that finds director Barry Jenkins further strengthening his visual and narrative craft.

filmInfoContainer3: The life and work of the renowned primatology scientist, Jane Goodall, especially on her research about chimpanzees.
filmInfoContainer4: Jane honors its subject's legacy with an absorbing, beautifully filmed, and overall enlightening look at her decades of invaluable work.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in the Watts area of Los Angeles, a slaughterhouse worker must suspend his emotions to continue working at a job he finds repugnant, and then he finds he has little sensitivity for the family he works so hard to support.
filmInfoContainer4: By turns funny, sad, and profound, Killer of Sheep offers a sympathetic and humane glimpse into inner-city life.

filmInfoContainer3: A depressed uncle is asked to take care of his teenage nephew after the boy's father dies.
filmInfoContainer4: Manchester by the Sea delivers affecting drama populated by full-bodied characters, marking another strong step forward for writer-director Kenneth Lonergan.

filmInfoContainer: Rivers and Tides: Andy Goldsworthy Working with Time
filmInfoContainer3: Portrait of Andy Goldsworthy, an artist whose specialty is ephemeral sculptures made from elements of nature.
filmInfoContainer4: Andy Goldsworthy and his art are beautifully captured in this engaging documentary.

filmInfoContainer3: A research chemist comes under personal and professional attack when he decides to appear in a "60 Minutes" expose on Big Tobacco.
filmInfoContainer4: Intelligent, compelling, and packed with strong performances, The Insider is a potent corporate thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: A retired legal counselor writes a novel hoping to find closure for one of his past unresolved homicide cases and for his unreciprocated love with his superior - both of which still haunt him decades later.
filmInfoContainer4: Unpredictable and rich with symbolism, this Argentinian murder mystery lives up to its Oscar with an engrossing plot, Juan Jose Campanella's assured direction, and mesmerizing performances from its cast.

filmInfoContainer: A Story from Bhutan: The Making of 'Travellers & Magicians'
filmInfoContainer3: Add a Plot »
filmInfoContainer4: Interwined tales of spiritual discovery are set against a gorgeous, evocative landscape in this pleasant, engaging import.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1964, to explore the adage "Give me a child until he is seven and I will give you the man," World in Action filmed seven-year-olds. Every seven years, Michael Apted visits them. At 49, ...
filmInfoContainer4: The latest installment in this remarkable series, 49 Up is a satisfying continuation of Michael Apted's singular sociological and cinematic experiment.

filmInfoContainer3: Documentary depicts what happened in Rio de Janeiro on June 12th 2000, when bus 174 was taken by an armed young man, threatening to shoot all the passengers. Transmitted live on all ...

filmInfoContainer: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
filmInfoContainer3: Roy Neary, an electric lineman, watches how his quiet and ordinary daily life turns upside down after a close encounter with a UFO.
filmInfoContainer4: Close Encounters of the Third Kind is deeply humane sci-fi exploring male obsession, cosmic mysticism, and music.

filmInfoContainer: Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem
filmInfoContainer3: After a lukewarm marriage of over twenty years, a woman appeals to her husband's compassion to obtain the desirable divorce document in front of a court, which proves to be more challenging than she would expect.
filmInfoContainer4: On paper, GETT: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem might seem less than thrilling, but on the screen, it delivers two hours of nonstop, tightly wound, brilliantly acted drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Spring. Yorkshire. Young farmer Johnny Saxby numbs his daily frustrations with binge drinking and casual sex, until the arrival of a Romanian migrant worker for lambing season ignites an intense relationship that sets Johnny on a new path.
filmInfoContainer4: A quiet, moving rumination on loneliness and newfound intimacy, God's Own Country marks an outstanding directorial debut for Francis Lee.

filmInfoContainer3: While investigating a gold magnate's smuggling, James Bond uncovers a plot to contaminate the Fort Knox gold reserve.
filmInfoContainer4: Goldfinger is where James Bond as we know him comes into focus - it features one of 007's most famous lines ("A martini. Shaken, not stirred") and a wide range of gadgets that would become the series' trademark.

filmInfoContainer3: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.
filmInfoContainer4: It follows a predictable narrative arc, but Good Will Hunting adds enough quirks to the journey -- and is loaded with enough powerful performances -- that it remains an entertaining, emotionally rich drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A divorced father and his ex-con older brother resort to a desperate scheme in order to save their family's ranch in West Texas.
filmInfoContainer4: Hell or High Water offers a solidly crafted, well-acted Western heist thriller that eschews mindless gunplay in favor of confident pacing and full-bodied characters.

filmInfoContainer3: While navigating their careers in Los Angeles, a pianist and an actress fall in love while attempting to reconcile their aspirations for the future.
filmInfoContainer4: La La Land breathes new life into a bygone genre with thrillingly assured direction, powerful performances, and an irresistible excess of heart.

filmInfoContainer3: A couple embarks on a journey home for Chinese new year along with 130 million other migrant workers, to reunite with their children and struggle for a future. Their unseen story plays out as China soars towards being a world superpower.
filmInfoContainer4: Last Train Home is a haunting, vivid documentary exploring the human toll of China's economic boom in intimate, unforgettable detail.

filmInfoContainer3: Born on the original Christmas in the stable next door to Jesus, Brian of Nazareth spends his life being mistaken for a messiah.
filmInfoContainer4: One of the more cutting-edge films of the 1970s, this religious farce from the classic comedy troupe is as poignant as it is funny and satirical.

filmInfoContainer3: A faded movie star and a neglected young woman form an unlikely bond after crossing paths in Tokyo.
filmInfoContainer4: Effectively balancing humor and subtle pathos, Sofia Coppola crafts a moving, melancholy story that serves as a showcase for both Bill Murray and Scarlett Johansson.

filmInfoContainer3: Two South Africans set out to discover what happened to their unlikely musical hero, the mysterious 1970s rock n roller, Rodriguez.
filmInfoContainer4: A fascinating portrait of a forgotten musical pioneer, Searching for Sugar Man is by turns informative and mysterious.

filmInfoContainer3: A boy growing up in Dublin during the 1980s escapes his strained family life by starting a band to impress the mysterious girl he likes.
filmInfoContainer4: Sing Street is a feel-good musical with huge heart and irresistible optimism, and its charmimg cast and hummable tunes help to elevate its familiar plotting.

filmInfoContainer3: Dr. Richard Kimble, unjustly accused of murdering his wife, must find the real killer while being the target of a nationwide manhunt lead by a seasoned US Marshall.
filmInfoContainer4: Exhilarating and intense, this high-impact chase thriller is a model of taut and efficient formula filmmaking, and it features Harrison Ford at his frantic best.

filmInfoContainer3: Jack Skellington, king of Halloween Town, discovers Christmas Town, but his attempts to bring Christmas to his home causes confusion.
filmInfoContainer4: The Nightmare Before Christmas is a stunningly original and visually delightful work of stop-motion animation.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman filming a documentary on childhood rape victims starts to question the nature of her childhood relationship with her riding instructor and running coach.
filmInfoContainer4: The Tale handles its extraordinarily challenging subject matter with sensitivity, grace, and the power of some standout performances led by a remarkable Laura Dern.

filmInfoContainer3: A mother personally challenges the local authorities to solve her daughter's murder when they fail to catch the culprit.
filmInfoContainer4: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri deftly balances black comedy against searing drama -- and draws unforgettable performances from its veteran cast along the way.

filmInfoContainer3: A dramatization of the Irish civil rights protest march and subsequent massacre by British troops on January 30, 1972.
filmInfoContainer4: Bloody Sunday powerfully recreates the events of that day with startling immediacy.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Venezuelan revolutionary Ilich Ramírez Sánchez, who founded a worldwide terrorist organization and raided the 1975 OPEC meeting.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite its hefty running time, Carlos moves along briskly, thanks to an engaging story, exotic locales, and a breakout performance by Edgar Ramirez.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1985 Dallas, electrician and hustler Ron Woodroof works around the system to help AIDS patients get the medication they need after he is diagnosed with the disease.
filmInfoContainer4: Dallas Buyers Club rests squarely on Matthew McConaughey's scrawny shoulders, and he carries the burden gracefully with what might be a career-best performance.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on 85-year-old sushi master Jiro Ono, his renowned Tokyo restaurant, and his relationship with his son and eventual heir, Yoshikazu.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautiful, thoughtful, and engrossing, Jiro Dreams of Sushi should prove satisfying even for filmgoers who don't care for the cuisine.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of cult film director Alejandro Jodorowsky's ambitious but ultimately doomed film adaptation of the seminal science fiction novel.
filmInfoContainer4: Part thoughtful tribute, part bittersweet reminder of a missed opportunity, Jodorowsky's Dune offers a fascinating look at a lost sci-fi legend.

filmInfoContainer3: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, 2 monsters realize things may not be what they think.
filmInfoContainer4: Clever, funny, and delightful to look at, Monsters, Inc. delivers another resounding example of how Pixar elevated the bar for modern all-ages animation.

filmInfoContainer3: Bosnia and Herzegovina during 1993 at the time of the heaviest fighting between the two warring sides. Two soldiers from opposing sides in the conflict, Nino and Ciki, become trapped in no man's land, whilst a third soldier becomes a living booby trap.
filmInfoContainer4: Bleak and darkly humorous, No Man's Land vividly illustrates the absurdity of war.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s campaign to secure equal voting rights via an epic march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama, in 1965.
filmInfoContainer4: Fueled by a gripping performance from David Oyelowo, Selma draws inspiration and dramatic power from the life and death of Martin Luther King, Jr. -- but doesn't ignore how far we remain from the ideals his work embodied.

filmInfoContainer3: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the titular opposites.
filmInfoContainer4: Sense and Sensibility is an uncommonly deft, very funny Jane Austen adaptation, marked by Emma Thompson's finely tuned performance.

filmInfoContainer3: An egomaniacal film star develops a relationship with a young dancer against the backdrop of Hollywood's silent era.
filmInfoContainer4: A crowd-pleasing tribute to the magic of silent cinema, The Artist is a clever, joyous film with delightful performances and visual style to spare.

filmInfoContainer3: Pakistan-born comedian Kumail Nanjiani and grad student Emily Gardner fall in love but struggle as their cultures clash. When Emily contracts a mysterious illness, Kumail finds himself forced to face her feisty parents, his family's expectations, and his true feelings.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, heartfelt, and intelligent, The Big Sick uses its appealing leads and cross-cultural themes to prove the standard romcom formula still has some fresh angles left to explore.

filmInfoContainer3: Set over one summer, the film follows precocious six-year-old Moonee as she courts mischief and adventure with her ragtag playmates and bonds with her rebellious but caring mother, all while living in the shadows of Walt Disney World.
filmInfoContainer4: The Florida Project offers a colorfully empathetic look at an underrepresented part of the population that proves absorbing even as it raises sobering questions about modern America.

filmInfoContainer3: During the Iraq War, a Sergeant recently assigned to an army bomb squad is put at odds with his squad mates due to his maverick way of handling his work.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-acted, intensely shot, action filled war epic, Kathryn Bigelow's The Hurt Locker is thus far the best of the recent dramatizations of the Iraq War.

filmInfoContainer3: Broken, desperate men chase their dreams and run from their demons in the North Dakota oil fields. A local Pastor risks everything to help them.
