filmInfoContainer4: Hard-hitting, absorbing, and painfully relevant, The Overnighters offers an urgent and compassionate picture of life in 21st century America.

filmInfoContainer3: A faded professional wrestler must retire, but finds his quest for a new life outside the ring a dispiriting struggle.
filmInfoContainer4: Mickey Rourke gives a performance for the ages in The Wrestler, a richly affecting, heart-wrenching yet ultimately rewarding drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Near the Iraqi-Turkish border on the eve of an American invasion, refugee children like 13-year-old Kak (Ebrahim), gauge and await their fate.
filmInfoContainer4: Set in Iraq after the fall of Saddam, Turtles Can Fly is being hailed as extraordinary, moving, and lyrical.

filmInfoContainer3: A 3-D presentation of U2's global "Vertigo" tour. Shot at seven different shows, this production employs the greatest number of 3-D cameras ever used for a single project.
filmInfoContainer4: 3D transports the viewer to an intimate seat at a U2 performance, for an exhilarating musical experience at the price of a movie ticket.

filmInfoContainer3: Six short stories that explore the extremities of human behavior involving people in distress.
filmInfoContainer4: Wickedly hilarious and delightfully deranged, Wild Tales is a subversive satire that doubles as a uniformly entertaining anthology film.

filmInfoContainer3: In Mexico, two teenage boys and an attractive older woman embark on a road trip and learn a thing or two about life, friendship, sex, and each other.
filmInfoContainer4: A road movie that's not only sexy, but intelligent as well.

filmInfoContainer3: An American grandson of the infamous scientist, struggling to prove that his grandfather was not as insane as people believe, is invited to Transylvania, where he discovers the process that reanimates a dead body.
filmInfoContainer4: Made with obvious affection for the original, Young Frankenstein is a riotously silly spoof featuring a fantastic performance by Gene Wilder.

filmInfoContainer3: Since 1978, Anvil has become one of heavy metal's most influential yet commercially unsuccessful acts. In 2006, after a fledging European tour Anvil sets out to record their thirteenth album and continue to follow their dreams.
filmInfoContainer4: A touching, uplifting and inspirational rockumentary about an aging metal band, both hilarious and heart-warming in equal measure.

filmInfoContainer3: In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea.
filmInfoContainer4: Children of Men works on every level: as a violent chase thriller, a fantastical cautionary tale, and a sophisticated human drama about societies struggling to live.

filmInfoContainer3: John McClane, officer of the NYPD, tries to save his wife Holly Gennaro and several others that were taken hostage by German terrorist Hans Gruber during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.
filmInfoContainer4: Its many imitators (and sequels) have never come close to matching the taut thrills of the definitive holiday action classic.

filmInfoContainer3: When an unconfident young woman is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.
filmInfoContainer4: Exquisitely illustrated by master animator Miyazaki, Howl's Moving Castle will delight children with its fantastical story and touch the hearts and minds of older viewers as well.

filmInfoContainer3: A small-time hood aspires to work his way up the ranks of a local mob.
filmInfoContainer4: Mean Streets is a powerful tale of urban sin and guilt that marks Scorsese's arrival as an important cinematic voice and features electrifying performances from Harvey Keitel and Robert De Niro.

filmInfoContainer3: A determined woman works with a hardened boxing trainer to become a professional.
filmInfoContainer4: Clint Eastwood's assured direction - combined with knockout performances from Hilary Swank and Morgan Freeman - help Million Dollar Baby to transcend its clichés, and the result is deeply heartfelt and moving.

filmInfoContainer3: Quadriplegics, who play full-contact rugby in wheelchairs, overcome unimaginable obstacles to compete in the Paralympic Games in Athens, Greece.
filmInfoContainer4: An entertaining and gripping documentary that shows being confined to a wheelchair doesn't mean the fun has to end.

filmInfoContainer3: When five orphan girls are seen innocently playing with boys on a beach, their scandalized conservative guardians confine them while forced marriages are arranged.
filmInfoContainer4: Mustang delivers a bracing -- and thoroughly timely -- message whose power is further bolstered by the efforts of a stellar ensemble cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Parallel tales of two sexually obsessed men, one hurting and annoying women physically and mentally, one wandering around the city talking to strangers and experiencing dimensions of life.
filmInfoContainer4: Naked lives up to its title with a thoroughly committed performance from David Thewlis that's backed up with some of Mike Leigh's most powerful direction.

filmInfoContainer3: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring terrific performances and epic action, Kubrick's restored swords-and-sandals epic is a true classic.

filmInfoContainer3: A family of undercover superheroes, while trying to live the quiet suburban life, are forced into action to save the world.
filmInfoContainer4: Bringing loads of wit and tons of fun to the animated superhero genre, The Incredibles easily lives up to its name.

filmInfoContainer3: The second part of Aki Kaurismäki's "Finland" trilogy, the film follows a man who arrives in Helsinki and gets beaten up so severely he develops amnesia. Unable to remember his name or ...
filmInfoContainer4: Kaurismäki delivers another droll comedy full of his trademark humor.

filmInfoContainer3: Producers Max Bialystock and Leo Bloom make money by producing a sure-fire flop.
filmInfoContainer4: A hilarious satire of the business side of Hollywood, The Producers is one of Mel Brooks' finest, as well as funniest films, featuring standout performances by Gene Wilder and Zero Mostel.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of two climbers and their perilous journey up the west face of Siula Grande in the Peruvian Andes in 1985.
filmInfoContainer4: Gripping even though the outcome is known.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Crime, Family, Mystery
filmInfoContainer3: In a city of anthropomorphic animals, a rookie bunny cop and a cynical con artist fox must work together to uncover a conspiracy.
filmInfoContainer4: The brilliantly well-rounded Zootopia offers a thoughtful, inclusive message that's as rich and timely as its sumptuously state-of-the-art animation -- all while remaining fast and funny enough to keep younger viewers entertained.

filmInfoContainer3: A frigid young housewife decides to spend her midweek afternoons as a prostitute.
A circus' beautiful trapeze artist agrees to marry the leader of side-show performers, but his deformed friends discover she is only marrying him for his inheritance.
The brother (House Peters Jr.) of rancher Bill Martin (Bill Elliott) is killed in a stampede started by cattleman. Bill returns to the Fargo country to take his brother's place and is ...
filmInfoContainer4: Violent, quirky, and darkly funny, Fargo delivers an original crime story and a wonderful performance by McDormand.

filmInfoContainer3: Archival footage and personal testimonials present an intimate portrait of the life and career of British singer/songwriter Amy Winehouse.
filmInfoContainer4: As riveting as it is sad, Amy is a powerfully honest look at the twisted relationship between art and celebrity -- and the lethal spiral of addiction.

filmInfoContainer3: Acting under the cover of a Hollywood producer scouting a location for a science fiction film, a CIA agent launches a dangerous operation to rescue six Americans in Tehran during the U.S. hostage crisis in Iran in 1979.
filmInfoContainer4: Tense, exciting, and often darkly comic, Argo recreates a historical event with vivid attention to detail and finely wrought characters.

filmInfoContainer3: A profile of the noted and extraordinarily cheerful veteran New York City fashion photographer.
filmInfoContainer4: Suffused with happiness and modest charm, Bill Cunningham New York offers a touching, gently humorous portrait of its subject without invading his jealously guarded privacy.

filmInfoContainer: Burma VJ: Reporter i et lukket land
filmInfoContainer3: Using smuggled footage, this documentary tells the story of the 2007 protests in Burma by thousands of monks.
filmInfoContainer4: A powerfully visceral docu-drama highlighting the evils of censorship and the essential need for freedom of speech.

filmInfoContainer3: Two melancholy Hong Kong policemen fall in love: one with a mysterious female underworld figure, the other with a beautiful and ethereal server at a late-night restaurant he frequents.
filmInfoContainer4: Even if all it had to offer were writer-director Wong Kar-wai's thrillingly distinctive visuals, Chungking Express would be well worth watching; happily, its thoughtfully drawn characters and naturalistic performances also pack a potent dramatic wallop.

filmInfoContainer3: With the help of a German bounty hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner.
filmInfoContainer4: Bold, bloody, and stylistically daring, Django Unchained is another incendiary masterpiece from Quentin Tarantino.

filmInfoContainer3: Fifteen years after murdering his sister on Halloween night 1963, Michael Myers escapes from a mental hospital and returns to the small town of Haddonfield, Illinois to kill again.
filmInfoContainer4: Scary, suspenseful, and viscerally thrilling, Halloween set the standard for modern horror films.

filmInfoContainer3: A story between a mole in the police department and an undercover cop. Their objectives are the same: to find out who is the mole, and who is the cop.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart and engrossing, this is one of Hong Kong's better cop thrillers.

filmInfoContainer3: A young boy named Kubo must locate a magical suit of armour worn by his late father in order to defeat a vengeful spirit from the past.
filmInfoContainer4: Kubo and the Two Strings matches its incredible animation with an absorbing -- and bravely melancholy -- story that has something to offer audiences of all ages.

filmInfoContainer3: In a Russian coastal town, Kolya is forced to fight the corrupt mayor when he is told that his house will be demolished. He recruits a lawyer friend to help, but the man's arrival brings further misfortune for Kolya and his family.
filmInfoContainer4: Leviathan lives up to its title, offering trenchant, well-crafted social satire on a suitably grand scale.

filmInfoContainer3: After the death of a friend, a writer recounts a boyhood journey to find the body of a missing boy.
filmInfoContainer4: Stand By Me is a wise, nostalgic movie with a weird streak that captures both Stephen King's voice and the trials of growing up.

filmInfoContainer3: After suffering a near fatal head injury, a young cowboy undertakes a search for new identity and what it means to be a man in the heartland of America.
filmInfoContainer4: The Rider's hard-hitting drama is only made more effective through writer-director Chloé Zhao's use of untrained actors to tell the movie's fact-based tale.

filmInfoContainer3: A young boy becomes friends with a gang of skinheads. Friends soon become like family, and relationships will be pushed to the very limit.
filmInfoContainer4: A moving coming-of-age tale that captures the despair among England's working-class youth in the 1980s.

filmInfoContainer3: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to find his father murdered and his mother remarrying the murderer, his uncle. Meanwhile, war is brewing.
filmInfoContainer4: Kenneth Branagh's sprawling, finely textured adaptation of Shakespeare's masterpiece lives up to its source material, using strong performances and a sharp cinematic focus to create a powerfully resonant film that wastes none of its 246 minutes.

filmInfoContainer3: Two astronauts work together to survive after an accident which leaves them stranded in space.
filmInfoContainer4: Alfonso Cuarón's Gravity is an eerie, tense sci-fi thriller that's masterfully directed and visually stunning.

filmInfoContainer3: A devastating and heart-rending take on grizzly bear activists Timothy Treadwell and Amie Huguenard, who were killed in October of 2003 while living among grizzly bears in Alaska.
filmInfoContainer4: Whatever opinion you come to have of the obsessive Treadwell, Herzog has once again found a fascinating subject.

filmInfoContainer3: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a CEO.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, innovative, and thrilling, Inception is that rare summer blockbuster that succeeds viscerally as well as intellectually.

filmInfoContainer3: In the near future, a weary Logan cares for an ailing Professor X. However, Logan's attempts to hide from the world and his legacy are upended when a young mutant arrives, pursued by dark forces.
filmInfoContainer4: Hugh Jackman makes the most of his final outing as Wolverine with a gritty, nuanced performance in a violent but surprisingly thoughtful superhero action film that defies genre conventions.

filmInfoContainer3: Two con artists try to swindle a stamp collector by selling him a sheet of counterfeit rare stamps (the "nine queens").
filmInfoContainer4: Deliciously twist-filled, Nine Queens is a clever and satisfying crime caper.

filmInfoContainer3: The extracurricular king of Rushmore Preparatory School is put on academic probation.
filmInfoContainer4: This cult favorite is a quirky coming of age story, with fine, off-kilter performances from Jason Schwartzman and Bill Murray.

filmInfoContainer3: Jason Bourne dodges a ruthless C.I.A. official and his Agents from a new assassination program while searching for the origins of his life as a trained killer.
filmInfoContainer4: The Bourne Ultimatum is an intelligent, finely tuned non-stop thrill ride. Another strong performance from Matt Damon and sharp camerawork from Paul Greengrass make this the finest installment of the Bourne trilogy.

filmInfoContainer3: On the outskirts of Rio de Janeiro is Jardim Gramacho, the world's largest landfill, where men and women sift through garbage for a living. Artist Vik Muniz produces portraits of the workers and learns about their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: Waste Land begins with an eco-friendly premise, but quickly transforms into an uplifting portrait of the power of art and the dignity of the human spirit.

filmInfoContainer3: A single mother's life is thrown into turmoil after her struggling, rarely seen younger brother returns to town.
filmInfoContainer4: You Can Count On Me may look like it belongs on the small screen, but the movie surprises with its simple yet affecting story. Beautifully acted and crafted, the movie will simply draw you in.

filmInfoContainer3: Over the course of a few hectic days, numerous interrelated people prepare for a political convention as secrets and lies are surfaced and revealed.

An Irish immigrant lands in 1950s Brooklyn, where she quickly falls into a romance with a local. When her past catches up with her, however, she must choose between two countries and the lives that exist within.
filmInfoContainer4: Brooklyn buttresses outstanding performances from Saoirse Ronan and Emory Cohen with a rich period drama that tugs at the heartstrings as deftly as it satisfies the mind.

filmInfoContainer3: When Lee Israel falls out of step with current tastes, she turns her art form to deception. An adaptation of the memoir Can You Ever Forgive Me?, the true story of best-selling celebrity biographer Lee Israel.
filmInfoContainer4: Deftly directed and laced with dark wit, Can You Ever Forgive Me? proves a compelling showcase for deeply affecting work from Richard E. Grant and Melissa McCarthy.

filmInfoContainer3: Armed with a license to kill, Secret Agent James Bond sets out on his first mission as 007, and must defeat a private banker to terrorists in a high stakes game of poker at Casino Royale, Montenegro, but things are not what they seem.
filmInfoContainer4: Casino Royale disposes of the silliness and gadgetry that plagued recent James Bond outings, and Daniel Craig delivers what fans and critics have been waiting for: a caustic, haunted, intense reinvention of 007.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the relationship between Karamakate, an Amazonian shaman and last survivor of his people, and two scientists who work together over the course of forty years to search the Amazon for a sacred healing plant.
filmInfoContainer4: As rich visually as it is thematically, Embrace of the Serpent offers a feast of the senses for film fans seeking a dose of bracing originality.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of professional bank robbers start to feel the heat from police when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.
filmInfoContainer4: Though Al Pacino and Robert De Niro share but a handful of screen minutes together, Heat is an engrossing crime drama that draws compelling performances from its stars -- and confirms Michael Mann's mastery of the genre.

filmInfoContainer3: A defense officer, Nameless, was summoned by the King of Qin regarding his success of terminating three warriors.
filmInfoContainer4: With death-defying action sequences and epic historic sweep, Hero offers everything a martial arts fan could ask for.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of two coalitions -- ACT UP and TAG (Treatment Action Group) -- whose activism and innovation turned AIDS from a death sentence into a manageable condition.
filmInfoContainer4: Angry, powerful, and stirring, How to Survive a Plague is a brilliantly constructed documentary about the activists who pushed for action to combat the AIDS epidemic.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: A hapless young Viking who aspires to hunt dragons becomes the unlikely friend of a young dragon himself, and learns there may be more to the creatures than he assumed.
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting dazzling animation, a script with surprising dramatic depth, and thrilling 3-D sequences, How to Train Your Dragon soars.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the battle of Iwo Jima between the United States and Imperial Japan during World War II, as told from the perspective of the Japanese who fought it.
filmInfoContainer4: A powerfully humanistic portrayal of the perils of war, this companion piece to Flags of our Fathers is potent and thought-provoking, and it demonstrates Clint Eastwood's maturity as a director.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on the life, music, and legacy of Bob Marley.
filmInfoContainer4: Kevin Macdonald's exhaustive, evenhanded portrait of Bob Marley offers electrifying concert footage and fascinating insights into reggae's greatest star.

filmInfoContainer3: A pair of young lovers flee their New England town, which causes a local search party to fan out to find them.
filmInfoContainer4: Warm, whimsical, and poignant, the immaculately framed and beautifully acted Moonrise Kingdom presents writer/director Wes Anderson at his idiosyncratic best.

filmInfoContainer3: A Mumbai teen reflects on his upbringing in the slums when he is accused of cheating on the Indian Version of "Who Wants to be a Millionaire?"
filmInfoContainer4: Visually dazzling and emotionally resonant, Slumdog Millionaire is a film that's both entertaining and powerful.

filmInfoContainer3: The brash James T. Kirk tries to live up to his father's legacy with Mr. Spock keeping him in check as a vengeful Romulan from the future creates black holes to destroy the Federation one planet at a time.
filmInfoContainer4: Star Trek reignites a classic franchise with action, humor, a strong story, and brilliant visuals, and will please traditional Trekkies and new fans alike.

filmInfoContainer3: A frustrated war correspondent, unable to find the war he's been asked to cover, takes the risky path of coopting the identity of a dead arms dealer acquaintance.
filmInfoContainer4: Antonioni's classic, a tale of lonely, estranged characters on a journey though the mysterious landscapes of identity, shimmers with beauty and uncertainty.

filmInfoContainer3: A Hollywood studio executive is being sent death threats by a writer whose script he rejected, but which one?
filmInfoContainer4: Bitingly cynical without succumbing to bitterness, The Player is one of the all-time great Hollywood satires -- and an ensemble-driven highlight of the Altman oeuvre.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of assassins come together for a suicide mission to kill an evil lord.
filmInfoContainer4: Takashi Miike's electric remake of Eiichi Kudo's 1963 period action film is a wild spectacle executed with killer, dizzying panache.

filmInfoContainer3: An ordinary word processor has the worst night of his life after he agrees to visit a girl in Soho who he met that evening at a coffee shop.
filmInfoContainer4: Bursting with frantic energy and tinged with black humor, After Hours is a masterful -- and often overlooked -- detour in Martin Scorsese's filmography.

filmInfoContainer: Bright Lights: Starring Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds
filmInfoContainer3: An intimate portrait of actress Debbie Reynolds and her relationship with her beloved children, Carrie Fisher and Todd Fisher.
filmInfoContainer4: Bright Lights: Starring Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds is a touching, bittersweet, and ultimately charming love story that serves as a poignantly effective tribute to the strangely complicated, uniquely resilient mother/daughter duo.

filmInfoContainer3: A seasoned FBI agent pursues Frank Abagnale Jr. who, before his 19th birthday, successfully forged millions of dollars' worth of checks while posing as a Pan Am pilot, a doctor, and a legal prosecutor.
filmInfoContainer4: With help from a strong performance by Leonardo DiCaprio as real-life wunderkind con artist Frank Abagnale, Steven Spielberg crafts a film that's stylish, breezily entertaining, and surprisingly sweet.

filmInfoContainer3: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, Vietnam, Watergate, and other history unfold through the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75.
filmInfoContainer4: Forrest Gump may be an overly sentimental film with a somewhat problematic message, but its sweetness and charm are usually enough to approximate true depth and grace.

filmInfoContainer: Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief
filmInfoContainer3: A documentary looking at the inner-workings of the Church of Scientology.
filmInfoContainer4: Thoroughly disquieting but impossible to ignore, Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief is a searing investigative work from a master documentarian.

filmInfoContainer3: A skilled London police officer is transferred to a small town that's harbouring a dark secret.
filmInfoContainer4: The brilliant minds behind Shaun of the Dead successfully take a shot at the buddy cop genre with Hot Fuzz. The result is a bitingly satiric and hugely entertaining parody.

filmInfoContainer3: An agoraphobic must give up his sheltered life and venture outside after a series of personal and financial problems.
filmInfoContainer4: Inventive, gorgeously animated, and powerfully moving, Inside Out is another outstanding addition to the Pixar library of modern animated classics.

filmInfoContainer3: After a vicious attacks leaves him brain-damaged and broke, Mark Hogancamp seeks recovery in "Marwencol", a 1/6th scale World War II-era town he creates in his backyard.
filmInfoContainer4: Inspiring and fascinating, Marwencol depicts its subject with heartfelt tenderness, raising poignant questions about art and personal tragedy along the way.

filmInfoContainer3: A mother desperately searches for the killer who framed her son for a girl's horrific murder.
filmInfoContainer4: As fleshy as it is funny, Bong Joon-Ho's Mother straddles family drama, horror and comedy with a deft grasp of tone and plenty of eerie visuals.

filmInfoContainer3: A young lawyer, Richard Goodwin, investigates a potentially fixed game show. Charles Van Doren, a big time show winner, is under Goodwin's investigation.
filmInfoContainer4: Robert Redford refracts the sociopolitical and moral issues posed by the subject material through a purely entertaining, well-acted lens.

filmInfoContainer3: Documentary detailing the origins and history of surf culture.
filmInfoContainer4: A great addition to the existing surfing documentaries.

filmInfoContainer3: A man decides to turn his moribund life around by winning back his ex-girlfriend, reconciling his relationship with his mother and dealing with an entire community that has returned from the dead to eat the living.
filmInfoContainer4: Shaun of the Dead cleverly balances scares and witty satire, making for a bloody good zombie movie with loads of wit.

filmInfoContainer3: Alex Gibney exposes the haunting details of the USA's torture and interrogation practices during the War in Afghanistan.
filmInfoContainer4: Taxi to the Dark Side is an intelligent, powerful look into the dark corners of the War on Terror.

filmInfoContainer3: In early 18th century England, a frail Queen Anne (Colman) occupies the throne and her close friend Lady Sarah (Weisz) governs the country in her stead. When a new servant Abigail (Stone) arrives, her charm endears her to Sarah.
filmInfoContainer4: The Favourite sees Yorgos Lanthimos balancing a period setting against rich, timely subtext - and getting roundly stellar performances from his well-chosen stars.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: An ordinary LEGO construction worker, thought to be the prophesied as "special", is recruited to join a quest to stop an evil tyrant from gluing the LEGO universe into eternal stasis.
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting beautiful animation, a charming voice cast, laugh-a-minute gags, and a surprisingly thoughtful story, The Lego Movie is colorful fun for all ages.

filmInfoContainer3: A gay activist attempts to raise H.I.V. and A.I.D.S. awareness during the early 1980s.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to Emmy-worthy performances from a reputable cast, The Normal Heart is not only a powerful, heartbreaking drama, but also a vital document of events leading up to and through the early AIDS crisis.

filmInfoContainer3: Pat Tillman never thought of himself as a hero. His choice to leave a multimillion-dollar football contract and join the military wasn't done for any reason other than he felt it was the ...
filmInfoContainer4: Passionate, angry, and insightful, The Tillman Story offers a revealing portrait of its subject's inspiring life and untimely death.

filmInfoContainer3: A hotel owner and landlord in a remote Turkish village deals with conflicts within his family and a tenant behind on his rent.
filmInfoContainer4: Epic in length, thrilling to behold, and utterly absorbing, Winter Sleep demands -- and rewards -- viewers' patient attention.

filmInfoContainer3: A man afraid to fly must ensure that a plane lands safely after the pilots become sick.
filmInfoContainer4: Though unabashedly juvenile and silly, Airplane! is nevertheless an uproarious spoof comedy full of quotable lines and slapstick gags that endure to this day.

filmInfoContainer3: An original mix of fiction and reality illuminates the life of comic book hero everyman Harvey Pekar.
filmInfoContainer4: Exhilarating both stylistically and for its entertaining, moving portrayal of an everyman, American Splendor is a portrait of a true underground original.

filmInfoContainer3: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver finds himself taking part in a heist doomed to fail.
filmInfoContainer4: Stylish, exciting, and fueled by a killer soundtrack, Baby Driver hits the road and it's gone -- proving fast-paced action movies can be smartly written without sacrificing thrills.

filmInfoContainer3: Follows the lives of three young males living in the Crenshaw ghetto of Los Angeles, dissecting questions of race, relationships, violence and future prospects.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-acted and thematically rich, Boyz N the Hood observes urban America with far more depth and compassion than many of the like-minded films its success inspired.

filmInfoContainer3: The former World Heavyweight Champion Rocky Balboa serves as a trainer and mentor to Adonis Johnson, the son of his late friend and former rival Apollo Creed.
filmInfoContainer4: Creed brings the Rocky franchise off the mat for a surprisingly effective seventh round that extends the boxer's saga in interesting new directions while staying true to its classic predecessors' roots.

filmInfoContainer3: An urbane fox cannot resist returning to his farm raiding ways and then must help his community survive the farmers' retaliation.
filmInfoContainer4: Fantastic Mr. Fox is a delightfully funny feast for the eyes with multi-generational appeal -- and it shows Wes Anderson has a knack for animation.

filmInfoContainer3: With the intention to break free from the strict familial restrictions, a suicidal young woman sets up a marriage of convenience with a forty-year-old addict, an act that will lead to an outburst of envious love.
filmInfoContainer4: A raw, provocative drama about star-crossed love and the lives of immigrants caught between the traditional and modern.

filmInfoContainer3: Paul Rusesabagina was a hotel manager who housed over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda.
filmInfoContainer4: A sobering and heartfelt tale about massacre that took place in Rwanda while most of the world looked away.

filmInfoContainer3: A family determined to get their young daughter into the finals of a beauty pageant take a cross-country trip in their VW bus.
filmInfoContainer4: Little Miss Sunshine succeeds thanks to a strong ensemble cast that includes Greg Kinnear, Steve Carell, Toni Collette, Alan Arkin, and Abigail Breslin, as well as a delightfully funny script.

filmInfoContainer3: One day in the life of Anders, a young recovering drug addict, who takes a brief leave from his treatment center to interview for a job and catch up with old friends in Oslo.
filmInfoContainer4: An upfront study of a drug addict confronting his demons, Oslo, August 31st makes this dark journey worthwhile with fantastic directing and equally fantastic acting.

filmInfoContainer3: Nine high school students from disparate corners of the globe navigate rivalries, setbacks, and hormones on their quest to win the international science fair. Only one can be named "Best in Fair."
filmInfoContainer4: Science Fair offers further proof that real-life academic competition can make for effortlessly entertaining - and ultimately uplifting - cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: A wealthy San Francisco socialite pursues a potential boyfriend to a small Northern California town that slowly takes a turn for the bizarre when birds of all kinds suddenly begin to attack people.
filmInfoContainer4: Proving once again that build-up is the key to suspense, Alfred Hitchcock successfully turned birds into some of the most terrifying villains in horror history.

filmInfoContainer3: A year in the life of a city grappling with urban violence.
filmInfoContainer4: Impeccably crafted and edited, The Interrupters is a tough and honest documentary about street violence that truly has the power to inspire change.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of a failure of justice in the case against the West Memphis Three.
filmInfoContainer4: Both a sobering look at a true crime story and a scathing indictment of the American justice system, West of Memphis is a real-life horror story told with fury and compassion.

filmInfoContainer3: Screenwriter Paul Javal's marriage to his wife Camille disintegrates during movie production as she spends time with the producer. Layered conflicts between art and business ensue.
filmInfoContainer4: This powerful work of essential cinema joins "meta" with "physique," casting Brigite Bardot and director Godard's inspiration Fritz Lang.

filmInfoContainer: The Day the Earth Stood Still
filmInfoContainer3: An alien lands and tells the people of Earth that they must live peacefully or be destroyed as a danger to other planets.
filmInfoContainer4: Socially minded yet entertaining, The Day the Earth Stood Still imparts its moral of peace and understanding without didacticism.

filmInfoContainer3: Amélie is an innocent and naive girl in Paris with her own sense of justice. She decides to help those around her and, along the way, discovers love.
filmInfoContainer4: The feel-good Amelie is a lively, fanciful charmer, showcasing Audrey Tautou as its delightful heroine.

filmInfoContainer3: Clara, a 65 year old widow and retired music critic, was born into a wealthy and traditional family in Recife, Brazil. She is the last resident of the Aquarius, an original two-story ...
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a powerful performance from Sônia Braga, Aquarius uses a conflict between a tenant and developers to take an insightful look at the relationship between space and identity.

filmInfoContainer3: A linguist is recruited by the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecrafts land around the world.
filmInfoContainer4: Arrival delivers a must-see experience for fans of thinking person's sci-fi that anchors its heady themes with genuinely affecting emotion and a terrific performance from Amy Adams.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama based on the experiences of Agu, a child soldier fighting in the civil war of an unnamed African country.
filmInfoContainer4: Beasts of No Nation finds writer-director Cary Fukunaga working with a talented cast to offer a sobering, uncompromising, yet still somehow hopeful picture of war's human cost.

filmInfoContainer3: The discovery of a severed human ear found in a field leads a young man on an investigation related to a beautiful, mysterious nightclub singer and a group of psychopathic criminals who have kidnapped her child.
filmInfoContainer4: If audiences walk away from this subversive, surreal shocker not fully understanding the story, they might also walk away with a deeper perception of the potential of film storytelling.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of Captain Richard Phillips and the 2009 hijacking by Somali pirates of the U.S.-flagged MV Maersk Alabama, the first American cargo ship to be hijacked in two hundred years.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, powerfully acted, and incredibly intense, Captain Phillips offers filmgoers a Hollywood biopic done right -- and offers Tom Hanks a showcase for yet another brilliant performance.

filmInfoContainer3: A troubled child summons the courage to help a friendly alien escape Earth and return to his home world.
filmInfoContainer4: Playing as both an exciting sci-fi adventure and a remarkable portrait of childhood, Steven Spielberg's touching tale of a homesick alien remains a piece of movie magic for young and old.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the punk rock band The Ramones.
filmInfoContainer4: Gabba gabba hey! With its focus on the groundbreaking work of the 1970s punk band The Ramones End of the Century makes a solid entry into the growing canon of documentaries that capture Punkology.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of the machinations behind the scenes at a real estate office.
filmInfoContainer4: This adaptation of David Mamet's play is every bit as compelling and witty as its source material, thanks in large part to a clever script and a bevy of powerhouse actors.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of intergalactic criminals are forced to work together to stop a fanatical warrior from taking control of the universe.
filmInfoContainer4: Guardians of the Galaxy is just as irreverent as fans of the frequently zany Marvel comic would expect -- as well as funny, thrilling, full of heart, and packed with visual splendor.

filmInfoContainer3: A father and his thirteen year-old daughter are living an ideal existence in a vast urban park in Portland, Oregon, when a small mistake derails their lives forever.
filmInfoContainer4: Leave No Trace takes an effectively low-key approach to a potentially sensationalistic story -- and further benefits from brilliant work by Ben Foster and Thomasin McKenzie.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical
filmInfoContainer3: In Ancient Polynesia, when a terrible curse incurred by the Demigod Maui reaches Moana's island, she answers the Ocean's call to seek out the Demigod to set things right.
filmInfoContainer4: With a title character as three-dimensional as its lush animation and a story that adds fresh depth to Disney's time-tested formula, Moana is truly a family-friendly adventure for the ages.

filmInfoContainer3: A year with one platoon in the deadliest valley in Afghanistan.
filmInfoContainer4: Forsaking narrative structure for pure visceral power, Restrepo plunges viewers into the experiences of soldiers on the front lines of the Afghan War.

filmInfoContainer3: The day-to-day lives of several suburban Los Angeles residents.
filmInfoContainer4: Robert Altman's ensemble drama deftly integrates its disparate characters and episodes into a funny, poignant, emotionally satisfying whole.

filmInfoContainer3: In the horror of 1944 Auschwitz, a prisoner forced to burn the corpses of his own people finds moral survival upon trying to salvage from the flames the body of a boy he takes for his son.
filmInfoContainer4: Grimly intense yet thoroughly rewarding, Son of Saul offers an unforgettable viewing experience -- and establishes director László Nemes as a talent to watch.

filmInfoContainer3: Determined to have a normal family life once his mother gets out of prison, a Scottish teenager from a tough background sets out to raise the money for a home.
filmInfoContainer4: A bleak, but heartbreaking coming-of-age tale that resonates with truth.

filmInfoContainer3: Teacher and novelist François Bégaudeau plays a version of himself as he negotiates a year with his racially mixed students from a tough Parisian neighborhood.
filmInfoContainer4: Energetic and bright, this hybrid of documentary style and dramatic plotting looks at the present and future of France through the interactions of a teacher and his students in an inner city high school.

filmInfoContainer3: Mr. Lãzãrescu, a dying old man, is shuttled from hospital to hospital by a loyal paramedic as doctors refuse to operate and no one can agree on a diagnosis.
filmInfoContainer4: Shot in naturalistic style, this is a powerful indictment of absurdity and indifference in the face of human suffering.

filmInfoContainer3: A retelling of Sir Ernest Shackleton 's ill-fated expedition to Antarctica in 1914-1916, featuring new footage of the actual locations and interviews with surviving relatives of key ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: The Endurance presents exciting footage of an amazing real-life story of survival.

filmInfoContainer3: A disillusioned college graduate finds himself torn between his older lover and her daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: The music, the performances, the precision in capturing the post-college malaise -- The Graduate's coming-of-age story is indeed one for the ages.

filmInfoContainer3: A mermaid princess makes a Faustian bargain with an unscrupulous sea-witch in order to meet a human prince on land.
filmInfoContainer4: The Little Mermaid ushered in a new golden era for Disney animation with warm and charming hand-drawn characters and catchy musical sequences.

filmInfoContainer3: While both participating in a production of "Death of a Salesman," a teacher's wife is assaulted in her new home, which leaves him determined to find the perpetrator over his wife's traumatized objections.
filmInfoContainer4: The Salesman takes an ambitiously complex look at thought-provoking themes, and the well-acted results prove another consistently absorbing entry in writer-director Asghar Farhadi's distinguished filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1980 New York, three young men who were all adopted meet each other and find out they're triplets who were separated at birth. Then they discover why.
filmInfoContainer4: Surreal and surprising, Three Identical Strangers effectively questions the nature of reality and identity.

filmInfoContainer3: An enterprising Saudi girl signs on for her school's Koran recitation competition as a way to raise the remaining funds she needs in order to buy the green bicycle that has captured her interest.
filmInfoContainer4: Transgressive in the best possible way, Wadjda presents a startlingly assured new voice from a corner of the globe where cinema has been all but silenced.

filmInfoContainer3: Documentary on the migratory patterns of birds, shot over the course of three years on all seven continents.
filmInfoContainer4: A marvel to watch.

filmInfoContainer: Enron: The Smartest Guys in the Room
filmInfoContainer3: A documentary about the Enron corporation, its faulty and corrupt business practices, and how they led to its fall.
filmInfoContainer4: A concise, entertaining documentary about the spectacular failure of Enron.

filmInfoContainer3: A collection of animated interpretations of great works of Western classical music.
filmInfoContainer4: A landmark in animation (and a huge influence on the medium of music video), Disney's Fantasia is a relentlessly inventive blend of the classics with phantasmagorical images.

filmInfoContainer3: A day at a group home for troubled adolescents. Denim is the head counselor, involved somehow with Natalia, another counselor. During the day, we watch them and other staff deal with a boy ...
filmInfoContainer4: Short Term 12 is an emphatic, revealing drama that pulls audiences into the perspective of neglected youths.

filmInfoContainer3: A rich but jealous man hires a private investigator to kill his cheating wife and her new man. But, when blood is involved, nothing is simple.
filmInfoContainer4: Brutally violent and shockingly funny in equal measure, Blood Simple offers early evidence of the Coen Brothers' twisted sensibilities and filmmaking ingenuity.

filmInfoContainer3: A Korean-born man finds himself stuck in Columbus, Indiana, where his architect father is in a coma. The man meets a young woman who wants to stay in Columbus with her mother, a recovering addict, instead of pursuing her own dreams.
filmInfoContainer4: Wonderfully acted and artfully composed, Columbus balances the clean lines of architecture against the messiness of love, with tenderly moving results.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Oscar Grant III, a 22-year-old Bay Area resident, who crosses paths with friends, enemies, family, and strangers on the last day of 2008.
filmInfoContainer4: Passionate and powerfully acted, Fruitvale Station serves as a celebration of life, a condemnation of death, and a triumph for star Michael B. Jordan.

filmInfoContainer: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
filmInfoContainer3: It's Harry's third year at Hogwarts; not only does he have a new "Defense Against the Dark Arts" teacher, but there is also trouble brewing. Convicted murderer Sirius Black has escaped the Wizards' Prison and is coming after Harry.
filmInfoContainer4: Under the assured direction of Alfonso Cuaron, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban triumphantly strikes a delicate balance between technical wizardry and complex storytelling.

filmInfoContainer3: Anna, a young novitiate nun in 1960s Poland, is on the verge of taking her vows when she discovers a dark family secret dating back to the years of the German occupation.
filmInfoContainer4: Empathetically written, splendidly acted, and beautifully photographed, Ida finds director Pawel Pawlikowski revisiting his roots to powerful effect.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Sci-Fi
filmInfoContainer3: Bob Parr (Mr. Incredible) is left to care for the kids while Helen (Elastigirl) is out saving the world.
filmInfoContainer4: Incredibles 2 reunites Pixar's family crimefighting team for a long-awaited follow-up that may not quite live up to the original, but comes close enough to earn its name.

filmInfoContainer3: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.
filmInfoContainer4: Powered by Robert Downey Jr.'s vibrant charm, Iron Man turbo-charges the superhero genre with a deft intelligence and infectious sense of fun.

filmInfoContainer3: When a good-natured factory supervisor living in Milan with his Northern wife returns to his native Sicily, a decades' old oath forces him to fulfill a nightmarish obligation.
filmInfoContainer4: Mafioso begins as an amusing farce and skillfully transforms into a portentous social drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A pregnant Colombian teenager becomes a drug mule to make some desperately needed money for her family.
filmInfoContainer4: In a striking debut, Moreno carries the movie and puts a human face on the drug trade.

filmInfoContainer3: The life and career of fashion designer Lee Alexander McQueen: from his start as a tailor, to launching and overseeing his eponymous line, and his untimely death.
filmInfoContainer4: McQueen offers an intimate, well-sourced, and overall moving look at a young life and brilliant career that were tragically cut short.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Harvey Milk, and his struggles as an American gay activist who fought for gay rights and became California's first openly gay elected official.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored by Sean Penn's powerhouse performance, Milk is a triumphant account of America's first openly gay man elected to public office.

filmInfoContainer3: A widowed single mother, raising her violent son alone, finds new hope when a mysterious neighbor inserts herself into their household.
filmInfoContainer4: As challenging as it is rewarding, Mommy finds writer-director Xavier Dolan taking another impressive step forward.

filmInfoContainer3: Oakland A's general manager Billy Beane's successful attempt to assemble a baseball team on a lean budget by employing computer-generated analysis to acquire new players.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Bennett Miller, along with Brad Pitt and Jonah Hill, take a niche subject and turn it into a sharp, funny, and touching portrait worthy of baseball lore.

filmInfoContainer3: After a car wreck on the winding Mulholland Drive renders a woman amnesiac, she and a perky Hollywood-hopeful search for clues and answers across Los Angeles in a twisting venture beyond dreams and reality.
filmInfoContainer4: David Lynch's dreamlike and mysterious Mulholland Drive is a twisty neo-noir with an unconventional structure that features a mesmirizing performance from Naomi Watts as a woman on the dark fringes of Hollywood.

filmInfoContainer3: The lives of three men who were childhood friends are shattered when one of them has a family tragedy.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored by the exceptional acting of its strong cast, Mystic River is a somber drama that unfolds in layers and conveys the tragedy of its story with visceral power.

filmInfoContainer3: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in five days.
filmInfoContainer4: Violent and definitely not for the squeamish, Park Chan-Wook's visceral Oldboy is a strange, powerful tale of revenge.

filmInfoContainer3: Two men reaching middle age with not much to show but disappointment embark on a week-long road trip through California's wine country, just as one is about to take a trip down the aisle.
filmInfoContainer4: Charming, thoughtful, and often funny, Sideways is a decidedly mature road trip comedy full of excellent performances.

filmInfoContainer3: Daniel Johnston, manic-depressive genius singer/songwriter/artist is revealed in this portrait of madness, creativity and love.
filmInfoContainer4: Whether you think this mentally ill cult musician is worthy of being called a "genius," this document of his life is crafted with sincere respect and is fascinating to watch.

filmInfoContainer3: A Turkish man travels to Istanbul to find the daughter of his father's former girlfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: Evocative and complex, this story of struggling immigrants in Germany will stay with you after you leave the theater.

filmInfoContainer3: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars after his team assume him dead, and must rely on his ingenuity to find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, thrilling, and surprisingly funny, The Martian offers a faithful adaptation of the bestselling book that brings out the best in leading man Matt Damon and director Ridley Scott.

filmInfoContainer3: After her death, a mother returns to her home town in order to fix the situations she couldn't resolve during her life.
filmInfoContainer4: Volver catches director Pedro Almodovar and star Penelope Cruz at the peak of their respective powers, in service of a layered, thought-provoking film.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Crime, Family, Fantasy, Mystery
filmInfoContainer3: A toon-hating detective is a cartoon rabbit's only hope to prove his innocence when he is accused of murder.
filmInfoContainer4: Who Framed Roger Rabbit is an innovative and entertaining film that features a groundbreaking mix of live action and animation, with a touching and original story to boot.

filmInfoContainer: In the Name of the Father
filmInfoContainer3: This is about a father and his daughter who has been injured from the mines from Iran-Iraq war.

A film about an unfinished film which portrays the people behind and before the camera in the Warsaw Ghetto, exposing the extent of the cinematic manipulation forever changing the way we look at historic images.
filmInfoContainer4: A heartbreaking, haunting historical document, A Film Unfinished excavates particularly horrible chapter of Holocaust history, and in doing so, the film provides a glimpse into the Nazi propaganda machine.

filmInfoContainer3: A lovelorn screenwriter becomes desperate as he tries and fails to adapt 'The Orchid Thief' by Susan Orlean for the screen.
filmInfoContainer4: Dizzyingly original, the loopy, multi-layered Adaptation is both funny and thought-provoking.

filmInfoContainer3: Adèle's life is changed when she meets Emma, a young woman with blue hair, who will allow her to discover desire and to assert herself as a woman and as an adult. In front of others, Adèle grows, seeks herself, loses herself, and ultimately finds herself through love and loss.
filmInfoContainer4: Raw, honest, powerfully acted, and deliciously intense, Blue Is the Warmest Color offers some of modern cinema's most elegantly composed, emotionally absorbing drama.

filmInfoContainer3: The adventures of high school and junior high students on the last day of school in May 1976.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring an excellent ensemble cast, a precise feel for the 1970s, and a killer soundtrack, Dazed and Confused is a funny, affectionate, and clear-eyed look at high school life.

filmInfoContainer3: English teacher John Keating inspires his students to look at poetry with a different perspective of authentic knowledge and feelings.
filmInfoContainer4: Affecting performances from the young cast and a genuinely inspirational turn from Robin Williams grant Peter Weir's prep school drama top honors.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary about the disastrous 1968 round-the-world yacht race.
filmInfoContainer4: Equal parts mystery and biography, Deep Water is both an engrossing documentary and an affecting treatise on human folly and obsession.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Drama, Fantasy, Sci-Fi
filmInfoContainer3: Set in Japan, Isle of Dogs follows a boy's odyssey in search of his lost dog.
filmInfoContainer4: The beautifully stop-motion animated Isle of Dogs finds Wes Anderson at his detail-oriented best while telling one of the director's most winsomely charming stories.

filmInfoContainer3: Two men return home from World War II to work on a farm in rural Mississippi, where they struggle to deal with racism and adjusting to life after war.
filmInfoContainer4: Mudbound offers a well-acted, finely detailed snapshot of American history whose scenes of rural class struggle resonate far beyond their period setting.

filmInfoContainer3: U.K. gay activists work to help miners during their lengthy strike of the National Union of Mineworkers in the summer of 1984.
filmInfoContainer4: Earnest without being didactic and uplifting without stooping to sentimentality, Pride is a joyous crowd-pleaser that genuinely works.

filmInfoContainer3: Ex-con Alex plans to flee to the South with his girl after a robbery. But something terrible happens and revenge seems inevitable.
filmInfoContainer4: With Revanche, Götz Spielmann has crafted a debut as surprising as it is suspenseful.

filmInfoContainer3: A film that excavates layers of myth and memory to find the elusive truth at the core of a family of storytellers.
filmInfoContainer4: In Stories We Tell, Sarah Polley plays with the documentary format to explore the nature of memory and storytelling, crafting a thoughtful, compelling narrative that unfolds like a mystery.

filmInfoContainer3: When his only friend dies, a man born with dwarfism moves to rural New Jersey to live a life of solitude, only to meet a chatty hot dog vendor and a woman dealing with her own personal loss.
filmInfoContainer4: A sweet and quirky film about a dwarf, a refreshment stand operator, and a reclusive artist connecting with one another.

filmInfoContainer3: After a drunken house party with his straight mates, Russell heads out to a gay club. Just before closing time he picks up Glen but what's expected to be just a one-night stand becomes something else, something special.
filmInfoContainer4: It may be a chamber piece but Weekend's revelations on modern sexuality expand far beyond the modest setting.

filmInfoContainer3: Ron Stallworth, an African American police officer from Colorado Springs, CO, successfully manages to infiltrate the local Ku Klux Klan branch with the help of a Jewish surrogate who eventually becomes its leader. Based on actual events.
filmInfoContainer4: BlacKkKlansman uses history to offer bitingly trenchant commentary on current events -- and brings out some of Spike Lee's hardest-hitting work in decades along the way.

filmInfoContainer3: Bonnie Parker, a bored waitress falls in love with an ex-con named Clyde Barrow and together they start a violent crime spree through the country, stealing cars and robbing banks.
filmInfoContainer4: A paradigm-shifting classic of American cinema, Bonnie and Clyde packs a punch whose power continues to reverberate through thrillers decades later.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that follows the efforts of "Raqqa Is Being Slaughtered Silently," a handful of anonymous activists who banded together after their homeland was taken over by ISIS in 2014. ...
filmInfoContainer4: City of Ghosts takes a hard-hitting, ground-level look at atrocities in a part of the world that may seem foreign to many viewers, but whose impact will be no less devastating.

filmInfoContainer3: A troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes, after he narrowly escapes a bizarre accident.
filmInfoContainer4: Richard Kelly's debut feature Donnie Darko is a daring, original vision, packed with jarring ideas and intelligence and featuring a remarkable performance from Jake Gyllenhaal as the troubled title character.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a team of female African-American mathematicians who served a vital role in NASA during the early years of the U.S. space program.
filmInfoContainer4: In heartwarming, crowd-pleasing fashion, Hidden Figures celebrates overlooked -- and crucial -- contributions from a pivotal moment in American history.

filmInfoContainer3: An ambitious coal miner is talked into becoming a boxer by his gambler brother.
filmInfoContainer4: Powered by Robert Downey Jr.'s vibrant charm, Iron Man turbo-charges the superhero genre with a deft intelligence and infectious sense of fun.

filmInfoContainer3: The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.
filmInfoContainer4: Kill Bill: Volume 2 adds extra plot and dialogue to the action-heavy exploits of its predecessor, while still managing to deliver a suitably hard-hitting sequel.

filmInfoContainer3: During the chaotic final weeks of the Vietnam War, the North Vietnamese Army closes in on Saigon as the panicked South Vietnamese people desperately attempt to escape. On the ground, ...
filmInfoContainer4: As gripping as it is inspiring, Last Days in Vietnam offers a surprisingly fresh -- and heart-wrenching -- perspective on the end of the Vietnam War.

filmInfoContainer3: Sixteen-year-old Lilja and her only friend, the young boy Volodja, live in Estonia, fantasizing about a better life. One day, Lilja falls in love with Andrej, who is going to Sweden, and invites Lilja to come along and start a new life.
filmInfoContainer4: A tragic, hard-hitting story about a teenager trapped in a life of prostitution.

filmInfoContainer3: A naive hustler travels from Texas to New York City to seek personal fortune, finding a new friend in the process.
filmInfoContainer4: John Schlesinger's gritty, unrelentingly bleak look at the seedy underbelly of urban American life is undeniably disturbing, but Dustin Hoffman and Jon Voight's performances make it difficult to turn away.

filmInfoContainer3: When Louis Bloom, a con man desperate for work, muscles into the world of L.A. crime journalism, he blurs the line between observer and participant to become the star of his own story.
filmInfoContainer4: Restless, visually sleek, and powered by a lithe star performance from Jake Gyllenhaal, Nightcrawler offers dark, thought-provoking thrills.

filmInfoContainer3: After his swamp is filled with magical creatures, Shrek agrees to rescue Princess Fiona for a villainous lord in order to get his land back.
filmInfoContainer4: While simultaneously embracing and subverting fairy tales, the irreverent Shrek also manages to tweak Disney's nose, provide a moral message to children, and offer viewers a funny, fast-paced ride.

filmInfoContainer3: The one joy in the lives of a mother and daughter comes from the regular letters sent to them from Paris from the family's adored son, Otar. When the daughter finds out that Otar has died ...
filmInfoContainer4: A drama that's both funny and moving.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that exposes the genocide raging in Darfur, Sudan as seen through the eyes of a former U.S. marine who returns home to make the story public.
filmInfoContainer4: The Devil Came on Horseback is both a strong primer on the complexities of the situation in Darfur and a harrowing first-person doc.

filmInfoContainer3: When a teenage girl is possessed by a mysterious entity, her mother seeks the help of two priests to save her daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: The Exorcist rides its supernatural theme to magical effect, with remarkable special effects and an eerie atmosphere, resulting in one of the scariest films of all time.

filmInfoContainer3: Three young Irish women struggle to maintain their spirits while they endure dehumanizing abuse as inmates of a Magdalene Sisters Asylum.
filmInfoContainer4: A typical women-in-prision film made untypical because it's based on real events.

filmInfoContainer3: A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to the Wachowskis' imaginative vision, The Matrix is a smartly crafted combination of spectacular action and groundbreaking special effects.

filmInfoContainer3: A mute woman is sent to 1850s New Zealand along with her young daughter and prized piano for an arranged marriage to a wealthy landowner, but is soon lusted after by a local worker on the plantation.
filmInfoContainer4: Powered by Holly Hunter's main performance, The Piano is a truth-seeking romance played in the key of erotic passion.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of disgraced New York Congressman Anthony Weiner's mayoral campaign and today's political landscape.
filmInfoContainer4: Weiner uses sharp insight and untrammeled access to offer a portrait of a political and personal collapse that's as queasy as it is undeniably compelling.

filmInfoContainer3: Two youngsters from rival New York City gangs fall in love, but tensions between their respective friends build toward tragedy.
filmInfoContainer4: Buoyed by Robert Wise's dazzling direction, Leonard Bernstein's score, and Stephen Sondheim's lyrics, West Side Story remains perhaps the most iconic of all the Shakespeare adaptations to visit the big screen.

filmInfoContainer3: Director Michael Apted revisits the same group of British-born adults after a 7 year wait. The subjects are interviewed as to the changes that have occurred in their lives during the last seven years.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Michael Apted continues to utilize cinema as a window into the lives of everyday people, and in the reflection of this documentary we can glimpse our own aging humanity.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that chronicles artist and activist Ai Weiwei as he prepares for a series of exhibitions and gets into an increasing number of clashes with the Chinese government.
A little boy goes on an adventurous quest in search of his father.
filmInfoContainer4: Boy and the World's distinctive animation is visually thrilling -- and it's backed up with a daring, refreshingly different storyline that should enthrall younger viewers while resonating deeply with adults.

filmInfoContainer3: An aspiring photographer develops an intimate relationship with an older woman in 1950s New York.
filmInfoContainer4: Shaped by Todd Haynes' deft direction and powered by a strong cast led by Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara, Carol lives up to its groundbreaking source material.

filmInfoContainer3: Henry Spencer tries to survive his industrial environment, his angry girlfriend, and the unbearable screams of his newly born mutant child.
filmInfoContainer4: David Lynch's surreal Eraserhead uses detailed visuals and a creepy score to create a bizarre and disturbing look into a man's fear of parenthood.

filmInfoContainer3: The lone survivor of an onslaught of flesh-possessing spirits holes up in a cabin with a group of strangers while the demons continue their attack.
filmInfoContainer4: Evil Dead 2's increased special effects and slapstick-gore makes it as good -- if not better -- than the original.

filmInfoContainer3: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soapmaker form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.
filmInfoContainer4: Solid acting, amazing direction, and elaborate production design make Fight Club a wild ride.

filmInfoContainer3: American nuclear weapons testing results in the creation of a seemingly unstoppable, dinosaur-like beast.
filmInfoContainer4: More than straight monster-movie fare, Gojira offers potent, sobering postwar commentary.

filmInfoContainer3: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.
filmInfoContainer4: Dark, intelligent, and stylish to a fault, Gone Girl plays to director David Fincher's sick strengths while bringing the best out of stars Ben Affleck and Rosamund Pike.

filmInfoContainer3: A weatherman finds himself inexplicably living the same day over and over again.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, sweet, and inventive, Groundhog Day highlights Murray's dramatic gifts while still leaving plenty of room for laughs.

filmInfoContainer3: A week in the life of a young singer as he navigates the Greenwich Village folk scene of 1961.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, funny, and profoundly melancholy, Inside Llewyn Davis finds the Coen brothers in fine form.

filmInfoContainer: Jonestown: The Life and Death of Peoples Temple
filmInfoContainer3: Featuring never-before-seen footage, this documentary delivers a startling new look at the Peoples Temple, headed by preacher Jim Jones who, in 1978, led more than 900 members to Guyana, where he orchestrated a mass suicide via tainted punch.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Stanley Nelson avoids editorializing and sensationalizing in Jonestown, letting the CIA photos and film speak for themselves, and giving a voice to the surviving victims.

filmInfoContainer3: During a preview tour, a theme park suffers a major power breakdown that allows its cloned dinosaur exhibits to run amok.
filmInfoContainer4: Jurassic Park is a spectacle of special effects and life-like animatronics, with some of Spielberg's best sequences of sustained awe and sheer terror since Jaws.

filmInfoContainer3: At a Montréal public grade school, an Algerian immigrant is hired to replace a popular teacher who committed suicide in her classroom. While helping his students deal with their grief, his own recent loss is revealed.
filmInfoContainer4: Monsieur Lahzar is a tender and thoughtful portrait of a man with hidden grief and also a compelling exploration of the teacher-student dynamic.

filmInfoContainer3: An aging, booze-addled father makes the trip from Montana to Nebraska with his estranged son in order to claim a million-dollar Mega Sweepstakes Marketing prize.
filmInfoContainer4: Elegant in its simplicity and poetic in its message, Nebraska adds another stirringly resonant chapter to Alexander Payne's remarkable filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: A disfigured Holocaust survivor sets out to determine if the man she loved betrayed her trust.
filmInfoContainer4: Tense, complex, and drenched in atmosphere, Phoenix is a well-acted, smartly crafted war drama that finds writer-director Christian Petzold working at peak power.

filmInfoContainer3: Eric Love is a 19 year old teenager who is so violent he has been 'Starred Up' (Moved to Adult prison) where he finds his father Neville who Eric hasn't seen since he was 5 (since he was ...
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, hard-hitting, and queasily realistic, Starred Up is an instant classic of U.K. prison cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: Jafar Panahi is banned from making movies by the Iranian government, he poses as a taxi driver and makes a movie about social challenges in Iran.
filmInfoContainer4: Jafar Panahi's Taxi offers another round of trenchant societal commentary from a director whose entire filmography stands as a daring act of dissent.

filmInfoContainer3: A band comprised of members of the Egyptian police force head to Israel to play at the inaugural ceremony of an Arab arts center, only to find themselves lost in the wrong town.
filmInfoContainer4: The Band's Visit is both a clever, subtle slice-of-life comedy, and poignant cross-cultural exploration.

filmInfoContainer3: In 2001, Afghanistan is under the control of the Taliban. When her father is captured, a determined young girl disguises herself as a boy in order to provide for her family.
filmInfoContainer4: The Breadwinner's stunning visuals are matched by a story that dares to confront sobering real-life issues with uncommon -- and richly rewarding -- honesty.

filmInfoContainer3: Jep Gambardella has seduced his way through the lavish nightlife of Rome for decades, but after his 65th birthday and a shock from the past, Jep looks past the nightclubs and parties to find a timeless landscape of absurd, exquisite beauty.
filmInfoContainer4: Dazzlingly ambitious, beautifully filmed, and thoroughly enthralling, The Great Beauty offers virtuoso filmmaking from writer/director Paolo Sorrentino.

filmInfoContainer3: An Iranian man deserts his French wife and her two children to return to his homeland. Meanwhile, his wife starts up a new relationship, a reality her husband confronts upon his wife's request for a divorce.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully written, sensitively directed, and powerfully acted, The Past serves as another compelling testament to Asghar Farhadi's gift for finely layered drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A joinery instructor at a rehab center refuses to take a new teen as his apprentice, but then begins to follow the boy through the hallways and streets.
filmInfoContainer4: Austere, finely crafted, and compelling.

filmInfoContainer: What We Do in the Shadows
filmInfoContainer3: Viago, Deacon and Vladislav are vampires who are finding that modern life has them struggling with the mundane - like paying rent, keeping up with the chore wheel, trying to get into nightclubs and overcoming flatmate conflicts.
filmInfoContainer4: Smarter, fresher, and funnier than a modern vampire movie has any right to be, What We Do in the Shadows is bloody good fun.

filmInfoContainer3: Rusalochka opens in modern day Copenhagen, Denmark. Several tourists gather around the capital's famous mermaid statue, as a tour guide explains its significance. A fish in the water below ...
filmInfoContainer4: The Little Mermaid ushered in a new golden era for Disney animation with warm and charming hand-drawn characters and catchy musical sequences.

filmInfoContainer3: A transient young man breaks into empty homes to partake of the vacationing residents' lives for a few days.
filmInfoContainer4: A tender and moving romance from Spring, Summer, Fall, Winter... And Spring's director Kim Ki-Duk.

filmInfoContainer3: A man coping with the institutionalization of his wife because of Alzheimer's disease faces an epiphany when she transfers her affections to another man, Aubrey, a wheelchair-bound mute who also is a patient at the nursing home.
filmInfoContainer4: An accomplished directorial debut by Sarah Polley, Away From Her is a touching exploration of the effects of Alzheimer's, in which the tender wisdom of Polley's script is beautifully complemented by a wonderful performance from Julie Christie.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a forbidden and secretive relationship between two cowboys, and their lives over the years.
filmInfoContainer4: A beautiful, epic Western, Brokeback Mountain's love story is imbued with heartbreaking universality thanks to moving performances by Heath Ledger and Jake Gyllenhaal.

filmInfoContainer3: A cinematic portrait of the homeless population who live permanently in the underground tunnels of New York City.
filmInfoContainer4: Marc Singer's documentary about a group of homeless people living beneath the streets of New York City is haunting and uplifting in equal measure.

filmInfoContainer3: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a breath-taking humanoid A.I.
filmInfoContainer4: Ex Machina leans heavier on ideas than effects, but it's still a visually polished piece of work -- and an uncommonly engaging sci-fi feature.

filmInfoContainer3: A troubled family must face the facts when something goes terribly wrong at their son's desolate military post.
filmInfoContainer4: Foxtrot uses topical themes to deliver a bruising sociopolitical statement that's equally effective taken simply as an absorbing, well-acted drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A businessman thwarts his wife's bequest of an estate to another woman.
filmInfoContainer4: A superbly-mounted adaptation of E.M. Forster's tale of British class tension, with exceptional performances all round, Howard's End ranks among the best of Merchant-Ivory's work.

filmInfoContainer3: After having suffered a heart-attack, a 59-year-old carpenter must fight the bureaucratic forces of the system in order to receive Employment and Support Allowance.
filmInfoContainer4: I, Daniel Blake marks yet another well-told chapter in director Ken Loach's powerfully populist filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: A profile of an ancient city and its unique people, seen through the eyes of the most mysterious and beloved animal humans have ever known, the Cat.
filmInfoContainer4: Kedi is a cat fancier's dream, but this thoughtful, beautifully filmed look at Istanbul's street feline population offers absorbing viewing for filmgoers of any purr-suasion.

filmInfoContainer3: Sparks fly when spirited Elizabeth Bennet meets single, rich, and proud Mr. Darcy. But Mr. Darcy reluctantly finds himself falling in love with a woman beneath his class. Can each overcome their own pride and prejudice?
filmInfoContainer4: Sure, it's another adaptation of cinema's fave Jane Austen novel, but key performances and a modern filmmaking sensibility make this familiar period piece fresh and enjoyable.

filmInfoContainer3: An idealistic FBI agent is enlisted by a government task force to aid in the escalating war against drugs at the border area between the U.S. and Mexico.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by outstanding work from Emily Blunt and Benicio del Toro, Sicario is a taut, tightly wound thriller with much more on its mind than attention-getting set pieces.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary featuring interviews with all surviving former heads of Shin Bet, the Israeli security agency whose activities and membership are closely held state secrets.
filmInfoContainer4: Strikingly stark, brutally honest, and rivetingly assembled, The Gatekeepers offers essential perspective on a seemingly intractable war from some of the men who fought it.

filmInfoContainer3: A redemptive tale of an aspiring rap artist surviving failed levees and her own troubled past and seizing a chance for a new beginning.
filmInfoContainer4: This incredible documentary displays the tragedy and mismanagement of Katrina along with the heroism of strangers and survivors.

filmInfoContainer3: A real-time account of the events on United Flight 93, one of the planes hijacked on September 11th, 2001 that crashed near Shanksville, Pennsylvania when passengers foiled the terrorist plot.
filmInfoContainer4: Potent and sobering, United 93 treats the subject matter with respect, never resorting to Hollywood aggrandizement.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of the decade-long hunt for al-Qaeda terrorist leader Osama bin Laden after the September 2001 attacks, and his death at the hands of the Navy S.E.A.L.s Team 6 in May 2011.
filmInfoContainer4: Gripping, suspenseful, and brilliantly crafted, Zero Dark Thirty dramatizes the hunt for Osama bin Laden with intelligence and an eye for detail.

filmInfoContainer3: Count Dracula moves from Transylvania to Wismar, spreading the Black Plague across the land. Only a woman pure of heart can bring an end to his reign of horror.
filmInfoContainer4: Stunning visuals from Werner Herzog and an intense portrayal of the famed bloodsucker from Klaus Kinski make this remake of Nosferatu a horror classic in its own right.

filmInfoContainer3: In a post-apocalyptic world, a family is forced to live in silence while hiding from monsters with ultra-sensitive hearing.
filmInfoContainer4: A Quiet Place artfully plays on elemental fears with a ruthlessly intelligent creature feature that's as original as it is scary -- and establishes director John Krasinski as a rising talent.

filmInfoContainer: Birdman: Or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
filmInfoContainer3: A washed-up superhero actor attempts to revive his fading career by writing, directing, and starring in a Broadway production.
filmInfoContainer4: A thrilling leap forward for director Alejandro González Iñárritu, Birdman is an ambitious technical showcase powered by a layered story and outstanding performances from Michael Keaton and Edward Norton.

filmInfoContainer3: A young blade runner's discovery of a long-buried secret leads him to track down former blade runner Rick Deckard, who's been missing for thirty years.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually stunning and narratively satisfying, Blade Runner 2049 deepens and expands its predecessor's story while standing as an impressive filmmaking achievement in its own right.

filmInfoContainer3: An authorized documentary on the late musician Kurt Cobain, from his early days in Aberdeen, Washington to his success and downfall with the grunge band Nirvana.
filmInfoContainer4: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck makes a persuasive case for its subject without resorting to hagiography -- and includes plenty of rare and unreleased footage for fans.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on perception of the United States's war with Iraq, with an emphasis on Al Jazeera's coverage.
filmInfoContainer4: A fascinating, enlightening behind-the-scenes look at the Al Jazeera network.

filmInfoContainer: Encounters at the End of the World
filmInfoContainer3: Film-maker Werner Herzog travels to the McMurdo Station in Antarctica, looking to capture the continent's beauty and investigate the characters living there.
filmInfoContainer4: Encounters at the End of the World offers a poignant study of the human psyche amid haunting landscapes.

filmInfoContainer3: James Bond willingly falls into an assassination ploy involving a naive Russian beauty in order to retrieve a Soviet encryption device that was stolen by SPECTRE.
filmInfoContainer4: The second James Bond film, From Russia with Love is a razor-sharp, briskly-paced Cold War thriller that features several electrifying action scenes.

filmInfoContainer3: With only the plan of moving in together after high school, two unusually devious friends seek direction in life. As a mere gag, they respond to a man's newspaper ad for a date, only to find it will greatly complicate their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: With acerbic wit, Terry Zwigoff fashions Daniel Clowes' graphic novel into an intelligent, comedic trip through deadpan teen angst.

filmInfoContainer3: Three former parapsychology professors set up shop as a unique ghost removal service.
filmInfoContainer4: An infectiously fun blend of special effects and comedy, with Bill Murray's hilarious deadpan performance leading a cast of great comic turns.

filmInfoContainer3: Two men form an unlikely friendship that will change both of their lives forever.
filmInfoContainer4: An original and thoughtful human drama, Goodbye Solo looks at relationships and loneliness while proving director Ramin Bahrani's is an important American voice.

filmInfoContainer3: An epic mosaic of interrelated characters in search of love, forgiveness, and meaning in the San Fernando Valley.
filmInfoContainer4: Critics say Magnolia is an ambitious, lengthy work that ultimately succeeds due to the interesting stories and excellent ensemble performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A TV interviewer and his cameraman meet a former actress and travel through her memories and career.
filmInfoContainer4: The story of an aging movie actress' complicated personal saga unfolds in this sophisticated anime film that deftly blurs memory and make-believe into a meditation on the nature of cinema itself.

filmInfoContainer3: A tribute to the late German choreographer, Pina Bausch, as her dancers perform her most famous creations.
