filmInfoContainer3: A frontiersman on a fur trading expedition in the 1820s fights for survival after being mauled by a bear and left for dead by members of his own hunting team.
filmInfoContainer4: As starkly beautiful as it is harshly uncompromising, The Revenant uses Leonardo DiCaprio's committed performance as fuel for an absorbing drama that offers punishing challenges -- and rich rewards.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, self-referential, and irreverent to a fault, The Wolf of Wall Street finds Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio at their most infectiously dynamic.

filmInfoContainer3: When technical illustrator Tony Takitani asks his wife to resist her all-consuming obsession for designer clothes, the consequences are tragic.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite its deceptive wispiness, this delicately lovely and melancholy film about loneliness has a haunting power.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Spanish woman who has recently moved to Berlin finds her flirtation with a local guy turn potentially deadly as their night out with his friends reveals a dangerous secret.
filmInfoContainer4: Victoria's single-take production is undeniably impressive, but it's also an effective drama in its own right -- and one that juggles its tonal shifts as deftly as its technical complexities.

filmInfoContainer3: A struggling lawyer and volunteer wrestling coach's chicanery comes back to haunt him when the teenage grandson of the client he has double-crossed comes into his life.
filmInfoContainer4: Rich, wonderful characters and strong performances populate Win Win, with writer/director Thomas McCarthy continuing to emerge as a great American humanist.

filmInfoContainer3: An offbeat romantic comedy about a woman who doesn't believe true love exists, and the young man who falls for her.
filmInfoContainer4: A clever, offbeat romantic comedy, 500 Days of Summer is refreshingly honest and utterly charming.

filmInfoContainer3: Four weeks after a mysterious, incurable virus spreads throughout the UK, a handful of survivors try to find sanctuary.
filmInfoContainer4: Kinetically directed by Danny Boyle, 28 Days Later is both a terrifying zombie movie and a sharp political allegory.

filmInfoContainer3: A young queen, who is married to an insane king, falls secretly in love with her physician - and together they start a revolution that changes a nation forever.
filmInfoContainer4: A Royal Affair is a lavish and sumptuous costume drama with a juicy story to back it up.

filmInfoContainer3: A con man, Irving Rosenfeld, along with his seductive partner Sydney Prosser, is forced to work for a wild F.B.I. Agent, Richie DiMaso, who pushes them into a world of Jersey powerbrokers and the Mafia.
filmInfoContainer4: Riotously funny and impeccably cast, American Hustle compensates for its flaws with unbridled energy and some of David O. Russell's most irrepressibly vibrant direction.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at four seasons in the lives of a happily married couple and their relationships with their family and friends.
filmInfoContainer4: Characterized by strong performances and the director's trademark feel for the nuances of everyday life, Another Year marks another solid entry in Mike Leigh's career of kitchen-sink English drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Faced with both her hot-tempered father's fading health and melting ice-caps that flood her ramshackle bayou community and unleash ancient aurochs, six-year-old Hushpuppy must learn the ways of courage and love.
filmInfoContainer4: Beasts of the Southern Wild is a fantastical, emotionally powerful journey and a strong case of filmmaking that values imagination over money.

filmInfoContainer3: The relationship of a contemporary married couple, charting their evolution over a span of years by cross-cutting between time periods.
filmInfoContainer4: This emotionally gripping examination of a marriage on the rocks isn't always easy to watch, but Michelle Williams and Ryan Gosling give performances of unusual depth and power.

filmInfoContainer3: Charlie is an average French suburban teenager, but when she becomes fast friends with Sarah, the rebellious new girl at school, she discovers there's nothing average about how she feels.
filmInfoContainer4: Breathe finds writer-director Mélanie Laurent opening a sensitive, well-acted window into the bittersweet upheaval of adolescence.

filmInfoContainer3: In the forests of the Pacific Northwest, a father devoted to raising his six kids with a rigorous physical and intellectual education is forced to leave his paradise and enter the world, challenging his idea of what it means to be a parent.
filmInfoContainer4: Captain Fantastic's thought-provoking themes -- and an absorbing starring turn from Viggo Mortensen -- add up to an above-average family drama with unexpected twists.

filmInfoContainer3: Lieutenant John Dunbar, assigned to a remote western Civil War outpost, befriends wolves and Indians, making him an intolerable aberration in the military.
filmInfoContainer4: A grand, sweeping epic with inarguably noble intentions and arresting cinematography, but one whose center, arguably, is not as weighty as it should be.

filmInfoContainer3: In Nazi occupied Czechoslovakia, a childless couple agree to hide a Jewish friend at great personal risk of discovery and execution.
filmInfoContainer4: Divided We Fall takes a complex look at World War II, skillfully balancing humor and gravity.

filmInfoContainer3: Feature-length version of the documentary TV series Planet Earth (2006), following the migration paths of four animal families.
filmInfoContainer4: With its spectacular and extensive footage, Earth is both informative and entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: Col. Katherine Powell, a military officer in command of an operation to capture terrorists in Kenya, sees her mission escalate when a girl enters the kill zone triggering an international dispute over the implications of modern warfare.
filmInfoContainer4: As taut as it is timely, Eye in the Sky offers a powerfully acted -- and unusually cerebral -- spin on the modern wartime political thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: A family vacationing in the French Alps is confronted with a devastating avalanche.
filmInfoContainer4: Gleefully uncomfortable, Force Majeure is a relationship drama that's hard to watch -- and just as difficult to ignore.

filmInfoContainer3: Quentin Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez's homage to exploitation double features in the 60s and 70s with two back-to-back cult films that include previews of coming attractions between them.
filmInfoContainer4: Grindhouse delivers exhilarating exploitation fare with wit and panache, improving upon its source material with feral intelligence.

filmInfoContainer3: Filmmakers discuss how Francois Truffaut's 1966 book "Cinema According to Hitchcock" influenced their work.
filmInfoContainer4: Essential viewing for cineastes while still offering rich rewards for neophytes, Hitchcock/Truffaut offers an affectionate -- and well-crafted -- tribute to a legend.

filmInfoContainer: I Am Big Bird: The Caroll Spinney Story
filmInfoContainer3: Caroll Spinney has been Sesame Street's Big Bird and Oscar the Grouch since 1969; at 78-years-old, he has no intention of stopping.
filmInfoContainer4: Every bit as good-natured as longtime fans might hope, I Am Big Bird: The Carroll Spinney Story offers heartwarming behind-the-scenes perspective on a cultural icon.

filmInfoContainer3: A police detective, a bank robber, and a high-power broker enter high-stakes negotiations after the criminal's brilliant heist spirals into a hostage situation.
filmInfoContainer4: Spike Lee's energetic and clever bank-heist thriller is a smart genre film that is not only rewarding on its own terms, but manages to subvert its pulpy trappings with wit and skill.

filmInfoContainer3: Zaza is a 31-year old Israeli bachelor, handsome and intelligent, and his family wants to see him married. But tradition dictates that Zaza has to choose a young virgin. She must be ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: An observant black comedy about arranged marriages and tradition.

filmInfoContainer3: An old shepherd lives his last days in a quiet medieval village perched high on the hills of Calabria, at the southernmost tip of Italy. He herds goats under skies that most villagers have ...
filmInfoContainer4: Birth, death, and transformation are examined in Le Quattro Volte, a profound and often funny mediation on the cycles of life on earth.

filmInfoContainer: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
filmInfoContainer3: High schooler Greg, who spends most of his time making parodies of classic movies with his co-worker Earl, finds his outlook forever altered after befriending a classmate who has just been diagnosed with cancer.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully scripted and perfectly cast, Me & Earl & the Dying Girl is a coming-of-age movie with uncommon charm and insight.

filmInfoContainer3: Tom Berninger chronicles his time spent on the road as a member of the tour crew for The National, the rock & roll band fronted by his brother, Matt.
filmInfoContainer4: A suitably complicated look at fraternal bonds, Mistaken for Strangers offers more depth and insight than the usual tour documentary.

filmInfoContainer3: When a headstrong chef takes charge of her equally stubborn 8-year-old niece, the tensions between them mount... until an Italian sous-chef arrives to lighten the mood.
filmInfoContainer4: Mostly Martha may have a predictable plot, but it still feels charming and fresh, and the food will make you hungry.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Palestinian freedom fighter agrees to work as an informant after he's tricked into an admission of guilt by association in the wake of an Israeli soldier's killing.
filmInfoContainer4: Twisty and riveting, Omar is a well-directed crime drama with uncommon depth.

filmInfoContainer3: Two childhood friends are recruited for a suicide bombing in Tel Aviv.
filmInfoContainer4: This film delves deeply into the minds of suicide bombers, and the result is unsettling.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Shakespeare, out of ideas and short of cash, meets his ideal woman and is inspired to write one of his most famous plays.
filmInfoContainer4: Endlessly witty, visually rapturous, and sweetly romantic, Shakespeare in Love is a delightful romantic comedy that succeeds on nearly every level.

filmInfoContainer: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi
filmInfoContainer3: After a daring mission to rescue Han Solo from Jabba the Hutt, the rebels dispatch to Endor to destroy a more powerful Death Star. Meanwhile, Luke struggles to help Darth Vader back from the dark side without falling into the Emperor's trap.
filmInfoContainer4: Though failing to reach the cinematic heights of its predecessors, Return of the Jedi remains an entertaining sci-fi adventure and a fitting end to the classic trilogy.

filmInfoContainer3: Two brothers and a sister witness the disappearance of their childhood memories when they must relinquish the family belongings to ensure their deceased mother's succession.
filmInfoContainer4: Olivier Assayas' contemplative family drama handles lofty ideas about art and culture with elegance and lightness.

filmInfoContainer3: A tale of nineteenth-century New York high society in which a young lawyer falls in love with a woman separated from her husband, while he is engaged to the woman's cousin.
A widowed mother, plagued by the violent death of her husband, battles with her son's fear of a monster lurking in the house, but soon discovers a sinister presence all around her.
filmInfoContainer4: The Babadook relies on real horror rather than cheap jump scares -- and boasts a heartfelt, genuinely moving story to boot.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of how the novel "Mrs. Dalloway" affects three generations of women, all of whom, in one way or another, have had to deal with suicide in their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: The movie may be a downer, but it packs an emotional wallop. Some fine acting on display here.

filmInfoContainer3: The Little Prince questions the universe in this story of innocence and wonder.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully animated and faithful to the spirit of its classic source material, The Little Prince is a family-friendly treat that anchors thrilling visuals with a satisfying story.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman brings her family back to her childhood home, which used to be an orphanage for handicapped children. Before long, her son starts to communicate with an invisible new friend.
filmInfoContainer4: Deeply unnerving and surprisingly poignant, The Orphanage is an atmospheric, beautifully crafted haunted house horror film that earns scares with a minimum of blood.

filmInfoContainer3: A boy who is believed to bring bad luck to everyone around him leads his family and two new friends through Laos to find a new home. After a calamity-filled journey through a land scarred ...
filmInfoContainer4: A feel-good success crafted with care, Kim Mordaunt's story of two young kids in Laos is a heartfelt audience pleaser while remaining sensitive toward its subjects.

filmInfoContainer3: In the Ottoman province of Hijaz during World War I, a young Bedouin boy experiences a greatly hastened coming-of-age as he embarks on a perilous desert journey to guide a British officer to his secret destination.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by an outstanding performance from Jacir Eid Al-Hwietat in the title role, Theeb is a startlingly assured first effort from director/co-writer Naji Abu Nowar.

filmInfoContainer: Tibet: Cry of the Snow Lion
filmInfoContainer3: A film about the state of Chinese occupied Tibet and its history of oppression and resistance.
filmInfoContainer4: Makes no effort to do more than present one side of its story, but does it so passionately and persuasively that the viewer almost cannot help but be moved.

filmInfoContainer3: A drunken, hard-nosed U.S. Marshal and a Texas Ranger help a stubborn teenager track down her father's murderer in Indian territory.
filmInfoContainer4: True Grit rides along on the strength of a lived-in late-period John Wayne performance, adding its own entertaining spin to the oft-adapted source material.

filmInfoContainer3: On the steppes of Kazakhstan, Asa lives in a yurt with his sister Samal, her husband Ondas, and their three children. Ondas is a herdsman, tough and strong. It's dry, dusty, and windy; too ...
filmInfoContainer4: Kazakh sheep herders get their cinematic due in this lovely, unsentimental debut from director Sergei Dvortsevoy.

filmInfoContainer3: A video game villain wants to be a hero and sets out to fulfill his dream, but his quest brings havoc to the whole arcade where he lives.
filmInfoContainer4: Equally entertaining for both kids and parents old enough to catch the references, Wreck-It Ralph is a clever, colorful adventure built on familiar themes and joyful nostalgia.

filmInfoContainer3: A small financial institution called Abacus becomes the only company criminally indicted in the wake of the United States' 2008 mortgage crisis.
filmInfoContainer4: Abacus: Small Enough to Jail transcends its less-than-dramatic trappings to present a gripping real-life legal thriller with far-reaching implications.

filmInfoContainer3: Filmmaker Matthew Heineman examines the state of the ongoing drug problem along the U.S.-Mexican border.
filmInfoContainer4: Raw, brutal, and bitter, Cartel Land offers a ground-level look at vigilante efforts to thwart organized crime at the Mexican-American border.

filmInfoContainer3: In Tuscany to promote his latest book, a middle-aged British writer meets a French woman who leads him to the village of Lucignano. While there, a chance question reveals something deeper.
filmInfoContainer4: The main stars are absolutely perfect in this absorbing, existential drama that dissects human relationships.

filmInfoContainer3: Two death-row murderesses develop a fierce rivalry while competing for publicity, celebrity, and a sleazy lawyer's attention.
filmInfoContainer4: A rousing and energetic adaptation of the Broadway musical, Chicago succeeds on the level pure spectacle, but provides a surprising level of depth and humor as well.

filmInfoContainer3: An orphaned cheetah becomes the best friend and pet of a young boy living in South Africa.
filmInfoContainer4: This is an old-fashioned, richly textured family film that will appeal to children and adults alike.

filmInfoContainer3: When his mother, who has sheltered him his entire 40 years, dies, Elling, a sensitive, would-be poet, is sent to live in a state institution. There he meets Kjell Bjarne, a gentle giant and...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Quirky without being overly cutesy, Elling is a gentle, warm comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: After a daughter witnesses her father having an affair, she begins a chain reaction that could tear her family apart.
A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.
filmInfoContainer4: Ridley Scott and an excellent cast successfully convey the intensity of Roman gladitorial combat as well as the political intrigue brewing beneath.

filmInfoContainer: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
filmInfoContainer3: A young wizard finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.
filmInfoContainer4: The main characters are maturing, and the filmmakers are likewise improving on their craft; vibrant special effects and assured performances add up to what is the most complex yet of the Harry Potter films.

filmInfoContainer3: In February 2002 in the Shamshatoo Refugee Camp in the North West Frontier Province in Pakistan, there are 53,000 refugees living in sub-human conditions since 1979 with the Soviet Union ...
filmInfoContainer4: Using documentary-style filmmaking to blur the lines between fact and fiction. In This World tells a harrowing but important story about the plight of refugees.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of life inside the Grande Chartreuse, the head monastery of the reclusive Carthusian Order in France.
filmInfoContainer4: A meditative, deliberately paced doc capable of absorbing patient viewers into a whole different world.

filmInfoContainer3: A scientific observer's job of observing an old cantankerous single man's kitchen habits is complicated by his growing friendship with him.
filmInfoContainer4: By turns touching and funny, this Norwegian import offers quietly absorbing commentary on modern life and friendship.

filmInfoContainer3: A tale about a strange young man, Bulcsú, the fellow inspectors on his team, all without exception likable characters, a rival ticket inspection team and racing along the tracks - and a tale about love.
filmInfoContainer4: Kontroll is a smart thriller that's dark, gritty, and funny.

filmInfoContainer3: A nerdy florist finds his chance for success and romance with the help of a giant man-eating plant who demands to be fed.
filmInfoContainer4: Remixing Roger Corman's B-movie by way of the Off-Broadway musical, Little Shop of Horrors offers camp, horror and catchy tunes in equal measure -- plus some inspired cameos by the likes of Steve Martin and Bill Murray.

filmInfoContainer: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
filmInfoContainer3: A botched card game in London triggers four friends, thugs, weed-growers, hard gangsters, loan sharks and debt collectors to collide with each other in a series of unexpected events, all for the sake of weed, cash and two antique shotguns.
filmInfoContainer4: Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels is a grimy, twisted, and funny twist on the Tarantino hip gangster formula.

filmInfoContainer3: When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated.
filmInfoContainer4: A terrifically original, eccentric screwball comedy, Raising Arizona may not be the Coens' most disciplined movie, but it's one of their most purely entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: A restless retired woman teams up with her deceased neighbor's maid to seek out a man who has a secret connection to her past life as a farm owner at the foothill of Mount Tabu in Africa.
Documentary that follows the struggle for control of Dr. Albert C. Barnes' 25 billion dollar collection of modern and post-impressionist art.
filmInfoContainer4: Deeply esoteric and unapologetically one-sided, The Art of the Steal proves a documentary doesn't have to make an objective argument as long as it argues well.

filmInfoContainer3: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-made sequel that delivers the thrills.

filmInfoContainer3: Photographer Robert Kincaid wanders into the life of housewife Francesca Johnson, for four days in the 1960s.
filmInfoContainer4: Sentimental, slow, schmaltzy, and very satisfying, The Bridges of Madison County finds Clint Eastwood adapting a bestseller with heft, wit, and grace.

filmInfoContainer3: In the aftermath of the Persian Gulf War, four soldiers set out to steal gold that was stolen from Kuwait, but they discover people who desperately need their help.
filmInfoContainer4: Three Kings successfully blends elements of action, drama, and comedy into a thoughtful, exciting movie on the Gulf War.

filmInfoContainer3: An Orthodox Jewish couple's faith is tested after praying to the Lord for a child on the Succoth holiday.
filmInfoContainer4: Ushpizin offers a rare and warmly intimate look into ultra-Orthodox Jewish culture.

filmInfoContainer3: A watch salesman meets a young woman soon leaving for Paris and becomes infatuated, so he begins to change all the clocks in Taipei to Paris time.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it requires patience to view, What Time Is It There?'s exploration of loneliness is both elegant and haunting.

filmInfoContainer3: Following a banal incident in her local village, 8-year old girl Shula is accused of witchcraft. After a short trial she is found guilty, taken into state custody and exiled to a witch camp...
filmInfoContainer4: I Am Not a Witch approaches real-life injustices with a beguiling blend of sorrow, anger, and humor, marking debuting writer-director Rungano Nyoni as an exciting new talent.

filmInfoContainer3: A mild-mannered man becomes a local hero through an act of violence, which sets off repercussions that will shake his family to its very core.
filmInfoContainer4: A History of Violence raises compelling and thoughtful questions about the nature of violence, while representing a return to form for director David Cronenberg in one of his more uncharacteristic pieces.

filmInfoContainer3: An outcast New York City cop is charged with bringing down Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas, whose real life inspired this partly biographical film.
filmInfoContainer4: American Gangster is a gritty and entertaining throwback to classic gangster films, with its lead performers firing on all cylinders.

filmInfoContainer3: Mario Van Peebles' half-documentary/half-homage to his father Melvin Van Peebles' movie Sweet Sweetback's Baadasssss Song (1971).
filmInfoContainer4: An entertaining and intriguing tribute to a father from his son.

filmInfoContainer3: A mix of Dave Chappelle's sketch comedy and musical interludes, inspired in part by the 1973 documentary Wattstax.
filmInfoContainer4: Dave Chappelle's Block Party is a raucous return to the spotlight for the comic, buoyed by witty, infectious humor and outstanding musical performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A fan who has an affair with one minor-league baseball player each season meets an up-and-coming pitcher and the experienced catcher assigned to him.
filmInfoContainer4: Kevin Costner at his funniest and most charismatic in Bull Durham, a film that's as wise about relationships as it is about minor league baseball.

filmInfoContainer3: A fast-talking mercenary with a morbid sense of humor is subjected to a rogue experiment that leaves him with accelerated healing powers and a quest for revenge.
filmInfoContainer4: Fast, funny, and gleefully profane, the fourth-wall-busting Deadpool subverts superhero film formula with wildly entertaining -- and decidedly non-family-friendly -- results.

filmInfoContainer3: From dawn to dusk, a few hours in the shadowy life of a mystic man named Monsieur Oscar.
filmInfoContainer4: Mesmerizingly strange and willfully perverse, Holy Motors offers an unforgettable visual feast alongside a spellbinding -- albeit unapologetically challenging -- narrative.

filmInfoContainer3: Two business executives--one an avowed misogynist, the other recently emotionally wounded by his love interest--set out to exact revenge on the female gender by seeking out the most innocent, uncorrupted girl they can find and ruining her life.
filmInfoContainer4: Neil LaBute's pitch-black comedy is a masterful exploration of male insecurity, and it's elevated by a breakout performance by Aaron Eckhart as a businessman who likes to play psychological games.

filmInfoContainer3: A high school French teacher is drawn into a precocious student's increasingly transgressive story about his relationship with a friend's family.
filmInfoContainer4: Dark, tense, and wryly funny, In the House is brilliantly directed by François Ozon and features fine performances from its talented cast.

filmInfoContainer: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
filmInfoContainer3: During the Napoleonic Wars, a brash British captain pushes his ship and crew to their limits in pursuit of a formidable French war vessel around South America.
filmInfoContainer4: Russell Crowe's rough charm is put to good use in this masterful adaptation of Patrick O'Brian's novel.

filmInfoContainer3: An in-depth look at the life and music of Manchester-based rock band, Oasis.
filmInfoContainer4: Oasis: Supersonic foregoes a comprehensive approach to its multi-platinum subjects in favor of an appreciative -- and stirring -- look at their heady early years.

filmInfoContainer3: Three company workers who hate their jobs decide to rebel against their greedy boss.
filmInfoContainer4: Mike Judge lampoons the office grind with its inspired mix of sharp dialogue and witty one-liners.

filmInfoContainer3: In New York City's Harlem circa 1987, an overweight, abused, illiterate teen who is pregnant with her second child is invited to enroll in an alternative school in hopes that her life can head in a new direction.
filmInfoContainer4: Precious is a grim yet ultimately triumphant film about abuse and inner-city life, largely bolstered by exceptional performances from its cast.

filmInfoContainer3: In a dystopic and crime-ridden Detroit, a terminally wounded cop returns to the force as a powerful cyborg haunted by submerged memories.
filmInfoContainer4: While over-the-top and gory, Robocop is also a surprisingly smart sci-fi flick that uses ultraviolence to disguise its satire of American culture.

filmInfoContainer3: A small-time boxer gets a supremely rare chance to fight a heavy-weight champion in a bout in which he strives to go the distance for his self-respect.
filmInfoContainer4: This story of a down-on-his-luck boxer is thoroughly predictable, but Sylvester Stallone's script and stunning performance in the title role brush aside complaints.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in a future where a failed climate-change experiment kills all life on the planet except for a lucky few who boarded the Snowpiercer, a train that travels around the globe, where a class system emerges.
filmInfoContainer4: Snowpiercer offers an audaciously ambitious action spectacular for filmgoers numb to effects-driven blockbusters.

filmInfoContainer3: When Cartman and his friends go see an R rated movie, they start cursing and their parents think that Canada is to blame.
filmInfoContainer4: Its jokes are profoundly bold and rude but incredibly funny at the same time.

filmInfoContainer3: A scientist in a surrealist society kidnaps children to steal their dreams, hoping that they slow his aging process.
filmInfoContainer4: Not all of its many intriguing ideas are developed, but The City of Lost Children is an engrossing, disturbing, profoundly memorable experience.

filmInfoContainer: The Diary of a Teenage Girl
filmInfoContainer3: A teen artist living in 1970s San Francisco enters into an affair with her mother's boyfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: Boldly unconventional and refreshingly honest, Diary of a Teenage Girl is a frank coming-of-age story that addresses its themes -- and its protagonist -- without judgment.

filmInfoContainer3: A lawman apprehends a notorious outlaw and gives him nine days to kill his older brother, or else they'll execute his younger brother.
filmInfoContainer4: Brutal, unflinching, and violent, but thought-provoking and with excellent performances, this Australian western is the one of the best examples of the genre to come along in recent times.

filmInfoContainer3: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.
filmInfoContainer4: The Thin Red Line is a daringly philosophical World War II film with an enormous cast of eager stars.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the New York Times bestseller, this movie tells the incredibly inspiring and heartwarming story of August Pullman, a boy with facial differences who enters the fifth grade, attending a mainstream elementary school for the first time.
filmInfoContainer4: Wonder doesn't shy away from its bestselling source material's sentiment, but this well-acted and overall winsome drama earns its tugs at the heartstrings.

filmInfoContainer3: A magician meets an eccentric girl and offers her to work together in his magic show. It is only until a year later that he starts to know her personally and develops a feeling towards her despite her own problems.
In the bleak days of the Cold War, espionage veteran George Smiley is forced out of semi-retirement to uncover a Soviet Agent within MI6's echelons.
filmInfoContainer4: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy is a dense puzzle of anxiety, paranoia, and espionage that director Tomas Alfredson pieces together with utmost skill.

filmInfoContainer3: A boy seeks the help of a tree monster to cope with his single mother's terminal illness.
filmInfoContainer4: A Monster Calls deftly balances dark themes and fantastical elements to deliver an engrossing and uncommonly moving entry in the crowded coming-of-age genre.

filmInfoContainer: Amandla! A Revolution in Four Part Harmony
filmInfoContainer3: Interviews, archival footage, and filmed performances highlight the role of music in the South African struggle against apartheid.
filmInfoContainer4: The powerful singing in Amandla makes for an uplifting, compelling documentary.

filmInfoContainer3: The University of California at Berkeley, the oldest and most prestigious member of a ten campus public education system, is also one of the finest research and teaching facilities in the ...
filmInfoContainer4: Its generous running time will test less forbearing viewers' patience, but for filmgoers seeking more of director Frederick Wiseman's observant brand of documentary, At Berkeley satisfies.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of James Braddock, a supposedly washed-up boxer who came back to become a champion and an inspiration in the 1930s.
filmInfoContainer4: With grittiness and an evocative sense of time and place, Cinderella Man is a powerful underdog story. And Ron Howard and Russell Crowe prove to be a solid combination.

filmInfoContainer3: A faded country music musician is forced to reassess his dysfunctional life during a doomed romance that also inspires him.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to a captivating performance from Jeff Bridges, Crazy Heart transcends its overly familiar origins and finds new meaning in an old story.

filmInfoContainer3: An aspiring writer is hired as a croupier at a casino, where he realizes that his life as a croupier would make a great novel.
filmInfoContainer4: The writer slumming for human truths and real experience is a common enough story, but this cool-headed and slick thriller provides a gut-churningly compelling backdrop to a look at our darker sides.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenager gets a summer job working for a horse trainer and befriends the fading racehorse, Lean on Pete.
filmInfoContainer4: Lean on Pete avoids mawkish melodrama, offering an empathetic yet clear-eyed portrayal of a young man at a crossroads that confirms Charley Plummer as a major talent.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a Palestinian widow who must defend her lemontree field when a new Israeli Defense Minister moves next to her and threatens to have her lemon grove torn down.
filmInfoContainer4: A positive and personal Israeli film that offers an understated and thought-provoking vision of the West Bank troubles.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary crew followed Metallica for the better part of 2001-2003, a time of tension and release for the rock band, as they recorded their album St. Anger, fought bitterly, and sought the counsel of their on-call shrink.
filmInfoContainer4: Fascinating behind-the-scenes look at how Metallica survives one of their more turbulent periods.

filmInfoContainer3: Follows a jealous countess, a wealthy businessman, and a young orphaned boy across Portugal, France, Italy and Brazil where they connect with a variety of mysterious individuals.
An innocent teenager, studying to be a vet, develops a craving for human flesh.
filmInfoContainer4: Raw's lurid violence and sexuality live up to its title, but they're anchored with an immersive atmosphere and deep symbolism that linger long after the provocative visuals fade.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama set at a Swiss ski resort and centered on a boy who supports his sister by stealing from wealthy guests.
A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train. A mission he has only 8 minutes to complete.
filmInfoContainer4: Finding the human story amidst the action, director Duncan Jones and charming Jake Gyllenhaal craft a smart, satisfying sci-fi thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: After the crew of the Enterprise find an unstoppable force of terror from within their own organization, Captain Kirk leads a manhunt to a war-zone world to capture a one-man weapon of mass destruction.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually spectacular and suitably action packed, Star Trek Into Darkness is a rock-solid installment in the venerable sci-fi franchise, even if it's not as fresh as its predecessor.

filmInfoContainer3: 15-year-old Oliver Tate has two objectives: To lose his virginity before his next birthday, and to extinguish the flame between his mother and an ex-lover who has resurfaced in her life.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, stylish, and ringing with adolescent truth, Submarine marks Richard Ayoade as a talent to watch.

filmInfoContainer3: Jake Blues, just out from prison, puts together his old band to save the Catholic home where he and brother Elwood were raised.
filmInfoContainer4: Too over the top for its own good, but ultimately rescued by the cast's charm, director John Landis' grace, and several soul-stirring musical numbers.

filmInfoContainer3: A monster emerges from Seoul's Han River and focuses its attention on attacking people. One victim's loving family does what it can to rescue her from its clutches.
filmInfoContainer4: As populace pleasing as it is intellectually satisfying, The Host combines scares, laughs, and satire into a riveting, monster movie.

filmInfoContainer3: American-born Gogol, the son of Indian immigrants, wants to fit in among his fellow New Yorkers, despite his family's unwillingness to let go of their traditional ways.
filmInfoContainer4: An ambitious exploration of the immigrant experience with a talented cast that serves the material well.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenage boy must deal with his mother's complicated response after his father temporarily abandons them to take a menial and dangerous job.
filmInfoContainer4: Wildlife's portrait of a family in crisis is beautifully composed by director Paul Dano -- and brought brilliantly to life by a career-best performance from Carey Mulligan.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary focused on Stuxnet, a piece of self-replicating computer malware that the U.S. and Israel unleashed to destroy a key part of an Iranian nuclear facility, and which ultimately spread beyond its intended target.
filmInfoContainer4: Factors beyond Gibney's control prevent Zero Days from offering a comprehensive look at its subject, but the partial picture that emerges remains as frightening as it is impossible to ignore.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman living in the woods with her husband, a struggling musician, and her daughter discover she has terminal cancer. She begins to tape-record a journal of the time she has left.
Poor Milton can't get any respect. He works at an evil corporation called Initech and his "office" has been shoved into the basement. He talks to the camera, picks his nose, and threatens ...
filmInfoContainer4: Mike Judge lampoons the office grind with its inspired mix of sharp dialogue and witty one-liners.

filmInfoContainer3: On a distant planet, descendants of a crashed spaceship are subjected to mysterious forces that cause them to age and die in just eight days. They must also live in caves to escape the ...
filmInfoContainer4: Simultaneously sweeping and intimate, Quest uses one family's experiences to offer trenchant, wide-ranging observations about modern American life.

filmInfoContainer3: A 20-year veteran of the Angolan civil war returns to the capital city of Luanda where he faces the challenges of assimilation and survival.
filmInfoContainer4: With death-defying action sequences and epic historic sweep, Hero offers everything a martial arts fan could ask for.

filmInfoContainer3: A paraplegic marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.
filmInfoContainer4: It might be more impressive on a technical level than as a piece of storytelling, but Avatar reaffirms James Cameron's singular gift for imaginative, absorbing filmmaking.

filmInfoContainer3: A New York socialite, deeply troubled and in denial, arrives in San Francisco to impose upon her sister. She looks a million, but isn't bringing money, peace, or love...
filmInfoContainer4: Woody Allen's Blue Jasmine finds the director in peak late-period form -- and benefiting from a superb cast led by Cate Blanchett.

filmInfoContainer3: A cab driver finds himself the hostage of an engaging contract killer as he makes his rounds from hit to hit during one night in Los Angeles.
filmInfoContainer4: Driven by director Michael Mann's trademark visuals and a lean, villainous performance from Tom Cruise, Collateral is a stylish and compelling noir thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: An inspirational true story of a group of friends from a working men's club who decide to take on the elite 'sport of kings' and breed themselves a racehorse
filmInfoContainer4: Dark Horse offers a thoroughly crowd-pleasing look at an incredible -- and inspirational -- real-life story that will thrill equine enthusiasts and novices alike.

filmInfoContainer3: While on a journey of physical and spiritual healing, a brilliant neurosurgeon is drawn into the world of the mystic arts.
filmInfoContainer4: Doctor Strange artfully balances its outré source material against the blockbuster constraints of the MCU, delivering a thoroughly entertaining superhero origin story in the bargain.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical
filmInfoContainer3: When the newly-crowned Queen Elsa accidentally uses her power to turn things into ice to curse her home in infinite winter, her sister Anna teams up with a mountain man, his playful reindeer, and a snowman to change the weather condition.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully animated, smartly written, and stocked with singalong songs, Frozen adds another worthy entry to the Disney canon.

filmInfoContainer: I Am Trying to Break Your Heart
filmInfoContainer3: First-time filmmaker and award-winning photographer Sam Jones documents the recording of Wilco's album, "Yankee Hotel Foxtrot."
filmInfoContainer4: Besides being a treat for Wilco fans, I Am Trying to Break Your Heart also exposes the workings of a profit-driven music industry.

filmInfoContainer3: The comfortable daily routines of aging Parisian actor Gilbert Valence, 76, are suddenly shaken when he learns that his wife, daughter, and son-in-law have been killed in a car crash. ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: I'm Going Home is a masterfully subtle and poignant exploration of mortality.

filmInfoContainer3: Musician Cat Power narrates this documentary on Janis Joplin's evolution into a star from letters that Joplin wrote over the years to her friends, family, and collaborators.
filmInfoContainer4: Respectful without veering into hagiography and inquisitive without being intrusive, Janis: Little Girl Blue offers an insightful glimpse into the life of a rock 'n' roll legend.

filmInfoContainer3: For fun-loving party animal Ben Stone, the last thing he ever expected was for his one-night stand to show up on his doorstep eight weeks later to tell him she's pregnant with his child.
filmInfoContainer4: Knocked Up is a hilarious, poignant and refreshing look at the rigors of courtship and child-rearing, with a sometimes raunchy, yet savvy script that is ably acted and directed.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama that charts ten years in the relationship of a male-to-female transsexual's relationship with her lover.
filmInfoContainer4: Passionate and powerfully acted, Laurence Anyways sometimes strains to achieve its narrative ambitions (and fill its three-hour running time), but ultimately succeeds.

filmInfoContainer3: An arthritic Nova Scotia woman works as a housekeeper while she hones her skills as an artist and eventually becomes a beloved figure in the community.
filmInfoContainer4: Maudie's talented cast -- particularly Sally Hawkins in the title role -- breathe much-needed depth into a story that only skims the surface of a fascinating life and talent.

filmInfoContainer3: A German Jewish refugee family moves to and adjusts to a farm life in 1930s Kenya.
filmInfoContainer4: A visually lovely epic with compelling, three-dimensional characters.

filmInfoContainer3: A paranoid mathematician searches for a key number that will unlock the universal patterns found in nature.
filmInfoContainer4: Dramatically gripping and frighteningly smart, this Lynchian thriller does wonders with its unlikely subject and shoestring budget.

filmInfoContainer3: This feature-length documentary focuses on the efforts by troops in the U.S. military during the Vietnam War to oppose the war effort by peaceful demonstration and subversion. It speaks ...
filmInfoContainer4: A powerful reflection on a pivotal era, from a viewpoint seldom visited, this documentary hits home, especially with its relevance to current events.

filmInfoContainer3: Surfers and secret spots from around the world are profiled in this documentary.
filmInfoContainer4: A perfect companion piece to The Endless Summer.

filmInfoContainer3: A linguistics professor and her family find their bonds tested when she is diagnosed with Alzheimer's Disease.
filmInfoContainer4: Elevated by a gripping performance from Julianne Moore, Still Alice is a heartfelt drama that honors its delicate themes with bravery and sensitivity.

filmInfoContainer3: An elderly couple fight against local authorities in rural New Brunswick to build their final home.
filmInfoContainer4: James Cromwell and Geneviève Bujold are outstanding in this tender, affecting, insightful drama about the bonds and sacrifices of marriage.

filmInfoContainer: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
filmInfoContainer3: The infamous story of Benjamin Barker, aka Sweeney Todd, who sets up a barber shop in London which is the basis for a sinister partnership with his fellow tenant, Mrs. Lovett.
filmInfoContainer4: Full of pith and Grand Guignol grossness, this macabre musical is perfectly helmed and highly entertaining. Tim Burton masterfully stages the musical in a way that will make you think he has done this many times before.

filmInfoContainer3: Wannabe actors become regulars in the stylish neo-lounge scene; Trent teaches his friend Mike the unwritten rules of the scene.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, heartfelt, and effortlessly cool, Swingers made stars out of Vince Vaughn and Jon Favreau, established Doug Liman as a director to watch.

filmInfoContainer3: Satirical comedy follows the machinations of Big Tobacco's chief spokesman, Nick Naylor, who spins on behalf of cigarettes while trying to remain a role model for his twelve-year-old son.
filmInfoContainer4: Loaded with delightfully unscrupulous characters and and a witty, cynical script, Thank You For Smoking is a sharp satire with a brilliantly smarmy lead performance from Aaron Eckhart.

filmInfoContainer3: A biopic depicting the early years of legendary Director and aviator Howard Hughes' career from the late 1920s to the mid 1940s.
filmInfoContainer4: With a rich sense of period detail, The Aviator succeeds thanks to typically assured direction from Martin Scorsese and a strong performance from Leonardo DiCaprio, who charts Howard Hughes' descent from eccentric billionaire to reclusive madman.

filmInfoContainer3: A widower is determined to get to the bottom of a potentially explosive secret involving his wife's murder, big business, and corporate corruption.
filmInfoContainer4: The Constant Gardener is a smart, gripping, and suspenseful thriller with rich performances from the leads.

filmInfoContainer3: A remote Australian community, populated by quirky characters, plays a key role in the first Apollo moon landing.
filmInfoContainer4: A feel good movie without an abundance of mush.

filmInfoContainer: The Kid Stays in the Picture
filmInfoContainer3: Documentary about legendary Paramount producer Robert Evans (the film shares the same name as Evans's famous 1994 autobiography).
filmInfoContainer4: Though not objective by any means, The Kid Stays in the Picture is irresistibly entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: A laconic, chain-smoking barber blackmails his wife's boss and lover for money to invest in dry cleaning, but his plan goes terribly wrong.
filmInfoContainer4: Stylish but emotionally distant, The Man Who Wasn't There is a clever tribute to the film noir genre.

filmInfoContainer3: A Muppet fanatic with some help from his 2 human compatriots must regroup the Muppet gang to stop an avaricious oil mogul from taking down one of their precious life-longing treasures.
filmInfoContainer4: Clever, charming, and heartfelt, The Muppets is a welcome big screen return for Jim Henson's lovable creations that will both win new fans and delight longtime devotees.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a controversial pornography publisher and how he became a defender of free speech.
filmInfoContainer4: The People Vs. Larry Flynt pays entertaining tribute to an irascible iconoclast with a well-constructed biopic that openly acknowledges his troublesome flaws.

filmInfoContainer3: A man in an iron lung who wishes to lose his virginity contacts a professional sex surrogate with the help of his therapist and priest.
filmInfoContainer4: Tender, funny, and touching, The Sessions provides an acting showcase for its talented stars and proves it's possible for Hollywood to produce a grown-up movie about sex.

filmInfoContainer3: An in-depth look at The New York Times' long-time crossword puzzle editor Will Shortz and his loyal fan base.
filmInfoContainer4: You see them hunched over with their brows furrowed, folded newspaper in hand as they attempt to complete the crossword puzzle. This may even describe you. This ingeniously edited documentary introduces viewers to some of the more dedicated fans of this solitary pastime, none more well-known the puzzle editor for the New York Times, Will Shortz. This underground world provides a surprising amount of crowd-pleasing entertainment and suspense, especially at the annual crossword tournament. Didn't know there was one, did you?

filmInfoContainer3: After getting in a car accident, a woman is held in a shelter with two men, who claim the outside world is affected by a widespread chemical attack.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, solidly crafted, and palpably tense, 10 Cloverfield Lane makes the most of its confined setting and outstanding cast -- and suggests a new frontier for franchise filmmaking.

filmInfoContainer3: In February of 2009, a group of Danish soldiers accompanied by documentarian Janus Metz arrived at Armadillo, an army base in the southern Afghan province of Helmand. Metz and ...
A young man is rocked by two announcements from his elderly father: that he has terminal cancer and that he has a young male lover.
filmInfoContainer4: Wearing its twee heart on its sleeve, Beginners explores the depths of modern, multi-generational romance with wit and depth.

filmInfoContainer: Diana Vreeland: The Eye Has to Travel
filmInfoContainer3: A look at the life and work of the influential fashion editor of Harpers Bazaar, Diana Vreeland.
filmInfoContainer4: An affectionate portrait created with visual flair, Diana Vreeland is entertaining, informative, and stylish, due in large part to its charismatic subject.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the life of the astronaut, Neil Armstrong, and the legendary space mission that led him to become the first man to walk on the Moon on July 20, 1969.
filmInfoContainer4: First Man uses a personal focus to fuel a look back at a pivotal moment in human history - and takes audiences on a soaring dramatic journey along the way.

filmInfoContainer3: An inside look at Italy's modern crime families.
filmInfoContainer4: Portraying organised crime with an unflinching realism, this gritty and searing Italian crime masterpiece pulls no punches.

filmInfoContainer3: After the family matriarch passes away, a grieving family is haunted by tragic and disturbing occurrences, and begin to unravel dark secrets.
filmInfoContainer4: Hereditary uses its classic setup as the framework for a harrowing, uncommonly unsettling horror film whose cold touch lingers long beyond the closing credits.

filmInfoContainer3: A secret agent exacts revenge on a serial killer through a series of captures and releases.
Conversations with death row inmate Michael Perry and those affected by his crime serve as an examination of why people - and the state - kill.
filmInfoContainer4: Another probing, insightful look at an interesting subject, Werner Herzog explores the American prison system with passion and not politics.

filmInfoContainer3: James, a twenty-something New Yorker, struggles to take control of his self-destructive behavior in the face of momentous family challenges.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by powerfully complementary performances from Christopher Abbott and Cynthia Nixon, James White offers an affecting calling card for debuting writer-director Josh Mond.

filmInfoContainer3: Terry Gilliam's doomed attempt to get his film, The Man Who Killed Don Quixote (2018), off the ground.
filmInfoContainer4: A remarkable behind-the-scenes look at a movie that wasn't, Lost in La Mancha is an incisive, entertaining document of the difficulties inherent in the moviemaking process.

filmInfoContainer3: Two New Yorkers are accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college, and one of their cousins--an inexperienced, loudmouth lawyer not accustomed to Southern rules and manners--comes in to defend them.
filmInfoContainer4: The deft comic interplay between Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei helps to elevate My Cousin Vinny's predictable script, and the result is a sharp, hilarious courtroom comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: In the deep south during the 1930s, three escaped convicts search for hidden treasure while a relentless lawman pursues them.
filmInfoContainer4: Though not as good as Coen brothers' classics such as Blood Simple, the delightfully loopy O Brother, Where Art Thou? is still a lot of fun.

filmInfoContainer3: A young girl risks everything to prevent a powerful, multinational company from kidnapping her best friend - a fascinating beast named Okja.
filmInfoContainer4: Okja sees Bong Joon-ho continuing to create defiantly eclectic entertainment -- and still hitting more than enough of his narrative targets in the midst of a tricky tonal juggling act.

filmInfoContainer3: A mob enforcer's son witnesses a murder, forcing him and his father to take to the road, and his father down a path of redemption and revenge.
filmInfoContainer4: Somber, stately, and beautifully mounted, Sam Mendes' Road to Perdition is a well-crafted mob movie that explores the ties between fathers and sons.

filmInfoContainer3: A Chinese-American lesbian and her traditionalist mother are reluctant to go public with secret loves that clash against cultural expectations.
filmInfoContainer4: A charming tale of a love affair that overcomes cultural taboos.

filmInfoContainer3: In an alternate present-day version of Oakland, telemarketer Cassius Green discovers a magical key to professional success, propelling him into a universe of greed.
filmInfoContainer4: Fearlessly ambitious, scathingly funny, and thoroughly original, Sorry to Bother You loudly heralds the arrival of a fresh filmmaking talent in writer-director Boots Riley.

filmInfoContainer: The Beat That My Heart Skipped
filmInfoContainer3: Will Thomas still lead a life of crime and cruelty, just like his thuggish father, or will he pursue his dream of becoming a pianist?
filmInfoContainer4: Stylish and visceral, this able remake is infused with realism, grit, and a taut performance by star Romain Duris.

filmInfoContainer: The Black Panthers: Vanguard of the Revolution
filmInfoContainer3: This documentary tells the rise and fall of the Black Panther Party, one of the 20th century's most alluring and controversial organizations that captivated the world's attention for nearly 50 years.
filmInfoContainer4: The Black Panthers: Vanguard Of The Revolution offers a fascinating -- if somewhat rudimentary -- introduction to a movement, and an era, that remains soberingly relevant today.

filmInfoContainer3: Elise and Didier fall in love at first sight, in spite of their differences. He talks, she listens. He's a romantic atheist, she's a religious realist. When their daughter becomes seriously ill, their love is put on trial.
filmInfoContainer4: The Broken Circle Breakdown's reach occasionally exceeds its grasp, but overall, it's an intoxicating, finely wrought romance -- and one with a terrific soundtrack to boot.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Rubin "Hurricane" Carter, a boxer wrongly imprisoned for murder, and the people who aided in his fight to prove his innocence.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks in large part to one of Denzel Washington's most powerful on-screen performances, The Hurricane is a moving, inspirational sports drama, even if it takes few risks in telling its story.

filmInfoContainer3: A cooler-than-ever Bruce Wayne must deal with the usual suspects as they plan to rule Gotham City, while discovering that he has accidentally adopted a teenage orphan who wishes to become his sidekick.
filmInfoContainer4: The Lego Batman Movie continues its block-buster franchise's winning streak with another round of dizzyingly funny -- and beautifully animated -- family-friendly mayhem.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1970s Los Angeles, a mismatched pair of private eyes investigate a missing girl and the mysterious death of a porn star.
filmInfoContainer4: The Nice Guys hearkens back to the buddy comedies of a bygone era while adding something extra courtesy of a knowing script and the irresistible chemistry of its leads.

filmInfoContainer3: A sister and brother face the realities of familial responsibility as they begin to care for their ailing father.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to a tender, funny script from director Tamara Jenkins, and fine performances from Philip Seymour Hoffman and Laura Linney, this film delivers a nuanced, beautifully three-dimensional look at the struggles and comforts of family bonds.

filmInfoContainer3: A celebration of the musical work of a group of session musicians known as "The Wrecking Crew", a band that provided back-up instrumentals to such legendary recording artists as Frank Sinatra, The Beach Boys and Bing Crosby.
filmInfoContainer4: The Wrecking Crew may not achieve the greatness of the many classic songs its subjects helped bring to life, but it remains a heartfelt, overdue tribute to overshadowed brilliance.

filmInfoContainer3: A mixture of original interviews and archival footage and photographs sheds light on the life experiences of Mike Tyson.
filmInfoContainer4: A fascinating, emotional, and frank confessional from Iron Mike that sheds a sympathetic light on one of boxing's most controversial icons.

filmInfoContainer3: For generations, all that distinguished Eagle Pass, TX, from Piedras Negras, MX, was the Rio Grande. But when darkness descends upon these harmonious border towns, a cowboy and lawman face a new reality that threatens their way of life.
filmInfoContainer4: Western earns the viewer's attention with an unpredictable, patiently told tale that evokes the spirit of the titular genre while adding its own unique touches.

filmInfoContainer3: Harry knew Michel in high school; they meet again by accident, Harry inserts himself in Michel's life... and things take a sinister turn.
filmInfoContainer4: A darkly funny thriller that's reminiscent of Hitchcock.

filmInfoContainer3: Four independent stories set in modern China about random acts of violence.
filmInfoContainer4: Its screenplay isn't as graceful as the choreography of its action sequences, but A Touch of Sin offers enough stylishly satisfying violence to muscle past its rough spots.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama set in the Mississippi delta, where one man's suicide affects three people's lives.
filmInfoContainer4: A searing debut by director Lance Hammer, this subtle and contemplative Mississippi set drama lingers long after its conclusion.

filmInfoContainer: Before the Devil Knows You're Dead
filmInfoContainer3: When two brothers organize the robbery of their parent's jewelry store the job goes horribly wrong, triggering a series of events that sends them, their father and one brother's wife hurtling towards a shattering climax.
filmInfoContainer4: A tense and effective thriller, Before the Devil Knows You're Dead marks a triumphant return to form for director Sidney Lumet.

filmInfoContainer3: A Catholic priest and an English teacher get stranded in a school in Kigali during the 1994 Rwandan genocide.
filmInfoContainer4: Complex, human characters and on-location shooting give Beyond the Gates palpable tension and urgency.

filmInfoContainer3: When his secret bride is executed for assaulting an English soldier who tried to rape her, Sir William Wallace begins a revolt against King Edward I of England.
filmInfoContainer4: Distractingly violent and historically dodgy, Mel Gibson's Braveheart justifies its epic length by delivering enough sweeping action, drama, and romance to match its ambition.

filmInfoContainer3: After Rudi's wife Trudi suddenly dies, he travels to Japan to fulfill her dream of being a Butoh dancer.
filmInfoContainer4: This mature and eloquent meditation on grief and loss sports measured performances and moments of humor.

filmInfoContainer3: Three teenagers live isolated, without leaving their house, because their over-protective parents say they can only leave when their dogtooth falls out.
filmInfoContainer4: It'll be too disturbing -- and meandering -- for some, but Dogtooth is as disturbing and startlingly original as modern filmmaking gets.

filmInfoContainer3: The early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.
filmInfoContainer4: No mere historical drama, Elizabeth is a rich, suspenseful journey into the heart of British Royal politics, and features a typically outstanding performance from Cate Blanchett.

filmInfoContainer3: A working-class African-American father tries to raise his family in the 1950s, while coming to terms with the events of his life.
filmInfoContainer4: From its reunited Broadway stars to its screenplay, the solidly crafted Fences finds its Pulitzer-winning source material fundamentally unchanged -- and still just as powerful.

filmInfoContainer: Gonzo: The Life and Work of Dr. Hunter S. Thompson
filmInfoContainer3: A portrait of the late gonzo journalist Hunter S. Thompson.
filmInfoContainer4: While not the comprehensive profile of the man that his die-hard fans might have hoped for, Gonzo remains an insightful introduction to the life of rebellious writer Hunter S. Thompson and his influences.

filmInfoContainer3: A punk rock band is forced to fight for survival after witnessing a murder at a neo-Nazi skinhead bar.
filmInfoContainer4: Green Room delivers unapologetic genre thrills with uncommon intelligence and powerfully acted élan.

filmInfoContainer3: Martin Blank is a professional assassin. He is sent on a mission to a small Detroit suburb, Grosse Pointe, and, by coincidence, his ten-year high school reunion party is taking place there at the same time.
filmInfoContainer4: A high-concept high school reunion movie with an adroitly cast John Cusack and armed with a script of incisive wit.

filmInfoContainer3: The tragic story of world renowned classic cellist Jacqueline du Pré, as told from the point of view of her sister, flautist Hilary du Pré-Finzi.
filmInfoContainer4: Brilliant performances, lush cinematography, and complex storytelling deserve audience's attention.

filmInfoContainer3: Secret Service agent Frank Horrigan couldn't save Kennedy, but he's determined not to let a clever assassin take out this president.
filmInfoContainer4: A straightforward thriller of the highest order, In the Line of Fire benefits from Wolfgang Peterson's taut direction and charismatic performances from Clint Eastwood and John Malkovich.

filmInfoContainer3: As the Allies sweep across Germany, Lore leads her siblings on a journey that exposes them to the truth of their parents' beliefs. An encounter with a mysterious refugee forces Lore to rely on a person she has always been taught to hate.
filmInfoContainer4: Newcomer Saskia Rosendahl gives an astonishingly assured performance in the title role, and director Cate Shortland establishes a delicate, disturbingly ominous tone in the powerful World War II drama Lore.

filmInfoContainer3: When a teen is bullied, his brother and friends lure the bully into the woods to seek revenge.
filmInfoContainer4: Mean Creek is an uncomfortably riveting glimpse into the casual cruelty of youth.

filmInfoContainer3: A veteran high school teacher befriends a younger art teacher, who is having an affair with one of her 15-year-old students. However, her intentions with this new "friend" also go well beyond platonic friendship.
filmInfoContainer4: In this sharp psychological thriller, Judi Dench and Cate Blanchett give fierce, memorable performances as two schoolteachers locked in a battle of wits.

filmInfoContainer3: Danny Ocean and his eleven accomplices plan to rob three Las Vegas casinos simultaneously.
filmInfoContainer4: As fast-paced, witty, and entertaining as it is star-studded and coolly stylish, Ocean's Eleven offers a well-seasoned serving of popcorn entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: Focusing on the bonding between three girls in Brooklyn's "Jackie Robinson Steppers Marching Band" and the choices the girls face once their high school closes down for asbestos removal.
filmInfoContainer4: Graced with such a realistic feel that it resembles a documentary, Our Song is a sensitive portrayal of three teenage girls.

filmInfoContainer3: A family's home is haunted by a host of demonic ghosts.
filmInfoContainer4: Smartly filmed, tightly scripted, and -- most importantly -- consistently frightening, Poltergeist is a modern horror classic.

filmInfoContainer3: A young police officer must prevent a bomb exploding aboard a city bus by keeping its speed above 50 mph.
filmInfoContainer4: A terrific popcorn thriller, Speed is taut, tense, and energetic, with outstanding performances from Keanu Reeves, Dennis Hopper, and Sandra Bullock.

filmInfoContainer3: A man brutally murdered comes back to life as an undead avenger of his and his fiancée's murder.
filmInfoContainer4: Filled with style and dark, lurid energy, The Crow is an action-packed visual feast that also has a soul in the performance of the late Brandon Lee.

filmInfoContainer3: In suburban New Canaan, Connecticut, 1973, middle class families experimenting with casual sex and substance abuse find their lives beyond their control.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Ang Lee revisits the ennui-laden decadence of 1970s suburban America with deft humor and gripping pathos.

filmInfoContainer3: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.
filmInfoContainer4: It handles its potentially prickly subject matter with kid gloves, but Intouchables gets by thanks to its strong cast and some remarkably sensitive direction.

filmInfoContainer3: Two children conceived by artificial insemination bring their biological father into their non-traditional family life.
filmInfoContainer4: Worthwhile as both a well-acted ensemble piece and as a smart, warm statement on family values, The Kids Are All Right is remarkable.

filmInfoContainer3: A hard-partying high school senior's philosophy on life changes when he meets the not-so-typical "nice girl."
filmInfoContainer4: The Spectacular Now is an adroit, sensitive film that avoids typical coming-of-age story trappings.

filmInfoContainer: The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada
filmInfoContainer3: Ranch hand Pete Perkins looks to fulfill the promise to his recently deceased best friend by burying him in his hometown in Mexico.
filmInfoContainer4: Tommy Lee Jones' directorial debut is both a potent western and a powerful morality tale.

filmInfoContainer3: The two men embark on parallel, if separate, journeys. Their yearning is a common one--for a better and different life. Dondup, delayed by the timeless pace of his village, is forced to ...
filmInfoContainer4: Interwined tales of spiritual discovery are set against a gorgeous, evocative landscape in this pleasant, engaging import.

filmInfoContainer3: Mockumentary captures the reunion of 1960s folk trio the Folksmen as they prepare for a show at The Town Hall to memorialize a recently deceased concert promoter.
filmInfoContainer4: Though not as uproariously funny as Guest's previous movies, A Mighty Wind is also more heartfelt.

filmInfoContainer3: A heartfelt documentary focusing on the day-to-day lives of professional wrestlers, some on the rise, some on the wane, and others fighting for their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: Even if you aren't a fan, Beyond the Mat provides a riveting, perceptive look into the world of professional wrestling by taking a closer look at the people beneath the personas.

filmInfoContainer3: After the terrible news of a fatal car accident involving her son, a desperate mother will do anything in her powers to set her child free.
filmInfoContainer4: It isn't necessarily an easy watch, but thanks to Netzer's interesting direction and a riveting performance from Gheorghiu, Child's Pose is rewarding.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary portrait that takes us into Jonathan Gold's universe to tell the improbable story of a revolution inspired by the pen, but driven by the palate.
filmInfoContainer4: Even for viewers who've never read or heard of food critic Jonathan Gold, City of Gold offers a thoroughly entertaining introduction to a talented writer and brilliant career.

filmInfoContainer3: This contemporary romantic comedy, based on a global bestseller, follows native New Yorker Rachel Chu to Singapore to meet her boyfriend's family.
filmInfoContainer4: With a terrific cast and a surfeit of visual razzle dazzle, Crazy Rich Asians takes a satisfying step forward for screen representation while deftly drawing inspiration from the classic -- and still effective -- rom-com formula.

filmInfoContainer3: Life changes for Malcolm, a geek who's surviving life in a tough neighborhood, after a chance invitation to an underground party leads him and his friends into a Los Angeles adventure.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring a starmaking performance from Shameik Moore and a refreshingly original point of view from writer-director Rick Famuyiwa, Dope is smart, insightful entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: Flama and Moko are fourteen years old; they have been best friends since they were kids. They have everything they need to survive yet another boring Sunday: an apartment without parents, ...
filmInfoContainer4: This modest cinematic slice-of-life manages to subtly capture many small but resonant and truthful moments of adolescence.

filmInfoContainer3: Shot documentary-style, this film follows the daily grind of two young police officers in LA who are partners and friends, and what happens when they meet criminal forces greater than themselves.
filmInfoContainer4: End of Watch has the energy, devotion to characters, and charismatic performances to overcome the familiar pitfalls of its genre and handheld format.

filmInfoContainer3: A divorced woman who decides to pursue the man she's interested in learns he's her new friend's ex-husband.
filmInfoContainer4: Wryly charming, impeccably acted, and ultimately quite bittersweet, Enough Said is a grown-up movie in the best possible way.

filmInfoContainer3: As a director and his crew shoot a controversial film about Christopher Columbus in Cochabamba, Bolivia, local people rise up against plans to privatize the water supply.
A high school wise guy is determined to have a day off from school, despite what the Principal thinks of that.
filmInfoContainer4: Matthew Broderick charms in Ferris Bueller's Day Off, a light and irrepressibly fun movie about being young and having fun.

filmInfoContainer3: Over the course of five social occasions, a committed bachelor must consider the notion that he may have discovered love.
filmInfoContainer4: While frothy to a fault, Four Weddings and a Funeral features irresistibly breezy humor, and winsome performances from Hugh Grant and Andie MacDowell.

filmInfoContainer3: Eli and Daniel, two Korean American brothers, own a struggling shoe store and have an unlikely friendship with Kamilla, a street wise 11-year-old African American girl. Kamilla ditches ...
filmInfoContainer4: From its confrontational title to its striking cinematography, this raw cinematic gem uncompromisingly proves writer/director/actor Justin Chon is a filmmaker to watch.

filmInfoContainer3: Pleasantly plump teenager Tracy Turnblad teaches 1962 Baltimore a thing or two about integration after landing a spot on a local TV dance show.
filmInfoContainer4: Hairspray is an energetic, wholly entertaining musical romp; a fun Summer movie with plenty of heart. Its contagious songs will make you want to get up and start dancing.

filmInfoContainer: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
filmInfoContainer3: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.
filmInfoContainer4: Dark, thrilling, and occasionally quite funny, Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is also visually stunning and emotionally satisfying.

filmInfoContainer3: Human Flow is director and artist Ai Weiwei's detailed and heartbreaking exploration into the global refugee crisis.
filmInfoContainer4: Epic in scope yet clear-eyed and intimate, Human Flow offers a singularly expansive -- and sobering -- perspective on the global refugee crisis.

filmInfoContainer3: Two Los Angeles homicide detectives are dispatched to a northern town where the sun doesn't set to investigate the methodical murder of a local teen.
filmInfoContainer4: Driven by Pacino's performance, Insomnia is a smart and riveting psychological drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman is followed by an unknown supernatural force after a sexual encounter.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, original, and above all terrifying, It Follows is the rare modern horror film that works on multiple levels -- and leaves a lingering sting.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of the Soviet slaughter of thousands of Polish officers and citizens in the Katyn forest in 1940.
filmInfoContainer4: Masterfully crafted by an experienced directorial hand, Katyn is a powerful, personal depiction of wartime tragedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Monica and Quincy love and play basketball together through many life challenges from childhood to adulthood.
filmInfoContainer4: Confident directing and acting deliver an insightful look at young athletes.

filmInfoContainer3: A bank robber arrives to do a job in a small French town and strikes up a friendship with a retired poetry teacher.
filmInfoContainer4: A lovely, contemplative character study with two wonderful performances at its center.

filmInfoContainer3: Photographer Edward Burtynsky travels the world observing changes in landscapes due to industrial work and manufacturing.
The IMF is shut down when it's implicated in the bombing of the Kremlin, causing Ethan Hunt and his new team to go rogue to clear their organization's name.
filmInfoContainer4: Stylish, fast-paced, and loaded with gripping set pieces, the fourth Mission: Impossible is big-budget popcorn entertainment that really works.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the work and surprising success of a four-year-old girl whose paintings have been compared to the likes of Picasso and has raked in hundreds of thousands of dollars.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Amir Bar-Lev grapples with exposing the authenticity of four-year-old Marla's paintings at the sake of burdening her publicly shamed family to transfixing results.

filmInfoContainer3: A filmmaker looks at the history and transformation of his birthplace, Liverpool, England.
filmInfoContainer4: Terrence Davies' heartfelt, sometimes funny new feature documentary is part scrapbook, part confessional.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the life and career of the legendary rhythm and blues musician Ray Charles, from his humble beginnings in the South, where he went blind at age seven, to his meteoric rise to stardom during the 1950s and 1960s.
filmInfoContainer4: An engrossing and energetic portrait of a great musician's achievements and foibles, Ray is anchored by Jamie Foxx's stunning performance as Ray Charles.

filmInfoContainer3: An affluent and unexceptional homemaker in the suburbs develops multiple chemical sensitivity.
filmInfoContainer4: Safe's eerie social satire and somewhat sterile stylization is balanced by comedic undertones and an impressive, understated performance from Julianne Moore.

filmInfoContainer2: Adventure, Crime, Drama, History, Thriller, Western
filmInfoContainer3: Australian western set on the Northern Territory frontier in the 1920s, where justice itself is put on trial when an aged Aboriginal farmhand shoots a white man in self-defense and goes on the run as a posse gathers to hunt him down.
filmInfoContainer4: Sweet Country makes brilliant use of the Australian outback as the setting for a hard-hitting story that satisfies as a character study as well as a sociopolitical statement.

filmInfoContainer3: After being wrongfully imprisoned for thirteen years and having her child taken away from her, a woman seeks revenge through increasingly cruel and brutal means.
filmInfoContainer4: Stylistically flashy and gruesomely violent, Sympathy for Lady Vengeance fits in nicely with the other two films of Park's revenge trilogy.

filmInfoContainer3: During his final days, a dying man is reunited with old friends, former lovers, his ex-wife, and his estranged son.
filmInfoContainer4: A moving and heart-felt film from director Denys Arcand.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary Roosevelt Roughriders, a girls' high-school basketball team in Seattle, and one player's fight to regain her eligibility to play.
filmInfoContainer4: This group of high school girls and their eccentric basketball coach easily win your heart with their unusual humanity and dynamism.

filmInfoContainer3: A young man romantically pursues his masochistic piano teacher.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it makes for rather unpleasant viewing, The Piano Teacher is a riveting and powerful psychosexual drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that follows a billionaire couple as they begin construction on a mansion inspired by Versailles. During the next two years, their empire, fueled by the real estate bubble and cheap money, falters due to the economic crisis.
filmInfoContainer4: The Queen of Versailles is a timely, engaging, and richly drawn portrait of the American Dream improbably composed of equal parts compassion and schadenfreude.

filmInfoContainer3: The brother of Kitty Genovese investigates the circumstances of her murder and the truth of the story that dozens of locals witnessed the crime and did nothing to intervene.
filmInfoContainer4: The Witness can't hope to truly untangle the true crime case at its center, but offers a series of fascinating -- and troubling -- insights in the attempt.

filmInfoContainer3: Is American foreign policy dominated by the idea of military supremacy? Has the military become too important in American life? Jarecki's shrewd and intelligent polemic would seem to give an affirmative answer to each of these questions.
filmInfoContainer4: A provocative and timely film that explores the military/industrial complex and the motivating forces that lead us to war.

filmInfoContainer3: While searching for honey, Pooh and his friends embark on an adventure to find Eeyore's missing tail and rescue Christopher Robin from an unknown monster called, The Backson.
filmInfoContainer4: Short, nostalgic, and gently whimsical, Winnie the Pooh offers young audiences -- and their parents -- a sweetly traditional family treat.

filmInfoContainer3: Thirtysomething Suat still lives with his parents and works at his father's store when not practicing as goalie for the local football team, Esnaf Spor. The neighborhood's greatest wish is ...
filmInfoContainer4: A spirited film that explores gender politics with comedy, intelligence, and a variety of interesting characters.

filmInfoContainer3: A recently unemployed single father struggles to get back his foreclosed home by working for the real estate broker who is the source of his frustration.
filmInfoContainer4: Fueled by powerful acting and a taut, patiently constructed narrative, 99 Homes is a modern economic parable whose righteous fury is matched by its intelligence and compassion.
