filmInfoContainer3: Cowboy and Indian's only wish was to come up with a brilliant idea for Mr Horse's birthday, but when their plan ends up in utter disaster, they'll need to travel the world and back to make things right again.
filmInfoContainer4: A Town Called Panic is a raucous, endlessly creative animated romp with a quirky, adult sense of humor.

filmInfoContainer3: Tells the story of a young woman's relentless search for her fiancé, who has disappeared from the trenches of the Somme during World War One.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-crafted and visually arresting drama with a touch of whimsy.

filmInfoContainer3: Filmmaker Davis Guggenheim follows Al Gore on the lecture circuit, as the former presidential candidate campaigns to raise public awareness of the dangers of global warming and calls for immediate action to curb its destructive effects on the environment.
filmInfoContainer4: This candid, powerful and informative documentary illuminates some of the myths surrounding its dual subjects: global warming and Al Gore.

filmInfoContainer3: A single mother and waitress, a misanthropic author, and a gay artist form an unlikely friendship after the artist is assaulted in a robbery.
filmInfoContainer4: James L. Brooks and Jack Nicholson, doing what they do best, combine smart dialogue and flawless acting to squeeze fresh entertainment value out of the romantic-comedy genre.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Drama, Family, Fantasy, Musical, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: When a shy groom practices his wedding vows in the inadvertent presence of a deceased young woman, she rises from the grave assuming he has married her.
filmInfoContainer4: As can be expected from a Tim Burton movie, Corpse Bride is whimsically macabre, visually imaginative, and emotionally bittersweet.

filmInfoContainer3: Dheepan is a Sri Lankan Tamil warrior who flees to France and ends up working as a caretaker outside Paris.
filmInfoContainer4: Dheepan offers a timely, powerful look at the modern immigrant experience in Europe.

filmInfoContainer3: When a member of a popular New York City improv troupe gets a huge break, the rest of the group - all best friends - start to realize that not everyone is going to make it after all.
filmInfoContainer4: Don't Think Twice offers a bittersweet look at the comedian's life that's as genuinely moving as it is laugh-out-loud funny -- and a brilliant calling card for writer-director Mike Birbiglia.

filmInfoContainer3: Follows three men who are in love with a most beautiful waitress: An intellectual restaurant owner, a mysterious musician and an erratic businessman; taking place during the WWII.
filmInfoContainer4: Gloomy Sunday is beautiful, well-acted, and every bit as downcast as its title.

filmInfoContainer3: Multimedia artist Laurie Anderson reflects on her relationship with her beloved terrier Lolabelle.
filmInfoContainer4: Of a piece with much of director Laurie Anderson's idiosyncratic output, Heart of a Dog delves into weighty themes with lyrical, haunting grace.

filmInfoContainer3: Few are aware that America may be on the brink of a financial meltdown. I.O.U.S.A. explores the country's shocking current fiscal condition and ways to avoid a national economic disaster.
filmInfoContainer4: A potent and lithely constructed documentary about America's financial crisis, I.O.U.S.A grabs you with figures but holds you with irreverent wit.

filmInfoContainer3: In a story depicted in oil painted animation, a young man comes to the last hometown of painter Vincent van Gogh to deliver the troubled artist's final letter and ends up investigating his final days there.
filmInfoContainer4: Loving Vincent's dazzling visual achievements make this Van Gogh biopic well worth seeking out -- even if its narrative is far less effectively composed.

filmInfoContainer3: A depressed musician reunites with his lover. Though their romance, which has already endured several centuries, is disrupted by the arrival of her uncontrollable younger sister.
filmInfoContainer4: Worth watching for Tom Hiddleston and Tilda Swinton's performances alone, Only Lovers Left Alive finds writer-director Jim Jarmusch adding a typically offbeat entry to the vampire genre.

filmInfoContainer3: The Buckmans are a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse.
filmInfoContainer4: Bolstered by a delightful cast, Parenthood is a funny and thoughtfully crafted look at the best and worst moments of family life that resonates broadly.

filmInfoContainer3: A journalist covering police assigned to a juvenile division enters an affair with one of her subjects.
filmInfoContainer4: Polisse is a gripping and powerful procedural drama filled with fine acting and unflinching eye for truth and brutality.

filmInfoContainer3: Stronger is the inspiring real life story of Jeff Bauman, an ordinary man who captured the hearts of his city and the world to become a symbol of hope after surviving the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing.
filmInfoContainer4: Stronger rises on the power of its well-chosen ensemble to offer an emotionally resonant fact-based story that transcends inspirational drama clichés.

filmInfoContainer3: A man raised by gorillas must decide where he really belongs when he discovers he is a human.
filmInfoContainer4: Disney's Tarzan takes the well-known story to a new level with spirited animation, a brisk pace, and some thrilling action set-pieces..

filmInfoContainer3: A woman who studies butterflies and moths tests the limits of her relationship with her lesbian lover.
filmInfoContainer4: Stylish, sensual, and smart, The Duke of Burgundy proves that erotic cinema can have genuine substance.

filmInfoContainer3: An extremely volatile and dangerous Englishman goes to Los Angeles to find the man he considers responsible for his daughter's death.
filmInfoContainer4: Crafted with eccentric moodiness and style by Steven Soderbergh, The Limey is also a gritty neo-noir showcase for the talent of leading man Terence Stamp.

filmInfoContainer3: Cellist Yo-Yo Ma and other international artists of The Silk Road Project discuss their philosophies on music and culture.
filmInfoContainer4: The Music of Strangers: Yo-Yo Ma and the Silk Road Ensemble offers a thrilling and too-rare glimpse of art's power to bridge personal and cultural divides.

filmInfoContainer3: A brilliant plastic surgeon, haunted by past tragedies, creates a type of synthetic skin that withstands any kind of damage. His guinea pig: a mysterious and volatile woman who holds the key to his obsession.
filmInfoContainer4: The Skin I Live In lacks Almodovar's famously charged romance, replaced with a wonderfully bizarre and unpredictable detour into arthouse ick.

filmInfoContainer3: In late 1950s New York, Tom Ripley, a young underachiever, is sent to Italy to retrieve Dickie Greenleaf, a rich and spoiled millionaire playboy. But when the errand fails, Ripley takes extreme measures.
filmInfoContainer4: With Matt Damon's unsettling performance offering a darkly twisted counterpoint to Anthony Minghella's glossy direction, The Talented Mr. Ripley is a suspense thriller that lingers.

filmInfoContainer3: A film about the war crimes of the American diplomat, Henry Kissinger.
filmInfoContainer4: This compelling unauthorized biography takes a muckraker's view of the controversial diplomat.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of New Zealander Burt Munro, who spent years rebuilding a 1920 Indian motorcycle, which helped him set the land speed world record at Utah's Bonneville Salt Flats in 1967.
filmInfoContainer4: Overcomes its formulaic storyline thanks to Anthony Hopkins' warm and endearing portrayal of an age-defying thrill seeker.

filmInfoContainer3: Joseph, a man plagued by violence and a rage that is driving him to self-destruction, earns a chance of redemption that appears in the form of Hannah, a Christian charity shop worker.
filmInfoContainer4: Tyrannosaur is a brutal, frank, and ultimately rewarding story of violent men seeking far-off redemption.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in the near-future, technology controls nearly all aspects of life. But when Grey, a self-identified technophobe, has his world turned upside down, his only hope for revenge is an experimental computer chip implant called Stem.
filmInfoContainer4: Like its augmented protagonist, Upgrade's old-fashioned innards get a high-tech boost -- one made even more powerful thanks to sharp humor and a solidly well-told story.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in contemporary Chicago, amid a time of turmoil, four women with nothing in common except a debt left behind by their dead husbands' criminal activities, take fate into their own hands, and conspire to forge a future on their own terms.
filmInfoContainer4: Widows rounds up a stellar ensemble for a heist thriller that mixes popcorn entertainment with a message - and marks another artistic leap for director Steve McQueen.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1962, the United States government enlists the help of Mutants with superhuman abilities to stop a malicious dictator who is determined to start World War III.
filmInfoContainer4: With a strong script, stylish direction, and powerful performances from its well-rounded cast, X-Men: First Class is a welcome return to form for the franchise.

filmInfoContainer3: A man upon retirement, embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding, only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected.
filmInfoContainer4: In this funny, touching character study, Nicholson gives one of the best performances of his career.

filmInfoContainer3: In a poor working class London home Penny's love for her partner, taxi-driver Phil, has run dry, but when an unexpected tragedy occurs, they and their local community are brought together, and they rediscover their love.
filmInfoContainer4: All or Nothing's depiction of the working-class can be depressingly bleak, but the performances are wonderfully true to life.

filmInfoContainer3: Two American college students on a walking tour of Britain are attacked by a werewolf that none of the locals will admit exists.
filmInfoContainer4: Terrifying and funny in almost equal measure, John Landis' horror-comedy crosses genres while introducing Rick Baker's astounding make-up effects.

filmInfoContainer3: A recently-deceased husband and wife commission a bizarre demon to drive an obnoxious family out of their home.
filmInfoContainer4: Brilliantly bizarre and overflowing with ideas, Beetlejuice offers some of Michael Keaton's most deliciously manic work - and creepy, funny fun for the whole family.

filmInfoContainer3: 160 elite U.S. soldiers drop into Somalia to capture two top lieutenants of a renegade warlord and find themselves in a desperate battle with a large force of heavily-armed Somalis.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it's light on character development and cultural empathy, Black Hawk Down is a visceral, pulse-pounding portrait of war, elevated by Ridley Scott's superb technical skill.

filmInfoContainer3: A former boxer-turned-drug runner lands in a prison battleground after a deal gets deadly.
filmInfoContainer4: Brawl in Cell Block 99 rides a committed Vince Vaughn performance into the brutally violent -- and undeniably entertaining -- depths of prison-set grindhouse genre fare.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenage loner pushes his way into the underworld of a high school crime ring to investigate the disappearance of his ex-girlfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: This entertaining homage to noirs past has been slickly and compellingly updated to a contemporary high school setting.

filmInfoContainer3: When a cockerel apparently flies into a chicken farm, the chickens see him as an opportunity to escape their evil owners.
filmInfoContainer4: Chicken Run has all the charm of Nick Park's Wallace & Gromit, and something for everybody. The voice acting is fabulous, the slapstick is brilliant, and the action sequences are spectacular.

filmInfoContainer: Client 9: The Rise and Fall of Eliot Spitzer
filmInfoContainer3: An in-depth look at the rise and fall of New York Governor Eliot Spitzer, including interviews with the scandalized, former politician.
Fact-based drama set during the 1967 Detroit riots in which a group of rogue police officers respond to a complaint with retribution rather than justice on their minds.
filmInfoContainer4: Detroit delivers a gut-wrenching -- and essential -- dramatization of a tragic chapter from America's past that draws distressing parallels to the present.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: A young maiden in a land called Andalasia, who is prepared to be wed, is sent away to New York City by an evil queen, where she falls in love with a lawyer.
filmInfoContainer4: A smart re-imagining of fairy tale tropes that's sure to delight children and adults, Enchanted features witty dialogue, sharp animation, and a star turn by Amy Adams.

filmInfoContainer2: Action, Drama, History, Romance, Thriller, War
filmInfoContainer3: A drama centered on two fighters in the Holger Danske World War II resistance group.
filmInfoContainer4: The true story of the Danish resistance in WW2, though lengthy and sprawling, is gripping and competently made.

filmInfoContainer3: The Guardians must fight to keep their newfound family together as they unravel the mystery of Peter Quill's true parentage.
filmInfoContainer4: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2's action-packed plot, dazzling visuals, and irreverent humor add up to a sequel that's almost as fun -- if not quite as thrillingly fresh -- as its predecessor.

filmInfoContainer3: A middle-aged woman finds herself in the middle of a huge conflict that will either make her a profit or cost her life.
filmInfoContainer4: Tarantino's third film, fashioned as a comeback vehicle for star Pam Grier, offers typical wit and charm -- and is typically overstuffed.

filmInfoContainer3: The Dragon Warrior has to clash against the savage Tai Lung as China's fate hangs in the balance. However, the Dragon Warrior mantle is supposedly mistaken to be bestowed upon an obese panda who is a novice in martial arts.
filmInfoContainer4: Kung Fu Panda has a familiar message, but the pleasing mix of humor, swift martial arts action, and colorful animation makes for winning Summer entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: Two newly paired cops who are complete opposites must put aside their differences in order to catch a gang of drug smugglers.
filmInfoContainer4: The most successful installment in a phenomenally successful series, Lethal Weapon helped redefine action movies for the 1980s and 1990s.

filmInfoContainer3: Ivan Locke, a dedicated family man and successful construction manager, receives a phone call on the eve of the biggest challenge of his career that sets in motion a series of events that threaten his carefully cultivated existence.
filmInfoContainer4: A one-man show set in a single confined location, Locke demands a powerful performance -- and gets it from a never-more-compelling Tom Hardy.

filmInfoContainer3: Two brothers attempt to pull off a heist during a NASCAR race in North Carolina.
filmInfoContainer4: High-octane fun that's smartly assembled without putting on airs, Logan Lucky marks a welcome end to Steven Soderbergh's retirement -- and proves he hasn't lost his ability to entertain.

filmInfoContainer3: Kenichi and his uncle Shunsaku Ban must find the mystery behind robot girl Tima.
filmInfoContainer4: A remarkable technical achievement, Metropolis' eye-popping visuals more than compensate for its relatively routine story.

filmInfoContainer3: A law firm brings in its "fixer" to remedy the situation after a lawyer has a breakdown while representing a chemical company that he knows is guilty in a multibillion-dollar class action suit.
filmInfoContainer4: Michael Clayton is one of the most sharply scripted films of 2007, with an engrossing premise and faultless acting. Director Tony Gilroy succeeds not only in capturing the audience's attention, but holding it until the credits roll.

filmInfoContainer3: Two best friends living on the streets of Portland as hustlers embark on a journey of self discovery and find their relationship stumbling along the way.
filmInfoContainer4: A tantalizing glimpse of a talented director and his stars all at the top of their respective games, Gus Van Sant's loose reworking of Henry IV is smart, sad and audacious.

filmInfoContainer3: Is he the village idiot or a genius in disguise? 17 year old Noi drifts through life on a remote fjord in the north of Iceland. In winter, the fjord is cut off from the outside world, ...
filmInfoContainer4: A darkly humorous, quirky coming-of-age film, enhanced by its Icelandic setting.

filmInfoContainer3: Young nobleman Orlando is commanded by Queen Elizabeth I to stay forever young. Miraculously, he does just that. The film follows him as he moves through several centuries of British ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Orlando can't match its visual delights with equally hefty narrative -- but it's so much fun to watch that it doesn't need to.

filmInfoContainer3: A psychologically troubled novelty supplier is nudged towards a romance with an English woman, all the while being extorted by a phone-sex line run by a crooked mattress salesman, and purchasing stunning amounts of pudding.
filmInfoContainer4: Odd, touching, and unique, Punch-Drunk Love is also delightfully funny, utilizing Adam Sandler's comic persona to explore the life of a lonely guy who finds love.

filmInfoContainer3: The first chapter of a two-part story centered on a battle fought in China's Three Kingdoms period (220-280 A.D.).
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring some impressively grand battlefield action, John Woo returns to Asia and returns to form in the process for this lavish and slick historical epic.

filmInfoContainer3: Scott Pilgrim must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes in order to win her heart.
filmInfoContainer4: Its script may not be as dazzling as its eye-popping visuals, but Scott Pilgrim vs. the World is fast, funny, and inventive.

filmInfoContainer3: A black-and-white study of a social environment in London, concentrating on a pair of unlikely new friends and the girl they both fancy.
filmInfoContainer4: Shane Meadows hits the spot with this short but sweet slice of good natured comedy, surprisingly, as it's essentially an extended black & white advert for a train station.

filmInfoContainer3: Steve Jobs takes us behind the scenes of the digital revolution, to paint a portrait of the man at its epicenter. The story unfolds backstage at three iconic product launches, ending in 1998 with the unveiling of the iMac.
filmInfoContainer4: Like the tech giant co-founded by its subject, Steve Jobs gathers brilliant people to deliver a product whose elegance belies the intricate complexities at its core.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Chesley Sullenberger, an American pilot who became a hero after landing his damaged plane on the Hudson River in order to save the flight's passengers and crew.
filmInfoContainer4: As comfortingly workmanlike as its protagonist, Sully makes solid use of typically superlative work from its star and director to deliver a quietly stirring tribute to an everyday hero.

filmInfoContainer3: An account of Baron Munchausen's supposed travels and fantastical experiences with his band of misfits.
filmInfoContainer4: Bursting with Terry Gilliam's typically imaginative flourishes, this story of a possibly deranged Baron recounting his storied life is a flamboyant and witty visual treat.

filmInfoContainer3: A cover-up that spanned four U.S. Presidents pushed the country's first female newspaper publisher and a hard-driving editor to join an unprecedented battle between the press and the government.
filmInfoContainer4: The Post's period setting belies its bitingly timely themes, brought compellingly to life by director Steven Spielberg and an outstanding ensemble cast.

filmInfoContainer: This Film Is Not Yet Rated
filmInfoContainer3: Kirby Dick's exposé about the American movie ratings board.
filmInfoContainer4: A fascinating and entertaining film that will open many eyes to the often-questioned tactics of the MPAA and their ratings sytem.

filmInfoContainer3: When a lottery winner dies of shock, his fellow townsfolk attempt to claim the money.
In New York City, a young girl is caught in the middle of her parents' bitter custody battle.
filmInfoContainer4: It's undeniably difficult to watch at times, but What Maisie Knew ultimately rises on the strength of its solidly sourced script, powerful performances, and empathetic direction.

filmInfoContainer: When the Road Bends... Tales of a Gypsy Caravan
filmInfoContainer3: A brief look into Romani culture and Rom (Gypsies) from around the globe as five famous Romani groups tour the USA. The film visits their families at home in Spain, India, Macedonia and Romania.
filmInfoContainer4: A dynamic doc following five Romani bands is a pleasure for the senses thanks to vibrant colors and eclectic music.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that investigates the birth and death of the electric car, as well as the role of renewable energy and sustainable living in the future.
filmInfoContainer4: A searing indictment of big business and greed, Who Killed The Electric Car? is a well-tuned doc that simultaneously entertains and enrages.

filmInfoContainer3: A freak accident brings together a critically ill mathematician, a grieving mother, and a born-again ex-con.
filmInfoContainer4: Alejandro González Iñárritu deftly weaves an uncommonly structured narrative with panache in 21 Grams, a stylish, haunting drama full of fine performances.

filmInfoContainer3: Military lawyer Lieutenant Daniel Kaffee defends Marines accused of murder. They contend they were acting under orders.
filmInfoContainer4: An old-fashioned courtroom drama with a contemporary edge, A Few Good Men succeeds on the strength of its stars, with Tom Cruise, Demi Moore, and especially Jack Nicholson delivering powerful performances that more than compensate for the predictable plot.

filmInfoContainer3: The life of Cuban poet and novelist, Reinaldo Arenas.
filmInfoContainer4: An impressionistic, fragmented look at Reinaldo Arenas, Before Night Falls' imagery manages to evoke a sense of the writer's artistry, and Bardem's strong performance holds the film together. Finally, a biopic done well.

filmInfoContainer3: In the Nazi-occupied Netherlands during World War II, a Jewish singer infiltrates the regional Gestapo headquarters for the Dutch resistance.
filmInfoContainer4: A furious mix of sex, violence, and moral relativism, Black Book is shamelessly entertaining melodrama.

filmInfoContainer3: After being freed from his life in an underground bunker, a man sets out to make a movie of the only TV show he has ever known.
filmInfoContainer4: Audiences attuned to Brigsby Bear's strange frequency will be moved by its earnest -- and endearingly original -- approach to pop culture's impact and the creative urge.

filmInfoContainer3: Eliezer and Uriel Shkolnik are father and son as well as rival professors in Talmudic Studies. When both men learn that Eliezer will be lauded for his work, their complicated relationship reaches a new peak.
Takes place in the days before Christmas near a little-known border crossing on the Mohawk reservation between New York State and Quebec. Here, the lure of fast money from smuggling ...
filmInfoContainer4: Veteran character actress Melissa Leo delivers a stunning performance in this powerful -- if grim -- indie film.

filmInfoContainer3: A genetically inferior man assumes the identity of a superior one in order to pursue his lifelong dream of space travel.
filmInfoContainer4: Intelligent and scientifically provocative, Gattaca is an absorbing sci fi drama that poses important interesting ethical questions about the nature of science.

filmInfoContainer: Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai
filmInfoContainer3: An African-American Mafia hit man who models himself after the samurai of old finds himself targeted for death by the mob.
filmInfoContainer4: An innovative blend of samurai and gangster lifestyles.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at a few chapters in the life of Poppy, a cheery, colorful, North London schoolteacher whose optimism tends to exasperate those around her.
filmInfoContainer4: Mike Leigh's latest partially-improvised film is a light-hearted comedy with moments that bite, and features a brilliant star turn by Sally Hawkins.

filmInfoContainer3: A dramatization of one man's rescue of Jewish refugees in the German-occupied Polish city of Lvov.
In the summer of 1989, a group of bullied kids band together to destroy a shape-shifting monster, which disguises itself as a clown and preys on the children of Derry, their small Maine town.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-acted and fiendishly frightening with an emotionally affecting story at its core, It amplifies the horror in Stephen King's classic story without losing touch with its heart.

filmInfoContainer3: The lives of two lovelorn spouses from separate marriages, a registered sex offender, and a disgraced ex-police officer intersect as they struggle to resist their vulnerabilities and temptations in suburban Massachusetts.
filmInfoContainer4: Little Children takes a penetrating look at suburbia and its flawed individuals with an unflinching yet humane eye.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Richard and Mildred Loving, a couple whose arrest for interracial marriage in 1960s Virginia began a legal battle that would end with the Supreme Court's historic 1967 decision.
filmInfoContainer4: Loving takes an understated approach to telling a painful -- and still relevant -- real-life tale, with sensitive performances breathing additional life into a superlative historical drama.

filmInfoContainer: Me and You and Everyone We Know
filmInfoContainer3: A lonely shoe salesman and an eccentric performance artist struggle to connect in this unique take on contemporary life.
filmInfoContainer4: Miranda July's debut feature is a charmingly offbeat and observant film about people looking for love.

filmInfoContainer3: A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to a smart script, spectacular set pieces, and charismatic performances from its leads, Men in Black is an entirely satisfying summer blockbuster hit.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game and became an FBI target.
filmInfoContainer4: Powered by an intriguing story and a pair of outstanding performances from Jessica Chastain and Idris Elba, Molly's Game marks a solid debut for writer-director Aaron Sorkin.

filmInfoContainer3: When a man with HIV is fired by his law firm because of his condition, he hires a homophobic small time lawyer as the only willing advocate for a wrongful dismissal suit.
filmInfoContainer4: Philadelphia indulges in some unfortunate clichés in its quest to impart a meaningful message, but its stellar cast and sensitive direction are more than enough to compensate.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1920, Inge, a German national, travels from Norway to rural Minnesota for her arranged marriage to Olaf, a Norwegian farmer; bureaucracy and prejudice cause major complications.
filmInfoContainer4: Finding the right balance between subtle and sentimental, Sweet Land moves beyond other similarly-themed dramas with evocative cinematography that plays an equal role to the talented cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Emperor Kuzco is turned into a llama by his ex-administrator Yzma, and must now regain his throne with the help of Pacha, the gentle llama herder.
filmInfoContainer4: The Emperor's New Groove isn't the most ambitious animated film, but its brisk pace, fresh characters, and big laughs make for a great time for the whole family.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a tourist family in Thailand caught in the destruction and chaotic aftermath of the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami.
filmInfoContainer4: The screenplay isn't quite as powerful as the direction or the acting, but with such an astonishing real-life story at its center, The Impossible is never less than compelling.

filmInfoContainer3: An estranged family gathers together in New York City for an event celebrating the artistic work of their father.
filmInfoContainer4: The Meyerowitz Stories (New and Selected) observes the family dynamic through writer-director Noah Baumbach's bittersweet lens and the impressive efforts of a remarkable cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A psychoanalyst and his family go through profound emotional trauma when their son dies in a scuba diving accident.
filmInfoContainer4: The Son's Room is a moving and contemplative study of grief.

filmInfoContainer2: Drama, Fantasy, Horror, Mystery, Romance, Thriller
filmInfoContainer3: A confused religious girl tries to deny her feelings for a female friend who's in love with her. This causes her suppressed subconsciously-controlled psychokinetic powers to reemerge with devastating results.
filmInfoContainer4: Thelma plays with genre tropes in unexpected ways, delivering a thoughtfully twisty supernatural thriller with a lingering impact.

filmInfoContainer3: A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious, ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.
filmInfoContainer4: A mostly unqualified triumph for James Cameron, who offers a dizzying blend of spectacular visuals and old-fashioned melodrama.

filmInfoContainer3: Home movies, photographs, and recited poetry illustrate the life of Tupac Shakur, one of the most beloved, revolutionary, and volatile hip-hop M.Cs. of all time.
filmInfoContainer4: There's no question where the director's loyalty lies in this one-sided tribute; however, Tupac's charisma makes this doc an engaging sit.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of an English boxer incarcerated in one of Thailand's most notorious prisons as he fights in Muay Thai tournaments to earn his freedom.
filmInfoContainer4: A Prayer Before Dawn is far from an easy watch, but this harrowing prison odyssey delivers rich rewards -- led by an outstanding central performance from Joe Cole.

filmInfoContainer3: After a collision with a shipping container at sea, a resourceful sailor finds himself, despite all efforts to the contrary, staring his mortality in the face.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored by another tremendous performance in a career full of them, All Is Lost offers a moving, eminently worthwhile testament to Robert Redford's ability to hold the screen.

filmInfoContainer3: After being released from prison, Billy is set to visit his parents with his wife, whom he does not actually have. This provokes Billy to act out, as he kidnaps a girl and forces her to act as his wife for the visit.
A romantic comedy centered on the daily lives of five Lebanese women living in Beirut.
filmInfoContainer4: Caramel is both an astute cultural study, and a charming comedic drama from a talented newcomer.

filmInfoContainer3: A head chef quits his restaurant job and buys a food truck in an effort to reclaim his creative promise, while piecing back together his estranged family.
filmInfoContainer4: Chef's charming cast and sharp, funny script add enough spice to make this feel-good comedy a flavorful -- if familiar -- treat.

filmInfoContainer3: Foul-mouthed mutant mercenary Wade Wilson (AKA. Deadpool), brings together a team of fellow mutant rogues to protect a young boy with supernatural abilities from the brutal, time-traveling cyborg, Cable.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it threatens to buckle under the weight of its meta gags, Deadpool 2 is a gory, gleeful lampoon of the superhero genre buoyed by Ryan Reynolds' undeniable charm.

filmInfoContainer: Dracula: Pages from a Virgin's Diary
filmInfoContainer3: A ballet rendition of Bram Stoker's "Dracula", stylized as an Expressionistic silent film.
filmInfoContainer4: Guy Maddin's film is a richly sensuous and dreamy interpretation of Dracula that reinvigorates the genre.

filmInfoContainer3: An old Jewish woman and her African-American chauffeur in the American South have a relationship that grows and improves over the years.
filmInfoContainer4: Warm and smartly paced, and boasting impeccable performances from Morgan Freeman and Jessica Tandy.

filmInfoContainer: Eat That Question: Frank Zappa in His Own Words
filmInfoContainer3: An in-depth look at the life and work of avant-garde musician, Frank Zappa.
filmInfoContainer4: Eat That Question: Frank Zappa in His Own Words offers an illuminating primer for Zappa novices as well as an entertaining retrospective for diehard fans.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1997, when the U.S. president crashes into Manhattan, now a giant maximum security prison, a convicted bank robber is sent in to rescue him.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring an atmospherically grimy futuristic metropolis, Escape from New York is a strange, entertaining jumble of thrilling action and oddball weirdness.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of controversial leader of independent Congo, Patrice Lumumba.
filmInfoContainer4: Ebouaney's fiery performance makes Lumumba compelling.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of french gangster Jacques Mesrine, before he was called Public Enemy N°1.
filmInfoContainer4: It's undeniably uneven, but Vincent Cassel's electrifying performance makes Mesrine: Killer Instinct a gangster biopic worth seeking out.

filmInfoContainer3: An exploration of the last quarter century of the great, if eccentric, British painter J.M.W. Turner's life.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a masterful performance from Timothy Spall and brilliantly directed by Mike Leigh, Mr. Turner is a superior Hollywood biopic.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the true story of the Black September aftermath, about the five men chosen to eliminate the ones responsible for that fateful day.
filmInfoContainer4: Munich can't quite achieve its lofty goals, but this thrilling, politically even-handed look at the fallout from an intractable political conflict is still well worth watching.

filmInfoContainer3: Put in charge of his young son, Alain leaves Belgium for Antibes to live with his sister and her husband as a family. Alain's bond with Stephanie, a killer whale trainer, grows deeper after Stephanie suffers a horrible accident.
filmInfoContainer4: Surging on strong performances from Marion Cotillard and Matthias Schoenaerts, Rust and Bone is as vibrant and messily unpredictable as life itself.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a young journalist who fell from grace when it was discovered he fabricated over half of his articles from the publication The New Republic magazine.
filmInfoContainer4: A compelling look at Stephen Glass' fall from grace.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at Germany's terrorist group, The Red Army Faction (RAF), which organized bombings, robberies, kidnappings and assassinations in the late 1960s and '70s.
filmInfoContainer4: Intricately researched and impressively authentic slice of modern German History, with a terrific cast, assured direction, and a cracking script.

filmInfoContainer3: A young married couple's lives are thrown into a harrowing tailspin when an acquaintance from the husband's past brings mysterious gifts and a horrifying secret to light after more than 20 years.
filmInfoContainer4: The Gift is wickedly smart and playfully subversive, challenging the audience's expectations while leaving them leaning on the edges of their seats.

filmInfoContainer3: An aspiring author during the civil rights movement of the 1960s decides to write a book detailing the African American maids' point of view on the white families for which they work, and the hardships they go through on a daily basis.
filmInfoContainer4: Though arguably guilty of glossing over its racial themes, The Help rises on the strength of its cast -- particularly Viola Davis, whose performance is powerful enough to carry the film on its own.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman who lives in her darkened old family house with her two photosensitive children becomes convinced that the home is haunted.
filmInfoContainer4: The Others is a spooky thriller that reminds us that a movie doesn't need expensive special effects to be creepy.

filmInfoContainer3: After Homer accidentally pollutes the town's water supply, Springfield is encased in a gigantic dome by the EPA and the Simpson family are declared fugitives.
filmInfoContainer4: The Simpsons Movie contains the hearty laughs, biting satire, and honest portrayal of an American family that makes the show so popular. And it boasts slicker animation and polished writing that hearkens back to the show's glory days.

filmInfoContainer: The Vertical Ray of the Sun
filmInfoContainer3: With the brilliant Vietnamese summer as a setting Vertical Ray of the Sun is beautiful from beginning to end. The plot centres around three sisters, two of whom are happily married (or so ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: The Vertical Ray of the Sun is gorgeously, poetically composed, lulling the viewer into its story of everyday life.

filmInfoContainer3: An English Professor tries to deal with his wife leaving him, the arrival of his editor who has been waiting for his book for seven years, and the various problems that his friends and associates involve him in.
filmInfoContainer4: Michael Douglas and Tobey Maguire do wonders in this clever dark comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: When Brent turns down his classmate Lola's invitation to the prom, she concocts a wildly violent plan for revenge.
filmInfoContainer4: Successfully mixing the conventions of the teen and horror genres with a twist, Australian director Sean Byrne makes a striking directorial debut.

filmInfoContainer3: Cornered by the DEA, convicted New York drug dealer Montgomery Brogan reevaluates his life in the 24 remaining hours before facing a seven-year jail term.
filmInfoContainer4: An intelligent and well-acted film despite the usual Spike Lee excesses.

filmInfoContainer3: An unprecedented look at the iconic shower scene in Alfred Hitchcock's Psycho (1960), the "man behind the curtain", and the screen murder that profoundly changed the course of world cinema.
filmInfoContainer4: 78/52: Hitchcock's Shower Scene takes a look at one of modern cinema's most memorable moments, offering insights of value to cineastes and casual viewers alike.

filmInfoContainer3: In this singular exploration of legacy, love, loss, and the enormity of existence, a recently deceased, white-sheeted ghost returns to his suburban home to try to reconnect with his bereft wife.
filmInfoContainer4: A Ghost Story deftly manages its ambitious themes through an inventive, artful, and ultimately poignant exploration of love and loss.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the making of the film Troll 2 (1990) and its journey from being crowned the "worst film of all time" to a cherished cult classic.
Black Dynamite is the greatest African-American action star of the 1970s. When his only brother is killed by The Man, it's up to him to find justice.
filmInfoContainer4: A loving and meticulous send-up of 1970s blaxsploitation movies, Black Dynamite is funny enough for the frat house and clever enough for film buffs.

filmInfoContainer3: The life of musician Blaze Foley.
filmInfoContainer4: As lyrical and bittersweet as the music its subject left behind, Blaze takes a decidedly unconventional -- yet richly rewarding -- approach to the musical biopic.

filmInfoContainer3: In May 1940, the fate of Western Europe hangs on British Prime Minister Winston Churchill, who must decide whether to negotiate with Adolf Hitler, or fight on knowing that it could mean a humiliating defeat for Britain and its empire.
filmInfoContainer4: Darkest Hour is held together by Gary Oldman's electrifying performance, which brings Winston Churchill to life even when the movie's narrative falters.

filmInfoContainer3: Artist and filmmaker David Lynch discusses his early life and the events that shaped his outlook on art and the creative process.
filmInfoContainer4: David Lynch: The Art Life offers a look at the director's life and craft whose unusual approach is in keeping with its subject's singularly strange aesthetic.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of America's obesity epidemic and the food industry's role in aggravating it.
filmInfoContainer4: Compelling and troubling in equal measure, Fed Up is an advocacy documentary that earns its outrage.

filmInfoContainer3: Capturing life on the Italian island of Lampedusa, a frontline in the European migrant crisis.
filmInfoContainer4: Fire at Sea offers a clear-eyed yet empathetic look at a corner of the world whose terrain may be unfamiliar to many, but whose people's story remains universal.

filmInfoContainer3: The alumni cast of a space opera television series have to play their roles as the real thing when an alien race needs their help. However, they also have to defend both Earth and the alien race from a reptilian warlord.
filmInfoContainer4: Intelligent and humorous satire with an excellent cast -- no previous Trekkie knowledge needed to enjoy this one.

filmInfoContainer3: A quietly troubled young man returns home for his mother's funeral after being estranged from his family for a decade.
filmInfoContainer4: Delivering a quirky spin on familiar twentysomething tropes -- with a cannily-placed soundtrack -- Garden State has enough charm to mark a winning debut for first-time director Zach Braff.

filmInfoContainer3: Go! tells the story of the events after a drug deal, told from three different points of view.
filmInfoContainer4: With its sharp dialogue and raucous visuals, Go entertains at an exhilarating pace.

filmInfoContainer3: An ex-hit-man comes out of retirement to track down the gangsters that killed his dog and took everything from him.
filmInfoContainer4: Stylish, thrilling, and giddily kinetic, John Wick serves as a satisfying return to action for Keanu Reeves -- and what looks like it could be the first of a franchise.

filmInfoContainer3: In December 1914, an unofficial Christmas truce on the Western Front allows soldiers from opposing sides of the First World War to gain insight into each other's way of life.
filmInfoContainer4: The poignant humanity on display in Joyeux Noel makes its sentimentality forgivable.

filmInfoContainer3: During the First Lebanon War in 1982, a lone tank and a paratroopers platoon are dispatched to search a hostile town.
filmInfoContainer4: A powerful and personal account of war on the front line, writer-director Samuel Maoz takes the viewer inside an Israeli tank to deliver an exhausting, original film.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Drama, Family, Fantasy, Sci-Fi
filmInfoContainer3: A Hawaiian girl adopts an unusual pet who is actually a notorious extra-terrestrial fugitive.
filmInfoContainer4: Edgier than traditional Disney fare, Lilo and Stitch explores issues of family while providing a fun and charming story.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of notorious French gangster Jacques Mesrine.
filmInfoContainer4: Vincent Cassel is mesmerizing in the lead role. Even if it's less focused than its predecessor, it's more fun.

filmInfoContainer3: In Paris, a Turkish shop owner befriends a Jewish boy in his mid-teens.
filmInfoContainer4: With tender, assured performances, Sharif and Boulanger elevate what might have been a rote coming-of-age tale.

filmInfoContainer3: When Queen Victoria's husband dies, she finds solace in her trusted servant, Mr. Brown, but their relationship also brings scandal and turmoil.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to some top notch acting, the chemistry between its stars, and a witty, thoughtful script, Mrs. Brown delivers a nuanced and entertaining, if not entirely factual, account of a seldom explored historical relationship.

filmInfoContainer3: An inspector hunts down Nobel Prize-winning Chilean poet, Pablo Neruda, who becomes a fugitive in his home country in the late 1940s for joining the Communist Party.
filmInfoContainer4: Inventive, intelligent, and beautifully filmed, Neruda transcends the traditional biopic structure to look at the meaning beyond the details of its subject's life.

filmInfoContainer: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
filmInfoContainer3: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.
filmInfoContainer4: May leave you exhausted like the theme park ride that inspired it; however, you'll have a good time when it's over.

filmInfoContainer3: A U.S. fighter pilot's epic struggle of survival after being shot down on a mission over Laos during the Vietnam War.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Werner Herzog has once again made a compelling tale of man versus nature, and Christian Bale completely immerses himself in the role of fighter pilot (and prisoner of war) Dieter Dengler.

filmInfoContainer3: A glue-sniffing boy and his girlfriend escape the government-controlled no-hope Aboriginal community they live in and go to the city, Alice Springs, looking for a better life.
filmInfoContainer4: Alternately beautiful and heartrending, Samson and Delilah is terrifically acted and shot, and presents a complex portrait of what it means to be Australian.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Shaolin follower reunites with his discouraged brothers to form a soccer team using their martial art skills to their advantage.
filmInfoContainer4: The plot is utterly ridiculous, and the soccer in the movie is unlike any ever played anywhere on Earth, but watching Shaolin Soccer, you will probably find it impossible to care.

filmInfoContainer3: A desk-bound CIA analyst volunteers to go undercover to infiltrate the world of a deadly arms dealer, and prevent diabolical global disaster.
filmInfoContainer4: Simultaneously broad and progressive, Spy offers further proof that Melissa McCarthy and writer-director Paul Feig bring out the best in one another -- and delivers scores of belly laughs along the way.

filmInfoContainer3: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren work to help a family terrorized by a dark presence in their farmhouse.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-crafted and gleefully creepy, The Conjuring ratchets up dread through a series of effective old-school scares.

filmInfoContainer3: An American soldier struggles with an ethical dilemma when he becomes involved with a widow of a fallen officer.
filmInfoContainer4: A dark but timely subject is handled deftly by writer/directer Owen Moverman and superbly acted by Woody Harrleson and Ben Foster.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the relationship between the famous physicist Stephen Hawking and his wife.
filmInfoContainer4: Part biopic, part love story, The Theory of Everything rises on James Marsh's polished direction and the strength of its two leads.

filmInfoContainer3: Five friends who reunite in an attempt to top their epic pub crawl from twenty years earlier unwittingly become humanity's only hope for survival.
filmInfoContainer4: Madcap and heartfelt, Edgar Wright's apocalypse comedy The World's End benefits from the typically hilarious Simon Pegg and Nick Frost, with a plethora of supporting players.

filmInfoContainer3: In a future British tyranny, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V", plots to overthrow it with the help of a young woman.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually stunning and thought-provoking, V For Vendetta's political pronouncements may rile some, but its story and impressive set pieces will nevertheless entertain.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of one woman's one thousand one hundred mile solo hike undertaken as a way to recover from a recent personal tragedy.
filmInfoContainer4: Powerfully moving and emotionally resonant, Wild finds director Jean-Marc Vallée and star Reese Witherspoon working at the peak of their respective powers.

filmInfoContainer3: The X-Men band together to find a mutant assassin who has made an attempt on the President's life, while the Mutant Academy is attacked by military forces.
filmInfoContainer4: Tightly scripted, solidly acted, and impressively ambitious, X2: X-Men United is bigger and better than its predecessor -- and a benchmark for comic sequels in general.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of the tempestuous six year romance between megastar singer, Liberace, and his young lover, Scott Thorson.
filmInfoContainer4: Affectionate without sacrificing honesty, Behind the Candelabra couples award-worthy performances from Michael Douglas and Matt Damon with some typically sharp direction from Steven Soderbergh.

filmInfoContainer3: The film follows the production of seven ballets by the Paris Opera Ballet.
A misfit ant, looking for "warriors" to save his colony from greedy grasshoppers, recruits a group of bugs that turn out to be an inept circus troupe.
filmInfoContainer4: A Bug's Life is a rousing adventure that blends animated thrills with witty dialogue and memorable characters - and another smashing early success for Pixar.

filmInfoContainer3: Larry Gopnik, a Midwestern physics teacher, watches his life unravel over multiple sudden incidents. Though seeking meaning and answers amidst his turmoils, he seems to keep sinking.
filmInfoContainer4: Blending dark humor with profoundly personal themes, the Coen brothers deliver what might be their most mature -- if not their best -- film to date.

filmInfoContainer3: Four young men mistake their lives for a movie and attempt one of the most audacious heists in U.S. history.
filmInfoContainer4: American Animals tangles with a number of weighty themes, but never at the expense of delivering a queasily compelling true crime thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: A bourgeois couple, modern yet conventional. One night by accident, a young prostitute barges into their lives. Hounded down, beaten up, threatened, she will continue to struggle, with the ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Anything but chaotic, Chaos makes a high-energy and award-worthy stab at bourgeois apathy and racial tensions in France, while musing on chance.

filmInfoContainer3: Holden and Banky are comic book artists. Everything's going good for them until they meet Alyssa, also a comic book artist. Holden falls for her, but his hopes are crushed when he finds out she's a lesbian.
filmInfoContainer4: Chasing Amy explores gender roles, sexual mores, and the limits of friendship with a mixture of sensitivity, raw honesty, and director/screenwriter Kevin Smith's signature raunchy humor.

filmInfoContainer3: Chico is a young piano player with big dreams. Rita is a beautiful singer with an extraordinary voice. Music and romantic desire unites them, but their journey - in the tradition of the Latin ballad, the bolero - brings heartache and torment.
After having responded to her son's numerous letters in the guise of his father, a woman hires a stranger to pose as his dad when meeting him.
filmInfoContainer4: Dear Frankie is a small, good-hearted film with fine performances.

filmInfoContainer3: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.
filmInfoContainer4: Taking full advantage of Julia Roberts's considerable talent and appeal, Erin Brockovich overcomes a few character and plot issues to deliver a smart, thoughtful, and funny legal drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A friendship is formed between an ex-gangster, and two groups of hitmen - those who want to protect him and those who were sent to kill him.
filmInfoContainer4: Exiled has non-stop action, tension and style -- making it an excellent summer action movie. Johnnie To brings beautiful scenery and camerawork to the film, enhancing the action even more.

filmInfoContainer3: A story set in Santiago and centered on Gloria, a free-spirited older woman, and the realities of her whirlwind relationship with a former naval officer whom she meets out in the clubs.
filmInfoContainer4: Marvelously directed by Sebastian Lelio and beautifully led by a powerful performance from Paulina Garcia, Gloria takes an honest, sweetly poignant look at a type of character that's all too often neglected in Hollywood.

filmInfoContainer3: A single devastating event intertwines inextricably the lives of an unfortunate teenager, a weary woman with a critical degenerative heart condition and a team of compassionate doctors; all perfect strangers, perfectly interconnected.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully filmed and powerfully written, Heal the Living interweaves seemingly disparate narrative threads to present a vibrant portrait of human connection.

filmInfoContainer3: A mousy governess who softens the heart of her employer soon discovers that he's hiding a terrible secret.
filmInfoContainer4: Cary Fukunaga directs a fiery and elegant adaptation of Charlotte Bronte's classic novel, and Mia Wasikowska delivers possibly the best portrayal of the title character ever.

filmInfoContainer3: When a sports agent has a moral epiphany and is fired for expressing it, he decides to put his new philosophy to the test as an independent agent with the only athlete who stays with him and his former secretary.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored by dazzling performances from Tom Cruise, Cuba Gooding Jr., and Renée Zellweger, as well as Cameron Crowe's tender direction, Jerry Maguire meshes romance and sports with panache.

filmInfoContainer3: A new pair of best friends have their bond tested by their parents' battle over a dress shop lease.
filmInfoContainer4: Little Men takes a compassionate look at the ways in which adult problems impact childhood friendships -- and offers another affecting New York drama from director Ira Sachs.

filmInfoContainer3: Miracle tells the true story of Herb Brooks (Kurt Russell), the player-turned-coach who led the 1980 U.S. Olympic hockey team to victory over the seemingly invincible Russian squad.
filmInfoContainer4: Kurt Russell's performance guides this cliche-ridden tale into the realm of inspirational, nostalgic goodness.

filmInfoContainer3: A modern retelling of Shakespeare's classic comedy about two pairs of lovers with different takes on romance and a way with words.
filmInfoContainer4: Lighthearted to a fault, Much Ado About Nothing's giddy energy and intimate charm make for an entertaining romantic comedy -- and a Shakespearean adaptation that's hard to resist.

filmInfoContainer3: Rize chronicles a dance movement that rises out of South Central Los Angeles with roots in clowning and street youth culture.
filmInfoContainer4: The dances in Rize are electric even if the documentary doesn't go that deeply into the performers' lives.

filmInfoContainer3: A film that explores the dark and miserable town, Basin City, and tells the story of three different people, all caught up in violent corruption.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually groundbreaking and terrifically violent, Sin City brings the dark world of Frank Miller's graphic novel to vivid life.

filmInfoContainer3: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.
filmInfoContainer4: Though perhaps a case of style over substance, Guy Ritchie's second crime caper is full of snappy dialogue, dark comedy, and interesting characters.

filmInfoContainer3: In the summer of 2003, a group of shepherds took a herd of sheep one final time through the Beartooth Mountains of Montana, in the extreme north-west of the United States. It was a journey ...
filmInfoContainer4: At once tender and unsentimental, Sweetgrass gracefully captures the beauty and hardships of a dying way of life.

filmInfoContainer3: A British woman recalls coming of age during World War I - a story of young love, the futility of war, and how to make sense of the darkest times.
filmInfoContainer4: Testament of Youth is well-acted and beautifully filmed, adding up to an enriching if not adventurous experience for fans of British period dramas.

filmInfoContainer3: While training at the gym 11-year-old tomboy Toni becomes entranced with a dance troupe. As she struggles to fit in she finds herself caught up in danger as the group begins to suffer from fainting spells and other violent fits.
filmInfoContainer4: As gripping as it is unique, the thrillingly kinetic The Fits marks debuting writer-director Anna Rose Holmer as a singular talent.

filmInfoContainer3: In November 1984, the Soviet Union's best submarine captain in their newest sub violates orders and heads for the U.S. Is he trying to defect or to start a war?
filmInfoContainer4: Perfectly cast and packed with suspense, The Hunt for Red October is an old-fashioned submarine thriller with plenty of firepower to spare.

filmInfoContainer3: Three stories set in three times, 1911, 1966 and 2005. Two actors play the two main characters in each story.
filmInfoContainer4: Slowly paced, understated, and exquisitely shot, these are three lovely odes to love and longing.

filmInfoContainer3: On his first day on the job as a Los Angeles narcotics officer, a rookie cop goes beyond a full work day in training within the narcotics division of the L.A.P.D. with a rogue detective who isn't what he appears to be.
filmInfoContainer4: The ending may be less than satisfying, but Denzel Washington reminds us why he's such a great actor in this taut and brutal police drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A reclusive beekeeper slowly pulls his dysfunctional family back together, but not without having to fight his son's previous dastardly cohorts.
Life for a pair of veteran actors gets turned upside down after they meet a brash teenager.
filmInfoContainer4: Audiences may attend to witness Peter O'Toole's Oscar-worthy performance, but they'll also be treated to a humane, tender exploration of maturing with both dignity and irreverence.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Mussolini's secret lover, Ida Dalser, and their son Albino.
filmInfoContainer4: Part political treatise, part melodrama, Marco Bellocchio's Mussolini biopic forsakes historical details in favor of absorbing emotion -- and provides a showcase for a stunning performance from Giovanna Mezzogiorno.

filmInfoContainer3: Jack Rebney is the most famous man you've never heard of - after cursing his way through a Winnebago sales video, Rebney's outrageously funny outtakes became an underground sensation and ...
filmInfoContainer4: Though it doesn't quite answer all of the questions it raises, Winnebago Man is nevertheless a fascinating, hilarious, and surprisingly poignant look at a geniunely colorful internet celebrity.

filmInfoContainer3: Babe, a pig raised by sheepdogs, learns to herd sheep with a little help from Farmer Hoggett.
filmInfoContainer4: The rare family-friendly feature with a heart as big as its special effects budget, Babe offers timeless entertainment for viewers of all ages.

filmInfoContainer3: North Carolina produces more tobacco than any other state in America. Bright Leaves describes a journey taken across the social, economic, and psychological tobacco terrain of North ...
filmInfoContainer4: A rich, eccentric documentary about both filmmaking and the tobacco industry.

filmInfoContainer3: Strange things begin to happen when a group of friends gather for a dinner party on an evening when a comet is passing overhead.
filmInfoContainer4: A case study in less-is-more filmmaking, Coherence serves as a compelling low-budget calling card for debuting writer-director James Ward Byrkit.

filmInfoContainer3: During WWII, four North African men enlist in the French army to liberate that country from Nazi oppression, and to fight French discrimination.
filmInfoContainer4: Days of Glory is a powerful historical epic that pays homage to a valiant group of soldiers whose sacrifices have largely been forgotten.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Sir J.M. Barrie's friendship with a family who inspired him to create Peter Pan.
filmInfoContainer4: It won't pass muster for those looking for historical accuracy, but Finding Neverland is a warm, heartfelt drama with a charm all its own -- and Johnny Depp gives a graceful performance as Peter Pan creator J.M. Barrie.

filmInfoContainer3: Cambodian author and human rights activist Loung Ung recounts the horrors she suffered as a child under the rule of the deadly Khmer Rouge.
filmInfoContainer4: First They Killed My Father tackles its subject matter with grace, skill, and empathy, offering a ground-level look at historic atrocities that resonates beyond its story's borders.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of Yokohama teens look to save their school's clubhouse from the wrecking ball in preparations for the 1964 Tokyo Olympics.
filmInfoContainer4: Gentle and nostalgic, From Up on Poppy Hill is one of Studio Ghibli's sweeter efforts -- and if it doesn't push the boundaries of the genre, it remains as engagingly lovely as Ghibli fans have come to expect.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on the electric guitar from the point of view of three significant rock musicians: the Edge, Jimmy Page and Jack White.
filmInfoContainer4: An affectionate tribute to rock's most distinctive instrument, It Might Get Loud is insightful and musically satisfying.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the life of Alfred Kinsey, a pioneer in the area of human sexuality research, whose 1948 publication "Sexual Behavior in the Human Male" was one of the first recorded works that saw science address sexual behavior.
filmInfoContainer4: A biopic of the sex researcher is hailed as adventurous, clever, and subversive, with fine performances by Liam Neeson and Laura Linney.

filmInfoContainer3: A delusional young man strikes up an unconventional relationship with a doll he finds on the Internet.
filmInfoContainer4: Lars and the Real Girl could've so easily been a one-joke movie. But the talented cast, a great script, and direction never condescends to its character or the audience.

filmInfoContainer3: A successful cocaine dealer gets two tough assignments from his boss on the eve of his planned early retirement.
filmInfoContainer4: A stylized, electric British crime thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: The students of several New York City elementary schools learn ballroom dancing and compete in a city wide dance competition.
filmInfoContainer4: This heartwarming documentary will win audiences over, as the sheer charm of precocious, enthusiastic children learning to dance resonates from the screen.

filmInfoContainer3: Paris, 1920s. Marguerite Dumont is a wealthy woman, lover of the music and the opera. She loves to sing for her friends, although she's not a good singer. Both her friends and her husband ...
filmInfoContainer4: Touching, funny, and thoughtful, Marguerite honors its real-life inspiration with a well-acted and ultimately inspirational look at the nature of art and the value of a dream.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the life of Aileen Wuornos, a Daytona Beach prostitute who became a serial killer.
filmInfoContainer4: Charlize Theron gives a searing, deglamorized performance as real life serial killer Aileen Wuornos in Monster, an intense, disquieting portrait of a profoundly damaged soul.

filmInfoContainer3: Two 1990s teenage siblings find themselves in a 1950s sitcom, where their influence begins to profoundly change that complacent world.
filmInfoContainer4: Filled with lighthearted humor, timely social commentary, and dazzling visuals, Pleasantville is an artful blend of subversive satire and well-executed Hollywood formula.

filmInfoContainer3: A local Pennsylvania band scores a one hit wonder in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as they can, with lots of help from its manager.
filmInfoContainer4: A light, sweet, and thoroughly entertaining debut for director Tom Hanks, That Thing You Do! makes up in charm what it lacks in complexity.

filmInfoContainer3: A former radio DJ, suicidally despondent because of a terrible mistake he made, finds redemption in helping a deranged homeless man who was an unwitting victim of that mistake.
filmInfoContainer4: An odd but affecting mixture of drama, comedy and fantasy, The Fisher King manages to balance moving performances from Robin Williams and Jeff Bridges with director Terry Gilliam's typically askew universe.

filmInfoContainer: The Good, the Bad, the Weird
filmInfoContainer3: The story of two outlaws and a bounty hunter in 1940s Manchuria and their rivalry to possess a treasure map while being pursued by the Japanese army and Chinese bandits.
filmInfoContainer4: Whilst never taking itself too seriously, this riotous and rollicking Sergio Leone-inspired Korean Western is serious fun.

filmInfoContainer3: Paloma is a serious and highly articulate but deeply bored 11-year-old who has decided to kill herself on her 12th birthday. Fascinated by art and philosophy, she questions and documents ...
A Naval veteran arrives home from war unsettled and uncertain of his future - until he is tantalized by The Cause and its charismatic leader.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart and solidly engrossing, The Master extends Paul Thomas Anderson's winning streak of challenging films for serious audiences.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the true story of Forrest Tucker and his audacious escape from San Quentin at the age of 70 to an unprecedented string of heists that confounded authorities and enchanted the public.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-told story brought to life by a beautifully matched cast, The Old Man & the Gun is pure, easygoing entertainment for film fans - and a fitting farewell to a legend.

filmInfoContainer3: An employee of a corporation with a lucrative secret process is tempted to betray it. But there's more to it than that.

Shy 14-year-old Duncan goes on summer vacation with his mother, her overbearing boyfriend, and her boyfriend's daughter. Having a rough time fitting in, Duncan finds an unexpected friend in Owen, manager of the Water Wizz water park.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite its familiar themes, The Way Way Back makes use of its talented cast, finely tuned script, and an abundance of charm to deliver a funny and satisfying coming-of-age story.

filmInfoContainer3: A traumatized veteran, unafraid of violence, tracks down missing girls for a living. When a job spins out of control, Joe's nightmares overtake him as a conspiracy is uncovered leading to what may be his death trip or his awakening.
filmInfoContainer4: Bracingly elevated by a typically committed lead performance from Joaquin Phoenix, You Were Never Really Here confirms writer-director Lynne Ramsay as one of modern cinema's most unique -- and uncompromising -- voices.

filmInfoContainer3: A troubled woman living in an isolated community finds herself pulled between the control of her oppressive family and the allure of a secretive outsider suspected of a series of brutal murders.
filmInfoContainer4: Beast plays like bleak poetry, unfurling its psychological thrills while guided by its captivating leads and mesmerizing, visceral visuals.

filmInfoContainer3: In the dying days of the old west, an elderly sheriff and his posse set out to rescue their town's doctor from cannibalistic cave dwellers.
filmInfoContainer4: Bone Tomahawk's peculiar genre blend won't be for everyone, but its gripping performances and a slow-burning story should satisfy those in search of something different.

filmInfoContainer3: Sint-Truiden, Belgium. Jacky, a young cattle farmer who is constantly pumped on steroids and hormones, is approached by a veterinarian to make a deal with a notorious beef trader.
Two British track athletes, one a determined Jew, and the other a devout Christian, compete in the 1924 Olympics.
filmInfoContainer4: Decidedly slower and less limber than the Olympic runners at the center of its story, the film nevertheless manages to make effectively stirring use of its spiritual and patriotic themes.

filmInfoContainer3: An east European girl goes to America with her young son, expecting it to be like a Hollywood film.
filmInfoContainer4: Dancer in Dark can be grim, dull, and difficult to watch, but even so, it has a powerful and moving performance from Bjork and is something quite new and visionary.

filmInfoContainer3: When a criminal mastermind uses a trio of orphan girls as pawns for a grand scheme, he finds their love is profoundly changing him for the better.
filmInfoContainer4: Borrowing heavily (and intelligently) from Pixar and Looney Tunes, Despicable Me is a surprisingly thoughtful, family-friendly treat with a few surprises of its own.

filmInfoContainer3: A dramatization of the Black Sox scandal when the underpaid Chicago White Sox accepted bribes to deliberately lose the 1919 World Series.
filmInfoContainer4: Perhaps less than absorbing for non-baseball fans, but nevertheless underpinned by strong performances from the cast and John Sayles' solid direction.

filmInfoContainer3: Jon, a young wanna-be musician, discovers he's bitten off more than he can chew when he joins an eccentric pop band led by the mysterious and enigmatic Frank.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, clever, and endearingly unusual, Frank transcends its quirky trappings with a heartfelt -- and surprisingly thought-provoking -- story.

filmInfoContainer: I Am Big Bird: The Caroll Spinney Story
filmInfoContainer3: Caroll Spinney has been Sesame Street's Big Bird and Oscar the Grouch since 1969; at 78-years-old, he has no intention of stopping.
filmInfoContainer4: Every bit as good-natured as longtime fans might hope, I Am Big Bird: The Carroll Spinney Story offers heartwarming behind-the-scenes perspective on a cultural icon.

filmInfoContainer3: Several lonely hearts in a semi-provincial suburb of a town in Denmark use a beginner's course in Italian as the platform to meet the romance of their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: Unlike many romantic comedies, the charming Italian for Beginners feels natural and genuinely heart-warming.

filmInfoContainer3: A bullied young boy befriends a young female vampire who lives in secrecy with her guardian.
filmInfoContainer4: Similar to the original in all the right ways -- but with enough changes to stand on its own -- Let Me In is the rare Hollywood remake that doesn't add insult to inspiration.

filmInfoContainer3: The enchanted lives of a couple in a secluded forest are brutally shattered by a nightmarish hippie cult and their demon-biker henchmen, propelling a man into a spiraling, surreal rampage of vengeance.
filmInfoContainer4: Mandy's gonzo violence is fueled by a gripping performance by Nicolas Cage -- and anchored with palpable emotion conveyed between his volcanic outbursts.

filmInfoContainer3: Follows the key people at an investment bank, over a 24-hour period, during the early stages of the 2008 financial crisis.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, tightly wound, and solidly acted, Margin Call turns the convoluted financial meltdown of '08 into gripping, thought-provoking drama.

filmInfoContainer3: This is the story of those who live as if every day was a constant Sunday, those who spend their Mondays in the sun. The story of people who worked in a dockyard but are now unemployed.
filmInfoContainer4: Javier Bardem gives an outstanding performance in this hought-provoking (though occasionally plodding) movie about the effects of unemployment on a group of former shipyard workers.

filmInfoContainer3: A poet falls for a beautiful courtesan whom a jealous duke covets.
filmInfoContainer4: A love-it-or-hate-it experience, Moulin Rouge is all style, all giddy, over-the-top spectacle. But it's also daring in its vision and wildly original.

filmInfoContainer3: When a Vienna museum guard befriends an enigmatic visitor, the grand Kunsthistorisches Art Museum becomes a mysterious crossroads that sparks explorations of their lives, the city, and the ways in which works of art reflect and shape the world.
filmInfoContainer4: Its languid pace may frustrate some viewers, but for patient filmgoers, Museum Hours offers a carefully observed portrait of the human condition.

filmInfoContainer3: Paul is preparing to leave Tajikistan, while thinking back on his adolescent years. His childhood, his mother's madness, the parties, the trip to the USSR where he lost his virginity, the friend who betrayed him and the love of his life.
The last year of singer Nico's life, as she tours and grapples with addiction and personal demons.
filmInfoContainer4: Nico, 1988 takes an absorbing -- and appropriately idiosyncratic -- look at the singer's later years.

filmInfoContainer3: An ecological drama/documentary, filmed throughout the globe. Part thriller, part meditation on the vanishing wonders of the sub-aquatic world.
filmInfoContainer4: Oceans adds another visually stunning chapter to the Disney Nature library.

filmInfoContainer3: When the head of a statue sacred to a village is stolen, a young martial artist goes to the big city and finds himself taking on the underworld to retrieve it.
filmInfoContainer4: While Ong-Bak: The Thai Warrior may be no great shakes as a movie, critics are hailing the emergence of a new star in Tony Jaa, whose athletic performance is drawing comparisons with Bruce Lee, Jackie Chan, and Jet Li.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing and the aftermath, which includes the city-wide manhunt to find the terrorists responsible.
filmInfoContainer4: Patriots Day offers a stirring, solidly crafted tribute to the heroes of a real-life American tragedy without straying into exploitative action thriller territory.

filmInfoContainer3: The relationship between Sid Vicious, bassist for British punk group The Sex Pistols, and his girlfriend Nancy Spungen is portrayed.
filmInfoContainer4: Visceral, energetic, and often very sad, Sid and Nancy is also a surprisingly touching love story, and Gary Oldman is outstanding as the late punk rock icon Sid Vicious.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenaged skateboarder makes friends with a bunch of other skateboarding girls in New York City.
filmInfoContainer4: Skate Kitchen takes a beguiling slice-of-life approach to its characters, approaching its timely themes with a light hand that serves the story well.

filmInfoContainer3: A filmed account of the Zaire 74 soul music festival, originally intended to be in concert with the famous Rumble in the Jungle bout in Kinshasa, Zaire in 1974.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring some incredible performances from many 70s soul legends, Soul Power is an exhilarating snap-shot of a bygone era.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on a former Miss Wyoming who is charged with abducting and imprisoning a young Mormon Missionary.
filmInfoContainer4: It's far from his most thought-provoking work, but Tabloid finds Errol Morris as smart, spirited, and engaging as ever.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Jewish man develops a fiercely anti-Semitic philosophy. Based on the factual story of a K.K.K. member in the 1960s who was revealed to be Jewish by a New York Times reporter.
filmInfoContainer4: Gosling commands the screen with a raw, electrifying performance.

filmInfoContainer3: Three buddies wake up from a bachelor party in Las Vegas, with no memory of the previous night and the bachelor missing. They make their way around the city in order to find their friend before his wedding.
filmInfoContainer4: With a clever script and hilarious interplay among the cast, The Hangover nails just the right tone of raunchy humor, and the non-stop laughs overshadow any flaw.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in 2002, an abandoned 5-year-old boy living in a rundown orphanage in a small Russian village is adopted by an Italian family.
filmInfoContainer4: Poignant and unforgettable, The Italian stands out from other European melodramas. Like its extraordinary child lead, this Russian drama about an orphan's search for his birth mother is small in size and monumental in pathos.

filmInfoContainer3: In a dystopian near future, single people, according to the laws of The City, are taken to The Hotel, where they are obliged to find a romantic partner in forty-five days or are transformed into beasts and sent off into The Woods.
filmInfoContainer4: As strange as it is thrillingly ambitious, The Lobster is definitely an acquired taste -- but for viewers with the fortitude to crack through Yorgos Lanthimos' offbeat sensibilities, it should prove a savory cinematic treat.

filmInfoContainer3: Seven-year-old Sang-woo is left with his grandmother in a remote village while his mother looks for work. Born and raised in the city, Sang-woo quickly comes into conflict with his ...
filmInfoContainer4: A simple story told with much warmth and compassion.

filmInfoContainer3: A wife questions her life choices as she travels to Stockholm with her husband, where he is slated to receive the Nobel Prize for Literature.
filmInfoContainer4: The Wife relies on the strength of Glenn Close's performance to drive home the power of its story -- and she proves thoroughly, grippingly up to the task.

filmInfoContainer3: Affable hillbillies Tucker and Dale are on vacation at their dilapidated mountain cabin when they are mistaken for murderers by a group of preppy college students.
filmInfoContainer4: Like the best horror/comedies, Tucker & Dale vs. Evil mines its central crazy joke for some incredible scares, laughs, and -- believe it or not -- heart.

filmInfoContainer3: When his estranged father returns, a hairdresser is forced to quit performing at the local drag club.
filmInfoContainer4: Viva flirts with melodrama, but ultimately rises on the strength of strong performances and a thoroughly relatable message.

filmInfoContainer: We Steal Secrets: The Story of WikiLeaks
filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that details the creation of Julian Assange's controversial website, which facilitated the largest security breach in U.S. history.
filmInfoContainer4: As fascinating as it is provocative, We Steal Secrets: The Story of Wikileaks presents another documentary triumph for director Alex Gibney, as well as a troubling look at one of the more meaningful issues of our time.

filmInfoContainer3: An in-depth look at the life and music of Whitney Houston.
filmInfoContainer4: Whitney shifts from soaring highs to heartbreaking lows with palpable emotion and grace befitting its singular subject.

filmInfoContainer3: The troubled Vuillard family is no stranger to illness, grief, and banishment, but when their matriarch requires a bone-marrow transplant, the estranged clan reunites just in time for Christmas.
filmInfoContainer4: A sharp black comedy about a chaotic family holiday gathering, A Christmas Tale is always involving, thanks to an impressive ensemble cast.

filmInfoContainer3: In New York City 1981, an ambitious immigrant fights to protect his business and family during the most dangerous year in the city's history.
filmInfoContainer4: Gritty, gripping, and weighted with thought-provoking heft, A Most Violent Year represents another strong entry in writer-director J.C. Chandor's impressive filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: An elderly woman takes a train trip to visit her grandson at his army camp inside Chechnya.
filmInfoContainer4: At once ethereal and tangible, Aleksandr Sokurov's humane Chechen War drama features a spectacular turn by opera star Galina Vishnevskay.
