filmInfoContainer3: A woman on the run from the mob is reluctantly accepted in a small Colorado town. In exchange, she agrees to work for them. As a search visits the town, she finds out that their support has a price. Yet her dangerous secret is never far away.
filmInfoContainer4: A challenging piece of experimental filmmaking.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1980, a group of college baseball players navigate their way through the freedoms and responsibilities of unsupervised adulthood.
filmInfoContainer4: Nostalgic in the best sense, Everybody Wants Some!! finds Richard Linklater ambling through the past with a talented cast, a sweetly meandering story, and a killer classic rock soundtrack.

filmInfoContainer: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
filmInfoContainer3: As Harry races against time and evil to destroy the Horcruxes, he uncovers the existence of three most powerful objects in the wizarding world: the Deathly Hallows.
filmInfoContainer4: It can't help but feel like the prelude it is, but Deathly Hallows: Part I is a beautifully filmed, emotionally satisfying penultimate installment for the Harry Potter series.

filmInfoContainer3: A dealer in "outsider" art travels from Chicago to North Carolina to meet her new in-laws, challenging the equilibrium of this middle class Southern home.
filmInfoContainer4: Aided and abetted by a wonderful cast, director Phil Morrison transforms familiar material into an understated and resonant comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: After Ben and George get married, George is fired from his teaching post, forcing them to stay with friends separately while they sell their place and look for cheaper housing -- a situation that weighs heavily on all involved.
filmInfoContainer4: Held aloft by remarkable performances from John Lithgow and Alfred Molina, Love Is Strange serves as a graceful tribute to the beauty of commitment in the face of adversity.

filmInfoContainer3: Mike Nelson and his robot companions watch and give their comments about This Island Earth (1955).
filmInfoContainer4: Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Movie may be thin and uneven, but it's hilarious in enough of the right spots to do the show's big-screen transition justice.

filmInfoContainer: No One Knows About Persian Cats
filmInfoContainer3: Iranian musicians Negar and Ashkan look for band members to play at a London concert - and the visas that allow them to leave Tehran to do so.
filmInfoContainer4: Bringing a dose of humor and a fresh perspective to a very serious subject, No One Knows About Persian Cats is an exhilarating, quietly powerful tribute to the courage of Iran's underground musicians.

filmInfoContainer3: Three magazine employees head out on an assignment to interview a guy who placed a classified advertisement seeking a companion for time travel.
filmInfoContainer4: Safety Not Guaranteed's ostensibly modest ambitions are outmatched by the movie's strong performances, beguiling charm, and heartfelt story.

filmInfoContainer3: In the 17th century, two Portuguese Jesuit priests travel to Japan in an attempt to locate their mentor, who is rumored to have committed apostasy, and to propagate Catholicism.
filmInfoContainer4: Silence ends Martin Scorsese's decades-long creative quest with a thoughtful, emotionally resonant look at spirituality and human nature that stands among the director's finest works.

filmInfoContainer3: Summertime. A cruising spot for men, tucked away on the shores of a lake. Franck falls in love with Michel, an attractive, potent and lethally dangerous man. Franck knows this but wants to live out his passion anyway.
filmInfoContainer4: Sexy, smart, and darkly humorous, Stranger by the Lake offers rewarding viewing for adult filmgoers in search of thought-provoking drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Goaded by his buddies, a nerdy guy who's never "done the deed" only finds the pressure mounting when he meets a single mother.
filmInfoContainer4: Steve Carell's first star turn scores big with a tender treatment of its titular underdog, using raunchy but realistically funny comedy to connect with adult audiences.

filmInfoContainer3: An older British reporter vies with a young U.S. doctor for the affections of a beautiful Vietnamese woman.
filmInfoContainer4: Thoughtful and wonderfully acted, The Quiet American manages to capture the spirit of Green's novel.

filmInfoContainer: The Saddest Music in the World
filmInfoContainer3: A musical of sorts set in Winnipeg during the Great Depression, where a beer baroness organizes a contest to find the saddest music in the world. Musicians from around the world descend on the city to try and win the $25,000 prize.
filmInfoContainer4: Guy Maddin perfectly recreates the look and feel of a 1930s in this bizarre picture.

filmInfoContainer: The Year My Parents Went on Vacation
filmInfoContainer3: A boy is left alone in a Jewish neighborhood in the year of 1970, where both world cup and dictatorship happen in Brazil.
filmInfoContainer4: Hamburger deftly refracts the sociopolitical tumult of early '70s Brazil through the lens of a young boy's coming of age, and Joelsas' performance is wise beyond his years.

filmInfoContainer3: A man accidentally gets into a time machine and travels back in time nearly an hour. Finding himself will be the first of a series of disasters of unforeseeable consequences.
filmInfoContainer4: Timecrimes is a low-budget thriller that's well-crafted and loaded with dark humor and bizarre twists.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman goes on a 1,700-mile trek across the deserts of West Australia with four camels and her faithful dog.
filmInfoContainer4: What Tracks lacks in excitement, it more than makes up with gorgeous cinematography and Mia Wasikowska's outstanding performance.

filmInfoContainer3: Six days in the violent life of a young Johannesburg gang leader.
filmInfoContainer4: Chweneyagae's powerful performance carries this simple yet searing tale of a shantytown teenager's redemption.

filmInfoContainer3: A mother of three hires a night nanny to help with her newborn.
filmInfoContainer4: Tully delves into the modern parenthood experience with an admirably deft blend of humor and raw honesty, brought to life by an outstanding performance by Charlize Theron.

filmInfoContainer3: A pair of underachieving cops are sent back to a local high school to blend in and bring down a synthetic drug ring.
filmInfoContainer4: A smart, affectionate satire of '80s nostalgia and teen movie tropes, 21 Jump Street offers rowdy mainstream comedy with a surprisingly satisfying bite.

filmInfoContainer3: A young girl from South Los Angeles tries to make it to the National Spelling Bee.
filmInfoContainer4: A warm, family-friendly underdog story, featuring terrific supporting performances from Keke Palmer, Laurence Fishburne, and Angela Bassett.

filmInfoContainer3: A frustrated son tries to determine the fact from fiction in his dying father's life.
filmInfoContainer4: A charming father-and-son tale filled with typical Tim Burton flourishes.

filmInfoContainer3: As the extremely withdrawn Don Johnston is dumped by his latest woman, he receives an anonymous letter from a former lover informing him that he has a son who may be looking for him. A freelance sleuth neighbor moves Don to embark on a cross-country search for his old flames in search of answers.
filmInfoContainer4: Bill Murray's subtle and understated style complements director Jim Jarmusch's minimalist storytelling in this quirky, but deadpan comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Colette is pushed by her husband to write novels under his name. Upon their success, she fights to make her talents known, challenging gender norms.
filmInfoContainer4: Formally familiar but a brilliant match for its lead, Colette is a thoroughly entertaining biopic and an overdue testament to Keira Knightley's underrated gifts.

filmInfoContainer3: Marcello, a small and gentle dog groomer, finds himself involved in a dangerous relationship of subjugation with Simone, a former violent boxer who terrorizes the entire neighborhood. In an...
filmInfoContainer4: Dogman offers a grim character study set apart by Marcello Fonte's performance and director Matteo Garrone's tight grip on the material.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on H.G. Bissinger's book, which profiled the economically depressed town of Odessa, Texas and their heroic high school football team, The Permian High Panthers.
filmInfoContainer4: An acute survey of the football-obsessed heartland that succeeds as both a stirring drama and a rousing sports movie.

filmInfoContainer: Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer
filmInfoContainer3: Henry, a drifter, commits a series of brutal murders, supposedly operating with impunity.
filmInfoContainer4: Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer is an effective, chilling profile of a killer that is sure to shock and disturb.

filmInfoContainer3: Haunted by painful memories and increasing paranoia, a damaged woman struggles to re-assimilate with her family after fleeing an abusive cult.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a mesmerizing debut performance from Elizabeth Olsen, Martha Marcy May Marlene is a distinctive, haunting psychological drama.

filmInfoContainer3: At a turning point in his life, a former tennis pro falls for an actress who happens to be dating his friend and soon-to-be brother-in-law.
filmInfoContainer4: Woody Allen's sharpest film in years, Match Point is a taut, philosophical thriller about class and infidelity.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that looks at pundits-for-hire who present themselves as scientific authorities as they speak about topics like toxic chemicals, pharmaceuticals and climate change.
filmInfoContainer4: Merchants of Doubt is a thought-provoking documentary assembled with energy and style, even if it doesn't dig as deep as it could.

filmInfoContainer3: After her beloved husband's suicide, a mourning supermarket worker and her best friend hit the road in Scotland, but find that grief is something that you can't run away from forever.
filmInfoContainer4: Morton quietly makes this quirky, enigmatic mood piece a compelling watch.

filmInfoContainer3: Alan is a musician who leaves a busted-up band for New York, and a new musical voyage. He tries to stay focused and fends off all manner of distractions, including the attraction to his good friend's girlfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Bujalski continues to give cinematic voice to awkward, literate twentysomethings with noteworthy smarts and tenderness.

filmInfoContainer3: After being kicked out of his rock band, Dewey Finn becomes a substitute teacher of an uptight elementary private school, only to try and turn them into a rock band.
filmInfoContainer4: Black's exuberant, gleeful performance turns School of Rock into a hilarious, rocking good time.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Scottish man travels across America in pursuit of the woman he loves, attracting the attention of an outlaw who is willing to serve as a guide.
filmInfoContainer4: Slow West serves as an impressive calling card for first-time writer-director John M. Maclean -- and offers an inventive treat for fans of the Western.

filmInfoContainer3: An Arab surgeon living in Tel Aviv discovers a dark secret about his wife in the aftermath of a suicide bombing.
filmInfoContainer4: Tense and suspenseful while remaining smart and understated, The Attack honors its complex subject with an intelligent script and captivating performances.

filmInfoContainer3: Five friends go for a break at a remote cabin, where they get more than they bargained for, discovering the truth behind the cabin in the woods.
filmInfoContainer4: The Cabin in the Woods is an astonishing meta-feat, capable of being funny, strange, and scary -- frequently all at the same time.

filmInfoContainer3: Vincke and Verstuyft are the best detectives of the Antwerp police department. They are confronted with the murder on a leading executive and put all their effort to catch the murderer.
filmInfoContainer4: Even though The Memory of a Killer is standard genre fare, it is also engaging and stylish.

filmInfoContainer3: Sokol and Lorna, two Albanian emigrants in Belgium, dream of leaving their dreary jobs to set up a snack bar. They need money, and a permanent resident status. Claudy is a junkie - he needs...
filmInfoContainer4: Subtle and emotionally bleak, this gripping thriller features the Dardenne brothers' recognizable penchant for realism and very strong performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of male friends become obsessed with five mysterious sisters who are sheltered by their strict, religious parents in suburban Detroit in the mid 1970s.
filmInfoContainer4: Sofia's successful directorial debut lies in the movie's compelling story and the actors' genuine emotions.

filmInfoContainer3: In a small French colony, a drunken man kills someone. While a guillotine is being shipped in, he changes, becoming a good and popular man.
filmInfoContainer4: Critics are impressed with The Widow of St. Pierre's intriguing story and beautiful cinematography.

filmInfoContainer3: Jenna is a pregnant, unhappily married waitress in the deep south. She meets a newcomer to her town and falls into an unlikely relationship as a last attempt at happiness.
filmInfoContainer4: Sweet, smart, and quirky, Waitress hits the right, bittersweet notes through this romantic comedy through its witty script and a superb performance by Keri Russell.

filmInfoContainer3: Over the summer, a series of unfortunate happening triggers a financial crisis for a young woman and she soon finds her life falling apart.
filmInfoContainer4: Michelle Williams gives a heartbreaking performance in Wendy and Lucy, a timely portrait of loneliness and struggle.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the actress, writer, and broadcasting pioneer Gertrude Berg.
filmInfoContainer4: Equal parts edification and entertainment, Kempner's tender tribute to a forgotten pioneer of American entertainment is both richly deserved and long overdue.

filmInfoContainer3: Stranded in the midst of a zombie apocalypse, a man sets in motion an unlikely plan to protect his infant daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: Cargo takes a refreshingly character-driven approach to the zombie genre that's further distinguished by its Australian setting and Martin Freeman's terrific lead performance.

filmInfoContainer3: 'Sing' is a childhood drama with a lot of music, set in 1990s Budapest, Hungary. Inspired by a true story, it follows an award winning school choir and the new girl in class who just might uncover the ugly secret behind their fame.
filmInfoContainer4: Sing delivers colorfully animated, cheerfully undemanding entertainment with a solid voice cast and a warm-hearted -- albeit familiar -- storyline that lives up to its title.

filmInfoContainer3: Antoine Sforza, a thirty-year-old young man, left his village ten years before in order to start a new life in the big city, but now that his father, a traveling grocer, is in hospital ...
filmInfoContainer4: A noteworthy performance by Eric Guirado makes this gently pastoral film a moving coming-of-age story.

filmInfoContainer: A Pigeon Sat on a Branch Reflecting on Existence
filmInfoContainer3: Sam and Jonathan, a pair of hapless novelty salesman, embark on a tour of the human condition in reality and fantasy that unfold in a series of absurdist episodes.
filmInfoContainer4: Expertly assembled and indelibly original, A Pigeon Sat on a Branch concludes writer-director Roy Andersson's Living trilogy in style.

filmInfoContainer3: A family is haunted by the tragedies of deaths within the family.
filmInfoContainer4: Restrained but disturbing, A Tale of Two Sisters is a creepily effective, if at times confusing, horror movie.

filmInfoContainer3: Santa's clumsy son Arthur sets out on a mission with St. Nick's father to give out a present they misplaced to a young girl in less than 2 hours.
filmInfoContainer4: Aardman Animations broadens their humor a bit for Arthur Christmas, a clever and earnest holiday film with surprising emotional strength.

filmInfoContainer3: A widower takes an offer to screen girls at a special audition, arranged for him by a friend to find him a new wife. The one he fancies is not who she appears to be after all.
filmInfoContainer4: An audacious, unsettling Japanese horror film from director Takashi Miike, Audition entertains as both a grisly shocker and a psychological drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that follows an Alaskan bear family as its young cubs are taught life's most important lessons.
filmInfoContainer4: Sweet, beautifully filmed, and admirably short on sugarcoating, Bears continues Disneynature's winning streak.

filmInfoContainer3: Competition between the maid of honor and a bridesmaid, over who is the bride's best friend, threatens to upend the life of an out-of-work pastry chef.
filmInfoContainer4: A marriage of genuine characters, gross out gags, and pathos, Bridesmaids is a female-driven comedy that refuses to be boxed in as Kristen Wiig emerges as a real star.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on peer-to-peer bullying in schools across America.
filmInfoContainer4: Hard-hitting and gracefully filmed, Bully powerfully delivers an essential message to an audience that may not be able to see it.

filmInfoContainer3: Investigative journalist Jeremy Scahill is pulled into an unexpected journey as he chases down the hidden truth behind America's expanding covert wars.
filmInfoContainer4: Some viewers may find fault with director Rick Rowley's filmmaking methods, but they aren't distracting enough to keep Dirty Wars from serving as a terribly compelling argument against elements of American foreign policy.

filmInfoContainer3: Hoping to walk away with a massive fortune, a trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who isn't as helpless as he seems.
filmInfoContainer4: Don't Breathe smartly twists its sturdy premise to offer a satisfyingly tense, chilling addition to the home invasion genre that's all the more effective for its simplicity.

filmInfoContainer3: Andy Tennant directed this Cinderella variant. The Brothers Grimm arrive at the home of a wealthy Grande Dame (Jeanne Moreau) who speaks of the many legends surrounding the fable of the ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Ever After is a sweet, frothy twist on the ancient fable, led by a solid turn from star Barrymore.

filmInfoContainer3: A biography of Chinese Martial Arts Master Huo Yuanjia, who is the founder and spiritual guru of the Jin Wu Sports Federation.
filmInfoContainer4: Fearless is a brilliantly choreographed, beautifully filmed endcap to Li's quarter decade of epic martial arts glory.

filmInfoContainer3: Four incompetent British terrorists set out to train for and commit an act of terror.
filmInfoContainer4: Its premise suggests brazenly tasteless humor, but Four Lions is actually a smart, pitch-black comedy that carries the unmistakable ring of truth.

filmInfoContainer3: A boy inadvertently breaks three important rules concerning his new pet and unleashes a horde of malevolently mischievous monsters on a small town.
filmInfoContainer4: Whether you choose to see it as a statement on consumer culture or simply a special effects-heavy popcorn flick, Gremlins is a minor classic.

filmInfoContainer: I Don't Feel at Home in This World Anymore.
filmInfoContainer3: When a depressed woman is burglarized, she finds a new sense of purpose by tracking down the thieves alongside her obnoxious neighbor. But they soon find themselves dangerously out of their depth against a pack of degenerate criminals.
filmInfoContainer4: I don't feel at home in this world anymore. transcends its unwieldy title to offer timely, intoxicatingly dark observations on gender dynamics and social norms in modern America.

filmInfoContainer3: Lady Susan Vernon takes up temporary residence at her in-laws' estate and, while there, is determined to be a matchmaker for her daughter Frederica -- and herself too, naturally.
filmInfoContainer4: Love & Friendship finds director Whit Stillman bringing his talents to bear on a Jane Austen adaptation -- with a thoroughly delightful period drama as the result.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a man who rescues a German shepherd and how the two become fast friends.
In Seoul, Korea, two sisters must look after each other when their mother leaves them to search for their estranged father.
filmInfoContainer4: Intermittently wondrous and harsh, this sensitive drama about two abandoned sisters gives time and space to the intimate and beautiful moments of childhood.

filmInfoContainer3: A twenty-something comedienne's unplanned pregnancy forces her to confront the realities of independent womanhood for the first time.
filmInfoContainer4: Tackling a sensitive subject with maturity, honesty, and wit, Obvious Child serves as a deeply promising debut for writer-director Gillian Robespierre.

filmInfoContainer3: Through the neighborhoods of Paris, love is veiled, revealed, imitated, sucked dry, reinvented and awakened.
filmInfoContainer4: Paris Je T'aime is uneven, but there are more than enough delightful moments in this omnibus tribute to the City of Lights to tip the scale in its favor.

filmInfoContainer3: Samuel, a male nurse, saves the life of a thief whose henchmen take Samuel's wife hostage and force him to spring their boss.

filmInfoContainer: Professor Marston and the Wonder Women
filmInfoContainer3: The story of psychologist William Moulton Marston, and his polyamorous relationship with his wife and their mistress who would inspire his creation of the superheroine, Wonder Woman.
filmInfoContainer4: Professor Marston & The Wonder Women winds a lasso of cinematic truth around a fascinating fact-based tale with strong performances from its three stars.

filmInfoContainer: Riding Alone for Thousands of Miles
filmInfoContainer3: A Japanese father travels to China's Yunnan province in the place of his ailing son to film a famous folk-opera star.
filmInfoContainer4: Doesn't reach the heights of Zhang Yimou's best, but this is still a heartwarming tale of love and forgiveness from the acclaimed Chinese director.

filmInfoContainer3: Traces the birth and failure of new media company govWorks.com.
filmInfoContainer4: Startup.com is more than just a look at the rise and fall of the new economy. At its center is a friendship being tested to the limit, and that's what makes it worth viewing.

filmInfoContainer3: A child molester returns to his hometown after 12 years in prison and attempts to start a new life.
filmInfoContainer4: Kevin Bacon's performance as a pedophile who is trying to start fresh has drawn raves from critics, who have praised the Woodsman as compelling, creepy, complex and well-crafted.

filmInfoContainer3: A beautiful but naïve aspiring television personality films a documentary on teenagers with a darker ulterior motive.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, funny, and thoroughly well-cast, To Die For takes a sharp - and sadly prescient - stab at dissecting America's obsession with celebrity.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the novel by Antonio Di Benedetto written in 1956, on Don Diego de Zama, a Spanish officer of the seventeenth century settled in Asunción, who awaits his transfer to Buenos Aires.
filmInfoContainer4: Zama offers a series of scathingly insightful observations about colonialism and class dynamics -- and satisfyingly ends a long wait between projects from writer-director Lucrecia Martel.

filmInfoContainer3: The antisocial son of an alcoholic father and a bipolar mother grows up in 1960s Ireland.
Twelve jurors must decide the fate of a Chechen adolescent charged with murdering his stepfather.
filmInfoContainer4: Loosely based on 1957's 12 Angry Men, Nikita Mikhalkov's superbly acted 12 is clever and gripping like its predecessor, but with a distinctly Russian feel.

filmInfoContainer2: Adventure, Drama, Horror, Mystery, Sci-Fi, Thriller
filmInfoContainer3: A biologist signs up for a dangerous, secret expedition into a mysterious zone where the laws of nature don't apply.
filmInfoContainer4: Annihilation backs up its sci-fi visual wonders and visceral genre thrills with an impressively ambitious -- and surprisingly strange -- exploration of challenging themes that should leave audiences pondering long after the end credits roll.

filmInfoContainer3: As Scott Lang balances being both a Super Hero and a father, Hope van Dyne and Dr. Hank Pym present an urgent new mission that finds the Ant-Man fighting alongside The Wasp to uncover secrets from their past.
filmInfoContainer4: A lighter, brighter superhero movie powered by the effortless charisma of Paul Rudd and Evangeline Lilly, Ant-Man and The Wasp offers a much-needed MCU palate cleanser.

filmInfoContainer3: A teen gang in South London defend their block from an alien invasion.
filmInfoContainer4: Effortlessly mixing scares, laughs, and social commentary, Attack the Block is a thrilling, brisky-paced sci-fi yarn with a distinctly British flavor.

filmInfoContainer3: A Catholic school principal questions a priest's ambiguous relationship with a troubled young student.
filmInfoContainer4: Doubt succeeds on the strength of its top-notch cast, who successfully guide the film through the occasional narrative lull.

filmInfoContainer3: Two death-obsessed sisters, outcasts in their suburban neighborhood, must deal with the tragic consequences when one of them is bitten by a deadly werewolf.
filmInfoContainer4: The strong female cast and biting satire of teenage life makes Ginger Snaps far more memorable than your average werewolf movie -- or teen flick.

filmInfoContainer: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
filmInfoContainer3: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.
filmInfoContainer4: It's not easy to take the longest Harry Potter book and streamline it into the shortest HP movie, but director David Yates does a bang up job of it, creating an Order of the Phoenix that's entertaining and action-packed.

filmInfoContainer: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
filmInfoContainer3: An orphaned boy enrolls in a school of wizardry, where he learns the truth about himself, his family and the terrible evil that haunts the magical world.
filmInfoContainer4: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone adapts its source material faithfully while condensing the novel's overstuffed narrative into an involving -- and often downright exciting -- big-screen magical caper.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: The son of the Greek Gods Zeus and Hera is stripped of his immortality as an infant and must become a true hero in order to reclaim it.
filmInfoContainer4: Fast-paced and packed with dozens of pop culture references, Hercules might not measure up with the true classics of the Disney pantheon, but it's still plenty of fun.

filmInfoContainer3: With help from his friends, a Memphis pimp in a mid-life crisis attempts to become a successful hip-hop emcee.
filmInfoContainer4: Hustle & Flow is gritty and redemptive, with a profound sense of place and exciting music.

filmInfoContainer3: The lives of two Danish families cross each other, and an extraordinary but risky friendship comes into bud. But loneliness, frailty and sorrow lie in wait.
filmInfoContainer4: In a Better World is a sumptuous melodrama that tackles some rather difficult existential and human themes.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Nigerian man on the verge of being in an arranged marriage, suddenly questions his situation after an encounter with a stunning Latin woman, who is also about to be married.
filmInfoContainer4: The light-hearted romantic comedy Jump Tomorrow charms with its whimsy and sweetness.

filmInfoContainer3: After an Afghanistan-born woman who lives in Canada receives a letter from her suicidal sister, she takes a perilous journey through Afghanistan to try to find her.
filmInfoContainer4: Eerily timely, Kandahar offers haunting images of a bleak land.

filmInfoContainer3: In 19th-century rural England, a young bride who has been sold into marriage discovers an unstoppable desire within herself as she enters into an affair with a worker on her estate.
filmInfoContainer4: Lady Macbeth flashes some surprising toughness beneath its period exterior, bolstered by a mesmerizing -- and unforgiving -- central performance by Florence Pugh.

filmInfoContainer3: The life of Tao, and those close to her, is explored in three different time periods: 1999, 2014, and 2025.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully filmed, powerfully acted, and rich with meaning, Mountains May Depart represents another outstanding outing from writer/director Zhangke Jia.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on a true story, North Face is a suspenseful adventure film about a competition to climb the most dangerous rock face in the Alps. Set in 1936, as Nazi propaganda urges the nation's ...
filmInfoContainer4: A tense and gripping spectacular piece of snow-bound historical German film-making.

filmInfoContainer3: Two old pals reunite for a camping trip in Oregon's Cascade Mountains.
filmInfoContainer4: A serene, melancholy beauty permeates this meditative portrait of deep friendship and faded glory.

filmInfoContainer3: Whilst on a family vacation on the Mahurangi Peninsula in New Zealand, 13-year-old Janey begins to realize that her parents' marriage is on the rocks.
After breaking up with his lover and boss, a smooth-talking man takes his teenaged nephew out on the town in search of sex.
filmInfoContainer4: The movie could have benefited from a more experienced director, but a great cast and script overcome any first time jitters the director may have had.

filmInfoContainer3: A career-spanning documentary on the Rolling Stones, with concert footage from their "A Bigger Bang" tour.
filmInfoContainer4: It may offer little new for fans, but Martin Scorsese's document of the Rolling Stones' electrifying live show should provide satisfaction to audiences.

filmInfoContainer3: Two teenage cancer patients begin a life-affirming journey to visit a reclusive author in Amsterdam.
filmInfoContainer4: Wise, funny, and heartbreaking without resorting to exploitation, The Fault In Our Stars does right by its bestselling source material.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of Sudanese refugees, given the chance to resettle in the U.S., arrive in Kansas City, Missouri, where their encounter with an employment agency counselor forever changes all of their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: The Good Lie sacrifices real-life nuance in order to turn its true story into a Hollywood production, but the results still add up to a compelling, well-acted, and deeply moving drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Part drama, part documentary, The Road to Guantánamo focuses on the Tipton Three, a trio of British Muslims who were held in Guantanamo Bay for two years until they were released without charge.
filmInfoContainer4: A gut-wrenching and riveting docu-drama that serves as a stinging indictment of U.S. military justice in an era of ever-increasing scrutiny.

filmInfoContainer3: In the bleak days of the Cold War, espionage veteran George Smiley is forced from semi-retirement to uncover a Soviet Agent within MI6.
filmInfoContainer4: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy is a dense puzzle of anxiety, paranoia, and espionage that director Tomas Alfredson pieces together with utmost skill.

filmInfoContainer3: A man and woman are drawn together, entangled in the life cycle of an ageless organism. Identity becomes an illusion as they struggle to assemble the loose fragments of wrecked lives.
filmInfoContainer4: As technically brilliant as it is narratively abstract, Upstream Color represents experimental American cinema at its finest -- and reaffirms Shane Carruth as a talent to watch.

filmInfoContainer3: Quick-witted, well-read cultured types revolve around each other in a delightful potpourri of theatre, romanticism and theft.
filmInfoContainer4: Constructed with grace and wit, Va Savoir is a light-hearted yet cerebral romantic comedy of intertwining relations.

filmInfoContainer3: A nurse and her surgeon-lover are part of a resistance movement in 1940s Czechoslovakia. When they are discovered, her lover flees and she must find a place to hide. A patient whose life ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Zelary is a satisfyingly old-fashioned romance with an epic sweep.

filmInfoContainer3: A man takes over a dead man's task but doesn't realize the horror it entails.
filmInfoContainer4: This starkly minimalist nail-biter of a thriller relentlessly builds up the tension and keeps the audience guessing.

filmInfoContainer3: Documentary featuring interview footage with Traudl Junge, one of Hitler's personal secretaries during WWII.
filmInfoContainer4: The testimony of Junge is more than enough to make this bare-bones documentary fascinating.

filmInfoContainer3: Harry Caine, a blind writer, reaches this moment in time when he has to heal his wounds from 14 years back. He was then still known by his real name, Mateo Blanco, and directing his last movie.
filmInfoContainer4: Pedro Almodovar's fourth film with Penélope Cruz isn't his finest work, but he brings his signature visual brilliance to this noirish tale, and the cast turns in some first-class performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of soldiers in a small town on the Mekong River in northern Thailand are struck with a bizarre sleeping illness.
filmInfoContainer4: Cemetery of Splendor gracefully eludes efforts to pin down its meaning while offering patient viewers another gently hypnotic wonder from writer/director Apichatpong Weerasethakul.

filmInfoContainer3: A man struggles with memories of his past, including a wife he cannot remember, in a nightmarish world with no sun.
filmInfoContainer4: Stylishly gloomy, Dark City offers a polarizing whirl of arresting visuals and noirish action.

filmInfoContainer3: To avoid a potentially explosive scandal when the U.S. President goes into a coma, an affable temp agency owner with an uncanny resemblance is put in his place.
filmInfoContainer4: Ivan Reitman's refreshingly earnest political comedy benefits from an understated, charming script and a breezy performance by Kevin Kline.

filmInfoContainer3: A mobster travels to Hollywood to collect a debt, and discovers that the movie business is much the same as his current job.
filmInfoContainer4: With a perfect cast and a sly twist on the usual Hollywood gangster dynamic, Get Shorty delivers a sharp satire that doubles as an entertaining comedy-thriller in its own right.

filmInfoContainer: I Served the King of England
filmInfoContainer3: A look at the glamorous life at an old-world Prague hotel.
filmInfoContainer4: With charm and an eye for life's bittersweet moments, Czech New Wave master Jiri Menzel paints a picaresque story with whimsy and intellect.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in a dugout in Aisne in 1918, it is the story of a group of British officers, led by the mentally disintegrating young officer Stanhope, as they await their fate.
filmInfoContainer4: Journey's End brings R.C. Sherriff's 90-year-old play to the screen with thrilling power, thanks to director Saul Dibb's hard-hitting urgency and brilliant work from a talented cast.

filmInfoContainer: Lo and Behold, Reveries of the Connected World
filmInfoContainer3: Werner Herzog's exploration of the Internet and the connected world.
filmInfoContainer4: Lo and Behold: Reveries of the Connected World finds Werner Herzog bringing his distinctive documentarian gifts to bear on a timely topic with typically thought-provoking results.

filmInfoContainer: Mongol: The Rise of Genghis Khan
filmInfoContainer2: Action, Adventure, Biography, Drama, History, War
filmInfoContainer3: The story recounts the early life of Genghis Khan who was a slave before going on to conquer half the world in 1206.
filmInfoContainer4: The sweeping Mongol mixes romance, family drama, and enough flesh-ripping battle scenes to make sense of Ghenghis Khan's legendary stature.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the true story of two chambermaids (the Papin sisters) of 1930s France who murdered their employer and her daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: A historical account that is equally disturbing and engrossing, with a powerful performance by Sylvie Testud.

filmInfoContainer3: A former gunslinger is forced to take up arms again when he and his cattle crew are threatened by a corrupt lawman.
filmInfoContainer4: Greatly benefiting from the tremendous chemistry between Kevin Costner and Robert Duvall, Open Range is a sturdy modern Western with classic roots.

filmInfoContainer3: The life and times of Albert Pierrepoint - Britain's most prolific hangman.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Adrian Shergold doesn't shy away from the darker elements of the movie's subject, and Timothy Spall is mesmerizing as the title character.

filmInfoContainer3: Life for a happy couple is turned upside down after their young son dies in an accident.
filmInfoContainer4: It's often painful to watch, but Rabbit Hole's finely written script and convincing performances make it worth the effort.

filmInfoContainer3: Grizzled American private detective in England investigates a complicated case of blackmail turned murder involving a rich but honest elderly general, his two loose socialite daughters, a pornographer and a gangster.
A caving expedition goes horribly wrong, as the explorers become trapped and ultimately pursued by a strange breed of predators.
filmInfoContainer4: Deft direction and strong performances from its all-female cast guide The Descent, a riveting, claustrophobic horror film.

filmInfoContainer3: The son of a founding leader in the Palestinian organization, Hamas, becomes a spy for the Israelis.
filmInfoContainer4: The Green Prince doesn't answer all the questions it raises, but it's still timely, gripping -- and ultimately uplifting -- viewing.

filmInfoContainer3: A deaf boy joins a boarding school for similar children. Confronted by the violent and criminal antics of some of the other boys and girls, he struggles to conform and join the 'tribe'.
filmInfoContainer4: A bleak, haunting drama whose wordless dialogue speaks volumes, The Tribe is a bold, innovative take on silent films for a contemporary audience.

filmInfoContainer3: Steve Coogan has been asked by The Observer to tour the country's finest restaurants, but after his girlfriend backs out on him he must take his best friend and source of eternal aggravation, Rob Brydon.
filmInfoContainer4: Amiable, funny and sometimes insightful, The Trip works as both a showcase for the enduring chemistry between stars Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon and an unexpected perusal of men entering mid-life crises.

filmInfoContainer3: A family in 1630s New England is torn apart by the forces of witchcraft, black magic and possession.
filmInfoContainer4: As thought-provoking as it is visually compelling, The Witch delivers a deeply unsettling exercise in slow-building horror that suggests great things for debuting writer-director Robert Eggers.

filmInfoContainer: Touch the Sound: A Sound Journey with Evelyn Glennie
filmInfoContainer3: A documentary which explores the connections among sound, rhythm, time, and the body by following percussionist Evelyn Glennie, who is nearly deaf.
filmInfoContainer4: Not only does this documentary introduce viewers to Glennie, it gives them a taste of how she perceives the world.

filmInfoContainer: Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives
filmInfoContainer3: Dying of kidney disease, a man spends his last, somber days with family, including the ghost of his wife and a forest spirit who used to be his son, on a rural northern Thailand farm.
filmInfoContainer4: Languorous and deeply enigmatic, Palme d'Or winner Uncle Boonmee represents an original take on the ghosts that haunt us.

filmInfoContainer3: Thirteen-year-old Lili fights to protect her dog Hagen. She is devastated when her father eventually sets Hagen free on the streets. Still innocently believing love can conquer any difficulty, Lili sets out to find her dog and save him.
filmInfoContainer4: White God isn't an easy watch, but its soaring ambition and powerful acting -- human and canine alike -- make it well worth the effort.

filmInfoContainer3: Amidst turmoil and racial conflict in a Francophone African state, a white French woman fights for her coffee crop, her family and ultimately for her life.
It's time to rock and roll - air guitar style. AIR GUITAR NATION is the feature documentary about the year that air guitar swept America - from New York to Los Angeles and then all the way ...
filmInfoContainer4: It's up for debate how serious or ironic its subjects are, but Air Guitar Nation is nonetheless a funny and exciting documentary with a killer soundtrack.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama centered on the trials and tribulations of a proud Palestinian Christian immigrant single mother and her teenage son in small town Indiana.
filmInfoContainer4: A dramedy that's got a taste for the tragic as well as the poignantly comic, Amreeka adds a new sweetness to the hope and distress of the immigrant experience.

filmInfoContainer3: In small-town Texas, an affable mortician strikes up a friendship with a wealthy widow, though when she starts to become controlling, he goes to great lengths to separate himself from her grasp.
filmInfoContainer4: Richard Linklater's Bernie is a gently told and unexpectedly amusing true-crime comedy that benefits from an impressive performance by Jack Black.

filmInfoContainer3: Dior and I brings the viewer inside the storied world of the Christian Dior fashion house with a privileged, behind-the-scenes look at the creation of Raf Simons' first haute couture ...
filmInfoContainer4: Dior and I will obviously appeal to fashion fans, but this beautifully tailored documentary may draw in even the least sartorially inclined.

filmInfoContainer3: An ambitious salesman will do anything for that big promotion he's been chasing, but inevitably, he will learn that there is no such thing as the perfect crime.
filmInfoContainer4: If you like your comedies wicked and pitch-black, El Crimen Perfecto delivers without flinching.

filmInfoContainer3: An Iowa corn farmer, hearing voices, interprets them as a command to build a baseball diamond in his fields; he does, and the 1919 Chicago White Sox come.
filmInfoContainer4: Field of Dreams is sentimental, but in the best way; it's a mix of fairy tale, baseball, and family togetherness.

filmInfoContainer3: U.S. Olympic wrestling champions and brothers Mark Schultz and Dave Schultz join "Team Foxcatcher", led by eccentric multi-millionaire John du Pont, as they train for the 1988 Olympic Games in Seoul, South Korea, but John's self-destructive behavior threatens to consume them all.
filmInfoContainer4: A chilling true crime drama, Foxcatcher offers Steve Carell, Mark Ruffalo, and Channing Tatum a chance to shine -- and all three of them rise to the challenge.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1862, Amsterdam Vallon returns to the Five Points area of New York City seeking revenge against Bill the Butcher, his father's killer.
filmInfoContainer4: Though flawed, the sprawling, messy Gangs of New York is redeemed by impressive production design and Day-Lewis's electrifying performance.

filmInfoContainer3: An in-depth look at the legendary punk band, The Stooges.
filmInfoContainer4: Its infectious enthusiasm for its subjects - and Iggy Pop's ingratiating presence - more than make up for the effortlessly entertaining Gimme Danger's relative lack of context or depth.

filmInfoContainer3: When their latest work is buffed by a rival crew, two determined graffiti writers embark on an elaborate plan to bomb the ultimate location: the New York Mets' Home Run Apple.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to energetic performances from its young leads, Gimme The Loot captures a slice of city life with warmth and exuberance.

filmInfoContainer3: An abandoned wife is evicted from her house and starts a tragic conflict with her house's new owners.
filmInfoContainer4: Powerful and thought provoking film.

filmInfoContainer3: An underachieving voice coach finds herself competing in the movie trailer voice-over profession against her arrogant father and his protégé.
filmInfoContainer4: A funny, well-written screwball satire for film buffs, In a World... proves an auspicious beginning for writer, director, and star Lake Bell.

filmInfoContainer3: The honorable citizen Nils ploughs snow in the wild winter mountains of Norway, when his son is mistakenly murdered, Nils takes action, which ignites a war between the vegan gangster "the Count" and the Serbian mafia boss Papa.
filmInfoContainer4: In Order of Disappearance's black comedy doesn't always hit its targets, but on the whole, it still adds up to a sly, entertaining revenge thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on kids who attend a summer camp hoping to become the next Billy Graham.
filmInfoContainer4: Evangelical indoctrination is given an unflinching, even-handed look in this utterly worthwhile documentary.

filmInfoContainer3: Two kids, Dylan and Kylie, run away from home at Christmas and spend a night of magic and terror on the streets of inner-city Dublin.
filmInfoContainer4: Although admittedly sleight, this gritty but tender coming-of-age Irish drama features some impressive work both in front, and behind the camera.

filmInfoContainer3: Meduzot (the Hebrew word for Jellyfish) tells the story of three very different Israeli women living in Tel Aviv whose intersecting stories weave an unlikely portrait of modern Israeli life...
filmInfoContainer4: Lyrical, well-crafted and inventive, Jellyfish smartly mixes comedy, drama and magic realism.

filmInfoContainer3: For his final assignment, a top temporal agent must pursue the one criminal that has eluded him throughout time. The chase turns into a unique, surprising and mind-bending exploration of love, fate, identity and time travel taboos.
filmInfoContainer4: Fun genre fare with uncommon intelligence, Predestination serves as a better-than-average sci-fi adventure -- and offers a starmaking turn from Sarah Snook.

filmInfoContainer: Raiders!: The Story of the Greatest Fan Film Ever Made
filmInfoContainer3: A documentary of the story behind Raiders of the Lost Ark: The Adaptation (1989).
filmInfoContainer4: As fascinating as it is affecting, Raiders! offers an insightful look at fan culture while presenting a poignant portrait of friendship over the passage of time.

filmInfoContainer: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
filmInfoContainer3: A substance designed to help the brain repair itself gives advanced intelligence to a chimpanzee who leads an ape uprising.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by Rupert Wyatt's stylish direction, some impressive special effects, and a mesmerizing performance by Andy Serkis, Rise of the Planet of the Apes breathes unlikely new life into a long-running franchise.

filmInfoContainer3: Errol Morris examines the incidents of abuse and torture of suspected terrorists at the hands of U.S. forces at the Abu Ghraib prison.
filmInfoContainer4: Well researched and finely crafted, Standard Operating Procedure is another gem from master documentarian Errol Morris.

filmInfoContainer3: In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.
filmInfoContainer4: A faithful interpretation that captures the spirit of whimsy, action, and off-kilter humor of Neil Gaiman, Stardust juggles multiple genres and tones to create a fantastical experience.

filmInfoContainer3: Bob Saginowski finds himself at the center of a robbery gone awry and entwined in an investigation that digs deep into the neighborhood's past where friends, families, and foes all work together to make a living - no matter the cost.
filmInfoContainer4: There's no shortage of similarly themed crime dramas, but The Drop rises above the pack with a smartly written script and strong cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama based on the true story of Melvin B. Tolson, a professor at Wiley College Texas. In 1935, he inspired students to form the school's first debate team, which went on to challenge Harvard in the national championship.
filmInfoContainer4: A wonderful cast and top-notch script elevate The Great Debaters beyond a familiar formula for a touching, uplifting drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A soldier introduces himself to the Peterson family, claiming to be a friend of their son who died in action. After the young man is welcomed into their home, a series of accidental deaths seem to be connected to his presence.
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting enough intelligence to bolster its darkly violent thrills, The Guest offers another treat for genre fans from director Adam Wingard.

filmInfoContainer3: Through a failed medical experiment, a priest is stricken with vampirism and is forced to abandon his ascetic ways.
filmInfoContainer4: The stylish Thirst packs plenty of bloody thrills to satisfy fans of both vampire films and director Chan Wook Park.

filmInfoContainer3: Through a focus on the life of Dalton Trumbo (1905-1976), this film examines the effects on individuals and families of a congressional pursuit of Hollywood Communists after World War II. ...
filmInfoContainer4: Trumbo celebrates the life and work of blacklisted screenwriter Dalton Trumbo with measures of humor and sadness.

filmInfoContainer: We Need to Talk About Kevin
filmInfoContainer3: Kevin's mother struggles to love her strange child, despite the increasingly dangerous things he says and does as he grows up. But Kevin is just getting started, and his final act will be beyond anything anyone imagined.
filmInfoContainer4: We Need to Talk About Kevin is a masterful blend of drama and horror, with fantastic performances across the board (Tilda Swinton especially, delivering one of her very best).

filmInfoContainer3: A security pro finds his past coming back to haunt him, when he and his unique team are tasked with retrieving a particularly important item.
filmInfoContainer4: There isn't much to Sneakers plot and that's more than made up for with the film's breezy panache and hi-tech lingo.

filmInfoContainer3: In A CIAMBRA, a small Romani community in Calabria, Pio Amato is desperate to grow up fast. At 14, he drinks, smokes and is one of the few to easily slide between the region's factions - ...
filmInfoContainer4: A powerful character study, A Ciambra burns slowly, letting its compelling cast carry what could otherwise be just another coming-of-age story.

filmInfoContainer3: Two sisters join the first female professional baseball league and struggle to help it succeed amidst their own growing rivalry.
filmInfoContainer4: Sentimental and light, but still thoroughly charming, A League of Their Own is buoyed by solid performances from a wonderful cast.

filmInfoContainer3: One of the most celebrated war correspondents of our time, Marie Colvin is an utterly fearless and rebellious spirit, driven to the frontline of conflicts across the globe to give voice to the voiceless.
filmInfoContainer4: A Private War honors its real-life subject with a sober appraisal of the sacrifices required of journalists on the front lines - and career-best work by Rosamund Pike.

filmInfoContainer3: Armed with a super-suit with the astonishing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, cat burglar Scott Lang must embrace his inner hero and help his mentor, Dr. Hank Pym, plan and pull off a heist that will save the world.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a charming performance from Paul Rudd, Ant-Man offers Marvel thrills on an appropriately smaller scale -- albeit not as smoothly as its most successful predecessors.

filmInfoContainer3: The mixed-race daughter of a Royal Navy Admiral is raised by her aristocratic great-uncle in 18th-century England.
filmInfoContainer4: It boasts all the surface beauty that fans of period pictures have come to expect, but Belle also benefits from its stirring performances and subtle social consciousness.

filmInfoContainer3: Brazilian MD Drauzio Varella starts AIDS prevention in Brazil's largest prison, Carandiru, in São Paulo, where the population is nearly double its 4,000 maximum. Doc learns from experience ...
filmInfoContainer4: A gritty, poignant, and shocking prison movie.

filmInfoContainer3: A young man harasses a homeless woman, another man protests, the police arrest both and the woman has to leave the country. What were their various story-lines leading up to this event?
filmInfoContainer4: Though challengingly cryptic at times, Code Unknown still manages to resonate.

filmInfoContainer3: A clean-cut high school student relies on the school's rumor mill to advance her social and financial standing.
filmInfoContainer4: It owes a huge debt to older (and better) teen comedies, but Easy A proves a smart, witty showcase for its irresistibly charming star, Emma Stone.

filmInfoContainer3: When the older sister of Shira, an 18-year-old Hasidic Israeli, dies suddenly in childbirth, Shira must decide if she can and should marry her widowed brother-in-law, which also generates tensions within her extended family.
filmInfoContainer4: Graceful, complex, and beautifully layered, Fill the Void offers a sympathetic portrait of an insulated culture by exploring universal themes.

filmInfoContainer3: While trying to spice up their marriage in their remote lake house, Jessie must fight to survive when her husband dies unexpectedly, leaving her handcuffed to their bed frame.
filmInfoContainer4: Carla Gugino carries Gerald's Game's small-scale suspense with a career-defining performance.

filmInfoContainer3: A movie spun out of equal parts folk tale, fable and real-life legend about the mysterious, 1930s Tennessee hermit who famously threw his own rollicking funeral party... while he was still alive.
filmInfoContainer4: Subtle to a fault, this perfectly cast ensemble drama is lifted by typically sharp performances from Robert Duvall and Bill Murray.

filmInfoContainer3: Good girl Sandy and greaser Danny fell in love over the summer. When they unexpectedly discover they're now in the same high school, will they be able to rekindle their romance?
filmInfoContainer4: Grease is a pleasing, energetic musical with infectiously catchy songs and an ode to young love that never gets old.

filmInfoContainer3: The mythical world starts a rebellion against humanity in order to rule the Earth, so Hellboy and his team must save the world from the rebellious creatures.
filmInfoContainer4: Guillermo del Toro crafts a stellar comic book sequel, boasting visuals that are as imaginative as the characters are endearing.

filmInfoContainer3: Emma left Russia to live with her husband in Italy. Now a member of a powerful industrial family, she is the respected mother of three, but feels unfulfilled. One day, Antonio, a talented chef and her son's friend, makes her senses kindle.
filmInfoContainer4: It stumbles into melodrama, but I Am Love backs up its flamboyance with tremendous visual style and a marvelous central performance from Tilda Swinton.

filmInfoContainer3: A 15-year-old Long Island boy loses everything and everyone he knows, soon becoming involved in a relationship with a much older man.
filmInfoContainer4: L.I.E. is a well-acted and unsettling look at a boy's relationship with a pedophile.

filmInfoContainer3: An Indian-American man who is about to turn 30 gets help from his parents and extended family to start looking for a wife in the traditional Indian way.
filmInfoContainer4: Meet the Patels works on multiple levels, offering an affably entertaining documentary about one man looking for love while posing thoughtful questions about cultural assimilation and modern romance.

filmInfoContainer: My Brother Is an Only Child
filmInfoContainer3: Two brothers come of age in a small Italian town in the '60s and '70s.
filmInfoContainer4: Luchetti takes advantage of the storyline's historical context without sacrificing his cast's fine performances or the script's light wit.

filmInfoContainer3: In the Yorkshire countryside, working-class tomboy Mona meets the exotic, pampered Tamsin. Over the summer season, the two young women discover they have much to teach one another, and much to explore together.
filmInfoContainer4: My Summer of Love is a moody, bittersweet love story featuring outstanding performances from the leads.

filmInfoContainer3: A misunderstood boy takes on ghosts, zombies and grown-ups to save his town from a centuries-old curse.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully animated and solidly scripted, ParaNorman will entertain (and frighten) older children while providing surprisingly thoughtful fare for their parents.

filmInfoContainer3: A man's carefully cultivated private life is disrupted when his sister arrives for an indefinite stay.
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting stellar performances by Michael Fassbender and Carey Mulligan, Shame is a powerful plunge into the mania of addiction affliction.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: Princess Fiona's parents invite her and Shrek to dinner to celebrate her marriage. If only they knew the newlyweds were both ogres.
filmInfoContainer4: It may not be as fresh as the original, but topical humor and colorful secondary characters make Shrek 2 a winner in its own right.

filmInfoContainer3: When bitten by a genetically modified spider, a nerdy, shy, and awkward high school student gains spider-like abilities that he eventually must use to fight evil as a superhero after tragedy befalls his family.
filmInfoContainer4: Not only does Spider-Man provide a good dose of web-swinging fun, it also has a heart, thanks to the combined charms of director Sam Raimi and star Tobey Maguire.

filmInfoContainer: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
filmInfoContainer3: On the eve of retirement, Kirk and McCoy are charged with assassinating the Klingon High Chancellor and imprisoned. The Enterprise crew must help them escape to thwart a conspiracy aimed at sabotaging the last best hope for peace.
filmInfoContainer4: The Undiscovered Country is a strong cinematic send-off for the original Trek crew, featuring some remarkable visuals and an intriguing, character-driven mystery plot.

filmInfoContainer: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
filmInfoContainer3: Robert Ford, who's idolized Jesse James since childhood, tries hard to join the reforming gang of the Missouri outlaw, but gradually becomes resentful of the bandit leader.
filmInfoContainer4: On the strength of its two lead performances Assassination is an expertly crafted period piece, and an insightful look at one of the enduring figures of American lore.

filmInfoContainer3: Three activists cobble together a kidnapping plot after they encounter a businessman in his home.
filmInfoContainer4: The Edukators engagingly plays out the clash between youthful idealism and older pragmaticism.

filmInfoContainer3: As kids, they escaped a UFO death cult. Now, two adult brothers seek answers after an old videotape surfaces and brings them back to where they began.
filmInfoContainer4: The Endless benefits from its grounded approach to an increasingly bizarre story, elevated by believable performances by filmmakers Justin Benson and Aaron Moorhead.

filmInfoContainer3: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.
filmInfoContainer4: The Hateful Eight offers another well-aimed round from Quentin Tarantino's signature blend of action, humor, and over-the-top violence -- all while demonstrating an even stronger grip on his filmmaking craft.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman risks losing her chance of happiness with the only man she has ever loved.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite being a period piece, The House of Mirth's depiction of social cruelty still feels chilling and relevant for today.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1993, a teenage girl is forced into a gay conversion therapy center by her conservative guardians.
filmInfoContainer4: The Miseducation of Cameron Post tells its timely coming-of-age story with wit, compassion, and an affecting overall generosity of spirit.

filmInfoContainer3: A concert film featuring four major African American stand up comedians.
filmInfoContainer4: If you want lots of laughs and don't mind some profanity, The Original Kings of Comedy can deliver.

filmInfoContainer3: A British medical doctor fights a cholera epidemic in a small Chinese village, while being trapped at home in a loveless marriage to an unfaithful wife.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually, The Painted Veil has all the trappings of a stuffy period drama, but Norton's and Watts's deft portrayals of imperfect, complicated characters give the film a modern-day spark.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: A waitress, desperate to fulfill her dreams as a restaurant owner, is set on a journey to turn a frog prince back into a human being, but she has to face the same problem after she kisses him.
filmInfoContainer4: The warmth of traditional Disney animation makes this occasionally lightweight fairy-tale update a lively and captivating confection for the holidays.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a family in Waco, Texas in 1956. The eldest son witnesses the loss of innocence and struggles with his parents' conflicting teachings.
filmInfoContainer4: Terrence Malick's singularly deliberate style may prove unrewarding for some, but for patient viewers, Tree of Life is an emotional as well as visual treat.

filmInfoContainer3: A father heads overseas to recover the body of his estranged son who died while traveling the "El camino de Santiago," and decides to take the pilgrimage himself.
filmInfoContainer4: It may be a little too deliberately paced for more impatient viewers, but The Way is a worthy effort from writer/director Emilio Estevez, balancing heartfelt emotion with clear-eyed drama that resists cheap sentiment.

filmInfoContainer3: An actress attempts to convince a director how she's perfect for a role in his upcoming production.
filmInfoContainer4: Provocative, funny, and brilliantly acted, Venus in Fur finds Roman Polanski in top late-period form.

filmInfoContainer3: Shortly before an election, a spin-doctor and a Hollywood producer join efforts to fabricate a war in order to cover up a Presidential sex scandal.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, well-acted, and uncomfortably prescient political satire from director Barry Levinson and and all-star cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Photo-animated feature documentary, uniquely narrated by the 10 people who knew Bill best.
filmInfoContainer4: A treasure trove of archival material and interviews, American: The Bill Hicks Story is an exuberant celebration about a unique, sorely missed voice in comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Bamako. Melé is a bar singer, her husband Chaka is out of work and the couple is on the verge of breaking up... In the courtyard of the house they share with other families, a trial court ...
filmInfoContainer4: A courtroom drama and a portrait of everyday Mali life, Bamako approaches both subjects with equal skill and success.

filmInfoContainer3: The Dark Knight of Gotham City begins his war on crime with his first major enemy being the clownishly homicidal Joker.
filmInfoContainer4: An eerie, haunting spectacle, Batman succeeds as dark entertainment, even if Jack Nicholson's Joker too often overshadows the title character.

filmInfoContainer3: The three-year romance between 19th-century poet John Keats and Fanny Brawne near the end of his life.
filmInfoContainer4: Jane Campion's direction is as refined as her screenplay, and she gets the most out of her cast -- especially Abbie Cornish -- in this understated period drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A film star comes face-to-face with an uncomfortable reflection of herself while starring in a revival of the play that launched her career.
filmInfoContainer4: Bolstered by a trio of powerful performances from its talented leads, Clouds of Sils Maria is an absorbing, richly detailed drama with impressive depth and intelligence.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Crime, Drama, Sci-Fi, Thriller
filmInfoContainer3: A terrorist explosion releases a deadly virus on the masses, and it's up the bounty-hunting Bebop crew to catch the cold-blooded culprit.
filmInfoContainer4: This may be strictly for anime junkies, but they'll find much to like about Cowboy Bebop's casual violence and cool dialogue.

filmInfoContainer3: A dramatization of the disaster in April 2010, when the offshore drilling rig called the Deepwater Horizon exploded, resulting in the worst oil spill in American history.
filmInfoContainer4: Deepwater Horizon makes effective use of its titular man-made disaster to deliver an uncommonly serious -- yet still suitably gripping -- action thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: The French intelligence service alerts the U.S. about a Soviet spy operation during the height of the Cold War, which sets off an unfortunate chain of events.
A young man, his wife, and his incompetent case worker travel across country to find his birth parents.
filmInfoContainer4: Darkly funny, solidly cast, and surprisingly thoughtful, Flirting with Disaster proved David O. Russell's Spanking the Monkey was no fluke.

filmInfoContainer3: A grizzled tank commander makes tough decisions as he and his crew fight their way across Germany in April, 1945.
filmInfoContainer4: Overall, Fury is a well-acted, suitably raw depiction of the horrors of war that offers visceral battle scenes but doesn't quite live up to its larger ambitions.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenager facing an unplanned pregnancy seeks help from her acerbic grandmother, a woman who is long estranged from her daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting a stellar performance from Lily Tomlin and some powerfully empathetic work from writer-director Paul Weitz, Grandma is a dramedy that shouldn't have to ask you to visit.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman is taken along with her mother in 1910 to a far-away desert by her husband, and after his passing, is forced to spend the next 59 years of her life hopelessly trying to escape it.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully filmed with wonderful performances, this Brazilian tale deftly explores the passage of time and prolonged isolation in several decades of a mother and daughter relationship.

filmInfoContainer: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
filmInfoContainer3: In 1935, Indiana Jones arrives in India, still part of the British Empire, and is asked to find a mystical stone. He then stumbles upon a secret cult committing enslavement and human sacrifices in the catacombs of an ancient palace.
filmInfoContainer4: It may be too "dark" for some, but Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom remains an ingenious adventure spectacle that showcases one of Hollywood's finest filmmaking teams in vintage form.

filmInfoContainer3: A touching mother-daughter relationship that reflects the modern South Africa.
A look at the history of fame in the world through the eyes of pop star impresario, Rodney Bingenheimer.
filmInfoContainer4: A fascinating, poignant look at the cult of celebrity.

filmInfoContainer3: Ethics, being human and the soul come to the fore when a 7-year old finds a bag of Pounds just days before the currency is switched to Euros and learns what we are really made of.
filmInfoContainer4: A charming children fable even adults can enjoy.

filmInfoContainer3: When the trail goes cold on a murder investigation of a policeman an undercover narcotics officer is lured back to the force to help solve the case.
filmInfoContainer4: Jason Patric and Ray Liotta are electrifying in this gritty, if a little too familiar, cop drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Six years after the events of "Wreck-It Ralph," Ralph and Vanellope, now friends, discover a wi-fi router in their arcade, leading them into a new adventure.
filmInfoContainer4: Ralph Breaks the Internet levels up on its predecessor with a funny, heartwarming sequel that expands its colorful universe while focusing on core characters and relationships.

filmInfoContainer3: A popular novelist researches unlikely sources to find characters for her next bestseller.
filmInfoContainer4: Claude Lelouch has crafted an engaging thriller about murder and romance with plenty of stylistic panache.

filmInfoContainer3: Author P.L. Travers reflects on her childhood after reluctantly meeting with Walt Disney, who seeks to adapt her Mary Poppins books for the big screen.
filmInfoContainer4: Aggressively likable and sentimental to a fault, Saving Mr. Banks pays tribute to the Disney legacy with excellent performances and sweet, high-spirited charm.

filmInfoContainer3: Add a Plot »
filmInfoContainer4: This fascinating documentary will be of most interest to those who read and write for a living.

filmInfoContainer3: In the 1930s, jazz guitarist Emmet Ray idolizes Django Reinhardt, faces gangsters and falls in love with a mute woman.
filmInfoContainer4: Critics praise Woody Allen's Sweet and Lowdown for its charming, light-hearted comedy and quality acting.

filmInfoContainer3: The new teacher at a severely administered boys' boarding school works to positively affect the students' lives through music.
filmInfoContainer4: While predictable, this low-key heartwarmer manages to be uplifting without overdoing the sentiment.

filmInfoContainer3: A ghost writer, hired to complete the memoirs of a former British Prime Minister, uncovers secrets that put his own life in jeopardy.
filmInfoContainer4: While it may lack the revelatory punch of Polanski's finest films, Ghost Writer benefits from stylish direction, a tense screenplay, and a strong central performance from Ewan McGregor.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1850s Oregon, a gold prospector is chased by the infamous duo of assassins, the Sisters brothers.
filmInfoContainer4: The Sisters Brothers rides familiar genre trails in occasionally unexpected ways - a satisfying journey further elevated by its well-matched leading men.

filmInfoContainer3: A prestigious Stockholm museum's chief art curator finds himself in times of both professional and personal crisis as he attempts to set up a controversial new exhibit.
filmInfoContainer4: The Square finds writer-director Ruben Östlund as ambitious as ever -- and delivering an unforgettably unusual work whose challenging themes pay thought-provoking dividends.

filmInfoContainer3: A former secretary, newly appointed as a scriptwriter for propaganda films, joins the cast and crew of a major production while the Blitz rages around them.
filmInfoContainer4: Carried along by a winning performance from Gemma Arterton, Their Finest smoothly combines comedy and wartime drama to crowd-pleasing effect.

filmInfoContainer3: Two upper-class teenage girls in suburban Connecticut rekindle their unlikely friendship after years of growing apart. Together, they hatch a plan to solve both of their problems-no matter what the cost.
filmInfoContainer4: Thoroughbreds juggles genres with panache, delivering a well-written and refreshingly unpredictable entry in the teen thriller genre.

filmInfoContainer: Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
filmInfoContainer3: Director Michael Winterbottom (Northam) attempts to shoot the adaptation of Laurence Sterne's essentially unfilmable novel, "The Life and Opinions of Tristram Shandy, Gentleman."
filmInfoContainer4: Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon add madcap, knowing performances to the mix, and the result is a fun, postmodern romp.

filmInfoContainer3: The discovery of an abandoned child by two smugglers kicks into a gear a series of tragic, comic events.
filmInfoContainer4: A tragi-comic exploration of the universal search for stability in post-Communist Prague.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the Disney Renaissance, an incredibly prolific, successful and prestigious decade lasting from 1984 to 1994 that saw the fallen Walt Disney Animation Studios' unexpected progressive triumphant return to excellence.
filmInfoContainer4: It doesn't probe as deep -- or tell as many hard truths -- as it could have, but Don Hahn's look at Disney's rebirth offers a fascinating and surprisingly candorous glimpse into the studio's past.

filmInfoContainer3: Another live-action musical version of the play, with all-new songs, rather than the ones used in the famous Mary Martin production.
filmInfoContainer4: Solid if far from definitive, this version of Peter Pan is visually impressive, psychologically complex and faithful to its original source.

filmInfoContainer3: While matchmaking for friends and neighbors, a young 19th-century Englishwoman nearly misses her own chance at love.
filmInfoContainer4: Emma marks an auspicious debut for writer-director Douglas McGrath, making the most of its Jane Austen source material -- and a charming performance from Gwyneth Paltrow.

filmInfoContainer3: A socially awkward teenage math prodigy finds new confidence and new friendships when he lands a spot on the British squad at the International Mathematics Olympiad.
filmInfoContainer4: A Brilliant Young Mind is tender and perceptive -- and intelligent enough to find a wealth of dramatic riches buried under well-trod narrative ground.

filmInfoContainer: Aileen: Life and Death of a Serial Killer
filmInfoContainer3: This documentary looks at Aileen Wuornos convicted of killing 7 men while working as a prostitute in Florida. This is actually the second Wuornos documentary made by this group the first ...
filmInfoContainer4: This chilling, unsettling documentary provides an eye-opening look at both Wuornos and the American justice system.

filmInfoContainer3: Three friends plan to pull off a simple robbery and go on the run.
filmInfoContainer4: Bottle Rocket is Reservoir Dogs meets Breathless with a West Texas sensibility.

filmInfoContainer3: An African-American man is hired to find a woman, and gets mixed up in a murderous political scandal.
filmInfoContainer4: Humor, interesting characters, and attention to details make the stylish Devil in a Blue Dress an above average noir.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman returns to her Orthodox Jewish community that shunned her for her attraction to a female childhood friend. Once back, their passions reignite as they explore the boundaries of faith and sexuality.
filmInfoContainer4: Disobedience explores a variety of thought-provoking themes, bolstered by gripping work from leads Rachel Weisz, Rachel McAdams, and Alessandro Nivola.

filmInfoContainer3: Chris Rock explores the wonders of African-American hairstyles.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, informative, and occasionally sad, Good Hair is a provocative look at the complex relationship between African Americans and their hair.

filmInfoContainer: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
filmInfoContainer3: An ancient prophecy seems to be coming true when a mysterious presence begins stalking the corridors of a school of magic and leaving its victims paralyzed.
filmInfoContainer4: Though perhaps more enchanting for younger audiences, Chamber of Secrets is nevertheless both darker and livelier than its predecessor, expanding and improving upon the first film's universe.

filmInfoContainer3: After a casual encounter, a brokenhearted woman decides to confront her life and the most important events about her stranded daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: Julieta finds writer-director Pedro Almodóvar revisiting familiar themes -- and doing so with his signature skill.

filmInfoContainer3: In a self-destructing world, a vengeful Australian policeman sets out to stop a violent motorcycle gang.
filmInfoContainer4: Staging the improbable car stunts and crashes to perfection, director George Miller succeeds completely in bringing the violent, post-apocalyptic world of Mad Max to visceral life.

filmInfoContainer3: Two sisters find their already strained relationship challenged as a mysterious new planet threatens to collide with Earth.
filmInfoContainer4: Melancholia's dramatic tricks are more obvious than they should be, but this is otherwise a showcase for Kirsten Dunst's acting and for Lars von Trier's profound, visceral vision of depression and destruction.

filmInfoContainer3: Rango is an ordinary chameleon who accidentally winds up in the town of Dirt, a lawless outpost in the Wild West in desperate need of a new sheriff.
filmInfoContainer4: Rango is a smart, giddily creative burst of beautifully animated entertainment, and Johnny Depp gives a colorful vocal performance as a household pet in an unfamiliar world.

filmInfoContainer3: Jackie works as a CCTV operator. Each day she watches over a small part of the world, protecting the people living their lives under her gaze. One day a man appears on her monitor, a man she thought she would never see again, a man she never wanted to see again. Now she has no choice, she is compelled to confront him.
filmInfoContainer4: Red Road director Andrea Arnold skillfully parses out just enough plot details at a time to keep the audience engrossed in this seductive thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: The crew of the USS Enterprise explores the furthest reaches of uncharted space, where they encounter a new ruthless enemy, who puts them, and everything the Federation stands for, to the test.
filmInfoContainer4: Star Trek Beyond continues the franchise's post-reboot hot streak with an epic sci-fi adventure that honors the series' sci-fi roots without skimping on the blockbuster action.

filmInfoContainer3: An I.R.S. auditor suddenly finds himself the subject of narration only he can hear: narration that begins to affect his entire life, from his work, to his love-interest, to his death.
filmInfoContainer4: A fun, whimsical tale about an office drone trying to save his life from his narrator, Stranger Than Fiction features a subdued performances from Will Ferrell that contributes mightily to its quirky, mind-bending affect.

filmInfoContainer3: A young man, falsely imprisoned by his jealous "friend", escapes and uses a hidden treasure to exact his revenge.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it may not reach for any new artistic heights, The Count of Monte Cristo is an old-fashioned yet enjoyable swashbuckler.

filmInfoContainer: The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society
filmInfoContainer3: In the aftermath of World War II, a writer forms an unexpected bond with the residents of Guernsey Island when she decides to write a book about their experiences during the war.
filmInfoContainer4: Far more traditional and straightforward than its unwieldy title, The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Society offers delightful comfort food for fans of period drama.

filmInfoContainer: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
filmInfoContainer3: The dwarves, along with Bilbo Baggins and Gandalf the Grey, continue their quest to reclaim Erebor, their homeland, from Smaug. Bilbo Baggins is in possession of a mysterious and magical ring.
filmInfoContainer4: While still slightly hamstrung by "middle chapter" narrative problems and its formidable length, The Desolation of Smaug represents a more confident, exciting second chapter for the Hobbit series.

filmInfoContainer3: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.
