filmInfoContainer4: Thrilling and superbly acted, The Hunger Games captures the dramatic violence, raw emotion, and ambitious scope of its source novel.

filmInfoContainer3: Chris is a once promising high school athlete whose life is turned upside down following a tragic accident. As he tries to maintain a normal life, he takes a job as a janitor at a bank, where he ultimately finds himself caught up in a planned heist.
filmInfoContainer4: The Lookout is a genuinely suspenseful and affecting noir due to the great ensemble cast and their complex, realistic characters.

filmInfoContainer3: An industrial worker who hasn't slept in a year begins to doubt his own sanity.
filmInfoContainer4: Brad Anderson's dark psychological thriller about a sleepless factory worker is elevated by Christian Bale astonishingly committed performance.

filmInfoContainer3: A struggling salesman takes custody of his son as he's poised to begin a life-changing professional career.
filmInfoContainer4: Will Smith's heartfelt performance elevates The Pursuit of Happyness above mere melodrama.

filmInfoContainer3: In October 1962, the Kennedy administration struggles to contain the Cuban Missile Crisis.
filmInfoContainer4: Thirteen Days offers a compelling look at the Cuban Missile Crisis, and its talented cast deftly portrays the real-life people who were involved.

filmInfoContainer3: In the twenty-fifth century, a time when people have designations instead of names, a man, THX 1138, and a woman, LUH 3417, rebel against their rigidly controlled society.
filmInfoContainer4: George Lucas' feature debut presents a spare, bleak, dystopian future, and features evocatively minimal set design and creepy sound effects.

filmInfoContainer3: A wealthy New York City investment banking executive, Patrick Bateman, hides his alternate psychopathic ego from his co-workers and friends as he delves deeper into his violent, hedonistic fantasies.
filmInfoContainer4: If it falls short of the deadly satire of Bret Easton Ellis's novel, American Psycho still finds its own blend of horror and humor, thanks in part to a fittingly creepy performance by Christian Bale.

filmInfoContainer3: The beautiful daughter of a merchant sacrifices her freedom to save her father from the punishment of a cursed beast.
filmInfoContainer4: With an enchanting cast, beautifully crafted songs, and a painterly eye for detail, Beauty and the Beast offers a faithful yet fresh retelling that honors its beloved source material.

filmInfoContainer3: A chance encounter between a disgraced music-business executive and a young singer-songwriter, new to Manhattan, turns into a promising collaboration between the two talents.
filmInfoContainer4: Writer-director John Carney's return to musical drama isn't quite as potent as it was with Once, but thanks to charming work from its well-matched leads, Begin Again is difficult to resist.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of three brothers, the sons of a shepherd, close to the ndrangheta and of their divided soul.
filmInfoContainer4: Black Souls works within familiar themes to explore intelligent -- and thrillingly entertaining -- dramatic arcs that plunge into the deliciously dark depths of Mafia crime.

filmInfoContainer3: Los Angeles citizens with vastly separate lives collide in interweaving stories of race, loss and redemption.
filmInfoContainer4: A raw and unsettling morality piece on modern angst and urban disconnect, Crash examines the dangers of bigotry and xenophobia in the lives of interconnected Angelenos.

filmInfoContainer3: In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor.
filmInfoContainer4: Far from the Madding Crowd invites tough comparisons to Thomas Hardy's classic novel -- and its previous adaptation -- but stands on its own thanks to strong direction and a talented cast.

filmInfoContainer: I'll See You in My Dreams
filmInfoContainer3: A widow and former songstress discovers that life can begin anew at any age.
filmInfoContainer4: I'll See You in My Dreams would be worth watching even if Blythe Danner's central performance was all it had going for it, but this thoughtful drama satisfies on multiple levels.

filmInfoContainer: In Search of a Midnight Kiss
filmInfoContainer3: Broke and alone on New Year's Eve, Wilson just wants to spend the rest of a very bad year in bed. But, when his best friend convinces him to post a personal ad, he meets a woman bent on finding the right guy to be with at midnight.
filmInfoContainer4: Funny, quirky, and bittersweet, In Search of a Midnight Kiss is a romantic comedy with a heart and a brain -- and stands as a sharp debut for director Alex Holdridge.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1951, Marcus, a working-class Jewish student from New Jersey, attends a small Ohio college, where he struggles with sexual repression and cultural disaffection, amid the ongoing Korean War.
filmInfoContainer4: Indignation proves it's possible to put together an engaging Philip Roth adaptation -- and offers a compelling calling card for debuting writer-director James Schamus.

filmInfoContainer3: A couple find themselves in over their heads when they foster three children.
filmInfoContainer4: Instant Family may not quite capture the complexity of real-life adoption, but fittingly for the unconditional bond it honors, this flawed yet well-intentioned dramedy is ultimately worth the investment.

filmInfoContainer3: A young man of Chinese-Cambodian descent dies, leaving behind his isolated mother and his 4-year male lover, who grieve but don't speak a lick of each other's language.
filmInfoContainer4: Skillfully weaving multiple delicate tonal strands into a quietly affecting whole, Lilting serves as a thoroughly compelling calling card for writer-director Hong Khaou.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the true life story of a young Marine corporal whose unique discipline and bond with her military combat dog saved many lives during their deployment in Iraq.
filmInfoContainer4: Megan Leavey honors its real-life subjects with a sensitive, uplifting drama whose honest emotion more than makes up for its mild approach to the story.

filmInfoContainer3: Gianni is a middle-aged man living in Rome with his imposing and demanding elderly mother. His only outlet from her and the increasing debt into which they are sinking, are the increasingly...
filmInfoContainer4: Thoughtful, warm-hearted, and delightfully free of pretense, Mid-August Lunch offers viewers a light diversion with some surprising depth.

filmInfoContainer3: The life and works of Japanese artist and ukiyo-e painter Katsushika Hokusai, as seen from the eyes of his daughter, Katsushika O-Ei.
filmInfoContainer4: Miss Hokusai illuminates the life and creative legacy of its brilliant subject with a beautifully animated biopic whose absorbing visuals are matched by its narrative grace.

filmInfoContainer3: A struggling comedy writer, fresh off a breakup and in the midst of the worst year of his life, returns to Sacramento to care for his dying mother.
filmInfoContainer4: Other People resists easy melodrama, rewarding viewers with a smart, subtle look at family dynamics with a talented cast and a finely calibrated blend of funny and serious moments.

filmInfoContainer3: The fate of a Hungarian Jewish family throughout the 20th century.
While examining the influence of the fast food industry, Morgan Spurlock personally explores the consequences on his health of a diet of solely McDonald's food for one month.
filmInfoContainer4: Entertaining doc about the adverse effects of eating fast food.

filmInfoContainer3: Narrowly avoiding jail, new dad Robbie vows to turn over a new leaf. A visit to a whisky distillery inspires him and his mates to seek a way out of their hopeless lives.
filmInfoContainer4: The Angels' Share is a surprisingly delightful, uplifting comedy that successfully blends a charming story of redemption with bits of dark humor and a social message.

filmInfoContainer3: A man spreads the rumor of his fake homosexuality with the aid of his neighbor, to prevent his imminent firing at his work.
filmInfoContainer4: A pleasant comedy with a great cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Toranosuke Sugi, a brave and loyal Samurai, fights to practice and preserve his master's teachings amid a civil war. With friends on both side will he cave to temptation, or stand on principle and for freedom?
filmInfoContainer4: With high production values and thrilling battle scenes, The Last Samurai is a satisfying epic.

filmInfoContainer3: Snoopy embarks upon his greatest mission as he and his team take to the skies to pursue their archnemesis, while his best pal Charlie Brown begins his own epic quest back home to win the love of his life.
filmInfoContainer4: The Peanuts Movie offers a colorful gateway into the world of its classic characters and a sweetly nostalgic -- if relatively unambitious -- treat for the adults who grew up with them.

filmInfoContainer3: A motorcycle stunt rider turns to robbing banks as a way to provide for his lover and their newborn child, a decision that puts him on a collision course with an ambitious rookie cop navigating a department ruled by a corrupt detective.
filmInfoContainer4: Ambitious to a fault, The Place Beyond the Pines finds writer/director Derek Cianfrance reaching for -- and often grasping -- thorny themes of family, fatherhood, and fate.

filmInfoContainer3: It's 1968, and four young, talented Australian Aboriginal girls learn about love, friendship and war when their all-girl group The Sapphires entertain the US troops in Vietnam.
filmInfoContainer4: While it's plenty predictable and sentimental, The Sapphires also has an irresistible feel-good vibe, winning music and charming performances to spare.

filmInfoContainer3: A strait-laced French student moves into an apartment in Barcelona with a cast of six other characters from all over Europe. Together, they speak the international language of love and friendship.
filmInfoContainer4: This multicultural comedy captures the chaos and excitement of being young.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1974, high-wire artist Philippe Petit recruits a team of people to help him realize his dream: to walk the immense void between the World Trade Center towers.
filmInfoContainer4: The Walk attempts a tricky balancing act between thrilling visuals and fact-based drama -- and like its wire-walking protagonist, pulls it off with impressive élan.

filmInfoContainer3: A family of beekeepers living in the Tuscan countryside finds their household disrupted by the simultaneous arrival of a silently troubled teenage boy and a reality TV show intent on showcasing the family.
filmInfoContainer4: The Wonders offers a charming coming-of-age tale that doubles as a quietly effective tribute to a vanishing way of life.

filmInfoContainer: The Yes Men Fix the World
filmInfoContainer3: Troublemaking duo Andy Bichlbaum and Mike Bonanno, posing as their industrious alter-egos, expose the people profiting from Hurricane Katrina, the faces behind the environmental disaster in Bhopal, and other shocking events.
filmInfoContainer4: The Yes Men aim their barbs at the capitalist fat-cats with gutsy and hilarious performance pranks.

filmInfoContainer3: A family suffers from a major communication breakdown during their struggle to get through their hardships.
filmInfoContainer4: Exploring the effects of a family's dealings with an underhanded politician, this crime drama avoids showing the violent outcomes of its characters' misdeeds, resulting in a lingeringly potent film.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1940 Col. Dufort arrives in Timbuktu with his wife to take over the French garrison. This garrison is threatened by a Tuareg uprising supposedly inspired by Mohamet Adjani -- a holy man ...
filmInfoContainer4: Gracefully assembled and ultimately disquieting, Timbuktu is a timely film with a powerful message.

filmInfoContainer3: Tully Coates, Jr., with his good looks and chiseled body, is the local heartthrob, and while he has a new girlfriend virtually every night, he's incapable of getting close to anyone. His ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: A beautifully acted, quietly moving little film.

filmInfoContainer3: After making their way through high school (twice), big changes are in store for officers Schmidt and Jenko when they go deep undercover at a local college.
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting even more of the bromantic chemistry between its stars -- and even more of the goofy, good-natured humor that made its predecessor so much fun -- 22 Jump Street is the rare sequel that improves upon the original.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1947, Jackie Robinson becomes the first African-American to play in Major League Baseball in the modern era when he was signed by the Brooklyn Dodgers and faces considerable racism in the process.
filmInfoContainer4: 42 is an earnest, inspirational, and respectfully told biography of an influential American sports icon, though it might be a little too safe and old-fashioned for some.

filmInfoContainer3: Stephanie is a single mother with a parenting vlog who befriends Emily, a secretive upper-class woman who has a child at the same elementary school. When Emily goes missing, Stephanie takes it upon herself to investigate.
filmInfoContainer4: Twisty, twisted, and above all simply fun, A Simple Favor casts a stylish mommy noir spell strengthened by potent performances from Anna Kendrick and Blake Lively.

filmInfoContainer3: Shirin is struggling to become an ideal Persian daughter, politically correct bisexual and hip young Brooklynite but fails miserably in her attempt at all identities. Being without a cliché to hold onto can be a lonely experience.
filmInfoContainer4: Warm, funny, and quietly profound, Appropriate Behavior serves as a thoroughly compelling calling card for writer, director, and star Desiree Akhavan.

filmInfoContainer3: The son of a Baptist preacher is forced to participate in a church-supported gay conversion program after being forcibly outed to his parents.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored in empathy by writer-director-star Joel Edgerton, Boy Erased proves the road to complex, powerfully performed drama can also be paved with good intentions.

filmInfoContainer3: After being forgotten in a highway café during a bus trip, a housewife decides to start a new life by herself in Venice.
filmInfoContainer4: Bread and Tulips is a sweet-natured comedy offering gentle, escapist entertainment.

filmInfoContainer: Casino Jack and the United States of Money
filmInfoContainer3: A probing investigation into the lies, greed and corruption surrounding D.C. super-lobbyist Jack Abramoff and his cronies.
filmInfoContainer4: Casino Jack's subject matter is enraging, but in the hands pf director Alex Gibney, it's also well-presented and briskly entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: Chopper tells the intense story of Mark "Chopper" Read, a legendary criminal who wrote his autobiography while serving a jail sentence in prison. His book, "From the Inside", upon which the film is based, was a best-seller.
filmInfoContainer4: Eric Bana's performance as the charming but twisted Chopper is the highlight of this disturbing portrait about Australia's notorious author/criminal.

filmInfoContainer: Drunk Stoned Brilliant Dead: The Story of the National Lampoon
filmInfoContainer3: A look at the history of the American comedy publication and production company, National Lampoon, from its beginning in the 1970s to 2010, featuring rare and never-before-seen footage.
filmInfoContainer4: Drunk Stoned Brilliant Dead might not be the definitive doc National Lampoon fans are waiting for, but it's still almost as transgressively funny as the magazine in its heyday.

filmInfoContainer3: An airline pilot saves almost all his passengers on his malfunctioning airliner which eventually crashed, but an investigation into the accident reveals something troubling.
filmInfoContainer4: Robert Zemeckis makes a triumphant return to live-action cinema with Flight, a thoughtful and provocative character study propelled by a compelling performance from Denzel Washington.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the life of philosopher and political theorist Hannah Arendt, who reported for The New Yorker on the war crimes trial of the Nazi Adolf Eichmann.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a powerful performance from Barbara Sukowa, Hannah Arendt does a commendable job of dramatizing the life of a complex public figure.

filmInfoContainer3: A man in his early 30s (Keane) struggles with the supposed loss of his daughter from the Port Authority Bus Terminal in New York, while fighting serious battles with schizophrenia. We can ...
filmInfoContainer4: The scrutinizing camera angles of Keane might at first feel too close for comfort, but this powerful portrait of a man distraught by the abduction of his child plumbs the depths of mental illness and the corners of fleabag hotels in an intimate and touching examination of the seedier side of life.

filmInfoContainer3: Dave Lizewski is an unnoticed high school student and comic book fan who one day decides to become a superhero, even though he has no powers, training or meaningful reason to do so.
filmInfoContainer4: Not for the faint of heart, Kick-Ass takes the comic adaptation genre to new levels of visual style, bloody violence, and gleeful profanity.

filmInfoContainer3: A spy organization recruits an unrefined, but promising street kid into the agency's ultra-competitive training program, just as a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius.
filmInfoContainer4: Stylish, subversive, and above all fun, Kingsman: The Secret Service finds director Matthew Vaughn sending up the spy genre with gleeful abandon.

filmInfoContainer3: A french girl gifted with a great voice, has a complex about her weight and her appearance.
filmInfoContainer4: An observant drama-comedy about self absorption.

filmInfoContainer3: Eric, a football fanatic postman whose life is descending into crisis, receives some life coaching from the famously philosophical Eric Cantona.
filmInfoContainer4: Ken Loach's latest is an uplifting, entertaining and amusing socio-drama featuring a match-winning performance from Eric Cantona.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Thurgood Marshall, the crusading lawyer who would become the first African-American Supreme Court Justice, as he battles through one of his career-defining cases.
filmInfoContainer4: Marshall takes an illuminating, well-acted look at its real-life subject's early career that also delivers as an entertainingly old-fashioned courtroom drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Jim White moves his family after losing his last job as a football coach. He sees that some of the students are worth starting a cross-country team and turns seven students with no hope into one of the best cross-country teams.
filmInfoContainer4: Disney's inspirational sports drama formula might be old hat, but McFarland, USA proves it still works -- especially with a talented director and eminently likable star in the mix.

filmInfoContainer3: Male nurse Greg Focker meets his girlfriend's parents before proposing, but her suspicious father is every date's worst nightmare.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite sometimes sitcom-like execution, Meet the Parents is a hilarious look at familial relationships that works mostly because the chemistry between its two leads is so effective.

filmInfoContainer3: Within Brooklyn's ultra-orthodox Jewish community, a widower battles for custody of his son. A tender drama performed entirely in Yiddish, the film intimately explores the nature of faith and the price of parenthood.
filmInfoContainer4: Menashe offers an intriguing look at a culture whose unfamiliarity to many viewers will be rendered irrelevant by the story's universally affecting themes and thoughtful approach.

filmInfoContainer: Once in a Lifetime: The Extraordinary Story of the New York Cosmos
filmInfoContainer3: The rise and fall of the N.Y. Cosmos. The soccer team that brought Pele to America; against the backdrop of N.Y. City in the 70's.
filmInfoContainer4: You don't have to be a soccer fan to enjoy this stylish, breezy slice of 1970s sports history.

filmInfoContainer3: Pauline is a 'little girl of 66 years old'. She is intellectually disabled and been cared after by her sister Martha. When Martha dies, her two younger sisters, Paulette and Cecile have to ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Pauline and Paulette is a gently poignant, compassionate tale.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in the near future, an ex-jewel thief receives a gift from his son: a robot butler programmed to look after him. But soon the two companions try their luck as a heist team.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a brilliant performance from star Frank Langella, Robot & Frank works as both a quirky indie drama and as a smart, thoughtful meditation on aging.

filmInfoContainer3: A year after the murder of her mother, a teenage girl is terrorized by a new killer, who targets the girl and her friends by using horror films as part of a deadly game.
filmInfoContainer4: Horror icon Wes Craven's subversive deconstruction of the genre is sly, witty, and surprisingly effective as a slasher film itself, even if it's a little too cheeky for some.

filmInfoContainer3: A mentally disturbed man takes residence in a halfway house. His mind gradually slips back into the realm created by his illness, where he replays a key part of his childhood.
filmInfoContainer4: Ralph Fiennes is brilliant in this accomplished and haunting David Cronenberg film.

filmInfoContainer3: An ambitious graduate student convinces a writer that her thesis can resurrect his career.
filmInfoContainer4: Starting Out in the Evening features sharp dialogue and moving performances from the talented Frank Langella and Lili Taylor.

filmInfoContainer3: The general manager at a highway-side ''sports bar with curves" has her incurable optimism and faith, in her girls, her customers, and herself, tested over the course of a long, strange day.
filmInfoContainer4: Support the Girls handles serious themes with wit and humor, and provides a strong showcase for Regina Hall and a talented ensemble cast.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Washington D.C. radio personality Ralph "Petey" Greene, an ex-con who became a popular talk show host and community activist in the 1960s.
filmInfoContainer4: A riveting look at the life of legendary DJ "Petey" Greene, Talk to Me goes beyond the typical biopic with explosive performances from Don Cheadle and Chiwetal Ejiofor.

filmInfoContainer3: Comedy-drama about a widowed U.S. President and a lobbyist who fall in love. It's all above-board, but "politics is perception", and sparks fly anyway.
filmInfoContainer4: A charming romantic comedy with political bite, Rob Reiner's American President features strong lead performances and some poignant observations of politics and media in the 1990s.

filmInfoContainer: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
filmInfoContainer3: Tells the story of Benjamin Button, a man who starts aging backwards with bizarre consequences.
filmInfoContainer4: Curious Case of Benjamin Button is an epic fantasy tale with rich storytelling backed by fantastic performances.

filmInfoContainer3: For two weeks, 20 male participants are hired to play prisoners and guards in a prison. The "prisoners" have to follow seemingly mild rules, and the "guards" are told to retain order without using physical violence.

The story of Ray Kroc, a salesman who turned two brothers' innovative fast food eatery, McDonald's, into the biggest restaurant business in the world, with a combination of ambition, persistence, and ruthlessness.
filmInfoContainer4: The Founder puts Michael Keaton's magnetic performance at the center of a smart, satisfying biopic that traces the rise of one of America's most influential businessmen -- and the birth of one of its most far-reaching industries.

filmInfoContainer3: After a wealthy banker is given an opportunity to participate in a mysterious game, his life is turned upside down when he becomes unable to distinguish between the game and reality.
filmInfoContainer4: The ending could use a little work but this is otherwise another sterling example of David Fincher's iron grip on atmosphere and storytelling.

filmInfoContainer3: A modern-day witch uses spells and magic to get men to fall in love with her.
filmInfoContainer4: The Love Witch offers an absorbing visual homage to a bygone era, arranged subtly in service of a thought-provoking meditation on the battle of the sexes.

filmInfoContainer: The Man Who Fell to Earth
filmInfoContainer3: An alien must pose as a human to save his dying planet, but a woman and greed of other men create complications.
filmInfoContainer4: Filled with stunning imagery, The Man Who Fell to Earth is a calm, meditative film that profoundly explores our culture's values and desires.

filmInfoContainer3: A compilation of interviews, rehearsals and backstage footage of Michael Jackson as he prepared for his series of sold-out shows in London.
filmInfoContainer4: While it may not be the definitive concert film (or the insightful backstage look) some will hope for, Michael Jackson's This Is It packs more than enough entertainment value to live up to its ambitious title.

filmInfoContainer3: A violin prodigy and his father travel to Beijing, where the father seeks the means to his son's success while the son struggles to accept the path laid before him.
filmInfoContainer4: Though melodramatic at times, Together is heartwarming and well-acted.

filmInfoContainer3: A preoperative transgender woman takes an unexpected journey when she learns that she fathered a son, now a teenage runaway hustling on the streets of New York.
filmInfoContainer4: A terrific performance by Felicity Huffman carries this unconventional but touching transgender road movie.

filmInfoContainer3: Two mutants come to a private academy for their kind whose resident superhero team must oppose a terrorist organization with similar powers.
filmInfoContainer4: Faithful to the comics and filled with action, X-Men brings a crowded slate of classic Marvel characters to the screen with a talented ensemble cast and surprisingly sharp narrative focus.

filmInfoContainer3: The fabled children's story show from Broadway produced for television.
filmInfoContainer4: Solid if far from definitive, this version of Peter Pan is visually impressive, psychologically complex and faithful to its original source.

filmInfoContainer3: Diagnosed with an autoimmune disease, journalist Shannon Harvey went in search of the missing link in healthcare. Featuring interviews with leading scientists The Connection proves we have more to say about our health than we thought.
filmInfoContainer4: The Connection doesn't do itself any favors by forcing comparisons to The French Connection, but it's a reasonably entertaining thriller in its own right.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenage girl with nothing to lose joins a traveling magazine sales crew, and gets caught up in a whirlwind of hard partying, law bending and young love as she criss-crosses the Midwest with a band of misfits.
filmInfoContainer4: American Honey offers a refreshingly unconventional take on the coming-of-age drama whose narrative risks add up to a rewarding experience even if they don't all pay off.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Barry Seal, an American pilot who became a drug-runner for the CIA in the 1980s in a clandestine operation that would be exposed as the Iran-Contra Affair.
filmInfoContainer4: American Made's fast-and-loose attitude with its real-life story mirrors the cavalier -- and delightfully watchable -- energy Tom Cruise gives off in the leading role.

filmInfoContainer3: The pressures of fame have superstar singer Noni on the edge, until she meets Kaz, a young cop who works to help her find the courage to develop her own voice and break free to become the artist she was meant to be.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to smart direction and a powerhouse performance from Gugu Mbatha-Raw, Beyond the Lights transcends its formulaic storyline to deliver thoroughly entertaining drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A fisherman, a smuggler, and a syndicate of businessmen match wits over the possession of a priceless diamond.
filmInfoContainer4: Blood Diamond overcomes poor storytelling with its biting commentary and fine performances.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Christine Chubbuck, a 1970s TV reporter struggling with depression and professional frustrations as she tries to advance her career.
filmInfoContainer4: Rising on the strength of Rebecca Hall's gripping performance, Christine offers an empathetic look at its subject's public career and painful private life.

filmInfoContainer3: A middle-aged husband's life changes dramatically when his wife asks him for a divorce. He seeks to rediscover his manhood with the help of a newfound friend, Jacob, learning to pick up girls at bars.
filmInfoContainer4: It never lives up to the first part of its title, but Crazy, Stupid, Love's unabashed sweetness -- and its terrifically talented cast -- more than make up for its flaws.

filmInfoContainer3: When a boy's beloved dog passes away suddenly, he attempts to bring the animal back to life through a powerful science experiment.
filmInfoContainer4: Frankenweenie is an energetic stop-motion horror movie spoof with lovingly crafted visuals and a heartfelt, oddball story.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of friends who meet regularly for game nights find themselves entangled in a real-life mystery when the shady brother of one of them is seemingly kidnapped by dangerous gangsters.
filmInfoContainer4: With a talented cast turned loose on a loaded premise -- and a sharp script loaded with dark comedy and unexpected twists -- Game Night might be more fun than the real thing.

filmInfoContainer3: A father and daughter form an unlikely songwriting duo in the summer before she leaves for college.
filmInfoContainer4: Thoroughly sweet, comfortably familiar, and elevated by the chemistry between Nick Offerman and Kiersey Clemons, Hearts Beat Loud offers feel-good father-daughter drama.

filmInfoContainer3: During World War II era, a young woman, Wang Jiazhi, gets swept up in a dangerous game of emotional intrigue with a powerful political figure, Mr. Yee.
filmInfoContainer4: Ang Lee's Lust, Caution is a tense, sensual and beautifully-shot espionage film.

filmInfoContainer3: Jean, his loving wife and son live a simple, happy life. At his son's homeroom teacher Madamoiselle Chambon's request, he volunteers as substitute teacher and starts to fall for her ...

In Lausanne, the aspirant pianist Jeanne Pollet has lunch with her mother Louise Pollet, her boyfriend Axel and his mother. Lenna leans that when she was born, a nurse had mistakenly told ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting a masterful performance by Huppert, Merci Pour Le Chocolat is a suspenseful psychological thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: An experience about the highest peaks around the world.
filmInfoContainer4: Mountain offers a visually thrilling -- and surprisingly affecting -- look at man's relationship with some of Earth's most imposing natural wonders.

filmInfoContainer3: A film about the life and career of the American painter, Jackson Pollock.
filmInfoContainer4: Though Pollock does not really allow audiences a glimpse of the painter as a person, it does powerfully depict the creative process. Harris throws himself into the role and turns in a compelling performance.

filmInfoContainer3: In a Napoleonic era insane asylum, an inmate, the irrepressible Marquis De Sade, fights a battle of wills against a tyrannically prudish doctor.
filmInfoContainer4: Though hard to watch, this film's disturbing exploration of freedom of expression is both seductive and thought-provoking.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman's world unravels when a drug prescribed by her psychiatrist has unexpected side effects.
filmInfoContainer4: A smart, clever thriller with plenty of disquieting twists, Side Effects is yet another assured effort from director Steven Soderbergh.

filmInfoContainer: Supermensch: The Legend of Shep Gordon
filmInfoContainer3: The life and career of the legendary Hollywood insider, Shep Gordon.
filmInfoContainer4: Its unabashedly positive tone may strike some viewers as disingenuous, but even if Supermensch doesn't tell the whole story, it's an undeniably entertaining one.

filmInfoContainer3: Three old high school friends meet in a Michigan motel room to dissect painful memories from their past.
filmInfoContainer4: Tape's stagebound feel is balanced by the engrossing psychodrama of its storyline, which allows a committed cast to shine.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastic worlds where he must face his greatest fears.
filmInfoContainer4: The Book of Life's gorgeous animation is a treat, but it's a pity that its story lacks the same level of craft and detail that its thrilling visuals provide.

filmInfoContainer3: Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to North London to help a single mother raising 4 children alone in a house plagued by a supernatural spirit.
filmInfoContainer4: The Conjuring 2 can't help but lose a bit of its predecessor's chilly sting through familiarity, but what remains is still a superior ghost story told with spine-tingling skill.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary portrait of the late John Wojtowicz, whose attempted robbery of a Brooklyn bank to finance his male lover's sex-reassignment surgery was the real-life inspiration for Dog Day Afternoon (1975).
filmInfoContainer4: Fascinating, evocative, and as unconventional as its subject, The Dog offers a colorful window into the real-life story behind a classic film.

filmInfoContainer3: A kindergarten teacher in New York becomes obsessed with one of her students whom she believes is a child prodigy.
filmInfoContainer4: Elevated by a bravura performance from Maggie Gyllenhaal, The Kindergarten Teacher is one American remake that retains its impact the second time around.

filmInfoContainer3: A lawyer defending a wealthy man begins to believe his client is guilty of more than just one crime.
filmInfoContainer4: It doesn't offer any twists on the predictable courtroom thriller formula, but with a charming Matthew McConaughey leading its solid cast, The Lincoln Lawyer offers briskly enjoyable entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: In a war ridden country a woman watches over the husband reduced to a vegetable state by a bullet in the neck, abandoned by Jihad companions and brothers. One day, the woman decides to say things to him she could never have done before.
filmInfoContainer4: It may prove frustratingly slow for some viewers, but more contemplative filmgoers will find themselves rewarded by The Patience Stone's quietly fierce storytelling, as well as a searing starring turn from Golshifteh Farahani.

filmInfoContainer3: A scheming wife lures an insurance investigator into helping murder her husband and then declare it an accident. The investigator's boss, not knowing his man is involved in it, suspects murder and sets out to prove it.
filmInfoContainer4: A dark, tautly constructed adaptation of James M. Cain's novel -- penned by Billy Wilder and Raymond Chandler -- Double Indemnity continues to set the standard for the best in Hollywood film noir.

filmInfoContainer3: At the center of this extremely visualized narrative are the illusionist and his brother, who is lazy on the basis of either great love, or exorbitant envy of the brother. Having spoiled ...
filmInfoContainer4: The Illusionist is an engrossing, well-crafted story of mystery, magic and intrigue that is certain to enchant, if not hypnotize, audiences.

filmInfoContainer3: A gardener in East L.A. struggles to keep his son away from gangs and immigration agents while trying to give his son the opportunities he never had.

filmInfoContainer: Balzac and the Little Chinese Seamstress
filmInfoContainer3: Two youths sent for a Maoist "re-education" in the mountains fall in love with the village tailor's granddaughter.
filmInfoContainer4: This delicately told fable about the power of literature is a lyrical delight.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of how Benjamin "Bugsy" Siegel started Las Vegas.
filmInfoContainer4: Stylishly scattered, Bugsy offers cinematic homage to the infamous underworld legend, chiefly through a magnetic performance from Warren Beatty in the title role.

filmInfoContainer3: Archival footage, animation, and music are used to look back at the eight anti-war protesters who were put on trial following the 1968 Democratic National Convention.
filmInfoContainer4: Brett Morgan's half-animated, half-documentary film is an arresting, sometimes visionary portrait of the historic and chaotic trial.

filmInfoContainer3: The Rizzos, a family who doesn't share their habits, aspirations, and careers with one another, find their delicate web of lies disturbed by the arrival of a young ex-con (Strait) brought ...
filmInfoContainer4: Raymond De Felitta combines warmth, humanity, and a natural sense of humor, and is abetted by Andy Garcia and an excellent ensemble cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A loan officer who evicts an old woman from her home finds herself the recipient of a supernatural curse. Desperate, she turns to a seer to try and save her soul, while evil forces work to push her to a breaking point.
filmInfoContainer4: Sam Raimi returns to top form with Drag Me to Hell, a frightening, hilarious, delightfully campy thrill ride.

filmInfoContainer3: Several ordinary high school students go through their daily routine as two others prepare for something more malevolent.
filmInfoContainer4: The movie's spare and unconventional style will divide viewers.

filmInfoContainer3: A New York City doctor pushes himself on a harrowing and dangerous night-long odyssey of sexual and moral discovery after his wife admits that she once almost cheated on him.
filmInfoContainer4: Kubrick's intense study of the human psyche yields an impressive cinematic work.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of Southern California high school students are enjoying their most important subjects: sex, drugs, and rock n' roll.
filmInfoContainer4: While Fast Times at Ridgemont High features Sean Penn's legendary performance, the film endures because it accurately captured the small details of school, work, and teenage life.

filmInfoContainer3: A biography of artist Frida Kahlo, who channeled the pain of a crippling injury and her tempestuous marriage into her work.
filmInfoContainer4: Frida is a passionate, visually striking biopic about the larger-than-life artist.

filmInfoContainer: Going Upriver: The Long War of John Kerry
filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on Senator John Kerry's Navy tour of duty in Vietnam, his contributions to the peace movement that followed, and the ultimate shape of his future political career.
filmInfoContainer4: Interesting and revealing footage of both Kerry and the Vietnam era in general.

filmInfoContainer3: James Bond teams up with the lone survivor of a destroyed Russian research center to stop the hijacking of a nuclear space weapon by a fellow Agent formerly believed to be dead.
filmInfoContainer4: The first and best Pierce Brosnan Bond film, GoldenEye brings the series into a more modern context, and the result is a 007 entry that's high-tech, action-packed, and urbane.

filmInfoContainer3: Following the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy fights through grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define her husband's historic legacy.
filmInfoContainer4: Jackie offers an alluring peek into a beloved American public figure's private world -- and an enthralling starring performance from Natalie Portman in the bargain.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary shot by film-makers all over the world that serves as a time capsule to show future generations what it was like to be alive on the twenty-fourth of July, 2010.
John McClane and a young hacker join forces to take down master cyber-terrorist Thomas Gabriel in Washington D.C.
filmInfoContainer4: Live Free or Die Hard may be preposterous, but it's an efficient, action-packed summer popcorn flick with thrilling stunts and a commanding performance by Bruce Willis. Fans of the previous Die Hard films will not be disappointed.

filmInfoContainer3: The life of a simple bookshop owner changes when he meets the most famous film star in the world.
filmInfoContainer4: Charming performances provide romance aplenty.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in the early 1960s and during the era of Vatican II, a young woman in training to become a nun struggles with issues of faith, the changing church and sexuality.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a gripping performance from Melissa Leo, Novitiate grapples uncompromisingly -- and ultimately compellingly -- with questions of faith and feminism.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama focused on a life-changing moment in 67-year-old train engineer Odd Horten's existence: the evening of his retirement.
filmInfoContainer4: Bent Hamer's latest is a droll, deadpan comedy filled with strange touches and melancholy charm.

filmInfoContainer3: Beca, a freshman at Barden University, is cajoled into joining The Bellas, her school's all-girls singing group. Injecting some much needed energy into their repertoire, The Bellas take on their male rivals in a campus competition.
filmInfoContainer4: Pitch Perfect's plot is formulaic, but the performances are excellent and the musical numbers are toe-tapping as well.

filmInfoContainer3: This is the story of Ana, a first generation Mexican-American teenager on the verge of becoming a woman. She lives in the predominately Latino community of East Los Angeles. Freshly ...
filmInfoContainer4: Even though Real Women is another coming-of-age tale, it's a real charmer.

filmInfoContainer3: During the summer of 1979, a group of friends witness a train crash and investigate subsequent unexplained events in their small town.
filmInfoContainer4: It may evoke memories of classic summer blockbusters a little too eagerly for some, but Super 8 has thrills, visual dazzle, and emotional depth to spare.

filmInfoContainer3: After 20 years abroad, Mark Renton returns to Scotland and reunites with his old friends Sick Boy, Spud, and Begbie.
filmInfoContainer4: T2 Trainspotting adds an intoxicating, emotionally resonant postscript to its classic predecessor, even without fully recapturing the original's fresh, subversive thrill.

filmInfoContainer: Teen Titans Go! To the Movies
filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Comedy, Family, Musical, Sci-Fi
filmInfoContainer3: A villain's maniacal plan for world domination sidetracks five teenage superheroes who dream of Hollywood stardom.
filmInfoContainer4: Teen Titans Go! To the Movies distills the enduring appeal of its colorful characters into a charmingly light-hearted adventure whose wacky humor fuels its infectious fun -- and belies a surprising level of intelligence.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary chronicling sports legend Lance Armstrong's improbable rise and ultimate fall from grace.
filmInfoContainer4: Smartly constructed and scathingly sharp, The Armstrong Lie presents an effective indictment of its unscrupulous subject -- as well as the sports culture that spawned him.

filmInfoContainer3: Young Danny Flynn is released from prison 14 years after "taking the rap" for the IRA and tries to rebuild his life in his old Belfast neighborhood.
filmInfoContainer4: The Boxer is a standard drama that packs a true emotional wallop thanks to the highly tuned central performances.

filmInfoContainer3: After moving to a new town, two brothers discover that the area is a haven for vampires.
filmInfoContainer4: Flawed but eminently watchable, Joel Schumacher's teen vampire thriller blends horror, humor, and plenty of visual style with standout performances from a cast full of young 1980s stars.

filmInfoContainer3: Confined in an apartment from a New York housing project, the six Angulo brothers learned everything they know about the world through watching films and spend their time reenacting their favorite movies with intricate homemade costumes.
filmInfoContainer4: Offering a unique look at modern fears and our fascination with film, The Wolfpack is a fascinating -- and ultimately haunting -- urban fable.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Russian princess Anastasia, life is easy for her royal castles and fabulous wealth that go with being the daughter of Czar Nicholas.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautiful animation, an affable take on Russian history, and strong voice performances make Anastasia a winning first film from Fox animation studios.

filmInfoContainer3: Yann (Guillaume Canet) and Nadia (Leïla Bekhti) fall in love. Nadia has acquired a crumbling building in a Paris suburb and the couple decide to renovate it to launch a restaurant. But ...
The story of a group of Israeli soldiers stationed in an outpost prior to the withdrawal of forces of 2000.
filmInfoContainer4: Beaufort is a deeply observant and meditative war film, masterfully rendered by director Joseph Cedar.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that investigates incidents of hunger experienced by millions of Americans, and proposed solutions to the problem.
filmInfoContainer4: A Place at the Table is a well-reported documentary that raises important questions about the state of hunger in America culture.

filmInfoContainer3: Antwone Fisher, a young navy man, is forced to see a psychiatrist after a violent outburst against a fellow crewman. During the course of treatment a painful past is revealed and a new hope begins.
filmInfoContainer4: Washington's directing debut is a solidly crafted, emotionally touching work.

filmInfoContainer3: A broken-hearted hit man moves to the desert where he finds skilled swordsmen to carry out his contract killings.
filmInfoContainer4: Wong Kar Wai's redux, with a few slight changes from his 1994 classic, is a feast for the eyes, if a little difficult to follow.

filmInfoContainer3: On one day, in one city, the world comes together to grant one 5 year old cancer patient his wish. Batkid Begins looks at the 'why' of this flash phenomenon.
filmInfoContainer4: Sweet and unabashedly sentimental, Batkid Begins is an uplifting look at a selfless act that brought a city together.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of over-achieving Asian-American high school seniors enjoy a power trip when they dip into extra-curricular criminal activities.
filmInfoContainer4: A promising work by Lin, the energetic Better Luck Tomorrow is disturbing and thought-provoking.

filmInfoContainer3: A preteen's life turns upside down when he befriends the new girl in school and they imagine a whole new fantasy world to escape reality.
filmInfoContainer4: Bridge to Terabithia is a faithful adaptation of a beloved children's novel and a powerful portrayal of love, loss, and imagination through children's eyes.

filmInfoContainer3: A young man who was sentenced to seven years in prison for robbing a post office ends up spending three decades in solitary confinement. During this time, his own personality is supplanted by his alter-ego, Charles Bronson.
filmInfoContainer4: Undeniably gripping, Bronson forces the viewer to make some hard decisions about where the line between art and exploitation lies.

filmInfoContainer3: A mysterious device designed to provide its owner with eternal life resurfaces after four hundred years, leaving a trail of destruction in its path.
filmInfoContainer4: Guillermo del Toro's unique feature debut is not only gory and stylish, but also charming and intelligent.

filmInfoContainer3: Separated by a checkpoint, Palestinian lovers from Jerusalem and Ramallah arrange clandestine meetings.
filmInfoContainer4: Suleiman utilizes absurdist humor to craft a provocative, original film.

filmInfoContainer3: Dominic Toretto and his crew of street racers plan a massive heist to buy their freedom while in the sights of a powerful Brazilian drug lord and a dangerous federal agent.
filmInfoContainer4: Sleek, loud, and over the top, Fast Five proudly embraces its brainless action thrills and injects new life into the franchise.

filmInfoContainer3: Frank, a single man raising his child prodigy niece Mary, is drawn into a custody battle with his mother.
filmInfoContainer4: Gifted isn't quite as bright as its pint-sized protagonist, but a charming cast wrings respectably engaging drama out of a fairly predictable premise.

filmInfoContainer3: When four lifelong friends travel to New Orleans for the annual Essence Festival, sisterhoods are rekindled, wild sides are rediscovered, and there's enough dancing, drinking, brawling, and romancing to make the Big Easy blush.
filmInfoContainer4: Girls Trip is the rare R-rated comedy that pushes boundaries to truly comedic effect -- and anchors its laughs in compelling characters brought to life by a brilliantly assembled cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Twin boys move to a new home with their mother after she has face changing cosmetic surgery, but under her bandages is someone the children don't recognize.
filmInfoContainer4: Dark, violent, and drenched in dread, Goodnight Mommy is perfect for extreme horror enthusiasts -- or filmgoers who prefer to watch between splayed fingers.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman struggles to reconcile her love for her boyfriend and for heroin, as she finds out that suicide is the only way for her boyfriend to forgive her for her misdeed.
filmInfoContainer4: Grueling and rewarding in equal measure, Heaven Knows What hits hard -- and serves as a powerful calling card for its captivating star, Arielle Holmes.

filmInfoContainer: In the Realms of the Unreal
filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on Henry Darger, visionary artist, janitor, and novelist.
filmInfoContainer4: A fascinating treatment on the life of a reclusive man.

filmInfoContainer3: From childhood to adulthood, Tibet's fourteenth Dalai Lama deals with Chinese oppression and other problems.
filmInfoContainer4: Hallucinatory but lacking in characterization, Kundun is a young Dalai Lama portrait presented as a feast of sight and sound.

filmInfoContainer3: A family in financial crisis is forced to sell Lassie, their beloved dog. Hundreds of miles away from her true family, Lassie escapes and sets out on a journey home.
filmInfoContainer4: A beautifully-made retelling of the classic collie tale, one need not be a dog-lover to fall for Lassie.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of old friends reminisce about their lives over the years after the death of one of their crew.
filmInfoContainer4: With a cast that includes some of the best acting talent in Britain, Last Orders is a rewarding character-driven ensemble piece.

filmInfoContainer3: A semi-literate and lonely odd-job man bonds with a much older and well-read woman.
filmInfoContainer4: It's sentimental and treacly, but that's not enough to prevent My Afternoons with Margueritte from being truly affecting.

filmInfoContainer3: A movie crew invades a small town whose residents are all too ready to give up their values for showbiz glitz.
filmInfoContainer4: State and Main offers plenty of wit and laughs in its lampoons of the movie industry.

filmInfoContainer3: A heart-racing documentary portrait of Carl Boenish, the father of the BASE jumping movement, whose early passion for skydiving led him to ever more spectacular -and dangerous- feats of foot-launched human flight.
filmInfoContainer4: Sunshine Superman shines a light on a fascinating life with copious amounts of incredible, thrilling footage.

filmInfoContainer3: In a hospital on the outskirts of 1920s Los Angeles, an injured stuntman begins to tell a fellow patient, a little girl with a broken arm, a fantastic story of five mythical heroes. Thanks to his fractured state of mind and her vivid imagination, the line between fiction and reality blurs as the tale advances.
filmInfoContainer4: More visually elaborate than the fragmented story can sometimes support, The Fall walks the line between labor of love and filmmaker self-indulgence.

filmInfoContainer3: In turn-of-the-century Vienna, a magician uses his abilities to secure the love of a woman far above his social standing.
filmInfoContainer4: The Illusionist is an engrossing, well-crafted story of mystery, magic and intrigue that is certain to enchant, if not hypnotize, audiences.

filmInfoContainer3: A man accepts an invitation to a dinner party hosted by his ex-wife, an unsettling affair that reopens old wounds and creates new tensions.
filmInfoContainer4: The Invitation makes brilliant use of its tension-rich premise to deliver a uniquely effective -- and surprisingly clever -- slow-building thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: Having both coincidentally cheated death on the same day, estranged twins reunite with the possibility of mending their relationship.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by powerful performances from Kristen Wiig and Bill Hader, The Skeleton Twins effectively mines laughs and tears from family drama.

filmInfoContainer3: When a man goes for virtual vacation memories of the planet Mars, an unexpected and harrowing series of events forces him to go to the planet for real - or does he?
filmInfoContainer4: Under Paul Verhoeven's frenetic direction, Total Recall is a fast-paced rush of violence, gore, and humor that never slacks.

filmInfoContainer3: Add a Plot »
filmInfoContainer4: A highly entertaining entry in Disney's renaissance era," Aladdin is beautifully drawn, with near-classic songs and a cast of scene-stealing characters.

filmInfoContainer3: When famous DJ Alan Partridge's radio station is taken over by a new media conglomerate, it sets in motion a chain of events which see Alan having to work with the police to defuse a potentially violent siege.
filmInfoContainer4: The Alan Partridge movie ditches the TV series' nuanced humor for something broader, and succeeds in presenting the character on a global scale.

filmInfoContainer3: Arthur Curry learns that he is the heir to the underwater kingdom of Atlantis, and must step forward to lead his people and be a hero to the world.
filmInfoContainer4: Aquaman swims with its entertainingly ludicrous tide, offering up CGI superhero spectacle that delivers energetic action with an emphasis on good old-fashioned fun.

filmInfoContainer3: The picaresque and touching story of the politically incorrect, fully lived life of the impulsive, irascible and fearlessly blunt Barney Panofsky.
filmInfoContainer4: With a magnificent performance by Paul Giamatti, Barney's Version offers much comedy and insight to the complexities of modern romance.

filmInfoContainer3: Three high school friends gain superpowers after making an incredible discovery underground. Soon they find their lives spinning out of control and their bond tested as they embrace their darker sides.
filmInfoContainer4: Chronicle transcends its found-footage gimmick with a smart script, fast-paced direction, and engaging performances from the young cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A dowdy university instructor Isa is an inattentive husband to his younger, TV-business wife Bahar. Self-absorbed and selfish, Isa only communicates in the most rudimentary way, while she, similarly, detaches into crying jags and juvenile behavior.
filmInfoContainer4: Aesthetically sound and solidly acted, but will nonetheless ring hollow for some viewers.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in the ghettos of Paris in 2010, an undercover cop and ex-thug try to infiltrate a gang in order to defuse a neutron bomb.
filmInfoContainer4: A nonstop thrill ride, District B13's dizzying action sequences more than make up for any expository flaws.

filmInfoContainer3: A young teacher inspires her class of at-risk students to learn tolerance, apply themselves and pursue education beyond high school.
filmInfoContainer4: Freedom Writers is a frank, formulaic entry in the inspirational inner-city teacher genre, with an energetic Hilary Swank leading the appealing cast of unknowns.

filmInfoContainer3: Deckard Shaw seeks revenge against Dominic Toretto and his family for his comatose brother.
filmInfoContainer4: Serving up a fresh round of over-the-top thrills while adding unexpected dramatic heft, Furious 7 keeps the franchise moving in more ways than one.

filmInfoContainer3: Diana, without her father knowing it, trains as a boxer and achieves impressive success, blazing new trails for female boxers.
filmInfoContainer4: Michelle Rodriguez gives a compelling performance, despite lack of a boxing background; Karyn Kusama packs a punch with this directorial debut.

filmInfoContainer3: Charlotte Bronte's classic novel is filmed yet again. The story of the Yorkshire orphan who becomes a governess to a young French girl and finds love with the brooding lord of the manor is ...
An ex-con, who is the unlikeliest of role models, meets a 15-year-old boy and is faced with the choice of redemption or ruin.
filmInfoContainer4: Rich in atmosphere and anchored by a powerful performance from Nicolas Cage, Joe is a satisfying return to form for its star -- as well as director David Gordon Green.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: Continuing his "legendary adventures of awesomeness", Po must face two hugely epic, but different threats: one supernatural and the other a little closer to home.
filmInfoContainer4: Kung Fu Panda 3 boasts the requisite visual splendor, but like its rotund protagonist, this sequel's narrative is also surprisingly nimble, adding up to animated fun for the whole family.

filmInfoContainer3: Marcus Luttrell and his team set out on a mission to capture or kill notorious Taliban leader Ahmad Shah, in late June 2005. Marcus and his team are left to fight for their lives in one of the most valiant efforts of modern warfare.
filmInfoContainer4: A true account of military courage and survival, Lone Survivor wields enough visceral power to mitigate its heavy-handed jingoism.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the relationship between Mike and Sulley during their days at Monsters University -- when they weren't necessarily the best of friends.
filmInfoContainer4: Offering Monsters, Inc. fans a return visit with beloved characters, Monsters University delivers funny and thoughtful family entertainment for viewers of any age.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman who has been in and out of rehab for the past ten years, returns home for the weekend for her sister's wedding.
filmInfoContainer4: Rachel Getting Married is an engrossing tale of family angst, highlighted by Anne Hathaway's powerful performance and director Jonathan Demme's return to form.

filmInfoContainer3: On an impoverished Italian island, a free-spirited woman is accused of madness by townspeople fed up with her antics.
filmInfoContainer4: A sweet, but slight picture filled with beautiful people and locations.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1954, a U.S. Marshal investigates the disappearance of a murderer, who escaped from a hospital for the criminally insane.
filmInfoContainer4: It may not rank with Scorsese's best work, but Shutter Island's gleefully unapologetic genre thrills represent the director at his most unrestrained.

filmInfoContainer3: In Hamburg, German-Greek chef Zinos unknowingly disturbs the peace in his locals-only restaurant by hiring a more talented chef.
The son of a founding leader in the Palestinian organization, Hamas, becomes a spy for the Israelis.
filmInfoContainer4: The Green Prince doesn't answer all the questions it raises, but it's still timely, gripping -- and ultimately uplifting -- viewing.

filmInfoContainer3: A troubled couple vacate to a beautiful getaway, but bizarre circumstances further complicate their situation.
filmInfoContainer4: The One I Love doesn't take its intriguing premise quite as far as it could, but it still adds up to an ambitious, well-acted look at love and marriage.

filmInfoContainer: The Other Side of the Wind
filmInfoContainer3: A Hollywood director emerges from semi-exile with plans to complete work on an innovative motion picture.
filmInfoContainer4: A satisfying must-watch for diehard cineastes, The Other Side of the Wind offers the opportunity to witness a long-lost chapter in a brilliant filmmaker's career.

filmInfoContainer3: A man's life begins to unravel when his mistress brings him a bag of cash.
filmInfoContainer4: The Square may not quite live up to the modern noir classics that inspired it, but with twists and tension to spare, it comes admirably close.

filmInfoContainer3: A drifter discovers a pair of sunglasses that allow him to wake up to the fact that aliens have taken over the Earth.
filmInfoContainer4: A politically subversive blend of horror and sci fi, They Live is an underrated genre film from John Carpenter.

filmInfoContainer3: An Asian cross-cultural trilogy of horror films from accomplished indie directors.
filmInfoContainer4: This anthology contains brutal, powerful horror stories by three of Asia's top directors.

filmInfoContainer3: Following the suicide of his wife, an Israeli intelligence agent is assigned to befriend the grandchildren of a Nazi war criminal.
filmInfoContainer4: Politically complex and ambitious, Walk on Water delivers a memorable story of guilt, revenge, and human connectivity.

filmInfoContainer2: Action, Biography, Drama, History, Thriller, War
filmInfoContainer3: Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home to his wife and kids after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behind.
filmInfoContainer4: Powered by Clint Eastwood's sure-handed direction and a gripping central performance from Bradley Cooper, American Sniper delivers a tense, vivid tribute to its real-life subject.

filmInfoContainer3: As the Mayan kingdom faces its decline, a young man is taken on a perilous journey to a world ruled by fear and oppression.
filmInfoContainer4: Apocalypto is a brilliantly filmed, if mercilessly bloody, examination of a once great civilization.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of the 1973 tennis match between World number one Billie Jean King and ex-champ and serial hustler Bobby Riggs.
filmInfoContainer4: Battle of the Sexes turns real-life events into a crowd-pleasing, well-acted dramedy that ably entertains while smartly serving up a volley of present-day parallels.

filmInfoContainer3: A re-imagining of jazz legend Chet Baker's musical comeback in the late '60s.
filmInfoContainer4: Born to Be Blue benefits from a highlight-reel performance from Ethan Hawke and an impressionistic, non-hagiographic approach to Chet Baker's life and times.

filmInfoContainer3: A rich high school student tries to boost a new pupil's popularity, but reckons without affairs of the heart getting in the way.
filmInfoContainer4: A funny and clever reshaping of Emma, Clueless offers a soft satire that pokes as much fun at teen films as it does at the Beverly Hills glitterati.

filmInfoContainer3: A film producer struggles with suicidal despair.
filmInfoContainer4: A tragedy gracefully lifted by tender empathy and moments of joy, Father of My Children is a quiet triumph for writer-director Mia Hansen-Love.

filmInfoContainer3: A little boy and his baby-sitter inhabit the same imaginary world: through their adventures they are followed by a strange red balloon.
filmInfoContainer4: Hou Hsiao-hsien's remake of the 1956 classic is unhurried, contemplative, and visually rapturous.

filmInfoContainer3: Devastated Peter takes a Hawaiian vacation in order to deal with the recent break-up with his TV star girlfriend, Sarah. Little does he know, Sarah's traveling to the same resort as her ex - and she's bringing along her new boyfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: With ample laughs and sharp performances, Forgetting Sarah Marshall finds just the right mix of romantic and raunchy comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Vicki Maloney is randomly abducted from a suburban street by a disturbed couple. As she observes the dynamic between her captors she quickly realises she must drive a wedge between them if she is to survive.
filmInfoContainer4: Smartly constructed and powerfully acted, Hounds of Love satisfies as a psychological thriller with a few nasty surprises -- and marks writer-director Ben Young as a promising talent.

filmInfoContainer3: The destinies of two families are irrevocably tied together after a cyclist is hit off the road by a jeep in the night before Christmas Eve.
filmInfoContainer4: Part character study, part socioeconomic fable, Human Capital offers trenchant commentary as well as absorbing drama.

filmInfoContainer3: True story of the lifelong romance between novelist Iris Murdoch and her husband John Bayley, from their student days through her battle with Alzheimer's disease.
filmInfoContainer4: A solidly constructed drama, Iris is greatly elevated by the strength of its four lead performances.

filmInfoContainer3: Mourning his dead child, a haunted Vietnam War veteran attempts to uncover his past while suffering from a severe case of dissociation. To do so, he must decipher reality and life from his own dreams, delusions, and perceptions of death.
PATTI CAKE$ is centered on aspiring rapper Patricia Dombrowski, a.k.a. Killa P, a.k.a. Patti Cake$, who is fighting an unlikely quest for glory in her downtrodden hometown in New Jersey.
filmInfoContainer4: Patti Cake$ hits a number of predictable beats, but adds enough fresh elements -- not least Danielle MacDonald's potentially starmaking turn -- to make its underdog story work.

filmInfoContainer3: The adventures of an orphaned boy named Pete and his best friend Elliot, who just so happens to be a dragon.
filmInfoContainer4: Pete's Dragon continues Disney's current live-action winning streak with an update that gives the original a visual overhaul without overwhelming its sweet, soulful charm.

filmInfoContainer3: As Magdalena's 15th birthday approaches, her simple, blissful life is complicated by the discovery that she's pregnant. Kicked out of her house, she finds a new family with her great-granduncle and gay cousin.
filmInfoContainer4: This slice-of-life story of a teenage girl in Echo Park is both a sweet crowd-pleaser and a perceptive look at socioeconomic community issues.

filmInfoContainer3: The film chronicles the summer 1989 afternoon when the future President of the United States, Barack Obama, wooed his future First Lady, Michelle Obama, on a first date across Chicago's South Side.
filmInfoContainer4: Southside With You looks back on a fateful real-life date with strong performances and engaging dialogue, adding up to a romance that makes for a pretty good date movie in its own right.

filmInfoContainer3: A theatre director struggles with his work, and the women in his life, as he creates a life-size replica of New York City inside a warehouse as part of his new play.
filmInfoContainer4: Charlie Kaufman's ambitious directorial debut occasionally strains to connect, but ultimately provides fascinating insight into a writer's mind.

filmInfoContainer3: An Albanian family is torn apart by a murder, resulting in a blood feud that makes eldest son Nik a prime target and forces his sister, eldest daughter Rudina, to leave school in order to take over the family business.
In 1971, twenty-four male students are selected to take on randomly assigned roles of prisoners and guards in a mock prison situated in the basement of the Stanford psychology building.
filmInfoContainer4: As chillingly thought-provoking as it is absorbing and well-acted, The Stanford Prison Experiment offers historical drama that packs a timelessly relevant punch.

filmInfoContainer3: In New York City, the lives of a lawyer, an actuary, a house-cleaner, a professor and the people around them intersect as they ponder order and happiness in the face of life's cold unpredictability.
filmInfoContainer4: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing is an intelligent and poignant look at lives intersecting.

filmInfoContainer3: A cinematic portrait of various gay Orthodox Jews who struggle to reconcile their faith and their sexual orientation.
filmInfoContainer4: Trembling Before G-d looks at the effects of religious morality on believers whose sexuality falls outside the accepted norm with intelligence and compassion.

filmInfoContainer3: Two girlfriends on a summer holiday in Spain become enamored with the same painter, unaware that his ex-wife, with whom he has a tempestuous relationship, is about to re-enter the picture.
filmInfoContainer4: A beguiling tragicomedy, Vicky Cristina Barcelona charms with beautiful views of the Spanish city and a marvelously well-matched cast.

filmInfoContainer3: To learn what the USA can learn from other nations, Michael Moore playfully "invades" them to see what they have to offer.
filmInfoContainer4: Where to Invade Next finds documentarian Michael Moore approaching progressive politics with renewed -- albeit unabashedly one-sided -- vigor.

filmInfoContainer3: A movie director does a new film against heroine consumption, and the producers are heroine dealers.
filmInfoContainer4: Not only does it break ground in presenting a rarely examined age group, Innocence is a well-acted, powerful story about love.

filmInfoContainer3: The History of American Punk Rock 1980-1986
filmInfoContainer4: American Hardcore is an informative and highly entertaining look at the heyday of punk in the early 1980s.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Drama, Family, Fantasy, Musical, Mystery, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: The last surviving child of the Russian Royal Family joins two con men to reunite with her grandmother, the Dowager Empress, while the undead Rasputin seeks her death.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautiful animation, an affable take on Russian history, and strong voice performances make Anastasia a winning first film from Fox animation studios.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Drama, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: A working-class family man, Christopher Robin, encounters his childhood friend Winnie-the-Pooh, who helps him to rediscover the joys of life.
filmInfoContainer4: Christopher Robin may not equal A.A. Milne's stories -- or their animated Disney adaptations -- but it should prove sweet enough for audiences seeking a little childhood magic.

filmInfoContainer: Comic-Con Episode IV: A Fan's Hope
filmInfoContainer3: A behind-the-scenes look at the fans who gather by the thousands each year in San Diego, California to attend Comic-Con, the world's largest comic book convention.
The natural history of the oceans
Spending the summer at a Catskills resort with her family, Frances "Baby" Houseman falls in love with the camp's dance instructor, Johnny Castle.
filmInfoContainer4: Like its winsome characters, Dirty Dancing uses impressive choreography and the power of song to surmount a series of formidable obstacles.

filmInfoContainer3: A basketball player's father must try to convince him to go to a college so he can get a shorter sentence.
filmInfoContainer4: Though not without its flaws, He Got Game finds Spike Lee at or near the top of his late-period game, combining trenchant commentary with his signature visuals and a strong performance from Denzel Washington.

filmInfoContainer3: Friendless Peter Klaven goes on a series of man-dates to find a Best Man for his wedding. But, when his insta-bond with his new B.F.F. puts a strain on his relationship with his fiancée, can the trio learn to live happily ever after?
filmInfoContainer4: I Love You, Man makes the most of its simple premise due to the heartfelt and hilarious performances of Paul Rudd and Jason Segel.

filmInfoContainer3: A Frenchwoman tells her marital troubles to a man she mistakes for a psychiatrist, and soon they form an unusual relationship.
filmInfoContainer4: Intimate Strangers is Hitchcockian noir with a Gallic twist: Rather than simply imitating the genre's form, director/screenwriter Patrice Leconte delves into the underlying psychological drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A service that provides holographic recreations of deceased loved ones allows a woman to come face-to-face with the younger version of her late husband.
filmInfoContainer4: Intimate in setting yet ambitious in scope, the beautifully acted Marjorie Prime poses thought-provoking questions about memory, humanity, and love.

filmInfoContainer3: This documentary follows NBA superstar LeBron James and four of his talented teammates through the trials and tribulations of high school basketball in Ohio and James' journey to fame.
filmInfoContainer4: Though the film may not delve as deep as some would prefer, More Than a Game is an inspiring documentary featuring likable youngsters, a positive message, and some exciting in-game footage.

filmInfoContainer3: A wealthy art gallery owner is haunted by her ex-husband's novel, a violent thriller she interprets as a symbolic revenge tale.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-acted and lovely to look at, Nocturnal Animals further underscores writer-director Tom Ford's distinctive visual and narrative skill.

filmInfoContainer3: An eleven-year-old girl watches her father come down with a crippling depression. Over one summer, she learns answers to several mysteries, and comes to terms with love and loss.
filmInfoContainer4: Excellent performances mark this leisurely paced film.

filmInfoContainer3: A wayward daughter invites her dying mother and the rest of her estranged family to her apartment for Thanksgiving dinner.
filmInfoContainer4: Pieces of April transcends its small-scale setting and budget with endearing performances, playful humor, and genuine sweetness, resulting in a touching holiday treat.

filmInfoContainer3: In the depths of the Korvatunturi mountains, 486 meters deep, lies the closest ever guarded secret of Christmas. The time has come to dig it up. This Christmas everyone will believe in Santa Claus.
filmInfoContainer4: Rare Exports is an unexpectedly delightful crossbreed of deadpan comedy and Christmas horror.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of a newly appointed African-American coach and his high school team on their first season as a racially integrated unit.
filmInfoContainer4: An inspirational crowd-pleaser with a healthy dose of social commentary, Remember the Titans may be predictable, but it's also well-crafted and features terrific performances.

filmInfoContainer3: The filming of Nosferatu (1922) is hampered by the fact that its star Max Schreck is taking the role of a vampire far more seriously than seems humanly possible.
filmInfoContainer4: Shadow of the Vampire is frightening, compelling, and funny, and features an excellent performance by Willem Dafoe.

filmInfoContainer3: A compassionate young man, raised in an orphanage and trained to be a doctor there, decides to leave to see the world.
filmInfoContainer4: The Cider House Rules has wonderful performances, lovely visuals, and an old-fashioned feel.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Drama, Family, Fantasy, Musical
filmInfoContainer3: An Egyptian prince learns of his identity as a Hebrew and his destiny to become the chosen deliverer of his people.
filmInfoContainer4: The Prince of Egypt's stunning visuals and first-rate voice cast more than compensate for the fact that it's better crafted than it is emotionally involving.

filmInfoContainer3: A man entranced by his dreams and imagination is love-struck with a French woman and feels he can show her his world.
filmInfoContainer4: Lovely and diffuse, Sleep isn't as immediately absorbing as Gondry's previous work, but its messy beauty is its own reward.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary chronicling Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour's preparations for the 2007 fall-fashion issue.
filmInfoContainer4: This doc about the making of Vogue's biggest issue and its frosty editor-in-chief is fascinating eye candy and light-on-its-feet fun.

filmInfoContainer3: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland in 1997, a comic book fan adopts the persona of his favourite hero to save his enthusiastic friend and fight a tyrannical overlord.
filmInfoContainer4: A nostalgic ode to kids' movies of yesteryear, Turbo Kid eyes the past through an entertaining -- albeit surprisingly gory -- postmodern lens.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the life of legendary fashion designer Valentino.
filmInfoContainer4: Valentino: the Last Emperor utilizes its access to the fashion icon to the fullest, and the result is a glitzy, dishy, and insightful documentary.

filmInfoContainer3: In Bodeen, Texas, an indie-rock loving misfit finds a way of dealing with her small-town misery after she discovers a roller derby league in nearby Austin.
filmInfoContainer4: While made from overly familiar ingredients, Drew Barrymore's directorial debut has enough charm, energy, and good-natured humor to transcend its many cliches.

filmInfoContainer3: Nina Geld (Winstead) is a bracingly funny and blisteringly provocative stand-up comedian whose career is taking off, but whose personal life is a near-complete disaster. To escape a ...
filmInfoContainer4: Led by an outstanding central performance from Mary Elizabeth Winstead and brilliantly held together by writer-director Eva Vives, All About Nina is a delightfully raw dramedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Determined to make her own path in life, Princess Merida defies a custom that brings chaos to her kingdom. Granted one wish, Merida must rely on her bravery and her archery skills to undo a beastly curse.
filmInfoContainer4: Brave offers young audiences and fairy tale fans a rousing, funny fantasy adventure with a distaff twist and surprising depth.

filmInfoContainer3: When her father unexpectedly passes away, young Ella finds herself at the mercy of her cruel stepmother and her scheming step-sisters. Never one to give up hope, Ella's fortunes begin to change after meeting a dashing stranger.
filmInfoContainer4: Refreshingly traditional in a revisionist era, Kenneth Branagh's Cinderella proves Disney hasn't lost any of its old-fashioned magic.

filmInfoContainer3: Separated at the end of the Vietnam war, an "Americanized" woman and her Vietnamese mother are reunited after 22 years.
filmInfoContainer4: An emotionally wrenching portrayal of a family reunion that doesn't turn out as expected.

filmInfoContainer3: After inadvertently wreaking havoc on the elf community due to his ungainly size, a man raised as an elf at the North Pole is sent to the U.S. in search of his true identity.
filmInfoContainer4: A movie full of Yuletide cheer, Elf is a spirited, good-natured family comedy, and it benefits greatly from Will Ferrell's funny and charming performance as one of Santa's biggest helpers.

filmInfoContainer3: A young man's peculiar upbringing renders him unable to competently cope with the struggle of growing up.
filmInfoContainer4: In the vein of The Catcher in the Rye, Igby Goes Down is scathingly witty and sharply observant.

filmInfoContainer3: An unhinged social media stalker moves to LA and insinuates herself into the life of an Instagram star.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by strong performances from Aubrey Plaza and Elizabeth Olsen, Ingrid Goes West delivers smart, topical humor underlined by timely social observations.
