filmInfoContainer3: As an actress starts to adopt the persona of her character in a film, her world starts to become nightmarish and surreal.
filmInfoContainer4: Typical David Lynch fare: fans of the director will find Inland Empire seductive and deep. All others will consider the heady surrealism impenetrable and pointless.

filmInfoContainer3: After more than forty years apart, Andreas and Claire embark on an affair as reckless and intense as when they were young lovers. Widowed musician Andreas decides to get back in touch with ...
filmInfoContainer4: Not only does it break ground in presenting a rarely examined age group, Innocence is a well-acted, powerful story about love.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that questions the cost -- and value -- of higher education in the United States.
filmInfoContainer4: Although Ivory Tower makes it clear that there isn't enough room in a 90-minute film to tackle spiraling student loan debt, it also serves as a compelling call for deeper investigation.

filmInfoContainer3: Legendary explorer Thor Heyerdal's epic 4,300-mile crossing of the Pacific on a balsawood raft in 1947, in an effort to prove that it was possible for South Americans to settle in Polynesia in pre-Columbian times.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-crafted retelling of an epic true story, Kon Tiki is a throwback to old-school adventure filmmaking that's exciting and entertaining in spite of its by-the-book plotting.

filmInfoContainer3: A story that exposes the conspiracy of prominent German institutions and government branches to cover up the crimes of Nazis during World War II.
filmInfoContainer4: Labyrinth of Lies artfully blends fact with well-intentioned fiction to offer a thought-provoking look at how the lessons of history can be easily lost or forgotten.

filmInfoContainer3: In Tokyo, a young sex worker develops an unexpected connection with a widower over a period of two days.
filmInfoContainer4: In his second film outside his native Iran, director Abbas Kiarostami maintains the mysterious, reflective mood of previous triumphs.

filmInfoContainer3: Settlers traveling through the Oregon desert in 1845 find themselves stranded in harsh conditions.
filmInfoContainer4: Moving at a contemplative speed unseen in most westerns, Meek's Cutoff is an effective, intense journey of terror and survival in the untamed frontier.

filmInfoContainer3: All but abandoned by her family in a London retirement hotel, an elderly woman strikes up a curious friendship with a young writer.
filmInfoContainer4: Bittersweet and endearing, this film about aging and unexpected friendship is a lovely vehicle for Joan Plowright.

filmInfoContainer3: An indictment of closeted politicians who lobby for anti-gay legislation in the U.S.
filmInfoContainer4: Outrage walks a difficult moral and ethical line -- and not always successfully -- but despite its flaws, it's a fascinating, provocative look at homosexuality in American politics.

filmInfoContainer3: A bank manager with: (a) a gambling problem and (b) access to a multimillion dollar account gets into a messy situation. Based on the story of the largest one-man bank fraud in Canadian history.
filmInfoContainer4: This story of addiction may lack the typical flash and glamour, but Hoffman makes Mahowny compelling.

filmInfoContainer3: Through a set of wacky circumstances, a young gold digger mistakenly woos a mild-mannered bartender thinking he's a wealthy suitor.
filmInfoContainer4: Priceless is a light, farcical rom-com that features sharp performances from Audrey Tautou and Gad Elmaleh.

filmInfoContainer3: Looking for answers to life's big questions, a stuttering boy joins his high school debate team.
filmInfoContainer4: Though Rocket Science appears to be a typically quirky indie, the well-rounded performances and director Jeffrey Blitz's clear affection for his characters gives the film its proper human spark.

filmInfoContainer3: A novelist struggling with writer's block finds romance in a most unusual way: by creating a female character he thinks will love him, then willing her into existence.
filmInfoContainer4: Cleverly written and wonderfully acted, Ruby Sparks overcomes its occasional lags in pace with an abundance of charm and wit.

filmInfoContainer3: A struggling screenwriter inadvertently becomes entangled in the Los Angeles criminal underworld after his oddball friends kidnap a gangster's beloved Shih Tzu.
filmInfoContainer4: Seven Psychopaths delivers sly cinematic commentary while serving up a heaping helping of sharp dialogue and gleeful violence.

filmInfoContainer3: A burgeoning stand-up comedian struggles with the stress of a stalled career, a stale relationship, and the wild spurts of severe sleepwalking he is desperate to ignore.
filmInfoContainer4: Laugh-out-loud funny and endearingly messy, Sleepwalk with Me overcomes its tonal inconsistencies to deliver a sweetly melancholic, amiably reassuring indie crowd-pleaser.

filmInfoContainer3: The son of acclaimed cinematographer Haskell Wexler confronts his complex father by turning the camera on him. What results is a portrait of a difficult genius and a son's path out of the shadow of a famous father.
filmInfoContainer4: The dysfunctional interaction between director and subject is fascinating, poignant, and revealing of both men and of father-son relationships in general.

filmInfoContainer3: After reuniting with his mother in Ho Chi Minh City, a family tragedy causes Binh to flee from Viet Nam to America. Landing in New York, Binh begins a road trip to Texas, where his American father is said to live.
filmInfoContainer4: The plight of Asian refugees is sensitively rendered, and the movie builds, with the help of Nolte, to a wrenchingly poignant conclusion.

filmInfoContainer3: An idealistic staffer for a new presidential candidate gets a crash course on dirty politics during his stint on the campaign trail.
filmInfoContainer4: While not exactly exposing revelatory truths, The Ides of March is supremely well-acted drama that moves at a measured, confident clip.

filmInfoContainer3: Two young men, one Israeli and one Palestinian, discover they were accidentally switched at birth.
A documentary on the life of John Lennon, with a focus on the time in his life when he transformed from a musician into an antiwar activist.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it glosses over anything negative about Lennon, this documentary offers a lot of fascinating archival footage, plus its political issues still have relevance for today.

filmInfoContainer3: Former United States Secretary of Defense, Donald Rumsfeld, discusses his career in Washington D.C. from his days as a congressman in the early 1960s to planning the invasion of Iraq in 2003.
filmInfoContainer4: Viewers hoping to see Donald Rumsfeld admit making mistakes in public office (or hoping Errol Morris will force him to give straight answers) may find The Unknown Known frustrating -- but no less fascinating.

filmInfoContainer3: A comedian tries to make it as a serious actor when his reality television star fiancée talks him into broadcasting their wedding on her television show.
filmInfoContainer4: As smart, funny, and trenchant as writer-director-star Chris Rock's best standup work, Top Five is a career highlight for its creator -- and one of the comedy standouts of 2014.

filmInfoContainer3: When his son's body is found in a humiliating accident, a lonely high school teacher inadvertently attracts an overwhelming amount of community and media attention after covering up the truth with a phony suicide note.
filmInfoContainer4: World's Greatest Dad is a risky, deadpan, dark comedy that effectively explores the nature of posthumous cults of celebrity.

filmInfoContainer3: A rebellious and controversial Mexican pop icon becomes a huge success with her style and catchy songs, but a larger than life scandal will rock her world entirely.
filmInfoContainer4: Marvelously directed by Sebastian Lelio and beautifully led by a powerful performance from Paulina Garcia, Gloria takes an honest, sweetly poignant look at a type of character that's all too often neglected in Hollywood.

filmInfoContainer3: After his twin brother is accidentally killed by vengeful bullies, a 12-year old boy and his friends face the harsh realities of death, teenage hormones, and family dysfunction.
filmInfoContainer4: This shocking pre-teen drama manages, through realistic performances and a sense of empathy, to avoid exploitation and instead deliver something honest and haunting.

filmInfoContainer3: One murdered man, eight women, each seeming to be eager than the others to know the truth. Gimme, gimme, gimme some clues to make up my mind. And eventually enter the truth. Oh, thou cruel woman!
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring some of the best French actresses working today, 8 Women is frothy, delirious, over-the-top fun.

filmInfoContainer3: A cynical, immature young man is taught how to act like a grown-up by a little boy.
filmInfoContainer4: About a Boy benefits tremendously from Hugh Grant's layered performance, as well as a funny, moving story that tugs at the heartstrings without tilting into treacle.

filmInfoContainer3: Small-town love story of a young man with a reputation for womanizing and his best friend's sister.
filmInfoContainer4: Has enough honest moments to warrant a look.

filmInfoContainer3: When Tony Stark and Bruce Banner try to jump-start a dormant peacekeeping program called Ultron, things go horribly wrong and it's up to Earth's mightiest heroes to stop the villainous Ultron from enacting his terrible plan.
filmInfoContainer4: Exuberant and eye-popping, Avengers: Age of Ultron serves as an overstuffed but mostly satisfying sequel, reuniting its predecessor's unwieldy cast with a few new additions and a worthy foe.

filmInfoContainer3: Tragedy strikes a married couple on vacation in the Moroccan desert, touching off an interlocking story involving four different families.
filmInfoContainer4: In Babel, there are no villains, only victims of fate and circumstance. Director Alejandro Gonzalez Iñarritu weaves four of their woeful stories into this mature and multidimensional film.

filmInfoContainer: Back to the Future Part II
filmInfoContainer3: After visiting 2015, Marty McFly must repeat his visit to 1955 to prevent disastrous changes to 1985...without interfering with his first trip.
filmInfoContainer4: Back to the Future II is far more uneven than its predecessor, but its madcap highs outweigh the occasionally cluttered machinations of an overstuffed plot.

filmInfoContainer3: A couple who can't stop fighting embark on a last-ditch effort to save their marriage: turning their fights into songs and starting a band.
filmInfoContainer4: Band Aid tells a solidly affecting story of a relationship on the rocks -- and marks star Zoe Lister-Jones, who also wrote and directed, as a tremendous triple threat worth watching.

filmInfoContainer3: When a protective father meets a murderous ex-con, both need to deviate from the path they are on as they soon find themselves entangled in a downwards spiral of lies and violence while having to confront their own inner psyche.
filmInfoContainer4: Boasting plenty of twists, a suitably seedy tone, and a memorable supporting turn from Don Johnson, Cold in July proves an uncommonly rewarding thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: The lives of four black students at an Ivy League college.
filmInfoContainer4: Dear White People adds a welcome new voice to cinema's oft-neglected discussion of race, tackling its timely themes with intelligence, honesty, and gratifyingly sharp wit.

filmInfoContainer3: An unemployed defense worker frustrated with the various flaws he sees in society, begins to psychotically and violently lash out against them.

Nelson Mandela, in his first term as the South African President, initiates a unique venture to unite the apartheid-torn land: enlist the national rugby team on a mission to win the 1995 Rugby World Cup.
filmInfoContainer4: Delivered with typically stately precision from director Clint Eastwood, Invictus may not be rousing enough for some viewers, but Matt Damon and Morgan Freeman inhabit their real-life characters with admirable conviction.

filmInfoContainer3: A famous DJ in the Ibiza club scene finds the alcohol and drug-fueled party that is his life threatened by the progressive loss of his hearing.
filmInfoContainer4: Part raucous mockumentary, part drama-filled biopic, It's All Gone Pete Tong amuses and warms hearts with its touching, comic, and candid look at a musician faced with a career-ending handicap.

filmInfoContainer3: Jean-Claude Van Damme gets involved in a bank robbery with hostages situation and reflects about his life during it.
filmInfoContainer4: JCVD is a touching, fascinating piece, with Jean-Claude Van Damme confounding all with his heartfelt performance.

filmInfoContainer3: Juliet, Naked is the story of Annie (the long-suffering girlfriend of Duncan) and her unlikely transatlantic romance with once revered, now faded, singer-songwriter, Tucker Crowe, who also happens to be the subject of Duncan's musical obsession.
filmInfoContainer4: Juliet, Naked's somewhat familiar narrative arc is elevated by standout work from a charming cast led by a well-matched Rose Byrne and Ethan Hawke.

filmInfoContainer3: A lonely college freshman's life is turned upside-down by her impetuous, adventurous stepsister-to-be.
filmInfoContainer4: Mistress America brings out the best in collaborators Noah Baumbach and Greta Gerwig, distilling its star's charm and director's dark wit into a ferociously funny co-written story.

filmInfoContainer3: An aged, retired Sherlock Holmes deals with early dementia, as he tries to remember his final case, and a mysterious woman, whose memory haunts him. He also befriends a fan, the young son of his housekeeper, who wants him to work again.
filmInfoContainer4: Mr. Holmes focuses on the man behind the mysteries, and while it may lack Baker Street thrills, it more than compensates with tenderly wrought, well-acted drama.

filmInfoContainer3: As a lawyer investigates the murder of a colleague, he finds himself more connected to the crime than anyone else.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to an outstanding script, focused direction by Alan Pakula, and a riveting performance from Harrison Ford, Presumed Innocent is the kind of effective courtroom thriller most others aspire to be.

filmInfoContainer3: Two women who grew up together discover they have drifted apart when they retreat to a lake house together.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a searing performance from Elisabeth Moss, Queen of Earth is a demanding -- and ultimately rewarding -- addition to writer-director Alex Ross Perry's impressive filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: True story of the undersized Depression-era racehorse whose victories lifted not only the spirits of the team behind it but also those of their nation.
filmInfoContainer4: A life-affirming, if saccharine, epic treatment of a spirit-lifting figure in sports history.

filmInfoContainer3: A young girl flees her hometown and arrives in the Australian Alps, where new experiences help her learn the differences between sex and love.
filmInfoContainer4: A poignant coming-of-age tale marked by a breakout lead performance from Abbie Cornish and a successful directorial debut from Cate Shortland.

filmInfoContainer3: Popular Broadway actor Gary Johnston is recruited by the elite counter-terrorism organization Team America: World Police. As the world begins to crumble around him, he must battle with terrorists, celebrities and falling in love.
filmInfoContainer4: Team America will either offend you or leave you in stitches. It'll probably do both.

filmInfoContainer3: In this non-linear amalgamation, submarine crewmen and a woodsman wend their way through a voyage of odd experiences.
filmInfoContainer4: The Forbidden Room may frustrate viewers looking for a linear experience, but those seeking a challenge -- or already familiar with director Guy Maddin's work -- will be rewarded.

filmInfoContainer: The Killing of a Sacred Deer
filmInfoContainer3: Steven, a charismatic surgeon, is forced to make an unthinkable sacrifice after his life starts to fall apart, when the behavior of a teenage boy he has taken under his wing turns sinister.
filmInfoContainer4: The Killing of a Sacred Deer continues director Yorgos Lanthimos' stubbornly idiosyncratic streak -- and demonstrates again that his is a talent not to be ignored.

filmInfoContainer3: The idealist William Wilberforce maneuvers his way through Parliament, endeavoring to end the British transatlantic slave trade.
filmInfoContainer4: Amazing Grace is your quintessential historical biopic: stately, noble, and with plenty of electrifying performances.

filmInfoContainer3: In the 1970s, a gay couple fights a biased legal system to keep custody of the abandoned mentally handicapped teenager that comes to live under their roof.
FBI upstart Eric O'Neill enters into a power game with his boss, Robert Hanssen, an agent who was put on trial for selling secrets to the Soviet Union.
filmInfoContainer4: Powered by Chris Cooper's masterful performance, Breach is a tense and engaging portrayal of the FBI's infamous turncoat.

filmInfoContainer3: A British woman is determined to improve herself while she looks for love in a year in which she keeps a personal diary.
filmInfoContainer4: Though there was controversy over the choice of casting, Zellweger's Bridget Jones is a sympathetic, likable, funny character, giving this romantic comedy a lot of charm.

filmInfoContainer3: A hot-shot race-car named Lightning McQueen gets waylaid in Radiator Springs, where he finds the true meaning of friendship and family.
filmInfoContainer4: Cars offers visual treats that more than compensate for its somewhat thinly written story, adding up to a satisfying diversion for younger viewers.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama based on a Texas congressman Charlie Wilson's covert dealings in Afghanistan, where his efforts to assist rebels in their war with the Soviets have some unforeseen and long-reaching effects.
filmInfoContainer4: Charlie Wilson's War manages to entertain and inform audiences, thanks to its witty script and talented cast of power players.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Eddie Edwards, the notoriously tenacious British underdog ski jumper who charmed the world at the 1988 Winter Olympics.
filmInfoContainer4: Eddie the Eagle's amiable sweetness can't disguise its story's many inspirational clichés -- but for many viewers, it will be more than enough to make up for them.

filmInfoContainer: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
filmInfoContainer3: The adventures of writer Newt Scamander in New York's secret community of witches and wizards seventy years before Harry Potter reads his book in school.
filmInfoContainer4: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them draws on Harry Potter's rich mythology to deliver a spinoff that dazzles with franchise-building magic all its own.

filmInfoContainer: He Loves Me... He Loves Me Not
filmInfoContainer3: A young woman who is in love with a married doctor becomes dangerous when her attempts to persuade him to leave his wife are unsuccessful. However, when things are seen from his point of view, the real situation becomes clear.
filmInfoContainer4: This romantic thriller puts Tautou's sweetheart Amelie image to good use.

filmInfoContainer3: A wrongfully convicted boy is sent to a brutal desert detention camp where he joins the job of digging holes for some mysterious reason.
filmInfoContainer4: Faithful to its literary source, this is imaginative, intelligent family entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: Set during the Ice Age, a sabertooth tiger, a sloth, and a wooly mammoth find a lost human infant, and they try to return him to his tribe.
filmInfoContainer4: Even though Ice Age is treading over the same grounds as Monsters, Inc. and Shrek, it has enough wit and laughs to stand on its own.

filmInfoContainer3: Ruminations on the life of Bob Dylan, where six characters embody a different aspect of the musician's life and work.
filmInfoContainer4: I'm Not There's unique editing, visuals, and multiple talented actors portraying Bob Dylan make for a deliciously unconventional experience. Each segment brings a new and fresh take on Dylan's life.

filmInfoContainer3: An orphan, who lives with his two cruel aunts, befriends anthropomorphic bugs who live inside a giant peach, and they embark on a journey to New York City.
filmInfoContainer4: The arresting and dynamic visuals, offbeat details and light-as-air storytelling make James and the Giant Peach solid family entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: A dramatization of the 1968 strike at the Ford Dagenham car plant, where female workers walked out in protest against sexual discrimination.

At 10, Fanny Price, a poor relation, goes to live at Mansfield Park, the estate of her aunt's husband, Sir Thomas. Clever, studious, and a writer with an ironic imagination and fine moral ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Solid performances, bold direction.

filmInfoContainer3: A father and son go on the run, pursued by the government and a cult drawn to the child's special powers.
filmInfoContainer4: Midnight Special's intriguing mysteries may not resolve themselves to every viewer's liking, but the journey is ambitious, entertaining, and terrifically acted.

filmInfoContainer3: After entering a beauty contest in Tijuana, a young woman witnesses drug-related murders and is forced to do the gang's bidding.
filmInfoContainer4: Miss Bala's subject is loaded enough, but the frantic and muscular filmmaking puts this movie in a whole new league.

filmInfoContainer3: In New York City, a husband and wife butt heads with the granddaughters of the elderly woman who lives in the apartment the couple owns.
filmInfoContainer4: Nicole Holofcener's newest might seem slight in places, but its rendering of complex characters in a conflicted economic landscape is varied, natural, and touching all the same.

filmInfoContainer3: A police officer refuses to arrest a young man for offering drugs to his friends.
Four friends/fledgling entrepreneurs, knowing that there's something bigger and more innovative than the different error-checking devices they've built, wrestle over their new invention.
filmInfoContainer4: Dense, obtuse, but stimulating, Primer is a film for viewers ready for a cerebral challenge.

filmInfoContainer3: Never take your mistress on an annual guys' getaway, especially one devoted to hunting - a violent lesson for three wealthy married men.
filmInfoContainer4: Revenge slices and dices genre tropes, working within an exploitation framework while adding a timely -- yet never less than viscerally thrilling -- feminist spin.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman, recently released from a mental hospital, gets a job as a secretary to a demanding lawyer, where their employer-employee relationship turns into a sexual, sadomasochistic one.
filmInfoContainer4: Maggie Gyllenhaal impresses in this romantic comedy with a kinky twist.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the life and work of the renown architect.
filmInfoContainer4: This affectionate, casually framed portrait of the acclaimed architect reveals him to be an engaging, likeable subject.

filmInfoContainer: The Dangerous Lives of Altar Boys
filmInfoContainer3: A group of Catholic school friends, after being caught drawing an obscene comic book, plan a heist that will outdo their previous prank and make them local legends.
filmInfoContainer4: The inter-cutting of animation by Spawn's creator, Todd McFarlane, doesn't always work, but the performances by the young actors capture the pains of growing up well.

filmInfoContainer3: In the colorful future, a cab driver unwittingly becomes the central figure in the search for a legendary cosmic weapon to keep Evil and Mr. Zorg at bay.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually inventive and gleefully over the top, Luc Besson's The Fifth Element is a fantastic piece of pop sci-fi that never takes itself too seriously.

filmInfoContainer3: A Brooklyn-set romantic drama about a bachelor torn between the family friend his parents wish he would marry and his beautiful but volatile new neighbor.
filmInfoContainer4: Two Lovers is a complex, intriguing, richly-acted romantic drama

filmInfoContainer3: Victoria is a thirty-something lawyer who's looking for stability and true love in her life struggling with her past. Her search is not evident but finally, she realizes the fact that love should not be always searched.
filmInfoContainer4: Victoria's single-take production is undeniably impressive, but it's also an effective drama in its own right -- and one that juggles its tonal shifts as deftly as its technical complexities.

filmInfoContainer3: There's little wonder in the working-class lives of Bill, Eileen, and their three grown daughters. They're lonely Londoners. Nadia, a cafe waitress, places personal ads, looking for love; ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: A film that tackles something as simple as everyday life and succeeds beatifully. The witty script and clever direction keep the film flowing, while the superb acting keeps it alive. It doesn't aim for the sky and for that reason it hits its mark.

filmInfoContainer3: Marion and Jack try to rekindle their relationship with a visit to Paris, home of Marion's parents -- and several of her ex-boyfriends.
filmInfoContainer4: Delpy proves not only to be an adept actress, but makes her mark as a writer and director in this thought-provoking comedy that breaks the romantic comedy mold.

filmInfoContainer3: A Chechen Muslim illegally immigrates to Hamburg, where he gets caught in the international war on terror.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, subtle, and steadily absorbing, A Most Wanted Man proves once again that John le Carre books make for sharp, thoughtful thrillers.

filmInfoContainer3: Grieving after the death of her young son Joseph, novelist Betty Fisher enters a dark depression. Hoping to bring her out of it, her mother Margot arranges to kidnap another child, Jose, to...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Alias Betty works both as a gripping thriller and as a precisely drawn character study.

filmInfoContainer3: When a corrupt businessman and the grotesque Penguin plot to take control of Gotham City, only Batman can stop them, while the Catwoman has her own agenda.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Tim Burton's dark, brooding atmosphere, Michael Keaton's work as the tormented hero, and the flawless casting of Danny DeVito as The Penguin and Christopher Walken as, well, Christopher Walken make the sequel better than the first.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of the years leading up to Queen's legendary appearance at the Live Aid (1985) concert.
filmInfoContainer4: Bohemian Rhapsody hits a handful of high notes, but as an in-depth look at a beloved band, it offers more of a medley than a true greatest hits collection.

filmInfoContainer3: A vagrant enters the lives of an arrogant upper-class family, turning their lives into a psychological nightmare in the process.
filmInfoContainer4: Borgman's unpredictability may confound as many viewers as it enthralls, but either way, it's a refreshingly original experiment in off-kilter terror.

filmInfoContainer3: An oddly naive man-child stalks his childhood best friend and tries to reconnect with their past.
filmInfoContainer4: Poignant, unsettling.

filmInfoContainer: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Sci-Fi
filmInfoContainer3: A local scientist is often regarded as a failure until he invents a machine that can make food fall from the sky. But little does he know, that things are about to take a turn for the worst.
filmInfoContainer4: Quirky humor, plucky characters and solid slapstick make this family comedy a frenetically tasty time at the movies.

filmInfoContainer3: In the waning days of the American Civil War, a wounded soldier embarks on a perilous journey back home to Cold Mountain, North Carolina to reunite with his sweetheart.
filmInfoContainer4: The well-crafted Cold Mountain has an epic sweep and captures the horror and brutal hardship of war.

filmInfoContainer2: Biography, Comedy, Crime, Drama, Romance, Thriller
filmInfoContainer3: An adaptation of the cult memoir of game show impresario Chuck Barris, in which he purports to have been a CIA hitman.
filmInfoContainer4: Rockwell is spot-on as Barris, and Clooney directs with entertaining style and flair.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1961, famed social psychologist Stanley Milgram conducted a series of radical behavior experiments that tested ordinary humans' willingness to obey authority.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a gripping performance from Peter Sarsgaard, Experimenter uses a fact-based story to pose thought-provoking questions about human nature.

filmInfoContainer3: Michael Moore's view on what happened to the United States after September 11; and how the Bush Administration allegedly used the tragic event to push forward its agenda for unjust wars in Afghanistan and Iraq.
filmInfoContainer4: Extremely one-sided in its indictment of the Bush administration, but worth watching for the humor and the debates it'll stir.

filmInfoContainer3: An accidental cross-time radio link connects father and son across 30 years. The son tries to save his father's life, but then must fix the consequences.
filmInfoContainer4: A tight blend of surprises and suspense keeps audiences spellbound.

filmInfoContainer3: In Manhattan, film-maker Erik bonds with closeted lawyer Paul after a fling. As their relationship becomes one fueled by highs, lows, and dysfunctional patterns, Erik struggles to negotiate his own boundaries while being true to himself.
filmInfoContainer4: Keep the Lights On is a mysterious, sexy journey deep into the love affair of two men that always manages to stay true to life.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: Po and his friends fight to stop a peacock villain from conquering China with a deadly new weapon, but first the Dragon Warrior must come to terms with his past.
filmInfoContainer4: The storyline arc may seem a tad familiar to fans of the original, but Kung Fu Panda 2 offers enough action, comedy, and visual sparkle to compensate.

filmInfoContainer3: A phobic con artist and his protégé are on the verge of pulling off a lucrative swindle when the former's teenage daughter arrives unexpectedly.
filmInfoContainer4: Breezy and well-acted, Matchstick Men focuses more on the characters than on the con.

filmInfoContainer3: Cady Heron is a hit with The Plastics, the A-list girl clique at her new school, until she makes the mistake of falling for Aaron Samuels, the ex-boyfriend of alpha Plastic Regina George.
filmInfoContainer4: Funnier and more smartly written than the average teen comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: In the high-stakes world of political power-brokers, Elizabeth Sloane is the most sought after and formidable lobbyist in D.C. But when taking on the most powerful opponent of her career, she finds winning may come at too high a price.
filmInfoContainer4: Miss Sloane sits squarely on the shoulders of Jessica Chastain's performance -- and she responds with awards-worthy work that single-handedly elevates the film.

filmInfoContainer3: A young, compassionate man struggles to save his family and friends from the abusive exploitation of his cold-heartedly grasping uncle.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to a strong cast of experienced actors and director Douglas McGrath's steady hand, Nicholas Nickleby is a worthy and respectful adaptation of the Dickens novel.

filmInfoContainer3: Divided into three "kingdoms" -- Enfer (Hell), Purgatoire (Purgatory) and Paradis (Paradise) -- Notre Musique is an indictment of modern times.
filmInfoContainer4: A dense, but thoughtful meditation about war by Jean-Luc Godard.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of John Lennon's first years, focused mainly in his adolescence and his relationship with his stern aunt Mimi, who raised him, and his absentee mother Julia, who re-entered his life at a crucial moment in his young life.
filmInfoContainer4: Don't expect any musical insights, but this look at John Lennon's early life benefits from its restrained, low-key approach and some fine acting from Aaron Johnson.

filmInfoContainer: Outfoxed: Rupert Murdoch's War on Journalism
filmInfoContainer3: Documentary on reported Conservative bias of the Rupert Murdoch-owned Fox News Channel (FNC), which promotes itself as "Fair and Balanced". Material includes interviews with former FNC employees and the inter-office memos they provided.
filmInfoContainer4: Neither fair nor balanced itself, Outfoxed offers an often entertaining indictment of the Fox News Channel.

filmInfoContainer: Page One: Inside the New York Times
filmInfoContainer3: Unprecedented access to the New York Times newsroom yields a complex view of the transformation of a media landscape fraught with both peril and opportunity.

Alex, a hit man, tries to get out of the family business, but his father won't let him do so. While seeking the help of a therapist, he meets a sexually charged 23-year-old woman with whom he falls in love.
filmInfoContainer4: This quirky little film about a gangster in therapy feels fresh and well-crafted.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenage skateboarder's life begins to fray after he is involved in the accidental death of a security guard.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Gus Van Sant once again superbly captures the ins and outs of teenage life in Paranoid Park, a quietly devastating portrait of a young man living with guilt and anxiety.

filmInfoContainer3: Luciano is a charming fishmonger whose unexpected and sudden obsession with being a contestant on a reality show leads him down a rabbit hole of skewed perceptions and paranoia.
filmInfoContainer4: Part dark satire, part compelling drama, Reality occasionally struggles to communicate its message, but it's never less than entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: Various lives converge on an isolated island, all connected by an author whose novel has become inextricably entwined with his own life.
filmInfoContainer4: Beneath the gratuitous nudity lies a complex and visually striking movie.

filmInfoContainer3: A married couple whose bond is built on a mutual love of alcohol gets their relationship put to the test when the wife decides to get sober.
Three girls are kidnapped by a man with a diagnosed 23 distinct personalities. They must try to escape before the apparent emergence of a frightful new 24th.
filmInfoContainer4: Split serves as a dramatic tour de force for James McAvoy in multiple roles -- and finds writer-director M. Night Shyamalan returning resoundingly to thrilling form.

filmInfoContainer3: Martine offers Terry a lead on a foolproof bank hit on London's Baker Street. She targets a roomful of safe deposit boxes worth millions in cash and jewelry. But Terry and his crew don't realize the boxes also contain a treasure trove of dirty secrets - secrets that will thrust them into a deadly web of corruption and illicit scandal.
filmInfoContainer4: Well cast and crisply directed, The Bank Job is a thoroughly entertaining British heist thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: A year after their father's funeral, three brothers travel across India by train in an attempt to bond with each other.
filmInfoContainer4: With the requisite combination of humor, sorrow and outstanding visuals, The Darjeeling Limited will satisfy Wes Anderson fans.

filmInfoContainer3: 1921. An innocent immigrant woman is tricked into a life of burlesque and vaudeville until a dazzling magician tries to save her and reunite her with her sister who is being held in the confines of Ellis Island.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautiful visuals, James Gray's confident direction, and a powerful performance from Marion Cotillard combine to make The Immigrant a richly rewarding period drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A thirteen-year-old girl's relationship with her mother is put to the test as she discovers drugs, sex, and petty crime in the company of her cool but troubled best friend.
filmInfoContainer4: An emotionally wrenching, not to mention terrifying, film about the perils of being a teenager.

filmInfoContainer3: A fashion photographer with terminal cancer elects to die alone, preparing others to live past him rather than prolong the inevitable with chemotherapy or be smothered in sympathy by those who know him.
filmInfoContainer4: A reflective look at our own mortality through the experience of a middle-aged French man, Time To Leave manages to pull at our heart strings without resorting to cliches, and leaves a lasting impression.

filmInfoContainer3: A Transsiberian train journey from China to Moscow becomes a thrilling chase of deception and murder when an American couple encounters a mysterious pair of fellow travelers.
filmInfoContainer4: Traditional in form yet effective in execution, this taut thriller updates the "danger on a train" scenario with atmospheric sense.

filmInfoContainer3: Through a series of freak occurrences, a group of actors shooting a big-budget war movie are forced to become the soldiers they are portraying.
filmInfoContainer4: With biting satire, plenty of subversive humor, and an unforgettable turn by Robert Downey, Jr., Tropic Thunder is a triumphant late Summer comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: A young and impatient stockbroker is willing to do anything to get to the top, including trading on illegal inside information taken through a ruthless and greedy corporate raider who takes the youth under his wing.
filmInfoContainer4: With Wall Street, Oliver Stone delivers a blunt but effective -- and thoroughly well-acted -- jeremiad against its era's veneration of greed as a means to its own end.

filmInfoContainer3: The good-hearted Harbour has spent his whole life trying to take care of his motherless and suicidal little brother, Wilbur. The brothers are inseparable. When in their thirties, they lose ...
filmInfoContainer4: Despite its morbid subject matter, Wilbur is a charming and often funny film.

filmInfoContainer3: A young man is found bruised, beaten and stumbling down a secluded road. As the police try to piece together what happened, the convoluted relationship between a young woman and her two ...
A young mermaid princess risks being turned forever into sea-foam in order to fulfill her dreams of marrying her true love.
filmInfoContainer4: The Little Mermaid ushered in a new golden era for Disney animation with warm and charming hand-drawn characters and catchy musical sequences.

filmInfoContainer3: An aimless university dropout attempts to make sense of life as he spends one fateful day wandering the streets of Berlin.
filmInfoContainer4: Amiably slight, A Coffee in Berlin compensates for its lack of narrative drive with a sure-handed screenplay and echoes of early Woody Allen.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of King Seretse Khama of Botswana and how his loving but controversial marriage to a British white woman, Ruth Williams, put his kingdom into political and diplomatic turmoil.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-acted, solidly crafted, and all-around worthy, A United Kingdom presents an absorbing look at a singular true-life love story.

filmInfoContainer3: In the summer of 1987, a college graduate takes a 'nowhere' job at his local amusement park, only to find it's the perfect course to get him prepared for the real world.
filmInfoContainer4: Full of humor and nostalgia, Adventureland is a sweet, insightful coming-of-age comedy that will resonate with teens and adults alike.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1839, the revolt of Mende captives aboard a Spanish owned ship causes a major controversy in the United States when the ship is captured off the coast of Long Island. The courts must decide whether the Mende are slaves or legally free.
filmInfoContainer4: Heartfelt without resorting to preachiness, Amistad tells an important story with engaging sensitivity and absorbing skill.

filmInfoContainer3: A miserable conman and his partner pose as Santa and his Little Helper to rob department stores on Christmas Eve. But they run into problems when the conman befriends a troubled kid.
filmInfoContainer4: A gloriously rude and gleefully offensive black comedy, Bad Santa isn't for everyone, but grinches will find it uproariously funny.

filmInfoContainer3: The lives of three women intersect in small-town America, where each is imperfectly blazing a trail.
filmInfoContainer4: Certain Women further demonstrates writer-director Kelly Reichardt's gift for telling the stories of ordinary people with uncommon empathy and skill.

filmInfoContainer3: The relationships of two couples become complicated and deceitful when the man from one couple meets the woman of the other.
filmInfoContainer4: Closer's talented cast and Mike Nichols' typically assured direction help smooth a bumpy journey from stage to screen.

filmInfoContainer3: In the 1980s, ruthless Colombian cocaine barons invaded Miami with a brand of violence unseen in this country since Prohibition-era Chicago - and it put the city on the map. "Cocaine ...
filmInfoContainer4: As frenetic, thrilling, and lacking in subtletly as its drug of focus...and just as likely to prompt some hard questions after it's gone.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Jewish American man endeavors to find the woman who saved his grandfather during World War II in a Ukrainian village, that was ultimately razed by the Nazis, with the help of an eccentric local.
filmInfoContainer4: Although it excises much from its famously dense source material, Everything is Illuminated is a quirky, ambitious debut film from Liev Schreiber.

filmInfoContainer3: In the year 2032, Batô, a cyborg detective for the anti-terrorist unit Public Security Section 9, investigates the case of a female robot--one created solely for sexual pleasure--who slaughtered her owner.
filmInfoContainer4: The animation is lovely, but the plot is complex to the point of inscrutability, leaving Ghost in the Shell 2: Innocence both original and numbing.

filmInfoContainer3: A fast-track lawyer can't lie for 24 hours due to his son's birthday wish after he turns his son down for the last time.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite its thin plot, Liar Liar is elevated by Jim Carrey's exuberant brand of physical humor, and the result is a laugh riot that helped to broaden the comedian's appeal.

filmInfoContainer3: Self-esteem and insecurity are at the heart of this comedy about the relationship between a mother and her three confused daughters.
filmInfoContainer4: The bitingly truthful Lovely & Amazing is a smart and perceptive female character study.

filmInfoContainer3: A loan shark is forced to reconsider his violent lifestyle after the arrival of a mysterious woman claiming to be his long-lost mother.
filmInfoContainer4: It lacks subtlety and depth of character, but Pieta gets by with committed performances and a darkly ambitious, deceptively simple message.

filmInfoContainer3: A freelancing former U.S. Intelligence Agent tries to track down a mysterious package that is wanted by the Irish and the Russians.
filmInfoContainer4: Ronin earns comparisons to The French Connection with strong action, dynamic road chase scenes, and solid performances.

filmInfoContainer3: During a long English summer in the early 1980s, two schoolboys from differing backgrounds set out to make a film inspired by First Blood (1982).
filmInfoContainer4: Undeniable heart and charming young leads save the film's nostalgic storyline from suffering at the hands predictability.

filmInfoContainer3: A young boy whose parents have just divorced finds an unlikely friend and mentor in the misanthropic, bawdy, hedonistic war veteran who lives next door.
filmInfoContainer4: St. Vincent offers the considerable pleasure of seeing Bill Murray back in funny form, but drifts into dangerously sentimental territory along the way.

filmInfoContainer3: A team of international astronauts are sent on a dangerous mission to reignite the dying Sun with a nuclear fission bomb in 2057.
filmInfoContainer4: Danny Boyle continues his descent into mind-twisting sci-fi madness, taking us along for the ride. Sunshine fulfills the dual requisite necessary to become classic sci-fi: dazzling visuals with intelligent action.

filmInfoContainer3: Intrepid reporter Tintin and Captain Haddock set off on a treasure hunt for a sunken ship commanded by Haddock's ancestor.
filmInfoContainer4: Drawing deep from the classic Raiders of the Lost Ark playbook, Steven Spielberg has crafted another spirited, thrilling adventure in the form of Tintin.

filmInfoContainer3: British retirees travel to India to take up residence in what they believe is a newly restored hotel. Less luxurious than advertised, the Marigold Hotel nevertheless slowly begins to charm in unexpected ways.
filmInfoContainer4: The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel isn't groundbreaking storytelling, but it's a sweet story about the senior set featuring a top-notch cast of veteran actors.

filmInfoContainer3: Did you know that God is alive and lives in Brussels with his daughter?
filmInfoContainer4: The Brand New Testament takes a surreal, subversive, and funny look at Biblical themes through a modern -- and refreshingly original -- lens.

filmInfoContainer3: A hard-working young man meets and falls in love with his sister's bridesmaid. He soon finds out how disturbed she really is.
filmInfoContainer4: Chabrol has crafted another sophisticated, unsettling thriller about sinister doings among the bourgeoisie.

filmInfoContainer3: Young nurse Sissi lives a secluded life, seemingly entirely devoted to her patients at Birkenhof asylum. Her first encounter with ex-soldier and drifter Bodo has a lasting impact. He causes...
filmInfoContainer4: More slow-moving than Run Lola Run, this film nonetheless offers an intriguing storyline about love and fate.

filmInfoContainer3: A grieving man meets his lover's family, who were not aware of their son's sexual orientation.
filmInfoContainer4: Taut, chilling, and overall engrossing, Tom at the Farm offers further confirmation that writer-director Xavier Dolan is a filmmaking talent to be reckoned with.

filmInfoContainer3: Young Albert enlists to serve in World War I after his beloved horse is sold to the cavalry. Albert's hopeful journey takes him out of England and to the front lines as the war rages on.
filmInfoContainer4: Technically superb, proudly sentimental, and unabashedly old-fashioned, War Horse is an emotional drama that tugs the heartstrings with Spielberg's customary flair.

filmInfoContainer3: A hopeless romantic Chicago Transit Authority token collector is mistaken for the fiancée of a coma patient.
filmInfoContainer4: While You Were Sleeping is built wholly from familiar ingredients, but assembled with such skill -- and with such a charming performance from Sandra Bullock -- that it gives formula a good name.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1956, Ernesto 'Che' Guevara and a band of Castro-led Cuban exiles mobilize an army to topple the regime of dictator Fulgencio Batista.
filmInfoContainer4: Though lengthy and at times plodding, Soderbergh's vision and Benicio Del Toro's understated performance ensure that Che always fascinates.

filmInfoContainer3: At the age of 21, Tim discovers he can travel in time and change what happens and has happened in his own life. His decision to make his world a better place by getting a girlfriend turns out not to be as easy as you might think.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully filmed and unabashedly sincere, About Time finds director Richard Curtis at his most sentimental.

filmInfoContainer: Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
filmInfoContainer3: Ron Burgundy is San Diego's top-rated newsman in the male-dominated broadcasting of the 1970s, but that's all about to change for Ron and his cronies when an ambitious woman is hired as a new anchor.
filmInfoContainer4: Filled with inspired silliness and quotable lines, Anchorman isn't the most consistent comedy in the world, but Will Ferrell's buffoonish central performance helps keep this portrait of a clueless newsman from going off the rails.

filmInfoContainer3: The canine star of a fictional sci-fi/action show that believes his powers are real embarks on a cross country trek to save his co-star from a threat he believes is just as real.
filmInfoContainer4: Bolt is a pleasant animated comedy that overcomes the story's familiarity with strong visuals and likable characters.

filmInfoContainer3: A man searches for his missing wife after his car breaks down in the middle of the desert.
filmInfoContainer4: A brainy and suspenseful -- if somewhat uneven -- thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: Best buddies Acerola and Laranjinha, about to turn 18, discover things about their missing fathers' pasts which will shatter their solid friendship, in the middle of a war between rival drug gangs from Rio's favelas.
filmInfoContainer4: Brutal and unflinching, City of Men is both a harrowing look at Brazil's favela life, and a touching tale of youths rushed into adulthood.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary about how the likelihood of nuclear weapons (or fissile materials) usage has increased due to the rise of terrorism and lack of safeguards and verification.
The bizarre true story of Linda Riss and Burt Pugach.
filmInfoContainer4: Crazy Love's subjects and story are so compelling that they overcome the doc's dry, talking heads format.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Sci-Fi
filmInfoContainer3: When Gru, the world's most super-bad turned super-dad has been recruited by a team of officials to stop lethal muscle and a host of Gru's own, He has to fight back with new gadgetry, cars, and more minion madness.
filmInfoContainer4: Despicable Me 2 offers plenty of eye-popping visual inventiveness and a number of big laughs.

filmInfoContainer3: While matchmaking for friends and neighbours, a young 19th Century Englishwoman nearly misses her own chance at love.
filmInfoContainer4: Emma marks an auspicious debut for writer-director Douglas McGrath, making the most of its Jane Austen source material -- and a charming performance from Gwyneth Paltrow.

filmInfoContainer3: A French drug dealer living in Tokyo is betrayed by his best friend and killed in a drug deal. His soul, observing the repercussions of his death, seeks resurrection.
An update of the original film with new interpretations of great works of classical music.
filmInfoContainer4: It provides an entertaining experience for adults and children alike.

filmInfoContainer3: The life stories of the six men who raised the flag at the Battle of Iwo Jima, a turning point in World War II.
filmInfoContainer4: Flags of Our Fathers is both a fascinating look at heroism, both earned and manufactured, and a well-filmed salute to the men who fought at the battle of Iwo Jima.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Florence Foster Jenkins, a New York heiress who dreamed of becoming an opera singer, despite having a terrible singing voice.
filmInfoContainer4: Florence Foster Jenkins makes poignant, crowd-pleasing dramedy out of its stranger-than-fiction tale -- and does its subject justice with a reliably terrific turn from star Meryl Streep.

filmInfoContainer3: A mysterious man arrives at the offices of an FBI agent and recounts his childhood: how his religious fanatic father received visions telling him to destroy people who were in fact "demons."
filmInfoContainer4: Creepy and disturbing, Frailty is well-crafted, low-key horror.

filmInfoContainer3: Laurie Strode confronts her long-time foe Michael Myers, the masked figure who has haunted her since she narrowly escaped his killing spree on Halloween night four decades ago.
filmInfoContainer4: Halloween largely wipes the slate clean after decades of disappointing sequels, ignoring increasingly elaborate mythology in favor of basic - yet still effective - ingredients.

filmInfoContainer3: In 19th-century France, Jean Valjean, who for decades has been hunted by the ruthless policeman Javert after breaking parole, agrees to care for a factory worker's daughter. The decision changes their lives forever.
filmInfoContainer4: Impeccably mounted but occasionally bombastic, Les Misérables largely succeeds thanks to bravura performances from its distinguished cast.

filmInfoContainer3: After a family tragedy, a racist prison guard reexamines his attitudes while falling in love with the African American wife of the last prisoner he executed.
filmInfoContainer4: Somber and thought provoking, Monster's Ball has great performances all around.

filmInfoContainer3: In Washington, D.C., a female reporter faces a possible jail sentence for outing a CIA agent and refusing to reveal her source.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-crafted political thriller, Nothing But the Truth features a strong cast that helps the real-life drama make an effortless transition to the big screen.

filmInfoContainer3: A career woman reassesses her parents' lives after she is forced to care for her cancer-stricken mother.
filmInfoContainer4: Solid performances lift this drama to a higher level.

filmInfoContainer3: In modern-day Paris, a journalist finds her life becoming entwined with a young girl whose family was torn apart during the notorious Vel' d'Hiv Roundup in 1942.
filmInfoContainer4: Sarah's Key is an absorbing, impeccably-acted Holocaust drama with minor plot issues.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the true story of a black girl who was born to two white Afrikaner parents in South Africa during the apartheid era.
When a congressional aide is killed, a Washington D.C. journalist starts investigating the case involving the congressman, his old college friend.
filmInfoContainer4: A taut, well-acted political thriller, State of Play overcomes some unsubtle plot twists with an intelligent script and swift direction.

filmInfoContainer3: A deformed bell-ringer must assert his independence from a vicious government minister in order to help his friend, a gypsy dancer.
filmInfoContainer4: Disney's take on the Victor Hugo classic is dramatically uneven, but its strong visuals, dark themes, and message of tolerance make for a more-sophisticated-than-average children's film.

filmInfoContainer3: Three teenage friends, in the ultimate act of independence, decide to spend their summer building a house in the woods and living off the land.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to charming performances and endearingly off-kilter spirit, The Kings of Summer proves to be a slight, sweet entry in the crowded coming-of-age genre.

filmInfoContainer3: A Texas baseball coach makes the major league after agreeing to try out if his high school team made the playoffs.
filmInfoContainer4: A heart-warming sports flick, The Rookie greatly benefits from understated direction and the emotional honesty Dennis Quaid brings to the role of Jim Morris.

filmInfoContainer3: A hard-core New York Giants fan struggles to deal with the consequences when he is beaten up by his favorite player.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring Patton Oswalt's sympathetic portrayal, Big Fan humorously and effectively captures the dark and lonely world of a sports fanatic.

filmInfoContainer3: Lives spiral out of control when four friends cover up a murder.
filmInfoContainer4: A fun, whimsical tale about an office drone trying to save his life from his narrator, Stranger Than Fiction features a subdued performances from Will Ferrell that contributes mightily to its quirky, mind-bending affect.

filmInfoContainer: Bad Times at the El Royale
filmInfoContainer3: Circa 1969, several strangers, most with a secret to bury, meet by chance at Lake Tahoe's El Royale, a rundown hotel with a dark past. Over the course of one night, everyone will show their true colors - before everything goes to hell.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, stylish, and packed with solid performances, Bad Times at the El Royale delivers pure popcorn fun with the salty tang of social subtext.

filmInfoContainer2: Biography, Crime, Drama, History, Mystery, Thriller
filmInfoContainer3: A grief-stricken mother takes on the LAPD to her own detriment when it tries to pass off an obvious impostor as her missing child.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully shot and well-acted, Changeling is a compelling story that unfortunately gives in to convention too often.

filmInfoContainer3: A U.S. Army officer, despondent about a deadly mistake he made, investigates a female chopper commander's worthiness for the Medal of Honor.
filmInfoContainer4: An emotional and intriguing tale of a military officer who must review the merits of a fallen officer while confronting his own war demons. Effectively depicts the terrors of war as well as its heartbreaking aftermath.

filmInfoContainer3: The centuries old vampire Count Dracula comes to England to seduce his barrister Jonathan Harker's fiancée Mina Murray and inflict havoc in the foreign land.
filmInfoContainer4: Overblown in the best sense of the word, Francis Ford Coppola's vision of Bram Stoker's Dracula rescues the character from decades of campy interpretations -- and features some terrific performances to boot.

filmInfoContainer3: A trio of black female soul singers cross over to the pop charts in the early 1960s, facing their own personal struggles along the way.
filmInfoContainer4: Dreamgirls' simple characters and plot hardly detract from the movie's real feats: the electrifying performances and the dazzling musical numbers.

filmInfoContainer3: Zhao is an aging bachelor who hasn't been lucky in love. Thinking he has finally met the woman of his dreams, Zhao leads her to believe he is wealthy and agrees to a wedding far beyond his ...
filmInfoContainer4: One of Zhang's smaller films, Happy Times is nevertheless moving and bittersweet.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman takes the law into her own hands after police ignore her pleas to arrest the man responsible for her husband's death, and finds herself not only under arrest for murder but falling in love with an officer.
filmInfoContainer4: The story is the weakest link in this gorgeous and well-acted film.

filmInfoContainer3: After being swindled by her ex-husband, a woman takes on the Chinese legal system.
filmInfoContainer4: I Am Not Madame Bovary's sly social commentary and well-constructed story anchor director Feng Xiaogang's visually experimental approach.

filmInfoContainer3: Barbara Thorson struggles through life by escaping into a fantasy life of magic and monsters.
filmInfoContainer4: I Kill Giants' moody magical realism sometimes slips into the mundane, but impressive CGI and a powerhouse performance by Madison Wolfe pack an unexpected punch.

filmInfoContainer3: Four teenagers are sucked into a magical video game, and the only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game.
filmInfoContainer4: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle uses a charming cast and a humorous twist to offer an undemanding yet solidly entertaining update on its source material.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama centered around three women: A fifty-year-old woman, the daughter she gave up for adoption thirty-five years ago, and a woman looking to adopt a child of her own.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it occasionally veers into unnecessary melodrama, Mother and Child benefits from a stellar cast and writer-director Rodrigo Garcia's finely detailed, bravely unsentimental script.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman conceals the fact of her terminal cancer to live her life with a passion she never had before.
filmInfoContainer4: Sarah Polley keeps this production afloat with her moving performance.

filmInfoContainer3: A much-needed boost, in the form of a new factory, is promised to the residents of the tiny fishing village St. Marie-La-Mauderne, provided they can lure a doctor to take up full-time residency on the island. Inspired, the villagers devise a scheme to make Dr. Christopher Lewis a local.
filmInfoContainer4: A quirky and occasionally funny TV-sitcom blown up to feature length.

filmInfoContainer3: With its loud acting style, exuberant sets and stunning shots in pastel colours, this Thai cult film is as much a parody as an homage to the Western and the romantic tearjerker.
filmInfoContainer4: With a vibrant pastel color scheme and stylized action sequences, Tears of the Black Tiger is a bizarre, yet thoroughly entertaining Thai western.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1983, financially struggling college student Samantha Hughes takes a strange babysitting job that coincides with a full lunar eclipse. She slowly realizes her clients harbor a terrifying secret, putting her life in mortal danger.
filmInfoContainer4: Though its underlying themes are familiar, House of the Devil effectively sheds the loud and gory cliches of contemporary horror to deliver a tense, slowly building throwback to the fright flicks of decades past.

filmInfoContainer3: Exiled artist and poet Mustafa embarks on a journey home with his housekeeper and her daughter; together the trio must evade the authorities who fear that the truth in Mustafa's words will incite rebellion.
filmInfoContainer4: Kahlil Gibran's the Prophet is a thrillingly lovely adaptation of the classic text, albeit one that doesn't quite capture the magic of its source material.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman and her daughter have been constantly moving from town to town for years, but their newest home might be different from all the others.
filmInfoContainer4: Strong performances add authenticity and depth.

filmInfoContainer3: With an unmanned, half-mile-long freight train barreling toward a city, a veteran engineer and a young conductor race against the clock to prevent a catastrophe.
filmInfoContainer4: As fast, loud, and relentless as the train at the center of the story, Unstoppable is perfect popcorn entertainment -- and director Tony Scott's best movie in years.

filmInfoContainer3: Iris invites her friend Jack to stay at her family's island getaway after the death of his brother. At their remote cabin, Jack's drunken encounter with Hannah, Iris' sister, kicks off a revealing stretch of days.
filmInfoContainer4: Superbly acted and satisfyingly engaging, Your Sister's Sister subverts rom-com conventions with sensitive direction, an unconventional screenplay, and a big heart.

filmInfoContainer3: In Paris, a cat who lives a secret life as a cat burglar's aide must come to the rescue of Zoe, the little girl he lives with, after she falls into a gangster's clutches.
filmInfoContainer4: A Cat in Paris depicts a stylish, imaginative world with a wonderful soundtrack and Hitchcockian overtones.

filmInfoContainer3: A scheming couple put a struggling family man and his old friend through a series of increasingly twisted dares over the course of an evening at a local bar.
filmInfoContainer4: Gleefully nasty and darkly hilarious, Cheap Thrills lives down to its title in the best possible way.

filmInfoContainer3: Conflict arises in the small town of Holly Springs when an old woman's death causes a variety of reactions among family and friends.
A banished hero of Rome allies with a sworn enemy to take his revenge on the city.
filmInfoContainer4: Visceral and visually striking, Ralph Fiennes' Coriolanus proves Shakespeare can still be both electrifying and relevant in a modern context.

filmInfoContainer3: An abortion clinic worker with a special heritage is called upon to save the existence of humanity from being negated by two renegade angels trying to exploit a loop-hole and reenter Heaven.
filmInfoContainer4: Provocative and audacious, Dogma is an uneven but thoughtful religious satire that's both respectful and irreverent.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on the Baja 1000, an annual off-road race held in Baja, Mexico that attracts hundreds of racers, their souped-up machines, and thousands of fans.
filmInfoContainer4: Amazing footage from the Baja off-road race will give viewers an adrenaline rush.

filmInfoContainer3: A lawyer becomes a target by a corrupt politician and his N.S.A. goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a serious politically motivated crime.
filmInfoContainer4: An entertaining, topical thriller that finds director Tony Scott on solid form and Will Smith confirming his action headliner status.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of the romance between Camille and Sullivan, which begins during their adolescence and picks up after Sullivan's 8-year absence from exploring the world.
The story of three close friends who are involved in a love-triangle.
filmInfoContainer4: An art film to the max, Heartbeats intriguing and appealing premise is sometimes buried by director Xavier Dolan's filmmaking flourishes.

filmInfoContainer3: A self-help seminar inspires a sixty-something woman to romantically pursue her younger co-worker.
filmInfoContainer4: Hello, My Name Is Doris is immeasurably elevated by Sally Field's remarkable performance in the title role, which overpowers a surfeit of stereotypical indie quirk.

filmInfoContainer3: When Tony Stark's world is torn apart by a formidable terrorist called the Mandarin, he starts an odyssey of rebuilding and retribution.
filmInfoContainer4: With the help of its charismatic lead, some impressive action sequences, and even a few surprises, Iron Man 3 is a witty, entertaining adventure and a strong addition to the Marvel canon.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1933 New York, an overly ambitious movie producer coerces his cast and hired ship crew to travel to the mysterious Skull Island, where they encounter Kong, a giant ape who is immediately smitten with leading lady Ann Darrow.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring state-of-the-art special effects, terrific performances, and a majestic sense of spectacle, Peter Jackson's remake of King Kong is a potent epic that's faithful to the spirit of the 1933 original.

filmInfoContainer3: When you are all alone in a small dark room, what do you fear the most? Is it the temporary blindness or is it the uneasy deep feeling that someone, or rather something, is observing your every move?
filmInfoContainer4: Lights Out makes skillful use of sturdy genre tropes -- and some terrific performances -- for an unsettling, fright-filled experience that delivers superior chills without skimping on story.

filmInfoContainer3: Captives of the very relationships that define and sustain them, nine women resiliently meet the travails and disappointments of life.
filmInfoContainer4: Nine Lives is bolstered by a strong cast and features many insightful glimpses into the lives of women.

filmInfoContainer3: Secret agent OSS 117 foils Nazis, beds local beauties, and brings peace to the Middle East.
filmInfoContainer4: This clever spy spoof plays politics and movie conventions for laughs and features a great turn by Jen Dujardin as a smarmy-suave nouveau-Bond.

filmInfoContainer3: When the creator of a virtual reality world called the OASIS dies, he releases a video in which he challenges all OASIS users to find his Easter Egg, which will give the finder his fortune.
filmInfoContainer4: Ready Player One is a sweetly nostalgic thrill ride that neatly encapsulates Spielberg's strengths while adding another solidly engrossing adventure to his filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: Thirty years after the ring of the first bell, Rocky Balboa comes out of retirement and dons his gloves for his final fight; against the reigning heavyweight champ Mason 'The Line' Dixon.
filmInfoContainer4: Implausible but entertaining and poignant, Rocky Balboa finds the champ in fighting form for the first time in years.

filmInfoContainer3: Ichabod Crane is sent to Sleepy Hollow to investigate the decapitations of three people, with the culprit being the legendary apparition, The Headless Horseman.
filmInfoContainer4: Sleepy Hollow entertains with its stunning visuals and creepy atmosphere.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in 1985, working-class student Brian Jackson (McAvoy) navigates his first year at Bristol University.
filmInfoContainer4: Starter For 10 is a spirited coming-of-age tale that remains charming and witty even as it veers into darker teritory. The unique setting of a quiz show makes the film wittier than your average romantic comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: A British mystery author visits her publisher's home in the South of France, where her interaction with his unusual daughter sets off some touchy dynamics.
filmInfoContainer4: A sensual thriller with two engaging performers demanding our undivided attention.

filmInfoContainer3: Fleeing from the Russian secret police, a young Estonian fencer is forced to return to his homeland, where he becomes a physical education teacher at a local school. The past however catches up and puts him in front of a difficult choice.
filmInfoContainer4: The Fencer's inspirational coming-of-age arc is given added heft through sensitive direction, affecting performances, and a moving, fact-based story.

filmInfoContainer3: Story of two female Manhattan book editors fresh out of college, both finding love and themselves while frequenting the local disco.
A true-life drama, centering on British explorer Col. Percival Fawcett, who disappeared whilst searching for a mysterious city in the Amazon in the 1920s.
filmInfoContainer4: The Lost City of Z's stately pace and visual grandeur hearken back to classic exploration epics, and Charlie Hunnam turns in a masterful performance as its complex protagonist.

filmInfoContainer3: In a desperate attempt to prove his innocence, a skilled police negotiator accused of corruption and murder takes hostages in a government office to gain the time he needs to find the truth.
A dramatization of the turbulent first years of Queen Victoria's rule, and her enduring romance with Prince Albert.
filmInfoContainer4: Emily Blunt shines as Victoria in this romantic but plodding royal portrait.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1947, Dalton Trumbo was Hollywood's top screenwriter, until he and other artists were jailed and blacklisted for their political beliefs.
filmInfoContainer4: Trumbo serves as an honorable and well-acted tribute to a brilliant writer's principled stand, even if it doesn't quite achieve the greatness of its subject's own classic screenplays.

filmInfoContainer3: A man learns something extraordinary about himself after a devastating accident.
filmInfoContainer4: With a weaker ending, Unbreakable is not as a good as The Sixth Sense. However, it is a quietly suspenseful film that intrigues and engages, taking the audience through unpredictable twists and turns along the way.

filmInfoContainer3: A mysterious young woman seduces lonely men in the evening hours in Scotland. However, events lead her to begin a process of self-discovery.
filmInfoContainer4: Its message may prove elusive for some, but with absorbing imagery and a mesmerizing performance from Scarlett Johansson, Under the Skin is a haunting viewing experience.

filmInfoContainer3: An 8-year-old boy, raised by his grandmother, is surrounded by problems in his family he finds only himself capable of solving.
filmInfoContainer4: A coming-of-age tale that's more cloying than affecting.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of American poet Emily Dickinson from her early days as a young schoolgirl to her later years as a reclusive, unrecognized artist.
filmInfoContainer4: A Quiet Passion offers a finely detailed portrait of a life whose placid passage may not have been inherently cinematic, but is made more affecting by Cynthia Nixon's strong performance.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Crime, Drama, Mystery, Sci-Fi, Thriller
filmInfoContainer3: An undercover cop in a not-too-distant future becomes involved with a dangerous new drug and begins to lose his own identity as a result.
filmInfoContainer4: A faithful adaptation of Philip K. Dick's novel, A Scanner Darkly takes the viewer on a visual and mind-blowing journey into the author's conception of a drug-addled and politically unstable world.

filmInfoContainer3: A nature documentary centered on two cat families and how they teach their cubs the ways of the wild.
filmInfoContainer4: It isn't quite as majestic as its subjects, but African Cats boasts enough astounding footage -- and a big enough heart -- to keep things entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: A selfish prince is cursed to become a monster for the rest of his life, unless he learns to fall in love with a beautiful young woman he keeps prisoner.
filmInfoContainer4: With an enchanting cast, beautifully crafted songs, and a painterly eye for detail, Beauty and the Beast offers a faithful yet fresh retelling that honors its beloved source material.

filmInfoContainer3: The daughter of orthodox Sikh rebels against her parents' traditionalism and joins a football team.
filmInfoContainer4: Inspiring, compassionate, and with a sly undercurrent of social commentary, Bend It Like Beckham is a lively feel-good movie that genuinely charms.

filmInfoContainer3: Steve Rogers, a rejected military soldier transforms into Captain America after taking a dose of a "Super-Soldier serum". But being Captain America comes at a price as he attempts to take down a war monger and a terrorist organization.
filmInfoContainer4: With plenty of pulpy action, a pleasantly retro vibe, and a handful of fine performances, Captain America is solidly old-fashioned blockbuster entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: A bridegroom is possessed by an unquiet spirit in the midst of his own wedding celebration, in this clever take on the Jewish legend of the dybbuk.
filmInfoContainer4: Ambitious and beautifully shot, Demon delivers a gripping -- and sadly final -- testament to the singular talent possessed by director/co-writer Marcin Wrona.

filmInfoContainer: Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far on Foot
filmInfoContainer3: On the rocky path to sobriety after a life-changing accident, John Callahan discovers the healing power of art, willing his injured hands into drawing hilarious, often controversial cartoons, which bring him a new lease on life.
filmInfoContainer4: Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far on Foot avoids inspirational biopic clichés thanks to sensitive work from writer-director Gus Van Sant and the admirable efforts of a well-chosen cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A demon, raised from infancy after being conjured by and rescued from the Nazis, grows up to become a defender against the forces of darkness.
filmInfoContainer4: With wit, humor and Guillermo del Toro's fantastic visuals, the entertaining Hellboy transcends the derivative nature of the genre.

filmInfoContainer3: A jaded Japanese woman discovers a hidden copy of Fargo (1996) on VHS, believing it to be a treasure map indicating the location of a large case of money.
filmInfoContainer4: Powerfully acted and lovely to look at, Kumiko, the Treasure Hunter offers a treat for cinephiles with a taste for the pleasantly peculiar.

filmInfoContainer3: Three intersecting stories about people whose lives are affected by the death of a gay restaurateur.
filmInfoContainer4: Unconventional and refreshing, this strikingly un-Hollywood film takes a quiet and heartbreaking look at the warmth and inspiration of friendships lost.

filmInfoContainer3: A family falls into poverty during the Depression.
filmInfoContainer4: Though Liam's harrowing story is reminiscent of Angela's Ashes, it showcases strong performances, including one by child actor Anthony Borrows.

filmInfoContainer3: An arms dealer confronts the morality of his work as he is being chased by an Interpol Agent.
filmInfoContainer4: While Lord of War is an intelligent examination of the gun trade, it is too scattershot in its plotting to connect.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on the impact of globalization on the world's different wine regions.
filmInfoContainer4: Informative but lengthy behind-the-scenes look at the politics of modern winemaking.

filmInfoContainer3: Colin Clark, an employee of Sir Laurence Olivier's, documents the tense interaction between Olivier and Marilyn Monroe during the production of The Prince and the Showgirl (1957).
filmInfoContainer4: Michelle Williams shines in My Week with Marilyn, capturing the magnetism and vulnerability of Marilyn Monroe.

filmInfoContainer3: A biographical story of former U.S. President Richard Milhous Nixon, from his days as a young boy, to his eventual Presidency, which ended in shame.

filmInfoContainer2: Action, Adventure, Horror, Mystery, Sci-Fi, War
filmInfoContainer3: A small group of American soldiers find horror behind enemy lines on the eve of D-Day.
filmInfoContainer4: Part revisionist war drama, part zombie thriller, and part all-out genre gorefest, Overlord offers A-level fun for B-movie fans of multiple persuasions.

filmInfoContainer3: Antoine and Helene drive to South France to return their kids from a holiday camp. The traffic is dense and the atmosphere growingly tense; he is an alcoholic and becomes increasingly drunk...
filmInfoContainer4: Red Lights is a taut, character-driven thriller, set against the debris-strewn battleground of a failing marriage.

filmInfoContainer3: A female election agent and a gun-toting soldier try to collect votes among the local islanders with mixed success.
filmInfoContainer4: A moderately funny comedy that will reward patient viewers.

filmInfoContainer3: A father and son, both coroners, are pulled into a complex mystery while attempting to identify the body of a young woman, who was apparently harboring dark secrets.
filmInfoContainer4: The Autopsy of Jane Doe subverts the gruesome expectations triggered by its title to deliver a smart, suggestively creepy thriller that bolsters director André Ovredal's growing reputation.

filmInfoContainer3: Three film students vanish after traveling into a Maryland forest to film a documentary on the local Blair Witch legend, leaving only their footage behind.
filmInfoContainer4: Full of creepy campfire scares, mock-doc The Blair Witch Project keeps audiences in the dark about its titular villain -- thus proving that imagination can be as scary as anything onscreen.

filmInfoContainer3: A smart but sensible new graduate lands a job as an assistant to Miranda Priestly, the demanding editor-in-chief of a high fashion magazine.
filmInfoContainer4: A rare film that surpasses the quality of its source novel, this Devil is a witty expose of New York's fashion scene, with Meryl Streep in top form and Anne Hathaway more than holding her own.

filmInfoContainer3: A chambermaid and an ex-cop meet at a speed dating event and a romance develops. But during a romantic getaway things suddenly take a dark turn.
An aspiring playwright in New York strikes up a friendship with a guy while on the rebound from a break-up.
filmInfoContainer4: The Incredible Jessica James makes its standard storyline feel new, almost purely on the strength of a captivating, potentially star-making performance from Jessica Williams.

filmInfoContainer3: After spending years in California, Amir returns to his homeland in Afghanistan to help his old friend Hassan, whose son is in trouble.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite some fine performances, The Kite Runner is just shy of rendering the magic of the novel on to the big screen.

filmInfoContainer3: A man forms an unexpected bond with a transient woman living in her van that's parked in his driveway.
filmInfoContainer4: Led by a marvelous performance from Maggie Smith, Lady in the Van wrings poignant, often hilarious insight from its fact-based source material.
