filmInfoContainer3: A young, extroverted left-wing activist who sleeps with her political opponents to convert them to her cause is successful until she meets her match.
When her fiancé bows out on the eve of her wedding, Michal refuses to cancel the wedding arrangements. An Orthodox Jew, she insists that God will supply her a husband. As the clock ticks down.
filmInfoContainer4: The Wedding Plan is steeped in convention, but has a thoroughly charming star and enough fresh twists to set it pleasantly apart.

filmInfoContainer3: British soccer champion arrives to Swedish sleepy town to save their soccer team.
filmInfoContainer4: A spirited film that explores gender politics with comedy, intelligence, and a variety of interesting characters.

filmInfoContainer3: The vacation of a famous rock star and her boyfriend in Italy is disrupted by the unexpected visit of an old friend and his daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: Absorbing, visually arresting, and powerfully acted by an immensely talented cast, A Bigger Splash offers sumptuously soapy delights for fans of psychological adult drama.

filmInfoContainer: A Guide to Recognizing Your Saints
filmInfoContainer3: The movie is a coming-of-age drama about a boy growing up in Astoria, New York during the 1980s. As his friends end up dead, on drugs, or in prison. He comes to believe he has been saved from their fates by various so-called saints.
filmInfoContainer4: A Guide to Recognizing Your Saints is a lively, powerful coming-of-age tale with winning performances and sharp direction from first-timer Dito Montiel.

filmInfoContainer3: Mariane Pearl embarks on a frantic search to locate her journalist husband, Daniel, when he goes missing in Pakistan.
filmInfoContainer4: Angelina Jolie conveys the full emotional range of a woman in a desperate situation in A Mighty Heart, an urgent yet tactful film about a difficult subject.

filmInfoContainer3: Paul is a U.S. truck driver working in Iraq. After an attack by a group of Iraqis he wakes to find he is buried alive inside a coffin. With only a lighter and a cell phone it's a race against time to escape this claustrophobic death trap.
filmInfoContainer4: Wringing a seemingly impossible amount of gripping drama out of its claustrophobic premise, Buried is a nerve-wracking showcase for Ryan Reynolds' talent.

filmInfoContainer3: When JW becomes a drug runner in order to maintain his double life, his fate becomes tied to two other men: Jorge, a fugitive on the run from both the Serbian mafia and the police, and mafia enforcer Mrado, who is on the hunt for Jorge.
Paul, a teenager in the underground scene of early-nineties Paris, forms a DJ collective with his friends and together they plunge into the nightlife of sex, drugs, and endless music.

filmInfoContainer2: Documentary, Action, Drama, Music, Romance, War
filmInfoContainer3: In the slum of Cité Soleil, President Aristide's most loyal supporters were ruling as kings. The five major gang leaders were controlling heavily armed young men; the Chiméres. The Secret ...
filmInfoContainer4: Asger Leth risked his life to bring audiences this rare and gritty glimpse at Haitian gangs, poverty and politics.

filmInfoContainer3: A yakuza enforcer is ordered to secretly drive his beloved colleague to be assassinated. But when the colleague unceremoniously disappears en route, the trip that follows is a twisted, surreal and horrifying experience.
filmInfoContainer4: Miike continues his run of compellingly bizarre flicks.

filmInfoContainer: Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle
filmInfoContainer3: A Korean-American office worker and his Indian-American stoner friend embark on a quest to satisfy their desire for White Castle burgers.
filmInfoContainer4: The likable leads and subversion of racial stereotypes elevate Harold and Kumar above the typical stoner comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: An eight-year-old troublemaker must protect his house from a pair of burglars when he is accidentally left home alone by his family during Christmas vacation.
filmInfoContainer4: Home Alone uneven but frequently funny premise stretched unreasonably thin is buoyed by Macaulay Culkin's cute performance and strong supporting stars.

filmInfoContainer3: A retired military investigator works with a police detective to uncover the truth behind his son's disappearance following his return from a tour of duty in Iraq.
filmInfoContainer4: Though some of Paul Haggis's themes are heavy-handed, In the Valley of Elah is otherwise an engrossing murder mystery and antiwar statement, featuring a mesmerizing performance from Tommy Lee Jones.

filmInfoContainer3: A manic-depressive mess of a father tries to win back his wife by attempting to take full responsibility of their two young, spirited daughters, who don't make the overwhelming task any easier.
filmInfoContainer4: Infinitely Polar Bear handles its thorny themes with a somewhat troublesomely light touch, but Mark Ruffalo's complex performance keeps the drama solidly grounded.

filmInfoContainer: Interview with the Vampire: The Vampire Chronicles
filmInfoContainer3: A vampire tells his epic life story: love, betrayal, loneliness, and hunger.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite lacking some of the book's subtler shadings, and suffering from some clumsy casting, Interview with a Vampire benefits from Neil Jordan's atmospheric direction and a surfeit of gothic thrills.

filmInfoContainer3: Margherita, a director in the middle of an existential crisis, has to deal with the inevitable and still unacceptable loss of her mother.
filmInfoContainer4: Mia Madre explores thought-provoking themes with director/co-writer Nanni Moretti's reliably skillful blend of comedy and pathos.

filmInfoContainer3: Neil Young returns to his birth Canadian province of Ontario to revisit his old haunts and to perform in Toronto's vintage Massey Hall.
Leni takes Rafi to meet her family in Madrid. Leni's family is Jewish - mother, father, older sister and daughter, brother, and grandfather. Rafi is Palestinian, in Spain since age 12. ...
filmInfoContainer4: A cheerfully energetic screwball comedy, Only Human milks laughs from its culture-clash premise.

filmInfoContainer3: After a prank goes disastrously wrong, a group of boys are sent to a detention center where they are brutalized. Over ten years later, they get their chance for revenge.
A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner.
filmInfoContainer4: Sleepless in Seattle is a cute classic with a very light touch and real chemistry between the two leads -- even when spending an entire movie apart.

filmInfoContainer3: After being betrayed and left for dead in Italy, Charlie Croker and his team plan an elaborate gold heist against their former ally.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite some iffy plot elements, The Italian Job succeeds in delivering an entertaining modern take on the original 1969 heist film, thanks to a charismatic cast.

filmInfoContainer3: The journey that led to Charles Dickens' creation of "A Christmas Carol," a timeless tale that would redefine Christmas.
filmInfoContainer4: The Man Who Invented Christmas adds holiday magic to the writing of A Christmas Carol, putting a sweetly revisionist spin on the story behind a classic yuletide tale.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Mexican boy illegally travels to the U.S. to find his mother (who is illegally in the U.S.) after his grandmother passes away.
filmInfoContainer4: If Under the Same Moon is often manipulative, it is also heartfelt, and features strong performances from its leads.

filmInfoContainer3: Years after walking away from her past as a young private eye, Veronica Mars gets pulled back to her hometown, just in time for her high school reunion, in order to help her old flame Logan Echolls, who's embroiled in a murder mystery.
filmInfoContainer4: It might be a more entertaining watch for diehard fans of the show, but Veronica Mars offers enough sharp writing and solid performances to entertain viewers in the mood for a character-driven thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: A twelve-year-old piano prodigy who suffocates from his parent's big dreams for him decides to make his escape--and with the aid of his grandfather--chase his own dreams instead.
filmInfoContainer4: Though not highly original, Vitus is slightly redeemed by its charm and compelling performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A film set in a strange afterlife way station that has been reserved for people who have committed suicide.
filmInfoContainer4: Wristcutters: A Love Story sounds like a normal enough indie flick. Boy meets girl. Boy gets separated from girl. Boy goes on a road trip with friends to find girl and gains a new perspective on life. Except everybody's dead.

filmInfoContainer3: In a vignette called "Strange to meet you," Roberto sits at a small table in a coffee bar. Five cups of coffee and two ashtrays are in front of him; he drinks and smokes. Steven joins him. ...
filmInfoContainer4: Episodes vary in quality, but overall this talky film is quirkily engaging.

filmInfoContainer3: A young country girl comes to town and works in a brothel in order to help her fiance get the money to start his own business. "Paprika" is the name given to her by the madam.
filmInfoContainer4: Following its own brand of logic, Paprika is an eye-opening mind trip that is difficult to follow but never fails to dazzle.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of twenty-something friends, most of whom live in the same apartment complex, search for love and success in grunge-era Seattle.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, funny, and engagingly scruffy, Singles is a clear-eyed look at modern romance that doubles as a credible grunge-era time capsule.

filmInfoContainer3: Members of a world-renowned string quartet struggle to stay together in the face of death, competing egos and insuppressible lust.
filmInfoContainer4: An outstanding ensemble cast lends weight and depth to A Late Quartet's melodramatic script, and the result is insightful and emotionally satisfying.

filmInfoContainer3: Sir Robert Chiltern is a successful Government minister, well-off and with a loving wife. All this is threatened when Mrs Cheveley appears in London with damning evidence of a past misdeed....                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Brevity is the soul of wit, eh? This adaptation gets to the nitty gritty of Wilde's stage piece and plays on eternal human foibles.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the best-selling pair of memoirs from father and son David and Nic Sheff, Beautiful Boy chronicles the heartbreaking and inspiring experience of survival, relapse, and recovery in a family coping with addiction over many years.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautiful Boy sees Timothée Chalamet and Steve Carell delivering showcase work that's often powerful enough to make up for the story's muted emotional impact.

filmInfoContainer3: A hard-core New York Giants fan struggles to deal with the consequences when he is beaten up by his favorite player.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring Patton Oswalt's sympathetic portrayal, Big Fan humorously and effectively captures the dark and lonely world of a sports fanatic.

filmInfoContainer3: An actress, a writer, a student, and a government worker band together in an effort to escape Paris as the Nazis move into the city.
filmInfoContainer4: It's froth, but stylish and giddily entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the Bram Stoker Award nominee short story by cult author Joe R. Lansdale, Bubba Ho-tep tells the "true" story of what really did become of Elvis Presley. We find Elvis (Bruce ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: The best movie to star both the King and JFK.

filmInfoContainer3: Young filmmakers document their colleague's budding online friendship with a young woman and her family which leads to an unexpected series of discoveries.
filmInfoContainer4: Catfish may tread the line between real-life drama and crass exploitation a little too unsteadily for some viewers' tastes, but its timely premise and tightly wound mystery make for a gripping documentary.

filmInfoContainer3: Since his beloved violin was broken, Nasser Ali Khan, one of the most renowned musicians of his day, has lost all taste for life. Finding no instrument worthy of replacing it, he decides to confine himself to bed to await death.
filmInfoContainer4: Whimsical and melancholy, Chicken with Plums is visually striking and dreamily compelling despite its occasional narrative missteps.

filmInfoContainer3: After she ends up in prison and loses custody of her son, a woman struggles to assimilate outside her former life and remain clean long enough to regain custody of her son.
filmInfoContainer4: In one of her best roles, Cheung gives a believable and arresting performance as a recovering addict.

filmInfoContainer3: A nurse, a policeman, a young married couple, a salesman, and other survivors of a worldwide plague that is producing aggressive, flesh-eating zombies, take refuge in a mega Midwestern shopping mall.
filmInfoContainer4: A kinetic, violent and surprisingly worthy remake of George Romero's horror classic that pays homage to the original while working on its own terms.

filmInfoContainer3: A thirty-years traveling diamond salesman must mentor a brash young replacement when his company downsizes him.
filmInfoContainer4: Robert Forster's tour-de-force performance, along with Daniel M. Cohen's sensitive direction and subtly shaded screenplay, brings rare heft to this mentor/protégé buddy film.

filmInfoContainer3: In a violent, futuristic city where the police have the authority to act as judge, jury and executioner, a cop teams with a trainee to take down a gang that deals the reality-altering drug, SLO-MO.
filmInfoContainer4: Fueled by bombastic violence and impressive special effects, rooted in self-satire and deadpan humor, Dredd 3D does a remarkable job of capturing its source material's gritty spirit.

filmInfoContainer3: A young writing prodigy finds a mentor in a reclusive author.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite the predictability of its plot and its similarity to Good Will Hunting, Finding Forrester has an honest, solid feel to it and good rapport between Connery and Brown.

filmInfoContainer3: Having packed up her possessions to move in with her lover, Laure is more unsettled than she appears. Needing to get out and have a change of scenery, she jumps in her car to go to have ...
filmInfoContainer4: A dreamy, visually poetic film.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of James Brown's rise from extreme poverty to become one of the most influential musicians in history.
filmInfoContainer4: With an unforgettable Chadwick Boseman in the starring role, Get On Up offers the Godfather of Soul a fittingly dynamic homage.

filmInfoContainer3: The story is set at the beginning of the 20th century in Sicily. Salvatore, a very poor farmer, and a widower, decides to emigrate to the US with all his family, including his old mother. ...
filmInfoContainer4: Slow-moving but ultimately rewarding, Golden Door is a profound drama with scenes of fantastical magical realism, lively humor, and stunning images.

filmInfoContainer3: A love story set in 1930s England that follows 17-year-old Cassandra Mortmain, and the fortunes of her eccentric family, struggling to survive in a decaying English castle.
filmInfoContainer4: A handsome and charming adaptation of the novel.

filmInfoContainer3: A musical interpretation of three lovers living in Paris.
filmInfoContainer4: Love Songs is hampered by a lack of focus, but held together by Honore's deft direction and an engaging cast.

filmInfoContainer: Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again
filmInfoContainer3: Five years after the events of Mamma Mia! (2008), Sophie prepares for the grand reopening of the Hotel Bella Donna as she learns more about her mother's past.
filmInfoContainer4: Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again doubles down on just about everything fans loved about the original -- and my my, how can fans resist it?

filmInfoContainer3: A single woman takes the place of a stranger's blind date, which leads to her finding the perfect boyfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to fine performances from Lake Bell and Simon Pegg, Man Up largely strikes the deceptively difficult balance between romance and comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Down on his luck and facing financial hardship, Gerry teams up with younger charismatic poker player, Curtis, in an attempt to change his luck. The two set off on a road trip through the South with visions of winning back what's been lost.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-acted and steeped in Southern atmosphere, Mississippi Grind is a road movie and addiction drama that transcends each of its well-worn genres.

filmInfoContainer3: A fictionalized account of the first major successful sexual harassment case in the United States, Jenson vs. Eveleth Mines, where a woman who endured a range of abuse while working as a miner filed and won the landmark 1984 lawsuit.
filmInfoContainer4: Though sometimes melodramatic and formulaic, North Country is nonetheless a rousing, powerful story of courage and humanity.

filmInfoContainer3: When the evil spirit Pitch launches an assault on Earth, the Immortal Guardians team up to protect the innocence of children all around the world.
filmInfoContainer4: A sort of Avengers for the elementary school set, Rise of the Guardians is wonderfully animated and briskly paced, but it's only so-so in the storytelling department.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama focused on the friendship between a high-functioning autistic woman and a man who is traumatized after a fatal car accident.
filmInfoContainer4: Sigourney Weaver gracefully undertakes a difficult role, while the rest of the cast lifts the histrionic plot into something worthwhile.

filmInfoContainer: The Boy in the Striped Pajamas
filmInfoContainer3: Set during WWII, a story seen through the innocent eyes of Bruno, the eight-year-old son of the commandant at a German concentration camp, whose forbidden friendship with a Jewish boy on the other side of the camp fence has startling and unexpected consequences.
filmInfoContainer4: A touching and haunting family film that deals with the Holocaust in an arresting and unusual manner, and packs a brutal final punch of a twist.

filmInfoContainer3: A French police magistrate spends years trying to take down one of the country's most powerful drug rings.
filmInfoContainer4: The Connection doesn't do itself any favors by forcing comparisons to The French Connection, but it's a reasonably entertaining thriller in its own right.

filmInfoContainer: The Girl with All the Gifts
filmInfoContainer3: A scientist and a teacher living in a dystopian future embark on a journey of survival with a special young girl named Melanie.
filmInfoContainer4: The Girl with All the Gifts grapples with thought-provoking questions without skimping on the scares -- and finds a few fresh wrinkles in the well-worn zombie horror genre along the way.

filmInfoContainer3: A reluctant Hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, sets out to the Lonely Mountain with a spirited group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home, and the gold within it from the dragon Smaug.
filmInfoContainer4: Peter Jackson's return to Middle-earth is an earnest, visually resplendent trip, but the film's deliberate pace robs the material of some of its majesty.

filmInfoContainer3: Two men, six meals in six different places on a road trip around Italy. Liguria, Tuscany, Rome, Amalfi and ending in Capri.
filmInfoContainer4: While perhaps not quite as fresh as Coogan and Brydon's original voyage in The Trip, The Trip to Italy still proves a thoroughly agreeable sequel.

filmInfoContainer3: Siberian gulag escapees travel 4,000 miles by foot to freedom in India.
filmInfoContainer4: It isn't as emotionally involving as it should be, but this Peter Weir epic offers sweeping ambition and strong performances to go with its grand visual spectacle.

filmInfoContainer3: Anti-corporate activists travel from conference to conference, impersonating member of the World Trade Organization.
Titus returns victorious from war, only to plant the seeds of future turmoil for himself and his family.
filmInfoContainer4: The movie stretches too long to be entertaining despite a strong cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of students investigates a series of mysterious bear killings, but learns that there are much more dangerous things going on. They start to follow a mysterious hunter, learning that he is actually a troll hunter.
filmInfoContainer4: Trollhunter is a mockumentary with an appropriate level of creeping dread, but one that also benefits from generous helpings of dry wit.

filmInfoContainer3: In the Nazi-occupied Netherlands, a teenage boy gets involved in the Dutch Resistance after coming to the aid of a wounded RAF pilot.
filmInfoContainer4: A gripping, handsomely shot World War II melodrama with thriller elements successfully mixed in.

filmInfoContainer3: A dark comedy about a murder and its consequences presented in a backwards manner, where death is actually a rebirth. The film starts with an "execution" of the main protagonist and goes ...
filmInfoContainer4: Happy End is far from Haneke's best work, yet it still succeeds in forcing audiences to confront -- and uncomfortably consider -- the dark side of human nature.

filmInfoContainer3: A down-on-his-luck adult film star sees a chance to make a comeback via a lesbian documentary film-maker, but she is exploiting him to get financial backing for her pet project.
filmInfoContainer4: It may evoke memories of classic summer blockbusters a little too eagerly for some, but Super 8 has thrills, visual dazzle, and emotional depth to spare.

filmInfoContainer3: A troubled hedge fund magnate desperate to complete the sale of his trading empire makes an error that forces him to turn to an unlikely person for help.
filmInfoContainer4: Arbitrage is both a tense thriller and a penetrating character study, elevated by the strength of a typically assured performance from Richard Gere.

filmInfoContainer3: An exclusive golf course has to deal with a brash new member and a destructive dancing gopher.
filmInfoContainer4: Though unabashedly crude and juvenile, Caddyshack nevertheless scores with its classic slapstick, unforgettable characters, and endlessly quotable dialogue.

filmInfoContainer3: Young drug pushers in the projects of Brooklyn live hard dangerous lives, trapped between their drug bosses and the detectives out to stop them.
filmInfoContainer4: A work of mournful maturity that sacrifices little of its director's signature energy, Clockers is an admittedly flawed drama with a powerfully urgent message.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama centered on a group of people searching for human connections in today's wired world.
filmInfoContainer4: It's didactic in spots and melodramatic in others, but Disconnect's strong cast helps make it a timely, effective exploration of modern society's technological overload.

filmInfoContainer3: Two sisters confront their sexual attitudes and experiences while on a family holiday.
filmInfoContainer4: The controversial Fat Girl is an unflinchingly harsh but powerful look at female adolescence.

filmInfoContainer3: American soldiers of the 2/3 Field Artillery, a group known as the "Gunners," tell of their experiences in Baghdad during the Iraq War. Holed up in a bombed out pleasure palace built by Sadaam Hussein, the soldiers endured hostile situations some four months after President George W. Bush declared the end of major combat operations in the country.
filmInfoContainer4: A shapeless documentary, but shows what's it like for the soldiers on the ground.

filmInfoContainer3: A young, naive boy sets out alone on the road to find his wayward mother. Soon he finds an unlikely protector in a crotchety man and the two have a series of unexpected adventures along the way.

Thirty years after they served together in Vietnam, a former Navy Corpsman Larry "Doc" Shepherd re-unites with his old buddies, former Marines Sal Nealon and Reverend Richard Mueller, to bury his son, a young Marine killed in the Iraq War.
filmInfoContainer4: Last Flag Flying balances raw drama against refreshing moments of humor in an impeccably cast film that wrestles with questions of patriotism, family, and grief.

filmInfoContainer3: As Cecil Gaines serves eight presidents during his tenure as a butler at the White House, the civil rights movement, Vietnam, and other major events affect this man's life, family, and American society.
filmInfoContainer4: Gut-wrenching and emotionally affecting,  Lee Daniels' The Butler overcomes an uneven narrative thanks to strong performances from an all-star cast.

filmInfoContainer3: During one unusually hot and tragic weekend, four people struggle after hearing some life-changing news, this in turn brings them together.
filmInfoContainer4: With animated sequences adding imaginative quirkiness to the mix, this movie about death and disaster is insightful, empathic, and more uplifting than one would think.

filmInfoContainer: Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
filmInfoContainer3: Guinevere Pettigrew, a middle-aged London governess, finds herself unfairly dismissed from her job. An attempt to gain new employment catapults her into the glamorous world and dizzying social whirl of an American actress and singer, Delysia Lafosse.
filmInfoContainer4: Miss Pettigrew is a breezy period comedy carried by the strong performances of Amy Adams and Frances McDormand.

filmInfoContainer3: The romantic and coming-of-age misadventures of a 13-year-old American living in Germany.
filmInfoContainer4: Morris from America adds some novel narrative twists to its father-son story -- and gains added resonance thanks to a powerful performance from Craig Robinson.

filmInfoContainer3: The lives of three friends, from their early school days into young adulthood, when the reality of the world they live in comes knocking.
filmInfoContainer4: With Never Let Me Go, Mark Romanek has delivered a graceful adaptation that captures the spirit of the Ishiguro novel -- which will be precisely the problem for some viewers.

filmInfoContainer3: Will Henry is a newly single graphic novelist balancing parenting his young twin daughters and a classroom full of students while exploring and navigating the rich complexities of new love and letting go of the woman who left him.
filmInfoContainer4: People Places Things finds writer-director Jim Strouse in peak form -- and makes the most of talented stars who help breathe fresh life into familiar narrative territory.

filmInfoContainer3: A young couple living in a Connecticut suburb during the mid-1950s struggle to come to terms with their personal problems while trying to raise their two children.
filmInfoContainer4: Brilliantly acted and emotionally powerful, Revolutionary Road is a handsome adaptation of Richard Yates' celebrated novel.

filmInfoContainer3: An exploration of various interpretations of Stanley Kubrick's horror film, The Shining (1980).
filmInfoContainer4: Mysterious and provocative, Room 237 is a fascinating journey into the world of obsessive cinephilles.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1976, a lower-middle-class teenager struggles to cope living with her neurotic family of nomads on the outskirts of Beverly Hills.
filmInfoContainer4: Warm, real, and hilarious.

filmInfoContainer3: After being denied a promotion at the university where she teaches, Doctor Lily Penleric, a brilliant musicologist, impulsively visits her sister, who runs a struggling rural school in ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: The story may be a bit too melodramatic, but great performances abound in Songcatcher. The real reason to see the movie, however, is the hypnotic music.

filmInfoContainer3: The life and career of Andre Stander, a South African police officer turned bank robber.
filmInfoContainer4: An unsatisfying account of Stander's life.

filmInfoContainer: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith
filmInfoContainer3: Three years into the Clone Wars, the Jedi rescue Palpatine from Count Dooku. As Obi-wan pursues a new threat, Anakin acts as a double agent between the Jedi Council and Palpatine and is lured into a sinister plan to rule the galaxy.
filmInfoContainer4: With Episode III: Revenge of the Sith, George Lucas brings his second Star Wars trilogy to a suitably thrilling and often poignant -- if still a bit uneven -- conclusion.

filmInfoContainer3: Pregnant forensic psychologist Lydie Crane is hired to learn the truth behind the case of 16-year-old Stephanie Daley, who is accused of concealing her pregnancy and murdering her infant.
filmInfoContainer4: The premise has all the trappings of melodrama, but the excellent performances give the characters complexity and empathy.

filmInfoContainer3: In an old school Las Vegas casino, its top gambling jinx breaks his curse when he falls in love, much to his boss' consternation.
filmInfoContainer4: A small movie elevated by superb performances.

filmInfoContainer3: An American military advisor embraces the Samurai culture he was hired to destroy after he is captured in battle.
filmInfoContainer4: With high production values and thrilling battle scenes, The Last Samurai is a satisfying epic.

filmInfoContainer3: Identical twins Annie and Hallie, separated at birth and each raised by one of their biological parents, later discover each other for the first time at summer camp and make a plan to bring their wayward parents back together.
filmInfoContainer4: Writer-director Nancy Meyers takes the winning formula of the 1961 original and gives it an amiable modern spin, while young star Lindsay Lohan shines in her breakout role.

filmInfoContainer3: A mild-mannered chemist and an ex-con must lead the counterstrike when a rogue group of military men, led by a renegade general, threaten a nerve gas attack from Alcatraz against San Francisco.
filmInfoContainer4: For visceral thrills, it can't be beat. Just don't expect The Rock to engage your brain.

filmInfoContainer3: 6 Los Angeles celebrities are stuck in James Franco's house after a series of devastating events just destroyed the city. Inside, the group not only will have to face with the apocalypse, but with themselves.
filmInfoContainer4: Energetic, self-deprecating performances and enough guffaw-inducing humor make up for the flaws in This Is the End loosely written script.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at what goes on backstage during the last broadcast of America's most celebrated radio show, where singing cowboys Dusty and Lefty, a country music siren, and a host of others hold court.
filmInfoContainer4: The final film by the great Robert Altman, A Prairie Home Companion, the big screen adaptation of Garrison Keillor's radio broadcast showcases plenty of the director's strengths: it's got a gigantic cast and plenty of quirky acting and dialogue.

filmInfoContainer3: A Brooklyn teenager spends his days experimenting with drugs and looking online for older men to meet with.
filmInfoContainer4: Empathetic and powerfully acted, Beach Rats takes a clear-eyed yet dreamlike look at a young man's adolescent turmoil.

filmInfoContainer3: On a quiet suburban street, a babysitter must defend a twelve-year-old boy from intruders, only to discover it's far from a normal home invasion.
filmInfoContainer4: Carried by its charismatic young cast, Better Watch Out is an adorably sinister holiday horror film.

filmInfoContainer3: Big Eden is a small, fictional northwestern Montana town.
filmInfoContainer4: Though unrealistic, Big Eden has all the charm and sweetness of a fairy tale.

filmInfoContainer3: A suicidally disillusioned liberal politician puts a contract out on himself and takes the opportunity to be bluntly honest with his voters by affecting the rhythms and speech of hip-hop music and culture.
filmInfoContainer4: Star and director Beatty's ambitious take on race and politics in 20th-century America isn't perfect, but manages to provide more than its share of thought-provoking laughs.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of the social costs of corporate interests pursuing profits at the expense of the public good.
filmInfoContainer4: Love him or hate him, Capitalism captures Michael Moore in his muckraking element -- with all the Moore-centric showmanship that entails.

filmInfoContainer3: A calamity at Dante and Randal's shops sends them looking for new horizons - but they ultimately settle at the fast food empire Mooby's.
filmInfoContainer4: Clerks II dishes up much of the graphic humor and some of the insight that made the 1994 original a cult hit.

filmInfoContainer3: Chaos ensues when a man tries to expose a dark secret regarding a recently deceased patriarch of a dysfunctional British family.
filmInfoContainer4: Death At A Funeral is a rousing British farce, with enough slapstick silliness to overcome its faults.

filmInfoContainer3: A story centered on the friendship between a boy and a dolphin whose tail was lost in a crab trap.
filmInfoContainer4: Wisely dialing down the schmaltz, Dolphin Tale is earnest, sweet, and well-told, a rare family film that both kids and parents can enjoy.

filmInfoContainer3: Ruby Weaver, a woman from New York, believes she has found the man of her dreams. And Sam Deed is really such, except for he assures that he came from the future.
filmInfoContainer4: Happy Accidents has enough quirkiness and charm to rise above the more formulaic entries in the romantic comedy genre.

filmInfoContainer: I'll See You in My Dreams
filmInfoContainer3: The success and decline of songwriter Gus Kahn is portrayed, with his wife, Grace Kahn, sticking by him the whole time.
In 1937, a teenager is cast in the Mercury Theatre production of "Julius Caesar", directed by a young Orson Welles.
filmInfoContainer4: Me and Orson Welles boasts a breakout performance by Christian McKay and an infectious love of the backstage drama that overcomes its sometimes fluffy tone.

filmInfoContainer3: A man and his friends come up with an intricate and original plan to destroy two big weapons manufacturers.
filmInfoContainer4: It might be a little too whimsical for its own good, but Micmacs delivers more of the inventive silliness that director Jean-Pierre Jeunet is known for.

filmInfoContainer3: A darkness swirls at the center of a world-renowned dance company, one that will engulf the artistic director, an ambitious young dancer, and a grieving psychotherapist. Some will succumb to the nightmare. Others will finally wake up.
filmInfoContainer4: Suspiria attacks heady themes with garish vigor, offering a viewing experience that's daringly confrontational - and definitely not for everyone.

filmInfoContainer3: A politically charged epic about the state of the oil industry in the hands of those personally involved and affected by it.
filmInfoContainer4: Ambitious, complicated, intellectual, and demanding of its audience, Syriana is both a gripping geopolitical thriller and wake-up call to the complacent.

filmInfoContainer3: 16-year-old Amalia looks to save the soul of a middle-aged doctor.
filmInfoContainer4: This provocative, lyrical drama mixes themes of forbidden sexuality and redemptive faith with a touch of humanism in a memorable, if disorienting, visual style.

filmInfoContainer3: During the French Revolution, a Scottish aristocrat and her former lover, the Duke of Orleans, find themselves on opposite sides of the conflict.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually stunning, The Lady and the Duke uses current technology to elegantly bring the past to life.

filmInfoContainer3: After failing the audition to a prestigious music school because of the rude behavior of one of the testers, a girl takes revenge by gaining the trust of the same woman some years later and becoming indispensable for her.
filmInfoContainer4: Reminiscent of Hitchcock and Chabrol, The Page Turner is elegant yet suspenseful, a revenge potboiler of a high degree.

filmInfoContainer3: SpongeBob SquarePants takes leave from the town of Bikini Bottom in order to track down King Neptune's stolen crown.
filmInfoContainer4: Surreally goofy and entertaining for both children and their parents.

filmInfoContainer3: A desperate woman asks for a meeting with a journalist to disclose the cruel and inhumane punishment of her niece.
filmInfoContainer4: The Stoning of Soraya M. nearly transcends its deficiencies through the sheer strength of its subject material, but ultimately drowns out its message with an inappropriately heavy-handed approach.

filmInfoContainer3: A very rich and successful playboy amuses himself by stealing artwork, but may have met his match in a seductive detective.
filmInfoContainer4: Sleek, stylish, and painlessly diverting, The Thomas Crown Affair is a remake of uncommon charm.

filmInfoContainer3: Two tigers are separated as cubs and taken into captivity, only to be reunited years later as enemies by an explorer (Pearce) who inadvertently forces them to fight each other.
filmInfoContainer4: A charming family-friendly movie with stunning cinematography.

filmInfoContainer3: A pretty, popular teenager can't go out on a date until her ill-tempered older sister does.
filmInfoContainer4: Julia Stiles and Heath Ledger add strong performances to an unexpectedly clever script, elevating 10 Things (slightly) above typical teen fare.

filmInfoContainer3: Amid the Civil War in 17th-century England, a group of deserters flee from battle through an overgrown field. Captured by an alchemist, the men are forced to help him search to find a hidden treasure that he believes is buried in the field.
filmInfoContainer4: Recklessly assembled and occasionally compelling in spite of itself, A Field in England showcases a singularly brilliant voice in British cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the international best selling book. The true feel good story of how James Bowen, a busker and recovering drug addict, had his life transformed when he met a stray ginger cat.
filmInfoContainer4: A Street Cat Named Bob uses a fact-based feelgood tale as the inspiration for an unapologetically heartwarming movie that should move all but the most cynical of viewers.

filmInfoContainer: All the Money in the World
filmInfoContainer3: The story of the kidnapping of 16-year-old John Paul Getty III and the desperate attempt by his devoted mother to convince his billionaire grandfather Jean Paul Getty to pay the ransom.
filmInfoContainer4: All the Money in the World offers an absorbing portrayal of a true story, brought compellingly to life by a powerful performance from Christopher Plummer.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in '30s London, the film involves stage actors and their experiences with love and revenge.
filmInfoContainer4: Annette Bening delivers a captivating performance in Being Julia, a sophisticated comedy that follows a 1930s stage diva who experiences an identity crisis at age 40.

filmInfoContainer3: Haunted by the patients he failed to save, an extremely burned-out Manhattan ambulance paramedic fights to maintain his sanity over three fraught and turbulent nights.
filmInfoContainer4: Stunning and compelling, Scorsese and Cage succeed at satisfying the audience.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on Conan O'Brien's comedy tour of the U.S. and Canada after leaving his post at "The Tonight Show" and severing his relationship with NBC.
Dr. Ellie Arroway, after years of searching, finds conclusive radio proof of extraterrestrial intelligence, sending plans for a mysterious machine.

When a man and woman flirt with each other at a wedding reception, the sexual tension seems spontaneous. As they break from the party to a hotel room, the flirtation turns into a night filled with passion and remorse.
filmInfoContainer4: Its occasional use of split screen may feel gimmicky at times, but Conversations With Other Women is a bold, inventive drama carried by its two charismatic leads.

filmInfoContainer3: Acclaimed writer and historian Deborah E. Lipstadt must battle for historical truth to prove the Holocaust actually occurred when David Irving, a renowned denier, sues her for libel.
filmInfoContainer4: If Denial doesn't quite do its incredible story complete justice, it comes close enough to offer a satisfying, impactful drama -- and another powerful performance from Rachel Weisz.

filmInfoContainer3: An attorney, intent on climbing the career ladder toward success, finds an unlikely opponent in a manipulative criminal he is trying to prosecute.
filmInfoContainer4: Though Fracture's plot is somewhat implausible, the onscreen face-off between Gosling and Hopkins overshadows any faults.

filmInfoContainer3: Labeled an outcast by his brainy family, a bouncer overcomes long odds to lead a team of under performing misfits to semi-pro hockey glory, beating the crap out of everything that stands in his way.
filmInfoContainer4: Goon is a crude slapstick comedy with well-formed characters and a surprising amount of heart.

filmInfoContainer3: Horton the Elephant struggles to protect a microscopic community from his neighbors who refuse to believe it exists.
filmInfoContainer4: Horton Hears A Who! is both whimsical and heartwarming, and is the rare Dr. Seuss adaptation that stays true to the spirit of the source material.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1892, a legendary Army Captain reluctantly agrees to escort a Cheyenne chief and his family through dangerous territory.
filmInfoContainer4: Hostiles benefits from stunning visuals and a solid central performance from Christian Bale, both of which help elevate its uneven story.

filmInfoContainer3: A father and daughter journey from Denmark to an unknown desert that exists in a realm beyond the confines of civilization.
filmInfoContainer4: Jauja will prove haunting for those lured in by its deliberate pace and lovely visuals, though it may test some viewers' patience.

filmInfoContainer3: A French adaptation of the second (and much less well-known) version of D.H. Lawrence's erotic tale.
filmInfoContainer4: Tasteful, poetic, yet sexually forthright, Lady Chatterley skillfully translates its source novel's high-art erotica onto the big screen.

filmInfoContainer3: Macbeth, the Thane of Glamis, receives a prophecy from a trio of witches that one day he will become King of Scotland. Consumed by ambition and spurred to action by his wife, Macbeth murders his king and takes the throne for himself.
filmInfoContainer4: Faithful to the source material without sacrificing its own cinematic flair, Justin Kurzel's Macbeth rises on the strength of a mesmerizing Michael Fassbender performance to join the upper echelon of big-screen Shakespeare adaptations.

filmInfoContainer3: A true story that comically depicts the relationship between an ordinary woman and her three husbands, who live in the same house in a poor and arid small village of the Brazilian northeast.
filmInfoContainer4: Me You Them tells a warmly comical and touching story, and features a charismatically earthy performance by Casé.

filmInfoContainer3: Trip, a young roadie for Metallica, is sent on an urgent mission during the band's show. But what seems like a simple assignment turns into a surreal adventure.
filmInfoContainer4: Imaginatively shot and edited, Metallica Through the Never is an electrifying, immersive concert film, though its fictional sequences are slightly less assured.

filmInfoContainer3: The tempestuous love story between Fernando, an older man who has recently returned to his crime-ridden drug capitol hometown of Medellin, Colombia and the gun-happy 16-year-old assassin ...
filmInfoContainer4: Director Barbet Schroeder presents a bleak, darkly humorous drama about hopeless love in Medellin, Colombia.

filmInfoContainer3: As a war between humankind and monstrous sea creatures wages on, a former pilot and a trainee are paired up to drive a seemingly obsolete special weapon in a desperate effort to save the world from the apocalypse.
filmInfoContainer4: It may sport more style than substance, but Pacific Rim is a solid modern creature feature bolstered by fantastical imagery and an irresistible sense of fun.

filmInfoContainer3: As a part of their study of the Holocaust, the children of the Whitwell, TN Middle School try to collect 6 million paper clips representing the 6 million Jews killed by the Nazis, and grows to include millions of others killed.
filmInfoContainer4: A touching, though somewhat flat, documentary that follows a homogenous class of white Protestant eighth graders as they learn the importance of tolerance by erecting a monument to the 6 million victims of the Holocaust.

filmInfoContainer3: An F.B.I. Agent goes undercover to catch a gang of surfers who may be bank robbers.
filmInfoContainer4: Absurd, over-the-top, and often wildly entertaining, Point Break is here to show you that the human spirit is still alive.

filmInfoContainer3: In Paris, six people all look for love, despite typically having their romantic aspirations dashed at every turn.
filmInfoContainer4: The premise isn't anything new, but director Alain Resnais' attention to detail and smooth camerawork gives this movie a delicate edge.

filmInfoContainer3: Detective Sherlock Holmes and his stalwart partner Watson engage in a battle of wits and brawn with a nemesis whose plot is a threat to all of England.
filmInfoContainer4: Guy Ritchie's directorial style might not be quite the best fit for an update on the legendary detective, but Sherlock Holmes benefits from the elementary appeal of a strong performance by Robert Downey, Jr.

filmInfoContainer3: Chris wants to show girlfriend Tina his world, but events soon conspire against the couple and their dream caravan holiday takes a very wrong turn.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Ben Wheatley and writer-stars Alice Lowe and Steve Oram deliver a wicked road trip movie that successfully walks the line between dark comedy and horror.

filmInfoContainer3: A small town is taken over by an alien plague, turning residents into zombies and all forms of mutant monsters.
filmInfoContainer4: A slimy, B-movie homage oozing with affection for low-budget horror films, Slither is creepy and funny -- if you've got the stomach for it.

filmInfoContainer3: A hopeless man stranded on a deserted island befriends a dead body and together they go on a surreal journey to get home.
filmInfoContainer4: Disarmingly odd and thoroughly well-acted, Swiss Army Man offers adventurous viewers an experience as rewarding as it is impossible to categorize.

filmInfoContainer3: Desperate to be rid of her toddler, a dissatisfied Manhattan housewife hires a stranger to babysit and ends up getting much more than she bargained for.
filmInfoContainer4: Tallulah's narrative insight, thoughtfully written characters, and talented cast add up to an absorbing family drama that transcends genre tropes and capably overcomes its flirtations with melodrama.

filmInfoContainer3: Harper's autobiographical novel is almost out, his girlfriend Robin desires commitment, and he's best man at the wedding of Lance, a pro athlete. He goes to New York early (Robin will come ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: With a strong cast and a host of well-defined characters, The Best Man is an intelligent, funny romantic comedy that marks an impressive debut for writer/director Malcolm D. Lee.

filmInfoContainer3: In the midst of trying to legitimize his business dealings in New York City and Italy in 1979, aging Mafia Don Michael Corleone seeks to avow for his sins, while taking his nephew Vincent Mancini under his wing.

Carlo's life is thrown into a tailspin when his longtime girlfriend Giulia announces she's pregnant. As Carlo faces up to his anxieties about adulthood, his buddies Paolo, Adriano and ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Well-preformed, but it's nothing we haven't seen before.

filmInfoContainer3: In a dangerous post-apocalyptic world, an ailing father defends his son as they slowly travel to the sea.
filmInfoContainer4: The Road's commitment to Cormac McCarthy's dark vision may prove too unyielding for some, but the film benefits from hauntingly powerful performances from Viggo Mortensen and Kodi McPhee.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on true events, 16 year-old Jamie falls in with his mother's new boyfriend and his crowd of self-appointed neighborhood watchmen, a relationship that leads to a spree of torture and murder.
filmInfoContainer4: It's a bleak and brutal endurance test, but for viewers with the strength and patience to make it to the end, Snowtown will prove an uncommonly powerful viewing experience.

filmInfoContainer3: A cinematic triptych of three Tokyo-set stories.
filmInfoContainer4: An imaginative, if uneven, love letter to a city that signals a great creative enterprise by its three contributing directors.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War, and the soldiers on both sides that fought it, while their wives wait nervously and anxiously at home for the good news or the bad news.
filmInfoContainer4: The war cliches are laid on a bit thick, but the movie succeeds at putting a human face on soldiers of both sides in the Vietnam War.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenager journeys through a series of foster homes after her mother goes to prison for committing a crime of passion.
filmInfoContainer4: Strong performances by the lead actresses make White Oleander a compelling female melodrama.

filmInfoContainer3: A retired orchestra conductor is on vacation with his daughter and his film director best friend in the Alps when he receives an invitation from Queen Elizabeth II to perform for Prince Philip's birthday.
filmInfoContainer4: Gorgeously filmed and beautifully acted, Youth offers an enticing -- albeit flawed -- opportunity to witness an impressive array of seasoned veterans combining their cinematic might.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1950s Baltimore, a bad boy with a heart of gold wins the love of a good girl, whose boyfriend sets out for revenge.
filmInfoContainer4: John Waters' musical ode to the teen rebel genre is infectious and gleefully camp, providing star Johnny Depp with the perfect vehicle in which to lampoon his pin-up image.

filmInfoContainer3: The gruesome murders of Nancy and Derek Haysom in 1985 were an international media sensation. The Haysoms were wealthy, respected members of Virginia society, and the murder conviction of ...
filmInfoContainer4: The Promise wastes an outstanding cast and powerful real-life story on a love triangle that frustratingly fails to engage.

filmInfoContainer3: A cat burglar is forced to take a bickering, dysfunctional family hostage on Christmas Eve.
filmInfoContainer4: Undeniably uneven and too dark for some, The Ref nonetheless boasts strong turns from Denis Leary, Judy Davis, and Kevin Spacey, as well as a sharply funny script.

filmInfoContainer3: Six months after the rage virus was inflicted on the population of Great Britain, the US Army helps to secure a small area of London for the survivors to repopulate and start again. But not everything goes to plan.
filmInfoContainer4: While 28 Weeks Later lacks the humanism that made 28 Days Later a classic, it's made up with fantastic atmosphere and punchy direction.

filmInfoContainer3: A troubled young woman is encouraged by a teacher to enter a poetry contest.
filmInfoContainer4: A cautionary tale that rings true.

filmInfoContainer3: An enigmatic tale of four incredibly lucky people whose lives are intertwined by destiny are subject to the laws of fate. They discover that they cannot afford to be without luck as they ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: The plot gimmick is original, bolstered by stylishly intriguing setpieces.

filmInfoContainer3: The life and career of a legendary comedian, Andy Kaufman.
filmInfoContainer4: Jim Carrey is eerily dead-on in his portrayal of Andy Kaufman, which helps to elevate Man on the Moon above the script's formulaic biopic cliches.

filmInfoContainer3: Lyle Jensen is subject to sudden and violent outbursts, and he is committed to the juvenile wing of the Northwood Mental Institution. Several other youths are there with a variety of ...
filmInfoContainer4: A grim drama about emotionally damaged teens, Manic's solid cast helps to elevate the material above cliche.

filmInfoContainer3: A Spanish coming of age story focusing on the antics of two 17 year olds, who have a posh beach house almost all to themselves one summer. This is also a summer of sexual awakenings.
filmInfoContainer4: Nico and Dani offers a refreshingly honest look at adolescence and sexual coming-of-age.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary on the rise and stumble of Troy Duffy, the bartender-cum-filmmaker who was swept up by Miramax's Harvey Weinstein to turn his script for The Boondock Saints into a feature film.
filmInfoContainer4: This absorbing but wince-inducing documentary is a cautionary tale about the costs of hubris in the world of indie film.

filmInfoContainer3: The Darling family children receive a visit from Peter Pan, who takes them to Never Never Land where an ongoing war with the evil Pirate Captain Hook is taking place.
filmInfoContainer4: Solid if far from definitive, this version of Peter Pan is visually impressive, psychologically complex and faithful to its original source.

filmInfoContainer3: Schultze is an accordion player and newly without work. When the local music club celebrates its 50th anniversary, his taste of music changes unexpectedly.
filmInfoContainer4: Schultze Gets the Blues is a sweet and charming dark comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: A recently laid off factory worker kidnaps his former boss' friend's daughter, hoping to use the ransom money to pay for his sister's kidney transplant.
filmInfoContainer4: Though Park directs with stylistic flair, this revenge thriller is more excessively gruesome than thrilling.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a bullied fifteen-year-old boy in a small town as he struggles to adjust to his difficult life.
A woman spirals out of control while trying to keep her son from being found culpable in a murder investigation.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-acted film noir with arresting visuals.

filmInfoContainer3: After hitting something with her car, a bourgeois Argentine woman's life slowly descends into paranoia and isolation, as she fears she may have killed someone.
filmInfoContainer4: Careful and slight, Lucretia Martel's Headless Woman doesn't fit neatly into a clear storyline, but supports itself with ethereal visuals.

filmInfoContainer: The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou
filmInfoContainer3: With a plan to exact revenge on a mythical shark that killed his partner, Oceanographer Steve Zissou rallies a crew that includes his estranged wife, a journalist, and a man who may or may not be his son.
filmInfoContainer4: The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou is getting soaked by many critics, who call it smug, ironic and artificial. Still, others have praised the movie's sheer uniqueness, eccentricity and whimsy.

filmInfoContainer3: A man gets a chance to meet up with his dream girl from high school, even though his date with her back then was a complete disaster.
filmInfoContainer4: There's Something About Mary proves that unrelentingly, unabashedly peurile humor doesn't necessarily come at the expense of a film's heart.

filmInfoContainer: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
filmInfoContainer3: Arthur Dent and his friend Ford Prefect escape the destruction of Earth only to face incredible trials, tribulations and adventures in space and time.
filmInfoContainer4: A frantic and occasional funny adaptation of Douglas Adams' novel. However, it may have those unfamiliar with the source material scratching their heads.

filmInfoContainer3: Pirate Captain sets out on a mission to defeat his rivals Black Bellamy and Cutlass Liz for the Pirate of the year Award. The quest takes Captain and his crew from the shores of Blood Island to the foggy streets of Victorian London.
filmInfoContainer4: It may not quite scale Aardman's customary delirious heights, but The Pirates! still represents some of the smartest, most skillfully animated fare that modern cinema has to offer.

filmInfoContainer3: In Canton, Mississippi, a fearless young lawyer and his assistant defend a black man accused of murdering two white men who raped his ten-year-old daughter, inciting violent retribution and revenge from the Ku Klux Klan.
filmInfoContainer4: Overlong and superficial, A Time to Kill nonetheless succeeds on the strength of its skillful craftsmanship and top-notch performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A single mother struggles to clear her name after being wrongly accused and arrested for dealing drugs in an impoverished town in Texas.
filmInfoContainer4: Though its politics are as obvious as its outcome, American Violet is an earnest docudrama about the justice system with a powerful performance from Nicole Behairie.

filmInfoContainer: Bad Lieutenant: Port of Call New Orleans
filmInfoContainer3: Terence McDonagh is a drug- and gambling-addled detective in post-Katrina New Orleans investigating the killing of five Senegalese immigrants.
filmInfoContainer4: Befitting its unorthodox origins, this Bad Lieutenant benefits from Werner Herzog's typically fearless direction and a delightfully unhinged Nicolas Cage in the title role.

filmInfoContainer: Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie
filmInfoContainer3: 2 overly imaginative pranksters named George and Harold hypnotize their principal into thinking he's a ridiculously enthusiastic, incredibly dimwitted superhero named Captain Underpants.
filmInfoContainer4: With a tidy plot, clean animation, and humor that fits its source material snugly, Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie is entertainment that won't drive a wedge between family members.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman and her daughter open a chocolate shop in a small French village that shakes up the rigid morality of the community.
filmInfoContainer4: Chocolat is a charmingly light-hearted fable with a lovely performance by Binoche.

filmInfoContainer3: Healthcare professionals, government officials and everyday people find themselves in the midst of a worldwide epidemic as the CDC works to find a cure.
filmInfoContainer4: Tense, tightly plotted, and bolstered by a stellar cast, Contagion is an exceptionally smart -- and scary -- disaster movie.

filmInfoContainer: Detective Dee: Mystery of the Phantom Flame
filmInfoContainer3: An exiled detective is recruited to solve a series of mysterious deaths that threaten to delay the inauguration of Empress Wu.
Brutal cold forces two Antarctic explorers to leave their team of sled dogs behind as they fend for their survival.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring a stellar cast of marooned mutts, who deftly display emotion, tenderness, loyalty and resolve, Eight Below is a heartwarming and exhilarating adventure film.

filmInfoContainer3: A game designer on the run from assassins must play her latest virtual reality creation with a marketing trainee to determine if the game has been damaged.
filmInfoContainer4: Gooey, slimy, grotesque fun.

filmInfoContainer3: Hobbs has Dominic and Brian reassemble their crew to take down a team of mercenaries: Dominic unexpectedly gets convoluted also facing his presumed deceased girlfriend, Letty.
filmInfoContainer4: With high-octane humor and terrific action scenes, Fast & Furious 6 builds upon the winning blockbuster formula that made Fast 5 a critical and commercial success.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of one woman's lifelong struggle with her faith.
filmInfoContainer4: With Higher Ground, star and debuting director Vera Farmiga takes viewers on a challenging spiritual journey whose missteps are easily overcome by its many rich rewards.

filmInfoContainer3: Julia Child's story of her start in the cooking profession is intertwined with blogger Julie Powell's 2002 challenge to cook all the recipes in Child's first book.
filmInfoContainer4: Boosted by Meryl Streep's charismatic performance as Julia Child, Julie and Julia is a light, but fairly entertaining culinary comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: A rookie policeman from provincial Le Havre volunteers for the high pressure Parisian homicide bureau and is assigned to a middle-aged woman detective.
filmInfoContainer4: A gritty, languidly paced crime drama that blends old-fashioned ambiance with modern cynicism.

filmInfoContainer3: Two best friends grow up on the Isle of Wight and in Brighton in the 1970s and 1980s.
filmInfoContainer4: At times ponderous, Me Without You is engaging due to the fine work by Williams and Friel.

filmInfoContainer3: A man who lost his family in the September 11 attack on New York City runs into his old college roommate. Rekindling the friendship is the one thing that appears able to help the man recover from his grief.
filmInfoContainer4: Reign Over Me is a charming, affecting tale of friendship and loss, with solid performances from Adam Sandler as a broken, grief-stricken man and Don Cheadle as his old friend and savior.

filmInfoContainer3: A young, reformed gambler must return to playing big stakes poker to help a friend pay off loan sharks, while balancing his relationship with his girlfriend and his commitments to law school.
filmInfoContainer4: Richly atmospheric and colorful performances contributed to the movie's entertainment value.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of U.S. soldiers returning from Iraq struggle to integrate back into family and civilian life, while living with the memory of a war that threatens to destroy them long after they've left the battlefield.
filmInfoContainer4: Thank You for Your Service takes a sobering and powerfully acted -- if necessarily incomplete -- look at soldiers grappling with the horrific emotional impact of war.

filmInfoContainer3: An IT company hires an actor to serve as the company's president in order to help the business get sold to a cranky Icelander.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Lars von Trier ditches the pretensions but keeps his misanthropy in The Boss of it All, a surprisingly sharp and witty comedy about office life gone haywire.

filmInfoContainer3: An exceptionally adept Florida lawyer is offered a job at a high-end New York City law firm with a high-end boss - the biggest opportunity of his career to date.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it is ultimately somewhat undone by its own lofty ambitions, The Devil's Advocate is a mostly effective blend of supernatural thrills and character exploration.

filmInfoContainer3: A historical drama that illustrates Russian author Leo Tolstoy's struggle to balance fame and wealth with his commitment to a life devoid of material things.
filmInfoContainer4: Michael Hoffman's script doesn't quite live up to its famous subject, but this Tolstoy biopic benefits from a spellbinding tour de force performance by Helen Mirren.

filmInfoContainer: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants
filmInfoContainer3: Four best girlfriends hatch a plan to stay connected with one another as their lives start off in different directions: they pass around a pair of secondhand jeans that fits each of their bodies perfectly.
filmInfoContainer4: This adaptation of a beloved novel charms with its heartwarming tale of friendship and young adulthood; realistic portrayals of the lives of teenage girls lend the comedy-drama sincerity, and may capture hearts outside the female-centric demographic.

filmInfoContainer3: Actors Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon embark on a six-part episodic road trip through Europe. This time they're in Spain, sampling the restaurants, eateries, and sights along the way.
filmInfoContainer4: The Trip to Spain offers more of the same scenery, food, and conversation that filled Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon's first two Trips -- which is to say, more of a good thing.

filmInfoContainer3: Having thought that monogamy was never possible, a commitment-phobic career woman may have to face her fears when she meets a good guy.
filmInfoContainer4: Trainwreck drags commitment out of all but the most rom-com-phobic filmgoers with sharp humor, relatable characters, and hilarious work from Amy Schumer.

filmInfoContainer3: A man who controls small airplanes to detect Iraq's front line, is put in danger not being able to return.
filmInfoContainer4: Beautiful visuals, James Gray's confident direction, and a powerful performance from Marion Cotillard combine to make The Immigrant a richly rewarding period drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Baghead is a ghost story. Kevin is haunted by grief and has questions that only the recently deceased can answer. His search takes him to the most unremarkable of locations, a grotty ...
filmInfoContainer4: Pitting actors against murderers in a self-aware struggle for stardom, Baghead successfully skates the borders of horror and comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Hunger is a dark exploration into the breakdown of humanity. How far would you go to survive in the most extreme of circumstances? Five strangers awaken to find themselves trapped in an ...
filmInfoContainer4: Unflinching, uncompromising, vivid and vital, Steve McQueen's challenging debut is not for the faint hearted, but it's still a richly rewarding retelling of troubled times.

filmInfoContainer3: A young rapper, struggling with every aspect of his life, wants to make it big but his friends and foes make this odyssey of rap harder than it may seem.
filmInfoContainer4: Even though the story is overly familiar, there's enough here for an engaging ride.

filmInfoContainer3: A series of brutal murders puts the lives of three men on a collision course: The father of the latest victim now out for revenge, a vigilante police detective operating outside the ...
filmInfoContainer4: With just enough black humor to lighten the disturbing subject matter, Big Bad Wolves is as rewarding as it is challenging.

filmInfoContainer3: This is the story of Uxbal, a man living in this world, but able to see his death, which guides his every move.
filmInfoContainer4: Javier Bardem's searing performance helps to elevate Biutiful, as does Alejandro González Iñárritu's craftsmanship, but the film often lapses into contrivance and grimness.

filmInfoContainer3: Depicting Ted Kennedy's involvement in the fatal 1969 car accident that claims the life of a young campaign strategist, Mary Jo Kopechne.
filmInfoContainer4: Chappaquidick can't help leaving some of this true story's most intriguing questions unanswered, but it's bolstered by outstanding work from Jason Clarke in the central role.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the work of two stand-up comics, Jerry Seinfeld and a lesser-known newcomer, detailing the effort and frustration behind putting together a successful act and career while living a life on the road.
filmInfoContainer4: Comedian is an insightful look at the hard work of creating comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: After having an affair with a student, a Cape Town professor moves to the Eastern Cape, where he gets caught up in a mess of post-apartheid politics.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring outstanding performances from John Malkovich and newcomer Jessica Haines, Disgrace is a disturbing, powerful drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Overburdened and stuck in a greying marriage, Giovanna takes to caring for the Jewish Holocaust survivor her husband brings home. As she begins to reflect on her life, she turns to the man who lives across from her ...
A variety of losers in Dublin have harrowingly farcical intersecting stories of love, greed and violence.
filmInfoContainer4: An edgy and energetic ensemble story.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman tries to extort money, using a young boy as bait.
filmInfoContainer4: Tilda Swinton delivers a powerful performance in Julia, a tense thriller and a dark character study.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman searching for the perfect man instead discovers the perfect woman.
filmInfoContainer4: A trite but refreshing and comical spin on nature of love.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary that reveals how the unlikely partnership between aspiring filmmakers Christopher Stamp and Kit Lambert produced one of the greatest rock bands in history: The Who.
filmInfoContainer4: A sharp accounting of an era framed through the early adventures of the Who and the managers who helped make them famous, Lambert & Stamp should prove fascinating for fans and novices alike.

filmInfoContainer3: A listless and alienated teenager decides to help his new friend win the class presidency in their small western high school, while he must deal with his bizarre family life back home.
filmInfoContainer4: A charming, quirky, and often funny comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Norman Oppenheimer is a small time operator who befriends a young politician at a low point in his life. Three years later, when the politician becomes an influential world leader, Norman's life dramatically changes for better and worse.
filmInfoContainer4: Norman's elegantly told story is brought brilliantly to life by a quietly powerful performance from Richard Gere.

filmInfoContainer3: When it becomes clear that his solo album is a failure, a former boy band member does everything in his power to maintain his celebrity status.
filmInfoContainer4: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping updates the rock mockumentary for the 21st century mainstream -- and hits many of its low-hanging targets with side-splitting impact.

filmInfoContainer3: When the kinetic Rory moves into his room in the Carrigmore Residential Home for the Disabled, his effect on the home is immediate. Most telling is his friendship with Michael, a young man with cerebral palsy and nearly unintelligible speech. Somehow, Rory understands Michael, and encourages him to experience life outside the confines of home.
filmInfoContainer4: The dramatic aspects of Rory O'Shea Was Here veer into mawkish, formulaic sentiment, which undercuts the characters' individuality.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of Michael Oher, a homeless and traumatized boy who became an All American football player and first round NFL draft pick with the help of a caring woman and her family.
filmInfoContainer4: It might strike some viewers as a little too pat, but The Blind Side has the benefit of strong source material and a strong performance from Sandra Bullock.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the late '60s and early '70s rock band The Doors, including rare exclusive footage.
filmInfoContainer4: It's far from a critical assessment of the band's music or its legacy, but When You're Strange gives fans a beautifully filmed, lovingly assembled tribute to the Doors.

filmInfoContainer3: On a rainy London night in 1946, novelist Maurice Bendrix has a chance meeting with Henry Miles, husband of his ex-mistress Sarah, who abruptly ended their affair two years before. ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Neil Jordan has good direction with solid performances from Ralph Fiennes and Julianne Moore.

filmInfoContainer: The Galapagos Affair: Satan Came to Eden
filmInfoContainer3: About a series of unsolved disappearances on the Galapagos Island of Floreana in the 1930s.
filmInfoContainer4: It doesn't quite live up to its marvelously lurid premise, but The Galapagos Affair is still stranger than fiction in a very entertaining way.

filmInfoContainer3: An unruly class of gifted and charming teenage boys are taught by two eccentric and innovative teachers, as their headmaster pushes for them all to get accepted into Oxford or Cambridge.
filmInfoContainer4: While not quite having the impact of its original stage version, The History Boys nevertheless is a witty and involving school drama.

filmInfoContainer3: In the midst of the Gulf War, soldiers are kidnapped and brainwashed for sinister purposes.
filmInfoContainer4: While not the classic its predecessor is, this update is well-acted and conjures a chilling resonance.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman has a passionate affair with a man half her age, who is also sleeping with her daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: Reid gives a fearless, realistic performance in depicting an older woman's sexual blossoming.

filmInfoContainer3: Post-WWII Germany: Nearly a decade after his affair with an older woman came to a mysterious end, law student Michael Berg re-encounters his former lover as she defends herself in a war-crime trial.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite Kate Winslet's superb portrayal, The Reader suggests an emotionally distant, Oscar-baiting historical drama.

filmInfoContainer3: An introspective dentist's suspicions about his wife's infidelity stresses his mental well being and family life to the breaking point.
filmInfoContainer4: A witty and honest look at marriage in decay.

filmInfoContainer3: A sound engineer's work for an Italian horror studio becomes a terrifying case of life imitating art.
filmInfoContainer4: Its reach may exceed its grasp, but with Berberian Sound Studio, director Peter Strickland assembles a suitably twisted, creepy tribute to the Italian Giallo horror movies of the '70s that benefits from a strong central performance by Toby Jones.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of friends venture deep into the streets of New York on a rescue mission during a rampaging monster attack.
filmInfoContainer4: A sort of Blair Witch Project crossed with Godzilla, Cloverfield is economically paced, stylistically clever, and filled with scares.

filmInfoContainer3: Controversy surrounds high school basketball coach Ken Carter after he benches his entire team for breaking their academic contract with him.
filmInfoContainer4: Even though it's based on a true story, Coach Carter is pretty formulaic stuff, but it's effective and energetic, thanks to a strong central performance from Samuel L. Jackson.

filmInfoContainer3: A series of vignettes that all have coffee and cigarettes in common.
filmInfoContainer4: Episodes vary in quality, but overall this talky film is quirkily engaging.

filmInfoContainer3: A normal Friday service at a fast food restaurant becomes interrupted by a police officer who claims an employee stole from a customer, but something more sinister is going on.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored by smart, sensitive direction and strong performances, Complicance is a ripped-from-the-headlines thriller that's equal parts gripping and disturbing.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of the genocide in Sudan's western region of Darfur.
filmInfoContainer4: Although Darfur Now is not always engaging as cinema, the film succeeds in bringing attention to the crisis in Darfur.

filmInfoContainer3: James Cameron and Bill Paxton, director and actor of the 1997 film Titanic, travel to the final undersea resting place of the ill-fated ship of dreams.
filmInfoContainer4: The underwater footage is both beautiful and awe-inspiring.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Music, Musical, Romance
filmInfoContainer3: Into the world of the Emperor Penguins, who find their soul mates through song, a penguin is born who cannot sing. But he can tap dance something fierce!
filmInfoContainer4: Visually dazzling, with a thoughtful storyline and catchy musical numbers, Happy Feet marks a successful animated debut from the makers of Babe.

filmInfoContainer3: A young FBI agent, eager to prove himself in the field, goes undercover as a white supremacist.
filmInfoContainer4: The unsettling Imperium boasts troublingly timely themes and a talented cast led by Daniel Radcliffe as an undercover FBI agent infiltrating a ring of white supremacists.

filmInfoContainer3: While researching his novel "In Cold Blood", Truman Capote develops a close relationship with convicted murderers Dick Hickock and Perry Smith.
filmInfoContainer4: Though comparisons with last year's Capote may be inevitable, Infamous takes a different angle in its depiction of the author, and stands up well enough on its own.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1970, drug-fueled Los Angeles private investigator Larry "Doc" Sportello investigates the disappearance of a former girlfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: Inherent Vice may prove frustrating for viewers who demand absolute coherence, but it does justice to its acclaimed source material -- and should satisfy fans of director P.T. Anderson.

filmInfoContainer3: A British couple return to Paris many years after their honeymoon there in an attempt to rejuvenate their marriage.
filmInfoContainer4: Topped with bittersweet humor but possessing surprisingly thorny depths, Le Week-End offers a sophisticated, well-acted portrait of late-life struggles and long-term marriage.

filmInfoContainer3: Imprisoned for debt, playwright Molière is rescued by an aristocrat who needs his help in order to seduce a young marquise.
filmInfoContainer4: Moliere is a sophisticated, witty biopic of the great satirist.

filmInfoContainer3: A self-diagnosed nymphomaniac recounts her erotic experiences to the man who saved her after a beating.
filmInfoContainer4: Darkly funny, fearlessly bold, and thoroughly indulgent, Nymphomaniac finds Lars von Trier provoking viewers with customary abandon.

filmInfoContainer3: An American sets out with his motorbike to find both adventure and his sense of manhood, leading him on an extraordinary journey he could not have imagined, including fighting in the Libyan Revolution.
filmInfoContainer4: Thrilling and thought-provoking, Point and Shoot captures one man's fascinating -- if troublingly narcissistic -- "crash course in manhood."

filmInfoContainer3: A man joins the political campaign of a smooth-operator candidate for president of the USA.
filmInfoContainer4: Well acted and suprisingly funny.

filmInfoContainer3: A Chinese man travels to the Wild West to rescue a kidnapped Princess. After teaming up with a train robber, the unlikely duo takes on a Chinese traitor and his corrupt boss.
filmInfoContainer4: Although the plot is really nothing to brag about, Jackie Chan and Owen Wilson work well together. The cinematography looks great, and Jackie delivers a hilarious performance. This is an old-fashioned crowd-pleaser.

filmInfoContainer3: After Peter Parker is bitten by a genetically altered spider, he gains newfound, spider-like powers and ventures out to solve the mystery of his parent's mysterious death.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-chosen cast and sure-handed direction allow The Amazing Spider-Man to thrill, despite revisiting many of the same plot points from 2002's Spider-Man.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary following American women (some of whom emigrated from Afghanistan in the early 1980s) who return to the capital city of Kabul to open an American-style school for beauticians....
filmInfoContainer4: There's nothing frivolous about beauty school when hearing about the individual lives of these women in Afghanistan, and the contrast between them and the idealistic beauticians from America.

filmInfoContainer: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
filmInfoContainer3: Four kids travel through a wardrobe to the land of Narnia and learn of their destiny to free it with the guidance of a mystical lion.
filmInfoContainer4: With first-rate special effects and compelling storytelling, this adaptation stays faithful to its source material and will please moviegoers of all ages.

filmInfoContainer3: A rich man's daughter is held captive in an abandoned apartment by two former convicts who abducted her and hold her ransom in exchange for her father's money.

A clerk in a government agency finds his unenviable life takes a turn for the horrific with the arrival of a new co-worker who is both his exact physical double and his opposite - confident, charismatic and seductive with women.
