filmInfoContainer4: Hauntingly bleak and thrillingly ambitious, The Double offers Jesse Eisenberg a pair of compelling roles while reaffirming writer-director Richard Ayoade's remarkable talent.

filmInfoContainer3: A young American studying in Paris in 1968 strikes up a friendship with a French brother and sister. Set against the background of the '68 Paris student riots.
filmInfoContainer4: Though lushly atmospheric, The Dreamers doesn't engage or provoke as much as it should.

filmInfoContainer3: Follows the creation of The Metropolitan Museum of Art's most attended fashion exhibition in history, "China: Through The Looking Glass," an exploration of Chinese-inspired Western fashions by Costume Institute curator Andrew Bolton.
filmInfoContainer4: First Monday in May may not resonate far beyond its target demographic, but for fashion aficionados, it should prove utterly absorbing.

filmInfoContainer3: A detective hunts for the marksman who foiled the plan to catch a notorious team of bank robbers.
filmInfoContainer4: The Lookout is a genuinely suspenseful and affecting noir due to the great ensemble cast and their complex, realistic characters.

filmInfoContainer2: Action, Adventure, Comedy, Romance, Thriller, Western
filmInfoContainer3: A young thief, seeking revenge for the death of his brother, is trained by the once great, but aged Zorro, who also pursues vengeance of his own.
filmInfoContainer4: Banderas returns as an aging Zorro in this surprisingly nimble, entertaining swashbuckler.

filmInfoContainer3: Janet hosts a party to celebrate her new promotion, but once the guests arrive it becomes clear that not everything is going to go down as smoothly as the red wine.
filmInfoContainer4: Old-fashioned charm meets sharp wit and modern social satire in The Party, a biting comedy carried by a shining performance from Patricia Clarkson.

filmInfoContainer3: King Leonidas of Sparta and a force of 300 men fight the Persians at Thermopylae in 480 B.C.
filmInfoContainer4: A simple-minded but visually exciting experience, full of blood, violence, and ready-made movie quotes.

filmInfoContainer3: The tale of an outlaw who escapes from prison and sets out across the Texas hills to reunite with his wife and the daughter he has never met.
filmInfoContainer4: While conventional in plot, Ain't Them Bodies Saints is a visually poetic film that pays homage to the New Hollywood directors of the 1970s and promises big things from director David Lowery.

filmInfoContainer3: In the prehistoric past, a young man struggles to return home after being separated from his tribe during a buffalo hunt. He finds a similarly lost wolf companion and starts a friendship that would change humanity.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-acted and beautifully filmed, Alpha offers a canine-assisted epic adventure that blends rousing action with an extra helping of canine charm.

filmInfoContainer3: An ex-con reunites with his estranged wayward 17-year old daughter to protect her from drug dealers who are trying to kill her.
filmInfoContainer4: Blood Father meets every expectation a film fan could have for a latter-day Mel Gibson action thriller with its title -- and even, in some respects, handily exceeds them.

filmInfoContainer3: In 18th century France, the Chevalier de Fronsac and his native American friend Mani are sent by the King to the Gevaudan province to investigate the killings of hundreds by a mysterious beast.
filmInfoContainer4: Brotherhood of the Wolf mixes its genres with little logic, but the end result is wildly entertaining.

filmInfoContainer3: A disk containing mysterious information from a CIA agent ends up in the hands of two unscrupulous and daft gym employees who attempt to sell it.
filmInfoContainer4: With Burn After Reading, the Coen Brothers have crafted another clever comedy/thriller with an outlandish plot and memorable characters.

filmInfoContainer3: The friendship of two men becomes tested when they both fall for the same woman.
filmInfoContainer4: While it's better than Pearl Harbor, Dark Blue World still spends too much time on a trite love triangle.

filmInfoContainer3: In an Earthly world resembling the 1950s, a cloud of space radiation has shrouded the planet, resulting in the dead becoming zombies that desire live human flesh. A company called Zomcon ...
filmInfoContainer4: Making the most of its thin premise, Fido is an occasionally touching satire that provides big laughs and enough blood and guts to please gorehounds.

filmInfoContainer: Film Stars Don't Die in Liverpool
filmInfoContainer3: A romance sparks between a young actor and a Hollywood leading lady.
filmInfoContainer4: Film Stars Don't Die in Liverpool showcases brilliant work from Annette Bening, whose performance is more than enough to outweigh this biopic's basic narrative.

filmInfoContainer3: A young peasant maid working in the house of painter Johannes Vermeer becomes his talented assistant and the model for one of his most famous works.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually arresting, but the story could be told with a bit more energy.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenage girl raids a man's home in order to expose him under suspicion that he is a pedophile.
filmInfoContainer4: Disturbing, controversial, but entirely engrossing, Hard Candy is well written with strong lead performances, especially that of newcomer Ellen Page. A movie that stays with the viewer long after leaving the theater.

filmInfoContainer3: An examination of the infamous pornographic film Deep Throat (1972), covering aspects from the film's creation to its cultural impact.
filmInfoContainer4: A documentary on the film that brought smut mainstream, Inside Deep Throat is gaining praise as an entertaining look at a pop culture milestone. However, some critics say the film could have gone a little deeper into the people involved.

filmInfoContainer3: Chris Pontius, Johnny Knoxville, Steve-O, Bam Margera, and the whole crew return to the screen to raise the stakes higher than ever before.
filmInfoContainer4: Better than any sequel to a movie of a television show has a right to be, Jackass: Number Two dares you not to laugh.

filmInfoContainer3: Anger rages in Philip as he awaits the publication of his second novel. He feels pushed out of his adopted home city by the constant crowds and noise, a deteriorating relationship with his ...
filmInfoContainer4: As thought-provoking as it is uncompromising, Listen Up Philip finds writer-director Alex Ross Perry taking a creative step forward while hearkening back to classic neurotic comedies of '70s cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: The supervillain Megamind finally defeats his nemesis, the superhero Metro Man. But without a hero, he loses all purpose and must find new meaning to his life.
filmInfoContainer4: It regurgitates plot points from earlier animated efforts, and isn't quite as funny as it should be, but a top-shelf voice cast and strong visuals help make Megamind a pleasant, if unspectacular, diversion.

filmInfoContainer3: Laura Henderson buys an old London theater and opens it up as the Windmill, a performance hall which goes down in history for, among other things, its all-nude revues.
filmInfoContainer4: Judi Dench and Bob Hoskins shine in this warm, witty period piece.

filmInfoContainer3: A mentally unstable photo developer targets a middle-class family after his obsession with them becomes more sick and disturbing than any of them could imagine.
filmInfoContainer4: Robin Williams is very effective in this creepy, well-shot thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: With the aid of a fellow Auschwitz survivor and a hand-written letter, an elderly man with dementia goes in search of the person he believes to be responsible for the death of his family in the death camp to kill him himself.
filmInfoContainer4: Remember risks wandering into exploitative territory, but it's bolstered by some of Egoyan's best latter-day directing and a typically stellar performance from Christopher Plummer.

filmInfoContainer3: Wild behavior forces a pair of energy drink reps to enroll in a Big Brother program.
filmInfoContainer4: Role Models is a frequently crude, always funny comedy with the cast providing solid work throughout.

filmInfoContainer3: A female theatre dresser creates a stir and sparks a revolution in seventeenth century London theatre by playing Desdemona in Othello. But what will become of the male actor she once worked for and eventually replaced?
Thirty years ago, Andrei Simoniovich Filipov, the renowned conductor of the Bolshoi orchestra, was fired for hiring Jewish musicians. Now a mere cleaning man at the Bolshoi, he learns by ...
Senator Laine Hanson is a contender for U.S. Vice President, but information and disinformation about her past surfaces that threatens to derail her confirmation.
filmInfoContainer4: The Contender wears its political heart on its sleeve, but strong performances and a solid screenplay help the end result add up to a gripping drama from either side of the aisle.

filmInfoContainer3: A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer.
filmInfoContainer4: The Danish Girl serves as another showcase for Eddie Redmayne's talent -- and poignantly explores thought-provoking themes with a beautifully filmed biopic drama.

filmInfoContainer3: In what would cause a fantastic media frenzy, Clifford Irving sells his bogus biography of Howard Hughes to a premiere publishing house in the early 1970s.
filmInfoContainer4: The Hoax is an enormously appealing film, thanks to the uniformly excellent performances and Lasse Hallström's zippy direction.

filmInfoContainer3: Secrets, rumors and betrayals surround the upcoming marriage between a young dissolute man and virtuous woman of the French aristocracy.
filmInfoContainer4: More complicated than your average bodice ripper, Catherine Breillat's Last Mistress features beautiful costumes, wrought romances, and a feral performance from Argento.

filmInfoContainer3: Josh Sagers drives cross-country on a mission to deliver his father's birthday gift - a giant purple LazyBoy.
filmInfoContainer4: First-timer Duplass offers a realistic and thoughtful romantic comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Friends since childhood, a magazine editor and a hip-hop record executive stumble into romantic territory.
filmInfoContainer4: Though predictable and possibly too sweet, Brown Sugar is charming, well-acted, and smarter than typical rom-com fare.

filmInfoContainer3: A romantic drama about a brief, unexpected love affair that catches two people completely off-guard.
filmInfoContainer4: Though potentially too slowly paced for some, Cairo Time lingers long after the closing credits, largely due to a wonderful performance by Patricia Clarkson.

filmInfoContainer3: A 3-months-old chimpanzee is separated from his troop and is then adopted by a fully-grown male.
filmInfoContainer4: Chimpanzee often anthropomorphizes its subjects, but it's a beautifully filmed, remarkably intimate look at the lives of a family of primates.

filmInfoContainer3: A 40-year-old father's life is complicated when the mother of his two children moves to New York. Since he can't bear them growing up far away from him, he decides to move there as well.
filmInfoContainer4: Pleasantly easygoing and consistently funny, Chinese Puzzle offers a suitably endearing conclusion to Cédric Klapisch's Trilogy of Xavier.

filmInfoContainer3: A 1980s-set story centered around a man vs. machine chess tournament.
filmInfoContainer4: With its delightfully retro production design, Computer Chess is an inventive, intelligent, and humorous comedy that celebrates the eccentricity and uniqueness of its subject.

filmInfoContainer3: A suspense thriller about a reporter from Miami who travels to Ecuador in pursuit of a serial killer known as the "Monster of Babahoyo."
filmInfoContainer4: An unsettling and absorbing cautionary tale with John Leguizamo playing an unscrupulous TV reporter who uses the medium to further his own goals.

filmInfoContainer3: CIA operative Valerie Plame discovers her identity is allegedly leaked by the government as payback for an op-ed article her husband wrote criticizing the Bush administration.
filmInfoContainer4: It struggles with the balance between fact-based biopic and taut political thriller, but Fair Game brims with righteous anger -- and benefits from superb performances by Naomi Watts and Sean Penn.

filmInfoContainer3: In order to prove his fatherhood potential to his pregnant girlfriend, Frank 'kidnaps' her 12-year-old nephew and tags along on his best friend Casper's debauched weekend canoe trip.
The autobiographical story of Howard Stern, the radio rebel who is now also a TV personality, an author and a movie star.
filmInfoContainer4: A surprisingly endearing biopic about the controversial shock-jock Howard Stern that is equally funny and raunchy.

filmInfoContainer3: Bill Maher's take on the current state of world religion.
filmInfoContainer4: Religulous is funny and offensive in equal measure, and aims less to change hearts and minds than to inspire conversation.

filmInfoContainer3: A juror on the inside and a woman on the outside manipulate a court trial involving a major gun manufacturer.
filmInfoContainer4: An implausible but entertaining legal thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: Saint Ralph is the unlikely story of Ralph Walker, a ninth grader who outran everyone's expectations except his own in his bold quest of trying to win the 1954 Boston Marathon.
filmInfoContainer4: Saint Ralph is an amiable tear-jerker that walks a fine line between being inspirational and being hokum.

filmInfoContainer3: An inspirational tale about the relationship between two Sioux Indian brothers living on the Pine Ridge Indian reservation.
filmInfoContainer4: Though at times melodramatic, Skins' harsh depiction of life on the reservation is an eye-opener.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1912 London, a young working mother is galvanized into radical political activism supporting the right for women to vote, and is willing to meet violence with violence to achieve this end.
filmInfoContainer4: Suffragette dramatizes an important -- and still painfully relevant -- fact-based story with more than enough craft and sincerity to overcome its flaws.

filmInfoContainer3: The wife of a British Judge is caught in a self-destructive love affair with a Royal Air Force pilot.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring an outstanding performance by Rachel Weisz, The Deep Blue Sea is a visually stunning, melancholy tale of subsumed passion.

filmInfoContainer: The Girl Who Played with Fire
filmInfoContainer3: As computer hacker Lisbeth and journalist Mikael investigate a sex-trafficking ring, Lisbeth is accused of three murders, causing her to go on the run while Mikael works to clear her name.
filmInfoContainer4: Noomi Rapace and Michael Nyqvist remain extraordinarily well-suited to their roles, but the second installment in Stieg Larsson's Millennium Trilogy doesn't pack quite as much punch as the first.

filmInfoContainer3: The story follows Jack, a highly intelligent serial killer, over the course of twelve years, and depicts the murders that really develop his inner madman.
filmInfoContainer4: The House That Jack Built presents writer-director Lars von Trier at his most proudly uncompromising: hard to ignore, and for many viewers, just as difficult to digest.

filmInfoContainer3: The Kadam family leaves India for France where they open a restaurant directly across the road from Madame Mallory's Michelin-starred eatery.
filmInfoContainer4: Director Lasse Hallström does lovely work and Helen Mirren is always worth watching, but The Hundred-Foot Journey travels predictable ground already covered by countless feel-good dramedies.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman with a body writing fetish seeks to find a combined lover and calligrapher.
filmInfoContainer4: The Pillow Book is undeniably sensual and visually ravishing, but the film's narrative lacks the hypnotic pull of its imagery.

filmInfoContainer3: Bertrand Tavernier is in top form with this gripping, superbly mounted drama set against the savage Catholic/Protestant wars that ripped France apart in the 16th century. Based on a novella...
After a highly unusual zombie saves a still-living girl from an attack, the two form a relationship that sets in motion events that might transform the entire lifeless world.
filmInfoContainer4: Warm Bodies offers a sweet, well-acted spin on a genre that all too often lives down to its brain-dead protagonists.

filmInfoContainer3: Tells the story of Whitney Houston's extraordinary life and tragic death.
filmInfoContainer4: Whitney: Can I Be Me offers a sobering inside look at the tragic downfall of a brilliant performer, even as it leaves the audience yearning for deeper insight.

filmInfoContainer3: Framed for murder, heavyweight boxer Terry Williams is sent to prison, but is released after a few years on good behavior. He becomes a championship contender and then, on the eve of the ...
Under attack by Indians, passengers on a stagecoach reveal their true nature as the pressure mounts.
filmInfoContainer4: Ricky Gervais' consistently sharp performance and beautifully dry execution transform this otherwise mainstream comedy into an endearing, funny, and altogether snappy romantic comedy. With ghosts.

filmInfoContainer3: Eleven articulate people work through affairs of the heart in L.A.
filmInfoContainer4: It's overly talky, but Playing By Heart benefits from witty insights into modern relationships and strong performances from an esteemed cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A highly advanced robotic boy longs to become "real" so that he can regain the love of his human mother.
filmInfoContainer4: A curious, not always seamless, amalgamation of Kubrick's chilly bleakness and Spielberg's warm-hearted optimism, A.I. is, in a word, fascinating.

filmInfoContainer3: A college dropout, attempting to win back his father's high standards he gets a job as a broker for a suburban investment firm, which puts him on the fast track to success, but the job might not be as legitimate as it once appeared to be.
filmInfoContainer4: Its ending is disappointingly tidy, but Boiler Room boasts just enough sharp writing and brisk pacing to make getting there worthwhile.

filmInfoContainer3: When Colin Warner is wrongfully convicted of murder, his best friend Carl King devotes his life to proving Colin's innocence.
filmInfoContainer4: Crown Heights' heartbreaking fact-based narrative -- and LaKeith Stanfield's remarkable starring performance -- push this powerful drama past its structural flaws.

filmInfoContainer3: An aging rock star decides to change his life when he discovers a 40-year-old letter written to him by John Lennon.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to Al Pacino's stirring central performance - and excellent work from an esteemed supporting cast -- Danny Collins manages to overcome its more predictable and heavy-handed moments to deliver a heartfelt tale of redemption.

filmInfoContainer3: Martin McGartland joins the I.R.A. and feeds information to Britain's Special Branch Agent Fergus.
filmInfoContainer4: Though somewhat uneven in places, Fifty Dead Men Walking is a gripping portrayal of Ireland's violent history, carried by the strong performances of its lead actors.

filmInfoContainer3: A career criminal nabbed by Mexican authorities is placed in a tough prison where he learns to survive with the help of a young boy.
When a band of brutal gangsters led by a crooked property developer make a play to take over a local school, Master Ip is forced to take a stand.
filmInfoContainer4: Ip Man 3 isn't the most tightly plotted biopic a kung fu fan could ask for, but the fight scenes are fun to watch -- and at times, the drama is even genuinely poignant.

filmInfoContainer3: Against the background of an Australian desert, Sandy, a geologist, and Hiromitsu, a Japanese businessman, play out a story of human inconsequence in the face of the blistering universe. ...
filmInfoContainer4: An emotional film where Toni Collette gets to show her impressive range.

filmInfoContainer3: Three young people on a road trip from Colorado to New Jersey talk to a trucker on their CB radio, then must escape when he turns out to be a psychotic killer.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-constructed B-movie thriller, Joy Ride keeps up the necessary level of tension and chills. Critics also liked Zahn's performance as the goofball older brother.

filmInfoContainer3: Louis Theroux documents his investigation into what goes on behind the scenes of the infamous Church of Scientology.
filmInfoContainer4: My Scientology Movie offers a personal perspective on the controversial religion whose lack of investigative depth is more than balanced out by its sense of humor and all-around entertainment value.

filmInfoContainer3: A small-town English widow, facing financial troubles after her husband's suicide, turns to agriculture of an illegal kind.
filmInfoContainer4: The plot and basis for jokes are slight, but Saving Grace is indeed saved by some charming performances, most notably Brenda Blethyn's.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of martial-arts master Ip Man, the man who trained Bruce Lee.
filmInfoContainer4: Though its storytelling is a tad muddled, Wong Kar Wai's The Grandmaster still exhibits the auteur's stylistic flourishes in gorgeous cinematography and explosive action set pieces.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman makes a surprising discovery about the husband of her late best friend.
filmInfoContainer4: While flirting with camp, François Ozon's The New Girlfriend offers thoughtful -- and humorous -- commentary on sexual and gender identity.

filmInfoContainer3: A retiring police chief pledges to catch the killer of a young child.
filmInfoContainer4: Though its subject matter is grim and may make viewers queasy, The Pledge features an excellent, subtle performance by Jack Nicholson.

filmInfoContainer3: A female assassin leaves a trail of bodies behind her as she seeks revenge.
filmInfoContainer4: The Villainess offers enough pure kinetic thrills to satisfy genre enthusiasts -- and carve out a bloody niche for itself in modern Korean action cinema.

filmInfoContainer3: Black and white basketball hustlers join forces to double their chances of winning money on the street courts and in a basketball tournament.
filmInfoContainer4: White Men Can't Jump provides a fresh take on the sports comedy genre, with a clever script and a charismatic trio of leads.

filmInfoContainer3: Billy Zane leads a pack of money-grabbing relatives who try to take over his ailing uncle's industrial empire.
filmInfoContainer4: A charming children fable even adults can enjoy.

filmInfoContainer3: When a desperate movie producer fails to get a major star for his bargain basement film, he decides to shoot the film secretly around him.
filmInfoContainer4: A witty commentary on modern film-making, with enough jokes to keep it entertaining throughout.

filmInfoContainer3: Two pairs of parents hold a cordial meeting after their sons are involved in a fight, though as their time together progresses, increasingly childish behavior throws the discussion into chaos.
filmInfoContainer4: It isn't as compelling on the screen as it was on the stage, but Carnage makes up for its flaws with Polanski's smooth direction and assured performances from Winslet and Foster.

filmInfoContainer3: The Sheriff of a suburban New Jersey community, populated by New York City police officers, slowly discovers the town is a front for mob connections and corruption.
A look inside Paris' Crazy Horse, a club that boasts the greatest and most chic nude dancing in the world.
John McClane attempts to avert disaster as rogue military operatives seize control of Dulles International Airport in Washington, D.C.
filmInfoContainer4: It lacks the fresh thrills of its predecessor, but Die Hard 2 still works as an over-the-top -- and reasonably taut -- big-budget sequel, with plenty of set pieces to paper over the plot deficiencies.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the platonic relationship between Marie Antoinette and one of her female readers during the first days of the French Revolution.
filmInfoContainer4: Farewell, My Queen transcends its gaudy period trappings to offer an affecting historical drama built on timeless - and timely - themes.

filmInfoContainer3: Chronicles the rise and fall of a prominent, and particularly ruthless English gangster.
filmInfoContainer4: Gangster No. 1 is brutally violent, yet also compelling.

filmInfoContainer3: After a young man is murdered, his spirit stays behind to warn his lover of impending danger, with the help of a reluctant psychic.
filmInfoContainer4: Ghost offers viewers a poignant romance while blending elements of comedy, horror, and mystery, all adding up to one of the more enduringly watchable hits of its era.

filmInfoContainer3: Bertram Pincus is a man whose people skills leave much to be desired. When Pincus dies unexpectedly, but is miraculously revived after seven minutes, he wakes up to discover that he now has the annoying ability to see ghosts.
filmInfoContainer4: Ricky Gervais' consistently sharp performance and beautifully dry execution transform this otherwise mainstream comedy into an endearing, funny, and altogether snappy romantic comedy. With ghosts.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the events leading up to the Taliban's attack on Pakistani schoolgirl, Malala Yousafzai, for speaking out on girls' education followed by the aftermath, including her speech to the United Nations.
filmInfoContainer4: He Named Me Malala spotlights a worthy subject, but without the focus her story deserves.

filmInfoContainer3: With the help of a mysterious pill that enables the user to access one hundred percent of his brain abilities, a struggling writer becomes a financial wizard, but it also puts him in a new world with lots of dangers.
filmInfoContainer4: Although its script is uneven, Neil Burger directs Limitless with plenty of visual panache, and Bradley Cooper makes for a charismatic star.

filmInfoContainer3: IMF Agent Ethan Hunt comes into conflict with a dangerous and sadistic arms dealer who threatens his life and his fiancee in response.
filmInfoContainer4: Fast-paced, with eye-popping stunts and special effects, the latest Mission: Impossible installment delivers everything an action fan could ask for. A thrilling summer popcorn flick.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Jeffrey Dahmer struggles to belong in high school.
filmInfoContainer4: My Friend Dahmer opens a window into the making of a serial killer whose conclusions are as empathetic as they are deeply troubling.

filmInfoContainer3: A process server and his marijuana dealer wind up on the run from hitmen and a corrupt police officer after he witnesses his dealer's boss murder a competitor while trying to serve papers on him.
filmInfoContainer4: Both funny and scatter shot, this loose-knit action/buddy/stoner comedy bridges genres and keeps a steady tempo of low ball laughs.

filmInfoContainer3: A radio host interprets the possible outbreak of a deadly virus which infects the small Ontario town he is stationed in.
filmInfoContainer4: Witty and restrained but still taut and funny, this Pontypool is a different breed of low-budget zombie film.

filmInfoContainer3: 1958. Rose is a terrible secretary but a demon typist. Her handsome boss resolves to turn her into the fastest girl in the world.
filmInfoContainer4: The cheerfully frothy Populaire may lack substance, but its visual appeal -- and director Roinsard's confident evocation of 1950s filmmaking tropes -- help carry the day.

filmInfoContainer3: Shakespeare's famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue.
filmInfoContainer4: Baz Luhrmann's visual aesthetic is as divisive as it is fresh and inventive.

filmInfoContainer3: Two documentary filmmakers attempt to penetrate a cult who worships a woman who claims to be from the future.

Bennie travels to Buenos Aires to find his long-missing older brother, a once-promising writer who is now a remnant of his former self. Bennie's discovery of his brother's near-finished play might hold the answer to understanding their shared past and renewing their bond.
filmInfoContainer4: A complex meditation on family dynamics, Tetro's arresting visuals and emotional core compensate for its uneven narrative.

filmInfoContainer3: A police detective in a South American country is dedicated to hunting down a revolutionary guerilla leader.
filmInfoContainer4: The Dancer Upstairs benefits from a talented cast and alluring intelligence, although pacing problems prevent this John Malkovich-directed mystery from reaching its full potential.

filmInfoContainer3: Following the events of The Matrix (1999), Neo and the rebel leaders estimate they have 72 hours until 250,000 probes discover Zion and destroy it and its inhabitants. Neo must decide how he can save Trinity from a dark fate in his dreams.
filmInfoContainer4: Though its heady themes are a departure from its predecessor, The Matrix Reloaded is a worthy sequel packed with popcorn-friendly thrills.

filmInfoContainer3: In 16th century Venice, when a merchant must default on a large loan from an abused Jewish moneylender for a friend with romantic ambitions, the bitterly vengeful creditor demands a gruesome payment instead.
filmInfoContainer4: A respectable if uneven take on the Bard's The Merchant of Venice.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in China in the 1860's during the Taiping Rebellion, the story is based on the assassination of Ma Xinyi in 1870. Loyalist General Qingyun is the only survivor of a battle with ...
filmInfoContainer4: Slightly stodgy historical Chinese epic with impressive battles.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama based on the experiences of Kathryn Bolkovac, a Nebraska cop who served as a peacekeeper in post-war Bosnia and outed the U.N. for covering up a sex trafficking scandal.
filmInfoContainer4: Rachel Weisz puts on a compelling smoldering act though the film suffers from a literal-minded approach to the material.

filmInfoContainer3: The powerful, but arrogant god Thor, is cast out of Asgard to live amongst humans in Midgard (Earth), where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.
filmInfoContainer4: A dazzling blockbuster that tempers its sweeping scope with wit, humor, and human drama, Thor is mighty Marvel entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: A Disney animated version of "Treasure Island". The only difference is that the film is set in outer space with alien worlds and other galactic wonders.
filmInfoContainer4: Though its characterizations are weaker than usual, Treasure Planet offers a fast-paced, beautifully rendered vision of outer space.

filmInfoContainer3: John Beckwith and Jeremy Grey, a pair of committed womanizers who sneak into weddings to take advantage of the romantic tinge in the air, find themselves at odds with one another when John meets and falls for Claire Cleary.
filmInfoContainer4: Wedding Crashers is both raunchy and sweet, and features top-notch comic performances from Vince Vaughn and Owen Wilson.

filmInfoContainer3: As their surrounding community has taken a turn for the worse, the crew at Calvin's Barbershop come together to bring some much needed change to their neighborhood.
filmInfoContainer4: Heartfelt, thought-provoking, and above all funny, Barbershop: The Next Cut is the rare belated sequel that more than lives up to the standard set by its predecessors.

filmInfoContainer3: A wealthy Iranian family struggles to contain a teenager's growing sexual rebellion and her brother's dangerous obsession.
filmInfoContainer4: A thought-provoking, insightful look into Iranian youth culture.

filmInfoContainer3: A man seeks out his exact look-alike after spotting him in a movie.
filmInfoContainer4: Thanks to a strong performance from Jake Gyllenhaal and smart direction from Denis Villeneuve, Enemy hits the mark as a tense, uncommonly adventurous thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: Hallam's talent for spying on people reveals his darkest fears-and his most peculiar desires. Driven to expose the true cause of his mother's death, he instead finds himself searching the rooftops of the city for love.
filmInfoContainer4: Carefully balanced between the dark and the dreamy, Mister Foe is a charged coming-of-age story with whimsy and bite.

filmInfoContainer3: Stranded at a desolate Nevada motel during a nasty rain-storm, ten strangers become acquainted with each other when they realize that they're being killed off one by one.
filmInfoContainer4: Identity is a film that will divide audiences -- the twists of its plot will either impress or exasperate you.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the story of Vince Papale, a 30-year-old bartender from South Philadelphia who overcame long odds to play for the NFL's Philadelphia Eagles in 1976.
filmInfoContainer4: As simple and authentic as the gritty South Philly invirons in which it's set in, Invincible sends a uplifting and heartfelt message packed with an athletic enthusiasm that shouldn't be missed.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the true story of journalist Gary Webb. The film takes place in the mid-1990s, when Webb uncovered the CIA's past role in importing huge amounts of cocaine into the U.S. that was ...
filmInfoContainer4: Kill the Messenger's potent fury over the tale of its real-life subject overrides its factual inaccuracies and occasional narrative stumbles.

filmInfoContainer3: A case of mistaken identity lands Slevin into the middle of a war being plotted by two of the city's most rival crime bosses: The Rabbi and The Boss. Slevin is under constant surveillance by relentless Detective Brikowski as well as the infamous assassin Goodkat and finds himself having to hatch his own ingenious plot to get them before they get him.
filmInfoContainer4: Trying too hard to be clever in a Pulp Fiction kind of way, this film succumbs to a convoluted plot, overly stylized characters, and dizzying set design.

filmInfoContainer3: A leukemia patient attempts to end a twenty-year feud with her sister to get her bone marrow.
filmInfoContainer4: Marvin's Room rises above the pack of dysfunctional family dramas thanks to an impeccable cast that includes Meryl Streep, Diane Keaton, and Leonardo DiCaprio.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1976, complex political and emotional forces are set in motion when a young man returns to the race-torn Philadelphia neighborhood where he came of age during the Black Power movement.
filmInfoContainer4: A bold, original debut, Night Catches Us personalizes a tumultuous period in American history thanks to strong performances from Anthony Mackie and Kerry Washington.

filmInfoContainer3: Danny Ocean rounds up the boys for a third heist, after casino owner Willy Bank double-crosses one of the original eleven, Reuben Tishkoff.
filmInfoContainer4: Ocean's Thirteen reverts to the formula of the first installment, and the result is another slick and entertaining heist film.

filmInfoContainer3: A personal shopper in Paris refuses to leave the city until she makes contact with her twin brother who previously died there. Her life becomes more complicated when a mysterious person contacts her via text message.
filmInfoContainer4: Personal Shopper attempts a tricky series of potentially jarring tonal shifts with varying results, bolstered by a performance from Kristen Stewart that's impossible to ignore.

filmInfoContainer3: Two groups of people discover evidence that suggests spirits may be trying to invade the human world through the Internet.
filmInfoContainer4: A sinister spine-tingling techno-thriller whose artistry lies in the power of suggestion rather than a barrage of blood and guts or horror shop special effects.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: An outlaw cat, his childhood egg-friend and a seductive thief kitty set out in search for the eggs of the fabled Golden Goose to clear his name, restore his lost honor and regain the trust of his mother and town.
filmInfoContainer4: It isn't deep or groundbreaking, but what it lacks in profundity, Puss in Boots more than makes up for with an abundance of wit, visual sparkle, and effervescent charm.

filmInfoContainer3: At a home for retired musicians, the annual concert to celebrate Verdi's birthday is disrupted by the arrival of Jean, an eternal diva and the former wife of one of the residents.
filmInfoContainer4: It's sweet, gentle, and predictable to a fault, but Dustin Hoffman's affectionate direction and the talented cast's amiable charm make Quartet too difficult to resist.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman is kidnapped by a stranger on a routine flight. Threatened by the potential murder of her father, she is pulled into a plot to assist her captor in offing a politician.
filmInfoContainer4: With solid performances and tight direction from Wes Craven, Red Eye is a brisk, economic thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: Iranian-Canadian journalist Maziar Bahari is detained by Iranian forces who brutally interrogate him under suspicion that he is a spy.
filmInfoContainer4: Timely, solidly acted, and unabashedly earnest, Rosewater serves as an impressive calling card for first-time director Jon Stewart.

filmInfoContainer3: When Gabriel and Emilie meet by chance, he offers her a ride, and they spend the evening talking, laughing and getting along famously. At the end of the night, Emilie declines Gabriel's ...
filmInfoContainer4: Shall We Kiss? combines just enough romance and laughs to make for a charming French take on Woody Allen comedies.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama that interweaves the life of a teenager, with his old baby sitter, her estranged husband, and their daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: With fine acting and considerable emotional depth, Snow Angels aptly captures the highs, and especially the lows of human relationships.

filmInfoContainer: Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine
filmInfoContainer3: A look at the personal and private life of the late Apple CEO, Steve Jobs.
filmInfoContainer4: Steve Jobs: Man in the Machine offers absorbing viewing, even if it doesn't delve deeply into its complex subject.

filmInfoContainer3: A woman and her new husband returns to her hometown roots in coastal northern Florida, and must deal with family, business, and encroaching real estate development.
filmInfoContainer4: Wonderfully acted, but the story and pacing can use a little work.

filmInfoContainer3: When college friends reunite after 15 years over the Christmas holidays, they discover just how easy it is for long-forgotten rivalries and romances to be reignited.
filmInfoContainer4: The Best Man Holiday manages honest laughs out of broad humor, and affects convincing drama from a deeply conventional plot.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1965, three Mossad agents cross into East Berlin to apprehend a notorious Nazi war criminal. Thirty years later, the secrets the agents share come back to haunt them.
filmInfoContainer4: Its time-shifting narrative creates distracting casting problems, but ultimately, The Debt is a smart, well-acted entry in a genre that could use more like it.

filmInfoContainer3: In the 1913 US Open, 20-year-old Francis Ouimet played against his idol, 1900 US Open champion, Englishman Harry Vardon.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite all the underdog sports movie conventions, the likable cast and lush production values make The Greatest Game Ever Played a solid and uplifting tale.

filmInfoContainer3: A Nazi doctor, along with the Sonderkommando, Jews who are forced to work in the crematoria of Auschwitz against their fellow Jews, find themselves in a moral grey zone.
filmInfoContainer4: A grim and devastating tale of the Holocaust.

filmInfoContainer3: A U.S. Customs official uncovers a money laundering scheme involving Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar.
filmInfoContainer4: The Infiltrator's compelling fact-based story and tremendously talented cast are often just enough to balance out its derivative narrative and occasionally clunky execution.

filmInfoContainer3: Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son.
filmInfoContainer4: The Patriot can be entertaining to watch, but it relies too much on formula and melodrama.

filmInfoContainer3: Robbie, a singer, and Julia, a waitress, are both engaged, but to the wrong people. Fortune intervenes to help them discover each other.
filmInfoContainer4: It's decidedly uneven -- and surprisingly sappy for an early Adam Sandler comedy -- but The Wedding Singer is also sweet, funny, and beguiling.

filmInfoContainer3: A high-level government hit squad is sent into the streets in order to complete a deadly mission.
filmInfoContainer4: The Wrecking Crew may not achieve the greatness of the many classic songs its subjects helped bring to life, but it remains a heartfelt, overdue tribute to overshadowed brilliance.

filmInfoContainer3: A rather neurotic ant tries to break from his totalitarian society while trying to win the affection of the princess he loves.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring a stellar voice cast, technically dazzling animation, and loads of good humor, Antz should delight both children and adults.

filmInfoContainer3: A man begins to suspect his neighbors are not what they appear to be and their secrets could be deadly.
filmInfoContainer4: A suspenseful thriller led by strong cast performances built around a somewhat implausible story.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman arrives in Paris where she finds a job as a waitress in bar next on Avenue Montaigne that caters to the surrounding theaters and the wealthy inhabitants of the area. She will meet a pianist, a famous actress and a great art collector, and become acquainted with the "luxurious" world her grandmother has told her about since her childhood.
filmInfoContainer4: A cute and bubbly French comedy that carries no deeper lessons or agendas than to have a little fun for 90 minutes.

filmInfoContainer3: The dim-witted teen duo of Beavis and Butt-Head travel across America in search of their stolen television set.
filmInfoContainer4: Beavis and Butt-Head Do America is unabashedly offensive, unapologetically stupid, and unexpectedly funny.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of Whitey Bulger, the brother of a state senator and the most infamous violent criminal in the history of South Boston, who became an FBI informant to take down a Mafia family invading his turf.
filmInfoContainer4: Black Mass spins a gripping yarn out of its fact-based story -- and leaves audiences with one of Johnny Depp's most compelling performances in years.

filmInfoContainer3: Two Latina sisters work as cleaners in a downtown office building, and fight for the right to unionize.
filmInfoContainer4: Bread and Roses has powerful moments, but it also sometimes descends into preachiness.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of New Zealand's Robert "Rob" Edwin Hall, who on May 10, 1996, together with Scott Fischer, teamed up on a joint expedition to ascend Mount Everest.
filmInfoContainer4: Everest boasts all the dizzying cinematography a person could hope to get out a movie about mountain climbers, even if it's content to tread less challenging narrative terrain.

filmInfoContainer3: Shot on a micro-budget in only three days, Ramsay's adaptation of Shakespeare's immortal play premiered in competition at the Vancouver International Film Festival in 2011.
filmInfoContainer4: Kenneth Branagh's sprawling, finely textured adaptation of Shakespeare's masterpiece lives up to its source material, using strong performances and a sharp cinematic focus to create a powerfully resonant film that wastes none of its 246 minutes.

filmInfoContainer3: A new theme park, built on the original site of Jurassic Park, creates a genetically modified hybrid dinosaur, which escapes containment and goes on a killing spree.
filmInfoContainer4: Jurassic World can't match the original for sheer inventiveness and impact, but it works in its own right as an entertaining -- and visually dazzling -- popcorn thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: When a debt puts a young man's life in danger, he turns to putting a hit out on his evil mother in order to collect the insurance.
filmInfoContainer4: Violent, darkly comic, and full of strong performances, Killer Joe proves William Friedkin hasn't lost his touch, even if the plot may be too lurid for some.

filmInfoContainer3: The time-travelling adventures of an advanced canine and his adopted son, as they endeavor to fix a time rift they created.
filmInfoContainer4: Mr. Peabody & Sherman offers a surprisingly entertaining burst of colorful all-ages fun, despite its dated source material and rather convoluted plot.

filmInfoContainer3: Catherine, refuses to believe that her business partner, the unlikeable François, has a best friend, so she challenges him to set up an introduction. Scrambling to find someone willing to pose as his best pal, François enlists the services of a charming taxi driver to play the part.
filmInfoContainer4: Although the plot may sound contrived, the performances of Daniel Auteuil and Dany Boon manage to turn My Best Friend into an earnest and witty romp.

filmInfoContainer3: A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it sometimes feels like a television sitcom, My Big Fat Greek Wedding is good-hearted, lovable, and delightfully eccentric, with a sharp script and lead performance from Nia Vardalos.

filmInfoContainer3: Widow Ruth is seven months pregnant when, believing herself to be guided by her unborn baby, she embarks on a homicidal rampage, dispatching anyone who stands in her way.
filmInfoContainer4: As ambitious as it is daringly transgressive, Prevenge should thrill fans of pitch-black horror-comedy -- and open untold opportunities for writer/director/star Alice Lowe.

filmInfoContainer3: A retired FBI agent with psychological gifts is assigned to help track down "The Tooth Fairy", a mysterious serial killer. Aiding him is imprisoned forensic psychiatrist Dr. Hannibal "The Cannibal" Lecter.
filmInfoContainer4: Competently made, but everything is a bit too familiar.

filmInfoContainer3: The effects of the 9/11 terrorist attacks are told from different points of view around the world.
Retiring CIA agent Nathan Muir recalls his training of Tom Bishop while working against agency politics to free him from his Chinese captors.
filmInfoContainer4: The outcome of the kinetic Spy Game is never in doubt, but it is fun watching Robert Redford and Brad Pitt work.

filmInfoContainer3: A retired CIA agent travels across Europe and relies on his old skills to save his estranged daughter, who has been kidnapped while on a trip to Paris.
filmInfoContainer4: Taken is undeniably fun with slick action, but is largely a brainless exercise.

filmInfoContainer3: From the bitter quest of the Queen of Longtrellis, to two mysterious sisters who provoke the passion of a king, to the King of Highhills obsessed with a giant Flea, these tales are inspired by the fairytales by Giambattista Basile.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually splendid and narratively satisfying, Tale of Tales packs an off-kilter wallop for mature viewers in search of something different.

filmInfoContainer3: A female assassin receives a dangerous mission to kill a political leader in eighth-century China.
filmInfoContainer4: The Assassin's thrilling visuals mark a fresh highlight for director Hsiao-hsien Hou, even if its glacial pace may keep some viewers at arm's length.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of the childhood of a post-World War I leader.
filmInfoContainer4: The Childhood of a Leader mirrors the rise of fascism in post-WWI Europe with a well-acted, confidently crafted look at one young man's unsettling coming of age.

filmInfoContainer3: In Majorca, in 1823, a French general, Armand de Montriveau, overhears a cloistered nun singing in a chapel; he insists on speaking to her. She is Antoinette, for five years he has searched...
filmInfoContainer4: At times plodding and dialogue heavy, The Duchess of Langeais is nevertheless an intriguing and rewarding dissection of class and gender relations.

filmInfoContainer3: After their plane crashes in Alaska, six oil workers are led by a skilled huntsman to survival, but a pack of merciless wolves haunts their every step.
filmInfoContainer4: The Grey is an exciting tale of survival, populated with fleshed-out characters and a surprising philosophical agenda.

filmInfoContainer3: An aging thief hopes to retire and live off his ill-gotten wealth when a young kid convinces him into doing one last heist.
filmInfoContainer4: Though the movie treads familiar ground in the heist/caper genre, Robert DeNiro, Edward Norton, and Marlon Brando make the movie worth watching.

filmInfoContainer3: While dealing with a friend's cold feet on his wedding day, a writer reminisces about his youth with his best friends.
filmInfoContainer4: A charming piece of work with believable characters.

filmInfoContainer3: Justin throws himself and everyone around him into chaos when he attempts to break free from his addiction to his thumb.
filmInfoContainer4: Though quirky coming-of-age themes are common in indie films, this one boasts a smart script and a great cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Award-winning filmmaker Dome Karukoski brings to screen the life and work of artist Touko Valio Laaksonen (aka Tom of Finland), one of the most influential and celebrated figures of twentieth century gay culture.
filmInfoContainer4: Tom of Finland honors its subject with an empathetic, even-handed, and above all entertaining look at the pioneering art he produced from private turmoil.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1985 where former superheroes exist, the murder of a colleague sends active vigilante Rorschach into his own sprawling investigation, uncovering something that could completely change the course of history as we know it.
filmInfoContainer4: Gritty and visually striking, Watchmen is a faithful adaptation of Alan Moore's graphic novel, but its complex narrative structure may make it difficult for it to appeal to viewers not already familiar with the source material.

filmInfoContainer3: A middle-aged couple's career and marriage are overturned when a disarming young couple enters their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: Poignant and piercingly honest, While We're Young finds writer-director Noah Baumbach delivering some of his funniest lines through some of his most relatable characters.

filmInfoContainer3: Unhappy couples fall apart and hop into other beds with other people.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it may strike some viewers as cold and unpleasant, Neil LaBute's Your Friends & Neighbors is an incisive critique of sexual politics wrapped up in a scathing black comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: After a short introduction of the whole family, the story of the elder brother is told.
filmInfoContainer4: There is too much hollow bloodshed in Brother, and the characters are stereotypically flat.

filmInfoContainer3: In 2270, Earth is completely depleted and no one lives there anymore. Those that have money move to Rhea; but most of the population lives in orbit in space stations. Dr. Laura Portmann ...
An undercover MI6 agent is sent to Berlin during the Cold War to investigate the murder of a fellow agent and recover a missing list of double agents.
filmInfoContainer4: Atomic Blonde gets enough mileage out of its stylish action sequences -- and ever-magnetic star -- to make up for a narrative that's somewhat less hard-hitting than its protagonist.

filmInfoContainer3: A couple who is expecting their first child travel around the U.S. in order to find a perfect place to start their family. Along the way, they have misadventures and find fresh connections with an assortment of relatives and old friends who just might help them discover "home" on their own terms for the first time.
filmInfoContainer4: Built on a set of quirks and charms that are as noticeable as they are interchangeable, Away We Go is a sweet but uneven road trip.

filmInfoContainer3: A seventeen-year-old country boy working in Beijing as a courier has his bicycle stolen, and finds it with a schoolboy his age.
filmInfoContainer4: Though rather repetitive in its plot, Beijing Bicycle provides an interesting look at the economic and social changes that have occurred in China.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of how George Jung, along with the Medellín Cartel headed by Pablo Escobar, established the American cocaine market in the 1970s in the United States.
filmInfoContainer4: With elements that seem borrowed from movies like Goodfellas and Boogie Nights, Blow is pretty much been-there-done-that despite another excellent performance from Johnny Depp. It, also, becomes too sentimental at the end.

filmInfoContainer3: In the 1970s, a young trans woman, Patrick "Kitten" Braden, comes of age by leaving her Irish town for London, in part to look for her mother and in part because her gender identity is beyond the town's understanding.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-acted if monotonous drama about a transvestite prostitute in London during the 1970s.

filmInfoContainer3: A political consultant tries to explain his impending divorce and past relationships to his 11-year-old daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: With a clever script and charismatic leads, Definitely, Maybe is a refreshing entry into the romantic comedy genre.

filmInfoContainer3: A teen living under house arrest becomes convinced his neighbor is a serial killer.
filmInfoContainer4: Aside from its clichéd resolution, Disturbia is a tense, subtle thriller with a noteworthy performance from Shia LaBeouf.

filmInfoContainer3: A sixteen-year-old girl who was raised by her father to be the perfect assassin is dispatched on a mission across Europe, tracked by a ruthless intelligence agent and her operatives.
filmInfoContainer4: Fantastic acting and crisply choreographed action sequences propel this unique, cool take on the revenge thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: Years after a plague kills most of humanity and transforms the rest into monsters, the sole survivor in New York City struggles valiantly to find a cure.
filmInfoContainer4: I Am Legend overcomes questionable special effects and succeeds largely on the strength of Will Smith's mesmerizing performance.

filmInfoContainer3: Secure within a desolate home as an unnatural threat terrorizes the world, a man has established a tenuous domestic order with his wife and son. Then a desperate young family arrives seeking refuge.
filmInfoContainer4: It Comes at Night makes lethally effective use of its bare-bones trappings while proving once again that what's left unseen can be just as horrifying as anything on the screen.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in Depression-era Franklin County, Virginia, a trio of bootlegging brothers are threatened by a new special deputy and other authorities angling for a cut of their profits.
filmInfoContainer4: Grim, bloody, and utterly flawed, Lawless doesn't quite achieve the epic status it strains for, but it's too beautifully filmed and powerfully acted to dismiss.

filmInfoContainer3: Alex, Marty, Gloria and Melman are still fighting to get home to their beloved Big Apple. Their journey takes them through Europe where they find the perfect cover: a traveling circus, which they reinvent - Madagascar style.
filmInfoContainer4: Dazzlingly colorful and frenetic, Madagascar 3 is silly enough for young kids, but boasts enough surprising smarts to engage parents along the way.

filmInfoContainer3: Maggie wants to have a baby, raising him on her own, but when she gets romantically involved with John, a married man, things get complicated and all the balance of Maggie's plans may collapse.
filmInfoContainer4: With a typically absorbing performance from Greta Gerwig leading the way, Maggie's Plan gives rom-com sensibilities a smart, subversive twist.

filmInfoContainer3: A lonely young woman traumatized by a difficult childhood and her increasingly desperate attempts to connect with the people around her is sent into a murderous tailspin.
filmInfoContainer4: Above average slasher flick.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in 1980s Nottingham, social worker Margaret Humphreys holds the British government accountable for child migration schemes and reunites the children involved -- now adults living mostly in Australia -- with their parents in Britain.
filmInfoContainer4: Grounded in a heartwrenching fact-based story, steered by Loach's sensitive direction, and led by a powerful performance from Watson, Oranges and Sunshine sidesteps its pacing problems and occasionally clichéd screenplay.

filmInfoContainer3: A divorced woman and her diabetic daughter take refuge in their newly-purchased house's safe room, when three men break-in, searching for a missing fortune.
filmInfoContainer4: Elevated by Fincher's directorial talent and Foster's performance, Panic Room is a well-crafted, above-average thriller.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical, Mystery
filmInfoContainer3: A Heffalump is heard trumpeting in the hundred acre woods. Winnie the Pooh, Tigger, and Piglet are scared and rush to Rabbit's house for advice. Roo joins them and they all agree that ...
filmInfoContainer4: A charming and delightful walk through the Hundred Acres Woods for young viewers.

filmInfoContainer3: When her husband is taken hostage by his striking employees, a trophy wife (Deneuve) takes the reins of the family business and proves to be a remarkably effective leader. Business and ...

Two highway road workers spend the summer of 1988 away from their city lives. The isolated landscape becomes a place of misadventure as the men find themselves at odds with each other and the women they left behind.
filmInfoContainer4: A step back in the right direction for director David Gordon Green, Prince Avalanche shambles amiably along with a pair of artfully low-key performances from Paul Rudd and Emile Hirsch.

filmInfoContainer3: Following clues to the origin of mankind, a team finds a structure on a distant moon, but they soon realize they are not alone.
filmInfoContainer4: Ridley Scott's ambitious quasi-prequel to Alien may not answer all of its big questions, but it's redeemed by its haunting visual grandeur and compelling performances -- particularly Michael Fassbender as a fastidious android.

filmInfoContainer3: A young man visiting and helping his uncle in New York City finds himself forced to fight a street gang and the mob with his martial art skills.
filmInfoContainer4: An entertaining Jackie Chan stunt-fest in which the impressive action sequences overcome the low production value and by-the-numbers plot.

filmInfoContainer3: After being hypnotized by his sister-in-law, a man begins seeing haunting visions of a girl's ghost and a mystery begins to unfold around him.
filmInfoContainer4: Kevin Bacon's acting is so genuine that it's creepy and director David Keopp knows how to create true suspense.

filmInfoContainer3: A behind-the-scenes look at the annual Penguin World Surfing Championship, and its newest participant, up-and-comer Cody Maverick.
filmInfoContainer4: Surf's Up is a laid back, visually stunning animated movie that brings a fresh twist to some familiar conventions. Its witty mockumentary format is fun and inventive, and the CGI is breathtakingly realistic.

filmInfoContainer: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
filmInfoContainer3: Number one NASCAR driver Ricky Bobby stays atop the heap thanks to a pact with his best friend and teammate, Cal Naughton, Jr. But when a French Formula One driver, makes his way up the ladder, Ricky Bobby's talent and devotion are put to the test.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it occasionally stalls, Talladega Nights' mix of satire, clever gags, and excellent ensemble performances put it squarely in the winner's circle.

filmInfoContainer3: People suffer largely unnoticed while the rest of the world goes about its business. This is a documentary exploration of the mythic beauty of the Golden Gate Bridge, the most popular ...
filmInfoContainer4: Tactlessly morbid or remarkably sensitive? Deeply disturbing or viscerally fascinating? Critics are divided on Eric Steele's unique documentary on the Golden Gate Bridge, wonder of the modern world and notorious suicide destination.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: After their cave is destroyed, a caveman family must trek through an unfamiliar fantastical world with the help of an inventive boy.
filmInfoContainer4: While it may not be as (ahem) evolved as the best modern animated fare, The Croods will prove solidly entertaining for families seeking a fast-paced, funny cartoon adventure.

filmInfoContainer3: An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.
filmInfoContainer4: Tense, thoughtful, and deftly paced, The East is a political thriller that never loses sight of the human element.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of an 84 year-old Kenyan villager and ex Mau Mau veteran who fights for his right to go to school for the first time to get the education he could never afford.
The mother of a severely traumatized daughter enlists the aid of a unique horse trainer to help the girl's equally injured horse.
filmInfoContainer4: It might be a bit too eager to tug the heartstrings, but The Horse Whisperer is typically graceful, well-crafted Redford -- on both sides of the camera.

filmInfoContainer3: A poor yet passionate young man falls in love with a rich young woman, giving her a sense of freedom, but they are soon separated because of their social differences.
filmInfoContainer4: It's hard not to admire its unabashed sentimentality, but The Notebook is too clumsily manipulative to rise above its melodramatic clichés.

filmInfoContainer3: It's the summer of 1994, and the streets of New York are pulsing with hip-hop. Set against this backdrop, a lonely teenager named Luke Shapiro spends his last summer before university selling marijuana throughout New York City, trading it with his unorthodox psychotherapist for treatment, while having a crush on his stepdaughter.
filmInfoContainer4: Sympathetic characters and a clever script help The Wackness overcome a familiar plot to make for a charming coming-of-age comedy.

filmInfoContainer: Things We Lost in the Fire
filmInfoContainer3: A recent widow invites her husband's troubled best friend to live with her and her two children. As he gradually turns his life around, he helps the family cope and confront their loss.
filmInfoContainer4: Things We Lost in the Fire is a well-acted, beautifully filmed reflection on love, loss, addiction and recovery from life's obstacles.

filmInfoContainer: When Did You Last See Your Father?
filmInfoContainer3: The story of a son's conflicting memories of his dying father.
filmInfoContainer4: Sensitive to a fault, Tucker's adaptation of the Morrison novel is nonetheless solidly scripted and well-acted; guard your heartstrings.

filmInfoContainer3: A boy named Max imagines he is "Where The Wild Things Are''.
filmInfoContainer4: Some may find its dark tone and slender narrative off-putting, but Spike Jonze's heartfelt adaptation of the classic children's book is as beautiful as it is uncompromising.

filmInfoContainer3: This is the story of Jody, an unemployed young black man, who's been living with his mother for several years, even though he's got a child of his own. Romantically, he's having ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: Preachy and repetitive in parts, Baby Boy still manages to exude authenticity, thanks to its competent cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama about the awakening of painter Margaret Keane, her phenomenal success in the 1950s, and the subsequent legal difficulties she had with her husband, who claimed credit for her works in the 1960s.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-acted, thought-provoking, and a refreshing change of pace for Tim Burton, Big Eyes works both as a biopic and as a timelessly relevant piece of social commentary.

filmInfoContainer3: Tim Lippe has no idea what he's in for when he's sent to Cedar Rapids, Iowa to represent his company at an annual insurance convention, where he soon finds himself under the "guidance" of three convention veterans.
filmInfoContainer4: It's as conventional as its Midwestern setting, but Cedar Rapids boasts a terrific cast and a script that deftly blends R-rated raunch and endearing sweetness.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama inspired by the life of heavyweight boxer Chuck Wepner, who had a once in a lifetime bout with Muhammad Ali that would inspire the film, Rocky (1976).
filmInfoContainer4: Chuck is hit with a handful of sports biopic clichés but ultimately punches above its weight, largely thanks to a muscular performance from Liev Schreiber.

filmInfoContainer3: Gloria is an out-of-work party girl forced to leave her life in New York City and move back home. When reports surface that a giant creature is destroying Seoul, she gradually comes to the realization that she is somehow connected to this phenomenon.
filmInfoContainer4: Colossal's singular strangeness can be disorienting, but viewers who hang on may find that its genre-defying execution -- and Anne Hathaway's performance -- is well worth the ride.

filmInfoContainer3: During China's Tang dynasty the emperor has taken the princess of a neighboring province as wife. She has borne him two sons and raised his eldest. Now his control over his dominion is complete, including the royal family itself.
filmInfoContainer4: Melodrama, swordplay, and CG armies -- fans of martial arts epic will get what they bargain for, though the baroque art direction can be both mesmerizing and exhaustively excessive.

filmInfoContainer3: This drama centers on Hank Chinaski, the fictional alter-ego of "Factotum" author Charles Bukowski, who wanders around Los Angeles, CA trying to live off jobs which don't interfere with his primary interest, which is writing. Along the way, he fends off the distractions offered by women, drinking and gambling.
filmInfoContainer4: Matt Dillon's performance is the highlight of this somewhat slow but fascinating portrayal of Charles Bukowski's alter-ego.

filmInfoContainer3: Filmmaker Michael Moore examines the current state of American politics, particularly the Donald Trump presidency and gun violence, while highlighting the power of grassroots democratic movements.
filmInfoContainer4: Fahrenheit 11/9 finds Michael Moore in fine fighting form, delivering a political call to action that ranks among his most effective works.

filmInfoContainer3: Skeptical professor Phillip Goodman embarks on a trip to the terrifying after finding a file with details of three unexplained cases of apparitions.
filmInfoContainer4: Ghost Stories offers a well-crafted, skillfully told horror anthology that cleverly toys with genre tropes while adding a few devilishly frightful twists.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on writer Susanna Kaysen's account of her 18-month stay at a mental hospital in the 1960s.
filmInfoContainer4: Angelina Jolie gives an intense performance, but overall Girl, Interrupted suffers from thin, predictable plotting that fails to capture the power of its source material.

filmInfoContainer3: Events over the course of one traumatic night in Paris unfold in reverse-chronological order as the beautiful Alex is brutally raped and beaten by a stranger in the underpass.
filmInfoContainer4: Though well-filmed, Irreversible feels gratuitous in its extreme violence.

filmInfoContainer3: Amidst the war climate, a teenage boy discovering himself becomes love-stricken by Malèna, a sensual woman living in a small, narrow-minded Italian town.
filmInfoContainer4: Malena ends up objectifying the character of the movie's title. Also, the young boy's emotional investment with Malena is never convincing, as she doesn't feel like a three-dimensional person.

filmInfoContainer3: Cate Blanchett performs manifestos as a series of striking monologues.
filmInfoContainer4: Laugh-out-loud humor and Cate Blanchett's tour de force performance(s) make Manifesto worth watching, even if the subject matter is too esoteric for all but a few.

filmInfoContainer3: Frank determines to salvage his self-esteem and tackle his demons by attempting the ultimate test of endurance - swimming the English Channel.
filmInfoContainer4: Another blue-collar inspirational feel-good British dramedy, On A Clear Day succeeds on the strength of lead actor Peter Mullan's performance and Gaby Dellal's competent direction.

filmInfoContainer3: Hubert Bonisseur de la Bath, aka OSS 117, is the French spy considered by his superiors to be the best in the business. The year is 1967 - he's been sent on a mission to Rio de Janeiro, to ...
filmInfoContainer4: Led by another appealing performance from Jean Dujardin, this sequel offers more absurdly fun action -- and more politically incorrect humor -- for fans of '60s spy films.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary filmmaker and her fellow Gen X graduates face life after college, looking for work and love in Houston.
Two siblings rival each other inside the world of professional soccer.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite its fair share of sports movie cliches, Rudo y Cursi marks an auspicious directing debut for Carlos Cuarón, and features strong performances from García Bernal and Luna.

filmInfoContainer3: A coming-of-age story about a shy, young boy sent by his irresponsible mother to spend the summer with his wealthy, eccentric uncles in Texas.
filmInfoContainer4: A wholesome but schmaltzy movie.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of New Yorkers caught up in their romantic-sexual milieu converge at an underground salon infamous for its blend of art, music, politics, and carnality.
filmInfoContainer4: The sex may be explicit, but Mitchell integrates it into the characters' lives and serves the whole story up with a generous dose of sweetness and wit.

filmInfoContainer3: As his lover announces her pregnancy, a fortysomething slacker receives other life-changing news: 142 people, all of them the result of artificial insemination, have filed a class action lawsuit against him, their biological father.
A look at the state of the global environment including visionary and practical solutions for restoring the planet's ecosystems.
filmInfoContainer4: Well-researched and swimming in scientific data, this global warming documentary offers some practical and wide-ranging solutions to our climate crisis.

filmInfoContainer3: One hundred superstar comedians tell the same very, VERY dirty, filthy joke--one shared privately by comics since Vaudeville.
filmInfoContainer4: Can a joke stand up to repeated tellings? Hilarious and revealing of the way comedy works, The Aristocrats demonstrates that it's possible.

filmInfoContainer3: A discount store clerk strikes up an affair with a stock boy who considers himself the incarnation of Holden Caulfield.
filmInfoContainer4: A dark dramedy with exceptional performances from Jennifer Aniston and Jake Gyllenhaal, The Good Girl is a moving and astute look at the passions of two troubled souls in a small town.

filmInfoContainer3: An aging gambler on a losing streak attempts to rob a casino in Monte Carlo. But someone's already tipped off the cops before he even makes a move.
filmInfoContainer4: Bolstered by Nolte's strong performance, The Good Thief brims with seductive style.

filmInfoContainer3: A globetrotting hitman and a crestfallen businessman meet in a hotel bar in Mexico City in an encounter that draws them together in a way neither expected.
filmInfoContainer4: This humorously amoral, oddball comic thriller features strong performances by Pierce Brosnan and Greg Kinnear as a flamboyant, aging hit-man and an out of work suburban businessman, respectively.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in South Carolina in 1964, this is the tale of Lily Owens, a 14 year-old girl who is haunted by the memory of her late mother. To escape her lonely life and troubled relationship with ...
filmInfoContainer4: The Secret Life of Bees has moments of charm, but is largely too maudlin and sticky-sweet.

filmInfoContainer3: The Candyman, a murderous soul with a hook for a hand, is accidentally summoned to reality by a skeptic grad student researching the monster's myth.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it ultimately sacrifices some mystery in the name of gory thrills, Candyman is a nuanced, effectively chilling tale that benefits from an interesting premise and some fine performances.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Short, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical
filmInfoContainer3: A ruined industrialist tells his tale of his environmentally self-destructive greed despite the warnings of an old forest creature.
On the night of the discovery of a duplicate Earth in the Solar system, an ambitious young student and an accomplished composer cross paths in a tragic accident.
A love story between a man and woman. And between a mother and her son. A mystical and fantastical odyssey on love.
A drama about terrorism in Apartheid-era South Africa, revolving around a policeman and a young man who carries out solo attacks against the regime.
filmInfoContainer4: No stranger to the political thriller, director Phillip Noyce tackles apartheid and terrorism with experienced gusto, while Derek Luke and Tim Robbins hand in nuanced performances.

filmInfoContainer3: A brilliant scientist left for dead returns to exact revenge on the people who burned him alive.
The story of an uptown rat that gets flushed down the toilet from his penthouse apartment, ending in the sewers of London, where he has to learn a whole new and different way of life.
filmInfoContainer4: Clever and appealing for both children and adults, Flushed Away marks a successful entry into digital animated features for Aardman Animations.

filmInfoContainer3: A glimpse at the life of French singer Serge Gainsbourg, from growing up in 1940s Nazi-occupied Paris through his successful song-writing years in the 1960s to his death in 1991 at the age of 62.
filmInfoContainer4: It might be thinly written and messily made, but Gainsbourg: A Heroic Life is also appropriately glamorous and intense -- and powerfully led by a gripping performance from Erik Elmosnino.

filmInfoContainer3: Nearly a year after a botched job, a hitman takes a new assignment with the promise of a big payoff for three killings. What starts off as an easy task soon unravels, sending the killer into the heart of darkness.
filmInfoContainer4: Kill List is an expertly executed slow-burn crime thriller that thrives on tension before morphing into visceral horror.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1995, a teenager living with her sister and parents in Manhattan discovers that her father is having an affair.
filmInfoContainer4: Landline's talented cast -- and a fast-paced approach from director/co-writer Gillian Robespierre -- help this charming multi-generational dramedy overcome a familiar storyline.

filmInfoContainer3: A scheming raccoon fools a mismatched family of forest creatures into helping him repay a debt of food, by invading the new suburban sprawl that popped up while they were hibernating...and learns a lesson about family himself.
filmInfoContainer4: Even if it's not an animation classic, Over the Hedge is clever and fun, and the jokes cater to family members of all ages.

filmInfoContainer3: In a city of humanoid animals, a hustling theater impresario's attempt to save his theater with a singing competition becomes grander than he anticipates even as its finalists' find that their lives will never be the same.
filmInfoContainer4: Sing delivers colorfully animated, cheerfully undemanding entertainment with a solid voice cast and a warm-hearted -- albeit familiar -- storyline that lives up to its title.

filmInfoContainer3: A wild stallion is captured by humans and slowly loses the will to resist training, yet, throughout his struggles for freedom, the stallion refuses to let go of the hope of one day returning home to his herd.
filmInfoContainer4: A visually stunning film that may be too predictable and politically correct for adults, but should serve children well.

filmInfoContainer3: Nat Turner, a literate slave and preacher in the antebellum South, orchestrates an uprising.
filmInfoContainer4: The Birth of a Nation overpowers its narrative flaws and uneven execution through sheer conviction, rising on Nate Parker's assured direction and the strength of its vital message.

filmInfoContainer3: A man and a woman, secretly in love, alone in a room. They desire each other, want each other, and even bite each other. In the afterglow, they share a few sweet nothings. At least the man ...
filmInfoContainer4: The Blue Room proves a sobering study of the dark side of human nature, as well as a coolly assured directorial effort from star and co-writer Mathieu Amalric.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Drama, Family, Fantasy
filmInfoContainer3: In a world where dinosaurs and humans live side-by-side, an Apatosaurus named Arlo makes an unlikely human friend.
filmInfoContainer4: The Good Dinosaur delivers thrillingly beautiful animation in service of a worthy story that, even if it doesn't quite live up to the lofty standards set by Pixar, still adds up to charming, family-friendly entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: In the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin participate in a joint mission against a mysterious criminal organization, which is working to proliferate nuclear weapons.
filmInfoContainer4: The Man from U.N.C.L.E. tries to distract from an unremarkable story with charismatic stars and fizzy set pieces, adding up to an uneven action thriller with just enough style to overcome its lack of substance.

filmInfoContainer3: An aging widow from New York City follows her daughter to Los Angeles in hopes of starting a new life after her husband passes away.
filmInfoContainer4: The Meddler transcends its cutesy title and familiar premise with a heartfelt look at family dynamics that's honored by a marvelous performance from Susan Sarandon.

filmInfoContainer3: Yearning for escape and adventure, a young boy runs away from home and sails to an island filled with creatures that take him in as their king.
filmInfoContainer4: Some may find its dark tone and slender narrative off-putting, but Spike Jonze's heartfelt adaptation of the classic children's book is as beautiful as it is uncompromising.

filmInfoContainer3: A working mother puts herself through law school in an effort to represent her brother, who has been wrongfully convicted of murder and has exhausted his chances to appeal his conviction through public defenders.
filmInfoContainer4: Less compelling -- and more manipulative -- than it should be, Conviction benefits from its compelling true story and a pair of solid performances from Swank and Rockwell.

filmInfoContainer3: An overworked mother and her daughter do not get along. When they switch bodies, each is forced to adapt to the other's life for one freaky Friday.
filmInfoContainer4: Jamie Lee Curtis and Lindsay Lohan charm in Mark Waters' nicely pitched -- and Disney's second -- remake of the 1976 hit.
