filmInfoContainer3: The marriage between Gabrielle and Jean begins to fray after the discovery of a letter that belongs to Gabrielle.
filmInfoContainer4: Patrice Chéreau's exquisite rendering of Joseph Conrad's The Return brings underlying passions to surface in a long-suffering marriage.

filmInfoContainer: I Am Not a Serial Killer
filmInfoContainer3: In a small Midwestern town, a troubled teen with homicidal tendencies must hunt down and destroy a supernatural killer while keeping his own inner demons at bay.
filmInfoContainer4: I Am Not A Serial Killer honors the book it's based on with a well-acted drama that leavens its gore and dark themes with wry humor.

filmInfoContainer3: A murder in 1944 draws together the great poets of the beat generation: Allen Ginsberg, Jack Kerouac and William Burroughs.
filmInfoContainer4: Bolstered by the tremendous chemistry between Daniel Radcliffe and Dane DeHaan, Kill Your Darlings casts a vivid spotlight on an early chapter in the story of the Beat Generation.

filmInfoContainer3: A team of scientists explore an uncharted island in the Pacific, venturing into the domain of the mighty Kong, and must fight to escape a primal Eden.
filmInfoContainer4: Offering exhilarating eye candy, solid acting, and a fast-paced story, Kong: Skull Island earns its spot in the movie monster's mythos without ever matching up to the classic original.

filmInfoContainer3: A virus spreads through an office complex causing white collar workers to act out their worst impulses.
filmInfoContainer4: Mayhem delivers stylish violence by the bloody bucketful -- and grounds all the titular chaos in sharp humor and surprisingly effective real-world economic angst.

filmInfoContainer3: Lewis is a brilliant inventor who meets mysterious stranger named Wilbur Robinson, whisking Lewis away in a time machine and together they team up to track down Bowler Hat Guy in a showdown that ends with an unexpected twist of fate.
filmInfoContainer4: Meet the Robinsons is a visually impressive children's animated film marked by a story of considerable depth.

filmInfoContainer3: Pierre, a professional dancer, suffers from a serious heart disease. While he is waiting for a transplant which may (or may not) save his life, he has nothing better to do than look at the ...
filmInfoContainer4: Alternately a sharp ensemble dramedy and a love letter to the titular city, Paris is uneven but often striking.

filmInfoContainer3: Set during the Cold War, American chess prodigy Bobby Fischer finds himself caught between two superpowers and his own struggles as he challenges the Soviet Empire.
filmInfoContainer4: Anchored by a sensitive performance from Tobey Maguire, Pawn Sacrifice adds another solidly gripping drama to the list of films inspired by chess wiz Bobby Fischer.

filmInfoContainer3: When his peaceful life is threatened by a high-tech assassin, former black-ops agent Frank Moses reassembles his old team in a last ditch effort to survive and uncover his assailants.
filmInfoContainer4: It may not be the killer thrill ride you'd expect from an action movie with a cast of this caliber, but Red still thoroughly outshines most of its big-budget counterparts with its wit and style.

filmInfoContainer3: A fateful event leads to a job in the film business for top mixed-martial arts instructor Mike Terry. Though he refuses to participate in prize bouts, circumstances conspire to force him to consider entering such a competition.
filmInfoContainer4: Mamet's mixed marital arts morality play weaves between action and intellect but doesn't always hit its target.

filmInfoContainer3: In the months after the heady weeks of May '68, a group of young Europeans search for a way to continue the revolution believed to be just beginning.
filmInfoContainer4: Insightful, solidly acted, and smartly filmed, Something in the Air skillfully captures the idealism of youth without falling back on cheap nostalgia.

filmInfoContainer3: A swinger on the cusp of being a senior citizen with a taste for young women falls in love with an accomplished woman closer to his age.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it occasionally stumbles into sitcom territory, Something's Gotta Give is mostly a smart, funny romantic comedy, with sharp performances from Jack Nicholson, Diane Keaton, and Keanu Reeves.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the famous and influential 1960s rock band The Doors and its lead singer and composer, Jim Morrison, from his days as a UCLA film student in Los Angeles, to his untimely death in Paris, France at age 27 in 1971.
filmInfoContainer4: Val Kilmer delivers a powerhouse performance as one of rock's most incendiary figures, but unfortunately, Oliver Stone is unable to shed much light on the circus surrounding the star.

filmInfoContainer3: Celebrates the birth of show business and tells of a visionary who rose from nothing to create a spectacle that became a worldwide sensation.
filmInfoContainer4: The Greatest Showman tries hard to dazzle the audience with a Barnum-style sense of wonder -- but at the expense of its complex subject's far more intriguing real-life story.

filmInfoContainer3: A freak storm unleashes a species of bloodthirsty creatures on a small town, where a small band of citizens hole up in a supermarket and fight for their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: Frank Darabont's impressive camerawork and politically incisive script make The Mist a truly frightening experience.

filmInfoContainer3: Yella is estranged from her possessive and violent husband; but he can't quite bring himself to give her up. When their fraught interaction finally comes to dramatic conclusion, Yella's life takes an odd shift.
filmInfoContainer4: Chilly and haunting, Yella's atmosphere gets under the skin.

filmInfoContainer3: At the end of his career, a clueless fashion model is brainwashed to kill the Prime Minister of Malaysia.
filmInfoContainer4: A wacky satire on the fashion industry, Zoolander is one of those deliberately dumb comedies that can deliver genuine laughs.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the extraordinary true story of Operation Anthropoid, the WWII mission to assassinate SS General Reinhard Heydrich, the main architect behind the Final Solution and the Reich's third in command after Hitler and Himmler.

filmInfoContainer: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
filmInfoContainer3: A 1960s secret agent is brought out of cryofreeze to oppose his greatest enemy in the 1990s, where his social attitudes are glaringly out of place.
filmInfoContainer4: A light and goofy comedy which provides laughs, largely due to performances and screenwriting by Myers.

filmInfoContainer3: Two friends spend all their free time building flame-throwers and weapons of mass destruction in hopes that a global apocalypse will occur and clear the runway for their imaginary gang "Mother Medusa".
filmInfoContainer4: This fevered, stylish vision of the end of the world stitches multiple genres together and marks writer/director/star Evan Glodell as a true talent to watch.

filmInfoContainer3: A father takes his son to tour colleges on the East Coast and meets up with an old friend who makes him feel inferior about his life's choices.
filmInfoContainer4: Brad's Status transcends its familiar premise with insightful observations and affecting interplay between stars Ben Stiller and Austin Abrams.

filmInfoContainer3: A Women's Institute chapter's fundraising effort for a local hospital by posing nude for a calendar becomes a media sensation.
filmInfoContainer4: A charming, but cliched comedy reminiscent of The Full Monty.

filmInfoContainer3: A substitute teacher who drifts from classroom to classroom finds a connection to the students and teachers during his latest assignment.
filmInfoContainer4: Detachment's heart is in the right place, but overall it doesn't offer any solutions to its passionate ranting.

filmInfoContainer3: A silent, surreal parallel between a couple and a dog.
filmInfoContainer4: As visually thrilling as it is inscrutable, Goodbye to Language 3D offers a late-period masterpiece from a legendary director still very much in control of his craft.

filmInfoContainer3: A British college student falls for an American student, only to be separated from him when she's banned from the U.S. after overstaying her visa.
filmInfoContainer4: It has the schmaltzy trappings of my romantic films, but Like Crazy allows its characters to express themselves beyond dialogue, crafting a true, intimate study.

filmInfoContainer3: Follows the lives of eight very different couples in dealing with their love lives in various loosely interrelated tales all set during a frantic month before Christmas in London, England.
filmInfoContainer4: A sugary tale overstuffed with too many stories. Still, the cast charms.

filmInfoContainer3: An American agent, under false suspicion of disloyalty, must discover and expose the real spy without the help of his organization.
filmInfoContainer4: Full of special effects, Brian DePalma's update of Mission: Impossible has a lot of sweeping spectacle, but the plot is sometimes convoluted.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Mystery
filmInfoContainer3: Three teens discover that their neighbor's house is really a living, breathing, scary monster.
filmInfoContainer4: Monster House welcoms kids and adults alike into a household full of smart, monstrous fun.

filmInfoContainer3: Three friends attempt to recapture their glory days by opening up a fraternity near their alma mater.
filmInfoContainer4: While not consistently funny, the movie does have its moments.

filmInfoContainer3: When Blu, a domesticated macaw from small-town Minnesota, meets the fiercely independent Jewel, he takes off on an adventure to Rio de Janeiro with the bird of his dreams.
filmInfoContainer4: This straightforward movie reaches great heights thanks to its colorful visual palette, catchy music, and funny vocal performances.

filmInfoContainer3: Penny Chenery Tweedy and colleagues guide her long-shot but precocious stallion to set, in 1973, the unbeaten record for winning the Triple Crown.
filmInfoContainer4: Rousing, heartwarming, and squarely traditional, Secretariat offers exactly what you'd expect from an inspirational Disney drama -- no more, and no less.

filmInfoContainer3: The daughter of a Scottish farmer comes of age in the early 1900s.
filmInfoContainer4: Achingly lovely on both visual and narrative grounds, Sunset Song adds another small gem to writer-director Terence Davies' filmography.

filmInfoContainer3: A former rodeo champ befriends a young man with a propensity for violence.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart and well-acted, Sweet Virginia delivers a tense, atmospheric thriller that transcends genre conventions even as it embraces them.

filmInfoContainer3: A happily married woman falls for the artist who lives across the street.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring excellent work from an outstanding cast, the bittersweet drama Waltz proves that in the right hands, a familiar tale can still ring true.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on real life events, Assassination is set in 1974 and centers on a businessman who decides to take extreme measures to achieve his American dream.
The unexpected arrival of a wounded Union soldier at a girls school in Virginia during the American Civil War leads to jealousy and betrayal.
filmInfoContainer4: The Beguiled adds just enough extra depth to its source material to set itself apart, and director Sofia Coppola's restrained touch is enlivened by strong performances from the cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A young orphaned boy raised by underground cave-dwelling trash collectors tries to save his friends from an evil exterminator.
filmInfoContainer4: While it's far from Laika's best offering, The Boxtrolls is still packed with enough offbeat wit and visual splendor to offer a healthy dose of all-ages entertainment.

filmInfoContainer3: The clues to a young woman's death come together as the lives of seemingly unrelated people begin to intersect.
filmInfoContainer4: This dark thriller boasts a fresh approach, but it can still get bogged down by its heavy subject matter.

filmInfoContainer3: A teenage girl is targeted by an online sexual predator.
filmInfoContainer4: Director David Schwimmer gets some gut-wrenching performances out of his actors but he still lacks the chops to fully ratchet up story tension.

filmInfoContainer3: When the Davison family comes under attack during their wedding anniversary getaway, the gang of mysterious killers soon learns that one of the victims harbors a secret talent for fighting back.
filmInfoContainer4: You're Next's energetic and effective mix of brutal gore and pitch black humor will please horror buffs and beyond.

filmInfoContainer3: A man who specializes in debunking paranormal occurrences checks into the fabled room 1408 in the Dolphin Hotel. Soon after settling in, he confronts genuine terror.
filmInfoContainer4: Relying on psychological tension rather than overt violence and gore, 1408 is a genuinely creepy thriller with a strong lead performance by John Cusack.

filmInfoContainer3: As four friends prepare for life after high school, different challenges bring about turning points in each of their lives. The dramas unfold and resolve at their local rollerskating rink, Cascade.
filmInfoContainer4: Strong lead performances and catchy musical interludes rescue this coming-of-age story from its formulaic script and uneven direction.

filmInfoContainer3: An abandoned boy is lured to America and drawn into the shadow of a dangerous father figure. Inspired by the real life events that led to the 2002 Beltway sniper attacks.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, sobering, and quietly chilling, Blue Caprice uses its horrible true-life story -- and some solid performances -- to underscore the dreadful banality of evil.

filmInfoContainer3: An offbeat drama focused on a homeless youth, a pop music siren and a member of the paparazzi.
filmInfoContainer4: A funny, energetic satire of the paparazzi life and the entertainment industry, Delirious is another winner for indie helmer Tom DiCillo.

filmInfoContainer3: The aliens are coming and their goal is to invade and destroy Earth. Fighting superior technology, mankind's best weapon is the will to survive.
filmInfoContainer4: The plot is thin and so is character development, but as a thrilling, spectacle-filled summer movie, Independence Day delivers.

filmInfoContainer3: A male stripper teaches a younger performer how to party, pick up women, and make easy money.
filmInfoContainer4: Magic Mike's sensitive direction, smart screenplay, and strong performances allow audiences to have their beefcake and eat it too.

filmInfoContainer3: Bret Maverick, needing money for a poker tournament, faces various comic mishaps and challenges, including a charming woman thief.
filmInfoContainer4: It isn't terribly deep, but it's witty and undeniably charming, and the cast is obviously having fun.

filmInfoContainer3: The friendship between two life-long girlfriends is put to the test when one starts a family and the other falls ill.
filmInfoContainer4: Miss You Already isn't shy about going for filmgoers' tear ducts, but its solid script and talented cast are often powerful enough to make up for its more manipulative moments.

filmInfoContainer: Perfume: The Story of a Murderer
filmInfoContainer3: Jean-Baptiste Grenouille, born with a superior olfactory sense, creates the world's finest perfume. His work, however, takes a dark turn as he searches for the ultimate scent.
filmInfoContainer4: Perfume is what you'd expect from a Tom Twyker-directed movie glamorizing a serial killer: a kinetic visual feast, with a dark antihero that's impossible to feel sympathy for.

filmInfoContainer3: A band of rogue DJs that captivated Britain, playing the music that defined a generation and standing up to a government that wanted classical music, and nothing else, on the airwaves.
filmInfoContainer4: The good cast and rollicking soundtrack eventually drown when this comic homage to pirate radio loses its quippy steam.

filmInfoContainer3: A loyal and dedicated Hong Kong Inspector teams up with a reckless and loudmouthed L.A.P.D. detective to rescue the Chinese Consul's kidnapped daughter, while trying to arrest a dangerous crime lord along the way.
filmInfoContainer4: A kick-ass addition to the cop-buddy film genre.

filmInfoContainer3: When a girl attending a Christian high school becomes pregnant, she finds herself ostracized and demonized, as all of her former friends turn on her.
filmInfoContainer4: A satirical teen comedy that, unfortunately, pulls its punches.

filmInfoContainer3: Emmanuelle Béart stars as a widowed schoolteacher who flees Nazi-occupied Paris with her children. A teenaged boy comes to their rescue by leading them into the forest -- their best shot at survival.
filmInfoContainer4: Understated but compelling wartime drama.

filmInfoContainer3: As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle.
filmInfoContainer4: The Children Act showcases yet another powerful performance from Emma Thompson, who elevates this undeniably flawed picture into an affecting adult drama.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman grieving the loss of her mother, a famous scream queen from the 1980s, finds herself pulled into the world of her mom's most famous movie. Reunited, the women must fight off the film's maniacal killer.
filmInfoContainer4: The Final Girls offers an affectionate nod to slasher tropes while adding a surprising layer of genuine emotion to go with the meta amusement.

filmInfoContainer3: Three women who have been driven mad by pioneer life are to be transported across the country by covered wagon by the pious, independent-minded Mary Bee Cuddy, who in turn employs low-life drifter George Briggs to assist her.
filmInfoContainer4: A squarely traditional yet somewhat progressive Western, The Homesman adds another absorbing entry to Tommy Lee Jones' directorial résumé.

filmInfoContainer3: Mulder and Scully must fight the government in a conspiracy and find the truth about an alien colonization of Earth.
filmInfoContainer4: Results may vary for newcomers, but fans of the series will enjoy its big-screen transition.

filmInfoContainer3: When Anna and her family arrive at their holiday home, they find it occupied by strangers. This confrontation is just the beginning of a painful learning process.
filmInfoContainer4: A lean and unsettlingly thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: Wallace, who is burned out from a string of failed relationships, forms an instant bond with Chantry, who lives with her longtime boyfriend. Together, they puzzle out what it means if your best friend is also the love of your life.
filmInfoContainer4: Its narrative framework may be familiar, but What If transcends its derivative elements with sharp dialogue and the effervescent chemistry of stars Daniel Radcliffe and Zoe Kazan.

filmInfoContainer3: The mysterious murder of an environmental activist leads her straight-laced father, an Inspector of the local police force, through a haunting revelation of the murkiness of the British ...
filmInfoContainer4: For better and for worse, Edge of Darkness offers vintage Mel Gibson, working within the familiar framework of a bloody revenge thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: The U. S. Congress is one of the country's most important and misunderstood institutions. Ken Burns tells the story behind this branch of government.
filmInfoContainer4: The Congress rises on the strength of Robin Wright's powerful performance, with enough ambitious storytelling and technical thrills to overcome its somewhat messy structure.

filmInfoContainer3: The U. S. Congress is one of the country's most important and misunderstood institutions. Ken Burns tells the story behind this branch of government.
filmInfoContainer4: The Congress rises on the strength of Robin Wright's powerful performance, with enough ambitious storytelling and technical thrills to overcome its somewhat messy structure.

filmInfoContainer3: A Salem resident attempts to frame her ex-lover's wife for being a witch in the middle of the 1692 witchcraft trials.
A 90-year-old horticulturist and Korean War veteran is caught transporting $3 million worth of cocaine through Michigan for a Mexican drug cartel.
filmInfoContainer4: A flawed yet enjoyable late-period Eastwood entry, The Mule stubbornly retains its footing despite a few missteps on its occasionally unpredictable path.

filmInfoContainer3: The music of The Beatles and the Vietnam War form the backdrop for the romance between an upper-class American girl and a poor Liverpudlian artist.
filmInfoContainer4: Psychedelic musical numbers can't mask Across the Universe's clichéd love story and uninteresting characters.

filmInfoContainer3: Adam, a lonely man with Asperger's Syndrome, develops a relationship with his upstairs neighbor, Beth.
filmInfoContainer4: Hugh Dancy's elegant performance as a man with Asperger's Syndrome elevates Adam, an offbeat but touching romantic comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: Communist Radicals hijack Air Force One with The U.S. President and his family on board. The Vice President negotiates from Washington D.C., while the President, a Veteran, fights to rescue the hostages on board.
filmInfoContainer4: This late-period Harrison Ford actioner is full of palpable, if not entirely seamless, thrills.

filmInfoContainer3: A biography of sports legend Muhammad Ali, focusing on his triumphs and controversies between 1964 and 1974.
filmInfoContainer4: Though perhaps no film could fully do justice to the fascinating life and personality of Muhammad Ali, Mann's direction and Smith's performance combine to pack a solid punch.

filmInfoContainer3: A day in the life of a South Side Chicago barbershop.
filmInfoContainer4: Besides bringing on the laughs, Barbershop displays a big heart and demonstrates the value of community.

filmInfoContainer3: The inspirational story of World Champion Boxer Vinny Pazienza who, after a near fatal car crash which left him not knowing if he'd ever walk again, made one of sport's most incredible comebacks.
filmInfoContainer4: Bleed for This rises on the strength of Miles Teller's starring performance to deliver a solid fact-based boxing drama that takes a few genre clichés on the chin but keeps on coming.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a young girl in North London whose life changes after witnessing a violent attack.
In the 1970s a music promoter plucks Siamese twins from obscurity and grooms them into a freakish rock'n'roll act. A dark tale of sex, strangeness and rock music.
filmInfoContainer4: As bizarre as it is, this mockumentary about a pair of conjoined rockers is surprisingly poignant and filled with authentic period details.

filmInfoContainer3: A criminal subculture operates among U.S. soldiers stationed in West Germany just before the fall of the Berlin wall.
filmInfoContainer4: Overall, this caustic comedy hits more of its targets than it misses.

filmInfoContainer3: A true story of politics and art in the 1930s U.S., focusing on a leftist musical drama and attempts to stop its production.
filmInfoContainer4: Witty and provocative.

filmInfoContainer3: John and Molly, a divorced middle aged man and a single mother meet at a friends party and start up a small relationship, all John has to do now is meet Molly's son... Cyrus
filmInfoContainer4: While it may strike some viewers as slight, Cyrus is a successful hybrid of mainstream production values and the mumblecore ideals of directors Jay and Mark Duplass.

filmInfoContainer3: Cultural critic David Kepesh finds his life, which he indicates is a state of "emancipated manhood", thrown into tragic disarray by Consuela Castillo, a well-mannered student who awakens a sense of sexual possessiveness in her teacher.
filmInfoContainer4: An intelligent, adult, and provocative Philip Roth adaptation that features classy performances, Elegy is never quite the sum of its parts.

filmInfoContainer3: A Russian and a German sniper play a game of cat-and-mouse during the Battle of Stalingrad.
filmInfoContainer4: Atmospheric and thrilling, Enemy at the Gates gets the look and feel of war right. However, the love story seems out of place.

filmInfoContainer3: An international crew of astronauts undertakes a privately funded mission to search for life on Jupiter's fourth largest moon.
filmInfoContainer4: Claustrophobic and stylish, Europa Report is a slow-burning thriller that puts the science back into science fiction.

filmInfoContainer3: During the Depression, Jimmy Gralton returns home to Ireland after ten years of exile in America. Seeing the levels of poverty and oppression, the activist in him reawakens and he looks to re-open the dance hall that led to his deportation.
filmInfoContainer4: Benefiting from a talented cast and sensitive work from director Ken Loach, Jimmy's Hall offers period drama rich with relevant sociopolitical themes.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in Cincinnati at the height of the Great Depression, Kit Kittredge, a resourceful young girl, helps her mother run a boardinghouse after her father loses his job.
filmInfoContainer4: Refreshingly sweet and sincere, Kit's doll-and-book-inspired do-good mystery may be geared towards the tween girl but will please audiences of all ages.

filmInfoContainer3: Several scary black-and-white animated segments in different styles appeal to our fear(s) of the dark.
filmInfoContainer4: This French animated horror portmanteau is monochrome and minimalist, visually stunning, but light on scares.

filmInfoContainer3: A family living on a farm finds mysterious crop circles in their fields which suggests something more frightening to come.
filmInfoContainer4: With Signs, Shyamalan proves once again an expert at building suspense and giving audiences the chills.

filmInfoContainer3: A champion boxer fights to get his daughter back from child protective services as well as revive his professional career, after a fatal incident sends him on a rampant path of destruction.
filmInfoContainer4: Jake Gyllenhaal delivers an impressively committed performance, but Southpaw beats it down with a dispiriting drama that pummels viewers with genre clichés.

filmInfoContainer3: The story follows a man who returns home to discover a long-buried family secret, and whose attempts to put things right threaten the lives of those he left home years before.
filmInfoContainer4: With The Daughter, debuting writer-director Simon Stone turns Henrik Ibsen's The Wild Duck into a thoughtful meditation on the bonds of family, friendship, and community.

filmInfoContainer3: Twin siblings enduring the harshness of WWII in a village on the Hungarian border hedge their survival on studying and learning from the evil surrounding them.
filmInfoContainer4: It's hard not to admire its unabashed sentimentality, but The Notebook is too clumsily manipulative to rise above its melodramatic clichés.

filmInfoContainer3: A porter and a top-model have to pretend to be a couple in order to salvage a CEO's marriage.
filmInfoContainer4: Like much of director Francis Veber's work, The Valet is a witty, madcap farce with memorably zany characters.

filmInfoContainer3: A man enslaved by the mob since childhood and raised into behaving like a human attack dog escapes his captors and attempts to start a new life.
filmInfoContainer4: Jet Li gets to emote in some emotionally awkward scenes, but the gritty fight sequences come through in what is Li's best English language film.

filmInfoContainer3: Chronicles the rise of Chess Records and its recording artists.
filmInfoContainer4: What Cadillac Records may lack in originality, it more than makes up for in strong performances and soul-stirring music.

filmInfoContainer3: A modern day adaptation of the ancient Greek play Lysistrata by Aristophanes, set against the backdrop of gang violence in Chicago, Illinois.
filmInfoContainer4: Chi-Raq is as urgently topical and satisfyingly ambitious as it is wildly uneven -- and it contains some of Spike Lee's smartest, sharpest, and all-around entertaining late-period work.

filmInfoContainer3: A home care nurse works with terminally ill patients.
filmInfoContainer4: Chronic demands patience from the viewer -- and yields rich dividends with an affecting story and a committed starring performance by Tim Roth.

filmInfoContainer3: An exploration of how the actions of individual lives impact one another in the past, present and future, as one soul is shaped from a killer into a hero, and an act of kindness ripples across centuries to inspire a revolution.
filmInfoContainer4: Its sprawling, ambitious blend of thought-provoking narrative and eye-catching visuals will prove too unwieldy for some, but the sheer size and scope of Cloud Atlas are all but impossible to ignore.

filmInfoContainer3: Following the death of her father, Alice (Ruth Wilson) returns to her home village for the first time in 15 years, to claim the tenancy to the family farm she believes is rightfully hers.
filmInfoContainer4: Dark River is just as bleak as its title would suggest, but solidly conceived characters and a standout performance from Ruth Wilson make it worth diving in.

filmInfoContainer3: The cross-country adventures of 2 good-hearted but incredibly stupid friends.
filmInfoContainer4: A relentlessly stupid comedy elevated by its main actors: Jim Carrey goes bonkers and Jeff Daniels carries himself admirably in an against-type performance.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama about a family set in Calais with the European refugee crisis as the backdrop.
filmInfoContainer4: Happy End is far from Haneke's best work, yet it still succeeds in forcing audiences to confront -- and uncomfortably consider -- the dark side of human nature.

filmInfoContainer3: Spanning twenty-four hours, Heights follows five New Yorkers challenged to choose their destiny before the sun comes up the next day.
filmInfoContainer4: Yet another movie about relationships in the Big Apple, Heights is never dull thanks to a competent cast.

filmInfoContainer3: A couple's relationship is tested when uninvited guests arrive at their home, disrupting their tranquil existence.
filmInfoContainer4: There's no denying that mother! is the thought-provoking product of a singularly ambitious artistic vision, though it may be too unwieldy for mainstream tastes.

filmInfoContainer3: A shy boy grows up in 1940s Mississippi with the help of his beloved dog, Skip.
filmInfoContainer4: Critics say My Dog Skip is cute, wholesome entertainment for the family. It's especially designed to appeal to your sentiment, but you might find yourself choking up just the same.

filmInfoContainer3: High school student Nick O'Leary, member of the Queercore band The Jerk Offs, meets college-bound Norah Silverberg when she asks him to be her boyfriend for five minutes.
filmInfoContainer4: Nick and Norah's Infinite Playlist combines a pair of charming leads, the classic New York backdrop, and a sweet soundtrack.

filmInfoContainer3: During the American Civil War, two friends join the Bushwhackers, a militant group loyal to the Confederacy.
filmInfoContainer4: A well-acted, eccentric Civil War film, Ang Lee's Ride With the Devil is often more visually striking than it is emotionally engaging.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of WikiLeak's editor-in-chief Julian Assange as seen by documentary filmmaker Laura Poitras.
filmInfoContainer4: Risk poses knotty questions regarding documentary filmmaking ethics, but remains consistently compelling despite its flaws.

filmInfoContainer3: In a world of vampires, an expert vampire hunter and his young protégé travel toward sanctuary.
filmInfoContainer4: Though the genre is well worn at this point, director Jim Mickle focuses on strong characterization and eerie atmosphere to craft an effective apocalyptic vampire chiller that also manages to pack a mean punch.

filmInfoContainer: The 100-Year-Old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared
filmInfoContainer3: After living a long and colorful life, Allan Karlsson finds himself stuck in a nursing home. On his 100th birthday, he leaps out a window and begins an unexpected journey.
filmInfoContainer4: Its efforts to earn laughs can be as ungainly as its title, but for viewers in tune with its absurdist humor, The 100-Year-Old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared offers much to recommend.

filmInfoContainer3: The affair between a politician and a contemporary dancer is affected by mysterious forces keeping the lovers apart.
filmInfoContainer4: First-time writer/director George Nolfi struggles to maintain a consistent tone, but The Adjustment Bureau rises on the strong, believable chemistry of its stars.

filmInfoContainer3: An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters.

Katniss Everdeen is in District 13 after she shatters the games forever. Under the leadership of President Coin and the advice of her trusted friends, Katniss spreads her wings as she fights to save Peeta and a nation moved by her courage.
filmInfoContainer4: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 1 sets up the franchise finale with a penultimate chapter loaded with solid performances and smart political subtext, though it comes up short on the action front.

filmInfoContainer3: Bank clerk Stanley Ipkiss is transformed into a manic superhero when he wears a mysterious mask.
filmInfoContainer4: It misses perhaps as often as it hits, but Jim Carrey's manic bombast, Cameron Diaz' blowsy appeal, and the film's overall cartoony bombast keep The Mask afloat.

filmInfoContainer3: Two mismatched New York City detectives seize an opportunity to step up like the city's top cops, whom they idolize, only things don't quite go as planned.
filmInfoContainer4: A clever parody of cop-buddy action-comedies, The Other Guys delivers several impressive action set pieces and lots of big laughs, thanks to the assured comic chemistry between Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg.

filmInfoContainer3: A Pakistani involved in a planned attack in New York City experiences a crisis of conscience.
filmInfoContainer4: The War Within attempts to get into the mind of a terrorist, and the result is believable and unsettling.

filmInfoContainer3: A Mexican-American master chef and father to three daughters has lost his taste for food but not for life.
filmInfoContainer4: An English remake of Ang Lee's Eat Drink Man Woman, Tortilla Soup is as charming and flavorful as the dishes it features.

filmInfoContainer3: A twist on the slasher genre, following two death-obsessed teenage girls who use their online show about real-life tragedies to send their small mid-western town into a frenzy, and cement their legacy as modern horror legends.
filmInfoContainer4: Tragedy Girls injects familiar teen tropes with just enough up-to-the-minute commentary -- and pitch-black humor -- to work as an irreverently entertaining diversion.

filmInfoContainer3: An ancient struggle between two Cybertronian races, the heroic Autobots and the evil Decepticons, comes to Earth, with a clue to the ultimate power held by a teenager.
filmInfoContainer4: While believable characters are hard to come by in Transformers, the effects are staggering and the action is exhilarating.

filmInfoContainer3: A computer hacker is abducted into the digital world and forced to participate in gladiatorial games where his only chance of escape is with the help of a heroic security program.
filmInfoContainer4: Though perhaps not as strong dramatically as it is technologically, TRON is an original and visually stunning piece of science fiction that represents a landmark work in the history of computer animation.

filmInfoContainer: What We Did on Our Holiday
filmInfoContainer3: Doug and Abi take their kids on a family vacation. Surrounded by relatives, the kids innocently reveal the ins and outs of their family life and many intimate details about their parents. ...
filmInfoContainer4: Witty and well-cast, What We Did on Our Holiday injects unlikely laughs into a story dealing with dark, difficult themes.

filmInfoContainer3: Former United Nations employee Gerry Lane traverses the world in a race against time to stop the Zombie pandemic that is toppling armies and governments, and threatening to destroy humanity itself.
filmInfoContainer4: It's uneven and diverges from the source book, but World War Z still brings smart, fast-moving thrills and a solid performance from Brad Pitt to the zombie genre.

filmInfoContainer3: After losing her virginity, Isabelle takes up a secret life as a call girl, meeting her clients for hotel-room trysts. Throughout, she remains curiously aloof, showing little interest in the encounters themselves or the money she makes.
filmInfoContainer4: Ozon may not explore his themes as fully as he should, but Young & Beautiful poses enough intriguing questions -- and features a strong enough performance from Marine Vacth -- to compensate for its frustrations.

filmInfoContainer3: Rebecca is one of the world's top war photographers. She must weather a major emotional storm when her husband refuses to put up with her dangerous life any longer. He and their young ...
filmInfoContainer4: Beautifully filmed and powerfully acted, 1,000 Times Good Night achieves absorbing fact-based drama without overindulging in Hollywood contrivances.

filmInfoContainer3: James Cameron teams up with NASA scientists to explore the Mid-Ocean Ridge, a submerged chain of mountains that band the Earth and are home to some of the planet's most unique life forms.
filmInfoContainer4: An amazing array of images from beneath the sea.

filmInfoContainer3: The life of TV star Bob Crane and his strange friendship with electronics expert John Henry Carpenter.
filmInfoContainer4: Kinnear and Dafoe help make this downward spiral of one man's life a compelling watch.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at one year in the life of four babies from around the world, from Mongolia to Namibia to San Francisco to Tokyo.
filmInfoContainer4: Babies is a joyous celebration of humankind that's loaded with adorable images, but it lacks insight and depth.

filmInfoContainer3: Caught in the crossfires of civil war, CIA operatives must send a former U.S. diplomat to negotiate for the life of a friend he left behind.
filmInfoContainer4: Beirut tells a complex, tightly plotted tale of international intrigue, further elevated by strong central performances from Jon Hamm and Rosamund Pike.

filmInfoContainer3: A young boy wins a tour through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world, led by the world's most unusual candy maker.
filmInfoContainer4: Closer to the source material than 1971's Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory is for people who like their Chocolate visually appealing and dark.

filmInfoContainer3: A New Jersey guy dedicated to his family, friends, and church, develops unrealistic expectations from watching porn and works to find happiness and intimacy with his potential true love.
filmInfoContainer4: Don Jon proves to be an amiable directing debut for Joseph Gordon-Levitt, and a vivacious showcase for his co-star, Scarlett Johansson.

filmInfoContainer: Dreamer: Inspired by a True Story
filmInfoContainer3: Cale Crane catalyzes the rescue and rehabilitation of Sonador, a race horse with a broken leg.
filmInfoContainer4: Though formulaic, this horse story's saving grace is its strong performances.

filmInfoContainer3: 1953. Desmond Doyle is devastated when his wife abandons their family on the day after Christmas. His unemployment, and the fact that there is no woman in the house to care for the children...
filmInfoContainer4: Though predictable and sometimes overly sentimental, Evelyn still manages to be heartwarming.

filmInfoContainer: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
filmInfoContainer3: An oddball journalist and his psychopathic lawyer travel to Las Vegas for a series of psychedelic escapades.
filmInfoContainer4: Visually creative, but also aimless, repetitive, and devoid of character development.

filmInfoContainer3: A wrongfully expelled Harvard undergrad moves to London, where he is introduced to the violent underworld of football hooliganism.
filmInfoContainer4: When it comes to the subculture of soccer thugs, Green Street Hooligans lacks sufficient insight, and instead comes off as a Fight Club knock-off.

filmInfoContainer3: A Hollywood fixer in the 1950s works to keep the studio's stars in line.
filmInfoContainer4: Packed with period detail and perfectly cast, Hail, Caesar! finds the Coen brothers delivering an agreeably lightweight love letter to post-war Hollywood.

filmInfoContainer3: An elderly ex-serviceman and widower looks to avenge his best friend's murder by doling out his own form of justice.
filmInfoContainer4: Its lurid violence may put off some viewers, but Harry Brown is a vigilante thriller that carries an emotional as well as a physical punch, thanks to a gripping performance from Michael Caine in the title role.

filmInfoContainer3: Elle Woods, a fashionable sorority queen is dumped by her boyfriend. She decides to follow him to law school, while she is there she figures out that there is more to her than just looks.
filmInfoContainer4: Though the material is predictable and formulaic, Reese Witherspoon's funny, nuanced performance makes this movie better than it would have been otherwise.

filmInfoContainer3: In the early 1900s, three brothers and their father living in the remote wilderness of Montana are affected by betrayal, history, love, nature, and war.
A documentary on the legendary singer-songwriter, with performances by those musicians he has influenced.
filmInfoContainer4: A moving, if somewhat uneven, look at the legendary singer-songwriter, I'm Your Man treats Cohen's body of work with the reverence it deserves.

filmInfoContainer3: The film follows the surf and skateboarding trends that originated in Venice, California during the 1970's.
filmInfoContainer4: Lords of Dogtown, while slickly made and edited, lacks the depth and entertaining value of the far superior documentary on the same subject, Dogtown and Z-Boys.

filmInfoContainer2: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Musical
filmInfoContainer3: A Yeti is convinced that the elusive creatures known as "humans" really do exist.
filmInfoContainer4: Smallfoot offers a colorful distraction that should keep younger viewers entertained - and a story whose message might even resonate with older audiences.

filmInfoContainer3: Follows the life of Olympic hopeful Francis Barrett as he overcomes social and cultural barriers to realise his dream of fighting for the Irish Olympic team.
filmInfoContainer4: Jake Gyllenhaal delivers an impressively committed performance, but Southpaw beats it down with a dispiriting drama that pummels viewers with genre clichés.

filmInfoContainer3: In order to raise the tuition to send her young son to private school, a mom starts an unusual business -- a biohazard removal/crime scene clean-up service -- with her unreliable sister.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite a sometimes overly familiar plot, Sunshine Cleaning benefits from the lively performances of its two stars.

filmInfoContainer3: John Bennett, a man whose childhood wish of bringing his teddy bear to life came true, now must decide between keeping the relationship with the bear or his girlfriend, Lori.
filmInfoContainer4: Ted's "romance versus bromance" plot is familiar, but the film's held aloft by the high-concept central premise and a very funny (albeit inconsistent) script.

filmInfoContainer3: A drama based on the life of college football hero Ernie Davis, the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy.
filmInfoContainer4: The Express crosses the goal line as an inspirational sports drama, although fans of the genre will recognize many -- if not most -- of its clichés.

filmInfoContainer3: A blind girl gets a cornea transplant so that she would be able to see again. However, she got more than what she bargained for when she realized she could even see ghosts.
filmInfoContainer4: Conventional ghost tale with a few genuine scares.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of an Argentine family who lived with Josef Mengele without knowing his true identity, and of a girl who fell in love with one of the biggest criminals of all time.
filmInfoContainer4: The German Doctor applies a refreshing level of restraint to its intriguing premise, and boasts solid performances from a talented cast.

filmInfoContainer: The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio
filmInfoContainer3: In order to support her ten children, Evelyn Ryan enters a commercial jingle-writing contest.
filmInfoContainer4: Noteworthy for Julianne Moore's performance, Prize Winner is nonetheless a largely indistinct and tentative film that fails to convey the true power of its bittersweet tale.

filmInfoContainer3: An Eastern European tourist unexpectedly finds himself stranded in JFK airport, and must take up temporary residence there.
filmInfoContainer4: The Terminal transcends its flaws through the sheer virtue of its crowd-pleasing message and a typically solid star turn from Tom Hanks.

filmInfoContainer3: When troubled teen Milo, who has a fascination with vampire lore, meets the equally alienated Sophie, the two form a bond that begins to blur Milo's fantasy into reality.
filmInfoContainer4: The Transfiguration tells a quieter, more deliberately paced tale than genre fans might expect, but for those with the patience to let it sink in, it offers its own rewards.

filmInfoContainer3: The Zookeeper's Wife tells the account of keepers of the Warsaw Zoo, Antonina and Jan Zabinski, who helped save hundreds of people and animals during the German invasion.
filmInfoContainer4: The Zookeeper's Wife has noble intentions, but is ultimately unable to bring its fact-based story to life with quite as much impact as it deserves.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman is involuntarily committed to a mental institution, where she is confronted by her greatest fear--but is it real or a product of her delusion?
filmInfoContainer4: Unsane unleashes Steven Soderbergh's inner B-movie maestro, wading into timeless psychological thriller territory and giving it a high-tech filmmaking spin.

filmInfoContainer: Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
filmInfoContainer3: Singer Dewey Cox overcomes adversity to become a musical legend.
filmInfoContainer4: A parody that pokes fun at rock stars and reductive biopics alike, this comedy sings in large part because of stellar performances and clever original music.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of Lebanese women try to ease religious tensions between Christians and Muslims in their village.
Five stages in the romance between a woman and a man.
filmInfoContainer4: Five scenes from a marriage, deftly and poignantly presented.

filmInfoContainer3: A new kid in town assembles a fledgling rock band -- together, they achieve their dreams and compete against the best in the biggest event of the year, a battle of the bands.
filmInfoContainer4: Bandslam is an intelligent teen film that avoids teen film cliches, in an entertaining package of music and coming-of-age drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Based on the book by Toni Morrison, in which a slave is visited by the spirit of a mysterious young woman
filmInfoContainer4: A powerful, emotional and successful film adaptation of the original novel.

filmInfoContainer3: A widower finds out the woman he fell in love with is his brother's girlfriend.
filmInfoContainer4: The fine performances elevate Dan in Real Life beyond its sentimental plot.

filmInfoContainer3: A group of misfits enter a Las Vegas dodgeball tournament in order to save their cherished local gym from the onslaught of a corporate health fitness chain.
filmInfoContainer4: Proudly profane and splendidly silly, Dodgeball is a worthy spiritual successor to the goofball comedies of the 1980s.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1966, Texas Western coach Don Haskins led the first all-black starting line-up for a college basketball team to the NCAA national championship.
filmInfoContainer4: As formulaic as sports movies get, this underdog story still triumphs on the strength of its inspiring story.

filmInfoContainer3: With the world now aware of his identity as Iron Man, Tony Stark must contend with both his declining health and a vengeful mad man with ties to his father's legacy.
filmInfoContainer4: It isn't quite the breath of fresh air that Iron Man was, but this sequel comes close with solid performances and an action-packed plot.

filmInfoContainer3: The fractious family of a father and his two sons confront their different feelings and memories of their deceased wife and mother, a famed war photographer.
filmInfoContainer4: Louder Than Bombs finds director Joachim Trier using a capable cast in pursuit of some lofty dramatic goals, even if his ambitions occasionally evade his grasp.

filmInfoContainer3: Three radical environmentalists look to execute the protest of their lives: the explosion of a hydroelectric dam.
filmInfoContainer4: A uniquely character-driven thriller with a finely composed cast and some outstanding direction from Kelly Reichardt, Night Moves bolsters its thought-provoking themes with compelling drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Jesse Owens' quest to become the greatest track and field athlete in history thrusts him onto the world stage of the 1936 Olympics, where he faces off against Adolf Hitler's vision of Aryan supremacy.
filmInfoContainer4: Race is nowhere near as thrillingly fleet or agile as its subject, but the story -- and a winning central performance from Stephan James -- are enough to carry it over the finish line.

filmInfoContainer3: Two veteran salesmen dissect a sales pitch to a particular client, through their young protégé.
filmInfoContainer4: Wonderful adaptation of the stage play.

filmInfoContainer3: During Napoleon's exile on St. Helena, some loyalists hire a look-alike to swap places with the deposed emperor. While the impostor lives in luxury on the island, the real Napoleon returns to Paris in order to retake the throne.
filmInfoContainer4: The premise of The Emperor's New Clothes is intriguing, and Holm gives a delightful performance.

filmInfoContainer3: A man believes he has put his mysterious past behind him and has dedicated himself to beginning a new, quiet life. But when he meets a young girl under the control of ultra-violent Russian gangsters, he can't stand idly by - he has to help her.
filmInfoContainer4: The Equalizer is more stylishly violent than meaningful, but with Antoine Fuqua behind the cameras and Denzel Washington dispensing justice, it delivers.

filmInfoContainer3: A young lawyer joins a prestigious law firm only to discover that it has a sinister dark side.
filmInfoContainer4: The Firm is a big studio thriller that amusingly tears apart the last of 1980s boardroom culture and the false securities it represented.

filmInfoContainer3: A documentary about branding, advertising and product placement that is financed and made possible by brands, advertising and product placement.
filmInfoContainer4: The Greatest Movie Ever Sold plays smartly to Spurlock's strengths, and the result is a breezy, albeit not particularly enlightening documentary.

filmInfoContainer: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies
filmInfoContainer3: Bilbo and company are forced to engage in a war against an array of combatants and keep the Lonely Mountain from falling into the hands of a rising darkness.
filmInfoContainer4: Though somewhat overwhelmed by its own spectacle, The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies ends Peter Jackson's second Middle-earth trilogy on a reasonably satisfying note.

filmInfoContainer3: Martin, a mercenary, is sent from Europe by a mysterious biotech company to the Tasmanian wilderness on a hunt for the last Tasmanian tiger.
filmInfoContainer4: The Hunter occasionally suffers from predictability, but Willem Dafoe gives a terrific performance as an obsessive hunter on the trail of a mysterious beast.

filmInfoContainer3: James Bond is living on the edge to stop an evil arms dealer from starting another world war. Bond crosses all seven continents in order to stop the evil Whitaker and General Koskov.
filmInfoContainer4: Newcomer Timothy Dalton plays James Bond with more seriousness than preceding installments, and the result is exciting and colorful but occasionally humorless.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of the English exploration of Virginia, and of the changing world and loves of Pocahontas.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite arresting visuals and strong lead performances, The New World suffers from an unfocused narrative that will challenge viewers' attention spans over its 2 1/2 hours.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1870s America, the fury of a notorious gang leader is unleashed when a peaceful American settler avenges the death of his family. Then as his cowardly fellow townspeople betray him, he is forced to hunt down the outlaws alone.
filmInfoContainer4: It's all but impossible to add anything new or fresh to the traditional Western, but -- thanks in no small part to Mads Mikkelson's performance -- The Salvation comes close.

filmInfoContainer3: Upon moving into the run-down Spiderwick Estate with their mother, twin brothers Jared and Simon Grace, along with their sister Mallory, find themselves pulled into an alternate world full of faeries and other creatures.
filmInfoContainer4: The Spiderwick Chronicles is an entertaining children's adventure, with heart and imagination to spare.

filmInfoContainer3: When her husband unexpectedly disappears, a sharp-witted suburban wife and her daughters juggle their mom's romantic dilemmas and family dynamics.
filmInfoContainer4: A comedy/ drama for grown-ups, with fine performances by Joan Allen and Kevin Costner.

filmInfoContainer3: A young woman, dealing with anorexia, meets an unconventional doctor who challenges her to face her condition and embrace life.
filmInfoContainer4: To the Bone offers an insightful, empathetic look at a widespread issue, led by exemplary work from Lily Collins in the central role.

filmInfoContainer3: A frustrated office worker learns that he is the son of a professional assassin and that he shares his father's superhuman killing abilities.
filmInfoContainer4: Wanted is stylish, energetic popcorn fare with witty performances from Angelina Jolie (playing an expert assassin), James McAvoy, and Morgan Freeman that help to distract from its absurdly over-the-top plot.

filmInfoContainer3: In Brooklyn, New York, Kyra (Michelle Pfeiffer) loses her job and struggles to survive on her ailing mother's income. As the weeks and months go on, her problems worsen. This leads her on a risky and enigmatic path that threatens her life.
filmInfoContainer4: Where Is Kyra? rests on Michelle Pfeiffer's magnetically raw performance -- and lives up to it with a trenchant, hard-hitting story.

filmInfoContainer3: Soon after her divorce, a fiction writer returns to her home in small-town Minnesota, looking to rekindle a romance with her ex-boyfriend, who is now happily married and has a newborn daughter.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite its somewhat dour approach, Young Adult is a funny and ultimately powerful no-holds-barred examination of prolonged adolescence, thanks largely to a convincing performance by Charlize Theron.

filmInfoContainer3: Two business rivals who despise each other in real life unwittingly fall in love over the Internet.
filmInfoContainer4: Great chemistry between the leads made this a warm and charming delight.

filmInfoContainer3: The story of a young prosecutor who rises swiftly to power, but tumbles even quicker.
filmInfoContainer4: The King pursues a wildly ambitious thesis through some fairly bumpy territory, but emerges as a provocative and insightful look at modern America.

filmInfoContainer3: Uncle Tak, the old martial-arts master and medicine in normal life has severe problems with his former student Jonny, who wants nothing more than to kill his old master to show everyone who...
filmInfoContainer4: Smart and solidly engrossing, The Master extends Paul Thomas Anderson's winning streak of challenging films for serious audiences.

filmInfoContainer3: A stop-motion animated story about people living in a Sydney apartment complex looking for meaning in their lives.
filmInfoContainer4: Its storyline isn't as wondrous as its visuals, but $9.99 has a sophistication and handmade charm that sets it apart from the animated pack.

filmInfoContainer3: An aspiring novelist enters into a relationship with a woman, though there's just one catch: She's married and the couple can only meet between the hours of 5 and 7 each evening.
filmInfoContainer4: 5 to 7 too often settles for rom-com clichés, but they're offset by its charming stars, sensitive direction, and a deceptively smart screenplay.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at how the intense relationship between Carl Jung and Sigmund Freud gives birth to psychoanalysis.
filmInfoContainer4: A provocative historical fiction about the early days of psychoanalysis, A Dangerous Method is buoyed by terrific performances by Michael Fassbender, Keira Knightley, and Viggo Mortensen.

filmInfoContainer3: After his master dies, a peasant squire, fueled by his desire for food and glory, creates a new identity for himself as a knight.
filmInfoContainer4: Once you get past the anachronism, A Knight's Tale becomes a predictable, if spirited, Rocky on horseback.

filmInfoContainer3: In Bolivia, Butch Cassidy (now calling himself James Blackthorn) pines for one last sight of home, an adventure that aligns him with a young robber and makes the duo a target for gangs and lawmen alike.
filmInfoContainer4: Blackthorn invites comparisons to a classic Western -- and survives, thanks largely to a charismatic performance by a well-chosen Sam Shepard.

filmInfoContainer3: Three parents try to stop their daughters from losing their virginity on prom night.
filmInfoContainer4: Blockers puts a gender-swapped spin on the teen sex comedy -- one elevated by strong performances, a smartly funny script, and a surprisingly enlightened perspective.

filmInfoContainer3: Bridget's focus on single life and her career is interrupted when she finds herself pregnant, but with one hitch ... she can only be fifty percent sure of the identity of her baby's father.
filmInfoContainer4: Bridget Jones's Baby might be late on arrival, but fans of the series should still find its third installment a bouncing bundle of joy.

filmInfoContainer3: A soldier assigned to Guantanamo Bay befriends a man who has been imprisoned there.
filmInfoContainer4: Camp X-Ray's treatment of its subject verges on the shallow, but benefits greatly from a pair of impressive performances from Kristen Stewart and Peyman Moaadi.

filmInfoContainer3: The only residents of young Nicholas' sea-side town are women and boys. When he sees a corpse in the ocean one day, he begins to question his existence and surroundings. Why must he, and all the other boys, be hospitalised?
filmInfoContainer4: Creepy, provocative, and aesthetically absorbing, Evolution marks a satisfying step forward for director/co-writer Lucile Hadzihalilovic.

filmInfoContainer3: Two guys take their bromance to another level when they participate in an art film project.
filmInfoContainer4: Observant and insightful, this indie comedy takes a different tack on the "bromance" but still makes a point without sermonizing.

filmInfoContainer3: A cop turns con man once he comes out of the closet. Once imprisoned, he meets the second love of his life, whom he'll stop at nothing to be with.
filmInfoContainer4: This fact-based romantic comedy has its flaws, but they're mostly overcome by its consistently sweet, funny tone and one of the best performances of Jim Carrey's career.

filmInfoContainer3: A reimagined account of the early life of Maria Anna 'Nannerl' Mozart, five years older than Wolfgang, and a musical prodigy in her own right.
Three women's escapes from their afflicted lives. Each struggles to flee from the men who confine their personal freedom.
filmInfoContainer4: Uneven, but a keenly observed and well-acted film about three women's lives.

filmInfoContainer3: Confounded by her clashes with the seemingly rule-obsessed world, a troubled young girl seeks enlightenment from her unconventional drama teacher.
filmInfoContainer4: Blessed with a good cast, Phoebe's heart is in the right place, but its execution is dicey.

filmInfoContainer3: The Feds try to take down notorious American gangsters John Dillinger, Baby Face Nelson and Pretty Boy Floyd during a booming crime wave in the 1930s.
filmInfoContainer4: Michael Mann's latest is a competent and technically impressive gangster flick with charismatic lead performances, but some may find the film lacks truly compelling drama.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in 1990s Belfast, an active member of the IRA becomes an informant for MI5 in order to protect her son's welfare.
filmInfoContainer4: A tense, thought-provoking thriller, Shadow Dancer is bolstered by sensitive direction from James Marsh and a terrific performance from Andrea Riseborough.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of the Barack Obama administration's foreign policy team and the events of Obama's final year in office.
filmInfoContainer4: The Final Year uses director Greg Barker's wide-ranging access to take a detailed inside look at the closing months of the Obama administration.

filmInfoContainer3: Katniss and a team of rebels from District 13 prepare for the final battle that will decide the future of Panem.
filmInfoContainer4: With the unflinchingly grim Mockingjay Part 2, The Hunger Games comes to an exciting, poignant, and overall satisfying conclusion.

filmInfoContainer3: Debra Winger and Tracy Letts play a long-married, dispassionate couple who are both in the midst of serious affairs. But on the brink of calling it quits, a spark between them suddenly reignites, leading them into an impulsive romance.
filmInfoContainer4: With appealing leads and a narrative approach that offers a fresh perspective on familiar themes, The Lovers tells a quietly absorbing story with unexpected emotional resonance.

filmInfoContainer3: A former British Army officer, who was tortured as a prisoner of war at a Japanese labor camp during World War II, discovers that the man responsible for much of his treatment is still alive and sets out to confront him.
filmInfoContainer4: Understated to a fault, The Railway Man transcends its occasionally stodgy pacing with a touching, fact-based story and the quiet chemistry of its stars.

filmInfoContainer3: A young orphan girl, Sophie, gets taken away to a faraway land populated by Giants and Dreams.

Based on the best-selling autobiography by Irish expatriate Frank McCourt, Angela's Ashes follows the experiences of young Frankie and his family as they try against all odds to escape the ...                    See full summary »
filmInfoContainer4: In spite of its attempts to accurately record Frank McCourt's memoirs, the onscreen adaptation fails to capture any of the drama or humor of his life.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the lives of the strong-willed women of the Weston family, whose paths have diverged until a family crisis brings them back to the Oklahoma house they grew up in, and to the dysfunctional woman who raised them.
filmInfoContainer4: The sheer amount of acting going on in August: Osage County threatens to overwhelm, but when the actors involved are as talented as Meryl Streep and Julia Roberts, it's difficult to complain.

filmInfoContainer3: In order to make good with his former employers, a submarine captain takes a job with a shadowy backer to search the depths of the Black Sea for a submarine rumored to be loaded with gold.
filmInfoContainer4: Black Sea may not be particularly deep, but thanks to Kevin Macdonald's judicious direction and a magnetic performance from Jude Law, it remains an efficiently well-crafted thriller.

filmInfoContainer3: A poet falls in love with an art student who gravitates to his bohemian lifestyle -- and his love of heroin. Hooked as much on one another as they are on the drug, their relationship alternates between states of oblivion, self-destruction, and despair.
filmInfoContainer4: Stars Heath Ledger and Abbie Cornish look better than they should as heroin addicts, and their characters are too absorbed and self-pitying to be totally compelling.

filmInfoContainer3: Lightning McQueen sets out to prove to a new generation of racers that he's still the best race car in the world.
filmInfoContainer4: Cars 3 has an unexpectedly poignant story to go with its dazzling animation, suggesting Pixar's most middle-of-the-road franchise may have a surprising amount of tread left.

filmInfoContainer3: A small-town sheriff sets out to find the two kids who have taken his car on a joy ride.
filmInfoContainer4: Cop Car boasts a terrific premise and a grimly gripping opening act -- and for some viewers, that will be enough to compensate for the movie's uneven denouement.

filmInfoContainer3: A band director recruits a Harlem street drummer to play at a Southern university.
filmInfoContainer4: Essentially a sports movie with drums, the energetic Drumline somehow manages to make the familiar seem fresh.

filmInfoContainer3: Five of the world's best snowboarders are taken to the mountains of Alaska for some outrageous "Big Mountain" rides.
filmInfoContainer4: This snowboarding doc scores with its dazzling array of snowboarding stunts and beautiful scenery, but loses points with shameless product placement and an overlong runtime.

filmInfoContainer3: Two eighth-graders start to have feelings for each other despite being total opposites.
filmInfoContainer4: While not without its nostalgic charms, Rob Reiner's sometimes awkward adaptation of Wendelin Van Draanen's childhood novel doesn't reach the heights of the director's earlier work like Stand By Me.

filmInfoContainer3: The world is beset by the appearance of monstrous creatures, but one of them may be the only one who can save humanity.
filmInfoContainer4: With just enough human drama to anchor the sweeping spectacle of giant monsters smashing everything in sight, Gareth Edwards' Godzilla satisfyingly restores the franchise's fire-breathing glory.

filmInfoContainer3: Dispatched from his basement room on an errand for his widowed mother, slacker Jeff might discover his destiny (finally) when he spends the day with his unhappily married brother as he tracks his possibly adulterous wife.
filmInfoContainer4: Sweet, funny, and flawed, Jeff, Who Lives at Home finds the Duplass brothers moving into the mainstream with their signature quirky charm intact.

filmInfoContainer3: A drag queen comes to the rescue of a man who, after inheriting his father's shoe factory, needs to diversify his product if he wants to keep the business afloat.
filmInfoContainer4: Kinky Boots relies heavily on the Full Monty formula of Britcoms, while playing it too safe in a desperate attempt not to offend. Ejiofor's performance is its redeeming virtue.

filmInfoContainer3: A pair of former brothers-in-law embark on a road trip through Iceland.
filmInfoContainer4: Gently amusing and agreeably modest in scale, Land Ho! uses its stars' warm chemistry to impart its poignant, quietly effective message.

filmInfoContainer3: In Maoist China, a boy is taken from his family and trained to become a dancer, but everything he knows is challenged when he is chosen to attend a ballet summer school in Houston, Texas.
An Irish fisherman discovers a woman in his fishing net whom his precocious daughter believes to be a selkie.
filmInfoContainer4: Flawed but charming, Ondine reaffirms writer-director Neil Jordan's gift for myth, magic, and wonder.

filmInfoContainer3: After moving into a suburban home, a couple becomes increasingly disturbed by a nightly demonic presence.
filmInfoContainer4: Using its low-budget effects and mockumentary method to great result, Paranormal Activity turns a simple haunted house story into 90 minutes of relentless suspense.

filmInfoContainer3: Humans in a fascist, militaristic future wage war with giant alien bugs in a satire of modern world politics.
filmInfoContainer4: A fun movie...if you can accept the excessive gore and wooden acting.

filmInfoContainer3: After India's father dies, her Uncle Charlie, whom she never knew existed, comes to live with her and her unstable mother. She comes to suspect this mysterious, charming man has ulterior motives and becomes increasingly infatuated with him.
filmInfoContainer4: Its script doesn't quite carry the dramatic heft of his earlier work, but Park Chan-wook's Stoker showcases his eye for sumptuous imagery and his affection for dark, atmospheric narratives populated by mysterious characters.

filmInfoContainer3: A writer's young assistant becomes both pawn and catalyst in his boss's disintegrating household.
filmInfoContainer4: Though uneven in tone, this is one of the better adaptations of John Irving's novels, with Jeff Bridges giving one of his best performances.

filmInfoContainer3: When Wolverine is summoned to Japan by an old acquaintance, he is embroiled in a conflict that forces him to confront his own demons.
filmInfoContainer4: Although its final act succumbs to the usual cartoonish antics, The Wolverine is one superhero movie that manages to stay true to the comics while keeping casual viewers entertained.

filmInfoContainer3: The true story of Doug Bruce who woke up on Coney Island with total amnesia. This documentary follows him as he rediscovers himself and the world around him.
filmInfoContainer4: With a quirky visual style, this documentary follows a story of memory loss and confusion while posing provocative questions about the nature of personality.

filmInfoContainer3: Riva is an operator, a man with charm and ambition in equal measure. Kinshasa is an inviting place. With petrol in short supply in DRC's capital, he and his sidekick pursue a plot to get ...
filmInfoContainer4: Vibrant and violent, Viva Riva is a stylish, fast-paced crime drama.

filmInfoContainer3: The Parkers, a reclusive family who follow ancient customs, find their secret existence threatened as a torrential downpour moves into their area, forcing daughters Iris and Rose to assume responsibilities beyond those of a typical family.
filmInfoContainer4: A compelling story cleverly told, We Are What We Are quenches horror buffs' thirst for gore while serving up serious-minded filmmaking and solid acting.

filmInfoContainer3: Set in Southern California, a father moves his young family to the countryside to renovate and re-open a struggling zoo.
filmInfoContainer4: We Bought a Zoo is a transparently cloying effort by director Cameron Crowe, but Matt Damon makes for a sympathetic central character.

filmInfoContainer3: A chronicle of Whitney Houston's rise to fame and turbulent relationship with husband Bobby Brown.
filmInfoContainer4: Whitney shifts from soaring highs to heartbreaking lows with palpable emotion and grace befitting its singular subject.

filmInfoContainer3: Set against the backdrop of a decaying Midwestern town, a murder becomes the focal point of three people who work in a doll factory.
filmInfoContainer4: This rigorously stripped down, seemingly mundane little film still manages to be engrossing and creepy.

filmInfoContainer3: Wilbur the pig is scared of the end of the season, because he knows that come that time, he will end up on the dinner table. He hatches a plan with Charlotte, a spider that lives in his pen, to ensure that this will never happen.
filmInfoContainer4: Kids will be entertained by the straightforward plot and cute animals, and adults will be charmed by how quiet and humble the production is, a fine translation of E.B. White's genteel prose.

filmInfoContainer3: Luke and Kate are coworkers at a brewery who spend their nights drinking and flirting heavily. One weekend away together with their significant others proves who really belongs together and who doesn't.
filmInfoContainer4: Smart, funny, and powered by fine performances from Olivia Wilde and Jake Johnson, Drinking Buddies offers a bittersweet slice of observational comedy.

filmInfoContainer3: A child escapes from Poland during World War II and first heads to Greece before coming of age in Canada.
filmInfoContainer4: Though the retelling is a bit too subtle, the moving story and solid performances lift Fugitive Pieces beyond standard holocaust tales.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the lives of two teenage girls - inseparable friends Ginger and Rosa -- growing up in 1960s London as the Cuban Missile Crisis looms, and the pivotal event that comes to redefine their relationship.
filmInfoContainer4: Elle Fanning gives a terrific performance in this powerful coming-of-age tale about a pair of teenage girls whose friendship is unnerved by the threat of nuclear war.

filmInfoContainer3: The relationship between writer AA Milne and his son, Christopher Robin, and how this became the inspiration for Winnie the Pooh.
filmInfoContainer4: Goodbye Christopher Robin struggles to balance wartime tension and childlike wonder, but offers valuable insight into the darkness shadowing the creation of a classic children's tale.

filmInfoContainer3: Three friends conspire to murder their awful bosses when they realize they are standing in the way of their happiness.
filmInfoContainer4: It's nasty, uneven, and far from original, but thanks to a smartly assembled cast that makes the most of a solid premise, Horrible Bosses works.

filmInfoContainer: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events
filmInfoContainer3: When a massive fire kills their parents, three children are delivered to the custody of cousin and stage actor Count Olaf, who is secretly plotting to steal their parents' vast fortune.
filmInfoContainer4: Although it softens the nasty edges of its source material, Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events is a gothic visual treat, and it features a hilariously manic turn from Jim Carrey as the evil Count Olaf.

filmInfoContainer3: A freewheeling portrait of Ken Kesey and the Merry Pranksters' fabled road trip across America.
filmInfoContainer4: Magic Trip is overall unenlightening, though there's an inherent novelty and joy in seeing the unearthed footage of Ken Kesey and his band of Merry Pranksters.

filmInfoContainer3: Jessie and Angela, high school dropouts, are taking a week off to chill at the beach. Too bad their house got robbed, rent's due, they're about to get fired, and they're broke.
filmInfoContainer4: Never Goin' Back benefits from the chemistry between leads Maia Mitchell and Camila Morrone, whose easy rapport lifts a coming-of-age story with uncommon insight.

filmInfoContainer3: When a multimillionaire man's son is kidnapped, he cooperates with the police at first but then turns the tables on the kidnappers when he uses the ransom money as a reward for the capture of the kidnappers.
A man who falls in love with the woman who received his wife's heart must decide which woman it is who holds his heart.
filmInfoContainer4: David Duchovny and Minnie Driver provide heart-warming romance and comedy in this solid debut by Director Bonnie Hunt.

filmInfoContainer3: Sherry tries to integrate again into society and become a good mother.
filmInfoContainer4: Maggie Gyllenhaal delivers riveting performance as a recovering drug addict in a depressing and not entirely believable movie.

filmInfoContainer3: A London woman's love life and career both hinge, unknown to her, on whether or not she catches a train. We see it both ways, in parallel.
filmInfoContainer4: Despite the gimmicky feel of the split narratives, the movie is watch-able due to the winning performances by the cast.

filmInfoContainer3: Kenya McQueen, an accountant finds love in the most unexpected place when she agrees to go on a blind date with Brian Kelly, a sexy and free-spirited landscaper.
filmInfoContainer4: Something New tackles serious questions about race and interracial relationships with genuine appeal and an alluring romance that develops as naturally as the plot.

filmInfoContainer3: When a retired engineer is called upon to rescue a failing satellite, he insists that his equally old teammates accompany him into space.
filmInfoContainer4: While the plot is overly cliched, the suberb acting by the stars (especially the tense interactions between Clint Eastwood and Tommy Lee Jones) and the spectacular special effects make this a movie worth seeing.

filmInfoContainer3: In 1860s Britain, a boy inventor finds himself caught in the middle of a deadly conflict over a revolutionary advance in steam power.
filmInfoContainer4: The story isn't the greatest, but there's an abundance of sci-fi eye candy to compensate.

filmInfoContainer3: While drying out on the West Coast, an alcoholic hitman befriends a tart-tongued woman who might just come in handy when it's time for him to return to Buffalo and settle some old scores.
filmInfoContainer4: Featuring wonderful performances from Ben Kingsley and Tea Leoni, You Kill Me is a charming, funny take on the familiar inner-lives-of-hit-men premise.

filmInfoContainer3: 12 years after the tragic death of their little girl, a dollmaker and his wife welcome a nun and several girls from a shuttered orphanage into their home, where they soon become the target of the dollmaker's possessed creation, Annabelle.
filmInfoContainer4: Annabelle: Creation adds another strong chapter to the Conjuring franchise - and offers further proof that freaky-looking dolls remain reliably terrifying.

filmInfoContainer3: The inspiring true love story of Robin and Diana Cavendish, an adventurous couple who refuse to give up in the face of a devastating disease. Their heartwarming celebration of human possibility marks the directorial debut of Andy Serkis.
filmInfoContainer4: Strong performances from Breathe's well-matched leads help add an edge to a biopic that takes a decidedly heartwarming approach to its real-life story.

filmInfoContainer3: The Man in the Yellow Hat is an oddball museum employee who looks after his pet monkey, an inquisitive and wonderful creature whose enthusiasm often gets the best of him.
filmInfoContainer4: Curious George is a bright, sweet, faithful adaptation of the beloved children's books.

filmInfoContainer3: Politics and sexual passions threaten to corrupt a young, newly-ordained priest in a small Mexican town.
filmInfoContainer4: Though melodramatic, El Crimen del Padre Amaro's critique of the Catholic church is a timely one.

filmInfoContainer3: A look at the life and music of Nigerian singer Fela Kuti.
filmInfoContainer4: Though it doesn't fully capture the electrifying spirit of its subject, Finding Fela! is a solid overview of the life and work of a musical revolutionary.

filmInfoContainer3: On a mission to rid society of its most repellent citizens, terminally ill Frank makes an unlikely accomplice in 16-year-old Roxy.
filmInfoContainer4: A darkly comic polemic on modern culture, God Bless America is uneven and somewhat this but the ideas behind this revenge fulfillment journey has primal appeal.

filmInfoContainer3: A husband-and-wife team play detective, but not in the traditional sense. Instead, the happy duo helps others solve their existential issues, the kind that keep you up at night, wondering what it all means.
filmInfoContainer4: I Heart Huckabees certainly isn't for everyone, but audiences attuned to its quirky wavelength will find a singularly brainy screwball comedy that refuses to pander.
